reviews.review: Amazing place. You can spend here all the day and it is not enough...all continents are covered,very friendly environment for animals...all kids to be happy.This Zoo must be visited.
Marvelous. Very good experience and my children saw animals not seen in other zoos. Happy Monday deal was a great time for family to spent a wonderful time.

Park like grounds for a great day out. Great value for money
Beautiful park like environment
Wonderful walking
The range of animals was impressive and plenty of restaurants.
It is a big out of town.
A taxi cost us 400 CZk

Awesome zoo. This is one of the best zoos I have been to. They had a pretty impressive Elephant habitat. We were there for about 5-6 hours. We saw EVERYTHING! I think you could do it in less time if you didn't mind not seeing everything.

Big zoo, good value for tickets. Definitely worth a visit, very quiet in mid October on a Monday so could enjoy the views from the top of the park. Very glad we visited, seeing the gorillas playing was the best bit. Good value trip and very easy to get to by public transport from the city centre.

Great zoo and great place to relax. Huge territory and great collection of wild animals. No small cages - a lot of space for wild mountain goats,tigers etc. Be prepared for long walks. A lot of vending machines with water and small snacks.

Great place . Good place to get away from hassle and bussel of city life. It does require a lot of walking in the zoo lots to see polar bears were the main attraction for me and easy to get there by tram 🚊 then take 112 bus to the zoo.

One of the best Zoo's I've been too.. One of the best zoo's as the animals are all set in great settings without the use of too many cages and seems to have lots of space. The way they have designed the zoo they have made the viewing experience good and feel you have a less restricted view and most of the time above on walkways. They also have a large selection of animals to see. Set out over a large area be prepared to walk...

Perfect day. This is truly one of the best ZOOs we have visited. We spent here the whole day, kids didn't want to leave. There is plenty to do and see - not just animals, there are cool playgrounds and attractions to take a break. Regarding food - there is a lot of typical junk food as is usual at places like this (hot dogs, fries, sausage etc.) but at the observation tower there is a fast food restaurant where the food was actually really tasty, at least for a ZOO fast food. There were even some (almost) healthy, or at least healthier choices. Don't miss the seal show. it was very nice, kids loved it. Take cash, there is ATM at the main entrance and most of the attractions (cable car, pony riding, restaurants... etc.) do not accept credit cards.

Very well maintained. Get ready to walk walk walk.. Although we expected to do the zoo in half day, we ended up spending the entire day here. My 3 year old son absolutely loved the place. The zoo is divided into multiple pavilions - one for penguins, one for African animals, one for Indonesian animals, one for reptiles and so on. Ask for a map when you buy the ticket. And decide beforehand what you want to cover - this will save a lot of time. We did everything and took us 6 hours (including lunch and cafe breaks). Kids have a 50% discount on Monday so that might be a good option if you have kids. If you don't, may be you can avoid Mondays as the zoo will be full of kids from multiple school trips. Also there is lot of walking involved, sometimes uphill - so be prepared for it. There is also a cable car that lets you get to the other side of the zoo quickly (but you will miss few pavilions along way). It was not functional when we visited.

Great fun for the whole family. Prague zoo is the best one I have visited so far. Was the re in 2000 and came back again this October! It's a huge area dedicated to animals. Some of them you can meet at the alleys, others are freely inhabiting spacious open areas. This time we saw the baby elephant (just 3 days old) and the diving hippo. The jungle exhibition is also quite attractive. If you have one day - surely spend it there! Even if you do not have kids - you will not regret time spent at the Prague zoo.
Always a good idea!. Nice walk, nice views and a lot of animals to discover. Every time, you can find something new there.
Great place to spend the whole day. We spent the whole day therewith a 1.5 years old and it was splendid. The exhibits are nice, it's very clean and the restaurants are fine.

Best zoo ever. You can not go to Prague and not visit their zoo. AmazingBrilliant for all the family but also a nice romantic day outAnimals all look really well, enclosures are second to none.Food of a high standard and not too expensive.

Baby elephant! . We went on Monday and using our old student cards it cost just 50Kr to get in. Was pleasantly surprised with how nice the zoo was inside, large too. We also got to see a 4 day old elephant which was very nice. Gorillas very cool too. Food reasonably priced.
Great day out! . A great day out for 4 adults! Great variety of animals and the facilties were just as great! Only thing I found was maybe more information available in English on the animals!

One of the best zoo I visted. Prague So I is one of the best zoo I ever visted and I've been to the Bronx zoo and Berlin zoo.There are so many animals to watch and so many of them you can see up close and personal.The view from the zoo of the city is amazing.We spend 4 hours there and I feel like I missed part of the zoo in my visit.
Always amazing experience. I think this is one of the most beautiful Zoo on the world. Really pleasant surroundings, lots of happy animals: I love it here!
Brilliant. You need a whole day here that have every animal you an think of and its really cheap to visit and worth every penny. Brilliant

Best zoo in Europe!. This is a very well-designed zoo. You have to reserve full one day here. This worth it. There are no visible boundaries in the zoo, so you feel as if you are walking in the jungle.

Destination Prague Zoo. Went to the Prague Zoo today despite a little rain, it is much too big to see everything in one day. It is rated as one of Europes best Zoo's. One pavillion had fruit bats flying freely around the visitors heads including my own. An asian baby Elephant was born at the Zoo yesterday and we got to see it. The animals all looked healthy and had impressive habitats and space. Good visitor facilities with plenty of rest rooms and places to grab snacks or meals. Reasonably priced entrance fee of 200 Cz Kc = to $8 US per adult plus 100 Cz Kc parking. We will be back again.

Zoo Day. We visited Prague Zoo yesterday. We are keen animal lovers so thought it would be a good thing to do while in Prague. In general the zoo is lovely and we'll set out. We felt the signage was a little difficult as it wasn't in English, but they had corresponding pictures so you could work it out. It's s great zoo for kids with plenty for them to do and plenty of restaurants and bathrooms along the way. It's about a 20-30 minute drive from the town centre so we caught a taxi. You can't hail a taxi in Prague so you have to ask the information people to call one for you to get back or you can catch a bus if you're game.My only concert with the zoo were a number of larger animals did not have enough room and were clearly bored. One elephant spent eight hours swaying back and forward in the one spot alone on concrete surrounded by steel bars which I found very sad. However, they do have a number of breeding programs and they release back into the wild. All in all a great day.

Modern spacious zoo with great habitats for its animals. Prague zoo has spacious areas for its animals, and they are visible and active rather than hidden and asleep as you find at many zoos. In 2016 Prague Zoo had its first elephant to be both conceived and born at the same zoo. The zoo is very easy to get to via public transportation.
beautiful day. I love the place which is soooo big. I spend all the days to visit. Anf there were so many habitats.
Zoo Praha. Plenty of different animals , huge zoo park, very nice nature in the zoo. And good organization for vizitors. Transport to the zoo is by bus direct to the zoo.
Day out. One of the best zoos I have been to a little out of the way but worth it 200ck to enter about £6 worth every penny
Great zoo. One of the greatest zoo's I've been in, we enjoyed it very much. We spent here about 4 hours. I strongly recommend it, it's a must see in Prague.

Prague zoo. Exhibits were spacious and clean. A very nice zoo for all visitors. Many small baby animals that were born 2016. Enjoyed the baby giraffe. Baby aardvark and baby monkey. Started to rain and stopped at concession stand and the lady working understood English and made us hot tea and hot Caffè latte. Enjoyed our 3 hours there.

New experience for us... This year our family had an opportunity to explore the lowest part of this truly marvelous zoological garden. Despite it's been raining lightly we enjoyed different bird's singing,met with new inhabitants and even had a walk with a calm peacock by our side ) the only regret was the reconstruction of some pavilions, but guess we still had a lot to see )

very nice and tourist friendly.. very nice and tourist friendly. easy access by public transportation, beautiful place with huge amount of animals. the swimming polar bear was just amazing. the place is huge, so get ready for an exhausting day.

Beautiful zoo - BUT avoid sathurdays and its not very suitable for toddlers. If you can definetly avoid sathurday as the amount of people going there is incredible - in any kind of inside terarium or passage you ll have to wait for a while. As well small toddlers can not see most animals at all from the pushchair or even standing around since the fences are too high in many places and people who also have small kids in many cases are not taking care to remove the pushcair, and often for quite long blocking the view so the small ones can not see anything. Apart from that amazing experience- amount of animals is really impressive and also their living space is very nicely decorated. You can really have a beautiful walk there and see a lot.

Beautiful Zoo. This is beautiful place full of amazing animals and plants. Each year getting nicer and nicer. It is great also for kids, especially huge climbing frame in "Bororo". The best zoo I have ever visited.

Massive Zoo. Had a good long dayout at the zoo.Metro and then tranferred to zoo bus to/from the zoo which was pretty unpleasant as it was SO crammed on the bus but as its only 15mins (ish) so you can live with it. Wish id opted for the zoo boatride as it turned out they picked up right near my hotel. The zoo itself is HUGE (arguably too big) with alot of walking to do between some enclosures, feels more like a big woodland park full of dog walkers in places. The signage/directions are pretty basic and its easy to miss things (we didnt buy a map) but overall it has everything you could wish to see (aslong as you can find it). We spent about 5/6 hours exploring all of it on a sunny day and it was tiring but overall rewarding. The elephants, polar bears and the gorillas were real highlights. Would recommend anyone visiting Prague visits the zoo!

One of the best zoos in Europe! . This zoo is really big with lots of animals and is great for families. Animals agave a decent amount of space and Prices are not to high either! Make sure u visit the penguins!

Great zoo. My partner and I visited the zoo at the end of September. We found the travel from Prague city centre easy enough and cheap at 32ck, buses run very frequently too. The zoo is also reasonable at 200ck for an adult. We didn't have much of a wait to get in and the zoo grounds are lovely. All the animals were out and about and easy too see, especially with many enclosures having glass walls - the tigers and polar bears are a must see!There could be more food oulets throughout the zoo. All were very busy and we waited around 20-30 minutes at a kiosk for a hotdog! Overall, a great zoo and I would definitely recommend.

One of best zoos. Visited this zoo on a sunny Monday, there were quite a lot of visitors, but not crowded. Taking a metro and buss to the zoo is the fastest and cheapest way.Beautiful zoo with lots of things and animals to see, specially the baby animals born this year. The zoo area is huge, so put on your best shoes and reserve at least 4 hours for a visit. It's not even a bad idea to have a own picnic in the zoo, eventhough theres many restaurants and cafes in the area.

Really enjoyable day. Me and my friend spent the day at the zoo. Its bigger than I expected it to be but for an avid wildlife photographer it was fantastic. I got some great pictures of the animals, it was very cheap to get in and prices inside were reasonable. The view from the top over prague was great too. All in all we had a great day :)
a zoo..... it was the best time in Prague. This zoo is just beautifull. Wanna recommended for all..easz to take a boat in....

Astronomical Club ck. This is not just a clock but also shows the movement of the planets around the earth along with the sun and moon through the signs of the zodiac. There is quite a show on the hour. There is also a revolving calendar below the clock.The clock was built in 1410

Very nice place to visit with children. The Prague zoo is considered as one of the best zoological parks in the world. It's really one of the best. There are many cafes and souvenir shoops at park, places for children to play.  If you are at Prague and you have a free day (it will take you a whole day to see all the animals) visit it, you will not regret.

Good break. If you want a break from the crowds of Prague, this might be for you.
The zoo is situated on a very large area and covers a wide range of exhibits.
Care seems to be taken to ensure animals are placed in suitable environments.

What a fantastic zoo!!. This Zoo is one of the best I have ever been too. We did it in 4 hours but skipped a few exhibits. The animals look so cared for the polar bears well one of them swimming was brilliant he was having a lovely time. We got a taxi to the zoo from our hotel 12 pounds. Entrance only 6 pounds and got a bus and tram back which was fun. Must visit when in prague

Day out. Not usually a fan of zoos but we spent more or less a whole day exploring the Prague Zoo and enjoyed it. Very easy to get to using public transport and entrance fees were very cheap.This is definitely one of the better zoos in Europe and a really good day out if you have kids with you! The zoo is large and spread out and there is a really wide range of animals

Fabulous!!!. I love zoos and this one is incredible. Very clean, plenty of refreshments available all over the zoo. Extremely well priced considering the size of the zoo and the variety of animals. All enclosures were clean and well proportioned. So glad we took the time to visit it. Be prepared to walk though!! This place is huge!! Absolutely loved It!
Beautiful zoo . Very nice zoo. The best I've ever seen. You can see plenty kinds of happy animals. The zoo is clean.

Been to Berlin, Barcelona and others, but this is the zoo to visit if you only had one to choose from in Europe.. Well laid out, spacious enclosures, wide range of animals, many of which you won't see elsewhere. Everyone will have there favourites but for me, head and shoulders above everything else are the Lemurs, which will actually come over the rails and move around where you're sitting/standing....if you're lucky.....a true delight

AMAZING!!! Best zoo I've been to. I am an absolute zoo lover and drag my husband around to them all the time. This weekend I'm off to my 4th zoo this year alone haha But seriously Prague zoo was spectacular. It was really well set out. Amazing enclosures. So many different types of animals. Drink vending machines everywhere which is great on a hot day. Well priced for an attraction. Great seating areas to eat. It is set on a hillside so be prepared to walk. Only problem I had was seeing one particular segregated elephant swaying which I know is their way of conveying distress, whether current or past leading to this learnt behaviour. Other than that it was an amazing day out and I recommend it.

This must rate as one of the world's great zoos!. We visited Prague Zoo on 21st September 2016. We were a family group including our two young grandchildren and their parents who reside in Prague. It was a fun family day out but also of great interest to the wildlife enthusiast. They specialize in keeping the rarer species and contributing to international conservation efforts. In particular they have had a significant role in the conservation of Przwalki's horse, the last remaining species of truly wild horse.Each exhibit is designed foremost for the welfare of the inmates but also to facilitate the viewer. The landscaping is superb and makes creative use of the natural topography of the 60 hectare site. The catering facilities are numerous and of a high standard. Coming from the euro zone admission charges were really reasonable. Don't miss this world class attraction if you live in or are visiting Prague!
Amazing Zoo. This is a must for all ages. Sensible prices. Well laid out in huge grounds. We think this is the best zoo we have ever visited
Amazing animals. Seen animals that I have never seen before, it is very clean. The lift is very helpful to get to see the animals on the top. The view from the top towards the city is just amazing.
Fantastic day at the zoo. Brilliant day ,lovely enclosures well laid out beautiful setting. Weather helped too . Easy to get them from city centre. Good map easier to navigate.

A must when in Prague!☺. We visited the zoo when we first arrived in Prague.
It's one of the biggest zoos in Europe I believe.
Cheap as chips to enter.
Lots for the kids to do and there are food & drinks areas everywhere with a different theme running through each area of the zoo itself.
Go here by bus.
Loved it!
Enjoy!☺

Beautiful, beautiful place. We (especially our little one) love Zoos of any kinds and sizes. Contrary to views that animals suffer there, most Zoos I have visited work really hard towards protecting endangered species and are caring for the animals with love and passion. And by all means Prague Zoo is in that aspect the best I have ever seen!Apart from that it's really cheap - accessible to locals and a treat to tourists. Souvenirs, food, buggy rides - all very good value (ice cream about 50p a scoop!)There are LOTS of animal species, the whole zoo is clean, enclosures are spacious and well maintained and the animals do not appear stressed. Years ago I once visited in the winter (and I believe it was also after the huge floods that destroyed the zoo) and we have seen elephants in small indoor enclosures which was not pretty - I am glad it was obviously a temporary measure!So much to do for kids of all ages - numerous playgrounds, climbing frames, chair lift, paddling pool...you can even take a boat trip from town centre straight to the zoo.I would advise to arrive asap in the morning - especially during weekends and school holidays it gets pretty busy! And plan to stay the whole day - you won't want to leave.

Best zoo I have been to so far in Europe.. Amazing zoo, I have been to the zoo's of Amsterdam, England, Valencia and Barcelona recently and they are really good zoos but this one is something else. It is very big, has a wide range of different animals some funky looking ones too. the Polar bear was a first and the history of their elephants is really interesting. Not a lot of food options in comparision to the other zoos i mentioned but Animal, price and quality wise.. this was the best.

The best one in the world!!!! :). We have visited the Prague Zoo every year since I was young and we love it here. We always have a perfect day while visiting the zoo, everyone enjoys it. Wide scale of animals, nature, area, children´s attractions and others. Really worth to visiting the zoo while in Prague.
Pan. Definitely the best zoo in Czech republic. We had a great time here. Good accessibility by the public transport!

Great day out. Not usually a fan of zoos but this proved to be a really fun day. With all manner of animals available, some of which were a bit reluctant to show their faces such as the Polar Bear and the Red Panda but otherwise it was very reasonably priced and if you want to see everything including climbing up the tower it is pretty much a full day out. I would definitely recommend this zoo to friends, families, couples and so on. Remember to have change for the bus back to the subway though.
Super zoo. I like prague zoo. There are interesting animals and the locations with the animals are nice. Totally good for families with children. Especially when the weather is nice

Fabulous!. Very easy to reach via public transport and the zoo was an absolute bargain to get in (200 czh, around £6.50). It took us around 6 hours to walk around the zoo and fully appreciate all it had to offer. You could probably walk round all the attractions in around 3/4 hours if you didn't take much time looking at all the animals. There were lots of different animals which all looked well looked after. The food and drink was also reasonably priced throughout the zoo.

Good, but still a zoo . I'm not normally a fan of zoological gardens. I think they are cruel symbols of animal captivity. I have to say though, with this zoo trying it's best to recreate the conditions of an animal's choice of habitat, I find myself thinking that for the preservation of certain species this kind of healthy eco-system created by Zoo Praha is necessary. The animals are given good amounts of space to roam around. The Billy goats have a whole cliff face to themselves and much more. I did however dislike the use of electric fencing. Which is present in most enclosures.
Fantastic. Fantastic zoo. Animals well cared for and very clean enclosures. Well worth a visit. Spent the whole day and still more to see. Exceptional value for money

Value for money. A great zoo, reached by bus and/or metro and tram. The zoo is vast and has some decent climbs. The variety of animals is great and lots to see in big enclosures. We spent the whole day there

When in prague a must visit . We were travelling with one 2 year old and one 6 months. Didn't expect both of them to enjoy that much. Tips: u need to be der as early as possible in fact 9 in the morning. Animals are active at that time, later in the day they go back and u will miss the shows. Watch the polar bear jumping and smimming in the water. Then go strt down to the penguins side where u can see a small show. As they are a bit far on the map but these 2 u dnt want to miss. Later u can see rest of the animals. Animals are kept very well .

One of the best zoos in Europe!. The Prague Zoo is in the Top-10 of zoos of the world. And indeed it deserves this rating, you can spend a whole day here. Also inside the territory of the zoo is a very good and cheap restaurant that I can recommand.

greaat souroundings. Prague Zoo is exceptional with souroundings and landscaping, a great place to spend some hours outdoors. they have a chairlift, that costs 25czk - you should definitely try that! either down, up or both ways! (you go one by one, in a chair wich is locked with a chain) the animals have lots of space, but we didnt have any trouble in spotting them, because of the landscape. they have vending machines for drinks and snacks and you can buy souvenir coins with several of the animals. the have a lot of cafes as well (althoug we didnt visit any, you can also bring you own food)the Zoo offers student discount.

Disappointed, few animals.. The zoo is very big but other zoos have got much more animals. The ticket is (200czk for adult). I recomend you to take a map (5czk). The animals reside in a natural enviroment. Polar bear is amazing but the cage seems uncomfortable and shall be cleaned. They don't have a large area to swim in. I liked the kangaroos and penguins too. Has got a lot of place you can rest and eat something or drink a coffee. The prices for food and ice cream are good. There is a chair lift to transport you to the higher level. At noon, they feed the animals. Open daily-year round from 9a.m.
Very good . Really recommend the zoo loads of animals to see. Takes a good few hours to walk round it to see it all. Is uphill but has a stair lift that you can use.
Amazing zoo. Amazing zoo.It is very big and would require 2 days if you want to visit it all.You can find all kinds of animals.Great place to take the family.

Fantastic Day Out. Easy to reach via public transport, the bus stops right outside. We bought tickets at the gate for less than £7 each at current exchange rate and spent over six hours exploring the wonderfully landscaped grounds and seeing/experiencing many different animals, big and small. The views from the top of the park are a sight to behold and the wooden observation tower (included in entry price), is very much worth a climb. Food and drink is very reasonably priced and our meals were of good quality. The animal enclosures are well maintained and the whole zoo is kept spotlessly clean. We will definitely return if we are ever in Prague again and recommend this as a 'must do' attraction.

Beautiful place !!. Prague Zoo is beautiful !!!! There are so many animals, many attractions for childrens. Lot of place where you can eat or drink coffee and watch the giraffes or other animals. Definitely recommends !!!

one of the best Zoo's ever. Nicely set out zoo where the animals are well looked after.
The silverback gorilla Richard was a definite highlight.
Something a bit different from the regular Prague tourist spots also.

Great zoo!. The place is wonderful. It's a big place, with a great variety of animals. The zoo itself is beautiful, and most of the animals reside in a natural environment. I'd recommend spending around 3/4 hours at the zoo.

Beautiful Spot for Animal Lovers. Very attractive and intertwining spot in Prague 15 KM) distance from the city, with variety of animals and monorail for adults to enjoy more than the children ... Well equipped with Good restaurants, opening hours very comfortable 9:30 am till 20:00 hrs (in summer) moderate ticket price
Wonderful place to spend a day with family specially the kids
Attraction for different age groups. Prague zoo is nice option for a half-day or even one day exploration of the area. All age groups will find something exciting and useful in the zoo. Go for it!

A lot of cubs. Great zoo with very nice landscape.I enjoy every visit here. If you are planning to come consider how much time you want to spent, it is really large. Highlights of this year are baby elephant and gorillas family but there are a lot of other cubs - hippo, ant eater and others. Just consider your visit during weekend, it is really crowded.
Prague zoo. One of the best zoo around the world. Prague zoo. Open : 9 am -close 6 pm. Adult ticket 200 c. Spend about 4 hours to discover it
Prague castle tour. My friend and I were part of the Prague Castle tour today with Vivean as our guide. She did a great job of informing us about the history of the castle. Thanks!

Nice zoo. Nice day out and a huge place, easy to find take the number 12 tram, then change after about 10 stops onto the number 112 bus for about 7 stops, drops you right outside the entrance. 600 czk to enter pp and 5czk for a map. We covered all of the zoo in 6 hours and was a nice day out. Most of the animals are kept in reasonable enclosures except some of the cat family and the polar bears who do not have a large area to swim in. It was a hot day so some of the animals were not active but we did see them all, alot of the animals had just recently given birth so all the new arrrivals were cute to look at especially the baby elephant and the baby giraffe. There are plenty of cafes and vending machines around the zoo but not all the vending machines work properly. There is a chair lift in the middle of the zoo to transport you from the high level to the lower level or vice versa which Is quirky but we walked around the whole zoo on foot. Most of the animals have information boards and feeding times outside their enclosures and information on the new arrivals. Some of the exhibits are also indoors so a relief to get in out of the sun and heat. Well worth a visit especially if you have young children.

Baby elephant was incredible . All places I visited around the world I have to visit the zoo also there. Everybody was talking about the 4 month years old elephant there so I decided to go and see what's going on there. Tiger was sleeping far away so I couldn't see it. Too much walking. But I like the way of putting the animals in.

Not only for children!. I've been in the zoo with 3 of my friends. We all 25-30 years old and we really enjoyed it! So dont think that this is only for kids! The zoo is very clean, including animal's cages and a lot of animals to see. It is very easy to get to the zoo, just take the red line metro to the Vustaviste Holisovice station and from there bus number 112.

Not only for children, very joyful expreince!. Great way to spent almost a whole day in Prague, the visit involves a lot of walking! The zoo itself is huge and interesting, variety of animals. It separated into two zones, you can take funicular or walk to the higher zone by foot- we took the funicular.

Nice. Great place to spend one or two days with your kids.Very big zoo, plenty of playgrounds, lots of animals.The kids could play in the water, ride horses or poneys.The sad part was that we visited in the middle of July and we couldn't see many of the animals as they were sheltered from the excessive heat.But overall we had a lot of fun.

Loved it. Enjoyed it so much. I wish I could have spent more time. As the weather was too hot, animals were not so active which is understandable as I, myself had to sit down and have a rest often. I would love to revisit and take more time next time.
One of the kind!. If you don't mind to see animals in the enclosed area, The P. Zoo is one the attraction you can plan for almost one whole day.

Great Zoo and beautiful views. Went here with my boyfriend and really enjoyed it. It is much bigger than we thought it would be and the animals were great. Also, because it's on a sort on a hill, you get a great view of Prague from the top!
Very much fun. This was a 3-4 hours activity, depends on how much time you spend in every point and how slow you walk... the verity of animals is great and there are lots of activities there.

Incredibile . After reading that the Prague zoo was continually ranked in the top ten world wide our expectations were sky high. We weren't disappointed. With numerous animals i have not seen in any other zoo (such as the giant salamander and the javan Leopard). More importantly all animals seen to be subject to the highest level of care as evidenced by there healthy and happy look. Most animals were actively playing, in their topically very large, enclosures. Every effort seems to have been made to ensure an enclosure as close to the natural habitat as possible is provided. Standouts being the african Savanah animals having around 3 acres of space with all the herbivores in there together. Secondly, the mountain goats had a 50 meter high rocky cliff face that was approximately one hundred meters long allowing them to climb up and down a they pleased. The zoo is also very cheap to enter, filled with shaded areas and has various food options on offer. Great day out.

What a wonderful zoo. Too an uber from our hotel to the zoo. It was my birthday treat. Just 600 koruna to get in each and it is a massive zoo. It has just about every animal you might want to see. Don't miss the polar bears which were my favourite. Also elephants, seals, penguins, giraffes, monkeys of every description etc etc. It really was a fabulous day out
The best zoo in the world??. Has to be up there with them it's huge. Cheap as chips think it was £8!!!! Load's of animals could spend all day there. Brilliant day out

Amazing day. You can spend the whole day in Zoo Praha and still will not be able to say that you saw everything. Everytime I go there, there is something new or improved. You will rarely see cages, they really want you to feel close to the animals - but the animals have many options to hide from the visitors, which is nice. The price is definitely worth it. Be prepared for some walking, even hills.

Prague Zoo. The zoo in Prague is great in fact it's beautiful. I've never been to a zoo that clean or with the most beautiful animals. One day I hope anyone who read this review will go to the Prague zoo.
Zoo. Great place, you need full day and maybe you cant see all animals.it is a little far you need to go by metro and then a bus will take you there. You have to visit it! Amazing
Big and nice. One of the best zoo I have even seen in my life.Located in quite area, good trip if you wanna get out of city center, you can easily walk there. It takes about 1 hour.

Chilled Day at the Zoo. Good 3hr walk around the zoo. Maps available in many languages for 5czh. Plenty of room for the animals to walk around well laid out and easy to follow. Vending machines throughout 20czh for a bottle of water. Great cafe near the entrance. Baby Elephant playing with his parents you could only see on safari. But they have it here. Great photo opertunites as there are no cages on the big animals plenty of room for them to roam about. Easy to get to from the city, map enclosed. £6.30 per head and the cost of the "tube" and bus only one ticket needed 75p so £1.50 rtn. This gives you 30mins transfer time plenty to get you there and there is a ticket machine at the bus stop. (Coins only). Great day out if the weather is fine something for all the family.
Nice . It was amazing distination , with multiple different things to do especially. For children and also for adult Nice restaurant , with reasonable prices , highly recommended

Always love this zoo!!. My husband's family lives in Prague so we visit twice a year (summer and winter) and we have been going to the zoo with our now 15 year old daughter at least once a year since she was born. She never tires of it and neither do we!! It is a very well priced day for the family and there are yummy snacks and drinks everywhere. Both seasons have something to offer and I hope to visit in the spring someday too. Transportation there is easy from downtown first by metro and then by a bus that runs very frequent right to the front door. I also recommend the restaurant just in front of the zoo to your right just before the ticket booths.

Best Zoo in Europe. Excellent Zoo for Families , lots of interactive attractions play areas , wide choice of food easily accessible on public transport ,Large Zoo which has a range of natural settings ,Large and diverse range of animals , lots of excellent informative notices, Conservation a key theme,

Fantastic Place. This place is HUGE, I spent maybe 4 hours there and wasnt able to see everything, its also very cheap at around £7 for an adult with parking.The enclosures are nice and big and are very well kept, the Animals seem happy and most of them will come up to say hello.Sadly the 'skilift' type thing to bypass the long walk is only operational during a 'summer' period.Id recommend bringing lunch with you as the food offerings are ok but can get crowded.Also theres tapirs and who doesnt like Tapirs.

Massive zoo . Couldn't believe how big the zoo was it was lovely which really reflected on the size of enclosures they were brilliant. Was tough walking due to the heat but obviously no fault of the zoos, but all the animals were well cared for

Massive!. Huge zoo, unlike a lot of experiences with foreign zoos this one is great! plenty of stuff to occupy kids, would recommend paying the little extra for a map. We didn't and went in circles once or twice.... :p.

One of the most beautiful ZOO i ve ever seen. I visit this ZOO quite regularly to see what s new there.
from almost 50 ZOO over the world i find this one as the best, Definitelz worth visiting !!!

Planet of the Apes and other Fun Creatures. Even though the summer weather was quite warm, that did not stop my lover and I from visiting the "jungle!" I was really looking forward to seeing the lions and tigers, but during this visit I was captivated by the monkeys and apes. The zoo has enough attractions to keep a family occupied all day and even has a lift to take people to the "higher" part of the zoo. If you get there at the right time, you can watch how the animals are fed. The only downside for this last trip was the polar bear; who was sleeping lazily and looked mightily uncomfortable. His cage also looked like it could use a good "cleaning." However, everything else was perfect. As a photographer, I love the chance to take my camera and practice my skill. The only major challenge are the fingerprints on the glass, but with the right patience and angle, even those can be avoided.

Zooperb. Been to 7 zoos including Berlin, Amsterdam, Budapest and London this year, none come close to this zoo, this zoo was unreal the scenery was unbelievable, the layout is fantastic and the whole experience was amazing, superb value for money, we were I Prague for four days and spent two days here! Loved it!
Good choice for families with children. Large and very interesting zoo. There are a lot of attractions for children different ages. My sun likes tigers the most.

Best Zoo I have ever visited. This was a magical day out. There is very little I could suggest to make this day at the Zoo an better. Transport from central Prague is easy. It is inexpensive both I entrance fee and cost of foods etc. The animals are kept in brilliant setting as if they were in the wild. The place is massive so allow a whole day to take it all in. One tiny complaint was that we weren't able to buy a fridge magnet to remember our visit..!!

One of the best ZOOs in the world!. Prague ZOO is just perfect - it's perfect place for animals, they have great facilities and seem to be happy. It's children and dogs friendly. Do not miss this place!
Best of the best. Enjoyed a day in Prague's zoo! A lot of space to walk around, animals feel free and comfortable. Also there are a lot of places where you can get snacks and drinks.
Best Zoo i have ever visit. The zoo is very big and full of different amazing animals, It reminds me with Vienna zoo but it is cheaper.

Love this place . Had a great time at the zoo in Prague, it's definitely one of a kind. It's build on a huge hillside so there is a lot of climbing but there is a chairlift available and plenty of resting spots to relax in between. Beautiful landscapes and from the top you get a glorious view of Prague landscape. Great selection of animals, we especially loved the giraffe/Sahara exhibit. Good prices for food and great ice cream. Definitely bring good walking shoes and pace yourself. We spent close to 7 hours here (we walked pretty slow and took our time) and there was still a few exhibits we didn't catch. Definitely good for a day trip. Hope to go back again sometime.

Awesome zoo!. I've been to this zoo twice, and each time I'm amazed at how great it's put together and how much fun I have visiting it. It's a good sized zoo that's very well planned so that you can meander your way through the zoo and see everything without having to spend too much time looking at the map. My personal favorite is the penguins, but there are amazing animals for all types of animal lovers! Plus, they have good food stands, plenty of pivo and it's quite easy to get to from wherever you are in Prague! I'd recommend spending at least 3-4 hours here if you want to see everything, especially during the non-summer months when it closes relatively early. Getting to the zoo is really easy as well. You can take the metro and then a bus directly to the entrance, or you can take a nice bike ride or walk across the river from Stromovka Park, through a beautiful estate right to the park as well!
Nice zoo. Easy to get to the zoo with the bus and the tram. Entry prices are very cheap, 8 euro's for an adult ticket. Great range of Animals and a nice chair lift.

must see for family outing. i visited the prague zoo with my family , it was really perfect and i enjoyed my time there , you will find alot of excited animals , the zoo is very big and full of kids area and WC , transportation to the zoo is affordable ( metro + bus ) , fees are very reasonable specially for families , and they offer a big discounts on Monday as well

Not the best zoo ever but it's a good day out. . It's quiet long to get there, we had to take a boat cross the river and wait nearly an hour for a local bus! The zoo wasn't the best I've been to but it does offer a great city view because of how high it situated

Where else can you get within one centimetre of a polar bear?. Easy to get to - tram (or metro) to Holešovice and then the shuttle bus. Very reasonable entry prices, probably one-third the price of London Zoo for example. A few pence extra for a map, which - like every other zoo I've ever been to! - is rather vague.The animals are in superb enclosures, very large with a lot of variety. This means the whole zoo covers a large area and there's a fair bit of walking involved. Loved seeing the baby elephant, the spoonbills, the tapirs, the spider monkeys. But the polar bears... they have a pool separated only by 1cm of perspex from the visitors, and they swim right up to it - a real thrill!Lots of zoos and tourist attractions have extortionate prices for food and drink ... but not so, in Prague. Lots of cafes and kiosks, tasty foods and inexpensive drinks.Prague Zoo claims it's "the fourth best zoo in the world" - I haven't been to every zoo in the world, but this one is excellent. Got there early in the day, stayed seven hours, will quite happily go back again soon.
excellent zoo. Great range of animals, excellent value for money can even get a cheap chair lift to the top. Massive zoo.

Best zoo I know. The palce is greatly set in on the riverbank climbing up to the cliff. Funny rides by the gondola! And love some of the expositions, like otters or the Indonesian jungle. Lot of fun and education for kids!

Very good. This was the best zoo I've ever been to. The food, staff and animals were brilliant and the open area where the bats flew around was so much fun. And the chair lift that takes you to the top level was great fun. The seal show was the best I have ever seen and I've been to a lot of zoos.The only bad thing about the place as some of the animals were a bit stir crazy just walking around in circles and running to oposit sides of their enclosure.

Great ZOO!. I took some time and went to the zoo in Prague! I am glad I did. There were plenty of animals to see throughout the zoo. It opens at 10 am. I arrived then and spent several hours walking enjoying the variety of animals! Highly recommend!

Any zoo. I know there's going to be a lot of people who would not agree with me. They say that Prague's zoo is one of the best. I guess it is but for me it is still a prison for animals. I've been there long time ago. In that time my daughter wanted to go. I didn't feel quite all right. Especially in the gorillas pavilion. May be this is because I've been in Africa and saw the animals free. Or just imagine yourself to be behind bars and to be watched by animals.

Great family place for a full-day visit. Nice place to escape the busy historical city center. Children will love it. The management has been doing a great job putting different species together. The Indonesian Jungle is great. Turtles, reptiles, large cats, hippos, zebras, elephants, monkeys and the great Gorilla Pavilion (do not miss this one!)....and much much more. We always enjoy the day.

Great ZOO which is constantly developping. A lot of animals, big space - one day is not enaugh to enjoy all animals.
ZOO is well managed, you can even buy an elefant's... poo as "souvenir" or gift.
I strictly recomedt "Night visits" during winter and summer. As a guide, there are people from Zoo who'll tell you stories from life of these animals. Great experience!
Reserve whole day for Prague Zoo. Prague Zoo is beautiful, but to go through whole Zoo reserve whole day. It is really big and I can recommend it.
Most Beutiful ZOO. Its nice, its cheap, its clean! So many Animals :) My 3yo daughter loved it :) The prices are very very reasonable and it worth it! Toilets were clean and we had lovely food :)

Short break with friends. Great zoo one of the best I've ever been to.easy to get to via metro and bus highly recomended.The Animal pens are mainly modern and the animals seemed to be happy.Lots of babies.

great day out. awesome zoo as far I'm concerned, have been to Berlin Zoo, Colchester Zoo, Bristol Zoo, Edinburgh zoo to name but a few. Prague Zoo does not disappoint a bit hilly but a great day out and one of the cheapest zoos for admission and good food and drink stops agree at day out👍

So many animals . Today me and my girlfriend visited the zoo for the first time. First thing the entry fee, this was very very good at around £7-£8. I would recommend buying a map once you're in the zoo, as it is massive and has lots and lots of animals to see. Which brings me to my next point. The shear number of animals and species there is incredible , all the animals have good viewing places and the zoo also holds feeding sessions throughout the day, I am unsure on the exact animal or if they change day to day. Some exhibits have English information to read however not all. However this is not a complaint at all as we are in Czech. There are lots of places to buy food and drink throughout the day, the places we went was all reasonably priced and not over priced at all. We didn't actually have time to see all the animals in one day due to the size and quantity of animals. Overall loved the day out would definitely recommend

One of the best zoo. I used to live in Prague and visited the zoo often. One day is not enough to see and enjoy this place, or you should come at least early morning. The area is huge, but organized very well. The best attraction for me was lemur island, where lemurs run freely around you, and you can actually touch them (it isn't allowed though).

You'll get a workout going up the hills. This was a great zoo. There were so many animals and habitats. It was very clean and well maintained. I did not anticipate the zoo would be as hilly as it was. There were several areas which had very steep inclines to walk up to the next habitat. Would be hard for elderly or anyone who has difficulty going up hills.

Average zoo. Pros:+Clean toilets+Nice playground for kids in the middle+Wide selection of animals+Themed areas+Easy to access with public transport+Many beches and vending machines around areaCons:-Very terrainy and wide area (kids got exhausted fast)-Routes slightly unclear, hard to see all the animals logically-All signs not in englishAll in all, not the worst zoo visited, but not the best either. Would recommend to families with older children.

Everyone should visit this Zoo.. We travelled by tram and bus to the zoo, and were amazed how 'not busy' the zoo was ? Don't get me wrong, there were plenty of people there but it didn't feel crowded, which was a delight. The chair lift is a must, then enjoy the animals from the top to the bottom. The polar bears were very entertaining, it was great to be so close to them. The gorillas had a little baby to see too, another lovely surprise. A great zoo.

Great zoo, lots to see!. We visited this zoo on our long weekend trip to Prague and i'm so glad we did! Only 200kc per person to enter which is really cheap in GBP! The zoo is huge. Very hilly so be prepared to do some hard walking at this zoo! In the summer months the zoo is open until 9pm which we thought was amazing for a zoo! One recommendation is to buy a map as it can get confusing at some points and a map is needed to make sure you see everything. The food options throughout the zoo are great and the animals look very clean and cared for. One of the best zoo's i've ever been to, a big recommendation!!

The Best Zoo. Prague Zoo in Troja is just the best. There is so many animals and not just oné or Two but also a quite nice crowds. Its so huge. Even in a Bad weather you wouldnt be bored.cause there is many pavilons inside. i love the one where the bats are flying around you.I visited zoos in calgary-canada.frankfurt city zoo.nurnberg Germany and some other but prague is much bigger and much better. Feeding. Program for kids.even a special wooden trains for kids you can borrow.
Lovely zoo. The zoo of Prague is one of the attraction you need to visit while you are in Prague. Specially when you have kids. It's not expensive at all. You can easily spent 2-4 hours in there.
Fun day. Even 5 hours werent enough to see all the animals. The zoo offers a huge number of animals that you can see.

A good half day. My husband and i both enjoyed this zoo, especially because they have had such a good breeding season. A Young elephant, hippo and gorilla.The animals all seem happy and the enclosures were good sizes. We enjoyed eating a strawberry and vanilla ice cream as we walked.

Excellent. I thought Berlin Zoo was great, but this one is even better. We had approx 5 hours and it was so not enough. For elephant lovers: you can download "The Elephant Valley" ("Údolí slonů") mobile app. (The link is available at the Prague Zoo website.) It has "Who is who" tab with names, dates of birth and identifying marks of every elephant in the zoo.
The best zoo I've ever been to!. That's the best zoo I've ever been to! You will need a whole day to see it all! There is also nice food almost everywhere...

Must visit!. A really fantastic experience. The enclosures are spacious and the environments seem to be for the enjoyment of the animals rather than the humans who watch them - really nice to see a properly functioning zoo!We spent the majority of the day there and were never bored, there were plenty of places sit out of the sun as well as lots of places to eat and get a snack.It was very reasonable to enter, at about £6 a ticket with discounts for children and students.
Amazing Zoo. Its so beautiful ..Very large and had every type of animal..!!They do not accept euros so make sure you have exchange or a credit card.The food was ok..!!

Best zoo in the world?. I have been to zoos all over the world and this is easily the best I have visited yet. There is an incredible range of animals, from old favourites to rarer species, all of which are well looked after with naturally assimilated habitats.My favourite animals were the honey badger, bats and gharials, which I could have watched for hours. The feline house and gorilla enclosures were very busy however, so I'd recommend checking these out early or late in the day. All talks and shows are conducted in Czech, so unless you speak the language, it's best to discover the zoo for yourself.Do bring comfortable clothing however, as due to the size and multiple levels of the zoo, you will have plenty of walking to do you plan on seeing it all. At a medium pace, my partner and I managed to do so in about 8 hours and came away with loads of amazing photos and memories.The admission, shops and restaurants are all cheap, however make sure you purchase one of the maps when getting tickets, as they are not included in the entrance fee. The zoo is based out of the city centre as well, but easily accessible using a combination of public transport, notably trams and buses. The best thing to do is pay for 90 minute ticket each way, which covers all transfers and leaves you plenty of time to make connections.If you're in the city for a week and are looking to take a break from all the history and architecture, then I could not recommend a visit to Prague Zoo enough!

Probably a worst Zoo i've ever visited. The day we've visited at least 50% of the cages and aviaries were empty.The Zoo resides on hills so you need to go up and down a looot.Nothing more disappointing after a 10 minutes steep hill walk to find empty cages...Good points - it's not expensive and quite a loot of cafes and free toilets scattered inside the area.In a bottom line its was not worthwhile the time and effort.

Amazing!. This is the must see when you arę visting Prague, big and cheap parking make it easy if you travel by car. Spend whole day inside because it is magnificent! Gorillas and other animals are amazing! We spent 5 hours inside and didnt menage to see Every exhibition.
Great zoo. Very big zoo almost every animal you can think of. The animals seem very well cared for and the food and drink within the park is tasty and very reasonable

Best zoo I have been to. This was an amazing zoo. Very large and had every type of animal. The animals were well looked after and they had thought carefully about their habitat. Was easy to get to from Prague City Centre. Took C Metro from Florenc station, 2 stops and then bus 112. Very easy and took about 20 minutes. It only cost 200kr (roughly £7.50/8) to get him for each adult and well worth it. Warning They do not accept euros so make sure you have Kr or credit card. Food was quite good in cafe too. We spent 5 hours there but could have been there longer.

a great visit. i m not for captivty of animals but this zoo is very respectful for them and nice for people, just the circulation could be easier because some connexions don t exist and so it s sometime long to jon an other point..

We All Went to the Zoo One Day. Large zoo, with a good collection of animals. Many of the bigger animals have plenty of space in pleasant, simulated natural environments. A fair amount of walking required to see all animals (including hills), but both land train and chair lift available. Information about animals mainly in Czech.

Great ZOO in many ways. This ZOO is really well organized, there are a lot of animals that are being very well kept for. The staff I got to know is very friendly and nice.I would like to recommend Animal Theatre, they have very nice and educational shows.I was most impressed by polar bears, gorillas, elephants, giraffes and other savanna animals, that live there.

Overall a good day out . Worth a visit for sure, as a photographer it gave me lots of great up close photo opportunities as you can see I've included some. Overall a great variety and day out for all. Would recommend coming up with a route to follow prior to walking around to assure you see everything.

Good day in Prague. Zdenik was great. The boat cruise was good, a little crowded. It was made very enjoyable by the enthusiastic and very knowledgable tour guide, Zdenik. He provided us with many interesting facts and fun conversations. Answering all our questions and very fun to be around. We felt very looked after and comfortably. The zoo was a great experience. Beautiful elephants, wild cats, polar bear, it was well put together and all the animals seems cared for and in the right environment.

One of the best in the World. Great zoo, you actually dont suffer when seeing animals in captivity, they are taking good care of them, have a lot of animal rpeservation projects going on and currently there is a small elephant and gorilla! In the future, they are planning pandas. And the animal exhibits are constantly being renovated. For me this is the most important. They also have great guest facilities and a day in this ZOO will definitely be worth it!

Excellent value for money! Must see!. For the equivalent of £6 per person the zoo is the seventh best zoo in the world!. You cannot see it all in one day. The bus stops right outside the zoo and leaves every six minutes! What zoo can you vivit in England or Wales for such a small amount. It is hilly so be prepared for a climb! There is a cable car if you are brave enough to use it. Ample extremely cheap drinks machines. The snacks are also very very cheap!. A meal with wine and a beer only cost about £6. But there are ample picnic areas too. Don`t iss it if you vivit Prague.
kids paradise. take a whole day, 'cause it's to big to see in few hours. anyhow take a chair lift to catch a wonderful view.

I loved it!. It was easy to get here with the sub and by a connecting bus. You have to know that you have to spend almost a whole day here, because it's wery much to look at. The zoo is very nice built, every habitat for the animals was carefully done and most of them had a lot of space to be in. The owl's and the leopard had very small areas, the didn't look very happy about that. The food that was served in the luncharea by the elefants were pretty bad. Deepfried chicken that were incredible dry and overdone. But over all, it was a great day at the zoo.
"No. 4 ZOO in the world". The ZOO is in a beautiful greeny location in Prague, where is also nice view of the town. All animals look very well cared of, healthy, and happy.... :-)

Excellent zoo. We spent about 4 hours here and probably didn't see everything. Some great animals and enclosures, lots to see. High up in the zoo actually has some great views also. A lot of walking so wear comfortable shoes.

Amazing Exhibits, Beautiful animals. Good Points: - Lots and lots of great exhibits to walk around and see.- Fun little things to do like the chair lift and zoo express train- Very cheap compared with other zoos- Mist machines on hot days. Nothing compares to that feelingBad points:- Horse rides, we watched as the horses on a 30 degree plus day gave multiple rides back to back without a break or any fluids at all. That was disappointing.

Take your Passport if you are over 70 years old.. We had a great time exploring this zoo. There are lots of animals to see and they are out of their cages. There is lots of greenery and also lots of water falls and ponds etc. There are plenty of food outlets and rest areas. If you can prove your age and over 70 years you get in for 1 CZK.

Nice and big zoo. Prague has a very nice and big zoo. Enjoyed it a lot. Tickets aren't very pricey even though the place has so much to see. There's quite much up-hill climbing depending on which way you roam the place. There's many places to have something to eat and drink and sit down a bit.Animals seemed to have nice places to live in and there are so many animals, that even though we stayed there about 6 hours, we didn't go see all of them. You can also visit the place in the evening. Some of the houses won't be open then, but otherwise the place is open until 21.00.Something that I always wish at the zoo, that people wouldn't use flashlight when photographing and the workers would tell people not to do that more often.
Bigger than expected. Was surprised how big the zoo was, spent a good 6 hours seeing things at leisure. Lots of walking up and down hills so quite tiring but good day out.

Happy animals, happy people!. The zoo is spacious, the exhibits are big and well kept, there are many places with or without animals for children to keep them busy - especially Bororo - the enormous jungle gym! Highly recommend!If you go there during the weekdays and out of the summer season, there is a big chance that you will have half of the zoo only for yourself!

Brilliant Zoo. A lot of stairs and hills to climb which is not what you would expect so do bare this in mind! the animals they have there is amazing, they have elephants as well as polar bears which you do not always see in a Zoo. Animals well looked after with a lot of on site vending machines and restaurants.. Do also try the mountain side Seat Lift which is great fun and a good way to look across the park

A great day out, highly recommended . Spent a wonderful family day at Prague Zoo, excellent weather, a wide array of animals and species to see in conditions that allow more freedom within their enclosures. The staff are extremely welcoming and friendly, giving the family a day to enjoy and look back on in fondness

Prague Zoo. The Prague Zoo was a great experience throughout. The animals seem healthy and well taken care of. The African exhibit and the Polar bears were especially exciting. They had quite a nice aviary as well as a great cheetah exhibit.

Very interesting. it is very beautiful . The paths are very well designed - you can very easily move around and watch the animals. There are a lot of animals kept in nice areas. It attracts children's interest as well. You easily reach it by public transport. Not expensive.

One of the best zoos I've been too if not the best! . Very big zoo, my girlfriend and I spent about 5 hours here. Easy to get to just search on google maps how too and it's pretty self explanatory! Was only about £8/€9 each to get into which i thought was very reasonable! Highly recommend!

A great zoo! . After visiting great zoos at home in the UK we were curious to see if Prague zoo met the expectation of the 'the best zoo in continental europe.' We weren't disappointed. It was very easy to get to from central Prague, taking the metro and bus, it took us around 30 mins. There is plenty to see and the area is easy to navigate. We liked the fact that even in August it wasnt too touristy and seemed to be mostly Czech people around.

A Zoo with Animals - How Unique!. This is a nice place that actually has animals and lots of them. I gave up my membership at Brookfield Zoo near Chicago since it has become more of a park than a zoo. Easy to get to but make sure you are on the right tram no. 17.
Good One. Very well maintained and fantastic panoramic view.. We enjoyed too much.. The species were great and maintenance is with 100% marks

A great Learning Experience. A best Zooo have ever enjoyed in.The categories of Species was simple awesome.. specialy Panda, Whale, Shaanti The Elephant from India, The White Tiger from Bengal.. .Seriously WOW.. Our Indian Animal Foundation should learn from them and keep the species with best place

Great zoo, and welcoming to those with limited physical ability. During our trip to central Europe, our daughter badly sprained her ankle and couldn't walk without crutches. We had to find things to do that were welcoming to those with limited mobility. The Prague zoo was perfect. I called the staff the morning we went and reserved a wheelchair, which is free. The staff on the phone spoke perfect English. We took the bus to the zoo, got the wheelchair with no problem, and had a great day. The lions and tigers were fascinating - I have never seen them so close up! It's a beautiful park, and everything was perfect.
Beautiful and huge zoo. Great zoo, big areas for the animals, great view from the top and cheap beer =) Five or six playgrounds for the kids and many opportunities for families to have fun.

More to see that you've got time to spend!. We spend five hours in the zoo, and it was a wonderful experience and lots of animals to see. Unfortunately we didn't have the time, but you could easily spend a whole day in there. Lots of animals to see and experience

5 points is not enough!!!. Ok, I'm a huge fan of Zoo Opole (Poland), but this zoo just knocked me to my knees, especially Max the cutest baby elephant ever.First of all, the original ZOO PRICE FOR ADULT IS 200 CZK = € 7.3 = £ 6.4 = $ 8.4, so please be careful with offers that ask for 4x this price. To get to the zoo (outskirts of Prague) you can go by taxi, metro + bus or use steamer boat (all infos on zoo website in Czech, English, Russian, Chinese).The zoo is huge (good for a whole day trip), very well kept, unusually clean and what's most important, you don't have to imagine natural environments of animals you see. The zoo stays as true as possible to the original habitats of its animals (Valley of Elephants, huge Giraffes enclosure with binoculars installed, or nearly vertical rocky wall inhabited by "goats"). The best thing is, that I don't remember any fence, wall or glass that limited the visibility. The other thing that I love about this zoo, is that it cares for animals' privacy. If they have enough noisy people or flashes from the cameras, they can just leave and not be bothered in other parts of their home. This zoo is about animals' well-being and not tourists' whims. There are restaurants and food-kiosks. You can have a beer or ten, seating on a picnic table, watching you kids playing in a sandbox. There are few gift shops with stuffed animals, clothes and other souvenirs.For those with sense of adventure or not so kin on walking, the zoo provided a chair-line to the higher part of the object.Personally I advise to visit elephants at 10am (not in the pavilion but next to Gulab Restaurant) and have fun watching their youngest Max playing with hay and his "cousin" Sita. To see what I mean, you can check them on 8 livestream cameras on zoo website.So while visiting wonders of Prague, don't forget to plan one day trip to this amazing zoo, you won't regret it. Have fun (I know you will). ;-)

What an amazing place!. Hardly know where to start! Easy to get to on public transport (which is, incidentally, brilliant and a bargain). Very cheap to get in; about £5 per adult at the time of writing, which is incredible considering the quality of the zoo and the variety of animals, including tigers, red pandas, hippos, anacondas, eagles, vultures, polar bears and gorillas to name but a few! The enclosures were a good size and with plenty of natural features. We stayed for five hours and would've stayed longer but for my knee giving out due to all the hills. Speaking of which, the paths are good quality and there are plenty of sitting areas, kids play areas and cafes to stop at, but there are still a lot of hills to walk. The cafes are low priced and the food's fine; we paid around £4 each for a drink and a panini. There's also lots of drinks machines around where you can pick up a bottle of water for about 70p. And we enjoyed the cable cars, though the guys managing it are a little brusque. I believe what I'm trying to say is: if you're going to Prague, the zoo is a must!

Worth a visit. Its easy to reach with metro an bus 112. Also there are several parking lots.It opens at 9 am and you should be there early because after 12 it gets kind of crowded.You gave to walk a lot but there is a small train. All over the zoo are vendingmachines with drinks and snacks. Plus there are several restaurants but there are no despriptions in english or german.This is the huge Problem in this beautiful zoo ... the descriptions at the cages are only in czech, although there are many tourists from orher countries. You can buy an english map at the entrance.All in all its a cheap way to spend a whole day outside plus its great for kids because of the enormous amount of playgrounds
A great day out! . Stunning scenery and views, a lot of variety in food and sights, very good prices (entry, drinks and ice cream all coat £16 for both of us). We had an absolutely incredible time!!

Excellent Afternoon Trip. My wife and I visited this zoo on a Sunday afternoon after using the tram / bus from Prague city center. It takes about 30 minutes to reach the zoo using public transportation.Entrance to the zoo was relatively cheap (I can't remember exact cost). Most of the signs for the zoo are primarily Czech, there are excerpts in English and Russian for each exhibit. The exhibits are spacious, so I ended up feeling better about the animals being there when compared to other zoos. We spent about 4 hours at the zoo, and we could have easily spent more.

A Day at a Zoo. The zoo is quite large and we spend 7 hours without seeing everything. There is a lot of walking to be done. Some very undulating paths.Vending machines throughout zoo walkways and family dinning areas. Alcohol available at between £1-£1.10 per .Entrance is just 200 koruna per adult with concessions for seniors children and family groups. Worth a visit.

Extremely interesting. I've been to many zoos, but this one is a really unique place including micro-climates of different zones, relocating you to different continents in your imagination by showing you not only animals, but all their natural habitat. Be ready for walking for long distances.

Well laid out and interesting zoo. Definitely worth spending a whole day. Almost all of the information is also available in English. Not sure how much room beyond their display areas the lions and tigers had, but the leopards had plenty.

Nice place... 6 hours fun. Visiting this zoo might be a good choice if you don't have any special plan for that day. Quite easy to find it, large enough and with a lot of animals, proved to be pretty fun for the kid. There is also a train (well, a car) you can ride inside the garden if you get tired.

Great day . We came here on 15th of August and had a fantastic day. The zoo is huge with so many animals to see, though I was quite disappointed that I didn't get to see any of the red pandas (main reason I wanted to come to the zoo). For being a zoo it was exceptionally clean, both the paths and animal enclosures were very well kept. I would definitely return if I come back to Prague.

Fantasic day out for young and old. spent the hole day here,great day out we are 60, so many beautiful animals to see,you can go on miniture train and chair lifts these are to be paid for once in but very reasonable as is the cafe and gift shops well worth a visit

Prague zoo is wonderful not only for kids. If you come here, make sure that you have the whole day, because the place is veeery big and you can have a very long and nice walk. On the territory you have couple of places to eat lunch or dinner and some cafeterias, also lots of automates with snacks and drinks. Don't hesitate to use funicular to go up, it's really worthy! ;) what I like personally about that place is that they treat animals nicely, they have quite big space and good conditions. Apart from outside expositions you can see some inside, Malaysian jungles, or African house :)

The best zoo ever!!!. What can I say? Fantastic in every way!! Very good price and after 4 hours walking around this beautiful zoo, we still haven't seen everything. The animals are kept in spacious enclosures which mirror image their natural habitat as closely as possible.Adults and children will have a memorable day here! Even the vending machines for drinks are similarly priced to a store.We will be back to see the parts we had to miss.

Great 1day attraction. Huge garden with reasonable english signs (make sure to ask for the english pamphlet at the cashier for 5Cz).Spent 6h and were not able to cover even 1/2 of its area.Also look for the seals show around 1pm.Got to a nice cantine on the west side of the pinguine pool with great chicken breast and pork neck.
Great for children. I'm not sure that I agree with zoos, but our children loved being able to see animals in the flesh, and it was one of the highlights of our holiday

Huge Zoo!. I've been to a lot of zoos over the years and I think this one was the biggest I've seen! There's a lot of ground to cover if you want to see everything. It was definitely worth the visit as there is such a great variety of animals to view.

Well worth a visit & incredible value.. Spent a very enjoyable day here during our recent trip to Prague. Very easy to get to - metro to Nádraží Holešovice station then the 112 bus direct to the zoo. It was named 4th Best Zoo in the World in the 2015 Traveller's Choice Awards. Like many things in Prague it is exceptional value - only 200 CZK (£6) for adult entry. Built on a series of terraces there is a lot of ground to cover so pace yourself. The views over the city from the upper levels are amazing. Far too many highlights in the animal kingdom to name them all but a few stand outs were the elephants, gorillas and penguins. There is a chair lift to the upper heights if you wish to save your legs or a little paddy train. There are plenty of places for refreshment breaks and again prices are very good. We took our own food and there are many areas where you can sit for your picnic.It is very easy to spend upwards of 4 hours here to do the place justice. If you have the time in your Prague schedule I'd recommend a visit.
One of the best Zoos we were ever. Very good attraction for families. Make sure that you have enough time to spend here since this Zoo is hugh and it takes a whole day to explore it.

An interesting day at the zoo Praha. Prague Zoo is an important objective that can break the monotony city and visits to castles, bridges, towers and other medieval attractions. It can be reached by car (parking costs 100 CKR. Per day) but with urban bus lines. The garden is not very common, distances between cages are large animals such generous and tourists must travel long distances to see them. Classical approach has not been respected in the sense that animals are not organized by species but after the place of origin. You will find it in more places tigers, lions, snakes, lizards, because exposure areas are arranged according to the ecosystems in which they arise. One day in August 2016 an electronic billboard to announce that that day had been registered almost 6000 visitors. I highly recommend this aim especially for families with children.

Best Zoo I've ever been to. If you are in Prague this is a must do! We visited in August, caught the metro and then bus 112 which took us directly to the zoo. A long queue which moved quickly and we were in. Work out at only £6 each! Top tip: purchase a map! The place is huge!!! Beautiful animals in amazing enclosures. Wonderfully set out, just incredible. They even have polar bears!!!We spent a good 4 hours there and could have spent even more time. Lots of reasonably priced food and drinks available throughout the zoo which was very convenient on a hot day. Just go and see for yourselves! Well done Prague Zoo.

Lovely zoo. Lovely zoo though a lot of walking involved. And i would say that the polar bear enclosure is too small other than that most the animals seemed to have good enclosures! But the tickets were very reasonably priced and we really enjoyed our day trip there.

Excellent and improving, worth to visit. And do not forget Botanical garden few steps away.. The Prague Zoo is almost one hundred years old and profits of excellent selection of place,at Troja, off the center, on the border of the river and with a good possibility to grow. It is evaluated as one of the 5 best in the world with almost 1,5 million visitors a year. It is large – takes a minimum of 4-5 hours to walk through. There are almost 5000 animals of almost 700 species, 58 hectars - I recommend good tourist shoes, you will walk a lot. You can come with your pets on a leash (and a lot of bowls with water are ready for them). Playing activities for children are ruch, offers also contests for kids, a speciality are night visits with a guide. Use google streetview for visiting online. Children love it as the animals are in good condition (often breeding here, incl. elephants and gorillas) and you can observe them the whole year round (mostly outside, giraffes sometimes run in snow) or inside in pavillons. I still remember how much less developed it was when I was a boy, animals mostly in cages, no open space like now, but who cares. Zoo offers reasonable prices for food and drinks of OK quality. And be aware, that few steps from this place is a Botanical Garden with more than 20 hectars and thousands of plants worth to visit - I like the japan garden inside and wineries on the slope of the hill (tasting possible with a nice view of Prague). Part of it is a large greenhouse (1750 square m). of tropic flora and some fauna. Altogether a whole day, but worth to visit. Use public transport, car parking, or walking cross the bridge (my favorite way and recommendation). During the summer it is better to book onlne in advance.
Great zoo. The experience was great and the zoo is so huge it would take the full day to explore and enjoy , we totally loved it

Recommended!. An enormous zoo with all animals you can wish for to see. The animals have very much space. Beautiful surroundings and nice beautiful strolls in the zoo. Lots of places to eat and drink inside the zoo. Only 30 minutes by tram/metro + bus from central Prague. Really worth a visit! Recommended for all ages.

All day thing. Prague Zoo is a great place to be. Never mind if you are young or old, traveling with kids or with your second half, Prague Zoo is a place to go, and when you go, plan to stay at least 5 hours. Its not only about animals, and trust me, there are great number of them. Its also about how people of Prague made their Zoo. It great and beautiful, large if I may add, place. Me and my girl were walking and after 90 minutes we looked at a map to see where we are within the ZOO, only to find out we walked 1/4 of entire place. Also a lot of places to refresh and eat, a lot of toilets, so no worries there. What you can to before you go is to try and find out at what time there are special shows. When I say special show I mean with animals performing. They said its for kinds, but at my 33 years I had a great time also :) If you can manage to see them, than organize it. Reaching ZOO is also easy. One metro line and a bus from city center. Metro line C and bus 112, maybe even with tram number 17. Never the less you have a lot of tourist info, were we got a free map and they explained how to reach it. When you get there also buy a ticket that costs 300 or 350 CZK (cant remember how much). With that you can enter the ZOO, Botanical garden and one...well they call it castle I would say villa. And yes, one more thing. Don t go on Mondays. Fata Morgana (part of botanical garden) does not work on Mondays (at least it did not work in August) and not seeing it would be a big mistake. Also, since ZOO and Troya castle work until 19:00 I suggest you go in the morning, first see the ZOO, then Botanical Garden and then the castle.

Prague Zoo. Took a boat trip from Cech bridge in Prague to the zoo, cost 240 Kc return & took 50 minutes.Entrance to the zoo, which was a 15 minute walk from the pier, cost 200Kc.The zoo itself was wonderfully laid out & could easily take a full day to explore.A highlight was the polar bears not often seen in zoos & all the animals seemed comfortable & well cared for.So, for a total cost of approx £17 per person Prague zoo & the boat trip were excellent value & a great day out.

Very well maintained and great experience!. This place is huge so you will find difficult covering it in a day. The zoo has such a wide variety of birds and animals with an attempt to maintain their natural living conditions that it is commendable. My three year old enjoyed the experience and so did we. Take the ride on the chairlift for fun or better still you can take the chairlift up and find your path down as you explore the zoo.

Not a great animal lover, still enjoyed. I never had any real desire or intention to visit this zoo but was offered free tickets from a friend. The zoo has a great selection of animals (especially birds I found) and is educational enough to feel like you've learnt something. It's also interesting to see how various floods have affected the zoo over history. Ask someone about Gaston the seal!

A great family visit.
