We had gone here expecting quite a small attraction but were pleasantly surprised to find out it was very much bigger than first thought.The staff were very helpful and the selection of wildlife and things to do is top notch. The only thing I would highlight is that the toilet facilities on site are not very good but other than that it's a great value family full day out.

HUGE!. This is by far the biggest zoo I've been to, so far. It is huge and there is a lot of walking involved. I loved it and loved the fact that there's a chairlift that can take you from the top to the bottom in no time; especially, since we couldn't walk anymore by the end of the day. The only reason I gave it a 3 star is because some animals are not meant to be kept in this weather in Prague! I am referring to polar bears!! They are not meant to live in the weather here or to be caged the way they are. They have a small-time pool where 1 of the polar bears kept swimming back and forth cz of the heat. The other polar bear tried to snuggle next to a chunk of ice to keep itself cool in this heat.

Fantastic place for entire day out. Outstanding in terms of size and amount of interesting stuff to do there. We weren't able to see everything, despite being there almost all day long. Unique exhibits, nicely organised, lots of different attractions to satisfy travellers of any age. Little tip: go there as early as possible and during work days - amount of tourists on weekends and afternoons may ruin the experience for you.
ZOO. Simply one of the best ZOO in Czech Republic. Tip: Take a tour at later daytime or cloudy weather. ZOO is much exiting with less visitors.

Plan to do a lot of walking!. This zoo has to be the largest I've visited. We've been there 4 times, and I still don't think we've seen all of it. The large cat pavilion is one of our favorites, as you are almost guaranteed to see a lion or tiger. The elephant habitat is also amazing, and worth the hike to that part of the zoo. Do plan to spend the day if you can.
Extraordinary visit . This is a must see in Prague. Beautiful zoo with fantastic displays and rare species. The baby elephant, giant salamander, polar bears, aviarium, Tigers and many more.

Great day out. Prague's zoo is fantastic! Loved it. Lots to do. Great for kids. Went on really hot day so little water splash pool was great for kids to cool down. Restaurants in zoo were really good, lots to choose from. Ice crams shops all around too. We had a great day there! Definitely all day trip!

Outstanding zoo. I have visited zoo's all over the world and this one rates in the top five. Plan on doing a lot of walking. There are plenty of trees and snack bars to help with all the walking. They do offer a train ride service and chair lifts between the lower area near the river and the second section of the zoo on top of the hill. In the summer they offer extended hours to 9 pm. Most of the pavilions close at 7 pm. Today were lucky to get to see a 10 day old giraffe, three month old gorilla and five month old elephant. They have some nice outdoor exhibits and prized Mongolian horse exhibit.

Walk there from city centre!. Prague zoo is one of the nicest zoos I've visited; the animals are treated really well and there is so much to see! If you can think of an animal Prague zoo probably has it. We walked through a beautiful park and a small vineyard to get there and it was really beautiful.
Absolutely must see. The place is huge and you can easily stay there for an entire day. You will not get bored. It's very well mantained, with various animals, food and drink.

Tremendous Experience. My father wanted to go to the Prague Zoo for his birthday, and we had a lovely day. The zoo is incredibly spacious with lots of land and trees. Although we did not have any children with us, we loved the fact that the zoo was so focused on children - lots of play areas everywhere. The zoo is definitely hilly, so wear comfortable shoes. We were pretty tired after visiting the entire zoo on foot. It was a treat to see the elephants and polar bears in such beautiful and spacious enclosures.
Easy to walk and organized . We bought full tickets with zoo and aquarium, many species of aninals and easy signs to follow the walking directions

Disappointed. Prague Zoo is spread over a large bit of land with very little animals in it. We got up early one morning and got the bus to here but it is worth knowing it was really busy. We had to que for 30 minutes once we got there for tickets into the park. When we left the ques were longer, I don't think they serve people quick enough. Like I said, there's not many animals in here. Lots and lots of walking to do with little to see.

Love it. It's a huge place, you can spend the whole day there (&you should). With a lot of funny thing, and several species. Hipo and polar bears were our favourite. If you like animals and nature, you must go there, it is on of the best, I've ever seen.
Great Zoo. Easy to get there by bus. Not expensive. Lots of areas for kids to touch the animals. Took about 2-3 hours in total to see all. Not crowded.

Superb zoo. We took a trip along the river from Prague to the zoo which was a lovely way of getting there. We took the bus and metro back which was extremely easy, just make sure you purchase your ticket in advance or have ample change for the ticket machine.The zoo is extremely large and well kept with a very wide range of species including rare przewalski horses for which this zoo has a important breeding programe. The entry was extremelyd reasonable at 600 Korunas for a family ticket, so about the same as a single ticket in the UK. Food and drink was also reasonably priced.I would definitely recommend it as a family day out whilst in Prague and will visit again if in Prague.
Best Zoo Ever. My boyfriend and I had a fantastic day at Prague Zoo. I would recommend giving yourself the whole day there as its a massive zoo with lots of wonderful animals to see.

Best zoo ever!. This zoo is huge and is a must visit for anyone in Prague who loves animals. Make sure you've got some comfortable shoes on and you can easily spend all day here and you probably still won't see anything. Quite a lot of hills for people who struggle with walking but lots of places to stop with toilets and places to eat like a 5 minute walk apart.

The BEST zoo I've ever been to!. Having visited many zoos whilst travelling around Europe and other parts of the world - I have never been to one quite like this!150 CZK for a student (student pass needed) and 200 CZK for an adult. Absolutely GREAT value for money - we spent around 4 hours here but could have definitely spent longer. The place is absolutely huge and the scenery is so beautiful.There are numerous cafes and vending machines dotted around the zoo. The prices are actually really reasonable - much cheaper than any other zoo I have been too! I got a big bowl of chips and sauce for 55 CZK/£1.76 Great day out for ALL the family. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Prague - easily accessible by metro station/bus. Just ask your hotel for directions, I'm sure they would be happy to help :-)

Must visit!. It really is one of the nicest zoo's in the world! They got really rare animals and the parc is very clean. Two minor points are the food and the fact that there is not a good route to walk the whole parc. Apart from that it's really good and a real must see!

One of the best, if not the best zoo in Europe that I saw. It has been many years since I visited Prague Zoo last time and just a month ago I visited London Zoo. Many new features in Prague Zoo, like Indonesian Jungle and great space, indoor and outdoor, for elephants and giraffes. Zoo path goes up the hill but as an alternative there is also a small cable car (however, you pay for it, 25 CZK). Entrance to the Zoo is 200 CZK for adults, you can pay by card. The feel you have is that animals are well cared of and have sufficient space to live. Several cafes serve hungry and thirsty visitors and toilets are in sufficient number and clean. You can come by bus 112, at peak hours on weekend they are as frequent as every 5 minutes! To reach them, you have to take tram (we took a tram on line 17) or metro line C to station Nadrazi Holesovice.

The Best Zoo ive been too.. Im by no means a zoo expert but ive been too a few zoos in Europe and the Americas and Prague Zoo is by far the best one ive been too. I went with my other half for the day during our January holiday. We got the bus through and it was super easy to navigate.The zoo its self is massive, i mean seriously big and its got some hills that get the calves burning but thats not a bad thing. Theres so many animals there i didnt even get to see them all and i was there for a good few hours. Staff were friendly and helpful.As we were there in January not all animals where on show, but whats great is that even though we couldn't see some of the animals outside you were still able to see some inside, like the elephants and giraffes.What i cant get over is how cheap it is to get in! cost us the equivalent of about £5 each so 11/10 for price. We didnt eat there, but its a zoo so dont expect any Gordon Ramsey style cuisine. The layout of the zoo is great and theres always something new and different about each section. Only downside was that the viewing tower at the end of the zoo was closed due to it being winter, but thats completely understandable. I have such fond memories of the zoo and i can not wait to return again.

Spot on! !. Was really cheap, only £6 for entering. You don't get a free map but worth buying one, it isn't expensive. Loads to see, but wear good shoes! Lots of cheap food vendors, we got the sausage and mustard meal and it was delicious. You can walk around freely with a beer, perfect day out!!
A day at the Zoo. Easy access from the centre of Prague. It's a Zoo - what more to say?! There seemed to be a lot of enclosures where we couldn't see anything. Ideal for the children.

Fun for all ages!. Took a trip on my birthday! Very large zoo and animals were being playful! We used the Iamamsterdam card to get a discount. Lots of fun for all ages and nice break to nature from all the more touristy places. Cafe/ restuarant on the property before buying tickets was very good- looks like the locals do brunch there!
Loved this place. This is by far the largest zoo we have visited in Europe. Takes quite a while to cover all attractions. We spent almost 5 hours there and our son loved it.

Best zoo I’ve seen in my live. Many friends told me that Prague zoo was good. But I was not expecting that it will be that good. It is nice composition of habitable zones from around the world in which huge number of animals are incorporated. Plan to go there from morning to evening if you want to see all parts of the zoo. The ZOO is really big with many things to see. I would advise to bring along some water and snack. But there are number of places in the zoo you can buy food or drink.

Great zoo in parts. On the positive side this zoo is a great day out. Very cheap to get in and once in the food and drinks are just as cheap unlike other zoos in other places. There is an amazing array of animals but on the negative side some of the enclosures are extremely small. Also it would be a good the change the glass on some of the enclosures as it's really difficult to see inside due to the glare. We went on a cloudy day and we still struggled to see inside some of them. All in all a good day out.

Our Top 1 in Prague. Prague zoo is the top 1 favorite place in Prague. Very nice place, all notes have english translation, animals are healthy and they have big close-to-natural habitat cages. Many species and even parents will have a good time. On the way to zoo can choose to have a river cruise. Or the direct bus.

Loved this zoo!!!. This zoo has really made an impression on me! You can get so close to the animals, the polar bears where my fav by far!! It's cheap to get in and food and drink are very reasonable priced in fact our hotel charged more for drink than here!! We got the metro and then the 112 bus it was very easy to get to and as your metro ticket covers the bus it was very cheap travel! The animals do have big enclosures however I felt the animals may have been board a lot were showing repeat behaviours like walking back and forth on the same bit over and over mainly the cats and polar bears :o(

How to get there. Just a quick note to everyone on how to get there by public transportation.
No. 112 bus from Nádraží Holešovice metro station on line C.

Wow!. We had been recommended by a czech friend as she said this was her favourite place in the whole of Prague and I can see why. When we got there we were astounded at the price, only 200 kc to get in. The variety of animals was amazing and we saw a polar bear for the first time. The range of facilities and eateries was good and the prices were extremely reasonable! A lovely inexpensive day out, well worth the journey!

Lovely day out . Me and OH visited zoo and had a lovely time, got a bit tired nearer the end and missed a couple of the animals but we're happy with what we saw. Was a busy day (especially by the gorillas, may be best to try and get a glimpse at a quieter time) lots of souvenir stops and toilet stops, also plenty of drinks and food places. Taxis wait outside but do charge more than you'd think so perhaps look into alternate transport back to the centre. The giraffes and elephants were beautiful, really fun day out!

Ideal Sunday with Family. I visited Prague Zoo Garden already 100 times and I could fully recommend visit to everyone. It is one of the nicest Zoo Gardens in whole Europe. It is the best entertainment place in Prague for families with small kids, but also nice place for couples.
The best ZOO but quite far !!!. Big beautiful ZOO, worth of 30 minutes drive, must see if you are animals lover. I would recommend half day for this attraction.

Nice, big zoo. Beautiful zoo with many animals. A big zoo where its easy to get lost if you don't have a map. There is a difference in height where a fun factor was added: the chairlift! For only 50 cr or 1 euro u can go up and down.Many lovely animals with good facilities for animals and visitors as well. You can see they are taking care of everything. The Giraffes and elephants have beautiful places but the tigers 'home' is a bit small. According to me today they were nervous walking back and forth.Entrance is only 200 CR which makes it a great place to go when in Prague. Its easy to get here via subway and bus but also taking a walk from the subway is very nice to see a different part of Prague.

Huge, world class zoo.. There are many animals here that we'd never seen in real life-bush babies, slow loris, giant salamanders. Truly amazing. The themed areas like the rain forest are spectacular.Information is in many languages. Animal welfare and conservation is clearly important. (Though the polar bears and tigers looked bored) Admission is reasonable as is food and drink (unlike British zoos) Words of warning-the place is huge and on many levels. Get to the top and work down. Paths are sometimes not level, especially in the darker indoor areas, so may not be wheelchair friendly.
Loved it!. Absolutely loved it! Buying a map is recommended because otherwise you will get lost! Lots of gift shops and cafes and places to sit. Brilliant.Well worth the 200czk entrance fee!

Great zoo . There was 2 small children 2 older children and 3 adults we had a fantastic time, spent all day there and still did not see it all, the animals looked well taken care of which is nice. You can get a beer anywhere in there, they have an adventure playground for the older kids as well.

Great day out. I had heard of the zoo before going to Prague, but there was nothing in the guide books and not much in the tourist info centre. We decided to ask someone about it and they said it would be ok to spend half the day there. We made our way on the metro then bus and it didn't take too long. Transport and entry were very cheap less than £10 each I would say. We were blown away with how vast and well kept the zoo was. The food was lovely and cheap and there was so much to see - way more than half a days worth.I would highly recommend, especially for those with children.
A great zoo. A full day out. Animals clearly well cared for with plenty of space. Really enjoyable and not hard to get to from Prague centre by tram and bus.

Lovely day out. Being from San Diego, I am spoiled when it comes to zoo's. As we have the World Famous San Diego Zoo and The Wild Animal Park, which are awesome. So when I usually go to any other zoos, I am not impressed. Even stopped going to other zoos in other countries as was always disappointed. But my friend told me the Prague zoo was pretty good. So my husband and I gave it a go. Was happily surprised. Very big zoo. Plenty of room for the animals. Good variation of them as well. Good enclosures that were spacious. You can even pay an extra admission to bring your dog along. We had a very nice afternoon. Would recommend going if you have a free afternoon on your visit to Prague.

Great setup, great zoo. We were a little turned around arriving and ended up coming in through a back entrance. Once we had our bearings, we found the Prague Zoo to be a tremendous place to spend a day. The exhibits were great with fantastic views of the animals. We loved the creative setup (like the mountain goat exhibit and area behind the african indoors). Try to catch the feeding of the tigers. The views of the tigers here - my kids' favorites - were the best we'd seen in a zoo. A pleasant surprise for us, this zoo is world-class.
Prague Zoo. Overcrowded and overpriced zoo full of people who don't know how to behave. Buz on the other hand you can see there many various animal species.

One of the biggest and most beautiful zoos in Europe. Compared to its entry price (8€/pers), it is really unavoidable!We spent around 3 hours in it, and did not succeed to finish it. It is well arranged, and there are a lot of animals to see

nice but lots of prams and buggies. very nice zoo but there was a ton of people with prams and buggies there literally the whole zoo was just littered with buggies and crying kids so please dont add to this by bringing young children to this zoo. do the people around you a favor

Nice zoo. We went to Prague zoo with the info, that it is small and nicely kept. It was vast understatement. It is huge zoo with lot to see and extemely well kept. On the down side the area is large and there are lots of walking/climing up the hills. They even have a small cable lift to reach the highest areas.

Call of the Wild!. Amazing! I can't describe it otherwise.This is the best and most beautiful zoo i have ever seen! You can get close to some of the animals,it's enormous,you are never far away from a restroom,lots of places to buy something to eat or drink and that for only 200 kc or about 8 euro!! We walked around from 10.30 untill 19.40.This is the place to be!

Paid 8$ to see more than I expected.. Amazing experience for the money, in the states the cost would be 30$ atleast. I saw an orang-utan pick up straw and make nest with his feet and then cover his fort with the pizza box. Also if your wanting to channel your inner Brunce Wayne, they have an open bat exhibit which is amazing as it sounds.

The zoo. Very nice zoo for the whole family. Very big but with plenty of restrooms and places to eat and drink. After six hours we still hadn't seen it all so I recommend to book the entire day for this.

Huge area. Lots of such a beautiful animals. Never seen so huge zoo.
There were lots of people there, but it didn't bother us.

Great day out - 2 adults . We are 2 adults in our 20s and we had a great day at the zoo. Fairly easy to get to and find with public transport. The entry fee is so reasonable-cheapest zoo iv been to. The actual zoo is great - brilliant enclosures, loads of animals and they all seem so happy and well looked after. There is a cable car going through the zoo - it costs extra but it's cheap - I think £1 each. It's terrifying but great fun! We rode it twice. There is also a lot of different food options in the zoo - all well priced. Definitely recommend this zoo for a day out - we spent 4 hours here.

Lovely Zoo. I'm not a fan of Zoos in general but heard Prague Zoo is one of the better ones. The animals have so much space and clean conditions was great to see. Its a shame other Zoos dont follow suit like Prague Zoo. Amazing animals that are well cared for. Lots to see and plenty to do. Kids of all ages will love it. Our daughter is 12 and was amazed at seeing a polar bear and elephant for the first time. Glad we visited and a nice break from the city.

Where are the animals?. The place is really big. And you are good if you manage it all in one day! A lot of the areas were without animals. Maybe they were on vacation? The large "natural" areas for the animals were nice though.

IT WAS A GREAT DAY TOURING THE ZOO WE WHERE THERE FOR ONE DAY AND WE DID NOT SEEN IT ALL, EVEN WE WENT UP WITH THE CHAIR. When you are in Prague don't forget to visit the zoo it's a great outing for the whole family and i's worth every cent you pay to enter and I will visit the zoo again when I go to Prague again

Amazing!. This just might be one of the best zoos in the world! Absolutely amazing. The entire place is enormous and well cared for. It's clean and fun to walk around everywhere. So many animals and so much information. The place is fun for all ages, adults and children alike. Do not miss out on this experience; it was one of the best in Prague.
The best!!!!. I loved it! The best zoo I have ever been! My advice is- take comfortable shoes and prepare for long walks. Go before lunch so you would have time to see everything. It is huge!!!

4th Best Zoo in the World. This zoo is huge! It takes a whole day of walking and you barely see it all. There is a huge variety of animals and what I loved most about it was that the animals actually had space to move about. It's a must see! PS: Some of the walking is uphill, thus I would recommend good walking shoes.
big. very large zoo, you will need more than one day to cover it all, you can easily get lost in. many kind of animals. and there are fees for parking

Fantastic value for money and well worth a visit. Great view and local transport straight to the entrance. Very cheap at about 7 euros entry for an adult. You could spend all day here no problem, Food kiosks inside sell local delicacies like sausages and cabbage at minimal cost also, Great viewing and access to the animals
Zoo. Very nice place. Suitable for the families. It is rather big area. Many animals to see from all over the world.

Excellent place for animals and visitors. The zoo is rated one of the best in the world and rightly so. The setting is just amazing, plenty of space for the animals and visitors.It's huge (10 km of walkways), plenty of time is needed to see as much as possible. It is well served with refreshment places (reasonably priced) and public toilets, so it's quite easy to spend a whole day there. There is plenty to do for the children, there is also a viewing tower, and a cable car, a train running through the park.

"WELL ORGANISED AND MAINTAINED". I thought Prague Zoo was amazing - definitely the best I've been to. Its huge - my friend and I was there for 6 hours. The enclosures are lovely - very spacious. All of the animals looked like they had loads of space. The selection of animals is very broad. We were able to see most of the animals. If they weren't outside you could almost always go to the indoor part of the enclosure and see them there.I will definitely go back!!

Great day out. Great day out. Make sure you make in an all day thing. It was 200 CZK for entry. (About £6) and we were there for a good 6 hours. Ice cream is amazing and is 30 CZK (£1) water was about 20CZK (65p) so they don't try and rip you off when you're in.
One of the best in the world. We are a family with kids from different ages, we spent the day in the zoo enjoing the variety of the animals.

Cheap tickets and excellent zoo. A very big zoo and good size cages. Would advise a full day at this zoo. Easily accessible through the metro and then bus. Different to british zoos, i found that i was a lot closer to the animals than i had been before. I was about 2 metres away from a giraffe! Wide range of animals, liked how a few of them were mixed together. Wasn't a fan of the sad looking ponys carrying young children around in the hot weather.

Best Zoo I ever seen. Best Zoo I ever visited, it's kind of green park were you can rest in nature and by the way see lots of animals.To get there you need to get bus 112 it goes to zoo from Nádraží Holešovice metro station on line C.Admission for zoo is 200czk (7-7.5 eur) don't forget to buy the map (5czk 0.15eur) because the signs on zoo territory are not accurate. I recommend to start walking from south-west direction (seals, penguins) and after seeing first level you can go up level by rope way (25czk) In the territory are lots of places for "picnic", cheap burgers and hot dogs and beer. plan your visit in early morning, you need almost whole day to see the zoo and have ea good rest.

I would give it more stars if I could . I fell in love with the zoo, honestly the best experience ever. The way they have built the zoo is amazing, it's massive with enough space for every animal. I'm not sure if it's true but i heard it was the 4th best zoo in the world and I can see why. I spent 4 hours which wasn't enough time for me so I'm definitely going back again. I recommend those who are visiting Prague to see the zoo!!

Enjoyable but touristy. Max is the baby elephant born this year and was cute. The mountain goats are really close to their habitat of nearly shear cliffs. It is worth 5Kc for the map because it is easy to get lost and circle the same loop. There is still work to be done recovering from the flood, but all in all a nice outing that is different from the history sight seeing. Take the tram and bus to the zoo, super cheap and easy. Plan your route using google maps or online Prague transit. Wear walking shoes because there is a lot of it, much up or down hill.

Great and affordable fun for one whole day. Well maintained Zoo with many different animals. Affordable entrance and also the restaurants inside the Zoo (which was quite surprising, lunch in one of the restaurants inside the Zoo was 100,- to 200,- and a beer 32,-). Saw the most of the main attractions. They have the feeding times for animals. Highly recommend to visit animals during feeding times. Take a foto from the feeding times at the main entrance, since we didn't find those inside.

Up close. We spent an entire day at the zoo and it was a great experience. They have all sorts of animals and you can get pretty close. The animals had a lot of space, which was nice to see and both the entrance and the food was very affordable.

Fantastic day out. Great way to spend the whole day, public transport is very easy to get to the zoo, and the day ticket is very reasonable, the cable chairs are great fun! And the trains that go round are also a good price, there are plenty of places to stop and have a snack or drink, there are so many different animals to see, it is defiantly worth a visit, great day!

Huge Zoo for a great day out. Loads of animals well cared for with space to move. The walkways are Tarmac so easy to get around with pushchair and great for kids to run free with no traffic. The highlights for us were the elephants and gorillas. There is also a chair lift and motorised train looking trailers to take you around. There is so much to see 1 day would not really do it justice. A jewel of Prague that most tourists never see. You can get a boat or a tram (17) from the centre. Loved it!

Well maintained zoo. This is a good zoo, lots of breeding programas it seems, lots of endangered and critically endangered animals being kept there, multiple enclosures for similar animals is encouraging, suggests an active management policy, we did see some stressed animals (primarily the bull Indian elephant) but when you have hundreds of animals, some are going to be stressed some of the time, it's inevitable. The enclosures are very good, and have had a lot of thought put into them. Plan to spend a whole day here, take a picnic and buy some well priced beers there.
Amazing place . Amazing place with a hugh amount of animals. Attractions for kids, rest areas. Worth each cent. From 10:00 to 17:00 we visited about 60% of zoo. Very good and cheap.

Excellent day out for the family and very reasonable prices to get in. With the exception of Chester Zoo, this is the best I have visited. Eating and Drinking no dearer when inside. Best to get a free map just after ticket sales before you go through the entrance turnstiles as not all information is in English.

One of the Best in Europe - Try and spend many hours to see and understand the evolving concepts. We have visited every zoo where ever we went as a family.Taking in to consideration the distance from city,ease of travel,design and landscape of the zoo and the types of animals,birds fish and insects on display Prague Zoo was exceptional.The conservation projects were second to none.We liked the mountain goat display and the river islands for birds a lot.To see the Pinnawela elephants was a delight .

Polar Bears. Worth it just to see the polar bears. Nice zoo, very large, bring your walking shoes. Nice restaurant, snack shops and ice cream. Easily accessible by bus and tram but we took the boat which was a relaxing ride.

Extraordinary. Not for weak people. To experience everything you need to go for a walk up the hill. All means of transport are there for people's use, of course but there is no charm in this. We actually could see most of animals and birds, also the view of Veltawa was breathtaking.

A have nice Zoo. When you have children and love to watch animals, a visit to Prague Zoo certainly worth a visit. The park is great, and the animals have plenty of space. It is possible to buy food and drink at reasonable money.

Hella zoo. This Zoo is big! It was hard work up and down the hill in the hot sun, but well worth the effort with lots of weird animals like a rabbit donkey and pigfoxes!! Or this is what they looked like - most things had an English translation but we didn't need those. Everything here is great value for money. There is ice cold beer on tap and great food for £4-£5 that's really tasty! Especially with the amazing view from the top of the hill. The ice cream is also really good quality and yumtastic. I booked tickets via trip advisor including transport to and from and our taxi driver looked after us really well. He was hilarious and played us some crazy 80s music. Do recommend!

Best zoo I have ever been in. This is the best zoo I have ever been in and I have been in zoos all over the world. While they have fantastic large enclosures for vultures, elephants, giraffes, zebra, wolves; they also have a lemur exhibit where you can be with the lemurs in their exhibit - this is the first impression - awesome. The true highlight of this zoo is 3 Amur Leopards. The rarest cat in the world had 2 Cubs. For sure a do not miss. This is the model that all zoos should follow. TONs of play areas for kids that need to blow off energy, tram rides around the zoo, a chairlift to get from one end to the other, workers constantly cleaning, almost no zoo smell. Simply amazingAll of the animals looked very well cared for and happy. Two polar bears playing and smiling in their large exhibit. A baby elephant playing with the herd. List amazing. Great job!

Great Zoo. Great zoo set in the hills outside Prague. We visited by taking the 1 hour boat trip from centre of town which was pleasant though not the most interesting. The zoo is set in a hill so be prepared for plenty of hills. There is a fun chairlift and a tree top viewpoint. Great selection of animals in a well maintained zoo. Gorillas a highlight for us. Polar bear enclosure was only one I thought should have been bigger for these magnificent animals. Walked back into town through a lively park before picking up the tram back into town.
Best zoo in Europe! :). Amazing, magical zoo! The park is very huge, we think so it is a full-day program (about 4 hours without a child :D ).

Awesome Zoo. This is probably the nicest zoo I have visited. The animal habitats are large and well kept and the animals seem to live well. The zoo is on a steep hillside with two main levels. You can walk the hill between them but also opt for the chairlift...The are several nice restaurants and cafes with good food at very reasonable prices. Many activities and playgrounds for kids as well. The entry is only CZK 600 for the entire family, which is a steal!This place can only be recommended.

One of the best zoos in Europe. This zoo really surprised me. I have been in different zoos in Europe with my Family (in Finland, Germany, Sweden, Denmark, Holland etc) and I wasn't expecting that much from this zoo. But it was more than I or anybody in my family expected.The overall area of the zoo is very large and even if we spent more than three hours at the zoo we didn't have the time to explore it completely. There is much to see at the zoo and also playing grounds for the children, pony rides and other activities. We were expecting that the animal enclosures would be smaller than in the other European zoos but we were wrong. For the most part the enclosures were comparable to other European zoos. The animals were also quite active.The one place where we especially spent some time was the elephant area and the giraffe area next to it. Both of them had a large number of animals and also good places to photograph them.If you're visiting the zoo then you should also visit the wooden observation tower at the hill. But not that the tower is closed for safety reasons during the winter time.The only challenge that we had in the zoo was that in the cafeterias the menus were only in Czech and not in English. This made the ordering of the food somewhat challenging but we still succeeded.. :)

Lovely place. We spent about three hours wandering around the zoo and enjoyed it a lot. The drinks and ice cream were reasonably priced in the zoo grounds which isn't always the case. I'd like to see more signage in multiple languages as this did make it a little more difficult for us to find our way but it's not a major issue. There were lots of places to sit for a breather which was great and a fab chair lift which was good fun!

Lack of animals. The zoo is huge but because it was a hot day, many of the animals weren't out but hiding in the shade. The best part of the zoo were the gorilla, giraffe and elephant exhibits. They have baby elephants and gorillas born at the zoo recently so it was fun to watch. If you take A metro then catch a bus, there is a stop called Zoo so it's not hard to find. Beware that it does get crowded on the bus back with strollers and families.
One day at the zoo. We spent a whole day at the zoo and saw a lot of wonderful animals, had a lovely lunch and walked around some more after that.

AN Interesting Zoo. Located on the side of a hill, the Zoo is best explored by taking the road train to the top and meandering down hill. The polar bears are a great attraction and there are many animals in easy to view enclosures. If travelling from Central Prague take the tram 17 to the stop past Nadrazi Holesovice Metro Station then catch the frequent 112 bus from Trojska direct to the Zoo. Going by river involves a bit of a walk and going by metro involves a complex interchange. A must visit if you have children.

As an animal lover: Great place to go!. One of the best zoos in the world!Animal enclosures are well taken care of. Animals look happy and almost too groomed. Made me very happy. :) This is the level I would like all zoos to operate. You can see animals also when they are not in the main closure but you still don't feel like you would be distracting them by your presence. The bat tunnel (where bats fly free and you walk through) was a cool feature.

Animals well looked after here in this zoo. A large spacious zoo, where the animals appear to be well looked after, and can wander in and out of shelter as they please. Its a long walk around the whole zoo, with some hills, but there is a chair lift if you're feeling adventurous. This zoo is involved in conservation and breeding programmes. I particularly enjoyed seeing Prezwalski Horses - the oldest breed of horse. And we had never seen Anteaters before. My 10 year old loved his day at the zoo. Accessible by Metro at Nadrazi Holesovice (red line, 4 stops from Muzeum) which connects with Bus number 112 for the zoo. Regular connections, and a short trip.

Second visit . Wow. What a fantastic zoo. Came last year and again new things to see. Went up the chair lift this year from the bottom of the zoo to the top it was great felt like a big kid. Busy busy place but big enough and you didn't feel on top of each other. We got to the zoo via a boat trip which was great.

Nice zoo but..... Best to take boat ride to zoo abt. 45 min. ride experience canal similar to Panama Canal rising of boat . Zoo on hilly area. Not many animals. Nice cable chair ride up/down mountain 25 czh $. Cheap

A great zoo and being out with local families. We were so impressed with the zoo. It has an a great array of animals and we especially loved the gorillas, with the two month old baby clinging to her mom's back. There were translations to English, so we could figure out what the animals we were unfamiliar with were. We enjoyed being out of the tourist area. Easy to get to by train and then bus from old town. If rain is expected, bring an umbrella. We didn't pay attention to that and got caught in a big downpour.
Best zoo I've been to. This zoo is amazing and huge. Excellent value for money. So much to see and do here and the food isn't too expensive and is lovely.
highly recommended to visit. It is highly recommended to visit the whole day!Recommended for couples, families. The zoo Huge. With variety of animals, plenty of places to walk and interes

Full Zoo day. Been to quite a few zoos around the world including San Diego... this one is good... very natural ... on the mountainous terrain... all sorts of species ... birds ... pony ride... OK Indian restaurant... ice cream ... thumbs up!

Could have spent all day here. We only had a couple of hours to whizz round Prague Zoo during our visit but could have easily spent all day here. The animal enclosures are amazing with loads of baby animals to see as well. Although I don't have kids, there was so much for children there; a little swimming pool, a train and loads of other interactive stuff for them. Just a really beautiful zoo. So much space there and didnt feel rushed or cramped at all, and that was during peak time. Only reason for 4 stars is lack of sign posts telling you where you are/where you need to go. Otherwise it is a must see for anyone in Prague.

Love the gorillas - a must visit in Prague!. Who wouldn't enjoy spending a day watching animals? Especially when it's a sunny day in Prague? At the Prague zoo you'll get to see a whole bunch of different animals - ranging from gorillas and elephants to small nocturnal animals and tiny insects.A must visit and pretty close to Old Town.

grate value for money. long way from town but you can get the underground and then a bus a taxi is very dear
there is a chair lift that takes you to the top of the park and gives you a great view over the city

one of the top zoos. It´s told being the 4 fourthbest Zoo in the world - after a visit I have to say it seems they are right - if you have time and you want to get out from the city you have to visit the Zoo.
Spent a great time with family and friends. I have been there with my family and friends. We spent a great day there: a lot of animals :), fun, attractions, good food,...

Even better than in Berlin. This summer me and my family had trips to some zoo's - in Berlin and in Prague. I already was in Berlin some years ago and had just the best memories about the zoo, so I thought that Prague Zoo will leave me without impressions. I was wrong. Zoo was very interesting and big - we spent 5 hours there to watch everything. There was different animals and interactive expositions. It was really interesting. My 4 years old son was also impressed! And - price is much more affordable than in Berlin's Zoo. In Berlin we left about 50 Eur for 2 tickets for adults an 1 ticket for child (with Aquarium). Meanwhile in Prague we left just about 20 Eur for us all. I was really happy that we choose to visit this Zoo!

Happy animals, happy tourists. I could list all the reasons why I love Prague Zoo, but that would take far too long, so I'll just describe a few of my favourite exhibits.Near the entrance of the zoo we saw polar bears that were enjoying a nice swim on a hot day (so hot in fact that I suffered from heat stroke that evening). The more energetic of the two was swimming right up to the glass and showing off for all the tourists. Best bear ever. Later in the day we returned to see how they were doing and they were having a dander around their enclosure. Seems like a good life.My next favourite exhibit was the elephant enclosure. This featured a whole family of elephants of all ages. You could see the different personalities coming out as the littlest one was chasing around its older brother, while the adults were gracefully cooling off from the afternoon heat in the shade. There were various elephant related activities on offer including a elephant riding simulator. The highlight of the elephant enclosure for me was the raised bridge section which allowed for a better view of their habitat and also doubled as access to the giraffe, ostrich and antelope enclosure.Finally, I saw my favourite animal in the flesh for the first time ever, the cassowary. These dangerous birds are the closest experience I've had to coming face to face with a dinosaur, they really are seriously scary. I was afraid to turn my back to them to take a picture.On the whole, the zoo offers a surprising amount of variety and quality in its selection of animals. I'd recommend taking a whole morning and half an afternoon at least to see it, probably more if with small children. Don't miss out on this, it was my favourite tourist attraction in Prague!

Yearly visits. I lived in Prague for a couple of years and I visited the ZOO once - twice every year. Nice way to spend the day. Beware that you have to walk a lot as it's quite big, some path are a bit steep. Recommend to all
Must for children. best zoo i have ever been to.pretty far from city centre, went with own car, but read that it can be reached with PT, too.

Enforced Visit.. We had an enforced visit to Prague Zoo when we me up with a Czech friend and his 2.3/4 year old son who wanted to go to the Zoo. It is very cheap to get in, our friend paid and it only cost him 1ckz for all 4 of us, the 1ckz was for him, under 3s free, disabled over 70s and their carer are also free. The zoo itself is clean and tidy, partly on a hillside so some steep slopes. There is a good range of all kinds of animals from spiders to Elephants whom all seem happy and well cared for. There is also mini paddling pools and climbing frames for kids, toilets and eating places dotted all around the place and a land train to take you round the massive site. The zoo is well worth a visit for young or old and I can recommend it.

Best zoo I have been to in ages. Really easy to get to . I used the underground then the bus, both stops I needed were marked .on the underground it had a picture of animals and it was really obvious on the bus. So cheap to get in . It was a clean tidy modern zoo. A huge variety of animals in appropriate enclosures. This is a whole day trip. I think this place would keep young and old happy. Only negatives for us were it is on a steep hill and my boyfriend does not like heights and felt a bit wobbly at the top of the zoo. I however loved the panoramic views of the city.

Terrific for couples or family. Don't miss this delightful zoo situated on a hill overlooking Prague. With your Prague city pass you can take the 112 bus (free) which drops you just in front of the ticket office. Present your Prague pass at the Information desk for the entrance ticket. There are many pathways for strolling, signs everywhere, a chairlift (25 Czech crowns) which you can take in either direction up or down the hill. There are many natural type enclosures along with display pavillions sprinkled throughout. We saw many picnic type areas, mini pools for the kids, and several people accompanied by their dogs. Plenty of eating areas at various levels. Fun for adults as well as children. Arrive early to avoid the crowds and heat.
Go to Zoo when you are in Prague. Prague Zoo is beautiful. You have a feeling animals love to live in this place. I recomend it to all of my friends who visit Prague.
Amazing zoo!. Best we have ever been to. Different animals to zoos local to us. Very picturesque. There is also an interesting ride to the top of a hill where elephants can be found! Would recommend.
Huge. This place I deceivingly large, loads of different animals and polar bears to. Quit reasonable to you must go. It's a real pleasant walk around and get to see in the animals all around

Amazing !. Prague Zoo is ranked 4th in the world and is truly worth it ... it was a special experience for us because they had so many babies (baby elephant only 3 months old, and we got to see him nurse!), baby gorilla, baby baboon, baby hippo ... even without the babies, the zoo has SO much to see, and the coolest: a single per person chair lift because there is a significant elevation change in the park. A must see ...
Best zoo in Europe. Check opening times and spend all day there - 9am to 9pm during summer. Dog friendly! State-of-the-art enclosures and fantastic conservation work!

Nice for a few hours. Popped to the zoo for a few hours and it was pleasant, some works is currently on-going but it didn't stop us enjoying. Very reasonable price and lot to see, most animals looked well kept. Would recommend if you have a few hours free in Prague.

Big Zoo - nice place to spend a day. I stayed there for 6 hours with my 2 years old, it is quite big and worth seeing. You can walk several directions, there are lot of places to have a rest, to buy a meal, icecream, tasty Czech beer, souvenirs, there is even the stand of Koh-i-noor, famous Czech producer of pencils and colour boxes. We started our trip by polar bears and walk up and down accross the hill to see elephants, girraffes, hipos... (it´s longer way to get there, there are nice big paddocks), then we used the small train (for 30CZK/1€, goes from the side-gate/entrance) to get up to the hill. There is view-tower (free), then bizons, camels, playground and kiosks/takeaways. We then moved down the hill to the bottom part (you can use chair-lift, but I can´t with 2 years old and buggy...).Bottom part has not only animals (gorillas, felidae, pinguins, birds, dif. monkeys,...), but also entertainment for kids - playgrounds, small pool to paddle with todlers, little tram or you can ride a little train again around this part (for 30CZK/1€). There are planty of species on short-haul, so you can walk easily. You may catch feeding times, kids can try the speed of run compared to animals (there is a special trail with measurement, it´s a fun). To mention (slight) negatives - the bus No.112 going to the Zoo from metro station Nadrazi Holesovice is usually overcrowded, although it goes often. It´s unpleasant to be in with buggy or pram. Second, everything inside the park (food, drinks and souvenirs) are expensive (e.g. plushy toys - treble price...).Enjoy!

Prague zoo . Prague zoo is worth a visit it cost 600 czk each but there was a group 10 and they discounted for that.Inside it is sign so it's easy to find your way around but there's plenty of walking . The price of drinks and snack or not a rip of All in all a good day .

Really nice but crowded. We were there two times. Last time was at summer holidays and it was really crowded. Generally its one of the best ZOOs with I ever been. Very nice terrain on the hill and a lot of animals. Nice watching tower on the top of the hill with great panorame of Prague. One annoying thing is "touristic trains" riding on the pavements. Price for adults was 200 Krowns. For the people who are looking for strange souvenirs You can find elephant excrements for fertilize Your garden and liqeur "Elephant pee" but in the second its only a name.

I love this Zoo. Ironically the local floods by destroying it, helped it to become one of the best Zoo in Europe. It¨s spacious, there are no cages, the animals are treated with respect. I enjoz everz time I go there.

Small Enclosures . The zoo itself is quite big, and there is a large variety of animals, however the majority of the animals seem to have very small enclosures. A lot of the animals looked quite sad. We went on quite a hot day and the polar bear looked uncomfortable. One elephant was in an enclosure on it's own and was swaying back and forth, looking very distressed. The zoo is badly laid out and signposted, you end up having to double back on yourself in order to see everything.

Among the best in the world. it has a very unique continent based format with huge diversity in the type of animals present ... surely a surprise for most people visiting Prague who would have seen zoos elsewhere

(舒服的環境，令人不舒服的店員）Comfortable environment with unsatisfying service. "ill service that totally threw me in a bad mood"As a zoo ranked as top 4 in the world, zoo Praha has always been on my top list, and it did not disappoint me! Sadly, when I wanted to buy a postcard in the souvenir shop, the clerk RUDELY took away the postcard in my hand simply because I wanted to pay it with my 100 kc cash!! I told her I didn't have coins, and she gave me a flat refusal without talking to me. I don't know if it's because I am an Asian, a Taiwanese because I saw her happily talking with other Czech-speaking customers. As one of the best zoos in the world, it's really humiliating that discrimination exists in your zoo!!舒適的環境，開放的空間，逛動物園很愉快。但如果買東西，要考慮一下，店員會歧視顧客。我身上沒硬幣，拿一百克朗現金要買東西，店員直接抽走我手上的明信片，搖手把我趕走。做為世上最棒的動物園，卻讓我在最後有極不愉快的經驗！

Super organised, child friendly and animals kept better than most zoos.. Its one of the best zoo's i have ever been too. the walk from parking to the zoo along the river is also great. The animals are taken care for. The chairlifts are a good attraction for kids.

Good views of Old Town Prague from the Castle. Interesting castle but not exactly up to the standards of castles in Germany or France. Still it is impressive. You have some good views of Old Town Prague.

Unsure. Unsure how this is the 4th best zoo in the world as majority of the enclosures I saw were tiny and a lot of the animals looked depressed, especially the polar bear and the Asian Elephant. Went on a very hot day so didn't actually see too many animals but that's not the zoos fault.A few positives though, the space in total is huge and they do have a large variety of animals. Also a lot of play areas for children. Nice to see the Gorillas getting a larger living space.Definitely keep the day free for getting there as its huge and takes a long while. Not the worst all in all!

Polar bears!! . Easy trip to get to the zoo one tram and one bus. On arrival we had a short queue for tickets and were provided with an info leaflet (in Czech but you can see the pictures!) The zoo is very large and I'm sure we missed some small parts of it. We spent 7 hours there and started from the bottom so that we could get the chair lift up to the top this is an extra charge of 25kc but as the zoo itself was only 200kc (£6) it's worth it for a rest! They had so many animals lions, tigers, unusual leopards, birds, hippo, elephant and many more but by far the most amazing are the polar bears we did have to wait for them to come out as it was a very hot day but eventually they came outside we were so excited! There are lots of different stalls and kiosks to buy ice creams, snacks and drinks with different choices throughout. There are loads of toilet stop areas too. We had lunch in the gulab by the elephants...Thai curry and rice was delicious freshly cooked and surprisingly good. The food here was great value for a zoo too. All in all we had a lovely day it was so worth the visit. Definitely recommend for adults..children...everyone!

A great zoo. Prague zoo is huge and well organizedIt has all kinds of reptiles,birds animalsAlso it has many kids areas with restaurantsThe layout of the zoo is divided into zones according to the continent the animals come fromThe most intesting is the african zone which is on top of the mountainThe only small problem is that there are no signs showing where are the exits so is. easy for somebody to get lost when looking for an exit
Beautiful Zoo i ever seen. Great place for a sunny day, perfect for kids, a lot of animals, you can freed giraffes. it is also a great view of the city. You can eat also.

Great hike - wear good shoes. Start at top of castle complex and work your way down. Did not have problems with ticket lines at main castle entrance. Upper part nice with a couple of great cafes by the Monk's brewery. Lots of cobblestone walking so recommend good shoes, not sandals. Fun to have Rick Steves guided walking tour - lots of stories. Throwing people out of windows big part of history - defenestration.

interesting. didn't expect it to be that big for such an affordable entrance fee. the zoo is around 30 min far from city center. you can take the metro to a stop and then the bus which will drop you directly in front of the zoo. all kind of animals are there and the zoo is well managed. you will easily need 2 hours to check it out.
Day out. best zoo ever visited, kids will enjoy and so do adults. Lots of animal, very convinent and lots of things to do inside.

Dont miss!!!. I have been in many zoos around the world, but this was the best. Perfect set up, amenities and friendly staff. Be prepared for many hours of walking if you want to see everything. Dont miss the jungle and the bats.

Must see. Having four days in Prague we made a visit to the zoo, which was the best decision we made. The zoo is incredible! It's huge and you can definitely spend the whole day there. There are great views of Prague including an observation tour. Maps are available in English, however most signs are in Czech so that can be difficult at times. Great place, and highly recommended!
Very nice. Great zoo. Very clean with many fascilities. It is a big zoo, could have more animals, birds, fish and reptiles. We had an enjoy day.
Beautiful Zoo.. One of the biggest Zoo in Europe. Nice place, lot of animals, beautiful area around. Worth for visit while visiting Prague.
Too spacious. Took me a whole day to go through all of it, very much free space, just with hills, bushes etc... I defiantly expected more

Quality place and value. Rating a zoo is tough, as there are many variables. But I have been to many zoo's around the world and this is for sure one of the tops. Lets start off with location and how to get there - it's actually in the city and very easy to arrive by bus/tram or boat or car.Entry price - relatively cheap for all the animals and attractions.Animals and attractions - excellent! You have such a variety of animals and things to do for all ages of kids.Food - price and options are ok, not amazing, but a 3.5 out 5 stars.Overall it's a fun place to go with kids and family for a good half day.

Wow. I have been to a lot of zoo around the world. This one isn't the best but still worth checking it out because it is huge and cheap. I had spent 6 hours in the zoo and got pretty everything covered.

excellent day out. This was a wonderful day out. There were lots of animals from different parts of the world, and each area felt like it could be the real natural environment for the creatures. The refreshment areas were easy to find and suprisingly well-priced. The only slight complaint that I could give is that there could possibly have done with being a few more sign posts. Other than that, it was a lovely day out.
Spend day there. If you are in Prague with kids, spend all the day there. It is very nice zoo, clean and new buildings and it is really great experience from Prague.

Overrated place. It was a cool place but poorly designed. If you want to see all the animals you should walk some parts over and over again. They should have some kind of recommended route to visit the place.The staff in food courts was kind of rude.Although it seems far from city center you can go there with a bus in 15-20 mins.If you have +4 days and longer time in Prague it can be a good half day trip but I do not recommend it to travelers with limited time - not a must see place in my opinion

Really fun!. I visited here with 2 friends on our girly city break, it's a huge zoo! You get so much for your money we got student discount by just taking our normal uni cards and it cost us 150 czk which I think works out as around £5 which is an absolute bargain! I'd recommend comfy shoes as its a long way round and also up a steep hill at one point if you take it slow and look at the animals on the way up its not too bad. You can get a cable car up the hill but not great for those that don't like heights ! It's has such a wide range of animals including polar bears! The enclosures are also very big which impressed us. We spent around 5 1/2 hours here and didn't even see every animal. Only thing I would say is there's not many signs in English and when there was there was obviously and understandably not as much information as there was in Czech but some times we were left wondering what the animal was. Overall a great day and I would highly recommend a visit here !

One of he best zoo's I have visited. Came here on a lovely sunny day and spent almost the whole day making our way round all the exhibits (took about 6 hours in total to get around and look at everything) there were so many different animals to see it was great! I would recommend getting there as soon as it opens as there were big queues when we arrive at 9.30am (think it opened at 9am) ticket prices are very reasonable at 200 czk per adult and only 5czk for a map to guide you round. I wouldn't recommend not getting a map as you would get lost without it! I was a big hep to us to make sure we saw everything they had to offer. There are a number of cafes and restaurants along the way at very reasonable prices with the ocean restaurant being the biggest which is right by the entrance of the zoo. We got a taxi to the zoo as we were unsure of the bus routes at the time which cost 175 czk each way from our hotel which was about 5 mins from old town but you can get a day pass which allows you on all public transport for 110 czk (we found this out after our visit) and you can get bus number 115 from the centre to the zoo. Overall a really good day out , probably my highlight of our holiday!

Very good. Definitely worth a visit. Allow yourself to be there at least 4 hours, maybe longer if you have children with you. This zoo is one of the biggest I've been to with so many animals to see. We brought a lunch with us so can't comment on food prices but there is plenty on offer. Zoo is serviced by a bus so it's easy to get to. One of the highlights of our trip to Prague. Adult admission is £6 (June 2016)

The most beautiful memories from Prague. My boyfriend and I ae animal lovers and after we decided that we visit Prague we agreed to travel around the zoo. Best decision ever! It took 5h to see it. Elephants are my love so we stay there quite. Perfect zoo, as far as possible. Animals live in humane conditions, elephants have a couple of habitat, giraffes too, polar bears have icemaker within his boxing along with a huge lake. Delighted, I recommend to everyone.

Amazing . Zoo is pretty big so would recommend getting the fun train to see the elephants as they are on top of a hill or the chairlift but the place was amazing. I got close to animals I had never seen before and was a reasonable price.

Dissapointed after previous visits. This was our third or fourth visit to Prague Zoo and we were a tad disappointed, partly due to the really hot weather a lot of the animals were asleep and hidden, and partly because there is a lot of improvement work going on a the moment and a few of the animals were actually missing to the public.Don't get me wrong it is still a very good zoo to visit and I appreciate the improvements are necessary, the difference in the Elephants since their move to their new enclosure serving to prove a point, they looked so much happier, and of course it isn't the zoo's fault if it is too hot.It would have been nice if there had been a notice before entry explaining that some enclosures were closed so as to minimise the disappointment and of course the walking.It wont put us off going again in the future though as even with the missing animals it is still exceptional value.
Tooo big but just great. Big and nice. Clean and worth to see.The animals seem to enjoy... and the personal seem to care.the restaurant inside is quite good and the pricea are fair

well done. not really a big zoo goer - we had a spare afternoon so went with friends and their kids- From Old Town we took the metro and the112 bus- fast / easy / cheap. The zoo is reaaly well laid out. but be warned it is big . we spent 4 hours and left large chunks un seen. it was nice to have lots of shade. A downer was really slow food service during the lunch rush --- that burned up at least 45 minutes. all in all though a good day

A zoo you can't finish in one day. It was a nice day when we went to visit the zoo , lots of walking uphill and downhill, not Very well signposted so to see everything you might go round the same place more then once . A very good collection of all the animals birds reptiles etc it was fun to see the whole elephant family with a new baby born just a week before we visited.variety of restaraunt to eat. Seen some Hindu temples with there elephant God .penguine enclosed was good as well . If you have children they will really like it .

GO!. I have been to a few zoos. San Diego is supposedly world renonwed and Prague CRUSHES them. Just world class in every respect. Don't miss this. Taxi was 20 or so dollars in the am with traffic but the family ticket was almost the same so a great value.

Expected more. I must confess that the Zoo's teritory is wide, you have to spend whole day there if you want to see every animal. To my mind there were a lot of places where were no animals at all... It made me feel sad. If the teritory was not that wide it would be amaizing. You can reach zoo by traveling by boat which is aproximetly an hour from the Pragues centre.

A zoo unlike any you will find in the USA. Monkeys flying around free? A room of fruit bats that fly around your head? Getting up close and personal with wild animals? Bird sanctuaries you can walk in and interact with? None of these would be even remotely legal in the USA, but were incredible to see in Praha! This zoo is so relaxed, yet very well maintained with a wide variety of animals. Well worth the admission price!
A very nice Zoo. We enjoyed a full day of strolling around the zoo. There was a bit of construction going on which detracted a bit, but most animals seemed healthy and well cared for.

Entertaining day out. Plenty to do, especially with little ones. Enclosures are spacious and well-kept, animals all seem to be in good condition. Very busy though, even on a week day, and there's very little in English on menus etc so it's a good idea to brush up on your Czech before you go, though the staff all speak excellent English. Good value for money, food and drink weren't overpriced as they often are at attractions like this, wide range of exhibits. Be prepared to do a lot of walking, though.

One of the Most Memorable day of our trip to Prague. I'm not a huge fan of Zoo's but our daughter really wanted to go to the zoo. We went and all 5 of us had a fantastic time. Lots of walking up and down hills, all animals were out for us to observe. This makes a great break from the sight seeing if you have kids. Wonderful, memorable day.

Our favorite place - we visit once a week. As locals we love days in Prague zoo. With my two youngsters (2years and 5months) this is our favourite destination. The zoo has made great advancement, offers great cozy living areas for animals and is full of big trees and places to eat where you can find shade and some good food not only standard hotdog. Our zoo is constantly rated as one of the best ones globally and being a big traveler zoos were often on our list -I am proud for and completely in line with the outstanding ratings. Nowadays baby gorilla and baby elefant are undisputable signs that animals in the Prague zoo have comfortable habitat
Nice place.. Nice walk around the zoo. There is many animals from all the world. I like it elephant and surikatas.
One of the best ZOOs I've seen. I'm quite frequent visitor of this zoo and it is nice to watch how it flourishes. Highly recommended.
Engagement for Kids. Its quite engaging with new addition of baby chimp and elephant; worth the visit with kids around to keep them engaged

Great Zoo!. Visited the Prague Zoo while in Prague for a long weekend trip. Really nice atmosphere and lots of walking. Great place to see many animals. The gorillas were an especially nice exhibit. The Zoo is a bit north of the city and we took an inexpensive Uber to get there and back from the old town.

Best Zoo I Have Been To. What a lovely day out! This zoo is by far the best and well kept zoo I have been to - and the largest. Allow a good 6 hours to cover the whole zoo, which is set on various different levels - the view from the observation tower really is spectacular!! All the animals looked well cared for and happy in their environment - the hippos were amazing to see them so up close. Various restaurants/snacks outlets scattered around which is much needed as you will need a rest from all the walking.

Wow what a place.. Prague Zoo is fantastic -- so easy to get too, you grab the metro and the bus.- amazing grounds- wide range of animals- evident ALL animal are well looked after- can spend all day here, plenty to keep you entertained. - wide verity of snacks and meals. Yummy. - most of all THIS IS THE BEST value. X x

Amazing . What a mission it was to get here. We got lost and ended up walking about 5kms but if you plan your journey better than us I'm sure you'll be fine! The zoo was really great the animals all look so happy they have done a really great job! Sooooo many people at some points really hard to see the star animals but it's a tourist attraction worth seeing so you just get over it and be patient. Managed to get the bus back to the train station back to town on the way out which was pretty simple.

AMAZING!!!. Was reading that it was one of the best zoo's in Europe and Internationally and was wondering why. After visiting i have no doubt it is. This is not a zoo it is a whole village of animals. There is a huge variety of animals since it is a really really big space with two levels. First level some animals the second level you can go with hanging chair or walking to see even more animals. The landscape is beautiful; full of trees and impressive spaces that make the animals feel at the natural environment. Located in a hill, gives you a nice view of Prague especially when you go to the second level, even the route to go there gives an excellent idea of how beautiful Prague is even outside the center. It was so big not sure if we missed some animals because we got confused or there were not there at that period. You will need almost a whole day but if you love Zoo's then you will love this one.

Great day trip for kids and adults alike. I'm not a fan of zoos for many reasons, but the Prague Zoo is definitely worth the trip, especially if you have kids. This Summer they have many babies, and my daughter truly enjoyed herself.

Fantastic!!. I actually hate zoos but went along as I knew my husband fancied seeing around it. What a pleasant surprise it was - wide open spaces for the animals and so clean and well organised. A little 3 month old baby elephant was the highlight for me I must admit!!The cost to get in was about £6 pp was was excellent. Returning to the city was easy too, a bus to metro and then metro for 2 stops and a short walk back to our hotel.Would recommend this attraction to all but get there early as very busy!

Lots of walking, but very nice!. The set-up of the zoo makes for a lot of walking on hilly ground, but it is worth it. Some of the areas, such as the African walk and the mountain goat area (actually on a rockface) were some of the best we have seen. Food at African restaurant was OK, but note that the menu was not translated, making for an interesting order.

Wonderful!. Got a date? Or Family? Or do u just want to take a day off and enjoy nature? U really need to visit this Zoo! Many animals in good Constitution! And its pretty cheap ;) btw. They got a cable car!

Huge zoo - if you have children I would recommend. This is a nice big zoo with lots of interesting animals. I like the way they have arranged the zoo into areas of the world. We particularly enjoyed seeing some wild herons nesting (we happened to be there at the right time for that). If you want to have a relaxing day enjoying a zoo, I would recommend it.

First class Zoo.. We made the mistake of getting the boat trip to the void. Unless you want a 1/2 hour non-signposted walk for the Zoo take the tram and bus from the city centre which drops you off at the front door. The zoo is on a hill and may not suit you if you have walking difficulties. You can get either a chairlift or a train to the top of the zoo. We spend 5 hours in the zoo and still did not see everything. Price for food was very reasonable and lots of options where to stop. If you have the time don't miss a trip to the zoo when in Prague.

Fantastic and fun. Visited Prague zoo with my girlfriend. We have been living in Prague for two years and are not typically big fans of enclosed animals but the zoo in Prague seems to be quite genuinely concerned with the well being of animals and they have a lot of information that details things about the animals.

BEST ZOO i have ever been to!!. The Zoo is really easy to go to. Just take a 119 bus from the train or tram station. Me and my girl friend didnt have much expectations in the zoo based on those negative comments on the trip advisor. However, when we arrived there - IT WAS AMAZING !!. (PS. dont buy any water outside, the vending machine inside the zoo is wayyyyy more cheaper). Theres a cable car in a zoo. A CABLE CAR IN A zoo, which zoo on earth will have a cable car. IT is huge the zoo, you can even see the lions, tigers just within inches in front of you. Amazing experience. Theres variety of species and animals and places you can visit and see within the zoo. IT will be your loss if you dont visit here. You can spend a whole day here. Luckily, on the week we visited, cable car was free where Me and my gf rode on it for more than four times.

Beware of Bats. This zoo is really great! My husband and I went on a very hot day, but found a lot of shade and even some cool water misters. The animals are great, seem to be well taken care of. BEWARE of the free flying fruit bat exhibit...though amazing, you may just get hit. You wouldn't be the first person ;)
Very good zoo. Very good Zoo with lots to see. Huge Zoo also, took us a good solid morning to get around. Would definately recommend

A must with children, but lovely without too.. The best zoo I've ever been to. Loads of brilliant animal displays, play areas and food stops. A full day is best. Even dogs are allowed, but expect to pay a little for this.Monday non holidays can be discounted for children, check the website.Lost one star as the chair lift safety isn't brilliant. Holding a child (as she was too young to go on her own) the chain couldn't do up, so I held her. You can walk up though, which we did on the way back.

Beautiful Zoo. This is rated as one of the best zoos in the world and is one of the best I have been toIt is massive so allow yourself plenty of time, we got there at 20 past 9 in the morning and left at 8:30 at night and still missed out some bits!!When we got there there was a queue to get tickets and loads of school groups about and was worried it would be too busy and crowded. However, this was not the case. As it is so big the crowds soon dispersed and at no point did it feel too crowdedThe animals all had really big enclosures, particularly loved the mountain goats enclosure, very clever and never seen anything like itSaw alot of animals I have never seen before and also lots of babies. The baby elephant (only a few months old) was so cute!!There is also a chairlift which was particularly welcome as it was sooooooo hot and we couldn't face walking up the hill!There are lolvey views of Prague at the top and also a lookout towerThe food was lolvey and not to expensive at all. We went to the place selling hot food, the butter chicken was amazingAnd all for just over £6 (200 crowns) to get in... absolute bargainIf your in prague this is defentely worth the trip (we had to get 3 buses but it was very easy) there is also a boat that goes thereWonderful day out, highly recommended
The biggest Zoo i have ever seen!. When I travel to a city I always go to the zoo if there is one!This is one of the beastliest and biggest I have ever seen!

Cheap, big and very beautiful ZOO. When me and my friend decided to visit the ZOO we didn't expect anything. At the end of our walk through the zoo we were positively surprised. The zoo is one of the most beautiful zoos we have ever seen. And the ticket is cheap.

Best zoo ever!. We were lucky enough to visit when the lions&tigers were fed in their class cages - you're literally centimeters away from these beasts as they tear at a piece of meat the size of your leg. Thrilling!

Amazing. Make sure you leave yourself plenty of time to spend at the zoo! Amazing experience at this place and always busy! Cheap prices for food and drinks also.
The animals are well looked after and it was a good experience visiting the zoo. Highly recommend families to visit!
Zoo Without Animals. Well, this was an interesting zoo. No animals hardly. Very disappointing and certainly overpriced for what it was Avoid!!

Loved it! . I absolutely loved Prague Zoo. Having just been to Budapest Zoo a few days ago I think this zoo is way better. As I'm currently studying for a BSc in Ecology, I'm very aware about animal welfare and always think twice about going to zoos. But this one was great! All the animals had plenty of space (especially the giraffes and elephants) The only thing I would change would be the polar bears. Although their space was big, they didn't seem too happy (stereotypical stress movements) Think it might just be a too hot environment to keep them in. Apart from that it was really good and price is cheap. Easy to get to also (bus straight from metro station)

Day trip to the zoo. Catch a tram and bus to the zoo quick and cheap. Spent all day at the zoo plenty to see, elephants giraffes lions tigers and gorillas just to mention a few. On-site food is good from snacks to a full restaurant serving Czech food or snacks. Well worth the money.

Best Zoo till now. Before i started my day i thought we would spend like 2-3 hours and then come back but we spend 6+ hours in this zoo really amazing (cloudy climate made walking around zoo less tiring). Worth it!
Amazing. If you have kids, make sure spare one day and take them there. We spent 6 hours there, and it was barely enough

Amazing!!!. Great set up! Wide variety of animals! Accessible with strollers and rentable stroller/carts available! Worth it the distance out of the city! Amazing zoo and well set up! Shade and water for hot days and misters to keep cool. Petting zoo was decent, can do a pony ride for quite reasonable price! Great attraction for families in Prague! Could definitely be a couple day thing as there is so much to see.

Probably the best zoo I've visited. . Amazing place. We visited in July, and as a consequence it was incredibly warm. So getting round this massive complex was a bit difficult considering I couldn't talk five meters without needing a drink/ some shade or both. The whole place is on a huge hill leading up from the river, I don't know about you but hills and heat for me don't mix. But thankfully there is a handy and inexpensive chair lift to help (bit different for a zoo, but good all the same). I would 100% recommend going if you have the chance. A huge range of animals, all of which looked well cared for and had plenty of space. We also had some nice food at a small restaurant which was located at the top of the chair lift. All staff we encountered were friendly and knowledgeable. So yeah, would go again!!!
Family Day Out. Fantastic day out for the whole family. Plenty of things to do and see including children activities. I would recommend it to anyone.

Whole World in One Place in Prague for any member of family. Beautiful place for whole family to enjoy whole day in Prague home for many annimals together with them. The first animal here was the Lioness Sharka in 1930...today the ZOO has almost 5.000 pcs of animals. Prague's Zoo is in TOP 10 ZOO's in the World...If you really like to enjoy the atmosphere of many animal oasis, you need to reserve the whole day...6 hours as minimum :-) Nobody will be disappointed or bored...Performances of seals family, otter feeding, polar bears, tigers, lions, many birds - pink flamingos, pelicans, vultures, eagles etc. are really emazing.Also you can see If you are hungry or you are thirsty you can enjoy several restaurants, bistros, kiosks with differend kinds of food and drinks.You can also see penguins, sea lions, wolves, bisons, kangaroos, various reptiles and many othesr.If you come with children, you"ll need to rell me - what you could enjoy..
relax in ZOO. Prague ZOO is full of interesting and exotic animals. I love animals but I miss my lovely koala bears here. That´s a pitty. Other services are good.

Good zoo well worth a visit . The zoo is just outside Prague - just take the metro to Nadrazi Holesovice and follow the signs to the zoo for the right bus stop. The bus fare is included in the travelcards you buy in Prague. The zoo is not the biggest I've been to, but they've squeezed a lot in. This does mean that some of the enclosures are smaller than you would hope, but they have made real efforts to provide the animals with the correct environment and stimulation. Most of the animals looked relaxed and well cared for - the only sad sight was a tiger who was just pacing up and down in his enclosure. The zoo is split level, but a free chair lift means you don't have to climb up and down. All in all, it's one of the better zoos I've seen - opinion will always be divided on these - and they were building some new improved enclosures while I was there.
