Definitely a good day out if you have children with you, plus there are lots of kiosks as you walk round to get food, drinks, ice creams etc.

Nice surprise. When we visited great Prague Zoo we have seen a little elephant being born there a few days before. He still did not have name. We were told that this is the first elephant being born in that Zoo and there conceived. A rarity in Europe. On the way home we talked only about him and how cute he is. Worth a visit.

Great zoo, up there with the best. One of the best I have been to, and I have been to a lot of zoos! We literally spent 6 hours here and still struggled to see everything. There is a lot of walking but the cable car (costs about 25kc) gives a great view, saves the legs and a lot of time. If in Prague, definitely allocated a whole day to this zoo.

More than a zoo. One of the best in Europe! Many animals, good trails and a place to walk for good few hours. Enjoy the hippos, the elephants and the graceful giraffes. Have fun with entire family. Try to check online the schedules for feeding as you may even get a great show with the seals!

Best zoo we have visited!. The zoo is amazing, a huge range of animals with many of each animal. My favourite was the polar bears and the elephants. The elephant enclosure is huge. Each animals enclosure is rather large but does contain lots of animals so don't worry about not see them. Definitely try to get there early as we queued for about half an hour to get in. Any students out there take your student card, even if your a uk student as you get 50czechs discounted. The food inside the park is reasonable priced. There are many restaurants inside the park all serving different food the best one is the one up near the observation tower. The zoo overall is quite steep with many hills however they do have a chair lift which can take you up half the park. Also there's a train which goes around the park. If you have time 100% worth a visit! It's a great day out and takes about 6 hours to get around the whole park.

Wonderful place. We spent 7 hours in the zoo,and still we didn`t see all the animals.It is a very big place.I love cheetas,lions, tigers and polar bears especially,and it`s amasing to see them so close.We will bw back another time,and i really recommend everyone who visit Prague to go to the zoo :)

Best zoo in Europe . Absolutely awesome so many different animals to see and so many things to do. Took us about 5 hours to walk around the whole zoo but was well worth it and so cheap. Would also recommend taking the boat tour to the zoo with ticket included because you get to see a lot of Prague ans it takes out the hassle of trying to understand public transport if you have no clue about the language. Definitely the best day we've had on this holiday.
wow what a place. if you are with small kids don't miss it. we had there a full day and did not have enough. nice attractions in side for the kids in a reasonable price .

Good zoo. I read about Prague Zoo a lot of positive reviews, so it was a must see for me, when I traveled to Prague. A zoo was very large and nice. However, I would like to see more species of fish, frogs, wolves and foxes, bears... The pavilion for pandas was closed, so it was a disappointment for me. But flying fruit bats around you was some unique experience.

Beautiful place. I really recommend to spend a day in a beautiful Prague zoo. Book at least 1/2 day to see the top animals. This area is not a small garden, so you will spend some time while visiting all animals. I loved cableway :)

More to see than you'd think. We spent a good four hours at the zoo. Could have stayed longer but needed to catch our boat. It would be great for kids. The food and drink inside is good value. We got to see a baby hippo.

Worth a visit. Head off early it can get hot & busy. Really nice chair lift to help get you from one side of zoo to the other. We were lucky to see the new baby gorilla & the baby elephant. Overall enjoyed the day and we didn't even have children with us.

Best Zoo. Seems like the animals are happy. Nice visit. They have done excellent job renovating the zoo after the horrible flood.Enough toilets and restaurants/bars to have breaks.We really enjoyed the visit.
Huge . Huge. Lots to walk with not a lot to see but it was a good day trip. An very cheap only 7€ to get in but they only take Kronos ! Worth a trip if you have a day to kill

Fine place , good animal presentation .. The good : Its big needed at least 3h ,easy to get there by bus ,cost low , beautiful place , very clean , very good presentation of the big animals ,some presentations are very unique.Perfect place if you visit prague with kids .The less good : Its big sometimes too big without real reason - You can find there big rooms made only for some bugs.No free water , if its hot day ,my advice take big bottle with you (in any case there are lots of vending machines).
a full fun day at the zoo. we spent the a full day there, it has a lot to see and some really interesting spicies and wide variety of animals and tehy are in good conditions

Love At First Sight Experience. You name the creature and you will see it. I was impressed by the habitat they have created for all the animals. It was an eye candy for me to witness many rare species of birds and animals for which I didn't even hear of. If you have a special place for wild life and nature in your heart, this place is a must go. It took around 4-5 hours to visit the complete zoo. But it was refreshing after seeing those birds and animals very close to you. I would love to spend a whole day in there and know about the animals in more detail. I would highly recommend this place if you are in Prague. even if for 2 days.

Great Time at the Zoo!. The zoo was big and very interesting, with lots of different animals that kept our granddaughter (and us) highly entertained. The environment for the animals was in many cases very natural, and the animals themselves seemed well taken care of.
Great day at Prague zoo. A lot of different and exotic animals, they are safe and have a lot of room to play and are not in small confined spaces

Great zoo. This zoo is definitely up there as one of the best I've been to. It's so big we didn't manage to get round everything! The chairlift to the top is a nice touch as well as benches or seats near each enclosure so you can spend as long as you want watching the animals. Good food too. All for less than £6 each!

Great for Kids and Adults. Visit on a Saturday morning, quite busy as you can imagine on a beautiful weekend day.. but somehow the crowd did overspread quite quickly after the entrance. It will take you 4 good hours to get to see the whole zoo.. and a bit of walking as the place is big, bit hilly too. Good variety of animals; you will have the basics you are looking for at a zoo plus some other less common ones like Cassowaries, lemurs or bats. At the moment, you will also see a little elephant or a gorilla baby. Cute. There are attractions organised (feeding or shows) every day at different places in the zoo. The zoo has a kids playground with water games or a lift for going up the hill. There are some renovations currently happening but they won't prevent you to seeing enough animals. Go see the Gavials...

Beautiful zoo. Probably one of the most interesting zoos in Europe. The great thing is that you can go through the zoo and see everything in few hours but also spend there the whole day without getting bored :-) the entrance fee may seem a bit higher but I think it is still worth it .PS: Indonesian jungle and penguins are MUST

POLAR BEARS . Having done no research of this place before hand I was very excited to see not 1 not 2 not 3 BUT 4 Polar bears. And what creatures! Beautiful to watch. Going late in the year wasn't the best idea but the admission was cheap enough. Not all the animals were out as it was freezing. -7 the day we visited. Perfect for polar bears. Cheap food and really warm drinks. A good day out. Wear comfortable shoes!

One of the best zoos in the world . The Prague zoo is really something special and anyone can find something they enjoy. There is a great outdoor food court area at the top of the zoo and if you aren't too afraid of heights taking the chair lift to the top is a great option for about 75CZK

Great attraction. My child was a little bit bored by all the museums and city tours that we made the days before, and this experience was a breath of fresh air for him. It was very interesting for me too. I saw a salamander for the first time. There are a lot of children's attractions- you can make a lift tour, pony ride ...

Great Zoo. We visited this beautiful zoo as a family. We immensely enjoyed the few hours we spent there. The zoo is huge but still well organized. Animals could easily be seen and look healthy and well maintained. The area of the zoo includes a green hill in the middle with picturesque scenery on the top. There are trains that goes up the hill and around the zoo and then visitors could stroll down for less strenuous walk. The zoo could easily be reached by public transportation. There are many food option with fair prices, Highly recommended for families with children.

Excellent Zoo but be prepared to walk lots!. Prague Zoo is billed as the worlds 4th best zoo and I really doubted this was true before our visit. Actually I think the title is very well deserved. The zoo is extremely well maintained and the animals appear to be in good condition and happy. they are kept in compounds as near to their natural environment as possible in captivity. The toilets are all spotless and smell fresh. They put the facilities at some (most) of the British parks to shame with touch free taps, Dyson Airblade hand dryers and automatic doors. The restaurants and cafes are equally clean, and cheap by UK standards.The ski lift was an added bonus and was an opportunity for a few Kodak moments. The views from the top are quite spectacular and if you want more there is a wooden lookout tower which you can climb for free. It is well worth the effort. One small niggle for me was that the layout is a little random so you have to double back and cover a lot of mileage to see everything. We clocked up almost 17000 steps and 7.4 miles! Having said that, the weather was perfect and we really enjoyed our day. It seemed odd to be going without our kids (who are now grown up) but there is plenty to keep the adults engaged anyway.Highly recommended but wear good shoes!

Wonderful place to spend a day. I wouldn't have classed myself as a zoo person however Prauge Zoo is absolutely wonderful .The amount of animals there is vast and they are clearly happy and fantastically well cared for.The big animals are in large open areas and the smaller ones are in places appropriate to their size. In this shrinking world we need Zoos to keep endangered animals safe and this place is amazing. My favourite was the jungle enclosure with the most beautiful Orangutans , monkeys have always been my thing and I couldn't stop laughing having seen one of the cheeky Barbery Apes punch a goat for daring to nibble at the same bit of hay.You need 6 hrs to do the place justice in one hit and some comfortable shoes as its vast.It is so reasonably priced at 200kr per adult and you don't get ripped off inside either unlike Prauge Castle , the facilities are great and affordable .Use public transport if you can it's only 24 kr each back to town via the bus and metro as apposed to 500 kr in a taxi.

Best zoo I have ever seen. The sheer variety of exhibits here alone is incredible. This zoo has all manners of creatures, great and small, some of which I had never seen before in real life (as a biologist I was extremely excited). Just some of the highlights are the Cheetahs, the Polar Bears, Elephants (one of which is a tiny baby!), the Gorillas (which also have a newborn) and the twilight zone, where bats are allowed to roam freely within the room. For costing the equivalent of about £5 to get in the entrance fee is more than worth it. The food and drink within is also very reasonably priced (we paid £1.50 for two hotdogs) and there are plenty of stalls, cafes, restaurants and vending machines throughout the zoo to keep you stocked up. The funicular railway between the lower and upper areas of the zoo is a particular highlight as you can get a fantastic view as you ascend or descend. One thing I would advise is to set aside a full day for this; I visited for 6 and a half hours and could have easily spent a few more there. Also, make sure to wear comfortable shoes that are suitable for walking because there is a lot to see which means a lot of walking! Despite this Prague zoo definitely lived up to its title of Europe's best continental zoo.

Great Day Out!. I have to admit my favorite day in Prague was the day we went to the zoo! We spent 6-7 hours there and could have stayed much longer. It only cost around £6 each so well worth the money. I am a lover of Elephants so very much enjoyed the elephant enclosure especially as there was a baby elephant only a month or so old when we visited. Lots of interesting animals and some I had never seen or heard of before. Very much worth a visit.From the central of Prague you need to get a subway then a bus but it is very easy to get to.

On of the best ZOO in the world. Nice place with huge gardens close to the river. One of the best ZOO in the world with lot of pavilions and large cradles or open spaces for the animals. There is a lot of attraction for kids inside of the garden as well incl. food corners.

zoo. It is really big! there are all kinds of animal. But i got to admit that all the animals looked sad :(, really bored, it was heart breaking seeing the face of the gorilla just sitting there trying to ignore us.
Amazing everytime I visit. There is always something new and exciting with every visit. Perfect for children, families or for a date. One of the best ZOOs worldwide.

Not quite how it was marketed. I do not like zoos as I hate to see wild animals in small cages. We went to this one as its website gave the impression the animals had large areas in which to roam freely. This was true for some for the animals (Giraffes and Elephants), but the lions and Polar bears were in a very small enclosure and the other wild cats where in cages, apparently on their own. I saw too many animals just pacing backwards and forwards along the same route. The wild life programmes I have watched on TV suggest this they do this when they are stressed.The trip there was excellent using the river boat which was a relaxing way to travel and see something of the outskirts of Prague. The return journey was very crowded through so we could only sit inside, rather than in the sun.An interesting trip and upsetting at times. Not one I would repeat.

Great for kids and there is conservation too. The zoo is on a hill so expect to climb a little but there is a chair lift for fun (wasn't running when I was there). The big animal enclosures have improved recently but the tigers, big cats and polar bears need more room and I think there will be work to achieve at least some of this soon - not soon enough for me though - the animals are stressed. However I had a year pass for the family and really used it.

super zoo. a wonderful zoo covers a vast area. we can make use of a tram to go around. it is a wonderful site to see many animals in their natural habitat! in 1931 28th september the zoo was opened for the public. it was a coincidence that we went on the same day but on 2015 sep .it is noted as 7th best zoo in the world! On the event of marriage of prince of austria and prnicess of belgium a notification made to start this zoo.One can see polar bear prague gorrila and sumatran tiger though with fear as well as with excitement too and this zoo garden is famous for its first breeding of the species Przewalski's Horse

Very nice place!. Zoo in Prague is very nice place to spend your day. A lot of animals - we were lucky to see baby gorilla and baby elephant. Animals seem to have alot of space there which I liked a lot.

Amazing Zoo for an unbelievable price!. We travelled to the Zoo by public transport (the metro and a bus) which was simple and easy. The bus was frequent which was very good.We went on a Monday meaning the 'Happy Mondays' deal was on which meant as students (with a valid University Student Card) we had to pay just 50CZK each, equivalent to around £1.50!!The Zoo itself has a great range of animals to visit with plenty to do and see. It is spread over a large area which was good as no part of the park was ever too crowded. It was great to stroll around and see the wide range of animals from Guinea Pigs to Giraffes.

Wonderful surprise!. We visit the zoo in last day of our trip,and have not enough time for everything.It was one green,beautiful and so large and hilly place,you can spend there completely all day!Just put comfortable shoes and enjoy it amazing place!They offer very good ice creams and food,too!
Great Time. This is the best zoo I've been to. It is supposed to be ranked 4th in the world, but it's #1 on my list. We rode the chair lift 3 times. A great day!

Great zoo, but put on your walking shoes. Great zoo. Cheap to get in. We went by boat to the zoo (75 minutes). This was really nice! Back with the bus and subway, this was very easy.This is not a typical tourist attraction in Prague. You could notice this by a lot of signs where only in Tjech. The zoo is on a mountain, you had a chairlift which brings you up a bit. You need to have good walking shoes if you go.The zoo itself was really nice, we had a great time!

Good zoo. Visited the zoo on a rainy Saturday. Long lines to get tickets but it moved quickly. Lots of animals to see. We were there 5+hours and only saw half. Was not particularly stroller friendly especially with the crowds. I felt the layout was a bit confusing and we doubled back on ourselves many times. It is impressive the size of the zoo.

Nice place with children. Its in outskirts of town but good public transport to go there. You can relax and hlaving good family time with kids. My fav was Giraffe there. Few animals are good to watch there like Elephant temples and Giraffes, hippopotamius and polar beer. Kangroo( small kid) . Tiger and cheetah was little weak and so was Lion. On top of hill it was good to see city and relax. It takes usually 3/4th of day if you do hurry otherwise reserve whole day for it and reax with nature
Beautiful place RECOMMENDED . Loved it and spent all day in the zoo. Animals well kept and cared for...they had few additions this year like cangaroo, eliphant and gorilla babies. Loved it!!!
AMAZING. lovely experience. was surprised that tho ZOO is actually that nice considering such a small country.

The best Zoo in Europe. Prague Zoo is one of the best I've ever seen. It occupies huge area and it takes us almost a day to walk through it. As my kids are small at the moment, they like most of all Children's' Zoo area where they can see, touch and feed farm animals There are also a couple of playgrounds, the biggest and the newest is Bororo Reserve. My children love it, but it is well hidden and we couldn't find it without Zoo map. My personal favorite is Elephant Valley, I could stay for hours watching these big and beautiful animals.I would highly recommend families with children to visit Prague Zoo.
Prague ZOO - babies. Great time at the ZOO with the kids. We saw baby elephant, hippo and gorilla. Trully enjoyed walking around. Good restaurant inside also.

Long walks, Animals Inside, Renovations Occurring, but Wonderful. Although it is a very expansive zoo and requires a lot of walking, it's worth the effort. If you get stuck at the top or bottom and don't walk all the way up the hill, you can pay to take the chair lift. There are many food and drink stops all over the zoo, so you will not go hungry or thirsty. There's this wonderful berry and vanilla ice cream swirl that you can get at many of the places that is delicious! The best attractions are the baby Gorilla, hippos, penguins, and the fun loving polar bears! I don't know if they're trained to do some of the tricks and things but some of the penguins and polar bears will swim up to the glass, dance a little for you and then swim back over and over. It was cute. It wasn't too expensive either. Like many things in Prague it has a student discount, which is what I went in on.

Lots to see at this zoo!. We spent a day at the zoo at the end of May 2016. It was our last day in Prague so we weren't able to spend as much time there as we would have liked, but it kept us well occupied for the 4 hours that we were there. Highlights were the polar bears, the gibbons and the chair lift. The entrance and food/drink prices were very reasonable and we had a great meal at the restaurant near the elephants. It was also easy to get there on public transport. Highly recommended!

Amazing!. It is definitely one of the best ZOO worldwide, personally think much better than the one in Vienna. It is a must to see when visiting Prague. It is very hilly but this is what I find very interesting, you can have also a beautiful view on the capital of the Czech Republic.There are enough Bufes and small kiosks to buy a refreshment, coffee, etc..
Must see. If you have children, don't miss the zoo! Also one of the best zoo I had been. Must see-enjoy your visit!!!
really worth of visit. one of the best ZOO in the world,check it in the intrenet,really worth of visit.i love gorillas and polar bear swimming .very cpacy,also with good food

Amazing!. Stunning zoo. Massive grounds all modern and new. Enclosures are massive which is nice to see for a modern zoo, apart from some of the big cats. One of the leopards had a limp. Nice to see 3! Polar bears as you dont usually see them. They have an amazing ski lift that you sit in a really good addition to the zoo. Food is good. Staff were sometimes abrupt.

Must see if you like nature and are second time in Prague. Prague ZOO is huge park where you can walk all the day. Specially recommended for children, and it is unbelievable enjoyable in these few days, when small birds come out at spring. Late April? Nobody knows. But those small birds are all around in the water part of ZOO and are cute.

Best zoo I've ever been to . Don't even know where to begin with this zoo was hands down the best zoo ever. Be warned it's slightly hilly but then again it's not a race plenty of places to stop for a drink and stuff.ill mention now the small touches like the slide and ski lift are great little after thoughts there's a play park for kids with a paddling pool to bear in mind if traveling there with children. As for the exhibits wow they had very natural environments (all things considered) the animals looked content but the design was done so it feels like there's no obvious boundaries between you and some animals. The price was really cheap to get in and there was a cafe at the entrance that had free WiFi so we were able to uber a cab as it was too hot to take a bus.To sum this up without listing everything if you have more than 3 days in Prague and sunshine put this on the to do list you will not be dissapointed
Best zoo. It cant be explayned by words, it is amazing zoo and for me best in world! Must see animals and view to whole Prague.

Great place to go in Prague!. It was an amazing experience! So many different animals and species! Really worth the money and time. Although we were only adults with no children - we definitely had so much fun. And still couldn't see everything - so big the zoo is. I would definitely recommend to pay it a visit.

Great day out. Great place lots to do and see the zoo is over 2 levels the upper one you can walk to or get a chair lift long way to walk and up hill. lot of walking and be prepared to spend a good few hours here as it is very big area to cover

Best zoo ever! . Been too several zoos (including Edinburgh which was also excellent) and I think Prague zoo is the best I've been too so far. The zoo itself is massive and houses a range of animals all in large enclosures. Food was nice and reasonably priced and all staff were friendly, defiantly worth a visit!
not the way the brits treat animals. Great day out but the enclosures etc. we're tiny! Smallest I have ever seen. Poor polar bears. But still a good day out with plenty of facilities.

Brilliant zoo. We got an Uber taxi to the zoo which was around the same price as the subway for four of us. The zoo is really huge so wear sensible shoes as there is lots of walking, some of which is uphill. There is a stair lift if it becomes unmanageable. It is really cheap to get into the zoo and is well worth the money. The animals all seemed well looked after with lots of room to roam about.

Could spend an entire day there.. Settled on a hill with fantastic views of Prague and Vlatava makes this one of the most charming zoos I have ever visited. There is plenty of room and the animals are not in cages but in large fenced areas both indoor and outdoor. The Indonesian Jungle was especially an excellent experience.

Nice zoo. Take the Metro fro Prague to Nadrazi Holesovice, and take the 112 bus to the end of the line and you arrive at the zoo. The zoo is large and has lots of exhibits so can take up a full day. Don't miss the chairlift to get to the higher levels of the zoo which is fun in its self. There are a number of sightseeing trains if you don't want to walk around the enclosures, but be aware that there are several different trains that take in different areas of the park, and you would have to go on all of them to cover everything. There are several places to eat in the park and we went to the one near the elephants at elephant valley. Not great so I would recommend Cafe Trojsky Zamek which is just outside the entrance to the zoo for food.

Big zoo! . The zoo entrance is cheap, around € 8,- It's the biggest zoo I've ever seen. The animals have more space than I saw in other zoo's in the world. They also have a lot of different species. It's a lot of walking, so you need good shoes, also for the hills. On top of the hills you have a panoramic view of the city of Prague. We've been there from 11 a.m. till 3 p.m. and we didn't see all of it. Normally I'm done with a zoo in 2 hours. For this one you need time, because it's a lot of walking. A must see in Prague!

Unexpectedly great. We really enjoyed our day at the zoo! Lots to see, extremely cheap to get in (special offer on the door meant our children only cost 1 krona each (basically a few pence!). There are lots of toilets around the place (important with a 3 year old!) and the enclosures are all very smart and well looked after. We ate in one of the restaurants (more like a cafeteria) and the food wasn't bad and was reasonably priced. We took the metro and then the bus which was very easy and quick although the area outside the metro station (while we were waiting for the bus) was pretty dodgy. We had a great day overall, would highly recommend!

Good day out. Fantastic city zoo. Lots to see for your money and not ripped off when you get in on food and drink like some. Built into hill so lots of walking to be done. Train and chairlift to top help. Very clean and tidy and a vast array of animals to see.some surprisingly up close. Favourite was polar bears doing backstroke less than a foot away from you.

visit to Prague zoo. Loved going to the zoo. Had family to show us how to get there luckily. It only cost us £3 each to get in and it took us a few hours to see it all. My favourite was the tiger's. They had a lot of different animals and birds I would recommend any one to go there family's couple or friends. Well worth the money it's cheaper than some local bus fares over in England. The hot dogs at the top of the zoo were lovely as well.

Worth a day trip. Prague Zoo offers a wide variety of family fun activities in Prague for the whole family to enjoy! Check the daily schedule to find out what animals have special feedings, showings, or enrichment activities. There's so much to see & do, definitely worth a day trip!

Impressive.. This is the best Zoo i have ever visited. Spent there whole day walking around and exploring Zoo,and i have to admit that i did not get bored or something because it is very nicely made. Well done.

Animal Kingdom in Prague. Located by the river Vltava, the ZOO in set in a calm green place and you can access it by transport, bike/by walk or by steam boat and make it whole day trip! Ideal when it's nice weather.I had yearly ticket when I lived in the area and loved to visit my favourite Gorillas and see the constant improvements Zoo is making after the terrible flood in 2002.I love the fact that the Zoo has various landscape incl. hills, rocky slopes and even chairlift which takes you over it if you don't want to walk.There is a lot of great things to say about the Zoo but I think the best is to go there and see for yourself. I'm sure you'll love it! Say hello to Gorillas when you're there ;)

Great day away from the masses. If you're looking for a relaxing day away from the crowds in Old Town Square, take the tram up to the zoo for an enjoyable hike through this hilly but quite enjoyable zoo. We visit zoos throughout the world, and this one is high up there on my list.

Big zoo!. Great price, only £6 entrance fee and 1kc for pensioner mum! We visited on exceptionally hotday so didn't get around the whole zoo. Used the tractor train to get to the top as on a hillside. Lots of refreshments available and lovely draught beer to wander around with! Locals could bring their dogs which we found amazing....in fact dogs are welcome everywhere in the czech republic...even the shopping centres and food shops! Had a lovely experience on lemur island getting up close to them. Only small negative is all menus totally in czech which not the easiest language to understand but most staff speak basic English so you just about manage to order the right food which always seems to taste better than uk especially salad. They do like spicy herby everything so don't expect anything bland or plain! Also, lovely huge bbq serving fresh chicken, pork, sausages, herby potatoes and sauerkraut. We caught the number 17 tram in Prague to an out of town bus station then bus just to the zoo which took about 15 mins. Very enjoyable day. Animals looked well cared for and clean.
worth a visit. a beautiful zoo that is worth spending a day there.We really liked the Seals and the elefants area.
One of the best in Europe. I saw in EU around 20 other ZOO and this is one of the best. You need more than 5 - 6 hours if you want to see all animals.

Best zoo for animals and value 5 *****. Prague zoo is one of the best zoo`s I have seen, set on 2 levels - walk it or be brasve and pay for a chair lift . Easy to get to by metro then bus . £6 entrance - you will need a full day to see it all.A great day out - highly recommend.

Fantastic Zoo!. An amazing zoo packed with a range and variety of so many different animals. The Gorillas had just given birth to a baby when we visited - felt very lucky to see this! Great value for money, we paid 150koruna each as a student (just had to show our student cards). A brilliant experience and would happily return.

Lovely zoo, well worth a visit. What a gorgeous zoo!! I've been to a few zoos in different parts of the world, and this one has to be my favourite. It's so beautiful! Not sparse like some zoos, but with lot's of trees and plants, makes it feel like you're walking thorough more of a nature reserve. It's on 2 levels - the lower part and then you can either walk to the higher part of get a type of ski-lift-chair up to the top which is fun. They've got a really lovely elephant area, with tributes to elephants all around it. I found it so peaceful there and absolutely recommend this - whether you have children or not.

So many interesting animals. . We saw so many interesting animals we had not experienced in other zoos. I was excited to see the Przewalski's horse and the Komodo dragons, but there were exhibits of species I've never heard of before. The Zoo is quite large and hilly. We only spent a few hours, so we did not make it through all of it, but still felt the trip was worth it. We took an Uber from our hotel in Prague, it was very reasonable. I hope to return someday.

Fantastic day. This zoo is HUGE!!! Lots and lots of animals. We had a really good time here. Food is reasonably priced too - although I got short changed by an old man in one of the huts near the mountain goats.
We Taxied it and cost 450-500ckr from the centre of old town.
Best Zoo in the World. This is the Best Zoo in the world, the admission price is a bargain, and it is so big compared to most zoos, they have such a variety of different animals.

Huge Zoo!. Prague zoo is HUGE and requires a full day to see everything. They have so many different animals to see such as Polar Bears! I was however quite concerned with the size of the enclosures for the big cats, especially the lions and tigers. The animals seemed extremely aggitated which made me feel very guilty for even visiting the zoo. Bittersweet experience.

Recommend to visit this! Especially with kids!. It is a very large and really nice Zoo. You need a full day to visit this. They have some species that you don't commonly see in other Zoos nowadays, such as ice bears, gharials, etc.You can easily reach the Zoo with public transport. (Metro+Bus). The Prague card gives you free entrance (and free public transport)

NOT WORTH THE TRAVEL AND THE PRICE. Hands down the turn off for our trip. This place is huge but half the animals exhibits are empty. Overall you have to walk a lot but the animals are ones you can see anywhere in the world, nothing special. Avoid !

Good couple of hours for the family. There were many really good attractions at the zoo, and we could have spent even longer there had it not been for having a 2 year old with us!Still, not convinced I'd call it one of the best. TripAdvisor rates it 4th best in the world: https://www.tripadvisor.com/TravelersChoice-Attractions-cZoos-g1

Beautiful landscape, fabulous panoramic view of Prague, quality fastfoods. Prague ZOO has a very special location - it spreads over the hill down to Vltava river, which makes it very "natural". The animals are in a great shape (given their life circumstances obviously), living in close to natural environments. I also highly value the quality of the support facilities such as fast-foods - you can get decent Indian and local meals for less then 5EUR, toilettes are clean, there are plenty of activities for kids etc. Just a great place to spend the whole day!
Best Zoo I´ve ever been to.. This is a huge, well-kept and impressive zoo. Very worth paying the ticket, and perfect for a long visit.

Unexpected Delight!. When my friend (who is a local) suggested visiting the zoo, I was apprehensive. But I'm so glad that I went! It's a large zoo with many kinds of animals. My highlights included:--The gorillas, especially the little baby gorilla--The giant newts--The Galapagos turtles--All the wildcatsI'd recommend starting at the bottom of the zoo and paying the $1 fee to take the chair lift up to the top because the view is amazing!

A Top Notch Zoo with many Qualities.. First off getting there, Take the metro to Nadrazi Holesovice, then bus 112 to the Zoo. It comes around about every 15 minutes I've visited Prague many times but was a bit ashamed that I hadn't visited the Zoo before. This time I was sure to make it a priority and I'm glad I did. Being form Omaha I can say that I know what it's like to visit a great Zoo and the Prague Zoo is very good. The first thing I notice is that it is extremely affordable, 200 Czech Koruna. $8 dollars US. for Adults and cheaper for kids of course. I liked not only the variety of animals but the amount of green space in the park. Plenty of trees, shrubs, flowers and shade. Among my favorite exhibits were the Elephant, Hippo Polar Bear, and Seal exhibits. They had a Chair lift to help with those who preferred not to walk up the hill to the animals up there. Overall the walking distance wasn't to bad. A lot of the benches were being redone so not a over abundance of places along the trails to rest but lots of food stations and picnic tables at those locations. I spent a good 3 hours there. My only complaint is that they do not have a aquarium. I had a great time, I'm glad I finally made the time for something other than Pivo and Sausages ;)

Fantastic walk. This is the best zoo I've visited. Even my husband was excited. we've spent there 5 hours without stop. Animals seems to be happy, have a lot of space. most of wild animals such as tigers, monkeys, lions, have nternal aviary with access to the outside aviary, so if you can't find them in outside aviary you can go to special pavilion, where you can find them sleeping, for example like we have found tigers, sleeping like big cats))))

The beat zoo I have had the pleasure of visiting!!. This is genuinely the best zoo I have ever visited. They had an enormous variety of animals including rare creatures such as the giant salamander. The price was incredibly cheap and cost approximately £7 each (200 czh), giving amazing value for money. The site is huge, we were there all day from open till close and did not get to see it all. There are plenty of food, drink and toilet facilities around the park. I highly recommend the zoo as it was a great day out and is suitable for all ages.

Very large zoo. This zoo is really well taken care of, and has lots of rest spots and places to sit and enjoy the animals in their habitats. We got to watch teeny monkeys playing tag, lions, tigers, cheetahs. My only complaint was that their elephant exhibit promoted the use of bull hooks.

Good for the kids. We should rather skip this but my 9 year olds daughter insisted. She really liked it and enjoyed but for me it was kind of boring and nothing special for the adults. On the other hand they made a zoo not for humans to see but for the animals to live so I really appreciate their efforts.
They have a Slow Lloris. Went to this zoo in winter. Best part was the Indonesian wing and the Slow Lloris. Polar Bears were very close. Enclosure for large canines was very large. Great views too.

one of the best Zoo's in the world!!. We really enjoyed visiting the zoo. It's really big you need a whole day from the morning to see everything but still it's better if you can visit it in two days. Very interesting animals from all over the world and the best part is that you can see many baby animals that they were just born like the gorilla and the hippo. The ticket for its value it's a great deal, very cheap for what it has to offer to the guests!

The best zoo I've visited! . Prague zoo was fantastic! Coming from Australia I was able to see so many animals we don't have in the zoo's at home. They were all so active and their habitats were well maintained and quite beautiful in some parts! I loved the bush babies in the nocturnal house, I couldn't believe how high they could hop! The polar bear was amazing too - he was swimming around and playing with a tire in the water. What an experience! Thank you Prague zoo!

Wonderful peaceful day. We spent our last day in Prague at this beautiful zoo. It was a lovely getaway from the city's noise and crowd. Getting to and back from the zoo was surprisingly fast and easy with a combination of metro and bus. The zoo is vast and beautiful, like walking in an old magical garden. There is a large variety of animals, most of them in spacious exhibitions. The zoo is so large that we decided to skip some of it. There is a cable taking the visitors to the hilltop (otherwise a tedious climb). We were very impressed with the proximity of the animals to the visitors. Most of the exhibitions allow you to see the animals through a glass within a touching distance. I've never seen a lion or gorilla so close. I also liked that most of the animals can choose not to be seen, and hide or go to another cage. It seems respectful. The only downside was the map and signs. We found it vey hard to know where we are and how to get to a specific place. This part definitely needs improvement. If you have the time, I highly recommend visiting this beautiful place.

For kids and for adults, plus every visit is different. Prague ZOO is one of the best ZOO's I have been to. It offers a wide range of animals and is set in a lovely neighborhood. You can cycle to the ZOO along the river, take a ferry too... there are several entrances, if you want to explore different sides of the ZOO, try different entrances on your different visits.

One of the best Zoos I ever visited. Magnificent place to go in case of fine weather! A lot of animals to see. Huge area and nice environment for creatures. If you eager to visit zoo in the cities you travel - Prague Zoo is the number 1 place to go within the Europe!Never go there by the ferry... it is a long and boring trip. And if it is a sunny day - you will be fried on the deck.

Top 2 Zoo in Europe. This Zoo, or Berlin, is the best in Europe. Very carefully designed so that the walking distances are short and visitor can really see the animals. Nice funicular in the middle part that You can ride to climb to the top of the hill (or not) with more animals.
One of the best ZOO ever!. This ZOO is probably the best ZOO I've ever been to. Really large, clean and the animals look happy. Definitely recommend to everyone.

Zoo Praha. Wonderful species of animals. Great show rooms and exhibitions. Snacks machines at every stop, good meals at the restaurants. Family friendly with train and horse rides, up/down lifts, parks and benches. Keep in mind, there are a lot of hills to climb but nonetheless it was good exercise.
Awesome Zoo. One of the best zoos ive ever been too. Huge zoo, so come early so you have time to experience it all.
Prague Zoo. Nice park in super condition with excellent elephant pavilion. We also enjoyed good lunch there. We can recommend.

One of the best zoos I've been to. Prague zoo is great, even better than London zoo I'd say! There were so many different types of animals even polar bears & penguins which were my children's favourite! Entry price was very good & the food at the Ocean Restaurant in particular was excellent!
best zoo ever. Best of the zoos I've ever been to. Big, modern, lots of animals who seem to be relaxed and happy. Bats flying over your head both scary and awsome!

prague zoo worth a visit. here you go if you re an animal lover who wants to visit a very good zoo. at tge same time you get a good outpost for walki g back to town following Vltava river. Delightful.

Great place to visit for everyone!. Hi, everyone! Would like to recommend you to visit Prague Zoo if you have a chance. You will definitely enjoy it. It is lovely place, a lot of areas, cute animals, it will be great time for couples/friends/families/adults in general. We were there with friends, once with my parents during their visit. I remember we were looking at white bears, they used to play in water together, It was soooooo nice, we did not realized that we spent just near them more than 1 hour :))) Hope you will enjoy it ;)

What an amazing experience! . We went there with our 8 months old boy, it was very convenient with the stroller. So many things to see, we never saw so many species in one place before... The toilets are very clean, the staff was so nice and welcoming, answering questions, lots of nice food stands with fast but yummy dishes. The children zoo is a cool place where the little ones can play and feed farm animals. The weather was also on our favor so it was a very good experience for us.

The best in Europe. From the very entrance I felt like I was 12 again. Usually when I am at a zoo there is a little sense of guilt inside me. But this time I wished I was that polar bear with my own ice-maker. We spend over 4 hours walking around but have seen only a half or even less. The only thing that disappointed me was some repairs in the fur seal department on the day of our visit and it was stated nowhere.

If you have kids, a nice break.. The zoo is a place to take a break from absorbing the history of Prague. And is especially welcome if you have kids who are getting tired of the cathedrals and museums.

Really well set up zoo. We visited on a Monday when there was a little rain but this didn't seem to stop others either. Having visited zoos in a few locations I have to say this is one of the best I've seen. It was laid out very well and the chair lifts were a nice touch to rest the feet a little. One thing we were a little disappointed by was some areas of the zoo being shut or not having any animals, without being previously informed of this. However, had we not been expecting these animals to be present we certainly wouldn't have felt cheated with the vast variety of animals to be seen. Some of the 'displays' did seem a little small or inappropriate for the animals they housed, whilst the majority gave the animals plenty of space and facilities to play and roam around freely. Overall definitely worth a visit of you have a free few hours on your trip.

Hidden jewels. The Prague zoo is awesome. Animals are happy and playful, it's large, you get restaurants and souvenir shops, pretty much as you do anywhere else. Most people go there for the tigers and polar bears and elephants, but there are two species that are I think way more fascinating. (I mean all the animals are fascinating, some are just better known than others.) Firstly, they have an exhibit of Chinese giant salamanders and it rocks (if you're into amphibians, that is). They look like creatures from a different planet, all weird and blob-like. There's a little indoor pool with glass under the water surface and sometimes the salamanders swim under there making you feel like you could touch them ... if you wanted to. But not many people would want to I think. Even weirder than the salamander is a bird though, hiding all the way in the back of the zoo area. It's the Shoebil. When I first saw it live, it really gave me the creeps. It has the most evil and intelligent look ever. Chris Pratt's private army of raptors is nothing compared to one vicious looking shoebill. I'm not afraid of birds, but this one is ... different. Just go check it out :)

Great ZOO. We have visited quite a few ZOOs in the past, best being Singapore but the Prague ZOO is also very nice. Transport is easy from metro C, Nadrazi Holesovice get a bus 112. You can easily spent most of the day there and see some interesting animals like the Przewalski horses which are the world's only true wild horses. Entry is 200Kc for adults and 150Kc for kids 3-15. Every Monday (apart during July and August) kids are only 50Kc. You can even bring your dog with current vaccination, ticket costs 100Kc :)

Wear good walking shoes. We walked from downtown through residential areas using Google maps (although the buses are easy to use). The polar bears have their own snow machine and the elephants were celebrating and protecting their newly-born (2 weeks then) baby from the rowdy and gawking 2-footed visitors....some interesting exhibits....ride the chair lifts up and consider getting the train-side view as well.

Great place to visit. The place is big, you can easily spend the whole day there. We went with the river boat and walked from the pier. The signage were missing so we went sure which way to walk but eventually we found the zoo. There are great views, many different animals etc. I'll recommend to visit this place.

Nice Zoo. It is really nice zoo and it is quite big and it take the whole day to wander around the whole thing properly. It is really nice to walk around and amazing animals to have fun with! I recommend to go in good weather though
Huge, but very nice. Absolutely worth visiting. One of the best zoo I have ever seen. There are a lot of diffrent animals in their natural surrendings.
Amazing Zoo. Very beautiful enclosures with lots of space and quite exotic animals.Make sure to have enough time (2+ hours) in order to see all of it!

A surprisingly great day out. Easily accessible from city centre via metro and one bus change. Reasonably priced admission and refreshments. A large hilly site where good use has been made of the area. A good selection of well kept animals. The star of day was the hippos

Lovely way to spend the day as a family. Went on a sunny Saturday. Could have easily spent the whole day at the zoo. The animals seemed in very good health and well taken care of. The grounds were clean and well taken care of, however the bathrooms we not very good....if the zoo is the 4th best in the world, then the bathrooms are closest to the worst!

Nicest place to get rid of stress. I was in Prague for a conference, but skipped the first half of Monday to give this place a round. Totally worth it. The place is very nice, mostly in May with all the lush vegetation and flowers. The exhibit is comprehensive and there are lots of animals to see. Not a big fan of Zoos, mostly due to the idea of animal cruelty, but this place is worth. Pros: nice surroundings, not all the animals are in cages, most have `open space`.Lots of species and space for them. Cons: the explanation in English is not very long and always present. Large animals like giraffes and elephantes have very poor cages and were still inside. Tips:1. Try to plan more than 2 h. 4 h should be enough, 5 if you want to enjoy a bit of relax time. 2. The place is very tricky to handle, buy a map (10 czh) and find the funicular first. Then descend on your own. It is more likely to visit all the animals like this. 3. Come in May, the flowers are in full bloom, everything is green and the smell of the lilliac is great. Also, there is a warm light and it is not so hot, so many animals won't be hiding from heat.
Very big zoo. Very big and beautiful zoo, with big variety of animals of all kind from smallest to the biggest. Very close to the city center with good transportation. Lovely souvenir shops

Beautiful zoo. We went on a monday, surprisingly is was a happy monday, which means the ticket entry was very low (50 ckz). The website says the happy mondays ended in March, that's why I was surprised because I went in May. The zoo itself is big, but walkable. The animals have a lot of space, which is important. I especially liked the wide open field with the giraffes, ostriches and antelopes.

Pony rides, a farm, kids play area - Quite a fun zoo. I agree with TA rating for it as the 4th best zoos in the world. I have also visited the Singapore zoo, rated the third best, and this one was almost equally good. Singapore has a separate gorgeous bird park, but in Prague you see a good variety of birds in the zoo itself. Plus the kids totally enjoyed the 5 minute pony ride, the farm and the kids play areas. We got to see Lamas for the first time! Access on public transport was super easy. We spent about 4 to 5 hours here, and could see only about half of it, so arrive early and plan to spend the full day if you want to see it all.
Its a zoo. Its a normal zoo, but its a nice one. Some animals are missing and some other look sick. But in general they look good. Its a good walk so bring some good shoes.

amazing. This is a very well done zoo. animals seems to be healthy ( only the polar bears, the tiger and the lions gave me a sad impression). you are very close to the animal. their is a lot of babies which is a good sign... i hardly recommand a complete day to visit it ! they are also part of a protection and reintegration of the animals...

Whole day spent. Its definitely must to see when you are in Prague. I love to go there even tho I live in Prague Its beautiful and soooo big, you really need at least 4 hours to see everything with no rush!

Prague Zoo. The Prague really lives up to it's expectation as a world class zoo. It is very immersive with over a hundred different species of animals. It is truly a gorgeous zoo, with wonderful landscaping and a great outlay for the exinits. It is very well put together and I highly recommend visiting. My only major qualm however, has to do with the elephant exhibit. I was a little taken aback of how little and miniscule their exhibit was. Other than that the zoo was a fantastic experience that deserved a nice part of your day.

Great for young families!. We spent many enjoyable hours at this ZOO. It keeps kids well entertained. This is a large ZOO with great variety of animals. The animals seem to have enough room to roam free. In some parts it feels like being in a safari. Best months are the summer months, but winter visits are interesting too.
It's a must. If you plan to visit this zoo keep in mind that you should have free at least 6 hours to enjoy the whole experience. It's a place really nice with a lot of animals.

Excellent Zoo. This was our second visit to Prague zoo and once again we were very impressed. The zoo is very big and we saw new things we missed last time due to the size of the place. The animals look well cared for and happy with most of them in big 'natural as can be' enclosures. The entrance price and price for refreshments once inside is exceptional value compared to other zoos I have visited.

Definitelly worth it!. I keep coming to this place again and again for several years. Lately enjoying it with my small children. It is always getting better and better each visit and every time I get some pleasant surprise - new exhibitions here, new amusement center for kids there... Simply awsome! Once in Prague do not hesitate to visit. You will probably need the whole day though if you want to see it all at once.

Top ZOO. Its amazing to go there, definitely a place to visit in Prague. It takes the whole day and you can find everything there even a lift or a bus going around, nice cafes and restaurant. There are all kinds of animals that can be seen in a zoo

One of the nicest ZOOs in the world. The Prague ZOO is beautiful. It is situated in a hilly location with the possibility to use a short chair lift to get to the upper part. There are many animals - currently for example a baby elephant and a baby gorilla - and laso playgrounds for children and some restaurants and stall to have a refreshment.

One of the best zoos in the world. I have been to many zoos and aquariums around the world and this zoo was excellent. Many animals not seen anywhere else. It is a large zoo where you can spend all day. by the way, they allow pet dogs in! Wow! I would have loved to bring my dog to the zoo.

Best zoo I've been to!. I don't often go to a zoo when on holidays but when I read the reviews I felt compelled to go and I'm so glad I did! Visited with 7 friends and loved it, it's so laid back - you can buy beer and just stroll around looking at all the animals! Really nice family atmosphere and all the animals looked fantastic. Definitely visit if you're in Prague!! It's easy to access - just get the tube (can't remember the stop tho gig) and from there you can get a free bus that only takes 15 mins.

Wonderful Zoo!. This zoo was absolutely fantastic! I have been to several zoos in the US including DC and San Diego and this one was nicer than all of them. The exhibits were very interesting and well maintained. The price was very reasonable and the restaurant food was very good. We spent 4 or 5 hours here but if we had kids we could have spent the entire day. It was also a nice break from the tourist crowds because there were mostly locals. It wasn't hard to get there - only one or two transfers.

Amazing zoo you musn´t miss!. If you like animals, be sure you will spend here the whole day. Prague zoo is large and every year, you will find new animals, pavilions or new footpaths. In addition, you can find there a lot of attractions for children and many refreshments. The whole area is landscaped, well placed on the hill with new tower, which provides you with beautiful view on the city of Prague. No surprise that this zoo belongs among the best from the world!

Take A Most Definate Trip On The Wildside. I must start my review by saying that we ended up going here on a wet morning which became a wet day totally (Weds 4th May 2016) but, even though the weather was what it was we were there for 2hours (there are places to shelter etc but, it was just cold) this is an absolute must attraction to visit.We wasn't expected to go to the zoo, as it is out of city and Prague offers so many other places to go etc, but freeing some time during the week we managed to fit it in and boy I'm glad we went par the weather.We booked a taxi from the Intercontinental Prague Hotel to the zoo, the journey takes around 15 minutes and cost us 300CZK going (we were charged 350CZK back, this was due to traffic) you will see from other reviews that people have taken the bus / tram which I can say drop you more or less right outside the zoo, unsure of the price though.Prices are unbelievable considering the sheer size of this Zoo, 200CZK for adults, 150CZK for children & 1CZK for Seniors (Age 70+, ID is required).Obviously, due to the weather we didn't get to see all of the zoo, likewise some of the animals (asleep or staying warm in their enclosures) but we did manage to get to see the Polar Bears, The Elephant Enclosure complete with new arrival "Janita", Hippo's, antelopes, giraffes + one or two others we also managed to see some of indoor areas like the reptiles, fruit bats, birds etc.There are plenty of places also for food and drink so you don't need to pack lunch etc.Simply put, this is most definite attraction to visit when in Prague, obviously weather needs to be good, but don't let it put you off as there are still things to see and do undercover.

very big ZOO. The ZOO in Prague you can reach from Nadrazi Holesovice by bus - good connection. ZOO is very big, situated on the hill. You can get also map in 5 czk, its good option if you wanna make sure see all animals, you can even take your dog - there are tkts for a dog as well. Inside there is lots of small restaurants. You can also sit on the grass and have the picnic.

Was fun and relaxing. It was cold day on that day but still make me happy with this place, Prague zoo is really big we used almost 3-4 Hrs. to walk around the zoo but becoz the weather was cold almost all animals stay inside, next time we hope we will see all of animals there :)

the waiters to oceanic buffet they were very poorly educated .. the zoo very well, but the waiters to oceanic buffet they were very poorly educated .It is horrible that such an important zoo which the waiters do not know English and answer customers so badly. They would have to control this behavior.
Great place to visit. Do not miss one of the largest zoos in Europe. It has plenty of space, well fed animals and endangered species.

Do not miss it. We only had two hours to visit such a large zoo unfortunately. The animals are well fed and have plenty of space. Moreover they have there endangered species. I would like to visit again that zoo and I recommend it for children, families as well as groups of friends.

Wonderful Day at Great Zoo. We had a fantastic day at Prague Zoo, the best I've ever visited in Europe, we didn't manage to see everything and we will definitely go back! The bats flying around our heads was quite an experience, I loved it, my husband needed to leave rather quickly.......
Really great zoo!!. I visited here in the summer last year and I had a really great experience there. the Zoo is vast with lots of space for the animals. I'll definitely be back!

Great value for money experience!. I haven't visited a zoo since forever and thought it might be a mistake to see it through adult eyes. Quite the opposite, a really enjoyable and enlightening experience for adults and kids alike.What a great zoo, more like a hillside parkland with many animal exhibit area integrated into the natural landscape and clearly heavily invested into and managed with real pride. At around £6 per adult for entry, it's fantastic value, the guides are cheap, informative and easy to navigate with, there are lots of good value refreshment points/cafes. The whole experience is clearly aimed at offering a cost effective experience, to encourage people to use the facility, rather than extorting people.Easy access from the metro and dedicated bus that takes you straight to the main gates.High tech, modern pavilions and dedicated buildings for many species.The Elephant enclosure was modern and really well equipped with enough 'natural habitat' to allow them to successfully breed and a walkway that winds across the area to gain an elevated view.Interesting information panels and sculptures/features representing parts of world where animals originate.A large wooden look out tower on top of the hill, free to climb and offering great views over Prague.Definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Prague - can't recommend it highly enough.

Just wow. It was so big. We had to almost run through it in three hours time we were there. The fencings for animals were very big. The places for elephants and savanna animals were huge.There were some fencings where there wasn't anyone. Many animals had cubs, so cute. Beats the Copenhagen zoo...

Day out at the zoo.. We bought the family ticket for 1 year which allows you 48 entrances to the zoo, so for a family of 4 that's once a month for a year. It cost 1800CZk so it is good value for money. The trip to the zoo on Public transport is very convenient, and there is a bus from tram and metro that drops you off right by the main entrance. Going by car may be an issue during busy times as parking is limited. We went on a warm spring day and was a great outing for the family, we heard there were carts to pull children in but I couldn't see any. Don't worry too much about packing foods and drink as there are places to eat and very reasonable prices. 25CZK for a hot dog and about 30CZK for a bottle of water. The Zoo is very big and located on a hilly area so be prepared to walk up and down. We didn't have time to see the entire zoo as we spent an hour in a queue to see the newborn Gorrila, they were restricting the access to a few people at a time , the lady from the zoo came to thank us for our patience in Czech and English. We enjoyed the Indonesian exhibition and got ot see a Komodo Dragon for the first time. Was very hot in the dome. All in all it was very good, only thing I didn't like was the Tiger in the cage looked quite stressed as he walked up and down. I think they get turns inside the cage and outside. Very good zoo, well kept, clean and lots to see.

Massive Zoo. Massive Zoo that is a must visit, I often don't visit Zoo's when travelling but after hearing the reviews, this was easy to get to and had Polar Bears! Sky lift was cool and the day was lovely.Be warned the zoo is large and we never made it all before the legs give the best of us. Also take change for the bus? Struggled to get the bus back with no change to buy tickets.

Definitely Go!. Really, really enjoyed. The price was 200 Czech krona per person, which is £6-£7. Totally worth a visit. Just get yourself 90min ticket at vending machine for 32czk (£1) and this will get you to the zoo by tube and bus (112). Animal enclosures are good, especially for giraffes as they have massive territory to gaze around. was sad for lions and other big cats as they were kept in glass cages, but i guess that was just temporary. overall worth a visit.

Enjoyed my visit thoroughly! . First off, if you visit on a Monday and provide a Student ID card you gain entry for only 50 krowns, around £1,50 - a bargain! The zoo itself is clean and very well maintained with a great selection of animals in enclosures which appear to be rather good! The enclosures are big, with much to stimulate to animals! Also, there are many experiences provided by the Zoo which I've not found anywhere else, including an exhibition with some animals and free flying fruit bats! Also, there is an enclosure in which you can enter and be face to face with vultures and eagles, without any barrier! All around a great trip!

one of the best ZOOs in the world. If you are into ZOOs and if you have an additional day in Prague, I'd recommend to visit this ZOO. It is really lovely, you will walk a lot here. Go there via park Stromovka. If the weather is nice, I guarantee that it'll be a lovely day.

Very fun place for kids and adults. We were there from opening to closing and still couldn't complete seeing all what the zoo has to offer. There is a train ride, a funicular, lots of various pavilions and rear animal displays. It is recommended to visit the zoo on Saturday as there are some activities with animals like big cats feeding, Seals show and more. There are locker services in the zoo and also a lot of snack points where you can get hot dogs, local sausage, beer, coffee, ice cream for relatively low prices. In the bottom line the kids and us had a huge fun. One disadvantage that needs to be pointed out is that the arrival and departure from the zoo is made by busses which are getting crowded and this felt like being inside a sardine box.

Great animal care. Comparing to Budapest zoo, this does not have so many animal species (it's a total lack of fish tanks) but the animals have better enclosures.Many animals breed here (gorillas, elephants, suricate, and so on), we saw the babies!There are many restaurants and snack spots and a dedicated kids area.Being on a hill, the chairlift is really helping but also the zoo tours in dedicated tour vehicles.On foot it takes the whole day to visit it.
Nice place to spend time . Well organized, very nice place. For me they had honey budger form Africa !!! The best ever !!! I recommend this please especially with children
Whole day trip. You really need to go around organized because it's a very big zoo that is organized in districts. It is difficult to see a lot if you have small children with you...

Best Zoo I have been too.. This is by far the best zoo I've been too.The Zoo is HUGE and I would advise you take your walking shoes as there is plenty of hills. There are so many animals to see that it's worth giving your self plenty of time. It's very good value for money and there is lots in English. Our favourite parts were the polar bears and the fact they have cable cars to reach the top.

So big!. This zoo is by far one of my favorites, the animals look healthy and well taken care of. I went with my friend (she is 22 and im 23) and we had a great time! It is for all ages, a day worth spend. Take snacks, that way you wont buy so much inside.

Disappointed. We read in some guide that the zoo is the best in central Europe and ranked 4th in the World. We were very disappointed, and didn't stay very long. Displays are far away from each other, few or no animals were to be seen. We've seen better and much better. Don't waste your time as a tourist, even if you get free transportation and free entry with your Prague Card.

Wonderful Saturday trip. We went to the zoo with my husband to check out new elephant and gorilla babies but ended up spending there hours and just enjoying ourselves. Polar bears are super cute and flamingoes, giant turtles, ... loved it.
Amazing!!!. Best zoo I have ever been too. Bring good shoes and time as the zoo is huge. We spent 6 hours there and didnt manage to see all the animals. Highly recommended!

If you're in Prague, then you can't miss the Zoo.. A modern big zoo with lots of animals. I recommend the apes pavilion and the elephant district. Especially worth going with children. One of the best zoos in Europe! But don't expect to find anything good ro eat since all you'll find are cheap hotdogs and chicken wings.

Huge, interesting, but.... The place is really nice: various ladnscape, beatiful view on the city from some points, some territories for animals are big and funny (like outside zone for elephants). I visited this places several times, every time I see something new. Even sometimes I feel like animals here are happy and not so stressed as animals in others zoo.. But one time I saw an elephant in the inside zone with fetters on his legs, he was in a cage and couldnt move and a small elephant was on the other side of the cage trying to touch that big elephant with his trunk. Of course! There was nothing bad! But the whole picture was a bit sad, and now I have this small negative memory :( still the people who work there are very friendly and I nice that they treat animals in a good way.

Plan full day at Zoo. The Prague zoo is a great family destination. You can get there easily from the center of Prague by tram and bus. Be prepared for at least a 1/2 day or longer visit. This zoo is huge and has an incredible variety of animals from around the world in natural settings. For Americans, it is similar to the layout of the San Diego Zoo, but much larger. If you are in Prague for several days, this is a good break from the heavy tourist traffic in the Old Town area.

Not very inspiring. I went to the view based on other reviews and its supposed ranking as the 4th best zoo in the world. While it is a nice zoo there were many enclosures that were empty with no indication of why. The elephant and giraffe enclosures in particular had all the animals locked inside. You were still able to view the animals however I found these enclosures small and the animals were very agitated. I have to say that I was disappointed with the zoo and would definitely have given it a miss as I feel I wasted a day.

huge but the collection of animals isn't that wide. I went there in winter, so most of the animals were inside their caves (houses) and they barely go out for you to see them. I was really disappointed because the collection of animals there didn't amaze me except for the polar bears and the mini penguins.

Lovely, modern zoo. Absolutely gorgeous zoo with marvelous exhibits. We were lucky to see a three-week-old elephant, and I hear that a gorilla unexpectedly produced a baby a few days after we were there. We also had lunch from an outdoor stand--ordered a hamburger and bramboracky (potato pancakes--I had thought it meant French fries). Completely contrary to what I expected from zoo food it was outstanding! One of the best meals I had in Prague! All in all, it's a lovely setting with excellent habitats and exhibits.

Zoo. Prague zoo is excellent value for money - the elephant enclosure has a wonderful waterfall and a small temple dedicated to Ganesh together with beautiful statues of Hindu gods adds to the attraction, numerous small eating areas on the way up the hill is good and parents can hire a small cart they can put their child into - great idea!
family trip. I´ve been there last summer. I love this place, Animals are various and there are big paddocks for animals

Something missing. Going to the zoo was at the too of our to do list. Transport there and back was really easy, the zoo itself was very cheap (200ckz) about £6, totally worth it. It will take you a whole day to get around, there is so much to see! The zoo looks like it's going through a re-vamp and the new parts look great!!! Most exihbits don't have any English translations which is a shame. Some of the animals seemed a little unhappy/distressed, pasing around their small enclosures. The chair lift wasn't operating the day we went which was dissapointing and the Gorillas had all been shut away and with the news of the new baby we were gutted not to see them. More staff around getting involved with visitors would have been nice. We did however have a great day out and it did take all day to get around everything
Huge display. It was a nice excursion for the little ones. Huge variety of specimens long walk.Very nice clean and open country type of zoo. One of the more impressive ones ive visited.
Nice zoo. Would recommend to go to zoo in summertime. We went there in march and was a bit disappointed, as many of the animals where inside and hard to see.

Visit any day of year. As I have visited many Zoos alone or with my family, I can recommend Prague ZOO as one of the best. You can spend nearly whole day there walking, watching animals, playing, take a funicular. Be aware that area is definitely not flat, but there is no need to rush.

Well designed zoo. Very glad I visited the zoo with the children.You can find large collection of animals, some of them it first time we see like polar bear , sea lion and red panda,Some of the animals are in special cells that simulate the natural environment.You can find special areas like night nature of Indonesian gungle in which you can feel the real atmosphere.

Truely a wonderful experience for kids and family. Prague zoo is one of the best I have been to. It is perfectly organized, there are many places where one could rest, have some food/refreshments. It is clean and has good attractions. Obviously aim for the weekend when there are some shows and programs organized. It is equally interesting for younger kids as well as teens, we went there with mixed group of kids and all enjoyed it and loved it. If you manage to get around the zoo in shorter time (almost impossible, as one enjoys it), you may jump to the nearby Troya gardens, which are stunning... But this calls for a new review ;)

One of the best Zoo's in Europe. Great family friendly Zoo where you can easily walk around between the different animals or take a small train that takes you around. New Elephant zone is super cool and gives Asian vibes and the Eagle's at feeding time is a must. The Lemur area is also very nice where you literally walk with the Lemurs running around your feet.

Excellent zoo. This is one of the best and well kept zoos in Europe if not the world. Definitely worth a visit. Expect to spend a whole day in there, it's spread over quite big area, and there are a lot of animals. The territory is also very picturesque itself, as it's located on the hills on the bank of Vltava river, providing you great sights to other parts of the city.

One of the best Zoo I have visited. I have 2 year old baby and we go once a month to Prague Zoo and it always suprise us by something. We love their pavilons (Indonesian, Gorillas, Elephants, Hippos etc.) and during sunny days whole Zoo.
One of the best zoos. Visited with two kids, liked it very much. You get to see the animals very close. Very much recommended. Walking distances are manageable, so we didn't feel tired.

Excellent! Lots of Walking. I had read that this was a fantastic place to visit so we planned our transport links and we headed off the morning - firstly it was so easy to get to, we arrived on the bus and brought our ticket. No programs available in English but each animal had a brief description in English which was enough. Lots of interesting animals, it took us four hours to see everything - we were walking at a fast pace and usually only stay at zoos for 2 - 3 hours and walk round twice. Lots of walking, up hills and down hill - but this is just because they have so many animals to see. Excellent value for money too.

Beautiful ZOO!. I am very proud that this beautiful ZOO is in Prague :-) We visit it every year more than once and everytime there is something new (pavilions, attractions for children, animals) and everytime we learn something new! They do a lot for animals and try to inform visitors about ecology etc. (f.e. about palm oil). I recommend you to spend there a day! :-) With children or not... and it´s perfect place to a have a date in :-DJsem vážně pyšná, že takovou pěknou ZOO máme zrovna v Praze :-) Navštěvujeme ji každoročně několikrát a vždycky vidíme něco nového (pavilony, atrakce pro děti, nová zvířata), navíc se i něco nového dozvíme, protože probíhají různě informační kampaně (palmový olej, ekologie...). Rozhodně doporučuju návštěvu, ať už s dětmi, nebo bez nich :-) Třeba na rande :-)

Great day. Great for a sunny day walk, entrance reasonable and a huge choice of great creatures :) food and drinks as usualy within those kind of parks limited and expansive, suggesting to take a sandwich or Donught along..

Wear your walking shoes. The zoo is a significant distance from the city. We took an uber and it was very inexpensive. The grounds of the zoo are quite expansive so definitely come rested and ready to walk. The highlight of our visit was seeing the recently born little Asian elephant. The new addition was clearly creating waves in the established herd. There were several loud exchanges between the parents and the more cranky members as they attempted to get too close the little one. There could have been more signage in English. Several areas did have information in English, but it was inconsistent.

Absolutely Amazing. Best zoo I have been too. It has polar bears, elephants, gorillas, tigers, lions, crocodiles, penguins etc etc. The park is huge it takes a full day to walk around it. It also has aerial lifts to carry you to the top of the zoo. As you are walking around the there is plenty of Pitt stops for you to purchase food and beverages even nice cold beers are available. If I go back to Prague I would defiantly go back what an amazing place.

Amazing!. We came here with my boyfriend and his sister and brother In law and their 2 years old daughter and we spent lovely day in there. Even we came quite early we didn't have enough time to see everything. But we had opportunity to see the main animals like gorillas the alpha one was a bit scary looking one because apparently he doesn't like when people are taking pictyres of him so he was a bit angry and kicked the wall next to us a couple times. We also had opportunity to see baby hippo and baby elephant whey are so cute! Whey have big variety of any kind of animals which is really impressive. I also would recommend to try to eat in a restaurant next to penguins the food there was very tasty.

Huge zoo!. The zoo is really huge and there is a lot of green space and a great variety of animals. It is also great for children. Most of the explanations are in czech only, some in english. Unfortunately we were there when the lions and tigers were inside and there indoor cages were tiny so that was a bit sad.
Fantastic. great zoo can tell all the animals are well looked after, very big place and all sperad out so need a good full day to see everything

Absolutely amazing.great zoo.. Visited here yesterday and must say it was the best zoo we have been to. Having visited many both in England and other countries....this zoo is by far the best. It is very big and can take all day to go round. Plenty of places for picnics,drinks and restaurants. Plenty of toilets. Every animal you can think of and the park itself is easy to navigate and get round. Price is 200ck per adult which is very reasonable. It is very clean and tidy with food and drink purchased on site also very affordable. Some parts are under construction but this does not in any way affect the enjoyment of the zoo but no doubt will only add and benefit the park and future visitors. It is definately worth a visit if you are in Prague.

A great day for all animal lovers. I love Prague Zoo. I live in Prague and am quite a frequent visitor and every time, there is something new, the setting is also beautiful and there are nice views of Prague. The Zoo is extremely successful in breeding, and is participating in several programs that re-introduce animals into their original habitats, and it has been voted the 4th best Zoo in the world.
