Recently, in April 2016, a baby elephant was born, in March there was a baby anteater and hippo.. and the list goes on and on. It is quite big, so I really recommend good walking shoes, and kids always love to take the funicular. There is also a new huge playground, thankfully there is a café/bar adjacent as well, so grownups can have a coffee or beer while waiting for the kids. There is good public transport going to the zoo, you go to Nadrazi Holesovice, on C line of metro, and catch the Zoo bus. For the great walkers, I recommend a walk through Prague´s biggest park, Stromovka, it is about 3 Km but a really nice walk. There are several places where you can eat and small kiosks where you can buy beverages all over the place- in the summer there is a little pool for kids as well by the Children´s zoo. The biggest restaurant is by the main entrance, but there are at least four other restaurants scattered around the Zoo. The Zoo is extremely popular, so go early in the morning, or on a regular work day- or prepare for crowds. Even then, it is worth it.

Banging zoo . I've frequented Paignton zoo many a time and this zoo literally obliterated it so many animals and genuinely takes a day to get round, v reasonable, fantastic lion, loved a lil play (altho polar bear looked a little stressed which wasn't nice)

Wonderfull wold. Prague Zoo is cheap, but if you are a student use your card for discount. The Zoo is ginourmous, full of maps so you can guide yourself.It have pavillions for each specie, so if you are going in a cold time weather, don't be expecting animals to be outside.All the plates are in Czech so... The Zookeepers spend the day up and down the zoo which is very cool, you can see them work.There are a lot of restaurants and places you can eat, but keep it clean. You are most likely to spend the whole day in the Zoo, so be prepared with comfortable shoes.The pinguins are the most sociable animal, if you sit near the window they will come to you. But be careful there are some animals you just can't be near of, like the lions, they get stressed.

Prague Zoo, good day out. I am a brit but have lived in Prague more than 20 year, Just like to say Prague zoo is a great day out and not just for kids there are many trails and levels beautiful views of course a sunny day is best but even a spot of rain can't spoil it Have fun

Zootastic!. Our family is a fan, and yours will be also. Built on a hill looking over the Valtava it houses a rich variety of animals including the rare Chinese giant salamander in it's own pavilion. It's in great shape compared to most zoos we have visited in the US or Europe. A big plus is the main cafeteria where there is typical Czech food with many areas to stop for coffee tea or snacks at a very reasonable price. Just compare to the Milwaukee Zoo or Bronx Zoo in the US where the food is uber expensive and well, I won't mention the quality. If you are visiting from out of town it is easily accessible by public transport (tram and then bus). On warmer days they have upwards of 15,000 visitors so go early. Winter months are less crowded. They rent big wagons to haul kids and gear around if you like. Dogs are allowed but must pay entry also. Plan on 4-6 hours to see the entire zoo. Enjoy!
fantastic zoo in prague. perhaps when you visit Prague don't have the intention of visit the zoo but I recommend, is very big and you can see the animals very near. Fantastic

Super day trip for the kids!. We took a taxi to and from the zoo but it would be advisable to take the boat since the taxis charge you whatever they want on the way back into the city ( there are no metro stops or tram lines close by and walking long distances with tired kids maybe tough). The zoo itself is laid out very nicely and is very visitor friendly. Entry is not too expensive. Lots to see and the exhibits are clean and easily accessible. There are a few food kiosks with limited options but was fine! We had a great time!

Fantastic day out. I absolutely loved Prague Zoo, you can see why it's one of the top rated in the world. Great selection of animals, who all look well cared for, and are living in a great space. It's very big so lots of walking, some of it uphill. You will spend a lot of time here so I'd advise you to brings snacks and a bottle of water - even though these are available to buy. Very affordable tickets, and easy to get too by bus or taxi. I particularly enjoyed the polar bears, tigers, penguins, elephants and giraffe's - however, my boyfriend was disappointed there were no sharks (he likes dangerous animals)! The majority of it is outside, so it might not be pleasant on a rainy day - it snowed when we went and some of the animals were inside, however there were still so many too see so it didn't impact us too much at all.

Great place for the whole family. - plenty of interesting animals in well-kept surrounding- every year some new expositions- many facilities where to eat, take a rest, change diapers etc.- playing ground for older children- you can make "the elephant paper"

Probably the best Zoo in Europe. Excellent location (close to centre but very nice place), well managed, with a wide variety of animals. More a true Zoo than a theme park. Very high standard compared to other European capitals.

We love animals. What a fantastic day out, polar bears are amazing along with gorillas and giant tortoises me tons of others. Lots to see plenty of places to take a break as lots of walking... But all in all the great day out for all oh and you can take your dog!!!

Get walking!. Great Zoo and very good value. Make sure you like walking as there is a long distance from start to finish! Lots of different animals etc to see. One or two maybe could do with a little more space but overall all animals appear fit and healthy. A bit concerned about the Leopards though. Showing signs of habitual behaviour. Would like to see something done if possible.

unbelieavble jeff!!. Great zoo seen polar bears up close and elephant enclosure is the best I have ever seen, the place is huge so lots to see and over looks the city with a great view. Guy in café was very friendly and called jeff (American student!)

Amazing day. My teenage boys (15 & 17) and I loved our day at the zoo. We saw many animals we had never seen before and were enthralled watching the new month old elephant. Many of the enclosures were new also and the animals all seemed v well cared for. Thee were many food stalls to satisfy us also. The gondola was a laughable experience as it was old and had antiquated safety features... We all survived without a scratch!! A must do if u have a spare day in Prague and need a break from the history of this beautiful city.

Great day! . There are lots of places to visit in Prague with children but this is one place you should dedicated visit. The highlight is the breeding program which demonstrates how happy the animals are living here. The baby hippo and baby elephant were delightful to watch. Leave the best until the end - the gorillas. If you've never seen gorillas in the flesh then it's worth the price of the ticket alone! Tickets are inexpensive!

Great day out. A great day out, only downside is the big cats need lots more room. Food is reasonably priced as is entrance. Baby elephant so cute, but dad either needs to with the herd or out of eyesight.
Whole day fun. Amazing animals, amazing walk, but besides that taje some time to read about interesting facts, you might get surprised by some achievements they have had in the last few decades :)
A good afternoon trip. Easy to get to by public transport, and low entrance fee. Lots to see and do there, very nice setting

Absolutely fantastic. This is the most amazing zoo I've been to. Has every animal you can think off. Extremely cheap. Animals have great space indoor and out, a brilliant day for anyone. So much to see you need at least 4 or 5 hours to get around.

Amazing Zoo ❤️. This zoo is incredible and lives up to all the reviews given. I read the reviews previously and all the comments were very positive. I could not agree more this Zoo has some awesome animals and is worth a day trip as there is so much to see and do. The polar bears are a must see they are so active and are so cute to watch. The Tigers are incredible and are very active. As a zoo lover all the animals look very happy and well looked after. I would love to revisit this Zoo when I am next in Prague. It is a must see if you visit Prague and love animals. I previously went to Berlin Zoo and was not impressed half the animals were not present and look unhappy. All the animals were out playing and seemed much happier in Prague Zoo. Overall a great day spent at the Zoo!
Great place. We was expecting to spent there half of a day, but we was there all day. 5 adults like children, really great zoo.

Be wild!. I can more than highly recommend the Prague zoological garden. I visited it when I was a child and now as an adult. The garden has experienced many improvements. First of all, as I am a baby boom fan, I have to mention that there are many new animal babies. Not just the small elephant, which is the only one from the elephants who is walking around, the others rather remaining at one place. There is also a small hippopotamus, which I find the cutest of all the babies. It is swimming in water with its parent, sometimes using it as a means of transportation and if you watch it in a friendly way through the glass, it will peep out from water with its big beautiful curious childish eyes. There are also very cute and gentile babies of Surikata, which resemble small mice.But it is not only the plentiful of babies which improved. Also, there are more specialised pavillions, all perfectly equipped according to the given theme, so you can explore the Indonesian jungle, the Bororo pavillion, the palace of the beasts, the big room of the amphibians, where you can also listen to the audio story about it by our most favourite writer Karel Capek, narrated by the experienced Czech actor Jiri Labus.As I am a great Africa lover, I have to mention the palace called The Wonders of Africa.Another improvement I observed is that even in the rooms with monkeys or other huge mammals, the air does not stink like before.The park is an exquisite place for a beautiful walk, too, whereas educational, with children or a romantic one for couples.You can try the cabin which goes from the bottom to the top and back again.Overall, I was extremely satisfied and I am absolutely sure that you must visit this beautifully amazing place.

Fun zoo. My family went to the zoo for a break from all the historical sites of Prague, and we had a lot of fun. We had some up close time with the lemurs and enjoyed a chairlift up the large hill. There were also some Giant Chinese Salamanders which we had never seen before. Some commenters noted that there are some small indoor habitats, but I usually saw access to a larger outside area.

Excellent . I have been to several few zoos within UK and Spain over the years but Prague zoo will always be memorable because I got to see animals that I have not seen in other zoos! Wide selection to see and do during your visit here. Especially impressive for an off-season time of year (January). As a first time visiter to this zoo I am very impressed. Animals seem well catered for with pleasing enclosures. Zoo is large, so is definitely a full day of making memories with the kids

Beautiful zoo, very cheap entrance!. We went to this zoo this last week and it was beautiful, situated on a hill with lots of different animals, The little baby elephant is really cute :)The only thing which was a pity was that a lot of animals where still inside in April.Which ofcourse is understandable but I think the zoo would be even better if you go a little later in the year when all the animals are outside.We really loved this zoo and will be back!

Well worth a visit . Went to Prague zoo for the day. Very cheap to get in. Set in a huge site!! So privileged to see the week old baby elephant - he's gorgeous! The animals all look so well looked after with great surroundings. Food / drink in restaurant was lovely and pretty cheap. Wear comfy shoes as you will do a LOT of walking! Really enjoyed the day

Interesting. There are so many animals to see there. We've been in the zoo for 5 hours and we didn't manage to see everything. Bad point is that Zoo is closing at 18:00 but the first available bus after the closure for the metro station was only 45 minutes later!

Sad Animals. The zoo was ok! It had a lot of animals which was great and super super cheap. Some of the larger animals were inside, not sure that was due to it being cold but some of the inside habitats were very small and animals looked sad and were pacing back and forth.

One of the best zoos I have been to.. Before visiting, I read a Prague travel guidebook which said that the zoo is trying to catch up with the rest of Europe's zoos. The truth is the opposite. Other zoo's have a lot to learn from Prague zoo. The zoo is situated on a hill which gives a good opportunity to create diverse and natural conditions for the animals. The fact that they have so many new born animals, show that the animals have very good conditions. I went to the zoo by boat which might have been a bit more expensive but it took me very conveniently straight from my hotel to the zoo and back. Return trip with the boat cost 290 czk. Entrance to the zoo was 200 czk.

Huge zoo with plenty to see. This zoo is in my opinion one of the best in Europe. Compared to other places it is huge and it will take the whole day to see it all and you will be wasted at the end. You wont make it all with smaller kids. I recommend to buy tickets online and use the side entrance as the main tends to ger overcrowded.

Big Zoo, Small Entrance Fee with Lots to See and Do. Adults are 200czk and kids 150czk and it deserves a full day visit to appreciate the size and variety of animals there.Not particularly busy even though they had some new arrivals such as a baby elephant and meercats.I visited here about 8 or 9 years ago and the investment since then in elephant enclosure and penguin aquarium is noticable.I've seen people mention a petting area but I couldn't see or find it.Fast food was reasonably priced however, I had the goulash which was a bit fatty.
Well worth the visit.. Brilliant for a day out. Good value and easy to get to on public transport. Animals look extremely well cared for. The chair lift is fun.
Amazing Zoo with wonderful animals. Don't miss going to the Prague Zoo while in Praguethe Zoo has a great collection of animals and you will surely enjoy watching the monkeys and apes :)

Lovely Zoo. Quite a characteristic way of establishing a zoo. Wide variety of fauna in very inventive environments. The animals had exceptionally good room to roam around...Highly recommendable even for adults without kids

Beautiful . I read a lot of good reviews about this zoo..so I went there..it was nice , the zoo is very big and they are opening new areas ..maybe to fit more animals.the bad side was that I found it to big for the ammount of animals with plenty of birds and not very much reptilian or big animals.

Best place to visit in Prague. The zoo is simply amazing, tickets are not expensive at all, very clean and well organized. Variety of Animals, best way to spend 2 to 3 hours without getting bored in a such gothic city.The only drawback is that they close by 6:00 pm which is too early and the park is not recommended during winter, all animals are in their pavilion.

Probably the best Zoo I've been to!. This place is a GREAT day out! It's quite far out from the city centre, but easily accessible by public transport (we took an uber for about 260kc). Entry is 200kc for adults, and family and discounted tickets are available for families and children. This place is HUGE! every time we thought we'd seen everything, we'd find another building or enclosure we hadn't even noticed yet. Some enclosures such as the bird ones were accessible to walk through, and it was almost like being in a real forest. There was a dark area where fruit bats fly freely over your head, which was cool, but pretty terrifying as they can get quite close!There are so many animals to see! including animals I had never seen up close before, including hippos, and alligators. These enclosures had large glass windows next to the water so you could see them swimming! Managed to get up close to the tigers and lions because they were so close to the glass, surreal experience. There are plenty of resturants (cannot comment on these as we didnt use them and all menus were in Czech) and plenty of toilet facilities. This is a FULL day out, we were there around 5 hours and didnt make it all the way round before closing time! Your legs are definitely gonna hurt after walking round this!Only complaint is that the polar bear enclosure is FAR too small for 3 polar bears, they looked SO bored and it was quite distressing to see them just pacing up and down. This definitely needs to be addressed.

No wonder they say best in Europe. The zoo in Prague is lovely. Their enclosures are simply amazing and the animals look well cared for and are wide in variety. We didn't have much time so targeted the animals we most wanted to see but that said I think we covered most of the zoo in the 3 hours we were there. The rainforest bit is excellent. I have been to Blackpool zoo and Barcelona zoo and this zoo wins hands down as the best I have seen just for the authenticity and size of the enclosures and the created habitats for the animals. Was a lovely trip out.
So much to see!. Lovely day out, many species I'd never seen before, and it seems they make a good effort with the exhibits. Cheap tickets too!
Great zoo. This zoo was absolutely huge, with so many animals to see, could have easily spent the whole day there! The Polar bears especially were amazing
Amazing day out. This is a must if you go to Prague. It is a massive zoo. There are even polar bears. The cable car down is brilliant a bit scary though. Loved this place could easily stayed longer.

Great . I am from Prague and I went to Zoo with my friends from England a there baby!They and I loved it!Prices are great .entrance is 200 kc and is worth it!nice restaurant with a good prices too!We where there whole day and you all should go there!you know is one of the most beautiful Zoo!!

Fantastic zoo . Fantastic zoo - well kept with big enclosures for the animals. Is a big site and requires a lot of up hill walking - especially when the chair lift isn't working! Definitely worth a visit. Entry very reasonable priced. Food and drink were plentiful and reasonably priced. Got the metro and then bus 112 - no trouble at all. Would highly recommend.

Nice Monday at the Prague's ZOO. You shouldn't miss this, I believe one of the ten best ZOO rated in world. I would only avoid the restaurant on top of the hill (rozhledna) confusing ordering and pick-up of the food - the burger was good but the chicken tortilla awful!

Linger after closing hours... and fresh baby elephant!. I’m a regular visitor to the wonderful ZOO Praha and I’m glad to see so many visitor’s reviews enthusiastic about it. I can see that even many of the mentioned negatives are only misunderstandings caused by the particular impression of only one visit, or by judging animal‘s conditions superficially not aware they are different from humans and have different needs. There’s no doubt the zoo is on the highest professional level; the proof is number of newly born animals, of both common and very rare species, some of them only few institutions in the world are able to breed. This is possible only grace to perfect care and know-how and ardour from the breeders. The visitors can notice that almost every species lives in group or a pair or the male and female live separatedly and are put together in time of making and breeding babies, according to their nature. Several months ago there were in the reviews some displeasure about the anteaters being „evidently“ stressed and thus poorly cared about. But in fact they were the young pair expecting their first baby, so they really were rather nervous and irritated about this; nevertheless the baby was born and his mother, although unexperieced, cares well about him. The animals live their real lives in the zoo, they are not perfect pictures from National Geographic; one of the polar bears is mother bear Bora, who doesn’t like water – really! That’s why her fur is so shabby (the keepers wash her with hose every now and then). One of the tigers is elderly lady with occasional health inconveniences, so she has right to look not perfectly animated and rather sad. There is much speaking about tiger‘s enclosures being very small – but you should noticed that every cell has open doors to two neigbouring cells and also to inner, not visible utility rooms; and the tigers have their turn in outer enclosure, alone or in groups according to their relations. The big cats house is comparatively new and convenient enough to make home for first group of indian lions brought directly from India to the european zoo after decades; this could never be possible if people from India were not sure about high level of care and conditions in the Prague zoo. By the way, tigers and other species pacing to and fro is not necessarily mark of their stress – it’s natural for them to walk a lot, for in wild they go every day some distance round the borders of their hunting areal. Also the real biotop-like design of the inner enclosures, even though it makes great impression on us people, is not so important for the animals as the way they can profit from its arrangement – animal used to sleep or relax at elevated place just need the place and don’t care so much about if it’s made of concrete and has grey or whatever colour; the species differs in specific needs of temperature, hideaway, way of obtaining food, care about paws or hoofs and many, many other things which we visitor cannot know. A good exemple is old row of bird cages mentioned in some older reviews as the negative point – yes, they were squares with dark bares and this evoked a prison in human mind; but grace to their favourable position on the sunny southern slope there were very good conditions for exotic birds which were flourishing there; that’s why one of the cages will be preserved for remembrance although the completely new bird house is being built. The animal behaviour is different than human – some people thing gorillas being very bored and badly cared for they lie about a lot; but they really are very lazy – its natural for them to sleep or relax most of the day, for their strategy of earning food is only eat everything around them without waste lot of energy, in contrast to chimpanzees who work hard to earn energetically rich food. Also gorillas sometimes eat their own excrements for there are still quite a lot of undigested leaves - and its near. They can do it in zoo as well and it’s no mark of their hunger. I wish every visitor of the Prague Zoo were sure that the animals are on the first place there and enjoy his/her visit maximally :-) And don’t let yourself worry about the closing hour – it is possible to linger much longer only the inner houses are closing. I stay often half hour or more after the closing and it’s no problem, the exit is still open. And if you are still hesitate about visiting zoo, be sure that there are several days old elephant baby, some weeks old hippo baby, anteater baby, tapir babies, aardvark baby and much much more babies, eggs and adults waiting for you! :-)

Worth the effort to visit. Bit of a journey to get there, but a 24 tram followed by 112 bus gets you right to the gate. Cheap entrance - about £6 and very well set-out on a hill-side. Lots to see. Top tip = take a photo of the map on your phone, then refer to that as you go. Start up hill and work your way through Sumatra to Africa, then have a break in the restaurant or cafe. Continue round the hill and down to see the impressive gorilla pavilion and finish with penguins and sea lions. All-in-all a great value-for-money half day which could easily have been a full day.

AmaIng. Really enjoyed our day out at Prague zoo. Loads of animals and beautifully laid out. Cheap to eat and drink here, don't be fooled by other zoo's prices. Only paid 45 csz for a baguette and 30 csz for a bottle of water.
Best zoo iv been to . Been to quite a few zoos around EUR this is my favourite the polar bears are amazing. This zoo also has a very impressive breeding program, this means lots of cute baby animals.

Good for Kids.... Our children enjoyed the zoo as it has many animals and well kept... entrance is cheap but it's far from town so take a tram or a reputable cab. quite lot to walk but worth once a visit. Would say Dino park more educative if you want to choose between these two...

good value. we took our two year old daughter and she loved it so much we went again 2 days later. It's big and spacious and very reasonably priced and, as long as you can your mind off the fact these magnificent creatures are confined all year round, a very worthwhile visit.
Wouldn't bother with the train ride though, rather dull
Awesome zoo!. Great zoo with so many people exhibits. Took a cab from old town square for about 300 crown. Daughter loved it.

Very Big. We visited Prague Zoo for a few hours as we had some time to kill before we could check in to our hotel.We only had hand luggage and the zoo has large lockers so this was ideal!All of our bags fitted in 1 locker, which was handy.The price of entry is very cheap! Only around £5!!We went to the restaurant first and the prices in there were also very reasonable.The Zoo itself is very big and there are a lot of animals, we found that if you didn't see an animal outside then you would most likely see it if you went to the indoor enclosures.All in all a very good Zoo.

Loads to see, comparatively cheap. This zoo has a huge number of animals and very reasonably priced (tickets for adults cost 200). As others have mentioned, the zoo is not very well signposted; however, we had no trouble in finding it. The zoo is quite far from the old city and takes time to get there if you are not driving. There are loads of toilets and cafes dotted throughout the zoo. I would say that the enclosures for the large animals were very small.

As good as zoos get. Firstly, entry to this zoo is excellent value. We paid less than £20 for entry of a family of four- if this attraction was in the UK, you would pay upwards of £60. Although we didn't eat there, we bought a double-scoop ice-cream for just over £1. Similarly, in the UK this would likely cost over £3. Once in, enclosures for animals were spacious and animals seemed well cared for - very few moral dilemmas to be had. The quantity of animals is vast, and includes tigers, elephants, giraffes, penguins etc. You can also get very close to the animals- a handspan from a (behind glass!) tiger or a half-foot from a penguin. In part, this is because the zoo is not overcrowded (our visit was over the Easter holidays). All in all, this is the best zoo we've been to.

so much to see. we went via boat to the zoo, the only thing that i would say could be improved is signage to tell you how to get to the zoo as there isnt much in the town, just follow the buses. its a massive zoo with lots and lots to look at.

Best zoo we have been to!. Been to quite a few zoos, but this one was just brilliant, so many animals and lots of vending machines and places to get drinks and lots of toilets. The zoo was very cheap to enter more than half less than what you pay for zoos in the UK. The only thing l say is lots of walking everything is spread out so wear comfy shoes, also, we got underground and walked rest of way, what a mistake took lots of stress to find zoo nearly gave up until heard birds to our relief we found it!!!! Definitely get transport too difficult to find otherwise. Great zoo.:)
A nice zoo. Well worth the Visit.. My family has had a long tradition of visiting zoo's all over Europe. This is definately among the top ten in Europe.

Absolutely Brilliant! . We decided to visit the zoo, so found our way there buy subway and bus.Not having been to a zoo for some time we did not expect much.We were impressed by how close we could get to the animals and how well they were looked after.The whole of the large site was very well kept and sign posted. The entrance fee of about £7 was extremely good value compared to attractions back home so if you haven't been to a zoo then choose this one!

Massive zoo! Not many visitors, great animals!. One point less for the simple reason that there was not enough space provided for the big cats :) One of the tiger's was walking back and forth in sheer agony wanting to get out (felt his pain!). Other than that we had lots of fun. Restaurant was okay, schnitzel was good, fries a bit old.

Great animals but small enclosures :(. The zoo is great for the range of animals it has and how it's over a large area which makes it a full day trip out :-) However, some of the enclosures animals were in were very small (especially the Tigers) which was very sad to see. A lot of the animals were pacing and could tell they weren't happy.

It was ok. We went to prauge zoo by metro.then catch an bus straight to the zoo.not an lot to see as they was doing a lot of work in the zoo didn't see many aminals as they was closed,wont be going back there

Czech home of animals. ZOO in Prague can be proud for the amount of animals they have and is definitely competitive worldwide. Suitable both for children with many of attractions and adults, ZOO offers nice and healthy environment for animals with huge selection of what to see there. I couldn't get through all the sections just during one day.

This Zoo really worths the money!. I've been here in our last day in Prague.
This is a really big zoo, with lots of animals and really nice exhibitions.
Allow you at least 2 hours for covering the entire zoo.
There are also nice tourist facilities and small kioshks with food and snacks.
We really enjoyed this walk!

Just Amazing. This was just fantastic, spent over 6 hours in here, for a zoo it was really cheap it worked out to be roughly £6.00 per person. We went on a snowy day and it was nice that you could go inside to where the animals sleep and still see them. They all looked like they were well cared for.It is very big so expect a lot of walking and the map isnt that easy to follow.

A sad visit. The Prague zoo may be an exciting place for many people since there are a lot of different animals here, unfortunately it was not a pleasant visit for me.The animals don't have much space. Especially sad was seeing an elephant with so little space that he had to stand in his own excrements. Tigers and lions, animals that need running and a lot of space for a good life, were closed in a small space where they just went around the whole time.I went to this zoo because I read that it's one of the best ones in the world, but it definitely doesn't look like it. This visit only made me mad and I regret going here.
Nice place. We spend a full day at the ZOO but it was nice to see all the animals and make some sport. We really enjoined seeing the hippopotamus playing with his baby.

Wonderful!. The Zoo was amazing! Lot of animals to see,which live in very nice areas. We spend 5 hours in the zoo. You need this time to see everything, because you have to walk around a lot. The zoo is so huge and really nice :-) we recommend it to everybody who would like to see something different from the city.
One of the most beautiful ZOO in the world. I have visited few ZOOs around the world and this is one of the best. If you want to spend nice day outside, choose this ZOO.

Top zoo. . Had a wonderful day here in Easter Monday. The weather was sunny and wonderful and all the animals were out enjoying it. Obviously it is a zoo so some of the animals are in what appears to be slightly small enclosures but the zoo is doing what it can for endangered species. Also some restaurants were not open at this time of year which somewhat pushed out plan! Top tip is find out in advance the feeding schedule and make a route based on that.

doing well. the zoo was flooded in i think 2011 and suffered a lot of damage ,since then lots of work has been undertaken and a good breeding programme in place,lots of new animal houses amazing giraffe house.good value for money entrance only 200 krona adult.

Very pleasant and complete Zoo. Lots of animals and the facilities are in very good condition.
Easy to move around and lots of directions everywhere. Top

Average Zoo. Prague Zoo is supposed to be one of the best in the world but in reality is not. It is truly a big Zoo in extension but not in the amount of animals shown.Price is acceptable, ask for the family price.In regards to services in the Zoo, those are quite weak and all only in Czech and nothing in English for a tourist attraction in a city with 7 Mio visitors per year. Much to improve in this, I.e. all signs are in Czeck, all restaurants only show the menus in Czech, etc.In summary a place to go if you have a day too much in the city but not worth going there per se.
A beautiful location. This zoo is well laid out. On a warm day it would be a beautiful place to visit. Was colder when we went so many of the animals weren't visible. Well worth a look

Shocking Animal Welfare. Absolutely heartbreaking to see the unacceptable enclosures and conditions certain animals were kept in such as Polar bears, Hippopotamus', Elephants, birds of prey, and exotic birds to name a few. It was clear to see that these animals had gone insane through sheer boredom and awful treatment, this is shown by the animals constantly swaying their heads and carrying out repetitive movements over and over again in their tiny enclosure. This is just another example of human greed, and I'm so disappointed that I have contributed to this behaviour continuing.

Amazing place - massive - more animals than any other zoo - quite too.. Loved our day here. Its massive. It just keeps going and going. You get closer to the animals than anywhere else. Its cheap at only £6 each. Easy to get to, on the metro and the 112 bus. And its quite so no pushing or queues unlike Chester zoo where its so busy you see nothing.GO go got to go here.
Super. It was really Nice ..but need to Walk a lot. Its great for both kids n adults. Food is also reasonable n available at diff places. Worth a visit with kids
Huge & full of a variety of soecies. Such a fantastic zoo - home to several different species and a real place to explore! Worked out to be roughly £6 entry free per adult too! Brilliant!
A nice way to spend the day. Arrive early, because the zoo is massive and there is so much to see, and it closes quite early. It took us approx. 5 hours to see everything. Definitely worth a visit!

Good value for money. We spend 5 hours at the Zoo - 2 adults + 1 teenager, the entrance fee is very low compared to the time we spend here, we only left due to the park closed. The zoo is very different from those we have seen elsewhere. The level difference was used to show, mountain climbing animals, climbing mountains and the savanna animals in the flat area. The windows into the animals were clean making it possible to take nice photos. We ate in the Oceán Restaurant, which had good prices - 145 kronar for a beef-ragout with potato gnotti. You could get the standard french frittes, but we wanted a real meal and had a good experience. The park itself is for 4½ - the additional ½ is due to the standard at the restaurent.

Zoo. This Zoo is a must in prague!! It is amazing. The zoo is very cheap easy to get too and worth the money. It was fun but it is alot of walking as the zoo is huge!!! The polar bears are amazing and one even comes upto the window when swimming which gives time to capture a great photo. It is worth a see just because the zoo is amazing with a large variety of animals. Would visit again

Smashing Zoo, happy animals, a great morning out. We visited Prague Zoo on the second day of our stay. We got there by taking an Uber cab, as the public transport route didn't seem very straightforward. First thing that amazed us was the cost of the tickets - equivalent of about £6 for me and £4.50 for my daughter using her student card. The zoo is very well laid out although some steep hills which could be a bit of a problem for anyone with mobility difficulties. All of the animals had good enclosures and plenty of space. We did notice one of the polar bears seemed to be doing quite a bit of pacing about which I suppose could have meant s/he wasn't happy - but the other one seemed contented and they had plenty of space, so not really sure. All of the other animals seemed very happy and active. We especially loved the gorillas and felt privileged to see a baby very close up with its mother. We only ate chips and had drinks in the cafe so can't comment really on food quality but again it was very reasonably priced. The zoo isn't massive but we spent about 4 hours there before we'd seen everything and thoroughly enjoyed it. There were a couple of large school groups (teenagers) and a smaller group of younger children. All of them were impeccably behaved - no pushing and shoving as we're used to at London Zoo - a credit to their schools actually.

Prague Zoo. Great day out and all for approx £5 per person. So much to see and plenty of places to take a breather as it's quite steep in places and spread out. Take the tram and get the No 112 bus which takes you right to the door.

Prague ZOO. One of the best ZOO I've ever visited. Very good facilities for habitats. Large terrain so you'll spend all day there. Better to have a map, because it's easy to get lost and miss something interesting. There are some cafes, but they are quite far from each other ;) In many cases it's possible to be very close to animals.The ticket is 300 czk for adults.

One of the top ones in the world. I just love it there, each time I come there is something new and the whole place has an amazing spirit. It is worth of visiting, no doubt. Just get ready for a lot of walking around if you wanna see a lot, as it is quite large. There is an old school lift which I never used as I am afraid of heights but it saves you a trip uphill, so go for it. Bats flying around your head is quite an experience also. So over all , yes, yes, yes.....
Charming ZOO. We recommend spending a day in this charming spot among a variety of animals from all over the world. What´s more, you can dodge crowds of tourists and mingle with locals.

Superb zoo, great facilities for the animals and set over a vast amount of land. As London Zoo members we were intrigued to find what the zoo would be like as it was widely trailed as the 4th best in the world...Well the answer was it is superb. To start with it is huge and you have to be prepared to do a good deal of walking and cope with plenty of hills as it must rise up the valley side by 300 feet. I think it had disabled access but how good and how universal I couldn't swear to. So, it's big and you will fully fill 6 hours - well we did. It has a vast array of animals - all the usual suspects and many we hadn't come across before (an Ocelot springs to mind). But the facts that it was diverse wasn't the most impressive thing to me. What was impressive was that the animals, by and large, were very well housed with many obvious opportunities for enrichment. The highlight for me was the Orangutan exhibit, large, lots for the animals to do and in the appropriate climate. Just brilliant. Elephant enclosure also springs to mind as being very good. The vast majority were excellent - the only exception to me being the Polar Bear, but beyond the needs for conservation you have to question whether these animals should be in Zoos at all. However I digress, this is a a Must Visit IMO if you visit Prague. Getting there can be a bit tricky re public transport as you need a combination of trams and buses to be there. As we wanted to see animals not public transport we went for a cab from city center at 420 crowns each way. Easier and takes just 25 mins or so. The zoo are in the process of upgrading the Red Panda enclosure (my personal favorite) and look forward to seeing them the next time we visit Prague. Also don't be put off by the Zoo web site, it's very basic and in no sense does the Zoo justice, just get there and you won't regret it.

A must see!. Had such a perfect time in the Prague zoo that we stayed until closing time. I can definitely see what all the hype is about - this is by far the best zoo I've been in. I think most animals have large enough areas and they usually don't live alone, but with at least two other of the same species.I've seen a comment about the OCD behavior of the male elephant. When we were there, he was doing the same thing, but with another member of the herd - they were standing together and rocking like they were dancing. All 7 of them were outside together and we watched them go from one side to the other as a herd, then train the young one to use the trunk and we've also seen the baby play with the hanging ball.

All day enjoying with many many many different animals. From Africa to Antarctica, it is possible to see the different animals all over the world. Since it is reallllllllllly big area, I recommend to spend all the day there, and give a lunch break in one of the restaurants there, and enjoy the day by taking tons of pictures.One thing I really like a lot there, in one area you can feel bats flying around you and see them eating their food. Yes they are free, not in a cage :)

The zoo was a great day out!. Coming from Australia there were very obvious differences between the zoos at home and this one. The biggest difference was that the Prague Zoo had little to few barriers between you and the animals. In Australia all the exhibits are super safety conscious and it takes away from the up close and personal experience with the animals. It blows my mind that dogs are welcome in the Zoo, but owners are asked to not have them up against the glass of the Lions and polar bear exhibit as to not incite these carnivors. The giraffes were beautiful, the leopard youngsters play fighting with each other on a grassy hill and the sheer size of the polar bears where mind blowing. Food and drinks are very cheap at the zoo restaurants, service is fast. The gorillas were very entertaining, we even saw one eat her own faeces, this is common apparently

Amazing Zoo. Up in the hills this has great views of the city and was very cheap for 2 adult tickets.Would of been greta had we had the little one here as there was loads to see a good 3 hours walking worth. Highlight was the penguins making love, the mountain goats fighting on the hill side and the daddy hippo swimming around looking after his wife and baby. Very close access to all the big cats and walk through with bats and birds added authenticity to the experience. Would definitely recommend to couples and families and good walking shoes would be recommended also.
INCREDIBLE. Visit this place during the summer and it will be amazing!So many animals with brilliant viewing capabilities!I can see why this zoo is so highly rated!

Best zoo ever. Went here last week with my girlfriend with a alot of anticipation and I lived up to it and more! Brilliant Zoo and good viewing and chance to get very close to animals and opportunities for photo. Took us about 4 hours to walk around. Only about £4 per person which was brilliant! Highly recommended to anyone

Amazing!. We are a couple and we visited Prague Zoo almost a month ago. It was a very beautiful day! We had the chance to see a plethora of animals in an excellent physical environment. Almost all the species have a very large place and the entrance fee is also good. You have to buy a map (It's very cheap) because the area is huge and unfortunately the signals aren't in English. I suggest it, especially in families! So bring your camera and comfortable shoes and enjoy your day in Prague zoo!

Nice zoo. Considering a day pass costs around 200czk,which is what 6,7 quid?, this zoo is pretty good value for money. Plenty to see and a large zoo to look round. Some of the animals were inside or sleeping so was difficult to see them and I have to say some of the enclosures really should be bigger. However we spent several hours here today and really enjoyed our visit.

A HUGE zoo and a good 1 day activity for families with children.. We've been to the zoo 3 times, the last time was with both our children. They have free pullcarts for families at the entrance. It has been modernized a lot since our first visit some 9 years ago. It is very children friendly and accessible. The place is ENORMOUS and it will require a full day to enjoy all the different animals and kids activites. There are also many good playgrounds and eateries. For families with younger children this is a must.

Really good day out for the whole family. 1. Great outing2. Family friendly3. Amazing place4. good to take young kids5. Need a good pair of walking shoes and warm clothes6. If taking bus prepare ticket or loose change as shops outside WILL NOT help out7. Great train going round inside park but not all around

Great Zoo. We had a great time at Prague zoo it was much bigger than we thought and there was much more to see than expected. Great location and can understand why it is rated as one of the worlds top zoos. Wonderful day out and great value.

Something to see with or without kids.. This is the first thing we went to see when we went to Prague. This was something for my younger school aged child on our family trip. It was an extremely hot day but we loved it. People were friendly and spoke some English. Lots of attractions to see. There was even an area that had water misters which was refreshing. Great place to spend the day or just change things up for some of the younger kids. We spent a little more than half the day here. Lots of space to walk, a place for kids to play, along with plenty and affordable places to grab snacks. This zoo had some of the cleaner bathrooms that I have seen at any zoo. One highlight is the star walk with animal track/print of different animals. (Like the Walk of Fame in Hollywood).

Just go and make a day of it!. Prague Zoo was one of our main sights to see while in Prague, and what a great sight it was! Weather was nice with plenty of sunshine, we were up and about early enough to explore the whole zoo. Our hotel was in Mala Strana, and thanks to the great public transport system we got to the zoo in no time. On a Thursday morning around 10am we didn't have to queue at all. There was some kind of storage boxes and carts for those with more bags, we had no need for those so no idea if those were free of charge.The Zoo is divided in upper and lower part and we had just enough time (7 hours) to walk through both parts, have some coffee and snacks and even sit down and watch some animals minding their daily business. There is a lot of hills to climb, and we didn't find any simple route to walk, bearing in mind that we wanted to see everything.At some point it felt like we had seen some animals at least three times, just because we tried to find certain spots.All animals seemed healthy. The only thing that caught my eye was their only male elephant, he was separated from other elephants and he had some OCD-like behaviour e.g. he was rocking himself from side to side. As far as I'm aware of elephants as species, they are social animals and they need physical contact to other elephants. That is not possible there, as the male is separated from others with electrical fences and a massive gate.Also bats flying free in the Indonesian Jungle exhibit are something I don't approve - one bat got himself hit by a fellow visitor, as it is human instinct to hit something flying towards you in darkness. Just for the bats' sake, please give them a terrarium!Otherwise the Zoo is a really nice place with staff members making sure some animals with babies were given the peace they needed. Some signs about animals were only in Czech, some had a few words in English too. A little more information in English would'e been great. I don't know if they had some guidebooks in English available, as I didn't expect to need one in one of the most popular tourist attraction in Prague.Families with children seemed to enjoy their time too. There is some picnic areas, a few restaurants, vending machines, a lot of benches to sit back and relax, at least one café etc, so you won't be hungry or thirsty. Prices were reasonable, which was surprising as usually that kind of attractions try to make as much money as possible since there is no options to go and buy food and drinks outside the Zoo and come then back. There are toilets and baby changing facilities too, and no matter where in the area you are, you'll find a toilet sooner than later. All restaurant and café toilet facilities are also available free of charge.
Great day out . I visited the zoo with my boyfriend and had a fantastic day out. Great walks and views and a wide variety of animals to see!

Great zoo, definitely worth a visit. Compared to British zoos, Prague zoo is not only enormous but also very cheap. Despite the low price, it has good size enclosures, tons of space and a great range of animals to visit. If you're in Prague do take the time to visit!

Really nice Zoo Experience. The Zoo of Prague is really nice, lot to see and discover. From the free flying bats to the running track to see how fast you are compared to the animals - one of a kind and also nice price (around 8€'s) - highly recommended!

Fantastic zoo. Absolutely marvellous. I particularly enjoyed the gorilla enclosure - the glass is so clear, and you're so close to them.I'll admit that at my age I didn't try climbing the hill to the large enclosures, but there's plenty to see at the bottom level. Including two birds I've never seen before - wide beaks, and I thought they were statues - u till one started flying. And at my age, it only cost 1 Kc to go in! Astonishing.

Best and largest zoo in Europe!. Awesome, romantic, inovative, modern, with heart. This zoo is one of the best in the world and for me best in Europe! Our zoo has changed owner few years ago and since then it's just better and better, full of inovations and with a mission!

Absolutely massive!!!. This zoo is 4th in the world for a reason!!! Absolutely huge! Enclosures were mainly lovely and large and natural which was nice to see. Animals seem to be well cared for and very content. So much to do and see, we spent the best part of a day trying to navigate around it! Some very steep hills/ stairs and uneven paths so wear sensible shoes! All in all a great day and very worth the money! (200czk per adult). Would highly recommend!!!

The largest and best ZOO in Czech republic. Location, animals, in-ZOO actions and attractions, information, transport... everything is set perfectly. You can spend a whole day here if you want to. If you can, go early and see everyday Animal feeding schedule - pick what interests you. On weekends ZOO is very crowdy. Tickets for adults around 150,- CZK. After ZOO I recommend a walk east ~300m and across the river to the most famos city's park Stromovka. Or, go up to the hill behind the ZOO 300m and visit Botanical garden.
Very Recommended. The Zoo is very big and has a large amount of animals, familier one and also weird and exotic one.Me and my friends very enjoyed the zoo and it's very easy to get there.

One of our best experiences ever. The world's 4th best zoo according to tripadvisor. We had a fantastic day there what we will never forget!! It was definitely one of the best places in Prague. I suggest you to spend there at least 5-6 hours to see everything :)

Good to visit with family. You can spend whole day over there. Good fun for children. . Big with lot's of animals. Good to visit at summertime where is shows as well. Lot's of caffees and toilets which is good as you are going to be there few hours.
Large zoo!. Tons of different animals and a really great layout! It is spread out and can be quite a walk though!
good relax day. a long walk but its animals and grabbing a beer is always nice, however the kids there were all wildly out of control? not sure why?

Wonderful visit. The biggest zoo I gave ever been too. And the majority of the animals looked happy in their surroundings. Some animals had to be found as there were inside and outside spaces. Loved the giraffe enclosure but they were all kept inside whilst we were there. The elephants were amazing to see up close. Nothing felt crammed in like they seem to be in the UK. I've been to Twycross and Yorkshire wildlife and Praha Zoo seemed much kinder on the animals.

Truly Impressed.. We love zoos and we were pleasantly and unexpectedly surprised and how good this zoo was. Clean and animals appear well maintained with modern holding/display areas. Most impressive were the number of rare animals that we've never seen or heard of before. This is a must for bird and animal lovers. Great opportunities for photos and able to get up and close. Many animals in hiding because of cold and zoo undergoing some renovations at the moment but didn't detract from this world class zoo!!

Huge and varied but some stressed out animals :(. I wish I could give it more points- as zoos go this one is great, absolutely huge with an interesting layout, massive variety of animals, but at least 8 or so of the exhibits had animals stressed out and pacing, obsessive bar chewing etc etc.

Fun and cheap day out. Not all the animals were around, probably due to the cold weather but they seemed very well looked after. Large zoo-we were there for 4 hours and didn't see it all. Incredibly cheap entry and easy to get to via public transport from anywhere in Prague.

the best zoo I've ever seen!. If you go to visit Prague, spend one day to visit the zoo! all the habitats are recreated in a perfect way not only from the point of view of the visitors bus especially for the animals that seems very happy to be there.
Huge zoo. If you like animals and nature you have to spend half of your day there. The variety was great and if you are lucky you will see the seal's show. Just adorable! 150cz the reduced ticket .

BRILLIANT. I have a huge passion to visit zoo's all over the world. This has so far been the best one. The enclosures were huge and there was tonns of space for the animals to roam around. none of the enclosures felt like cages and all were very open and there was plenty of things to keep the animals occupied. I would love to come back here in the summer to see how beautiful it is then. even though it was a cold day we still saw plenty and spent a good 3-4 hours walking around. Alot of it is up hill so not ideal for people with walking difficulties. they also allow you to bring your dog and let them wander around too. great day out for all and lots to see. highly recommend and would love to go back soon.

Zoo. We had an enjoyable day at the zoo. The zoo is massive but very spread out and located on a very steep hillside so it might not be suitable for the less active. We managed this ok though and was worth it as we saw animals that we have never seen before. The animals were in quite large enclosures which were very clean and they looked well looked after and we're very active at this time of year

Best zoo i have ever visited!. This visit was one of the most enjoying things we have done in Prague! Although it was winter, we have seen there many animals that we will not find somewhere else easilly. Our little son also loved it a lot! There were available strollers to use for free if you had a little child, and that helped us a lot when he got tired of walking. We strengtly recommend it!

Great. We visited the zoo yesterday with another couple and really enjoyed it! I've been to zoos allover the world and this was easily one of the biggest and best. The only thing it could do with is more signage in English. It's a bargain to get in at 200kc which is so worth the money for what you see. It wasn't packed with people which meant we could go at our own pace but all agreed it would be even better in the warmer months . A must see in Prague.

The place is huge! Prepare for a lot of walking.. Been there twice, each time spent more than 4 hours there - didn't manage to see it all in any of those times. Planning tips: 1. bring a camera with full battery and empty memory/ spare films; 2. wear good shoes; 3. if possible, visit in the autumn - summer's too hot for some animal and they hide, winter's too cold for some others, and in spring most are busy with other matters and can be quite moody.

Beautiful spring walk in a beautiful Prague ZOO. I was born in Prague in 1989 and since that, I have been visiting ZOO every year or two - first with my great parents and parents, later with friends and nowadays with my boyfriend. During this period, the ZOO has rises from the dust to a heaven, it is modern, nice and tidy, with an huge number od newly renovated pavilons. There is plenty places where you can get a snack or a drink and playground for children as well. I read in magazine, that Prague ZOO is one of the four best ZOOs in the world. Comparing to another european ZOOs which I had visited and the NYC one, Prague ZOO is the best for sure!
The best ZOO. This is the best zoo! It is very big, clean and very careful for animals. Very interesting for family trip. Elephants and gorillas are worth seeing!

Great day. I walked along the river to get to the zoo. Great views.Zoo very clean and loads to see. It may be difficult to push a wheelchair or pushchair up the side of the hill to get to the wolves etc. Plenty to see and do

Best zoo we've been to!!. Wow! This zoo is really amazing (and cheap! Around 400CZK for a couple.). We didn't expect it to be this large and well built.There is a huge variety of animals from many different areas around the world, and they're divided into sections according to their origin.We went to the zoo expecting to be there 2-3 hours, and we stayed for around 4.5 hours! We went during the winter (in the snow) and even though some of the animals were locked away due to the cold, we didn't feel like we missed out.It was an amazing experience, suitable for all ages, in all seasons, highly recommended.

A modern, well designed ZOO. If you have a lot of time in Prague, especially if you enjoy visiting ZOO on your travels, give it try. ZOO is well run, their Gorila area is very nice and there are many other areas you will enjoy. You can take a chair lift up to the hill (if you are not affraid). There is restaurant just in front of the entrance, suitable for lunch. Across the street is Troia Chateau worth visiting. Short walk up the street you will find Botanical Garden. Easy city transportation (Metro and bus) all for one price of the ticket.. If you have even more time (and money) I highly recommend to take a boat from Rasinovo nabrezi all the way through the City and beautiful scenery, better than any sight-seeing tourist boats.

Best zoo I've been to.. I have been to Dublin Zoo, Belfast Zoo, London Zoo and a few on the Spanish Islands, but none come close to Prague Zoo. Some of the animals I seen I never knew existed. We went at the end of February so the Zoo was very quiet. I would recommend arriving early as it is so easy to spend the entire day there and miss a lot of things. We spent 6 hours there and missed almost a quarter of the animals.

4th best zoo in the world!. The Zoo (4th best zoo in the world!) is landscaped as a park, so it’s rather a walk among animals than a walk besides cages. There are over 650 species of animals: polar bears, penguins, zebras, wolves, gorillas, cheetahs, panthers, tigers, elephants, giraffes and the list continues until you begin to say „This is the largest zoo i have ever seen.” Prague Zoo is the second most visited destination in the Czech Republic after Prague Castle. It offers its visitors 12 pavilions, where they can become familiar with the variety of species of the animal kingdom, the popular Indonesian Jungle, African House, Gorilla Pavilion, Feline Pavilion, Elephant Valley, Hippo Pavilion and others among them… which offers the chance to see many animals in their natural habitate.

One of the best zoos I've visited! . Really good zoo with so many animals!! Probably the biggest zoo I've been to. It's really good value for money as well! All the animals seemed really happy and we had a really good day out! 2 or 3 hours is probably enough time to spend there

Fun day out for cheap. Superb day out even though a couple of animals eg birds werent in their cages? Possibly to do with the weather as we went in late february. All the big attractions however were there eg polar bear lion tiger etc
Awesome zoo. Awesome zoo with nice enclosures, most of the animals seem quite contented. The exhibit signs did not have english translations though

AMAZING. This Zoo is amazing! Unfortunately it rained all day but honestly it was so worth walking around in it! I would definitely advise anyone to go here, the whole place is beautiful and each section is made to look tropical or themed it's beautiful! I want to go back already!

Fantastic animals but a couple of things bothered us. We (my wife and I) visited Prague Zoo on 27 February. The animals are great and, essentially, that's what you're looking for in a zoo, hence the very good rating. A couple of things that let it down a little - the big cats didn't seem to have much room, I think they shared an out door area which seemed a little harsh. We're not suggesting it's cruel or anything though. Maybe due to the time of year, but I don't think there were any feeding shows - certainly nothing scheduled anyway. There was a general lack of staff around too. Hopefully this doesn't come across as overly critical though as we really enjoyed it and had a great day - it's cheap too!

Great value - easy to access via bus.. Fantastic value for money - tickets cost 200 CZK each for an adult (around £6 I think) and food/drink in the zoo is equally as cheap, makes a change from British zoos!On the whole, the animal enclosures were great and seemed to really cater for the particular animals - they largely had freedom to roam and climb etc which was nice to see!However, the elephants looked very bored, and a few of the larger animals seemed bored and under-stimulated which was sad to see, though this is the case in most zoo environments unfortunately.There are a few children's playgrounds dotted around, and plenty of things to see.

One of the best zoos around. Having come to prague for the weekend I ensured I came to see this zoo. It is simply outstanding. The diversity of wildlife is amazing with a real focus on the rarer species rather than just getting all the big showy ones. The paddocks on top of the hill are outstanding giving that African plains feel! Definitely one of the best zoos I have had the opportunity of seeing!

so many varieties of animals. The zoo is very lovely. this is a must attend location if you are in prague. We walked around the zoo and spent almost half a day. The zoo seems to be cleaned and well taken care of. and seems like the animals are in good health too. Lovely attraction

Great date in the zoo. So i thought i would be great idea to take my boyfriend to the zoo. We've never been there together and actually it was great . We had a long walk throughout the zoo and ended up having our lunch in the restaurant. Yes there's a restaurant in the zoo , many souvenir shops ... The place is clean and nice with lots of animals . We took tons of photos and had a really lovely time there. Highly recommended!

Amazing value, lovely zoo, wide range of animals.. Put aside a day to visit the zoo. Easily accessible via bus. There is a wide range of animals here, and the zoo is beautifully laid out. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit here, and for a zoological park, it was very cheap for admission.
Best zoo in Europe. It is a really amazing daylong experience. We were there with two kids of 4 and 7 and spent almost all day. Ani

Great day out. This I believe is one of the top Zoo's in the world, and I can quite believe it. Mind us being ove 70 helped as we only had to pay 1.ooCZK. for a wonderful day out. The Zoo is massive so you have to pace yourself. It is very well sign posted so no fear of getting lost. It was hard to know where to begin but we started with the polar bears which are beautiful. There is every type of animal and you can see they are very well cared for. What we did love was the giraffes they are such pretty animals and so graceful, Then there was the cheeky meercats one in particular was a right poser. We had coffee then started again. first stop was the tigers who are magnificent, there are two many animals to list but I think if you visit prague it should be on your list as what to see. We had lunch which was very reasonably priced and very tasty. there are plenty of facilities which are spotlessly clean. All in all we as two pensioners had a brilliant day out very tired but well worth it.
It was just good. We went there with our baby and she enjoyed,that we actually need.We have seen most of them but some of them were indoor because of the season I assume.

Awesome place definitely worth a visit! . This place is amazing and only 200ck (£6) entry fee. Be prepared to walk as it's massive but very well set out and you can get so close to the animals which all look very happy and content
Brilliant. Well worth a visit if your in Prague, a full day is probably required and good walking shoes. Excellent value for money and a great day out...

Amazing! . I am a massive zoo fan and this is by far one of the best zoo's I have ever visited! Be prepared for a bit of hilly walking, easy to get to if you know which metro's & busses to catch. The animals are fantastic and they don't seem depressed like they do in some zoo's in England!

Third best zoo in the world? It must have!!. Very beautiful zoo. Lots of pavilions with animals that you can browse and you're in close proximity to animals. Cableway. Train. I recommend to combine with a botanical garden. It is about 2 km from the zoo. You will need an extra day in Prague!
fantastic time. What a great day we had..... fantastic time animals were everywhere worth the entrance fee x we got a taxi from the hotel and backxx will definitely return xx

If it's good enough for Brad and Angelina.... Prague Zoo is large and you can easily spend the best part of the day there, (apparently Brad Pitt and Angelina were visitors here) we didn't see everything but still spent from 1.00pm to 5 there (it closes at 5pm). There are a couple of cafe's which serve hearty meals at very reasonable prices-( the hot stew was welcome on a cold day!)The tigers, monkey's and Polar bears are really impressive and the elephants but it was a bit sad to see them showing signs of major boredom and pacing around irritably. I think these magnificent beasts should been engaged more and have more stuff to do and interact with.We saw the otters being fed which made them active and entertaining. We missed the tigers and lions being fed so they were all asleep but we did see them close up indoors as well as outdoors. The elephants too didn't seem that happy but that might have been to do with some necessary segregation the zoo were implementing. Prague zoo is definitely worth visiting and making a day of it with the whole family, you can see all the major animals well and it is a pleasant location although a involves taking a 20 min bus from the centre of Prague.

I`d love to come back in summer.... My husband and I visited Prague Zoo in January 2016. We just had a couple of days in this beautiful city so we went by bus, metro and then another bus directly from the airport. After not much more than half an hour we arrived at the Zoo. Because of the snow and the cold weather lots of the animals were kept indoors. Still the gepards, the penguins, the flamingoes and lots of other majestic birds were out in the open. The absolute high point of our visit was the pavillion of the gorillas. There are not many humans that can visit the gorillas in the wild, so it is a blessing even to meet such characters in Prague Zoo. A very nice and informative young woman offered a lot of information about the different gorillas, especially about the silverback, - now aged around 28, he`d been a perfect father for a lot of gorilla babies. If you have the chance do visit this zoo.

Not recommended in the winter . We visited this place last week & was not a pleasant experience given the cold wind & rain which started about 20 minutes after arriving. The zoo was ok though it appeared a lot of the animals had gone into hiding with the cold weather as a lot of the enclosures were empty! Would probably come back in summer to see if it is more enjoyable. Easy to get there & back from the main tourist area. We got the metro from the Muzeum stop & then caught the 112 bus from outside the metro station at Nazdrazi Holesovice. Just buy a 32czk ticket each way (about £1) (coming back there is a bus ticket machine at the bus stop) & it's really easy. Just be careful of dodgy looking ppl on the metro & don't travel when it's dark.

Excellent Zoo. What more can I say, it's an excellent zoo. well set out, a good variety of animals, all have pretty nice natural areas and really quite cheap. When you compare this place to some where like London zoo you have to ask, how the hell can London charge what they do. This is on par with Berlin & Antwerp zoos, both places I've really enjoyed. Only thing it needs is more spiders and scorpions!!!!

The best zoo . We came here not expecting too much but this zoo really did surpass expectations. We had never seen some of these animals so close up before and it really felt like something special. It wasn't too busy and the zoo itself is set in a beautiful area over looking Prague. We got the train and bus to the zoo from the old town area and it was so easy and quick! Also very cheap, costing just a pound. The zoo was also reasonably priced. We had a fantastic time here and would highly recommend it

Best zoo ever. I visited the zoo with my boyfriend and it is the best zoo I have ever been, of course, it is a zoo, so the animals are not in their natural habitat but everything is clean and seem brand new. It is a must!

You get so close!!. We visited the Prague Zoo with high expectations having read a lot of positive reviews on-line and we were not disappointed! The enclosures are all designed to get you closer to the animals so there a number of walk-in enclosures for birds etc.Would 100% return!

Pampered Animals. This zoo shouldn't just be the 4th best zoo in the world; it should be the best! All of the many animals were very well looked after and looked so happy. Also, the chairlift was an unexpected surprise and so was the view from the top. If you ever go to Prague, make sure to come here.

Labyrinth of wonderful animals. The Prague Zoo is located quite far away from the main center but it's easy to get to once you know the Prague tube system. It's definitely worth a visit if you have the time, it's one of the best Zoos I've visited in a while. You do need a while to get through the zoo as it's a bit of a Labyrinth to see all the animals, I would recommend seeing all the big cats and the otters.

Beautiful. The Pragues Zoo is very beautiful. Entry and parking is very expensive. For child there is a many playgrounds and animal feed. Tour is on 4 - 6 hours. But we were there all day long. I recommend it.

Magic Prague ZOO. The ZOO is situated in a hilly and wooded Prague's Troja district, near the banks of the River Vltava - more than 50 hectares large (opened in 1931) and has almost 5000 animals. Very interesting are the Indonesian Jungle Pavilion where they behave Komodo dragons, sea lions pavilion, Monkey Island, as well as the hugely popular gorillas. For the second half of the zoo which is located on a hill above the river you can take the cable car, and there are, among others, runs the famous breeding of Przewalski's horses. Further I recommend to visit the area of elephants - almost safari and unique pavilion Čambal for gavials (or gharials) - one of the largest of all crocodilian species. Keep in mind that this is usually a day trip (zoo has several snacks) - the environment is very nice, especially the kids will surely love this trip (there are also several game sites for kids). Forbes magazine this zoo evaluated in 2008 as the 7th best zoo in the world (TripAdvisor in 2015, at the 4th place :-) !).

Great zoo. This was a great zoo with a wide variety of animals. You Need about 4 hours to walk around the whole zoo. Plenty of toilets and refreshment places scattered throughout. Great value for money.

Was not impressed. After reading reviews I was very disappointed , some of the animals had very little room and the elephants whilst we were there were in a small metal pen and did not look happy.
A lot of I closures were empty and the Hawks never had enough room to open there wings and fly up to tree perch.

Excellent . Loved this place ! Me and my sister went and we have never been so close to animals in our lives! Just a pane of glass between us, very cheap entry and friendly staff! Huge variety Of animals and lots of stands to buy food and drinks as you go along . Well laid out zoo with plenty of maps around the place. Would defiantly recommend and return again

Very pleasant day out.. Did not know Prague possessed this great zoo until informed by hotel receptionist,only to glad to say i took her advice.Excellent value and the number of animals on view quite astounding.Only meant to spend a short time but stayed over 5hours,think that says it all.
Fantastic place. If you don't like to be in a hurry, you can easily spend here a day. It's really worth visiting. One of the best places in Prague.

One of the best Zoos in Europe. One of the best zoos I've ever been to.We went off season so it wasn't as busy. I would recommend this place for people who are fit and healthy as there are a lot of inclines which I struggled with, so very small children, the elderly and disabled may find it difficult to get around.The animals are well kept (the hippos were the best! - fantastic enclosure!)The onsite food was a bit limited if you're not used to the local cuisine, so pack snacks! You'll get hungry anyway!This is a full day event, so arrive early.The price and what you get for it is unbelievable. ZSL doesn't even come close.I can't wait to go back!
Beautiful trip. Great choice for sunny weekend! Good locations. From town just for a 20 minutes... Nice parks in the area of zoo. You will find restaurants, toilettes, etc ...

OK place. The zoo is a good place to not meet so many foreigners. Despite the winter season it was kind of busy (Valentine's day top alternative attraction maybe?). In summer I think it would be super crowded... The animals do not have super spacious huts, but the location on the hillslope is really brilliant. You can easily reach the zoo by bus. No worries, go from Nádraží Holešovice Metro station every 10 mins.
Best zoo I've been to. . Good value for money, entry was only 200czk for an adult ticket. They have some really good animals there. The chair lift wasn't open on our visit unfortunately.

Prepare for a long day. An awful lot to see and an awful lot time needed to see it. We spent 4.5 hours and could have spent longer. Caution, watch out for the fruit bats, they are lose and do fly around your head in the dark.
Massive zoo, cool enclosures.. Only 200 czk per adult, zoo is massive and has all sorts of animals. Our favourite part was the mountain goats who have a cliff for an enclosure.

Good day out. Had a great day out, easy to reach from central prague tram 24 and bus 112. Value for money as well. Never seen polar bears up close before. A lot of good indoor viewing areas.the zoo is built around a hill so quite a lot of walking but well worth it.

Incredible time here!. We visited Prague Zoo on Tuesday 9th February. We had a fantastic time there is so much to see we were there for hours!!! they really take care of the animals and the staff are so knowledgable and keen to talk and provide information. Our favourites were the polar bears, the Indian lions that arrived 2 months (previously endangered in India) and the lovely hippo! I have been too a few zoo's and have never got so close to the animals before. The zoo is huge and the animals have loads of space which is always a concern.Thank you to Jane for keeping us calm walking through the free flying bat tunnel - and for all the knowledge you imparted!!

wow wow wow. this place was amazing, we spent 5 hours strolling around and you'll need it to see it all. without doubling back at all we did 9 miles of walking based on GPS watch. fantastic facilities all around, cheap snacks and drinks all around the park. of course best part was the animals which appear well cared for. clearly a lot of money spent on the zoo such a variety to see, polar bears!!! lions, tigers! seals, hawks, reptiles and gorillas silver back aswell and babies. it was all so amazing and only £6 entry. this is a great couples or family day out.
Absolutely great family place. So much to see and enjoy! Do not miss the tiger/lions den at 14:00 when their feeding starts inside because you can see them all as close as it gets!

Awesome. Prague zoo, biggest zoo in Europe is a place not to miss while in Prague. It's huge with all kind of animals kids and adults will love. specially loved the polar bear section and the Indonesian jungle. Just to keep in mind if you are visiting with kids to take strollers for them not to be tired.

Great zoo, my kids loved it. I have seen quite a few zoo's in the Netherlands, but the one in Prague was competing with the nicest in the Netherlands.There is so much too see it's amazing. If my kids had a choice they would go again instantly. I personally liked the zoo very much too, but with the cold quite a few animals were inside.

Lovely zoo. Well where can i begin with this place....we have visited it twice so far as it is a great day out for the family and couples alike...the zoo is very easy to reach by public transport about 20 minutes via metro and then bus and for less than a £ per person...once at the zoo theres lovely enclosures for the animals very spacious and lovely surroundings...there is a chair lift that you can go on to take you up to the top of the zoo and back down again very inexpensive at around 60p each way great to check out the view of the zoo and its surrounding areas...theres a lovely pizzeria at the top of the zoo and again very inexpensive aswel as lots of other various food stalls and restaurants dotted around selling anything from a coffee to a beer...i cant recommend this place enough if your looking for a great day out.

one of my favourite Zoos I've been to!. I was worried about coming here as it was January so the weather was cold and snowy. I wasn't disappointed. Really great big zoo with lots of animals out. All animals are in big open spaces and seem very happy. Loved Gorillas!

Fabulous zoo. Went on February 9th. Fairly quit day so easy to get round and view the animals. The place is huge so take good walking shoes. Animals look happy and well fed.
