Prices for food and merchandise very reasonable. We took the Number 22 tram and walked from there going up but it's a bit of a hike. We caught the bus back to the tram station.We are adults and loved it. Children will love it more. Lots of play areas. The Elephant enclosure is literally a shrine to elephants with an asthma, Buddhist temple and other elephant related displays. Just go, you'll love it!
Vrely big.. Amazing place to be. Get ready for lauds of walking. Buts its worted. Wrely nice and modern. ...........................
loved it. had such a good day here! its hard to put more information as you get whats on the tin! if you like zoos and you like animals then youl like this! well worth going to would deff recommend.
nice. The zoo is away from the city center, but easy to get. The nature around is amazing even in wintertime. Zoo offers a lot of fun and attractions.

Wonderfull day in Prague Zoo. Prague Zoo was a very nice surprise for me. It is huge and very well organised.I spent alomost 1 day there and I have not seen everything. There are a lot of animals of all the continents kept in very good conditions. Inside you will find everything you need(smol restaurants,caffeshops, souvenir shops, so you can spend there a hole day, but take care to ware comfortable shoes. You have to walk a lot and sometimes to climbe some hills. The price is very good; free for children and only 1 crown for the seniors over 70.Just in front of the Zoo, acros the road there is Troia Palace.Don't miss it. It is not very big so it will not take you too much time, but it is very nice. Visit first the palace and after go to the zoo.

Loved it. See reviews on the website of this zoo and I love a good zoo anyway!! Prepare for a lot of walking as their is so much to see!! The polar bears defiantly didn't like the morning but when they come out they were fascinating! Most of the animals look really happy and some even breed so they are obviously pretty content! Would say start fromThe top and walk down as it is hard work but defiantly worth the visit and really cheap entry too!!

First time to see such animals. Although I wasn't intrested in visiting a zoo, but i was completly mistaken, the layout and the animal assortment and how natural all the made environments are was really amazing, it took us 4 hours of hasty walking to finish like 80% of the animals, be prepared for at least 7 hours of walking and make sure to get your trainers

Favourite zoo yet. This zoo is absolutely fantastic. The enclosures for the animals are stunning and obviously well looked after. There is so much to see and plenty of opportunities to get lunch and refreshments for cheap prices. I would go back in a heartbeat, as I've not been to a zoo that had so much to see before!

No wonder it has been rated as one of the best ZOOs in the world!. Prague ZOO offers not only interesting meetings with animals, which are kept in as much natural conditions as possible, but also a beautiful walk. The area is quite large, allow yourself at least 3 hours. There are many special attractions for children, which they will love (children ´ s corner, animal ´ s feeding times, lift from lower to upper part of the ZOO, interactive programs etc.). But even the adults will be satisfied. After the ZOO, you can also visit botanical garden, which is very close and in summer season Troja Castle and Santa Klara vineyard.

Amazing zoo. Make sure you allow at least four hours for your visit as its a massive zoo. The polar bears were amazing play fighting and running around they seemed very happy. The bats were awesome they fly right over your head. Have been to alot of zoos around the world and there were animals here I had not seen before. Great place and only £6 entry. A definite if you like animals, well laid out in natural enclosures.

Great zoo. Visiting the zoo in January was brilliant as it was very quiet and even though it was snowing all the animals can be seen either outside or indoor. I saw animals that I never knew existed!! I like to visit zoos and this one was the cheapest entry at under £10.
Very beautiful old zoo.. Beautiful old and well oganist zoo with plenty to see and experience, great for families.It looks like they also care for the animals.
Best Zoo Ever. It is the best zoo I have ever visited in all my life, I saw the Panda for the 1st time in my life, excellent show rooms

Fantastic day out. Me and my friends visited this zoo in September of 2015 and it did not disappoint. There was a wide variety of animals there spread over the large zoo so you don't end up seeing everything too quickly. As the zoo is situated on a large hill there is a chairlift to get from top to bottom or vice versa. I would recommend this zoo for a great day out in Prague

The best part of our trip to Prague.. The zoo is fantastic. The highlight of our visit and well worth every penny. For just 200Czk you get a day pass which is far better value than many walking tours or other attractions for what you get out of it. There is a good range of animals and we'll laid out. The information signs have limited translations into Russian and English. The animals are very well looked after and seem very happy. I am recommending if you read this review that you make sure to take a good part of a day as it is certainly worth taking the time to see everything.

Best zoo ever. This is a fantastic zoo! It is a pleasure to walk around, everything is maintained with great care, the animals have large living areas, the diversity is incredible. Definitely worth a visit.

The best Zoo I`ve seen. The zoo in Prague is amazing. The area is very big and it has a lot of animal exemplars. I would recommend this for any age range, being at the same time a natural lesson and an entertaining nice walk. We visited the zoo in a nice day in February and I`m sure in spring and summer it`s even nicer.

Big Zoo. Great Enclosures. . I studied animal behaviour so whenever I go to a zoo that comes into play. I want big, realistic enclosures where the animals are well cared for. That's what I got. First off. The zoo is MASSIVE. 58Hectares and a lot of it is hilly. So bear that in mind. The enclosures are amazing. I was really impressed. Great use of space. Be sure to check out the cliffside enclosures. Food is a bit over priced but hey, it's a tourist attraction what do you expect? I've been most zoos in the UK. This IS one of, if not THE, best zoos I've visited so far.

Wonderful . What a fantastic place to visit. Old and young will love it, be warned it took us 4 hours to walk around and I don't think we visited everything! The animals are well looked after as far as Zoo's go and there are big spaces for them to roam as the park is huge, it's a little bit more like a safari park in my opinion. There are loads of little cafes dotted about and coffee stops which are cheap and the toilets are free! The park is easy to visit you just get on the metro and then on the bus using the same ticket and bobs your uncle. Overall I would recommend going here for a visit whilst in Prague and it's only 200kr each, approx £6.

Even in winter a great poace to visit. due to the snow and ice access to some areas was limited and offerings of food and drink very very restricted. still, it is a lovely place to visit. Beware, there are hills to climb, but also a lift.
Typical zoo. It's a good zoo but is a massive hill so not suitable for buggies and small children . other wise is a good visit and get an amazing view from the top.

Absolutely amazing... be ready to walk!. We've visited Prague Zoo twice now, once in October and recently in February. October seemed to have a lot more going on in terms of the food shacks dotted around the park, which are great value; and the lift being in operation which takes you from one end of the zoo to the other, although it isn't necessary and everything is accessible by walking around the paths, we'd definitely recommend a ride on it! By far the polar bears were our favourite animals there, watching them so closely you are literally a pane of glass away from them! We also got the opportunity to watch the lions and tigers being fed, with the feeding times signposted close to all enclosures it's an amazing sight to see.The only thing you should be prepared for is occasionally getting lost if you can't easily follow a map, and there is a lot of walking involved... and some steep inclines too! Overall, an experience that you MUST have in Prague!

Short break. Prague was fantastic . We took a taxi from our hotel £15 ,we arrange for the driver to collect us which he did on time . Entrance fee was £20 for 4 of us . The layout and cleanliness really impressed us all . Food was really good and priced reasonably .if you like animals well worth it .

One of the best ever. The zoo is huge with great selection of animals, the biggest elephant place I have ever seen with families of animals around 15-12 elephant , all other kind of animals are available from every place around the world, toilets available everywhere, a shop available with souviners, a sort of Rolar coaster which takes you from up to down or from down to up

Good place to spend Sunday and to come back many times . We were visiting this zoo a few times already. Every time discover smth new. Pleasant place for all kid age, including husband. Trolley cab, wolf, elephantS and a lot of other attraction with very much reasonable price. Could be compared somehow with Hamburg zoo

The zoo with kids. To really enjoy it here you should bring the kids. Family tickets presume that you are a 2+2 config but if you have more kids they'll work out the cheapest deal. You can rent little box buggies for the day but securing them if you eat or go into the buildings can be a challenge. If you have small kids then when you come in through the entry turn left to go to the lower part of the zoo first as that has the petting area, playgrounds and bigger restaurants. If you go up there is one small takeaway by the polar bear and the bigger places are towards the giraffes. You can easily spend 5 or 6 hours here. Remember if driving then the better carpark is at the bottom of the hill and turn right.
Immortal Venue For Wildlife. Place unshaken from beginning... Have seen polar beer snake tiger specially Shanti from India ... Looking for Bengal Tiger too...

4th Best Zoo in the World!. The Zoo is huge!! Best Zoo I've been too and the enclosures were large for every animal! A few enclosures had a walk through path which made it fun and the Mountain Goats were on the side of the mountain you would get the cable car over. Very well set out! The food was very disappointing, I know it was quiet as it was winter but we couldn't find any café or places to sit and the lady couldn't understand our question so we ate at one of the food points, the choice of stale hot dogs or grilled rubbery camembert was a let down but I hear the choice is much better in Summer!! This didn't affect our day too much as for everything else the zoo had to offer!

One of the best zoos ever!. This might not be on everyone's attractions list in Prague but if you have an afternoon to spare you will not be disappointed. We visited in winter whilst it was raining heavily and didn't expect to see much, but many of the exhibits have internal sections for you to get really close to the animals. The theming is also great, with lots of unique buildings and scenery as well as the animals themselves. Plus, there is a great variety of cheap food available throughout the zoo. The only downside I could think of is its location - though easy to get to it's a little further out - and not all information is available in English, but overall a great trip!

Spent the full day here, so much to see!. We had to get both a bus and train here from our hotel, but hotel staff gave us a lot of help with directions so it was not an issue for us. Cheap entry and so much to see! Elephants and Polar Bears were my favourite!Definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Prague it is such a good day out and so big it took us around 5 hours to fully explore it all.Cafe and Restaurant inside for food/snacks during the day. Gift Shop too.

Assortment of Animals . It's worth popping out to Prague Zoo if you enjoy a Zoo environment. The animals weren't really out and about off season. The elephants, Tigers and lions were pacing a lot which suggests to me that they weren't the happiest of animals. The polar bears were quite entertaining- splashing around and play fighting! Enough animals there to spend a good four or five hours there comfortably so get it out of the way early in the morning so you can head back into Prague. Also on the way back to the metro after you can pop into Cross Club cafe (turn left and walk straight as you walk out of the metro) where is serves a delicious whole pizza for equivalent of £3 and has a quirky feel to it.
Amazing!. For around £6 to get in this zoo is awesome! It's a really nice day out, and doesn't just have the standard animals. Well worth a trip there.
Great Sunday. Nice day for a Zoo. We were walking all day in this amazing place full of animals from all corners on the world. Amazing for everyone.
Best ZOO. The best ZOO in Europe!!! It is worth a visit.Just keep your children quiet for the animals' comfort ;-)

Best place on Earth . My favorite place to go on a sunny day in my hometown. It's a huge zoo that is number four best zoo on planet. You can spend a whole day walking around. Great for kids. Good restaurants. Educational. Try the cable car! It never gets old. Say hi to the giraffes from me :)
Nice zoo. A good place with a lot of different kind of animals. I've liked a lot, not one of the best in the world but still pretty good.

Never to disappoint. I can say I am a regular to the Prague Zoo. Now, I visit any zoo, if I have the chance, and even some famous ones do not seem to me to reach the same level as the one in Prague. On top of that, the Prague zoo is trying to improve every time in every aspect. This time my daughter and myself went through the whole place - which is a full-day entertainment - and we just rushed through some of the places. The new lions are great, but so is every pavilion we visited. The only thing one should be aware of is that outside the main season the choice of refreshments is more limited - though you do not have to be hungry.

Wide Range of Exhibits. The Prague Zoo has a wide range of animals and I hear they do fantastic work protecting animals but I think the enclosures are too small for some of the animals, especially the big cats.

Impressive . I've always been a massive fan of zoos and it's only recently my views on them have changed. Although this zoo is very impressive with their collection and ability to view the animals even in cold months like when I went, it has made me want to stop going to zoos all together as it upset me quite a lot. The day we went, it snowed quite a lot and the zoo was practically empty which actually made the visit not as fun or energetic. Even though it snowed we was able to still see every animal they had to offer because of their indoor pavilions for them which is a plus, but it was also what made me upset as some animals like the Tigers, lions and elephants seemed to be loosing their minds. Pacing with Boredom in their very small enclosures which was unsettling to see. Tigers want to roam and hunt, not be locked in a room no bigger than my bedroom. I'm sure when it's warm and they're in their very large suitable outdoor areas they are very happy but this zoo has made me dislike the concept of keeping wild animals locked up very wrong.
great fun. One of the most developed Zoo's in Europe. Like the idea of big living spaces for animals. Playgrounds for kids and adoption programme for visitors.
Highly recommended!. Great zoo, one of the best in the world. Has all kinds of animals and the first time i got to see a polar bear!Must visit place for children!
Awful . Most depressing place I've ever been too. Hardly no animals were out and the ones that were looked bored and depressed!!

Great zoo!. This zoo is huge and has so much to visit that you would need to spend a whole day to cover it.Pretty much something for everyone, whether you are a family or a good of young travellers. It's pretty hard not to enjoy. Things like the bat enclosure were a great experience (although I wouldn't recommend it if you don't like bats... obviously). If you are a backpacker and want to visit the zoo like us then definitely consider how much time you have and how tired you are, because it is surprisingly tiring.

A very fun afternoon, even in winter. This was a very nice experience, even though some of the exhibits were closed because it was winter. However, there were still lots of animals to see, as there are indoor spaces for the animals, and they were accessible to visitors. The zoo is very spacious, it takes quite a lot of time to visit all of it, so definitely plan a whole day for it. There are also several restaurants, and places where you can just get a quick bite and a hot drink.

beautiful zoo. This zoo is really beautiful. It is huge and I didn't get through all of it. While it's always going to suck to see animals in cages, the cages seemed decent sized and catered to the animals' natural habitats. A zoo is always going to get negative comments about cages, however the animals are safe from poaching and trophy hunting which is more than you can say for "free" animals. Also I hope the people who complain about cages are vegetarians cause if they care about caged animals they should probably start there, or is it just another case of "If I don't see it it doesn't exist."

The best in the world . I have never seen such a beautiful zoo. It took 5 hours to walk through all the zoo but it really worth it. It's a bit outside the city but well connected. Bus 112 from a metro station of Prague, leaves you at the doorstep. Here you can find all the animals and you can walk through some of them, mostly with the birds (it's safe). It costs 200kc per person. (Around 8€) and you don't need to pay anything else inside, a part for the souvenir shop, but that's up to you.We were in winter and it was almost empty so we really enjoyed it. I guess that in spring or summer it's even better due to the chance of swing some animals in the outside, instead some of them in this period were in a enclose area.I'll be back
fun even in the rain. Main problem was that several areas were closed making for much longer walks in the cold rain. In good weather highly recommended

Zoo in the winter time. We visited the zoo in January so it was well below zero degrees and snow on the ground. We didn't really think there would be too much to see as many animals can't stand the cold, but instead we were surprised by the amount of animals to see. Lots of indoors and warmed up glass walled houses for the animals, even the elephants and giraffes were there.Prague zoo means lots of walking and the elevator's not working during winter so you have to hike up the hill to see all the animals. We were ok with that and carried our 3-year old some of the time. We ate on the top at some restaurant most of the employees seemed to eat at as well - reasonably priced basic good tasting food.I would recommend the zoo as a winter activity as well if you're not too afraid of long walks and elevation.

Prague zoo. First, you may go there with kids, with husband for a romantic day or with your old parents (for them please learn in advance the map to plan the itinerary, and for sure there is no need to investigate all the far away corners with golden age people :) ).Second, how to get there? Of course, you may come by metro line C and then bus number 112, but spend 250 kc for a taxi from city center (order it by phone, It is chipper. Google in advance you will find some English or Russian speaking taxi). And your way back you may go by bus and metro.Third, When to go? Any season but in early spring or winter take a Caban/raincoat to your bag and a hat or a baseball cap depending on your style :). In case of raining it will be more comfortable than with umbrella in your right hand and wet zoo map in left. You may spend 3-4 hours there, so take comfy shoes as there hills and long distances. Come in the morning, you may see how they feed animals, sometimes there breakfast shows. Finally, What to do there 3-4hours?Learn the map on Zoo web site in advance. Print it out and mark animals you wanna visit. Upper side of the map you should go up a hill, but instead you may use a funicular. Near the elephants area there is a big food court with hot dishes, you may comfy seat there and eat, drink bear etc, but don't feed the enimals.And if you are without kuds don't miss a chance to visit Troja chateau just across the street from Zoo main entrance. You may visit it from April till November and

So much to see. I decided to go to this zoo when I heard it was rated #4 on TripAdvisor. Having been to the #1 zoo, San Diego, I hoped it would share at least a few similarities. Not only did it have many of the same animals, the size and layout of the zoo is very similar. It is very well planned so you can keep walking on a continuous path and see the whole zoo. They also do a wonderful job of keeping warm-climate animals visible when brought inside in the winter (and vice versa, I would assume).Perhaps the best part, however, was the price. As a student I got my ticket for 150 Kr. But the full-price adult ticket is only 200 Kr, an amazing deal compared to what American zoos charge. Hit it up!

So much to see... All day trip. This zoo was amazing... It is an all day event! It was just my Mom and I and we were there from 10am to 4pm and we did not see it all. Using public transportation was easy!

A huge zoo to enjoy. Though it can be a bit rough looking during winter time, the Prague zoo is definitely worth a visit when you are in Czech with family. The animals have pretty big cages, and you can walk for kilometres in this zoo. Very easy reachable by public transport too.

Fantastic even in the snow!. Even though it was -4 degrees & snowing heavily it was fantastic fun. Many of the animals were in there inside enclosures which you can go into and view them inside a pavilion or they are visible from the outside through glass. Also many of the pavilions you can walk though such as 'the jungle' are fully subversive so you feel you are walking through the jungle. One of the best experiences was walking into the twilight cave with free flying Fruit Bats! Despite the snow we saw many animals out playing in it or eating it. There were animals at the zoo that neither I or my partner had ever seen which was brilliant.Several places to purchase hot drinks and snacks (much needed in the cold) and four (maybe more) restaurants to choose from. Easily accessible via Tram 17 and Bus 112, with entry to the zoo equalling about £7!! Spent 4 hours here and still felt there was more to see, fantastic day out.
7th best ZOO on the world. Very nice place to spend day with family and friends. Big area with many animals, good for walk, eat and simply enjoy day.

Great place! Watch out for the old lady on tickets who tries to rip you off!. We were on a City Break but fancied getting away from the crowds. We went to the zoo and spent the Afternoon looking around. It was a perfectly sunny day. It got busier later on when families started to arrive but it was still great fun. We went down the cable car which was short and sweet but fun although a bit scary the way you were just left to it belting yourself in. The only negative was on entrance hen an older woman on the tills totally ripped us off and overcharged us! My girlfriend wanted to rope her head off! Other than that all good and recommend!

great experience. one of the best zoos I've been to, big open spaces for the animals, places to see them really up close! The Polar Bears are amazing! Was good to go in winter as it wasn't busy, more time to rome around and enjoy the experience

Take food with you. I love zoos and Prague zoo is included in that! It has a wide range of animals with for the most part pretty good enclosures. People take their dogs, which I found a little strange but seems to be the norm there. The elephants, apes and polar bears were my favs.If you visit in high season take your own food. I found many of the restaurants ran out of a lot of things. If you are veggie or fussy about food taking your own is a must. There is a lot of walking to do and some of the pathways lead you to a bit of a dead end so try plan out your route.You will need a good half day to get the most from your day

Best Zoo . We picked a great day to go to the zoo, the sun was shining and we took the boat there from a harbour down town. The layout and variety of animals at the zoo was great. It was definately a highlight of our trip to Prague and well worth the visit. The boat trip was about an hour but we were sorry afterwards that we hadnt left earlier and had more time at the zoo. The polar bear was my favourite seeing him up close swimming around.

Best Zoo Ever. I decided to go to the zoo on a whim, and I didn't regret it at all. The zoo is soooooo huge, and since I went in the winter, many animals were of course hiding inside, but the prague zoo have indoor exhibits for all the animals so we still can see the animals! They have a lot of animals and the zoo is beautiful as well, plus point is that they have a section just for Indonesian animals! I am from Indonesia, so it was great seeing that.

Great place for family fun. Great place to bring kids to have fun. Most animal are hiding inside in winter, so the best is to come during warmer months to get the best out of your visit, but even in winter you can get your fair amount of fun here. Our favourites are the elephant valley, bats flying in the dark around your head in the Indonesian pavilion, giraffes & zebras savannah and the kids love the Bororo playground.We usually have lunch in the restaurant next to the elephant enclosure - had thai curry there last time, it was surprisingly good.You can spend all day here, there is so much to see and do.
Lot of animals!!!. I saw finally the giraffes!!! You need half day to visit all the zoo in details but it is worthed!!!

Would have been better in the summer. We went here on a cold Wednesday in January, and I think that is why we didn't enjoy it as much as we could have. There are lots of animals in this zoo, but many of them were inside because of the weather and there are only a handful of opportunities to look at the animals inside. The only animals outside were different kinds of deer, wolves and polar bears. The only animals that were to be viewed from inside were the giraffes, elephants, gorillas nd felines. Next to that they do have some buildings where you can view smaller animals, reptiles and fish. All of the restaurants were closed as well, except one. The zoo is extremely cheap though, so I would definitely recommend going in summer.

my animals. Animals 've always liked from my childhood I have several times visited the zoo . The Prague zoo is a large area , it will be appreciated therefore especially younger ones . Too bad that there are brown bears .
best zoo I've ever visited. I've spend here all day and this was an exited experience! i adore great location and size. There was the first time i saw a penguins!
Excellent zoo. We visited the zoo on Boxing Day. Such good value to get in. We spent about 6 hours walking round as it is huge. Wear comfy shoes. Definitely worth a visit

nice and cheap, but not for winter. Went here on a cold winter day. Unfortunately a lot of the animals were inside and unable to be seen. Also, all the restaurants and souvenir shops were closed?! A lot of the exhibits were empty and so was the park, it was really quiet so the zoo felt strangely empty. It was also really cold so we wanted to go inside for a bit, but there's barely anywhere to go but outside. The pavillions are really hot inside and the contrast hot-cold is quite annoying. A few of the exhibits looked really small (too small...) and the Zoo is on a hill so there's a lot of climbing. There were a lot of beautiful animals, though, and the admission fee is really cheap (about €5) We had a nice day despite all the beforementioned.

great place to relax. This is seriously one of the best ZOOs in Europe. It´s very cosy and modern. Especially when visiting with your kids. From the hill you can even have beautifull views of this part of Prague and the Vltava river. You should definitely try the old school cable car. There´s a lot of fast food stands but if you want to eat seriously, go to "Gocarovy domy" restaurant or visit the self service restaurant close to the elephant/giraffe area (this one is faster and with more seats). These two also have best coffees. When finishing the visit you can extend your stay with beautiful river walk. Of course, during the weekend on the sunn days, this place could be overcrowded. Monday is usually the best time for visit.

Great Day Out. We had half a day to waste so we thought we would go to the zoo as we read the reviews on here. This was one of the best zoos I have ever been to and it only costs around £6 to get in. Wish we went earlier so we could spend more time as it is massive. However, the tigers looked very stressed out :(

Best animal world.. We visit this nice zoo twice a year, in the Summer and in Winter and can see how animals behave in various parts of the year. I have seen about 10 zoo gardens all over the world and I love this the most. It gives the importance to animals that is important and gives them the best home they need.

Great family day out. One of the best Zoos I have ever visited. It's a whole day trip. There are so many different specious and all the animals so well looked after! You can get there by bus or by a boat. There is even a cableway to take you from one level of the Zoo to another. Many educational programs going on every day so you can learn many interesting things about the animals in the Zoo. A must stop if you are in Prague with children!!!

A great zoo experience. My wife and I loved this zoo. Inside there are a number of caves / pavillions with themes (e.g.: animals from indonesia or africa) and it was larger than we imagined. Some animals (like the giraffes, zebras and elephants) are also inside wide, open fields.You should be prepared to spend a whole day here, should you want to see everything. There are restaurants and toilets inside, and in one section you can get a nice panoramic view of prague. There seemed to be places for shows, of birds and other animals.There is a chairlift that connects the lower and higher parts of the zoo, but during our visit it wasn't acessible.

Best zoo ever!. Having done lots of sightseeing, we decided to visit the zoo. What an amazing experience! It was vast. There must have been every animal under the sun. No cages here for most of the animals; they were grazing happily in huge natural fields where one could observe them in a natural environment. It took us three hours to walk around and even then we did not see everything!Thoroughly recommend a visit. You will have a lovely day out!

I just love animals!. We came there 3rd of January, despite that it was -5 and really windy, we enjoyed this place probably the most from our whole trip. The zoo is really big and decent, it has plenty of space, mountains, big areas for animals, very good indoors pavilions and even places to eat or to have a cup of hot wine (yes you need it in winter time). I am trying to go to every zoo if there is anyone in the city which i am visiting. So it was no except in Prague. I was amazed by the quantity of animals and of course by the quality how these animals are taken care and how much free space they have. I would strongly recommend to visit this place, even if it's cold or windy outside, or even if you are not the biggest fan of zoos. It's really worth to spend of day.Finally I would like to THANK all the people who are taking care of this amazing place and for their every day's work. You are doing superb job! Bets of luck!!

Huge!. We spent 5 hours here and still didn't quite get round everything. It is definitely a full day trip and at only 200Kc! As it was winter a lot of the animals were in doors but in this zoo in doors isn't out the back where you can't see anything, there are lots of in door areas where you can admire the animals. A long day but worth it if you're an animal lover. Can be quite hot inside some of the in door areas so no need for a big coat, even if it's a little cold outside.

So, um...yeah I really don't ah...I can't read Czech.. This zoo was one of the most unique zoos I have ever been to. Perched precariously on the side of a small mountain, this zoo is like nothing I have ever seen before. It has all of the big game animals one would expect a zoo to have, plus a few animals I had never seen before. Complete with very well thought out and interactive enclosures. There's an aviary, a walk through rain forest exhibit, and even a chairlift up the mountain! The side of the mountain is where they have found a great deal of fossils...at least I think they did. See, I really had to use every bit my deductive skills to try and figure out what the placards and signs were saying, because I don't thin one single sign, anywhere in the park, had a lick of English on them. And I'm not one of those folks who thinks that everyone in the world should speak English because I do, but a lot of the world does, and a lot of travelers do as well. And a LOT of them go to visit Prague. So I was a bit disappointed when a place, to attract the tourists no less, has brochures at every hotel lobby in the city, doesn't cater at all to said tourists.But other then that, it really was a neat place! Worth a stop for sure!

Best Zoo I've ever been to! . Knowing we were going to visit the zoo in Winter my boyfriend and I were a little apprehensive that we wouldn't see many animals. However, we were happily surprised and we could only imagine how amazing the zoo and animal visibility would have been in warmer months!It was extremely cheap entry, about £6pp and it is very easily reachable from Prague Old Town on public transport.The food inside the Zoo was also not as pricey as you would expect from inside an attraction.It was lovely to see so many different animals, that you wouldn't normally see in UK Zoos. The highlight of the experience was seeing the Polar Bears. Overall a fabulous day and well recommended.

Great day out!. Very cheap to get in, only 200 CRZ. Can get up close and personal with all the animals, the polar bears are a great spectacle! just a shame the elephants weren't out due to the bad weather. Very big with plenty to see, would definitely recommend!

Impressive. It is huge and even in winter you can see almost all animals. I think we couldn't see lions and tigers so up close if they were outside. We catched feeding time and that was very interesting. Scenery and habitations are well-built, you can see they have put a lot effort in every detail.

massive zoo. My boyfriend and I visited this zoo just before Christmas and my goodness this place is MASSIVE! I think we ended up walking 5 miles in total (and we didn't see it all due to sore feet) Every animal you can think of here, although when we went we couldn't find the lions it maybe we were reading the map wrong or following the signs wrong but we went to were it said but we couldn't find them :/ but I guess it is in an excuse to go back.The highlight of the zoo for me personally was seeing the Polar bears - they are my favourite animals and I got to their enclosure just as they were let out which was super special for me! It was raining whilst we were there so alot of the animals we indoors but we still got to see them. It was a really funny day out and I would happily return with even comfier shoes on! We did see two alpacas (I think they were) getting it on just as we were about to take a family friendly picture. The price of the zoo is so cheap compared to prices back home, it was a pleasure to go and see the beautiful zoo and the well looked after animals!
Old large Zoo. The zoo is very nice, one of the best I've visited. Plenty to see, even in the winter. The info called us a taxi, which overcharged us, so probably better to call one yourself.
The best Zoo ever. They have every animal what you like, for sure. Expositions are big and nice, there are lots of activists what you could do, besides watching animals.

This place is heaven! . I went there but wasn't expecting that huge amount of animals. I have seen them all. The zoo is organized in a beautiful way. You'll spend the whole day wandering happily among all this until they announce the close time.:) A must must see place.

great place to hang out. It took as an entire day to visit it. The location is huuuuge and great place to hang out. We got there by bus and you can buy a special type of ticket where you pay for the Zoo and the nezt door little Castle. My advice is to take 2 days to visit this area of the city. In the Zoo you can find restaurants and places to rest, location is really nice.

Super. Vzdycky v prazske zoo mam pocit, ze zvirata jsou tam stastny a ze jim nic moc nechybi. oproti jinym zoo. Bezva interakce. krasny pavilony. The bestI think the animals in the zoo are happy. I really appreciate it. Itis interactive, funny and interesting

If you don´t go on a summer weekend, really cool. Fantastic zoo, lot of work done, great services, always improving everything possible, fantastic for visits with or without children, surely worth visiting. Situated close to really cool botanical garden with great views over the centre of Prague, views regular tourist never gets. Troja Castle right opposite. Jurkovic architecture right at the entrance. Avoid crowded summer weekends or weekends in general. You can see the count of visitors behind the turnstiles on the right side, if it is more than 5000, it could be little crowded.

One of the best zoos we have visited.. We spent a whole day at the zoo more or less and I think it would be fair to say it is one of the best zoos we have visited.First of all, the zoo is huge with sizable enclosures for the animals and requires a lot of walking. I have a keen interest in zoology and conservation and the variety of animals on display was genuinely surprising, with so many exotic animals on display that I have never seen in other zoos. Enclosures are well designed to be both aesthetically pleasing for humans, whilst also providing excellent habitats for all the animals. We were particularly impressed by the Indonesian Jungle section and the Africa section. Unfortunately, as we visited in Winter we didn't get to see many animals outsides but for the most part, they are all easily accessible through indoor viewing areas. Prague Zoo also seems to have some excellent breeding programmes with a lot of juvenile/baby animals around, for those looking for a cute factor. For those looking to take photographs, we thought opportunities were reasonably good (considering the time of year) and got some excellent close ups.In summary, this zoo was great and so much cheaper than so many of its European counterparts (especially compared to the UK!). Would highly recommend it and can only imagine it's even better in the Spring/Summer.
nice place. Prague Zoo is really nice and big. It will take a few hours to walk in there. They have a lot of animals (many kinds).I really enjoy it and like it.

Avoid this place in winter !!. My first issue with this place is the pre-customer service. I sent an email to them requesting information well over a month before our visit today and they still haven't replied.On to the zoo itself, from various brochures and publications, this is supposed to be one of the best zoos in Europe however it failed to deliver. This place should either be closed during winter or they should not charge the full admission cost. The majority of animals were either hiding from the cold weather, sleeping or in their respective cages. Hippo was in the indoor enclosure so you only saw it from the murky water when it decided to come up for air. I say hippo and not hippos because only saw one.Elephants had a huge outdoor area for them to roam, however they were also indoors and could only be seen from the glass. Giraffes are the same. Not sure if they have lions but didn't see any. Didn't see penguins but I think they're supposed to have.Two tigers were seen and they were both asleep.The only animals which enjoy the winter weather were the main ones to be see, polar bears, fox, reindeer etc. They were also quite a bit of flamingos and pelicans all huddled together. Spiders were unseen, snakes were few or also somewhere seeking warmth. I'm sure this place could be better and more active but not worth visiting or worth the full price in winter. Lastly, they close promptly at 4:00PM (Jan / Feb). At 4 they have announcements on the loudspeaker in Czech and English letting you know the zoo is closed! Staff actually then go through each indoor pavilion to send visitors out. Total time spent: 4 !/2 hrsAdmission cost: 200CZK / $8 USD appx (Adults)

Best Zoo I have been to in Europe. The zoo is huge. Once again if you are traveling in the winter layer up and wear comfortable shoes. The zoo is great in the winter and has several indoor exhibits the zoo is very diverse with a large variety of animals. The outdoor exhibits are open and it allows you to get close to the animals

Excellent value day out. This is one of the best zoos my husband and I have ever visited on a break. There are a wide variety of healthy looking exotic animals kept in large enclosures and the entrance fee and travel costs from the city centre were really minimal. Food and drink bought at the zoo offered great value for money. I would say this attraction is possibly only suitable for the able bodied due to the amount of walking required to get around the zoo.

Great Zoo!. One of the best zoos I've been to, it's a very big zoo with different kinds of animals. There is also a cable car to go from the bottom to the top since the zoo is on a hill. We preferred to go up on our own. One thing we didn't like was the fact that no information in English was given.

Not that good for getting photographs. This is a big zoo and I was there frim about 0945 until 1600 (closing time for January).I didn't see everything eg lions but I saw more than I expected to considering that it was about freezing when I was there.I don't know if the lions were hiding inside because they didn't appreciate the cold or if they had been moved but there were none in the lion enclosure.I found that the aviary was quite small though there are various separate enclosures with owls, vultures and Australian birds.Though there are a lot of animal areas where there is an uninterrupted view of the creatures on display, there are many where glass (including dirty glass) or thick wire mesh get in the way. It would be better if natural barriers were utilised to keep the likes of tigers segregated from visitors and mesh with bigger gaps for the owls and vultures (since surely they would not be able to squeeze through 2" square holes).I walked to the zoo from my hotel near Prague Castle. It took about an hour and was a fairly straightforward route: a handful of turns and long straight stretches. I was able to make the return trip without reference to Google maps so, in a city I don't know, that suggests an easy route.Overall the zoo has a lot of animals over an area that is a day trip to get around. Admission is not expensive so it is a value for money day out. It just makes 4 out of 5 from me.

Massive Zoo!. It is very impressive!Lots of animals, well treated and a nice place. It is very big, with different kinds of animals taht attracts all likes. You can walk with bats, see the polar bear and see tigers and lions.. everythings even in the winter. The zoo has inside and outside spots for animals which allows the public to see every one.You need to prepare your body, because it is a long walk to visit all places in the zoo. They also have a cable car to go from the bottom to the top, because the zoo is in a hill.It is magnificent and very nice to visit if you have time and like animals. It is about 15 euros the ticket for adults and it is very easy to go there. One metro and a bus for the zoo in the metro train station. Easy and fast.So, do not miss this opportunity! ;)

A bit out of the way, but you will get your moneys worth!. We may have gotten a bit lost getting here.. And getting here can take a bit of getting your head around if you're not used to the Prague transit system.But that's hardly the zoos fault. This Zoo is massive, and it is really impressive to see how it works with the environment around it. It is definitely a full day out, and has such a wide variety of animals and interactive experiences that you will feel completely fulfilled by visiting. If you enjoy zoos, this is one of the better ones in Europe!

Lovely Zoo. We have been to this Zoo twice, once in the summer and now this winter in December.Love this Zoo, very beautiful surroundings. Well kept and looked after. The animals all look healthy. We were lucky to be there just at feeding time for the Lions & Tigers. There is a lovely view over the city from the walk way at the top. Enough places to eat inside and just outside the Zoo. We had a lovely time there this December the weather was gorgeous.

Bezkonkurenční. The best place for free day in prague. No matter if you have children or not, you can spend there the whole day. Maybe for the smallest children its so long and big. but you can rent a carriage :) and see everything, no matter if its winter or summer. every day its beautiful

Great Value, Hours of Enjoyment. If you are in Prague and have some spare time, be sure to visit Prague Zoo. It is excellent value as you could quite easily spend almost a full day here - we visited for around 4 hours and managed to perhaps make it around 2/3's of the zoo, at best. The food was reasonably priced and reasonable quality, and there were a wide number of interesting animals to see - nearly all of which were out and about when we visited.
Nice day out!!. been there in summer at it was amazing...Cannot compare with London zoo which is much worse. Defenetly worth a visit

Most animals were hiding or just not there. When I went it was quite an overcast day although some of the attractions like the bat cave and the birds were all there and very interesting. However some of the bigger animals when you went outside were not there. We walked past empty sites and enclosures. There was a good bit of land for the animals and from what we saw they looked to be in good condition and well looked after. It's also just on a bus route which was convenient for us. It was a little disappointing as I come from a city that has a big zoo.

Welcome change from old town prague. My girlfriend and I visited the zoo on day four in Prague when we could handle the crowded streets no more. I only wish we would have gone earlier. It was early January during our visit so the crowds were very light adding to the enjoyment. The zoo is fantastic (voted fourth in the world) and cheap! $7 entry if I remember correctly. $1 beers. Even the cafeteria had great looking good for cheap. There was a huge diversity of exhibits laid out in a fun and convenient way. I would suggest allowing for 4 hours here to leisurely see the exhibits that interest you eat some lunch and have a beer.

A wonderful zoo. My wife and I came here not really expecting much ,boy how wrong we were .about 14 pounds for both to get in .they seemed to have every animal imaginable . We spent about4 hours in their before it got dark .you could easily spend all day their so much to see and do we will certainly return again next time with our children .if you do get the chance to go you will not be dissapointed
Perfect. All you are looking for... Many animals, nice atmosphere, many attractions. Not bad food. Only they dont except any tourist cards.
Fantastic Zoo. Wrap up as you are exposed on the hills. It was a cold day but many of the animals were out and seemed happy. We were lucky and got to see the elephants let out (approx 11:30ish).

Excellent zoo,plenty of animals. We went to the zoo a rainy day of December.Despite the weather conditions we were able to see all the animals. We were impressed by the large variety of species we found there. The zoo is huge,well maintained and they gave a lot of space to its group of animals. I think that the elephants,the lions,the hippos and the giraffes are the most impressive. The price also is value for money.

Wonderful place. Went there with my sons for a day out. Really lovely place for we saw a lot more animals than we would have at my local zoo and found it good that the habitats had plenty of room for the animals. Would really like to go back again

Where are the gorillas???. My family and I visited the zoo on Christmas eve. Kids entrance was 5 euros, for that day. I was very happy to see many animals, most zoos have one of each animal, but there were too many to count. At least 10 elephants, four tigers, one lion, jaguars, wildcats, penguins, seals, exotic birds, more than one petting zoo. The funicular was fun, but a little dangerous as my 7 year old had never hopped on hopped off moving seats before, it was a little too fast, and no one buckled here seat belt for her. We walked for 4 hours but still didn't get to see everything so i think a 6 hour visit is needed. We followed the signs for the gorillas but never found them, but we really can't complain seeing as there were just too many animals. The kids enjoyed themselves immensely and the food kiosks were great as well.

Zoo experience. You may want to allow yourself full day as zoo is huge with plenty of stopover restaurant. Certainly one of this biggest and beautiful zoo around the globe with plenty of animals that we only heard about before. Great experience with family but zoo will definitely take your full energy. Be careful of taxi drivers outside zoo, they certainly rip off tourists. Do take taxi number or arrange something beforehand. We made arrange before and paid 300cz but on asking price at zoo it was 600cz.
Lots of animals. This is a large zoo with a wide range of animals. We took a couple of trams to get there from the city centre. It is quite nice walking zoo. Good for the family.

Good day out . Visited Prague in the Summer. Really lovey city, the zoo was great fun. Lots of different animals to see, though many were asleep due to the warm weather. Still would recommend it, was great to see animals so close.

Must seel!. Me and my friends spent a whole day there, it was incredible. The zoo is separated into different pavilions and everything looked exactly as their natural habitat and there are little ponds with ducks everywhere. I loved the Indonesian Jungle and the African savanna, with all the noises. You can take amazing photos. Impressive place!

BEST ZOO in Europe: a MUST-DO!!!. The Prague Zoo is a very big zoo in Prague. You can travel from the centre to Troja by tram, the zoo is a 10 minute walk from the tram stop. You can also come by bike on foot through Stromovka park or by car through the tunnel. The Prague zoo is on a hill, so there is a chair-lift that you can go on to get to the top. An alternative is to walk, which takes 30 minutes, but you will see many animals along the way. Go see the whole zoo or at least the highlights, you should plan on staying for about 4-7 hours. There are many indoor pavilions with insects or tigers or turtles and huge play areas for the kids. There is also a goat feeding area, which is very funny. One thing I dislike is that the train that can transport you from one place to another costs extra money and doesn't go very often. I really like the African part and also the viewing tower (free). You have a view of all of Prague. Also if you have heard of geocaching, there are many of them in the zoo. I think it is better than Berlin or any other zoo in Europe.

Great Day Trip.. Not too far from centre of Prague, we took a taxi. There is also a lovely garden across the way. Out side the zoo there is stalls with food, I recommend grabbing food and having a picnic in the gardens.
Very good. This is a great zoo to visit lots of different animals pola Bears especially . Take your time as lots to see.

Funny day in the zoo. Previous visit in this zoo was 20 years ago. Now it is a totally different place. The animals have a lot of room and they do not seem stressed at all. You can get very close to the animals, however. Huge area with tremendous number of animals to see.

One of the best zoos in the world. We love to visit zoos and try to do so every time we visit somewhere new, Prague zoo did not disappoint.We got there very early which was a good thing as the zoo is so large that you really do need to spend the whole day here to get to see everything and to not rush around. The zoo is spacious, very clean and different languages are catered for. There are a huge array of species to see and each pavilion is well thought out and planned.We loved the Gharials as this is the first zoo we've been to which had this animal and the pavilion was amazing getting you so close to them. The enclosure for the Barbary sheep and macaques was just amazing as you could see these animals climbing the sheer cliff face just as they do in the wild.All of the animals appeared happy and this is more than evident in the about of baby animals around the zoo, rare babies too (aardvark and tapir and the przewalski's horse).There are many places to eat around the zoo, (although one of the restaurants had no signs in English) and all appeared good value. We found the whole experience great value for money and had a great day.Be prepared to walk quite a distance and to climb the very large hill if the chair lift is off (as it was when we were there) but the views from the top are worth the climb alone. The viewing tower was closed when we were there too.We got a taxi there to be more efficient but did use public transport to get back into town. The bus and the metro were both very easy to use and very fast and great value.
ZOO in Prague. One of the most beautiful ZOOs I have ever visited and I love to come back. Many animals in great displays, you can easily spend a day there.

Nice ZOO. Beautiful ZOO with lot of animals, which have lot of space for running and nice pavilions. In some case you can walk inside areas where are wild monkeys and touch them. There is great public transportation connection by bus 112 from "Nádraží Holešovice" metro stop.

Zoo visit. We used the public transport to visit this attraction - very quick,easy to use and extremely cheap. The zoo entrance fee was approx £5.00. Excellent value as we were there for over 5 hours. The only other costs incurred were food, drinks and the chair lift to the top of the zoo (approx 50p). Very clean, the animals had plenty of space and it was a pleasure to visit. We would highly recommend this for adults and children alike.

Vast but a little worrying. I really enjoy a visit to the Zoo and try to go in as many different countries as I can.Prague zoo was great, its the first time I have seen a polar bear and buffalo, they have some great animals around the park.If you get hungry along the way you can choose from a good selection of places to eat on site, the burger was of far higher quality than I expected and the staff even if they don't smile first always smile after you say hello.The bit that worries me was that a lot of the animals seemed to be acting in a nervous manner, the tigers and gorillas especially. I hope this was a fleeting moment and not a longstanding issue within the zoo.Well worth visiting, they could improve the details for foreign languages. Very brief in English and German.

One of the top-zoos in Europe!. I visited the zoo with my 5 yrs old kid. After having visited several Zoos in Europe (incl. London Zoo), this is my top-1 favorite. Wide spread accommodation, with very beautiful animals (well treated, which you really can notice). A huge elephant accommodation. Worth the trip from Prague city center, just about 30' from the Jewish Quarter by tram/bus.

Can can't be bored in this ZOO!:). Prague ZOO is really worth a visit. It is very big and has a LOT interesting animals to see, you can also use a funicular to get up the hill with a wonderful view. It is more like a safari park (seemed to me), nicely decorated with natural material. Definitely, even if you don't have kids, go there!:)

A must to visit. We wasn't expecting much visiting such place in winter time, but to our surprise it was still very educational. We missed only crocodiles, otherwise it was much more interesting than the one in Tenerif.Plan whole day there. There are areas for picknic, but if you forgot your snacks you'll find restourants & cafes as well.In case you forgot your own trolley, you'll find plenty of them there (free of charge).

Excellent Zoo. This is simply an excellent zoo. One of the best we have been too. It has the largest variety of animals that we have seen in any other zoo. If you rush it will take you four hours. Otherwise plan on being there the whole day. It is worth it.You can also get some excellent views of Prague from there.

Prague Zoo is Amazing!!!. Be sure to pack your walking shoes for this one but man what a great zoo...the layout was spacious and the amount of animals was astounding. Most zoos have a pair of each animal but Prague for example had 9 giraffes and almost a dozen elephants in expansive enclosures. They definitely have families in mind with many picnic areas available throughout and they keep great care of their animals as well with indoor and outdoor availability for viewers to see the wildlife. We were amazed by the mountain goats as we strolled one of the walkways, they were literally climbing right above us on a steep cliff in their enclosure. The polar bears, seals and hippos were all swimming happily, they penguins were being fed and the gray wolves paced the front of their enclosure licking their chops as some of the dogs who were in the park with their owners must have looked like a tasty treat. We would highly recommend those with little ones taking the trip out to the Prague zoo, it's a bit out of the way and we felt hard to get to via public transport (we opted to take a taxi to maximize our time at the zoo) but well worth the time and effort to get there, you will not be disappointed!

Best zoo ever visited!!. On a Christmas trip to Prague, decided to go and visit Prague zoo and oh my god what a great day. I am an animal lover and have been to many wonderful zoos in the uk and did not expect Prague to top those however, I can honestly say that Prague zoo is the best zoo I have visited in many ways. Every single animal looked so healthy and so happy in their more than ample enclosures. Most had inside and outside enclosures and access to both. I was amazed at the hugely successful breeding programme that Prague have produced for many years it seems and with the more endangered species too. I commend them and would recommend a visit to anyone

Timebreak with children. If you are fed up with all the sights and children are asking you to do something different this is the place to go. They are also opened on Mondays, there are really nice playgrounds, old funicular and of course some animals. Since it is harder to get there be carefull about choosing the transport. I recommend the boat.
Beautiful zoo. If you come to Prague with kids, Prague zoo is the best thing to do.the zoo is big and beautiful. And it's worth thing to do. Kids will love it.

One of the best zoo's in Europe.. This zoo was very easy to find and get to. A big park with many kinds of animals. I've been to Berlin Zoo, Copenhagen Zoo and Stockholm Zoo and this was one of the best in both layout and diversity. It's cheap and worth your money! First time visiting Prague? Take a few hours of your time to go here with family, friend or why not the one you love? Have fun!

Huge area to walk. We visited zoo, because we sightseeing Prague with child, so we would like to show her also something interesting for her. There is a great variety of animals and also a huge area to go. Sometimes we were a little bit confusing to know where to go. If you spend in Prague more than 4 days than I recommend to visit zoo, otherwise not to think about it.

Lack of space animals looked bored. As a family of three we have just returned from a day trip to Prague Zoo . I feel compelled to write as I do not think the reviews on are a candid representation of the zoo. Whilst the zoo is very large and took us all day to walk around some of the older enclosures were very small and not well maintained.We saw lots of mice in the cages of the exhibits, cockroaches, mice and grass hoppers in with the rather sad looking tortoises, 3 Polar bears (which are solitary animals) in very small enclosure all showing signs of boredom, 7 giraffes in a very small indoor enclosure, a hippo with filthy water again demonstrating signs of boredom as were the elephants which seemed a little overcrowded in their paddock.....I am sure the Zoo meets regulations but had it not been for my son I would have left the zoo at the earliest opportunity as for me there was very little stimulation when you compare it to other zoo's around the world. I would not visit again as the Polar Bears are still playing on my mind as I write this note.On the plus side the restaurant food was very reasonably priced and very good. Portions were huge.

A nice day out. My partner and I came here on a boiling hot day, couldn't find any shade, kept having to go inside and get cool, although there were vending machines for water dotted all over the zoo which was good. Animals seemed happy enough and cages were clean. Spent a good few hours walking round and reading information about the animals - particularly about the flood that affected the zoo quite badly when Prague flooded in the early 2000s, there were also photos of the devastation and how the zoo got back on its feet. All in all a nice day, although nothing spectacular.

Healthy, well-cared for animals. We love going to zoos. We always go whenever we go to a new city. This was one of the best zoos We have ever been to. Animals had large, clean, well-maintained areas. You could tell they were very happy. There were so many animals you don't see at typical zoos. My husband and I spent the whole day there and were totally enthralled. The animal names are in english, but signs are mostly in Czech. Don't let that deter you. All of the animals were active, playing, and made for great photos. A definite must see! They also have the world's largest salamander :)

Excellent displays.. I am not a fan of animals in captivity, but I understand the requirement for research, breeding, and education and I think this zoo delivers that and makes it a very enjoyable zoo experience. Be prepared to do some walking, which is a good thing as it means the enclosures are of a good size. It was nice to see a lot of the animals active which I hope means they are quite happy. Highlights are the monkeys, polar bears, and the seals. Lots of playing going on, and very reasonably priced too.

Vivid presentation of animals. As many travelers admitted this particular zoo has an interesting presenting of animals, when it looks like some of them are not over a fence. It made so nice, that some animals are divided from a viewer just with some plants and a trench, which is partly hidden because of plants. Good, that zoo has many toilets around the area and there is a restaurant. Although restaurant is more like a canteen. The only way to get to the zoo with a public transport is to take 112 bus from metro station Nádraží Holešovice.

Great afternoon for the family. Bigger zoo than expected and we ended up staying an extra hour just to see everthing! The Zoo is 2 "sections", one lower section and one up the hill. They do offer a lift back up for really cheap.

Family friendly Zoo. Prague Zoo is located on the outskirts of Prague and is accessible by car and public transport. The park is located in a hilly terrain which invites varied and great outdoor areas for both animals and visitors.The area was adapted for families with great play areas and free lending of strollers. There were also several kid-friendly eateries.I visited the park in winter and it was more of the animals that were not present. I would therefore recommend to visit the park during the summer.
wild cz. we had a nice day there. it s a big Zoo and you should take enough time to see everything there. amazing big area .

Polar bears took our heart <3. It is nice to visit a zoo where you can see lots of space - for animals. Though it was winter time during our visit there was lot to see and enjoy. And polar bears just took our heart, one of them was having time of his life diving, swimming and floating on his back, smiling all the time. Prepare to walk quite a lot, so recommending good comfortable shoes.

Veryy nice. Though it was December, the zoo was still very nice and alive. It's place on the hill and below it, so the views are quite interesting. Many animals, large aviaries, elephant pavilion where you can see backstage of the zoo, mother-tapir with a baby, funicular.Must visit if you are with kids.
Great. I love this Zoo, they have very big place for animals, and it is very good to walk and spend time with kids
Brilliant zoo.. The best zoo we have been to. You get so close to the animals and there is so much to see. And amazing value to.

Great zoo. We had a great day here, even though it was cold and wintery. Well layed out with lots of open spaces. The animals seem healthy and well taken care of. Arrive early or you will miss half the animals as it's a big zoo.

Be prepared to walk a lot!. First views of the zoo were pretty good as we could go inside the warm to see the animals then on to the polar bears but after that is a little bit confusing to know where to go and we seemed to just be walking for miles just to see soil and trees. May be worth a trip in the summer but not so good in winter however was reasonably priced and a few nice food places inside

Superb to see the polar bears!. Mixed feelings about heading out to the zoo, but once we got there we wished that we'd arrived earlier in the day. A really well kept zoo, with plenty of space and environmental consideration. You felt as though the animals were put first. It was wonderful to see the polar bears swimming and playing, (had never seen before) and the kids loved the orang-utans. The chair lift down the cliff was novel, and we enjoyed seeing the penguins and baboons. The zoo is spread out over a large area, is very reasonable (CZK 600 for a family pass), with plenty of food/drink stations dotted around. This attraction works on a dull/drizzly day too, with plenty of indoor exhibits. Easy to get there and back - you can get the bus from directly outside to the metro station, which takes you in to the city centre in minutes. Alternatively, a taxi costs around CZK, but you'll need to arrange a pick-up if you need one.

Brilliant!. Wow! We had some pretty special experiences in this zoo! Highly recommend for families with children who love animals. A highlight was the lemur exhibit with the very friendly keeper who was more than happy to engage with our kids with information and the fruit bat exhibit. So, so many great moments! Easily accessible by public transport. Oh, and the meals were very reasonably priced in case you don't have time to pack lunch. Have fun!

Zoo day out. We spent an enjoyable day at the zoo. The animals were all in excellent condition in clean, large enclosures. Most information signs were in English. The chair lift took you up to the zoo heights where there were great views over the Vltava

Day at the Zoo!. Loved this zoo! The animals are well maintained have spacious enclosures and they have a vast "collection" of animals to see. All look well fed and happy enough, the zoo is huge, 3-4 hours to stroll leisurely around, definitely recommend.

Great fun. My boyfriend and I had lots of fun visiting Prague Zoo for the day, was so much bigger than we were expecting and ended up spending nearly 4 hours here! Tickets are very cheap and good value and there is a regular bus route to get her easily. Wide variety of animals to see, our favourites were the penguins and monkeys. However, I was quite upset to see the lions and tigers in such small indoor spaces, they did have access to go outside but these doors were closed during our visit. One tiger seemed very distressed and was pacing back and fourth, this was quite upsetting to see and there were no staff about to inquire as to whether they were locked in due to it being feeding time soon or if they were locked in all day for visitors to see. I do not feel the treatment of animals here is as high of a standard compared to zoo's in the U.K. Despite this, majority of the other animals appeared to be content and had good living environments.
so nice for children. only few words: all the family that come in Praha must go here with the Children.... is better without the rain, but for the children is a fantastic experience

Great place to spend a day or two with young kids. This zoo is huge and have inside all kind of attractions for kids like a train who can take you up and down the hill which the zoo located in. If you traveling with young kids , it's recommend to take the train to the top of the zoo and to go down by foot. Their is also small cable car to go along the zoo, and large playground on the bottom of the. Zoo. The are lots of animals and shows of the animal and you can spend their a full day or even two.

wonderful zoo. Rating first in English, the same FinnishLopussa arvostelu suomeksi!The zoo admission price was reasonable and there really get to see a lot of animals. The animals are great and big spaces, both indoors and outdoors. In particular, fell in love, "savannah" which was a big area, though still saw in the spring, apparently out of service due to cold weather. Also, many kiosks and coffee shops were still closed, but it is not hindered us, is it still was not tourist season.The zoo has a lot to walk and we, the two adult people we spent here for about 5-6 hours .. kids with time should be sure to set aside a lot more.Definitely recommended the visit to Prague to visit here!Eläintarha sisäänpääsyn hinta oli kohtuullinen ja siellä todella näkee paljon eläimiä.Eläimet ovat suuret tilat niin sisällä kuin ulkona, Erityisesti ihastuimme "Savanniin", joka oli iso alue, mutta ilmeisesti näin keväällä vielä pois käytöstä kylmän sään takia. Myös monet kioskit ja kahvillat olivat vielä kiinni, se ei häirinnyt meitä, eihän vielä ollut varsinainen matkailusesonki.Eläintarhassa tulee käveltyä paljon, meiltä kahdelta aikauiselta aikaa kului 5-6 tuntia, ja enemmänkin olisi saanut kulumaan :D lasten kanssa aikaa tarvitsee varata varmasti veilä enemmän :).Suosittelemme ehdottomasti käymään jos prahassa vierailet
Even during the winter. I love this Zoo! Even during the winter you can spend a good 3-5 hours here! The zoo is well planned that you can see the animals from only a few meters away!

Brilliant !. Loved this zoo, one of the best I have ever been too. It's set over enormous grounds so all the animals have enough space and you can spend the whole day wandering around . Saw polar bears for the first time which was amazing !Leave a whole day to do it there are so many animals you will not want to miss anything .
Fantastic zoo - my absolute favourite!. My all time favourite zoo! Go see it and love every second - polar bears, hippos. A fun filled day out and easily accessible via bus!

some very special exhibits.. Having been to a few zoos, I was a bit concerned this zoo (rated on many sites as the best in Europe) was going to be a flop. I was concerned about the rest of the zoos in Europe. But a couple of minutes in and we came across these self contained indoor ecosystems with glass doors in and out to control the environment. Inside were various animals. We were there in winter. Summer must be amazing. All the animals that would normally be outside in summer were inside, but the zoo is set up for visitors to see the animals in indoor exhibits. Well worth the visit. Kids loved it.

One of the best Zoo in Europe. Fantastic Zoo in a beatiful settings close to Prague city - animals has big areas to walk around and well maintained. Great place for kids and families for a whole day. Restaurants are good.

Best zoo have ever been to!. I am so glad I found this Zoo, we found it before we went to Prague on top things to do in Prague.It works out about £5 entry for an adult which is unheard of in England.This was without a doubt the best zoo we have been to and we had such a great day, even had some snow!All the animals could be seen easily even though lots were inside due to the cold. The zoo was pretty empty people wise and it was really great.

It was an excellent zoo. It was an excellent zoo with great collection as well a large collection of flora and fauna,we went by under way railway,ticket price was around euro6-euro7.you need a whole day to see that,they have penguins and polar beer also.

An excellent zoo and a memorable experience. Prague Zoo is truly worth a visit. The new facilities are excellent and worth the trip on the bus to get there. This is a great example of a modern zoo. It is a bit of a walk to get round the whole thing but well worth it.

Great zoo. One of the best zoos we've been to. It's easy to get to (one tram and short bus) from Prague. It was really cheap and the restaurant had some great Czech food on offer. The animals were amazing - the highlight was a polar bear swimming right in front of you. Be prepared to wrap up warm though as it's very exposed

all-day funny time you can spend in the nature. Train that gets you to different places in the zoo, is only 50 CZK. It's a wonderful experience for the kids and there is possible to track the animals. From the cable car is a beautiful view of the city and saves you the way downhill and uphill. Plenty of restaurants provide plenty of food and drink. There is plenty of places for children to play where they can have fun and parents to relax.I recommend to use a boat from the centre of Prague. It will bring you a great experience and relaxation.

Amazing Zoo. Prague Zoo is one of the most beautiful Zoos in the world. They are trying to prepare for animals their natural surrounding and you see many and many animals. Zoo is quite big and I think that one visit is not enough. I was there many times and I cannot say that I saw all animals. If you want to see some smaller zoos with very nice concept - visit Zoo in Plzen or in Liberec.

Hidden gems. I found out about the zoo via trip advisor and was so he I did. If you are able to go, please do as it is a total hidden gem in the trip. We got the metro c and followed previous trip advisor instructions to get the 112 bus.so easy we thought we had messed u! Such a fabulous day and so worth the price.If you get a chance get on it!!! That said if you are unable to cope with hills or steep stairs or slopes give them a miss. Would definitely return with my kids xxx

Best zoo I've ever been to. We are from the UK and have been to lots of different zoos. Prague zoo is the best zoo we have ever been to, it's huge and there are so many different animals to see and they are all very lively.

Great outing. Visited Prague Zoo in a foggy morning. Despite the chill, children were thrilled by the polar bears, owls, swans and a free roaming peacock. Adults appreciate the thematic areas of Indonesian forest and elephants. Coming from Asia, we are impressed with the holistic presentation of animals in relation to the cultural aspects. Prague zoo is easily accessible by bus 112 and metro Nadrazi Holesovic (Red line). A taxi ride costs about 220kr from Central train station Hlvani nadrazi. Vending machines offering drinks and snacks are available along the pathway. Ocean cafe offers reasonably- priced lunch, with options including pasta, salad, roast chicken, ice cream and drinks. An enjoyable 4hr outing. Can image the zoo being packed with visitors in summer!
Would highly recommend! . We were skeptical about visiting a zoo while we were away especially when there was so much in Prague to see already but this zoo was amazing! :)
very nice. just when you get in take a look at the map because it is a very big place and you may miss something...

Great day out. Decided to take a trip to the zoo after overdoing the sites of this beautiful city.£6 ish to get in what a bargin. A great day out far better than London at a fraction of the price. Could easily spend the day their. Great displays animals well cared for.Plus the restaurant just outside very nice as well.Both well worth the visit

One of the best. The Prague Zoo is one of the best I have ever visited. Great collection of animals, very well kept, a variety of additional entertainment programs. I strongly recommend visiting Prague zoo

Fabulous Zoo. Ok lets start by how to get there ... catch the metro line C (red line) to Nadrazi Holeservice. Follow the signs out to the zoo and then catch the 112 bus which takes you all the way there. In total takes around 30-40 mins so get a 90 min ticket for 32k and remember to stamp it at the start of your journey.The zoo itself is pretty big with all sorts of animals to see. Enclosures are pretty good, and great for photography as you can get very close. Lots of toilets, places to eat drink and although its built on a hill, the walking wasn't too bad.It was pretty cold the day we went but most of the animals were outside and those that weren't e.g gorillas, giraffes ... we could see inside quite easily. Really enjoyed this place and would expect that on a warm summers day you can easily spend the whole day there.

OK. We decided to visit the Zoo as we had nothing left to do in our 4 day trip to Prague.The zoo is quite large and had many animals to see including elephants, polar bears, lions, tigers, gorillas etc.However, we got to the zoo at about 10.30am and as were walking around most of the animals were kept inside and not out in their enclosures.

Great zoo. Easy to get to from Prague on the tram and bus takes about 35 minutes. Lots of unusual animals an big animals such as polar bears, Tigers leopards gorillas etc. there is a cable car to take you to the top of the hill but we walked up and weaved our way down. Was a very cold day and some animals were inside but saw most things. Enclosures were very thoughtful and clean and was overall a very nice zoo

Day visit . Visited for the day with a friend. Arrived via the underground and then a local bus. There was lots to see including shows. The only downside was that the information at each encloser did not include an English translation.
You can bring in your own food and drink.
Definitely recommend this day trip.
Best Zoo I've ever been. I've ran through it in a couple of hours in the winter because I had to leave, and even then it was so great. Also Batcave...

Good and bad . This zoo had a big selection of animals and was very large! We went on a really cold day and the animals seemed pretty miserable.
