Some of the animals have enough room, but some others (like the polar bears,parrots, and bald eagle) had not nearly enough room. Those animals in particular, along with others, seemed trapped and sad in the small enclosures.

ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. We haven't been to the zoo for years so we were really looking forward to our visit and we certainly wasn't disappointed. We started on the upper level and worked our way down to the ground level by using the chair lift which gave you a brilliant view of the city. The zoo is very well laid out and sign posted and the range of animals etc is second to none. The amenities are also excellent there are plenty of places to eat and drink and also plenty of public conveniences, there was not a queue to be had at any of them even though the zoo was busy everything ticked over like clockwork. The entry price is unbelievably cheap, we cannot praise it enough - WELL WORTH A VISIT.

One of the best in Europe. I have been there with my two children and they were literally in heaven. But this place is not only for children! So many interesting animals and places. The round trip around the ZOO takes approximately 4 hours. Prepare your legs!

Thoroughly enjoyable. Visited this zoo without really knowing what to expect. It was quiet due to the time of year which made it much more of an experience. A huge range of animals, never thought I would get to see a polar bear! Were there for 6 hours and had a great time.

good. beautiful zoo, a lot of animals. Only this day we can't see some of the most popular animals because some television crew filmed individual animals so we can't go in pavilion. lift is a great and very exciting, all super ...
cool zoo. the zoo is beautiful. prepare for a fair amount of walking. the animals are well kept...I would advise that the best time to visit would not be in the winter.

a wonderful day out. Wishing for a break from all the culture of Prague, we decided to spend a peaceful day at the zoo.The zoo was easy to access, taking the metro and then a special "zoo bus" (121), it was possible to get there on a 24kr ticket from the Florenc station.The entrance cost 200kr.We spent the next 5-5 hours looking at a wide array of animals, including some "theme" exhibitions, such as the Indonesia display (Komodo dragons) and the Elephant section (which includes an exhibition of the living quarters and about how the animals are kept).Apparently this is one of the top seven zoos in the world. Well worth a visit.

Interesting. Lot of animals in really nice corridors. I was very taken aback how nice it could be. My opinion of ZOO was : every animal in horrible cage, but this was so attractive! There are so many animals, that you can spend two days in here! Especially for children, it is so interesting, because there are also interactive games for them, not only looking at animals. really amazing!

Awesome. I got there at 12 and I still didn't have time to visit all. I have to say that it was a long time since I visited a zoo, and this one for me it was a joy. I mean c'mon they have a tropical environment created by them inside of a big sphere and you feel like your inside of a jungle. They have a lot of animals, it's no point to name them because the list will be too long. You can even rent minicars . They have machines where you can buy soda or water like ever 50 meters. It's really good, and it's worthing the money. Definitely

One of the best zoos you'll every visit!. Worth the visit! Easy to walk around, a large variety of animals, well kept and well maintained. Interesting! A relatively large area for the animals to roam around.

This zoo is fantastic!!!!!!!. I was a bit dubious about the zoo before I arrived, however having read the positive reviews we decided it was definitely worth a try!!! This zoo is amazing and far better than many in America. The huge variety of animals, and scenic landscaping makes this zoo a must see. The polar bears were my favourite; you can get so close, but not so close as to feel uncomfortable. The animals all have huge enclosures, and look really happy and well cared for.... An absolute must see!!! Please allow yourself plenty of time to look around, it is massive. The cable cars are also a must do.
An Amazing Zoo. I've visited the zoo on a sunny October day , this is one of the greatest zoos i've ever visit . Big variety of animals and very easy to reach via public transportation (Bus)

Very nice zoo.... Great zoo, it is big, has a lot of animals a lot of pavillons and its fun. It has a lot of space for kids to have fun. There is a lot of buffets, toilletes and a garbage can everywhere so it is very clean. Great idea how to spend a whole day if you like animals or have kids.

Great place. I have visited the zoo in September 2015 and spent a great day there. There is a great variety of animals, unfortunately I did not get to see all of them as the grounds of the zoo are extensive and I had just a few hours. I enjoyed it very much!

An Amazing Zoo That Represents Prague's Warmth With Its Variety. Little did I know that a zoo could be so interesting. We had to walk a fair bit around but everything was worth it at the end. The shelters and cages are built in a way that you do not feel that animals are being ridiculed. In fact, I even got to touch the deer and the smaller furry animals. The exotic animals are a top attraction here. Who expected to see a polar bear at Prague? The big cats were a delight and we caught the cubs chewing on the tail of their mom too!

No comment ! Great zoo !. We were ther almost whole day and we had to do / see there still something. Great placed into to city, Nice view of pravice on the top, animals Were great / I think that the are happy there. :) best zoo till now.

Winter Zoo Fun. The boyf & I visited Prague zoo on a grey, rainy, November Sunday... And we loved it! So much to see and do, great value and lots of fun. Its easy to navigate the public transport and worth the trip. Awesome for couples, friends ad families

The closest experience with animals. Prague Zoo is my favourite zoo followed by the one in Hokkaido. In there, you can have a very close observation of the animals. Actually it is as close as you can even touch them when you have stretched out your arms. The design of the zoo is fantastic with surprise everywhere. My most unforgettable animal in the zoo was the polar bear. It swam round and round in the pool whenever it saw tourists. The cheetah area was well designed too! it was my very first time to be so close with animals like that.

Long day in the zoo. We had little time to see everything but we saw animals that we wanted. The most animals were closed because of the weather but I had the feeling that the animals were ok even in the closed boxes. It is huge and there is no train or something else to help to see even more. The kids get tired of walking the whole zoo.

New born animal. I have visited Prague ZOO after several years with my 8 year old nephew. Very nice place for a family trip all parts are nicely reconstructed and is great to see how many new born animals they have.

Great value for money. Entry currently stands at 200 CZK per adult which equates to around 5.00 GBP / 7.00 EUR. For that price it is fantastic value for money! You can get extremely close to a lot of the animals which allows for brilliant pictures, and at the time of year we visited the zoo was not busy at all which can be a bonus as you will not have to battle through crowds to see anything. To get around the entire site is roughly 10km and at a leisurely pace it took 6 hours to complete. Extremely accessible via public transport from the centre of Prague (we took the easy to navigate metro and then took a connecting bus service). We did not try any of the food facilities that were available but they seem like they might be an acquired taste; there are food and drink kiosks all around the site for a quick pit stop. Cannot recommend this place more highly, it is a must visit if you are a fan of zoos and animals.

Family Fun.... Truly a treat for the whole family! As a visitor to Prague with children, the Prague Zoo is a wonderful place to spend a day.As residents of Prague, we have the annual pass and visit frequently.

Very family friendly and excellent zoo..... I like visiting zoo's and was not disappointed by my visit here.Arrived at 10am and spent over 5 hours here and still didn't see everything.The place is beautiful, well run and well laid out, the views from the top are fantastic.There are toilets aplenty, so no need to worry where the next one is if you get caught short, there are also plenty of place for kids to play and have fun.The restaurant near the elephant enclosure serves a beautiful pint of cider, just to refresh yourself before the walk up the hills.Animals all looked to be in good condition and looked well looked after.Considering the low admission price it was the best value day out we had in Prague and would recommend to anyone wishing to visit Prague.
All animals in one place. To visit Prageu ZOO you need at least one all day, to see all animals that are here.. Wild animals have nice open coops, so you can meet tham right almost face to face.

Zoo Worth visiting. Went to the zoo as we read it was one of the best zoos on the world. We were not disappointed! We spent 4 hours and we could not get enough of it. There are plenty of species kept in good habitation. I wish i could speak Czech though bécause most of the write up is not translated in English.

Great experience . One of the most beautiful zoos I visited. It's huge. We spent more then four hours and it wasn't enough to see well all the attraction this zoo offers. I was especially amazed with the Indonesia jungle with great nature and waterfalls in it. Zoo has good connection to to city center.

Lots of animals, poor living conditions. . We visited the zoo and at some points it was enjoyable but the overwhelming consensus from my partner and I was the living conditions were too small and unsuitable which was quite clearly distressing the animals. Upsetting really.
Fantastic Day Trip. Wonderful zoo. Easy to reach from the centre . Prices far cheaper than UK . One of the best zoos I have been to . A must see in Prague

Problems with language. The ZOO is beautiful.
But I didn't liked that almost everything was writen only in Czech language. A lot of the facts about animals I could not understand.
Fun day out. Fun time, clean, very interactive. Really well later out and easy to stroll through. A little hilly but great time over all!!

Fantastic Day. Not sure what it is about us visiting zoos in the winter but we always seem to. Prague zoo tops Berlins by far we were walking non stop for 5 hours around the whole thing and every animal was still out. It works out about 15 euros for us to go and a bus goes straight there. A very enjoyable day with lots to see!
Amazing zoo. Absolutely brilliant zoo! Excellent value for money at approximately six pounds and some wonderful animals! Be prepared for lots of walking though as the zoo is massive!!

An absolute treat- would go back as didn't have enough time!. My friend and I visited for a few hours one morning before our flight home. We really didn't have enough time to appreciate everything. I could have sat watching the polar bear and tiger for hours- majestic. The enclosures are all lovely and the animals looked very happy and healthy. Some very unusual animals as well that I've not seen elsrwhere. Very cheap ticket price and loads to see. Highly recommended. Fairly easy to get to by tram then bus. Half an hour tops from the centre.

Prague Zoo.. At 0900 hrs purchased a ticket costing 200 czk and entered the zoological park.Forbes traveler magazine had listed the Prague zoo as the seventh best zoo in the World in 2015 and hence i travelled this distance far out of Prague City.Excellent beyond description and Prague zoo is reputed for breeding endangered species.Saw a group of Gorilla's along with a baby being carried on its back by its mother.A handsome male silver-back was the breeding stud male. Prague zoo is also successful in captive breeding of Cheetahs and akin to the "Gorilla family" came across a Cheetah family in the zoo.Saw the "Sumatran" and "Malayan" tigers which could soon become extinct in the wild as well as captivity.I was lucky to view the last specimen of these species and hope that other tiger species like the Bengal and Siberian tigers from India and Russia don't face the same future decades from today.Viewed the giant ant-eater for the second time in my life the first being just a few days ago at the Schoenbrunn zoo in Vienna.Had to undergo another small hill trek as the zoo enclosures are situated on the slopes of a hill.Some of the prominent and endangered species enclosures have the animal name tag and description in English language while most other species are only in Czech language.Saw beautiful Gharials and Anaconda's.For the first time in my life saw the "Giant Chinese Salamander" which akin to the Panda is facing extinction in its natural habitat.Viewed the"King Vulture"and "Bearded vulture" as also many rare bird species.The view of Prague from the top of the hill is awesome and there is a rope - way for visitors not wanting to trek back to the base of the zoo. Finally after three hours of zoo viewing made me way to the exit and boarded the"112" bus back to the station.

Fantastic zoo! With a Polar Bear!. This is one of the best zoos I've ever been to, and the only zoo I've been to with a Polar Bear. Great variety of animals, fantastic atmosphere and there's a ski lift too!

Wonderful Zoo. Scenic, interesting and we'll worth a visit, so much to see and do that sadly we could not get around the whole zoo before closing time (the zoo closes 2 hours early in the winter months).For us, personal highlights included the Polar Bears, the Bats and Cért the (infamous) Honey Badger!

Beautiful and large zoo. Wow! Prague Zoo is definitely worth a visit.The Zoo Parc is very large, it can take about 4-5 hours.The animals looks very beautiful and groomed. Every kind of animal has an outer space and an inner space, so if you visit in the rainy weather, you won't miss the animals.There are some walk from the down part to the upper part, but if you don't like walking, you can take the funicular.The explanations are in about 5 languages, so everybody can understand.There are a lot of place to buy something to drink or to eat. In every corner you got a map, and some nice places for children to take pictures.All the family loved it a lot!

Very good Zoo. In very nice condition, many animals species, you definitely should go there especially with children. Zoo is very big, so you need to reserve at least 4 hours for that, but actually for visiting all animals you need much more time!!

Well worth the visit. Visited in July 2014. It was a very well maintained modern zoo. Large ground with every animal imaginable. There is food with non extortionate prices within the zoo ground. Recommended especially for family with young children.

Well worth a visit. Visited with 2 and 4 year old. Great day out easily enough their for a whole days fun. Fantastic selection of animals - special mention to Polar Bears! Easy to reach via metro and bus. Reasonable prices from the restaurant for lunch. Remember to purchase a map when buying your entrance ticket.The facilities were all clean and plentiful (and free! :) )

Beautiful and lots of walking. Lots of animals to see and kept in beautiful environments. The animals looked pretty happy where they were. Don't miss the Indonesian jungle where there are free flying fruit bats to welcome you.My favourite part were the elephant and giraffe dens.
Lovely place. Excellent atmosphere for visitors and most of the animals. You need a whole day to finish the routes. There is a small train inside the zoo if you are tired...

A fabulous zoo. We had SUCH a good day at Prague Zoo. The setting was stunning and the animals amazing. There was such a variety of animals and they all seemed healthy, active and comfortable. Particular highlights included the gibbons, spider monkeys and the baby gorillas, the big cats and the mountain goats. An excellent day out.

Very good zoo. The best thing is that I didn't expect anything special but visiting Prague zoo was one of the best decisions while we were visiting Prague. It was colorful experience for kids and adults.

Great Zoo, too much to see, park layout doesn't help.. I travelled here in March 2015, it was cold but dry, this place would be a nightmare if it rained. Allow yourself more than 3 hours to get around as the zoo is huge! The hill in the middle of the zoo makes the layout slightly awkward as the middle route (straight up the hill) has a lot to offer but entirely cuts out some of the best parts of the zoo. The middle route in itself is probably not worth a second climb once you have seen the park (once you finish a single loop of around 60% of the park you'll have been there at least 3 hours). The highlight of the trip for me was the more than incredible hippo enclosure which allows you see the near comic fashion in which hippos traverse the ground underwater. Hopefully I'll get to go again someday as after spending almost 5 hours there, I feel like I've still only seen 60-70% of what the zoo has to offer.

What a great day out. We visited the zoo by metro and bus which was really easy. It cost £6 entry per adult. We had a great day with many close encounters with various animals. My favourite was the large silverback gorilla. Take the chairlift for amazing views. Lots of walking, some uphill but a stunning place. There are many places to eat and drink and good facilities. It was a very enjoyable day out.

Awesome Zoo. It was really lovely to see the animals who all seemed to be enjoying themselves. Our favourites were definitely the polar bear and the mountain goats. There are a lot of hills and a lot of walking, we spent over four hours there so wear comfortable shoes, bring snacks if you want and bring sun cream if you need it. There are also areas with free WiFi so we got to Skype home for a bit and showed them the elephants etc. We also easily got there by public tram and bus from our hotel. I would definitely recommend going!

Amazing Zoo.. I visited this zoo in Feb 2015, the variety of animals is brilliant (Polar bears especially), some lovely shows and feeding times. be prepared to walk a lot if you wish to see every animal there. Well worth the money. One of the best zoos I've been to.

Best zoo we've visited.. Prague Zoo is the best of many zoos we have visited. Set out on a huge site, it has an enormous variety of animals, some of which you rarely see elsewhere eg hyenas and bush dogs. The enclosures are generally large and well thought out, enabling good viewing. The site is hilly so be prepared for a lot of walking; there are plenty of places to get snacks and drinks but all quite low key - we found it very refreshing that there was not an attempt to fleece you at every turn with photographs, face painting, balloons etc. The admission fee is very reasonable too, so a great value for money day out. There are great views from the top of the hill, and the chairlift is good fun if you don't mind a relaxed attitude to health and safety! Transport is easy, the 112 runs on a loop every five minutes from Nádraží Holešovice metro station on line C, but make sure you follow the orange signs to the zoo bus, not the blue bus signs or you'll end up in the coach station.

Gorgeous zoo - be prepared for some walking!!. Myself and my boyfriend spent about 4/5 hours here. There are some really unusual animals and they are really kept in wonderful enclosures. A lot of the indoor houses let you see animals right up close - including tigers and other felines. The animals are very far apart so be prepared for some serious walking - up hill too!! Well worth a visit, and the zoo is very reasonably priced. Its less than 10 euro and there are student prices too!

Let the elephants play outside. Got there on a sunny morning by public transportation which was very easy. The zoo is spread on a very large area of hills which means a lot of climbing and stairs. Most animals enjoy large spaces where they can run free. It was sad to find out the elephant island so large and inviting but the elephants were all confined to a small pavillon where they looked sad. No signs in any other language but Czech.

Beautiful, yet disappointing . Got there on a beautiful Friday morning,looking forward to see the elephants, giraffes and monkeys which you just don't get to see in every zoo. The zoo is beautiful without any doubt, the animals are located in green, wide open areas which is great to see. When we got to the elephants area we just Couldn't find them,it was sad to realize that they were in a small pavilion while they're beautiful closure was left empty. Be prepared for lots of walking, up and down the hills. The place is not really friendly for tourists cause all of the animal information is in Czech, nothing in English. Prices aren't expensive.

Very good, until you reach the elephants. Firstly, if this was based on what we saw of the elephants alone, it would be a zero or one star. They seemed distressed, bored and lonely. Two elephants were stood in the same spot, swaying from side to side for over 90 minutes. There was also a loud clicking sign that was annoying us for the time we visited, so no wonder how these animals must have felt. Also, over half their closure was closed, and there was no sign of a reason.Overall, taken the elephant enclosure out of the equatin, it his rouhly £6 to enter which is incredible when the animals, look extremely well cared for and the enclosure seem spacious and well thought out and especially when you compare that with UK prices.Gorillas, seals, giraffes and tigers all had lots of spaces inside and out to roam, it was just the poor elephants, that you can't shake out of your mind.Be prepared for lots of walking and not many food stalls.

Definitely a must . We visited the Zoo at our last day in Praha and it was a perfect choice. It lies in a very nice and big green area with hills at the side and is wonderful to walk through. There are so many different animals, for me there were a lot that I've seen for the first time in real. The prices are moderate and there are often places to sit, have a coffee or go to toilet. It was also very good to come by Metro and Bus. It was very fast and it seemed that there are driving buses all the time, we didn't have to wait for the bus on both ways. We had a great time there!

Fun to Visit and Cheap!. The zoo is pretty big so you will do a lot of walking throughout your time there. However, the variety of animals they have is awesome and they all looked pretty satisfied which is always nice to see. It's really cheap compared to the admission price you would pay at zoo in England.

A zoo for all tastes. This zoo specializes in habitats tailored to each animal. Using the natural bluffs in the zoo (built on two levels) it can provide large flee flight cage and nesting areas for large European vultures, for example. The cheetahs have a hilly enclosure (family of five-mother and 4 daughters)-allowing the cheetah to sit on a slope and stare intently at the human staring back from the other side of the fence.Lots of interior habitats and animal groupings. For example- a small Sonoran Desert habitat with sand and native vegetation features four lizard varieties and a small land tortoise-all from the region.Extensive exhibits of breeding and rescue programs like the indoor/outdoor giant Galapagos tortoise exhibit.Well worth a day-good and reasonable restaurants/cafeterias. Easy public transportation access-Metro C to Nadrazi Holesovice and bus 112(?) direct to the Zoo. ( A special Zoobus runs in the summer).Best of all-reasonable entrance fares. In fact, if you are over 70 you get in for 1 Koruna-it pays to get old, sometimes.

Very large Zoo in lush green environment. I visited the zoo on a Monday afternoon. It was not vey busy. The zoo is lovely. Its on a hill and is filled with trees and other green plants. There are plenty of toilets and lots of little places to eat. I ate at Oceans restaurant which I thought was okay but not great food.I was happy with how easy it was to get to by public transport. I took Line C metro to stop Nadrazi Holesovice stop and got the 112 bus straight away. All up it took me 30 minutes to get there.The zoo is very big. A few animals were not out when I visited like the lions so be prepared for this. If you have young children it would be difficult to get through the whole zoo in one day. Also about 60% of the zoo is on an upward steep slope that is tiring to walk but wow, the views are impressive. I took 3 hours to get through about 40% of the zoo. I would suggest you pick what you want to see and head for that. Anything else you get to see would be a bonus.I am glad that they are building a new area for the gorillas because the glass enclosure they are in is small. I hope they build something better for the cats in the glass enclosures.

fun. A great day out for kids and big kids! Bat enclosure with them flying about your heads was great and the glass fronted polar bear enclosure was super too. Baby giraffes made the day... easily accessible by bus.
Amazing. Spent there more than 6 hours and saw about half. It's maybe Europe's best Zoo, or at least very high in the top 3.

We had a fantastic time.. A friend and I had a very fun, fulfilled time at the zoo. It is excellent! It was a public holiday so the zoo was a busy place, but the busy state of the place didn't cause a problem as it was still chaos-free. It is nice and reassuring to see that sections of the zoo have really been conditioned to suit the needs of the animals so that the animals can thrive and be as they are as much as possible. The animals that need ropes get ropes, the animals that need really hilly uneven terrain get really hilly uneven terrain, it is evident that the animals are given the food that's the most suitable for them, and that, despite their relative lack of freedom, the animals are left to do the things that they naturally really want to do. It is uplifting to see the animals thriving in their high levels of welfare and so my friend and I were able to see the bright, cheeky eyes of parrots, the hilarious polar bear, the remarkable bloodthirsty vultures, the really beautiful and serene deer, and so on. We were able to enjoy lots of richly interesting sounds made by lots of different interesting animals. It has been very educational for us, adults. Very often, you are able to get as close to the animals as you want to - being in that cage of parrots or parrot-like birds was amazing, it seemed like the brightly beautifully coloured parrots felt at ease, cheerful, and relaxed, enjoying us in the cage and they didn't feel distressed by us humans. The lemurs were very entertaining and fun, being so close to the children and adults, they've been very charming and active, and not at all aggressive - there was no problem on the Island of lemurs. Before we visited the zoo we already had lots of friends telling us what a great time they've had there and it's excellent. The zoo is a big place so if you'd like to take it easy, be relaxed and not watch animals too hard, there's plenty of opportunity to do that too. It is a very clean, orderly and hygienic public place but I found it annoying that people were smoking cigarettes a number of times during my half-day visit to the zoo. It would be nice if the zoo sets aside only several smoking areas inside the zoo and ban smoking everywhere else so that I don't have to suffer from other people's smoke while enjoying the sight of very beautiful animals.Go there!

Lovely in every season. Huge, well taken care of, good restaurants, lovely view of Prague. You can stroll around with friends or take your kids, they will love it. There's always something new everytime I visit. Recommended to visit on weekdays.

WOW WOW WOW!. We had planned 4 hours for our Prague Zoo visit but ended up spending 9 hours there and that tells a lot about our wonderful experience! We reached the zoo at 10 AM through quite an enjoyable Tram and Bus journey, bought our tickets and entered a magical world! Abhay was most excited seeing all those animals, greenery and birds right from the start. We saw so many birds, reptiles, insects and animals for the first time; it was one amazing experience!From the polar bears to the giraffes to all those wild cats to the penguins, every experience was a special one! Another special part of that day was the awesome lunch we had at the Gočáry Restaurant which serves Czech Cuisine. We ordered slowly baked duck thigh served with 2 types of steamed cabbage and Czech dumplings which was simply fabulous. The Grilled chicken Breast served with potato puree, mushrooms sauce, cauliflower puree and caramelised pickled onions was also very impressive. The perfect weather and all that greenery around us made our meal further spectacular!Our 18 months old son had a ball looking at all those animals, birds and reptiles! This one is a not to be missed experience in Prague!

Excellent day out. Easy to get by subway and bus. Very reasonably priced compared with other zoos. Good selection of animals. Lions and Hippos were missing when we visited. We were almost 4 hours and didn't see everything as it was very cold the day we visited
huge perfect zoo. This place is awesome. I never expected that i will be speechless after visiting zoo. Unbelievable animals, exhibits also food and prices

just amazing ZOO. we have visited many Zoo in the world and the one in Prague is among the best for sure. great variety of animals kept in nice conditions, placed in a wonderful part of the city next to the Vltava river. if you like animals and you visit with children, definitely a must go and see

Excellent Zoo kids will love it !. Went to Prague Zoo whilst on holiday in Prague it was amazing orangatangs, meerkats, elephants, hippos, rhinos you name it this place has got it, and only around £6.00 British pounds to get in it's amazing value for money the Zoo is massive so I recommend leaving early in the morning as you will need a full day to get round it all, there is a bat cave you can go through and bats miss your head by centimetres I recommend it for the thrill seekers it was very amusing, kids will love it and it's just a case of a train and bus to get to from the city centre of Prague.Have a wild day out !

So much to see! amazing!. went the Prague for the weekend and visited the zoo. spend around 6 hours there it was huge! so much to see and the animals looked happy and were really amazing. iv never been so up close to tigers and polar bears before it was such a fantastic experience! highly recommend!!

Nice walk. You can spend there whole day, or just take a few-hours walk. Nice to go with children, but pretty cool for a date too. A lot of pavilons have been reconstructed, so you can enjoy animals in more natural conditions (if it's possible to say so in a zoo). Get to know which animals have a baby and the times of feeding :-)

Great to spend time with children. The ZOO went through the renovation (some places are still to be reconstructed) - new playgrounds for children, many other activities for children, great animal houses, new places to eat. It is better to go there during working days - weekends are overcrowded. Also July and August are quite busy. I recommend to start at the bottom part of the ZOO and go uphill. You can easily spend there the whole day.
Super. Great place to visit, well maintained, kid's and dog's friendly. well preserved with all services needed.great to combine with botanical garden visit.
Higly recommended. One of the best in Europe, beautifully located, full of spectacular animals. I really recommend for sunny day in Prague.
Great zoo!. Really great zoo, very big and open. Took us half a day and we didn't even see half of it! Recommended to families with children and anyone who's into zoo's in general.
Budapest, Hungary. Beautiful Zoo! Must see if you visit Prague! After our visit I understand why this is the fourth best zoo in the world!

Best place to learn about animals . We were there all day, walking and watching the wise range of animals. Zoo is huge and wonderful. Whatever animals look happy, I'm concern about keeping them in gates. For example

What a zoo. This zoo kept us busy for the whole day and it only cost £24 for the 4 of us. It is clean and tidy and you can get so close to the animals it is amazing. The food was inexpensive and of good quality compared to other attractions we have visited. Even though it was raining the whole day we still had a great time .

Great chance to spend a good time with the family in nature and to see Prague from above. When You will visit this Zoo, every time and day is the "best". Even in rainy or cold days. The Zoo is spread on the hillside bank of the Vltava River, so You have to count with walking uphill or downhill (depends which parking place You will choose). Of course Yu can use public transport and pass the main gate. In the Zoo You can take a ride on cable train too. On both levels rides trains for tired visitors (payed extra). On the highest point of the Zoo is 18,5 m high tower (free). I recomend to climb, because the look on Prague surroundings is great. Many of the spots with animals are new (the best is with elephant, hippos and giraffes) on the upper level of the Zoo. In the lower part of the Zoo are the best spots: gorillas, lemurs and penguins. Don´t be affraid to get hungry or thirsty- there are many places to rest and take some food or drinks. For children is in the lover part of Zoo a small village Zoo with goats, rabbits and other animals and the children can go inside to the animals. And for kids activities is in the lover part a Bororo vilage with bridges, swings, nets etc.Best way to spend some time in Prague is to visit this Zoo.
Prague Zoo. Excellent day long attraction. Animals easily viewed. Very tiring though as there is so much walking and s of uphill treks.Well worth visiting.lot

Great but long . The zoo is fantastic git loads and loads of animals but would recommend a jacket and to go early as the park is massive. It took it 5 hours to go round which was redicules but apart from all that walking I'd say get your self there

Fantastic Day Out. I'm a huge fan of zoo's and safari's and was extremely impressed by how big Prague zoo is!It's great value for money only paying around £23 converted, what attracted me to visiting is the zoo has polar bears along with wide variety of other species. We had missed the reptile opening times but had great fun seeing the rest.It's a good full day out and prices once inside the zoo aren't too bad either for drinks and snacks.To get there from Prague town we needed to get the metro then the bus, Google Maps helped this as it told us exactly what we were looking for along with times. Taking no longer than 20 minutes and not costing much.Would recommend for any animal fanatic or family.

Amazing day out. Prague zoo is the BEST zoo we have ever visited, no wonder it ranks as one of the best zoos in the world !!We made the 20 minute journey from our hotel by metro /bus & arrived at 11 a.m. on a beautiful sunny day. We paid our admission fee - 200 Czk - excellent value for money ! & purchased a map for a few coppers, which came in handy as the enormity of the place is mind blowing !.We began our tour to the right, going into the jungle themed area , then just followed the signs to all of the many different areas of the zoo.There are too numerous animals, etc. to name which we loved, but we particularly enjoyed the polar bears enjoying their swim, the many different species of the monkey/ ape family- loved the baby orang-utans though, very cute & funny !.There are also many species of snakes, insects, birds, the list goes on...The whole area of the zoo is brilliantly set out, everything in here is just so interesting, informative & very educational.Also there are a few (small ) but very reasonably priced souvenir shops, places to eat & drink - again very reasonably priced, & there are plenty of toilet facilities throughout.We guessed we'd spend a few hours here, but it actually took us a whole 6 hours in total !! , so be prepared for a long - but fantastic day out.  We also noticed that there were stroller carts for the little kids to sit in to be pulled around by the adults, but didn't notice the charge for these, but a great idea nonetheless. So to sum up Prague zoo, fascinating, eye opening, & worth every penny, amazing, you cannot fail to be impressed by such a massive zoo.ranks as one of the best zoos in the world !!We made the 20 minute journey from our hotel by metro /bus & arrived at 11 a.m. on a beautiful sunny day. We paid our admission fee - 200 Czk - excellent value for money ! & purchased a map for a few coppers, which came in handy as the enormity of the place is mind blowing !.We began our tour to the right, going into the jungle themed area , then just followed the signs to all of the many different areas of the zoo.There are too numerous animals, etc. to name which we loved, but we particularly enjoyed the polar bears enjoying their swim, the many different species of the monkey/ ape family- loved the baby orang-utans though, very cute & funny !.There are also many species of snakes, insects, birds, the list goes on...The whole area of the zoo is brilliantly set out, everything in here is just so interesting, informative & very educational.Also there are a few (small ) but very reasonably priced souvenir shops, places to eat & drink - again very reasonably priced, & there are plenty of toilet facilities throughout.We guessed we'd spend a few hours here, but it actually took us a whole 6 hours in total !! , so be prepared for a long - but fantastic day out.  We also noticed that there were stroller carts for the little kids to sit in to be pulled around by the adults, but didn't notice the charge for these, but a great idea nonetheless. So to sum up Prague zoo, fascinating, eye opening, & worth every penny, amazing, you cannot fail to be impressed by such a massive zoo.

one of the best zoos we have visited. This zoo is great fun and was quiet during the two weekdays when we went in Winter and Autumn. It has a wide variety of animals and is beautifully set out, especially the elephant area. It offers great views and walks and it is easy to spend a day here. It is vfm in terms of entrance fee and the price of drinks and snacks. Looking forward to returning.

Beautiful Zoo. This is a kind of ZOO that I want to see. You can spent there whole day, you can have a lunch there (average quality) and also lots of beautiful animals which look happy. Atmosphere in Prague ZOO is super. For me the highlight were Red Panda (you have to be lucky to see this guy) and Lemurs ( you can go to them in the cage ). ZOO is one of the places that I like to see again and again.

A must when in Prague. I make sure I visit the zoo whenever I go away, and Prague zoo is huge. The layout is on the side of a hill does mean that it isn't the easiest to navigate if you have any mobility issues. The array of animals to see is great, and some of the more unusual species make the visit worth while even for the most sceptical zoo visitor. The food and drink available in the park is good, and reasonably priced, not as cheap as some of the centres eateries, but you wouldn't expect it to be when you are in an enclosed tourist area.Easily a half day worth of fun, and for most people probably more like a day.
Must see in Prague. Amazingly entertaining place with great variety of animals. A must-see destination in Prague! Put your comfortable shoes and prepare to spend entire day!
A must see. We were so happy to see Zoo Praha. The best zoo so far. The place is well organized. Enourmous kind of animals and amazing views over Prague

Take the day off in Prague and go to the zoo!. Me and my boyfriend have a tradition to visit all the zoo we can go to, and read about the Prague zoo before visiting the city. Of all the zoo we have visited (Berlin, Amsterdam, Spain, Portugal, London) this one is defiantly the BEST. It is huge, spend a whole day there if you plan to go. Lot of animals and the best thing is that they have plenty off space or/and big cages. Looking healthy and happy (compared to being in a zoo). The day ticket is low cost, in the zoo they have a lot of restaurants, drinks and good (free) toilets.

Spend the Day. The Prague Zoo is hands-down the best zoo I have ever visited. It's hard to even know where to begin writing a review, but since a zoo is about animals first and foremost, I'll start there. The zoo has an amazing variety of animals - some of which I've never seen (the gharials/"chambral" were the highlight for me). The enclosures for the most part were large and well thought out. If you had to be an animal in a zoo, this would definitely be the one to be in. There were outdoor areas, shelter, room to climb, water features, etc. That said, the animals were still very accessible to visitors. I was especially impressed with the mountain goat area, which was a rock cut on the side the hill that was at the centre of the zoo. Information about each animal was available in Czech and English. The layout of the zoo was great as well. I enjoyed the fact that it was built on a hill, which the planners have used to create diverse habitats, but which also made it interesting enough just for the walk. At the top of the hill there's a free tower you can climb for a photo-worthy view of Prague. If you don't feel like walking or if you have a disability, you can take a chair lift up or down the hill (which I didn't do, but appreciated the option). There's also a neat geological trail, with some impressive fossils on display and a shop at the end with some excellent specimens for sale. As the zoo is easily a full day activity (a day is a must if you want to try to see it all), it was good to find out that there were lots of opportunities to purchase food and water on site, with several seating areas. Bathrooms are available throughout, with no fee. One thing I really liked is that the vending machines (for pop and water) took credit cards, so you didn't have to have change on hand. Getting there was easy via transit - from the subway, there's a direct bus from the Nádraží Holešovice station (making travel to and from approx. $3 CAD total). The cost of the zoo itself was minimal - they could increase the cost 3x what it currently is and it would still be acceptable for the quality of the attraction. The only "negative" is that there was no real gift shop at the exit (just a small shop with stuffed animal toys). There are small gift shops throughout, all with a different selection. Keep in mind that if you see something you like in one of them, you should probably buy it then. One other thing to mention is that though I was not travelling with kids, I could see that there were lots of different play areas that looked really cool. There's a whole "Children's Zoo" section, and there looked to be a neat play structure at the Bororo Reserve area. Even though there were areas with stairs, as the zoo is on a hill, there were ramps on the side where strollers could be pushed up and down. It seemed very family-friendly. All in all, I highly recommend this zoo, both from the perspective of a visitor and for consideration of the animals housed within. I would say it's a must-do on any trip to Prague. I wouldn't hesitate to go back, and if I lived there, I would definitely get an annual pass. Protip: Before I went, I read online that there were no English maps available on site (I cannot verify if this is true). It was recommended to download a high-res version (easy to find via Google) of the English map in advance and keep it on your phone, which I did and I found to be very convenient. There are pictures on the map to help identify which animal is which, but it was better to be able to read it as well.

Most incredible zoo I've visited. We went here on our last time as a break from the city centre & it was well worth trying to work out the bus system!The zoo is huge and has a great range of animals, it's easy to spend hours there without realising. Loved it. Definitely recommend if you have a spare afternoon/day in Prague.

must !. Prague Zoo is number 4 in the Top 10 Zoos. Great attraction for a kids and whole family. Huge place, with fine design and super cool animals. You can freely spend a day just walking around. Easy to come, transportation is very useful. There are some true stars,You'll fall in love with . ....
greate. sure if you travel to prague you need to visit the zoo. we visit it in winter and spend two days to look all that they have. or you can go early in the morning and leave zoo in evening.

Eh. For a place that takes pride in being the #7 best zoo in the world, I was very disappointed. Don't get me wrong, it was a lovely zoo. The range of animals that were there was great-animals that I have never seen before. What put me off was the way everything was set up. Some of the animals you could only see through a tiny crack in the wall. Also, I wasn't too happy about the size of the closures, many of them seemed too small for the animals that were in there. Also, I don't mean to sound like an ignorant American, but there was hardly any English on any of the descriptions of the animals. For such a high of travel and quite an interesting zoo, to only have things in Czech was not a smart move on their part. I think they should at least have a guide you can buy or rent to hear about things in different languages. On another note, I really did enjoy seeing their variety of animals. Also, they did a tiger feeding, and that was also very interesting to watch.
Fourth best in the world and can see why. I'm a big animal lover so this was a must. Amazing range of animals. Well set out. Love it! Highly recommended :)
Whole day at the zoo.. When you go there, make sure you have at least 5-6 hours. Lots od animals and birds to see. Many food points. Free toilets. Great way to spent a day in Prague.

Huge zoo with lots to see. This zoo needs a whole day to enjoy. The animals have adequate enclosures for their needs. I like that you can get close to come of them for example you are allowed in the lemur enclosure. Loads of food stalls etc and toilets which are clean

Fun. Huge zoo park. We walked for 4 hours and did not finish all of it. Great change of scenery out of touristic prague. You get out of the area in 15 minuts by taxi. It is a very clean zoo without a lot of nasty smells. Great to spend a day there if you are on a family vacation.

Large but Average. Zoo was very large, Was very excited about going here as it has been voted the number 4 Zoo in the World. I have been to a lot of zoo's and found Prague Zoo very average. It is very large and there are carts to bring people to different parts if need be. We walked the whole zoo. Lots of stops for refreshments (ice cream, water and they sell alcohol too!) Enclosures were a decent size. The Gorillas were no where to be found and was very disappointed by the fact that there was only one Lion. There are chair lifts which I would recommend to have a go on. Zoo is just average, doesn't stand out in any way.

Great place to spend your day for kids and adults. I always enjoy Prague ZOO so much! It is great place, the animals are being so good taking care of, the people working and volunteering there are doing great job!.... everybody should go visit this place and support it as much they can...

The zoo!. We were a bit disspointed since there was a lack of animals in their exhibitions (like lions and tigers). Also the varity of the animals is pretty average.On the bright side, the place itself is great and has a great view, there are many different places to eat and rest.Most of the animals seem as they have an appropriate housing.

One of the "must see" in Prague. It is best place to spend one free and sunny day in Prague. Even without kids it will be interesting for adult people. There are so many animals that you will forget which you had seen already and what not yet. Every half an hour one of the animals is being feeded. Advice to see feeding of otters - by alive mice.

A really great experience - again.. It was not the first time, but I enjoyed it again. I have been to other zoo parks in the world as well, but I never saw a prettier and bigger and cosier zoo than this one in Prague. It really deserves to be the 4th best zoo in the world on TripAdvisor here. If you're in Prague, come by & enjoy.

If Noah needed more animals. Prague zoo is by far the biggest zoo we've ever visited. You can easily spend a whole day a wandering around looking at the animals. The majority of the attractions are outside so if the weather is poor it could make for a pretty miserable day.We used public transport to get to the zoo from our hotel on Wenceslas Sq, it's pretty easy only 4 stops on the Metro then the free bus to the zoo.There are plenty of food/drink stalls dotted around the zoo so there's no need to go hungry on your day out.

Better than expected!. I entirely didn't expect the zoo to be as large as it was. It was easy to get to by bus, cheap and a good range of animals. Definitely worth a visit if you have a few spare days in Prague
Amazing Zoo. The best zoo I've ever been. Beautiful animals in a beautiful designed zoo. Free flying bats over your heads. A lot of nice impressions threw a intelligent zoo map.
Massive! . Huge zoo with such a huge range of animals. Very easy to get to. Ski slope style lift is a great feature that connects two halves of the zoo. Well worth a visit.

Great cable car!!!!!. I would recommend to go early in the morning, so you can go through all the animals. It is easy to arrive at the Zoo with the bus and the tram. It costs 200 CZK for an adult. The cable car is great and it costs 20 CZK one way, plus you have an amazing view. The tigers seemed stressed. I loved the polar bears playing. But the Zoo really needs to put more descriptions in English and staff should speak good English!

A large impressive zoo with lots to see. This zoo had almost every animal I could imagine, and is easily one of the best zoos I've ever been to. Unfortunately it was overcrowded with people which made it a real chore trying to see some of the animals in the indoor areas due to pushing and shoving. It was a very hot day, and walking around on the steep terrain can become tiring, so make sure you come early as it will take a long time to get round and see everything. My favourite area was the alligators which is easily missedThe animals all seem to be well treated although in some places it seemed they lacked any sort of privacy (Good for visitors, but not for the animals). There are a variety of restaurants around and free Wifi (for people who feel the need to post everything on Facebook immediately). One of the highlights of the zoo is the view from the top which gives a great panorama of Prague. It was nice to sit here in the restaurant and cool down and relax tired legs.Getting to the Zoo is really easy using the metro and bus. The zoo is the last stop on the bus route so you won't get lost. There is also paid car parking if you come by car.This zoo is definitely worth a visit, but make sure you come early and give yourself plenty of time.
nice to see but not in the summer. great diversity of animals. Unfortunately when we went (july) it was very very hot and all the animals were hiding in the shadow and bored

Amazing zoo with amazing prices . This zoo was not only filled with every animal possible, it was very well priced and filled with beautiful scenery. I loved the polar bears and bats, that actually fly around your head! The drinks and snacks are so cheap and nice and admission is only 200 cz!

Improved still more... Best European Zoo. Od posledni navstevy pred ctyrmi lety udelali v Zoo kus prace. Velmi chvalim nove restaurace, zazemi pro navstevniky s detmi, cistotu, stanky s vkusnymi suvenyry. I takove malickosti jako slunecniky v restauraci uz dnes nemusi mit reklamni logo, pouze logo Zoo Praha. Since my last visit 4 years ago, they improved further more. Big commend for new restaurants with facilities for children, perfectly clean, stylish souvenirs shops. But above all, great variety of species, beautiful natural "paddocks"... Best European Zoo for sure!

Best zoo I've been too !. Excellent zoo with lots of animals including ones that i haven't seen before like the polar bears. The zoo was really reasonable too, it only cost 700 czech koruna for two adults and two students which is about 20 pounds. The food at the zoo was also really tasty we ate at the restaurant by the elephants and had the best beef goulash of our four day holiday.Tips: If your a student take your student card because you will get a discounted price
Great zoo. All I can say its getting better and better every year! Visiting it as often as I can with friends or family.

Best zoo I have ever been too!!!!. This was by far the best zoo I have ever visited!!!The variety of animals from meerkats to polar bears was very impressive and the polar bears were by far my most favourite!!!!The zoo layout was huge!! And very interactive with things to eat and do while wondering. Perfect day out for the family as there was loads for kids to do.And you can also take your dog for 100 koruna..The park has a chair lift to get from the bottom to the top. And there is a brilliant wooden tower which you can climb via steps. Which overlooks Prague and the zoo!! Not for the faint hearted but perfect for high up selfies! :)The zoo has lots of food outlets and toilets but be prepared to Que if your a lady. Only downside was access by public transport. As you have to get the metro and then a free bus from the train station. Which during school holidays was a nightmare. Hundreds of people trying to push onto buses every 15 mins. If you not keen on this use the metro and then get a taxi to take you there. It's a 5-10 min journey from the station.The cost of entrance was about £6 each. Which compared to UK zoo's it is an absolute bargain.This was the highlight of our Prague long weekend. And we will be definitely be doing it again if we revisit.
Really good.. Better to go early in the morning as it takes a lot of time to see all of the animals. We didnt manage.
Amazing . Been today.absolutely brilliant not to busy at all on a Tuesday no queues for anything all the animals looked well looked after

Bad services in great Zoo.. Prague Zoo is nice, and for the first time looks really great. Many new attractions, many new animals. Yes that's true...but...and there is the main problem of this Zoo. Services. I read many reviews about how great this Zoo is. Yes, if you are looking only for animals, that 5 stars is not enough. But if you need toilets, or some drinks, or other services, you are surprised. Mainly, Zoo has two parts, old one and new one (with new Africa exposition). But there is no children train to get from one to other and back. There is one children train in old one, and different in new one. And both paid. Separately. If you want use cableway, you are quite limited, small children are not allowed because cableway is very old and is not prepared for this. Food is quite overpriced, and not well quality. And...and...and...So make a long story short, animals are great, new expositions are great and all is falling down by bad services. I hope that someone from management take a time to improve it, because it is shame.

Love the Polar Bears playing in water. Easy to get to by no 12 tram then no 112 bus stops right outside Zoo. Reasonable price.Easy access into zoo and goos paths even if up hill. Maps throughout zoo would improve with English and maybe other translations as well.Chairlift to near top of park only good fror ambulant visitors.. No good for strollers or wheelchairs. Plenty of food, drink outlets & WCs through park.

An Amazing Maze.. The zoo is massive, there are so many species of animal. If you love animals you have to make the trip. The polar bears have a big habitat and they look so happy as they swim and play with each other. It's great to see. There is even a snow machine to replicate their tundra habitat in the wild. There is no real option for quality food which led to me leaving early, unfortunately. Lots of snacks available for average prices. MAKE SURE YOU GET A MAP FROM THE INFORMATION DESK BEFORE YOU ENTER THE ZOO.

Great zoo but hard to navigate. Huge variaty of animals! Pretty easy to get to - metro+bus. Pretty cheap (150 cz with student card).Only two bad things to say:1. There is minimal to no english translation for the explanations about the animals.2. The maps inside the zoo (it is quite big!) Are worn down which makes it hard to navigate. They should offer a suggested trail. Feels like they tried to make it complicated so you'll always miss some part and would go back :)

Truly one of the best in the world. I absolutely love the Prague ZOO. It is such a lovely area, you can easily spend all day wondering around here. Plenty of the pavilions are brand new and it is continuously improving. There is also a good variety of food options, plenty for kids and even a small funicular.

Endless Zoo!! Amazing! . Variety of animals! The place is clean and comfortable for a long day travel.
There is a discount in the entrance for students (providing student card).
Really enjoyed this wonderful day in the zoo.... high quality :)

The best zoo I have been to. The zoo is located north of the city centre, and can be accessed by catching a tram and then the bus. We did this on our final day in prague and it was a lovely way to end the trip. Entrance fees are also comparably very cheap which was good.Allow a whole day to see the zoo - there were so many animals here which I had never seen before in my life, and they all had large enclosures and looked very content. They even had polar bears with an artificial snow machine. The zoo is very well laid out and as another reviewer said, they have made excellent use of the natural terrain. For those wanting something more exciting, there is a cable car which takes people from the top point to the bottom of the zoo (with no safety harness). So if you're tired of the health and safety laws in the UK, come and do this for some rebellious fun and think 'Look at me! This is actually pretty dangerous but I am being allowed to think for myself and take risks! Thank you Prague!'The food however is pretty poor at the zoo. But there's not much choice as anything you pack yourself will likely taste terrible after you've carried it in a bag for hours in the scorching sun (if you come in winter however this may be possible). Overall, definitely come here. It's probably one of the best zoos in Europe and it costs literally a fraction of the price that any other zoo would cost.

So disappointed. Rated one of the best in Europe I looked forward to my visit to the zoo in Prague. It was so disappointing! The exhibits were so small and bordered on animal abuse. Each was surrounded by chain link fence and looked nothing like the animals natural habitat. The only thing good about this zoo is that it makes the worst zoo in the U.S. look like an animal paradise. I'm so sorry for the ones living in this zoo. Made me want to go get some bolt cutters and get to work. 5 thumbs down.

A must see!. I would definitely recommend a visit to Prague Zoo if you're in the area. It is very easy to get to by public transport and is pretty cheap to visit (by UK standards anyway!). The zoo is huge and you can spend a full day wondering around; we spent about six and a half hours there! The animals have lovely, well maintained enclosures and there is plenty to see and do.  I look forwards to visiting again in the future.

Amazing Zoo- and not expensive! . What an amazing zoo. I live in Belfast and this puts our zoo to shame. Be prepared for a long day of walking as the zoo is huge and so much to see! We went first thing in the morning so at the beginning some of the animals were asleep ( this made for some entertainment particularly with a tiger which I will include pictures off). the animals seemed well looked after and happy with lots of space. The giraffes and elephants were amazing and I love how at the elephant section they had all the images of Ganesh and showed the worship of elephants. Really well done. The cost was around £5 each- that is just unheard of in the UK. Cable cars to take you to the top part of the zoo- went up and down these numerous times simply for the views over Prague- absolutely amazing. We had no kids on our stay- 5 people ages 23-53 and we all really enjoyed ourselves. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Prague as this ain't like any other zoo I've seen!

One of the top ZOOs in Europe, if not the world. I havent been to the Prague ZOO for a few years, though i have been the sponsor of the mesopotamian spiked tail lizard for several years (if you go, please say hi :-) ). I must say that the ZOO improved in many ways, almost every year there is a major new exhibit. Definitely a place to visit when in Prague...

Definitely worth the visit. The zoo is fairly easy to get too - once you're off the train, there is a bus that takes you right there, and its the last stop so you don't get lost :)The zoo is really large, and you can spend many hours walking around there - it also isn't very expensive, so I thought it was great value.The free WiFi in certain areas was also a nice bonus too!The animals are all in great condition and are clearly under excellent care which I was really happy to see. Definitely worth the visit :)

a great half day for family with kids. one of the best places to go with kids in Prague areaa wide and diverse zoo, with some simple and some wonderful exhibition areas. you can see elephants and polar bears, small mammals and exotic jungle wildlife all through a long walk through different surroundingssmall kids would enjoy, soft shoes are a must, and come just if and when the whether allows it
One of the best zoos in the World. A great day out. Beautifully landscaped. Nice touch of mini temple near the elephant enclosure. Plenty of food stops and a cable car.

When to visit the ZOO. Ideal time when to visit the ZOO? Anytime! You don´t need to come in summer because also in winter you find lot of animals still outside playing! I don´t really recommend you to visit the ZOO in early morning hours (when the ZOO opens) because lots of animals are still sleeping :D
Worths 1 day. With our 2 year old we had a wonderful day. Easy with the stroller; variety of food and drink options except well known beverage brands ( don't know why).

Amazing. . My partner and I used public transport to get to this zoo from the city centre which wasnt too bad. It was cheap to get in and food wasn't to expensive either. We could have spent more than just one day in this place, we were there for a good 8 hours and still didn't see everything. There is rest stops not so far from each other. Really entertaining day, and really worth the money. Would most definitely recommend going here.

One of the best zoo's i've ever been to.. This zoo is incredible!!! what a wonderful day out this is. Short trip on the metro and bus to get to the zoo which was really easy and I didn't speak the language and I still found it straight away :) The price to get in was great and defo value for money as there is sooooo much inside to do. They have amazing views from the top of the zoo that you can see right to the river and get some great pictures or brave the chair lift and relax with a view. The animals enclosures were immaculate and perfect for every animal, I was so impressed with the size of the cages and the enrichment for the animals were fab. Check out the polar bears swimming or watch the apes swing thro there vast enclosures or watch the mountain goats climb to the very top. the restaurant was amazing and the dishes we tried were fab and great value for money, The zoo is very, very steep in parts so if you are taking anyone that does not do well with hills be aware as its very steep!!!

Very good zoo. We spent about 4.5 hours visiting this zoo, on a Wednesday in September, 2015, and we covered almost all of it. The zoo was pretty empty and at times we thought we were the only ones visiting it. Most of the enclosures had ample space for animals and the zoo is clean, has plenty of bathrooms and food stands, at reasonable prices too. However, most of the descriptions of animals don't have an English translation. We particularly enjoyed watching elephants and tigers. The zoo has many animals and species, but not a huge amount. It also has a cable car that takes you to the top of the zoo, from which a panorama of Prague can be observed. It was good day, from morning to afternoon, in a nice weather. However, I am surprised that this zoo is ranked 4th best in the world. Maybe top 10 in Europe, but 4th in the world seems overrated. Nevertheless, it's a good zoo, and worth a few hours visit. It's also comparatively very cheap. If you are in Prague for anymore than 2 days, visit the zoo - you'll enjoy it.
Must visit . We had a great day at Prague zoo. It's definitely worth a visit. So much to see & the set up is brilliant. We particularly enjoyed the polor bears & tigers.

Not one of the best in the world. Went after reading and hearing the reviews, plus points very easy and cheap to get too . Admission very cheap comparing to London, dublin, Vancouver and so many more, food inside also very cheap and lots of places to take a break.Unfortunately even though their were a number of good areas for the animals, there were also a number of very small areas for them.Also quite few empty areas.If not in use put a sign .

Almost every animal you can imagine. We spent the whole day at the Zoo. It was quite the hike up hill, but worth the effort.They make an effort to let you as close to the animals as possible. Information in available in different languages. The animals are well looked after. Clean toilets, and the food and drinks are priced acceptable. We understand why this Zoo is so highly recommended. And wow, the tigers!
Fantastic. One of the most lovely ZOOs in the world. I recomend especialy for families with small children. Realy perfect afternoon.

The enclosures are way too small. The zoo was very exciting to us as we were aware it's ranked 4th on the best Zoos in the world. This is an overstatement in my opinion. Yes, there was a great array of animals, nearly any animal you could think of was there. However, the cramped and small outside quarters for the animals such as the leopard and the cheetah left a very bad taste in my mouth. I was very uncomfortable with the small inside area where the tigers ate. It was tiny and people were taking pictures with the flash on but there was no personnel from the zoo enforcing this. The honey badger round around in circles on the same piece of track repeatedly in his cell, it was if he had lost his mind completely. It was terrible to see. One of the large cats were limping around and was clearing injured but was still on show for the public. My experience there was not good and I will not be recommending anyone to go here.

All size no substance. . The zoo is ranked 4th in the world I honestly can't tell why yes it is massive like really massive but that's it. Maybe its because the day we visited it was 30+ degrees and all the animals were just laying about in the shade not there fault I'd be doing the same. I mean we couldn't even see most of the animals because the were all hiding from the sun. The zoo is cheap even drinks etc in the place are not a rip of like all other zoos I've visited. I just felt like it was nothing special oh and definitely get the chair lift.

Top contender for Best Zoo!. A return visit for us, this time with our 2year old Granddaughter and a couple of friends. Entry fees very reasonable. As others have said, a map would have helped! Signposting is a bit misleading. We knew about the hills and the chairlift, but went up right from the entrance, as usual. With every animal needing careful inspection by our Granddaughter, we really needed 2 days at least! The animals do look happy and some are in huge enclosures. Much happier polar bears this time, big relief, and 3 of them, great! Plenty of toilets (with changing facilities), places to eat or drink, play areas and seats. A must visit place if you have time.

No 1 place to go with kids in Prague. According to Forbes one of top 10 zoos in the world... Variety of animals is fantastic, covering all continents and climates, recently expanded the places to play and kid's attractions, nice restaurants with modern food.

A good idea to spent your day in Prague. Prague ZOO is one of the best ZOOs I have been in. It is huge - so be sure to reserve a whole afternoon or even a day for visiting. It is completely renovated and is not crowded since it is so big. Everything is easy to access and the animals have a lot of space, which I really loved about it. Also great trip for children, on the way there are a lot of playgrounds, restaurants and cafes. They also have a chair lift if you don't want to walk to the top of hill. Definitely recommend!

It Is huge... Beware of hills!. The zoo is utterly huge, really well structured, cheap and varied. Every enclosure is adequately sized and the animals look happy. And as for animals, you name it, its there. Yeah Really! I was amazed with the pure scale of the place and its inhabitants. As soon as we walked in we knew we were in for a great day. Word of warning: The zoo is half placed on a large hill, so bare that in mind if you struggle with inclines. There are ways around this, for example there is a chair lift that takes you up and down, But to be honest we didn't see it until we were already at the top, and if your afraid of heights then your out of luck. The only thing I will say is that It would be nice if there were easier means to get up the hilly parts.As for price... £6 roughly for an adult, for a full day out. We went through the majority with young legs in around 5 hours. But you could easily spend more time.

One of the best!. One of most finest ZOO I`ve ever been to, very clean, animals keep in good condition.Be prepare for couple of hours of walking, because its very big I can recommend it to everyone. Variety of different areas, its one of my "MUST" list everytime I visit Prague
Surprisingly cheap!. Good day out, plenty to see and a good price. Even the food was good from the canteen style restaurants. Don't bother buying maps as there are so many on the way round the park.
Rudolf. Best Zoo in Czech, lots of beautiful animals,attractions fór kids. Clean and tidy. Good services. Good place for peace and quiet.
Have a good day:). This zoo should be one of the most beautiful zoos all over the world. Too many different areas, good prices and beautiful happy animals make your day better even if you don't want.

African Savanna & African House. We had an amazing time visiting this Zoo, my favorite part was the African Savanna & African House however i can`t exclude the Polar Bears & the Pavilion of Penguins. We couldn`t see some of the animals because they were finding in their huge habitats but i kinda liked how much space they have.Reserve a hole day for it, you won`t regret it!

One of the most memorable experiences in Prague. Best Zoo we've been to and we have been to many around the world! Amazing variety of spieces, easy to navigate grounds, healhy tasty food options (!!!!), so well made! Very cheap too!

Best zoo I've been to!. Stayed in Prague for 4 days with my boyfriend and we came to the zoo on a sunny day. It was fab! It's a huge zoo with lots to see and it's only about a fiver entry! There's a swing lift that takes you right to the top so you can see the whole or Prague from the top. Would definitely recommend!
Great. It's great. A must see. They have many species of animals that are living in beutiful spaces there..

Fantastic Zoo - I loved the Polar Bears <3. Stayed in Prague for 4 days in August and we came to the zoo on a very wet and rainy day. The entrance fee is only £5 - 6, we couldn't believe it as the zoo's in England are so expensive. The day we came was so quiet, maybe because of the weather but it was great we had the whole zoo practically to ourselves!There are so many animals and the zoo is split up into different continents which I thought was a good idea. The only negative thing I would say is that some of the signposts seemed a little confusing and we weren't given a map which made it slightly confusing when trying to find certain animals - but I think we found them all in the end :)My favorite of course were the Polar Bears - I have never come face to face with them before and they are extraordinary, I've never seen such a huge animal!Definitely worth a visit if you're in Prague, I think we read somewhere that it's the 4th best zoo in the world so I'm definitely glad we went :D and well worth the money!

Europes best zoo ?. Whilst on a break to Prague our first visit to this amazingly pretty city with my young son we spent a day at the zoo.Easily accessed by Pragues excellent transport system [ the metro is uber efficient and really easy to use] makes a visit here an absolute joy.My boy and I could have spent another full day here as theres so much to see and although it was a swelteringly hot day the animals didn't seem depressed like iv seen in other zoo,sThe polar bears were my fave.Plenty of really well built enclosures let most of these animals feel at home .Built on a hill theres two levels the top is accessed by an excellent chairlift system which is quite a buzz when your being whisked up to the top level.Loads of staff to help you if need anything ,shops ,bars ,cafes to see to your every need .This zoo must be up there as one of the best in the world and as is everything in Prague it is soooo cheap and definitely cheerful ...we had an awesome day here.Get there if you can .
Huge area to explore! . Lots and lots of animals! Nice large areas for animals, except some birds. Reserve a Day because it takes hours to see everything!

The best ZOO. A must go for families with children. It is the best zoo I have ever visited. I go there once a year and it is always an amazing visit. Thank you guys for taking such a good care of the animals!

Amazing. Its really big and wonderfull zoo ,, this is my firest time that i see such zoo, ,nice collection of animals, ,nice weather, ,everything was ok, ,you need at least 3 or 4 hours to finish it, ,most visit if u are in praque
A brilliant day out!. The best zoo I have ever been to. The number and variety of animals was simply staggering! I was also very impressed with the price which was roughly £5 per adult!

The best zoo ever. It was always there in our itinerary. My son was all excited to see all these animals so close and even touch the animals at kids area. We just had plans to spend 2-3 hours but later decided to spend the whole day at the zoo.

The best zoo!. This is by far the best zoo we have been too - and we have been to a lot! There is a huge variety of animals from big polar bears to tiny mammals! We enjoyed a fabulous day here! The food is very cheap! The ground of the zoo are beautiful and are lovely to have a wander round!
The best zoo I've ever visited. Whether you're with family friends or your partner. A day in this zoo is a really fantastic experience. Loads of species and new things to learn.

Lovely!. A great zoo and a "must see" if traveling with kids. Arrive early and plan for a full day. Plenty of places for lunch or a quick bite, and of course beer. Parking was great. Though very hilly, the layout was amazing; exhibits were top notch and animals well cared for.

4th best zoo in the world. The billboards all said it, I looked it up and trip advisor confirmed it. I was cynical though, until I walked through the south entrance. An amazing place!It is built around a hill and has individual habitats for different animals. Each habitat has a glass viewing area for the best possible visitor experience. The polar bear habitat was incredible with three bears. Stunning snow blowers churning out a cold environment for these amazing creatures even in the 30 degree plus weather! Very impressed.It is very child friendly with great viewing opportunities as well as play areas and refreshment stops. My 3 year old loved it. Only warning for those considering a visit is, have a good night sleep before hand and get there early. We rushed round and it still took 7 hours and we missed things. It is a hike as well...Well worth the £20 entry fee we paid for 3 adults, 2 children and the dog - yes dogs permitted!

Gorgeous zoo. This is a lovely zoo - you can tell the animals are well cared for and happy. Beautiful views of the city and nice walk around the zoo itself. The cafes are very nice as well - fresh food and lots of choice. Inexpensive entry, very clean, and dog and child friendly. Highly recommend this for a different thing to do when visiting Prague. Definitely better than the tourist crush of Old Town!

Wonderful zoo. The zoo is designed to be very attractive. Of course you can find zoos with more animals, more species, but this one is really fascinating! Unfortunately it's quite difficult to get here from the centre, but surely worth it. Probably my best spent day in Prague (museum of technology and Vyšehrad come close ;)

Great day out. Arrived by boat. This was too packed.standing room only so wasn't the best way to enjoy a river trip. I would definitely recommend getting bus 112 from nadrazi holesovice. Only took about 15 mins. We travelled back by bus. Can buy tickets at bus stop if you don't already have one. Visited on a hot August weekday. Big queue for tickets but moved quite quickly. Would recommend that you look into buying e ticket beforehand. Ask for a map (will need it). We didn't get given one with ticket but luckily had printed one off at home! Plenty of drink and toilet stops around. Also play areas and splash pool. On a big hill so enjoyed chairlift 20 czk each way. Good variety of animals. BE PREPARED TO WALJ A LONG WAY! Noticed some toddlers in pull along wagons (guess for hire). Great day out. Recommend go by bus and do a separate nicer boat trip

Good place for relax in Prague. Very nice place to spend time for relax. ZOO is maintained and in good condition. Fauna from different species of birds over the beast, elephants, giraffes, penguins and more....

Best zoo I have been to. My only criticism, and this is partly down to my own lack of organisation, was that the zoo is not 100% convenient to get to - we saw the sign for the underground stop to go to for the zoo so just went there and then realised the zoo was not in walking distance and I ordered an Uber. I think you can catch a bus though. The range of animals is amazing, there was so many there that I had never seen before and animals I never thought I would see in real life. My absolutely favourite was the slow loris and the whole exhibit of nocturnal and very exotic creatures that I didn't know existed, all with bats flying around in this dark room - I was a little bit scared.
