It was a hot day and it is a bit hilly so make sure you get water! There is plenty of food and drink stalls.

Nice zoo . While the zoo was nice and -well kept staff dealt with customers as if they were on a conveyer system .the chair lifts were extremely dangerous and were only glorified swings while I stood with my daughter who was unsure if she wanted to try them he pushed us on shouting "move you paid you go" very rude .the zoo takes a day to tour
Impressive . Beautiful areas for for all the animals and some real show offs among them. Probably the nicest zoo I've been to, and I've been to quite a few.

laid out nicely, but hilly. I enjoyed the bus ride to the zoo, past nice country and some beautiful homes. The zoo has several trains, but unfortunately not one to the top. there is a gondola, extra, that goes part way up, we did not take it. It is not as bad as it looks to get to the top since the path winds up. There is a great view from the top. There are lots of places for kids to play, there were many, many kids. It was worth the time and cost to go and be outside and see something different from castles and museums. for more information see my blog Rauhala Ramblers at sharonr1947.blogspot.com

Brilliant day out (or even two days!) for the family. Not to be missed !. This is the third time in 3 years that we,ve visited the zoo. No wonder that it,s just been voted the 4th best zoo in the world !!It has everything that you would expect in a zoo and much much more. If you going you are spending more than a weekend there,please visit the place . Prices are good value, services are superb and everything is clearly signposted. Plus food is very well priced and is tasty and filling.Very highly recommended.

Do not miss this!. Staying in Prague for more than a couple of days means you should definitely visit the zoo - one of the very best in the world. It was notable that there did not seem to be a single exhibit that was run down. Many exhibits are simply stunning with great use made of the local terrain. I would particularly note the shoebills; Sichuan bird house; African & Indonesian exhibits and the large African Savannah enclosures as outstanding. The bird collection is one of the best I have seen with many large aviaries with plenty that are also walk through. There were also plentiful small mammals. It really ticks all boxes :) hope to visit again as it is also clearly a zoo that is constantly improving and evolving still more.

The best Zoo ever...you should visit.. I think that our Zoo in Prague is such amazing place for families. I dont have children, but i love this place, is really very big and you can spend there very nice time. Just amazing. For sure recommended for all families..

We visited the Prague Zoo last year. A fascinated zoo, kept very well and there are plenty of animals to see. We enjoyed seeing a worker communicate with the elephants. We had lunch in one of the zoo food kiosks, and the food was delicious. It was one of the most positive experiences during our holiday in Prague. John Spiteri, Malta.
Lovely place to enjoy a day or more. Prague ZOO is one of the best in the world. It's compact, but still provides the proper living room conditions to the animals.

If you like animals, do not miss this zoo!. Spread out on hilly terrain with many spacious natural habitats and animals not commonly seen in smaller zoos, this is a top-notch zoo. It's hard to see everything on one visit. Particularly noteworthy are the cultural aspects devoted to the reverence for the Asian elephants--a small Hindu temple and sculptures of the Hindu deities Shiva, Parvati, and Ganesh (the elephant-headed god)--at the entrance to the elephant viewing area. We enjoyed watching two elephants playing in the water and then dusting themselves with red dirt. WCs and places to eat with appealing food are scattered throughout the zoo. We visited on a very hot, sunny August day, and zoo personnel gave each person a bottle of water at the entrance. One more plus for this fine zoo: seniors (over 70) pay only one Czech Koruna, about 4 cents each. It's not hard to get to the zoo by Metro and bus (112). Seniors over 70 also ride public transportation free!

Nice place to visit if you haven't visited many big zoos. This zoo is voted as one of the top zoos in the world and rightly so. Its sprawling, has lot of exotic species, well maintained and relatively clean than lot of zoos you will see. Its worth a full day visit if you are with family. Although it was pretty sunny when we visited, there is plenty of shade inside the zoo. Must see are the penguins, giraffes and zebras. The African species collection & Indonesian jungle is also pretty good. Make sure you dedicate a minimum of 5 hours if you plan to visit. Also, make sure you carry a map which you get near the entrance. You should also carry little good as the option inside isn't much.

Most incredible zoo. This zoo is a bit out of the way but hands down the best zoo I've ever been too! The enclosures for all the animals seem to be so much more free than back in the UK they use the most of the space they've got and great to see animals in the habitats they would be in the wild. From the mountain goats on cliffs to the African Savannah they all seem to be very happy and there is such vast variety of all animals there was nothing there I disappointed not to see. Conservation also seems to be very important to the zoo and saw plenty of new baby animals and boards up to advise they are breeding animals to actually release them back into the wild. Safe to say I will find it difficult to see such a great zoo and such happy animals over here. Definitely worth a visit

Great day out lots to see. Haven't been to a zoo for over 30 years
This was quite amazing
Lots of animals
And even free flying bats
Take the kids
It's a must see

One of the top zoos in the world for a reason. Very easy to get to by public transport, and only costs about a fiver to get in, which is cheap compared to a lot of zoos elsewhere. The zoo itself is huge, and took us a good 3/4 hours to get around. There are maps all round the park, but I'm led to believe you can also buy maps at the entrance very cheap.Plenty to see and do for animal lovers, familys, couples and small children, we went early on but as it was well above 30 degrees most of the animals were sleeping or trying to get some shade so if you visit in the summer perhaps leave it til a bit later on in the day. Food places around the zoo are very cheap, especially compared to the city centre and portions looked to be very good values.The zoo is very clean, has plenty of toilets and is a lovely day out.

Very good value!. Great place! Cheap fun for both children, couples and alone. Take subway and bus for an easy and quick way to the zoo. There is areas in the zoo where you can enjoy food you have taken with you (so you dont actually have to buy food in the zoo) and the beer is not to expencive :)

A lovely day out with the kids. A lovely zoo, great value for money, plenty to see and do and very well maintained. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and there was plenty of bathroom facilities and food kiosks as well as vending machines
Bargain. A bit far but a bargain (200cr + 5cr for a map). A huge place where you can spend a day. There are places to eat or make a picnic. A must for children.
Incredible.. Absolutely beautiful zoo! Great atmosphere, beautifully decorated. Just incredible!Give yourself a whole day to lounge around because it's massive!

Avery nice zoo. this was a suprise, this was not as bad as I was expecting, a big zoo,with lots to see ,the enclosures on the whole were big ,clean and well planted.this zoo has some very interesting animals,there were lots of people there and they seemed to be very interested, the reptile enclosures were very good and the great ape enclosures were of a very high standard.Overall we had a great day out.only problem the last boat leaves 3 hours before it closes and we missed a few exhibits.Take the early boat to make sure you see everything.

Spacious zoo. Large zoo with lots of animals, easy to reach by public transport. We had some drinks and pancakes for very acceptables prices. The zoo has a lower and higher part and a cable lift saves some climbing. The animals looks well treated, esspecially on the higher part the 'African' animals have a lot of space.
The Best Zoo. This is one or maybe the best Zoo i've ever visited in my life,, you need a full day to finish it.. Do not ever miss it if you are here in Prague.. :)

The amazing zoo!. It was a perfect experience. Prague Zoo is a very huge park with so many interesting animals to see. You should be in a good physical statement to see them all. It's a very long walk. However, I bet you'd love it. By the way, try the cableway, there is an overwhelmingly good view of the Prague there.

Recommend . Visited in 2012 it was nice, great atmosphere, lovely park and it gave me a happy feeling. The animals seemed to be great taken care of and had big areas to be in(at least that's how I remember it).

A must see :). Beautiful park! So well decorated! The animals are well fed and taken care of. Most of them seemed really happy! But others had small cages, especially the carnivores. They seemed a little distressed. And the polar bears, they've must have been boiling warm in 36°C.. Anyway, this was the highlight of Prague. Bring good shoes, you'll be walking a lot! Lots of vending machines to buy drinks from. Reasonable prices for food.I highly recommend spending a day at this amazing zoo!
Nice day in Zoo. Very beautiful place. Good for a trip with your partner or family. I most like the part with gorillas.
Good day out. Great zoo but map in English waste of time as does not correspond to layout. Was not worth 5 CZK. We spent three hours there and loved every minute.
Nice zoo!. What a lovely view. All kinds of animals and a great place. The cages of the animals are in good condition and the zoo is very big. And the tickets are not expensive at all!

Great Zoo!. We spent a day in Prague Zoo and really enjoyed it! So many different animals and areas to visit and all for a very small price! The zoo was very easily accessed for tourists by using the metro and a bus. Plenty of places to eat/get a drink throughout the zoo and fantastic views should you take the chairlift up to the top of the hill. A great day out!

Great day out-top value for money. Visited Prague Zoo in July 2015 with 4 kids and I would say it was an excellent day out. It is a short bus ride from Holesovice train/metro station. Great selection of animals to see and while you need to walk quite a bit it wasn't tiring at any stage. Highly recommend the sea-lion show. Tigers and Gorilla Pavilions are also worth see.

Uphill all the way. Exhausting but lovely animal spaces. This is very difficult to get to. We went by boat and it is about a mile to the zoo from the bost. The animals are spread over a large area and the zoo seemed very steep indeed. If like me you find walking uphill difficult, or you have a pram or push chair, then seeing the African animals is really hard work. The only other way to get to the top of the zoo is via a ski lift. This is not possible if you have boisterous two year olds! They are too small to go on their own and unsafe and too big to go with an adult. The animals were in pleasant surroundinngs, there are good, reasonably priced restaurants and you need at least a whole day to get around. Not as enjoyable as most zoos I have been to.

An excellent alternative to spend a day or its half in a great environment with an amazing variety of animal species. In the past let say 30 years a visit - once up to three times a year - to the Prague Zoo became a must for me and for my family. First with my own daughters, now with my first grand-daughter it is absolutely amazing, enriching and energizing to spend a day of out in Troja. Nicely recovered after the 2002 horrible flooding and thanks to its decicated staff the Prague Zoo with its marvellous setting in a rich natural scenery, carefully designed and watchfully maintained facilities and paramount all miraculously happy, healthy and beautiful animals is an island of rich and enjoyable fauna. The neighbouring Fata Morgana Botanical Garden with its rich green-houses is also worth to be visited - better separately not to overdo the mixture of fauna with flora.

Great value for money with lots to see.. There is a wide variety of animals to see. Would highly recommend the sea lion show. Great value for money and a cheap exciting day out. They have many restaurants dotted around the park which are also great value for money. If visiting Prague it is definitely a must.

Great Day Out!. I have visited Prague twice and both occasions have visited the Prague Zoo. The Zoo is a great place to go when you have a day to fill, its a short bus ride outside of the city life, nice a peaceful area. Great selection of animals to see, all look well looked after which is good! highly recommend this zoo if you are to ever visit Prague.

Incredible wildlife experience. We enjoyed very much the Gorilla pavilion, the Monkey islands, the Lemur island, the Giant Salamander house, the Hippo house, the Elephant valley, the Feline and Reptile pavilion, the Bird wetlands, the African savanna, and the Tigers and Panthers.

Great surprise . Really cool get away from the city life. They have many friendly animals and a lot of shaded paths to walk along on those really hot days. Over all this is one of my many favorite things in the city!

Complete Noah's ark. Fabulous day at a wonderful zoo. A large location capturing animals closest characteristics outside their natural continent. For me, a zoo naturally feels too small for animals such as giraffes and elephants. Prague has done its best to provide enough space for the animals, however this can of course, never been true to the natural habitat of the animal. The African enclosure was lovely to see a variety of animals in one large(ish) place. The maps are 5kc to buy which you really do need to walk around with since the park is so huge! There are lots of places to eat. We chose a restaurant by the elephant pavilion and had two meals and two drinks for 377kc (around €15) so pretty good value for money.Taxis outside the place try to rip off people exiting the park so definitely worth calling one before to get back to old town square. We called from the pay phone and it cost 170ck. We heard a family accept 500kc to the same place outside from a taxi waiting.
needs pandas but great. Need more pandas. There are zero pandas at the moment. One more than zero would be great! Other than that best zoo Ive ever been to youcheeky monkeys!

Amazing!!!. Hands down, the BEST zoo I have ever been to! It's not hard to get to and it's not expensive (about £4), there's actually no excuse not to for anyone who likes animals!Saw plenty of animals i've never seen before and even friends that weren't fussed about going ended up having an amazing dayIt takes a full day to see everything so go earlyThere's a chair lift as well that gives you an amazing view of Prague on the way down

Wide variety of animals. I visited the zoo with my file friend yesterday and, despite the heat, we had a good time; the zoo is very large and it has several animals that I had only previously seen in documentaries, and you can get extremely close to them so that you can exactly perceive how big they are. For lunch we stopped at the Gulab restaurant close to the elephants, and we have been quite disappointed; I had a schnitzel with fries and it was fine, but in my gf's curry she found an insect. We were refunded at least. Overall I think that if you have more than a couple days a visit to the zoo is worth it.

Cheap and definately worth the effort!. It is a very nice zoo with some animals you don't see in every zoo. Because of the large and nice design you don't have the feeling the animals are locked down. Instead you have the feeling you are walking in nature and see animals left and right of you. :)
Great place for family trips and dates. Very pleasant place to be in Prague. A lot of places to see, lot of things to enjoy. You can go there with your family or alone and it's best.

Excellent Zoo!. The zoo is large and also i was surprised how big and clean all the habitats were.Also its quite rare that prices are not skyhigh when you are at tourist attraction - beer, snacks and other food/Drinks were cheaper than most tourist-places at city. You could get 0,5 liter beer for 30CZK, it's not bad!Also tickets are very reasonable, and they accept all credit cards (also American Express)
Nice Zoo. Hugh zoo big day for the little ones. Probably need a few days if the kids are old enough easy to get to with public transport.
Zoo with a View!. Such a beautiful zoo to stroll around. Loved the giraffe area a lot. It also most look like a savanna in Africa! And the view from the pizza restaurant was awesome!
They really work on making it beautiful! . It's hudge area where everyone can pick the preferable places (animals and so on). It's a bit expensive but you can literally spend there whole day.

4th best zoo in the world. A must see!!If your in Prague for a long weekend and you think you have seen everything. Go to the zoo :)We got a taxi there from our hotel in the town centre. One way was 400 Czech crown, to get the tram followed by a bus is 300 Czech crown.So you might aswell get a taxi and save the waiting and walking as Prague zoo is massive and to walk it, it's about 7 km which took is 4 hrs. They have many drink/ice cream/ snacks, we had lunch at a place by the elephants, which had curry or fish & chips. It's cost 380 Czech crown for 2 meals and 2 drink.Zoo entry was 200 Czech crown. So overall in the park it cost us £20.I would recommend this to anyone, but there English is not as good as what it is in Prague one ( town centre) but this wasn't much of a problem.
ZOO. If you are in Prague, you have to visit this Zoo. We had such a great time. Kids are very happy! Thank you

Fantastic variety. The last time I have been to a zoo was ages ago so I decided to go check out the zoo in Prague as I have heard really good things about it. Was I ever impressed. Most people think its more of a family or childish place to go but I still learned a lot and was very impressed by all of the animals they had there. Everything from polar bears to elephants! Definitely a must see if you haven't been to a zoo in a while!

Lovely trip to the Zoo. I went to this Zoo as part of a city break to Prague with my boyfriend in February. It was definitely worth the visit, reasonably priced and you can easily spend the day here. One thing that was slightly frustrating was that all of the information about the animals was printed in Czech and there was no option to get any English guidebooks. They have a wide variety of animals including elephants and polar bears. Some of the animals appear to be in very small cages which was a shame to see.

An absolute must in Prague. The zoo ranks among the best zoos in the world. It is, indeed, fantstic and very animal-freindly. I visited Prague twice (April 2015 and October 2014) and both times I spent a day at Zoo. Both times it was not enough. What impressed me most: the hippo house where you can see the hippos gracefully swimming past you behind the glass wall; the Indonesian house hosting the rainforest and the orangutans; the elephant valley - a huge enclosure where the elephants walk and play and enoy themselves; the lemur house, Africa Up Close with the cutest bat-eared foxes and crazy hyperactive honey badgers; unbelievable giant salamanders in Giant Salamander House; Sichuan pavilion with its beautiful birds; the fantastic bird wetlands, particularly the awsome shoebills; and my absolute favourite, the African house with giraffes and my beloved aardvarks who look like a cross between a pig and a Kangaroo !!! Don't miss it, guys. But don't forget: you need at least several hours to see and enjoy it all. I will certainly go there again next time in Prague.

A must see : don't miss it. One of the nicest zoo's I ever saw.. This zoo has it all : it is very large and has 2 levels. You can travel from one level to the other by cable lift. They have several animals that I had never seen in any other zoo (and I have seen zoo's all over the world). The Prague sausage and beer they serve in several places are wonderfull.

Great trip if you've seen all of Prague. After two days, we saw all of Prague. We had one day left and did not know what to do with it. Since we had not been to a zoo in 10 years, I suggested to go to the Prague Zoo. We had a great day walking in the park (approximately 10 km) and eating pizza at the pizzeria near the elevator.
One of the Best in The World. One of the best zoos in the world. Animals have space (nothing compared to wild life but important compared to many other zoos).Great place.

Great way to spend a day!!. Amazing day spent at the zoo. The place is huge with so many things to see and the views are beautiful too. It's not too far from the centre of Prague so very reasonable taxi fare.

If you love animals, spend some time here. I am not a "zoo" person, but this one was so worth it. This was on our itinerary because our teenage grandson is active in world organizations that protect wildlife and wanted to visit. We were not disappointed. The variety and quantity of animals was surprising, especially those considered endangered. I was impressed by the size of the habitats provided for the animals and the use of natural materials throughout the zoo to create a pleasant environment for visitors. If you are over 70 the entrance fee is 1 crown, about 5 cents – a nice perk for “pensioners.”

Have not been keen on Zoo's, but this one is very special.. Just visited Prague Zoo, easy journey by Metro, and bus 112 takes you to the gate. Your metro ticket covers the bus fare too. Huge hilly area, so take all day. Plenty of rest spots, toilets and eateries. All on a steep hill, but there is a cable car up to the top if needed. I had not been keen to see animals in captivity, but it was a so nice to see rare animals treated so well. The elephants have their own pool to swim in as well as a vast area. Our favourite area was the tropical jungle. Marvellous, family day out, or leave them and go by yourself !! Would recommend to all.
By far our favorite Zoo. Absolutely loved This Zoo , my family and I have made it a tradition to visit the zoos in every state and country we visit , This one was just Amazing!
Need a nice day. Fortunately had a sunny day for our trip to the Zoo, well worth a visit. Disappointed at the Polar bears and Elephants enclosure, felt they needed moire space.
Amazing. . One of the best things to do in Prague. We loved it. Even to get there we took the boat and the experience it worth it.Recomendable.

Elefantastic. The Prague zoo holds a surprisingly wide range of animals. Besides the usual bugs and critters you could even find some rather bizarre creatures. For instance, you can find a giant frog that looked like something that would have roamed the world seas before dinosaurs ruled the world. Another enclosure held some exotic gambials, which are a apparently a crossing of ant eaters and crocodiles. There is tons to do for the whole family. You can tire out your kids on a playground and a little racing track with a speed meter. However, some of the older visitor take this very competitively and will often cheat by starting to far behind the starting line. Unfortunately, many of the animals seemed to be in a rather distressed state. A giant male giraffe was confined to a pen in which he could barely turn. But worst of all was the state of the king of the animal kingdom. Probably the number one attraction of the zoo, maybe in the whole of Prague, and definitely the reason I went to this zoo, the honey badger. I cannot comprehend how one can put an animal as majestic and intelligent as the honey badger in an 8 m^2 terrarium. There was nothing for it to do. It was just constantly banging his head against the window and walking up and down is prison. In fact, there was a larger areal attached but the door was closed for the honey badger. I guess it would have been too easy for him to escape. But if a zoo can't properly contain a honey badger, they shouldn't keep one. There is a reason very few zoos have honey badgers.

Arguably one of the best zoos .... This zoo is a must do for families with kids. Our experience was fabulous. Great facility at such a reasonable cost .Taxi from winceslas square - 300 KrFamily ticket for 4 - ‍‍‍600 KrOcean cafe - in zoo is super a great day out for kids who thoroughly enjoyed. Polar beer/ tigers/ penguins..... They have them all✌Play areas for kids/ slides are thoughtful /plentiful and paid rides are brilliant Even a small paddle pool - brilliant for a hot summer day.Better than most European zoos I have been to like Amsterdam etc and Perhaps as good as Disney animal kingdom . Just a fraction of the cost though....Taxi on way back slightly dearer at 400kr. could be a cheaper option.

Very nice zoo. It's a big zoo, you can easily spend there whole day. I recommend to use the chairlift, it's fun :-) I think that most of the animals are fine, but some of them look lonely, if they're alone.

Pleasant surprise. Visited Prague zoo in January,It definitely exceeded expectations!We went on a quiet weekday and found there to be no one around, there were plenty of animals to see and the park is well laid out! There is a bus stop right outside which makes it easy to get to.We really enjoyed our day at the zoo and would definitely return if we return to prague!

Best zoo I've ever been to.. This was a priority for us to go visit whilst in Prague. Really easy to get to thanks for Prague's fantastic public transport systems.This is an absolute fantastic zoo. Plenty to see and do and it's absolutely massive. Really cheap in comparasion to what you pay in Scotland/UK for zoos but I would have been happy to pay so much more.If you have young kids I would highly recommend taking a day out to come here.

Fantastic zoo. This zoo is really amazing. I went with my partner and we really enjoyed seeing the animals, especially the monkeys playing in their very nice enclosures. We also ate at one of the cafeterias and really enjoyed our meal. Tip: go for the whole day and be prepared to walk quite a bit as the zoo is huge!

Great way to spend the day!. We had a nice day visiting the Zoo. It was a great way to spend a day away from the hustle and bustle of the museums. It was a clean park, economical and everyone there was very friendly. The bus will take you right to the entrance, it is so easy! We rode the train once inside to get an overview of the grounds. Highly recommend!

Best zoo in europe?. Easy to find, very cheap entrance and even cheaper to eat there. Lots and lots of animals, clean and absolutely cool place to stay for a day. Reserve one whole dy, because it is a very very large zoo. One big downside is the toilets, they are not very clean, so avoid using them if u can. We paid 800czk for our family of 4 adults.

Prague Zoo okay but not so fantastic. Prague Zoo okay but not so fantastic, it look like it need it some cleaning and painting and the service staff look like they not happy, the zoo is big and you need good shoe to go there on the big mountain and it is hard to go on the high mountain. they have no train to take you from place to place and a normal zoo have, so be care full to go there if you are not fit for fight. The WC / Ca are not clean and look bad.

Well worth a visit . Wonderful zoo, a place to easily spend the whole day. The place is huge, with a great variety of of animals, the lowest ticket fares in Europe, and plenty of kiosks for a snack. The only complaints would have to be the staggering amounts of wasps(the animal, not the American type) trying to eat your food, destroy the world, and all the other wasp things to do! Guess they're only a problem in the summer months :-) All in all, a place well worth a visitTldr; Go visit, lookout for wasps!

Easily spend the whole day here!. Myself and my girlfriend visited this zoo and we were very satisfied. Be sure to arrive as early as possible as the place is absolutely massive!!! We spent 8 hours walking at a realxed pace and didn't see everything. Very few animals weren't on view which was good. Plenty of places to sit and take a rest which can be badly needed!

Winter zoo Trip. We went to Prague zoo in February 2015 over the valentines holidays. We found the animals which were at the zoo to be fantastic . They have polar bears, crocodiles, Lions,Bears and a lot more. We were very happy to see the family of polar bears there as in England it is always rare to find polar bears. The facilities at the park for the animals and for us were very good, with regular toilet stops and food huts around, and also the animal enclosers were nice and big for them, which is always a bonus. The only thing I would say is we went at the wrong time of the year and it would of been a lot better if we went in the summertime. This would be a fantastic family day out for anyone and the zoo is easily accessible and transport is a dazzle in Prague. Definitely will be going again but probably in the summer .
Zoo to be re-visited. Excellent idea and maintenance of the infrastructure and animals.I liked very much the close glass-protected interactions with tigers, lion, leopards penguins etc.

Lovely zoo. We walked from Letna Park, through another park to the zoo....about three miles. Beautifully kept parks and worth the walk. You can take a boat that drops you off near the zoo if you want to. The zoo is a good size, plenty to see and they serve beer! Was quite unusual to see people walking round a zoo with a beer in hand! But have to admit we joined them.....long walk back! The zoo is kept clean and the animals well cared for. Lovely enclosure for the giraffes. Well worth a visit for a day out....food available to but there, or take a picnic.
Very quiet. Many of the exhibits were empty and it was confusing to make our way around. I've been to better zoos.

A day out of the city. My daughter and i hopped on the Metro then took a bus (all very organised and prompt and easy) out to the zoo. It's a nice zoo - well laid out and well kept. We had the impression too that most of the visitors were local families whereas in Prague itself you tend to be swamped by other tourists. Good choice of food stalls, cafes etc and lots of animals to see. They looked well cared for and had space. You could spend a full day here and not see the same exhibit twice. We used the chair lift which was fun too. I'd recommend this as a great day out of the city itself.
Szeged . Extraordinary. Animals are in good shape, the place is perfect for families with young children. It's a day-long programme. .
Great family zoo always worth visiting. Prague zoo is a great zoo. We visited with three kids aged 6, 10 and 13 and they all enjoyed the visit. Spend 5 hours and walked 7 km

Amazing place. I do not understand how the Prague Zoo can have other that 5* reviews, I live in Prague and I visit the place at least once per 2 months, the area is beautiful, green with lots of interesting biotops itself, the animaal are in good shape, well taken care off,
1 of the best zoo in Europe. Where do I start! Such an amazing day out, so many different animals to see and interact with. Food and drink where a little over priced

Fantastic zoo!. I spent the week in Prague visiting my sister. She took me to the zoo via tram and bus which wasn't as painful as i imagined it would be. The public transport in Prague is very clean and efficient and London could learn alot. We arrived at the Zoo and spent the day walking around looking at the animals and the various exhibits there. The gorillas are definitely a must see as they are so confident with the visitors that they frequently sit by the glass and interact with you. I would also recommend the Giraffes, they can be quite difficult to see at times as their enclosure is very large. We didn't eat on site and the gift shops where reasonable. A great day out for families!
OK. Prague Zoo was OK experience for me. I visit there in january and in that time of year many places inside the Zoo area was close..

After hundreds of Zoo's around the world, this is my FAVOURITE!!. This Zoo is only a 20minute drive on the 112 bus from Prague City Centre. It is amazing for all ages. It is full of weird and wonderful animals, from the very unique to those we all love to see. The enclosures are stunning and worth going to see all by themselves. All the animals have massive areas to enjoy but also indoor glassrooms, meaning you can get within meters of lions, giraffes spectacular day out and experience. The Zoo has great views of the city and is located on the hillside looking over the city centre. A cable car runs through the centre of the zoo and celebs like Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt have sponsored areas of the brilliant Zoo.

Large and nice Zoo. we as a couple are very fond of Zoo so wherever we are we go to explore one. The Prague Zoo is located in a nice part of town (the travel there is like 30minutes from downtown) and belongs to the better ones in Europe. The selection of animals is huge and as "experienced Zooer" I can only appreciate the amout of places in pleasant shade as well as plenty of refreshment places (as well as toilets). Well managed Zoo with all the regular and some rare animals too (like Przewalski's horse). Better than expected - you may easily spend whole day;) Close t the Zoo there is small Troja Palace to see as well as Botanical Garden that I may recommend too.

A zoo with a view.. My daughter and her two teenage children visited this zoo and then less than a week later went back again this time with me along. Everywhere is clean and well tended and the animals seem to be contented. The zoo has a wonderful collection of all sorts of animals and their elephants in particular are worth spending time watching. The zoo is on quite a high hillside and it is a steep walk in places but there is the option of taking a little train or going on a chair lift for part of the way. We had a very good meal at the cafe at the top of the hill and the prices were very reasonable. I'm not usually a big fan of zoos but I would visit this one again and I highly recommend it as a great place for a family day out. Take all day to really enjoy it.

Good Zoo. Nice zoo and a relaxing scenic way of getting there is by boat, which takes 75 minutes if leaving from the Rasinovo Quay in Prague, we had return tickets so a nice cruise back as well.The zoo is one of the better ones and well worth the trip, my only tip is take plenty of change as there are numerous vending machines.

Very good, better then expected. This was a morning outing combining to Troja Palace next door on a combined ticket. We paid 600 ck each and they had the usual group of animals and some exotic ones including a Panda and Emu. Their is a top and bottom museum with a ski chair lift to take you between. Explanations in English at some exhibit. You access on the "B" Metro and get off at the Nadrazi Holesovic stop and go upstairs and pick up the "112" bus which only goes to the Zoo. Always buy 24 hour tickets.
Best zoo I have ever been to!. Fantastic zoo with very contented looking animals in large enclosures. We spent 8 hours there and didn't see it all!!
Lots of Variety. Massive variety of animals to see, seem to be kept in good conditions, easy to navigate around, easy to travel too from the city centre.

Worth more than one day visit. Prague ZOO is wonderful! Mostly I appreciate the care given to animals, they look very healthy, have big space to run and look much better than inhabitans of other world zoos we have seen. During the day there are many special meetings close to fences and the staff feeds animals and talks a little bit about them (only in Czech). Feeding brings the animals closer to you. You can borrow stroller and carrier for free. Except from animals there are many attractions, special events, places for kids, restaurants, inside exhibitions....I recommend to take more than one day for the zoo. And yes, still the fee is not so high for such a special place (200 crowns per person which is less then 10 euro).
Happy and healthy animals. Fabulous day ,lots to do. Animals looking good ,large places for them to run and everything very clean.

Nice and clean. This is a nice and clean zoo located just outside Prague city centre. They have tons of different animals. Lots of elepahnt. Some polar bears, and most everything else. I still feel bad for the caded animals. But it's the best zoo I've been to. And the cafes have reasonable prices, as well as the enterance fee. My only dislike is that there is very little information in english.

Definitely worth a visit. We live in Prague and usually visit the ZOO at least 1-2 times a year. It is a nice stroll, perfect for kids and adults. The place has some of the best and newest facilities and pavilions available. If you are not that bothered about animals you can hop round the corner to the botanical garden with its own winery....When compared to the Singapore ZOO which we have also visited and which is regularly seen as one of the world's best, I would say the ZOO in Prague is at least as good. Enjoy
Love it every time. Easily accessible from city centre. Variety of animals, large enclosures, every time I visit it I find something new :-)

Highy recommended!. I'm not a big fan of zoo's but this was a great one to visit and the best I've been so far.A huge variety of animals and they have a lot of space to move around.You can get really close to many animals, I was actually sitting beside a giant gorilla, just the window between us. Lots of places where to eat. Huge area, spent there 5 hours, and did not see everyhting. So be prepared with comfortable walking shoes and allow yourself enough time to walk around.

ZOO made with love!. Prague ZOO is simply beautiful: everything newly built, animals treated with love, dozens of equipment for visitors, baby-friendly, dogs-friendly... I love going here more times a year and I always enjoy it so much! Even the landscape the ZOO is situated in and the views over Prague castle and the city of Prague are unique. I highly recommend the visit to everybody who comes to Prague!

OK, I´m local. But it´s great! :). I go to the Prague zoo 3-4 times a year and I always get a different experience. I ´ve also been to many zoos around the world and I have to say, this is one of the best. I think it was inspired by the San Diego zoo (which is also exceptionnal) but maybe even a bit better - only the pandas are missing...but they are coming :)Best way to get to the zoo is either by boat from the city center, which is more enjoyable but also time consuming. Or you can take bus 112 from metro station "Nadrazi Holesovice" and make the whole journey from the city center in less than 30 minutes. Entrance fee is like 7-8 €.Reserve whole day and wear some comfy shoes, there´ll be a lot of walking. You can also visit a observation tower, situated directly in the zoo and get a beautiful view of Prague a Vltava river.

Day out. Fantastic zoo. Some of the cages seemed to be a bit small for the animals, but they were all looking healthy and well cared for. There is something for all the family and plenty of info about all the animals. It is in a beautiful setting and it was a lovely day out

A beautiful small and specil zoo.. Small and very easy to absorve the enimals for old people and to family with children. Peacefull place, clean and lovely resturnt to take a time out, self serve eith good food for small money.
Very nice. Nice zoo... enjoed the visit with our 10 months old baby.. a very nice place for families and even for couples...

GO! One of the best ZOO's in the World (and I have been to many). I love the Prague ZOO, which I think is one of the best in the World, definitely top in Europe. Even the landscape is diversified and interesting. The elephant part and the birds are my favourite. There are food stalls everywhere, clean WC, affordable tickets, great playground area for small kids. The cable car is great, only not suitable for small children. This ZOO is actually not only a mere animal exhibit but a real scientific and conservatory enterprise as it managed to save numerous types of animals. Most notably the "Horse Prevalskeho". They really do care.I strongly recommend getting there by boat from the city centre. The boarding is close to Palacke namesti (Karlovo namesti metro station line B). Easy to find. The trip takes about one hour and half and after it is 10 minutes at most walk to the entrance.

Loved every minute! . Couldn't wait to visit the zoo whilst in Prague and I wasn't disappointed. We got the underground from andel and then a bus which was really easy so if you're staying in the city centre then that's probably the best way of getting there ☺ the zoo is huge! So you'll need all day to get around and see everything as we missed a couple of things. There's polar bears and bats! It was amazing I'd definitely love to visit again. One of my best experiences visiting!

Wonderful. The zoo is huge, the environement created for each species is detailed, and there are lots of anumals, including giraffes, elephans, lions - you name it! Very clean, with lots of maps and places to get drinks. We spent a whole day there, went by boat in the morning (9.30) and caught the last boat back (6 p.m.). Totally worth it!
Worth visit. Big. Cheap. Many animals. We spent a day here, it is really huge, many things and animals to see, elephants especially. Personally love it.

GREAT! Don't forget to add this zoo name in you must-see list.. I was surprised by this zoo. Not because It was amazing. Just because most of the visitors forget to write this attraction in their must-see list. You will find the many interesting things just like North American zoos. Even some of the animal that you can't find in north American Zoos, you will see here. I will say one line, DON'T FORGET TO SEE WHILE IN PRAGUE.
One of the best zoos I visited !. There is much place for the animals. Very rare specimens (prezwalksy horse, gharial, salamander..). Big. Cheap. Many animals.

Prague Zoo. Well worth a visit - cost just over £5.00 to visit - approximately 60 hectares - some of the zoo is built into the hillside - some steep walking but you can use the small train around the zoo to avoid this - animals all look healthy and well cared for - plenty of picnic areas and the cafe are reasonably priced - paddling pool and extensive play area with adventure playground - you can get the small single seat cable car ride available to top - really nice day out for all - you can get the boat along the Vltava River or the bus stops right outside the Zoo.

Here you find everything :-). We spent a day here during our visit to Prague. They have everything, it is a huge zoo. Lots of elephants. Great lunch too. Personally I hope they will build more space for the polar bears and some of the birds, they didnt look too happy on a small territory.

The best zoo in Europe!. The zoo have many animals. Very big place with interesting views. If you want to see the holl zoo you must spend the holl day, from morning to the evening. The tickets are not cheap but it worth that. You can get to the zoo by car or bus that is very cheap and fast.VERY RECOMMENDED !!!

Amazing! . It's huge and soooo interesting! One of the best zoos in Europe. I've been walking around for 6 hours and haven't been able to see everything. And it is very affordable. Don't miss it if you visit Prague! The only complaint - lack of direct transport from the city centre. It is not difficult to get there (much easier than it seems), but I was a bit stressed by the trip. Direct bus would bring even more visitors to the zoo!

Very nicely done zoo built in the side and on top of a hill!. I was surprised by this zoo. Not because of where it is, but because of it doesn't see that advertised. In fact not really advertised at all outside Prague. Great zoo! Some nice exhibits and a different setup compared to North American Zoos. I also found it nice to see animals they didn't have in some NA zoos as well. We also had lunch in the Zoo cafe, and it was very nice. The people working there were very nice, and all in all it was a great day!Highly recommend this place if you have a free afternoon!

Beautiful way to spend a day. It takes a whole day to see all the animals and exhibitions here. The path may be tricky but you can get a map when buying tickets and things will be easier for you. There's a lot of information to learn and many species to see, what is more, you can even buy some goat food, climb over the fence and feed some cute baby goats right where they live. Amazing experience for people of all ages!

Great day out. The zoo is one of the best zoo's we have been to, even during winter the zoo is equipped to house some of the animals and also the public can see them in the housing. The only issue was the lack of English signs and descriptions.

HUGE. Man, is this place huge. They have all kinds of exhibits. You kind of start along the path and just keep going and going for miles (literally). I was there in a heat wave so it was a little rough. Finding the exit can be tricky. I saw the elephant exhibit some signs of disorder - he was rocking back and forth because he was isolated from the other elephants. It was a little sad. The baboon looked a little sad, too. I love zoos but this one made me feel a little sad for the animals. But they're clearly committed to making this the best experience for visitors. Tons of bathrooms and food shacks. Leave at least four hours to see this place.

Best ZOO experience. One of the largest zoos in Europe and most interesting animals are the same as in their environments. If you are in Prague you must visit the zoo and learn about animals like never before . To visit all the animals will have all day, but you can also use the children's train and cable car.

AMAZING. Amazing zoo, you can spend all day there, great if you have kids. A lot to see, entrance is so cheap and cafes are very reasonable. The zoo has a very sad story of the flood they had :( We got very lucky to see the Polo bears swimming in front of us (10.30am) Great seal show, its very well looked after!!

Great!. This was the best experience we had at Prague. At the pavilion you can see the animals really close. I know this is stupid, but I was a bit scared when my kids went to see the tigers... At the gate you can ask for a ... cart / box with a tires (?). We left our buggy at the hotel and used it.

Lovely zoo. We decided to go to the zoo on our last day in Prague as we were all churched and cultured out, and we were glad that we did... And it is fairly priced too.The zoo was lovely and well maintained, with clear evidence that they are constantly striving to improve it. Some of the enclosures for large birds of prey appeared a little small but other than that I really can't fault it. It is well worth a visit, and It is very easy to get too on the subway and bus.
Great!. It is most beautifull zoo in the world. be advised: you need whole day to see everything in it. (there are many cafes and food stands)

Nice place not only fot the family. Prague ZOO gets better every year. With new places and restaurants it turned into place where you can spend the whole day not only with your family but as well with your friend having nice lunch or dinner.

One of the best ZOO's in Europe. Thanks to the floods in 2002 a big reconstruction has been going on - since this time, each year a new pavilion opens up, it is located in a good reach from the centre, the only disadvantage is a bit poor catering facility, not too much choice. Nice playgrounds for smaller kids, chair lift. Shows according to a schedule. Definitely worth coming by a boat from the centre to get a nice day trip with kids. Possible to rent a cart for smaller kids.

Worth the Visit. Pros:Got a student discount, Saw real polar bears swimming and eating (first time ever), also saw my first kangaroo, Accessible via bus, Abundant variety of wildlife, Family friendly!, happy and friendly staff meant happy and friendly visitors, petting part of the zoo where you were allowed to pet some animals.Cons:Covers a large amount of ground and there is no means of transport within the zoo itself.<3 Loved it tho !

Amazing animals !. Going to Prague zoo is very convenient ! Just take the metro and get off on Nádraží Holešovice, then take the bus, the terminal of the zoo is the entrance of Prague zoo ! The price of the ticket is reasonable, only 150 krones for student(need to show student card) and you can spend a whole day in the zoo !I'd never imagine that i can see lions, zebras, tigers and elephants in Prague ! Amazing ! However, there are not many staffs in the zoo and they are not very fluent in English. It was quite hard to ask for informations, and i was a little worry of who taking care of these lovely animals, if the number of staffs is that little. Anyways, if you get bored by the normal tourist spots in Prague and you are an animal lover. Prague zoo is definitely an ideal place to go !

Day trip to zoo. Absolutely fantastic zoo . Very easy and quick to get to on regular bus route . Very clean well set out . Great selection of animals arranged into groups . Animals looked well cared for and cages clean . Would recommend a trip to this zoo

Amazing. I have been to a few Zoos around europe and this is by far the best. You can easily spend the day there and not get bored. It is really cheap to go to and there is lots to see and do.Highlight was definitely seeing the Polar Bears. You can also pick up a beer at the numerous shops. Lovely views of Prague from the top.

Cool Zoo. Is one of the most interesting zoo we have been to around the globe. There are many hills and corners that you can discover. The small train that takes you around is also great. The variety of animals that live here is very wide as well.

Exceeds Expectations. I have to be honest, going to the zoo in Prague was originally supposed to be a bit of a time filler but turned out to be a nice experience. The zoo is much more extensive than the London Zoo (sorry, I have nothing else to compare it too) and at just a fraction of the price. There is a chair lift which I assume is supposed to be used as just a means of travel up the hill to where half the other enclosures are but it can be seen as an attraction in itself at only 20czk. As a student I got a discounted price to the zoo itself but it is still ridiculously cheap for how big it is (and in comparison to the London Zoo).Food is available too of average quality, as expected from such a venue but at a super low price (once again, in comparison to food in attractions such as London Zoo or any other museum). My only complaint is probably that there are a load of flying insects in the zoo (probably expected in a zoo but still something that seemed worth mentioning as it seemed more than other places in the city and also in other zoos and animal farms). Another reviewer mentioned that the larger mammals seemed a bit stressed and I have to agree.tl;dr: extensive zoo, cheap food, insects, not a must-see but still a pretty good place to visit.

Brilliant!!. Loved the day we spent here! Fairly easy to get to with Prague's brilliant transport system. Zoo is huge, you need all day to walk round and there's loads to see and all the animals were there and looked happy enough. A very big green space overlooking Prague and amazing views. There's a cable car to get you from the top of the zoo to the bottom which is a great idea and food places spread throughout - we had a curry and a pint for a few quid. Enemy is super cheap, wipes the floor with any English zoo!

Seventh best in the world. I read somewhere that Prague Zoo is seventh best in the whole world. That I cannot compare, but Prague zoo is really nice place to be with or without children. The complex is quite large so one visit is not enough. Zoo is divided into two areas upper and lower connected either by a walk side or by a cable car. Children can use a "train"if they are tired to walk, several play grounds to rest and many stands and food places places with simple food and drinks. We recently recently purchased ticket for twelve visits and I am sure we will use it.

Best zoo i've been to. This zoo covers a huge area, i had a pedometer with me and counted nearly 20km walking during our visit, it tooks us about 6 hours, eventhough ww intentionally skipped a few species. So take your time, and do not come here in a hurry. The animals are well taken care of, and have fairly spacious enclosures. Free wifi near the elephants, if you need it. Plenty of places to stop and rest, with vending machines every 5 minutes.
Must to see. A great place to spend about 3-4 hours at least. Must to see if you are visiting Prague. Easy reachable by public transport.
Amazing place!. Prague zoo is amazing! Must be on travelers schedule! You can be close to the tiger, and much more. Don't miss this place!
Ok if stuck for something to do. Quite a large zoo, although the Tigers and some of the larger birds were in very small enclosures, and looked stressed.

Wow, zoo in grand style.. I've decided to visit Prague's zoo because of very good recommendations on trip advisor and it was a good move. It's not so easy to get to the zoo from the city center, we had to use two trams and i takes around 30, 40 min, but it was worth it. Zoo is situated on the hill and around it, it's very green, animals have large runs, it looks more like a safari park than a standard zoo. I could see many species which I haven't seen anywhere else like tapir. It's great place for families with children because you can find there many places to eat, sit down, rest, so kids will not be exhausted to fast. I'm very happy that I could see such a nice place.

well worth the visit. Really nice family outing. Huge open space. Great selection of animals. Lots of eating outlets. Free Wifi in selected area..... near the elephantsReally easy to find using public transport. Reasonably priced.Could easily spend the day there. Would highly recommend .
Great zoo 9/10. Lots of animals to see, plenty of benches and restaurants along the way tooHowever I almost boiled in this place, it was so hot I couldn't believe it

Great zoo to visit. This is a great zoo to visit. A very large variety of animals and is being updated with new structures. Especially love the aviary sections and the many different kinds of birds they have.

Absolutely huge. This is a whole day out for all the family. Entry prices are really cheap compared to other zoos we have visited and the whole zoo is massive. The zoo is almost in 2 halves with regards to modernisation as some of the enclosures are poor but it is obvious there is a lot of work in progress. Once inside there is lots to see and do and lots of ground to cover so wear comfortable shoes. I was very surprised at the price of food and drink inside as to make a picnic would probably have been more expensive!As the zoo is so big there seems to be a lack of staff to ask questions but the information boards are excellent. Felt sad for the polar bears, hopefully their enclosure is next, but could have sat and watched the gorillas and tigers for hours. Definitely recommend.

Fantastic (and cheap!). Easy to reach from the city centre (red metro to Holelovice and then 112 bus direct to entrance) and entry is a bargain 200kc per adult. The zoo is not laid out on the level and so you'll have to be prepared to walk up and down some gentle slopes. A lot of the animals are in the open and so you can get quite close (if they're awake as many are more active at night). It's great to see the bears/penguins/crocs from underwater viewing stations. I particularly enjoyed the indoor bat experience - be warned as they are free flying and may make you jump as they buzz past! As with all attractions in Prague we were surprised at the reasonable price of food etc.The one aspect I had a bit of concern over is the the chairlift. A great idea for getting from up and down to the higher/lower level but not only is it a bit rickety, safety is obviously not a major concern as there's only a loose chain to keep you in and I had to secure it myself as the chair left the station and the girls at the bottom were more interrested in their own conversation than making sure I left my seat. However, the ride is almost free at 20kr per trip (there's coin paystations for tickets).Just up from the top chairlift station is a viewing platform with good views over the zoo and surrounding area.I've been to many zoos and this is right at the top - especially when compared to the likes of London zoo which is not only expensive by comparison but also in need of a serious revamp. It is well laid out and feels spacious (which it is).You won't regret making the effort to visit.

Brilliant zoo. This zoo really is up there with the best. It is enormous and you can comfortably spend a whole day there. It takes a small effort to get there from the city centre by public transport but for the experience it is well worthwhile. The number of animals and variety on show is very impressive and they all seem to be well looked after! There are plenty of places to stop off for a drink or a bite to eat around the zoo and beer is served across many off the stalls. Incredible value for money, entrance is 200kc for adults and refreshments and souvenirs are very cheap as well. An excellent day out and a must see for anyone visiting Prague.
So much to see. Great zoo, not sure I saw all of it, just so much to see and do. Animals looked very well cared for and healthy, with loads of space, and staff very friendly. Recommended!

Fun day trip to the zoo. Prague zoo was a bit of a spear of the moment choice, as it was a nice day. As we were staying near to St Charles bridge, we walked to the top of Wenceslas square and caught the metro (museum to Nadrazi Holesovice) which is the Red line, then straight out of the station onto the 112 zoo bus. It was an easy journey once explained to us. Both the metro and bus run very frequently. We made the mistake of not eating breakfast before going, as we thought we would save time and eat there, but soon realised the type of food was not really aimed towards breakfast and ended up eating something similar to kebab meat and chips lol. I'd certainly say get a map and roughly plan a route, as the park is quite confusing and spaced out. We had a lovely day there and really enjoyed being so close to the polar bears swimming, they were mesmerising to watch. It was nice to be able to buy a few beers whilst walking around to, which were very cheap, roughly £1.75 a pint and entrance was £6.00 per adult, so a cheap day trip. The zoo itself seemed very nice, with decent sized enclosures, apart from the lions, which could have done with being bigger in my opinion. Animal feeding times are clearly marked in each area and there is a sky lift which takes you up the hill, with another part of the park and some great views. There is never to far to walk to either a toilet, seating area for a rest or somewhere to eat. All in all a nice day out.

Best Zoo I have ever visited. If you have an extra day in Prague, go to the zoo. It is built on top of and into the side of the mountain. There are beautiful views of the city and area, great food, and some of the best exhibits I have ever seen. The savannah area is the larges I have seen in a zoo. They have many unique animals and the exhibits are very large and natural (as zoos go). Fun for all ages and easily accessed from the main tourist area by cab or public transportation

Spacious and varied. I'm always in two minds about zoos - respecting them for their educational value and railing against them for keeping animals in captivity - so I was pleased to find that on the whole the animals at Prague Zoo are given plenty of space and seem quite content. (Some of the interior spaces were cramped, but hopefully this will be addressed in time; it seems as though the place is expanding and improving.)As an Australian I was also impressed by the comparatively large and representative array of fauna from my own country: grey and red kangaroos, wallabies and wallaroos, as well as emus and cassowaries and an enclosure with free-flying rainbow lorikeets.We didn't eat or drink or at the zoo, but if admission prices are anything to go by I imagine it's a fairly wallet-friendly day out whatever your age and whoever you go with.

Little gem of a find. Although off the beaten track Prague zoo has such a plethora of animals to view.the admission price is ridiculously cheap and the day was filled with laughter.the food was also very commendable

Nice zoo. Lovely zoo. My only complaint is that the lions, tigers and other various big cat enclosures are on the small side. Sharing one cage was 3 leopards and a black panther, far too small for all 4 of them. One of the Tigers is rather skinny also. The raven cage is also far too small and they cannot fly properly. Also the polar bears are in small enclosures.There are many positives about the zoo though. It's very cheap. Me and my partner spent around £30 for entry and food and drinks. The zoo is very well kept and most of the animals have lovely enclosures and look very content. Definitely take the cable car seats to the top of the zoo for 20 crowns, it's a lot of fun and you get some awesome views!

A "must-see" Zoo in Prague!. If you come to Prague even for a short period don't miss this wonderful Zoo! A large territory with a range of animals. It seems that all the Zoo inhabitants are comfortaby livng there. You will not see any cages as in prison.The most interesting for us was the place where a lot of lemurs live. You can make a photo sitting with a lemur (or 2, 3 lemurs..) on one bench! You can practically touch a lemur (but this is not allowed, unfortunately). A lot of positive emotions!Wear comfortable shoes as it will take all day to walk through the whole territory, which is well-cared-for.The Prague Zoo is an interesting place both for children and grown-ups.

Fun experience. They had a large range of animals from around the world. It's a big park and it took us 5 - 6 hours to get around it all. Bring good shoes for walking. You might want to eat during this time, but bring your own food. The cafeteria was terrible. Food was dry, tasteless and actually kinda pricy for prague and what you got for your money. Altso it was really loud in there. Wouldn't recommend it. Think some of the animals seemed lonely and stressed as they walked back and forth a lot. Pack animals shouldn't be alone. The stress part might be a bit the tourists fault as there signs showing when you should be a bit quieter. Also the area for the polar bears was small. Can't imagine that's a good habitat even though they seemed to just be sleeping for the most part. Lots of rest rooms. Lots of places to get something to drink. Couldn't get into the WiFi spots, but there seemed to be quite a few around the park. There aren't signs in English, so study the map beyond the entrance. Overall a fun experience.

Lovely zoo. Went here on june 17th lovely when sun out. Its a fairly big zoo and i have been to quite a few zoos and parks. A lot of info was in czech we paid for a map on entrance. We arrived on a river boat when u got there you had like a ten min walk past a lovely chatau which was good. Got there about 11 am and left around 4 45 a big zoo so be prepared to walk.I always think a good zoo always have young and they had plenty here lots if different animals in good enclosures. The only one that hugely disappointed me was the polar bears oh dear that enclosure the size of a postage stamp way way too small for three polar bears they were pacing and doing the same over and over obviously bored. The enclosure about the same size as mandy the polar bear at flamingoland and there was one if her. Something needs to be done about it.The food outlets fine we ate by the one by the giraffes n elephants was pretty good actually. Had a lovely day and would recommend only about 6 quid to get in was lovely going and coming back on the riverboat. Hope they give the polar bears a bigger home like at least ten times its current size x

Amazing zoo. This is one of the best zoo's that I have visited. It is easily accessible, take the metro then get on a bus, takes approx 20-30 minutes.The zoo is so big, the enclosures are really adequately sized for the animals, and there is still so much space to expand, which I think they're in the process of doing so.The animals do seem well cared for, they were all relaxed, and may had just had babies, which is always a good sign of healthy animals!It is very cheap to get into the zoo - 200 CZK and well worth it. We spent around 4 hours here and even then we didn't see everything!

Well worth a day. Wonderful place, very sprawling with animals clearly happy in their environment. Ski lift a nice touch. Easy bus access but a bit of a queue to get in. I wouldn't normally bother with a zoo on a short city visit but this one is cared for, clean, good value food and drink, ticks all the boxes.

Great day out. Myself and my boyfriend visited the zoo to get out of the centre of Prague for the day, and had a great time. It has the widest selection of animals I have seen in a zoo, and they all seem well cared for. We really enjoyed seeing the polar bears, and the multitude of tigers, and taking the chairlift up to the higher part of the zoo (definitely more fun than walking!). It took us a whole day to go round- the zoo is very big!- definitely worth a visit :)

Lovely day out. This is a lovely day out at a zoo that is beautifully maintained both the grounds and the animals. We went on a very hot day so a lot of the animals were too hot to come out and show themselves. There are plenty of places to buy drinks and snacks. One thing I would recommend it that you wear flat, comfortable shoes as you walk miles and miles or at least what seems like it. The entrance fee was also very reasonable.

talk about awesome . I am not a great fan of enclosures and caged animals, but mannn did I love this place, I have read other reviews and ofcourse if you dont like zoos then simple dont go there, but if you go there with an open mind and understanding there is also survival preservation and caring of the animals, then as me you will love it. I arrived at 2 pm it was an extremely hot day but they had vendors and toilettes very well sparse inside the park so no problem there. the enclosures are nothing short of awesome. The elephant one that holds 7 elephants and shows u how they live is very professional. Loved the zoo and their work the metro will take u to the bus connection and to the zoo's door ( bonus one of the royal summer palaces is just infront of the it)

Great Zoo. We visited Prague zoo on our last day and really enjoyed it. There are good transport links, we got the metro and then there is a shuttle bus which takes you right outside. The zoo is so big you could easily spend a whole day there in order to see it all. They have a good variety of animals, some which we were surprised to see such as polar bears. I think Prague zoo would be fun for all ages, we are young travellers (aged 19) and it was a good day out, we would recommend the zoo to anyone!

Brilliant... This was an excellent trip for a couple of hours. The zoo is located in Troja, and easy to get to. It is a good walk to get around it, and to see all that it has to offer, I recommend putting on comfortable shoes. I was amazed with the varieties of animals in this zoo, even animals I've not seen in real life before. There are lots of places to eat. Lots of wifi hotspot for you to upload pictures or to check-in to your Facebook page, or an Instagram photo with the correct location. As for me, I recommend this zoo to everyone, it is a must see if you are in Prague.

In serching rhino.  Very good zoo. You walk in the park like, and around different animals. Made with great creativity and love. Lack grids creates the effect of presence and immersion in nature.It is a pity that now there are no rhino skin which was painted with aftograf visitors

Great Zoo...empty exhibits.... The zoo is big - REALLY big. There are many different species of animals spread throughout this zoo, which is situated on the slope of a tall mountain. That meant lots of uphills and downhills with strollers. It seemed some of the exhibits were vacant. Not "the animals are resting" vacant - more like "this exhibit is closed!" vacant. There also seemed to be a bunch of exhibits under renovation. The zoo's been rated as 1 of the best in the world. Not a zoo afficianado, I'll take their word for it. We went for the kids, the kids liked it, that was it.

Amazballs!!!! Super super super day of fun.. This place is so easy to get to - public transport is a dream in Prague and very cheap. We arrived early - 9.30am and the place was already busy. There is just so much to see - its just wonderful. Saw animals here I didn't even know existed - and I'm an animal lover. My suggestions would be to buy a map though - think its like 15 Krone or something. Almost all of the attractions have English translations - there are interactive items on some of the pens (wolf howling beside wolfs etc etc). I think the best part of the zoo was the "free flying fruit bats" section. That is one of the coolest things I've ever seen. You walk through their enclosure and they fly around you head (or at least that's what it feels like!!!). They have put huge effort into making this suitable for all ages - which I think it does exceptionally well. My only issue was that one of the Sumatran Tigers was very very thin. This may be in their make up and how they are in the wild but when you can see the top of hip bones - it made me feel a little uncomfortable. But other than that - I would go back again tomorrow if I lived in Prague. Well done - excellent!!!

Don't go when its hot!. A big zoo and there was enough room for the animals (big areas, not small fences). We saw all kind of new animals and there were some baby animals (elephant, tapir, goats) so very cute! The zoo is big so prepare to walk a lot. We went there when it was sunny and almost 30°C warm, so we didn't have enough energy to see all the animals and the animals didn't have much energy either, so they just slept. So if you want to see them do something else than sleeping, pick a cooler day. Also, demand a map, because we didn't get one when we bought our tickets and no one offered it to us. Don't know if they forgot or if my face didn't please them enough. But other than that it was a nice visit and you can get there easily by bus (112) and there's lot of places to get something to eat or drink.

What a great experience. The zoo is just amazing, it has almost everything you can think of, from all continents. It takes a few hours to pass everything and see everything. The animals are well fed, kept in large pavilions and seem happy, as opposed to some other worse kept zoos I've been to.The entrance is very cheap, and they have student passes (they didn't even ask us for student ID). There are a few restaurants and also many stalls for drinks or fast food. The toilets are all around, free and clean. I recommend downloading or buying a map (its 5 ck) especially if you want to make sure you didn't miss anything.In the afternoon most of the animals got lazy and sleepy, especially the felines (surprise surprise) so I'm guessing that going earlier would be better especially if you would like to snap some pictures.

The best ZOO in Europe. I have been visited lot of zoo in Europe, and I think that Prague zoo is most beautiful. Lot of exotic animals in nice pavilons, also animals like on farm and many restaurant and shops.

gorillas and polar bears. Great zoo. the gorillas and polar bears were so cute. The zoo was easy to get around. It was cheap. The animals had good enclosures. The zoo was clean. English translations weren't so great. Go visit, we had a fun day!
Great zoo. For those who arrive in Prague zoo is a must do but you have to remember that to visit the zoo will need at least half a day for it is huge.

Right place at the wrong time. When we went to the zoo the weather was still somewhere around +5 so unfortunately most of the animals were inside. However, this zoo being in Central Europe, they have thought about this and many of the animals can be seen inside their own "rooms". It was a little sad but we only had a few days so we had to go someday. The area was beautiful!The zoo is located a little outside the city center but it is very easy to reach. Just take the metro line C to Nadrazi Holesovice and there bus No 112 will be waiting. The bus' final stop is the zoo so it's easy to use. Also if you buy a metro ticket for 60 minutes, it will be enough for you to use it also on the bus.

Some of the enclosures were terrible but some were great - OK zoo.. The zoo was very easy to get to, cheap to pay into and large and easy to get around. Some of the enclosures were terrible though with poor research. The entire Indonesian enclosure was pretty off, at least 4 different animals were named sugar gliders when they definitely weren't, one was a possum if I remember correctly and the other ones weren't even marsupials I don't think. Very poor English translations. The most interesting translation was a 'baboon' in a 6" x 4". I assume it was a baboon spider but I didn't see it so it could have been a miniature baboon... They also mixed a lot of lizards into one enclosure, they weren't labelled and they were put in with mammals. There was a fair bit of overcrowding in this section. Strangely, they couldn't even correctly identify people, there were pictures of Australian Aboriginals representing Indonesia.The polar bear enclosure was awful, they had no toys the entertain them at all so the polar bears were distressed. One had a cut paw and was walking up and down a ledge licking the ledge at the same point each time it turned around... urgh, it was depressing.Moving on from this section though there were some great exhibits, the bird sections were amazing, a lot of the birds could fly free, they seemed quite happy and they somehow stuck to their enclosures. The pelicans were hilarious, you could get quite close to them (keep small children away, they like to attack people) and the flamingos looked pretty happy about their enclosure.The wild cat section was brilliant, the cats seemed very happy, they were kept entertained and the enclosures were clean and nice. The cats were happy enough to breed which says something.The elephants were very happy, also breeding which was a good sign. This area was great, the maned wolf enclosure was beautiful, the antelope although incorrectly signed at times I'm pretty sure looked happy.Food wise the zoo is brilliant, there is a lot of choice, there's lots of beer, vegetarian food. There's a great cable seat that takes you up to the top of the hill.I wouldn't recommend this zoo to a friend, I feel that the enclosures are too hit and miss. Some are great and some are depressing.

Fantastic day out for old and young. A great day out at Prague zoo for young and old.Getting there is easy buy a one day travel ticket for £3.10p gets you on tram , bus and metro.get of at Nadrazi Hlesovice ( red metro line ) and then a zoo bus stop it outside the station.Entrance to zoo is only £6.00 ( don`t go on Mondays in May -free for mums and toddles place packed ) Loads to see and do when inside well spaced out so good footwear needed.

Big, vast but non with english texts. Very big and plenty animals (very nice at the girafs and elephants).But the writings are mostly only in czech language and not in english. Also, they don't have a map in english, and even like that the map is not free to get.Nice zoo, but the Stuttgart Zoo was better.

Good place to visit with kids!. We spent a weekend in Prague, the zoo is very nice we specially liked the ice bears and the elephans! Our kids had a very good time, the food in the main restaurant was ok, but the cleaning personal is rude. The ice cream pleace is very nice! We had a 0.50€ tutti frutti ice that was delicious!!

zoo lovers. Easy to get to from centre Prague.train 20 mins or under,32k or less travel per adult. C line then 10 min bus.zoo entry 200 kron adult.spend 4-6 hours looking around,lots of food around site,not expensive.enjoy.

Great day out for animal lovers. This review first featured on North East Nerd (http://www.northeastnerd.co.uk/)As far as zoos go, Prague is great. It was similar to Edinburgh Zoo in that a lot of the walking is uphill and it can be tiring. We had prepared ourselves sandwiches that morning because we didn't want to spend any more money than necessary (although we came home with a lot of travel money left over) so there wasn't the chance to experience any of the food available. But we aren't going for food anywhere - I want to see the animals! There is a whole list of animals you'd expect to see at the zoo. The highlights of Prague Zoo were:- The elephants: there were so many of them and there was the cutest baby elephant ever in such a playful mood. I think it was only 2 years old. It was playing on the rocks, climbing up them only to get stuck and try and maneuver down (and got a stern look from an older elephant like it had just been in trouble!) and it also ran around and made a cute little noise, like a squeaky trumpet. Adorable!- The owls: I don't know if I've ever seen an owl in the zoo - I don't recall it - but Prague Zoo had a few and we saw up close THE sassiest owl. It was a funny little bird.- The polar bear: the bear only had a small (ish) enclosure, or at least a small amount of water so was doing laps. It came right up to the glass several times.- The bats: as with most zoos there is a nocturnal enclosure and it was dark in there. The weirdest thing about this bit was that there was no glass screen or metal caging around the bats so they flew right above us and past us!All in all, the animals were not shy when we visited! We were up close to a lot of them and it was such a fun day out. The zoo was easy to figure out, although large, so we made a neat enough route around to see most of the animals (definitely all the ones we had wanted to see). It was a full day (or close enough) affair but definitely worth a visit for animal lovers.

Awesome. The best thing we did all week. The zoo is huge, with loads to see; we actually ran out of time and missed a few animals after 5 hours of walking minus lunch. The animals seem happy, and their living conditions good. Plenty of animals you don't see in every zoo, and the layout of the zoo was very nice.

Best ZOO in CEE. Best ZOO in Central/Eastern Europe and still under development of new pavillons and attraction. You can not only see the animals but you can educate yourself in topic on nature. You will need full day to visit the ZOO and enjoy the time there.

Very big !. I really enjoy zoos and these one have some red pandas so it was amazing !
Big number of species, big park, cannot see everything in one day...
I'll do it again !
