Lemurs around you . If you are adult it's no matter! Zoo so big. It's really hard to see its all. Prague zoo is first zoo where I saw hippopotamuses. Also you can take photos with lemur!

East or west, home is best. As I visited a lot of European and Czech zoological gardens I can well compare and I think Prague Zoo is the best. A lot of beautiful and interesting animals in good and still upgraded enclosures, a lot of accompanying program and almost every weekend some special event. Appropriate amount of restaurants, machines for drinking and souvenir shops. The fact, that zoo is from the river up the hill give visitors an opportunity to have a beautiful view on the city, which provides also the cabin and the tower.
Must See. Really great zoo with loads of cool animals. It was very cheap to visit. The zoo is accessible by tram/bus from Old Town Square.
Really nice a peaceful place to spend the afternoon. Really nice pleace where the animals have a almost natural place where to live, where visitors are close, but it does not disturb them that much.

Tired Feet But So Worth It. Wow! This zoo definitely earns its rank as one of the top 10 zoos in the world. By the end of our visit my FitBit says I walked close to 8 miles. I think that is because there was so much to see and we could not find the most efficient way to see it allWe want to the airport immediately after and were relieved that our luggage fit in the lockers at the front of the zoo. A 10 ck coin is all you need for the locker and you get it back when you return the key. Also if you geocache, there are many throughout the zoo. We were able to complete 4 but there were a ton of them!Highly recommend this to others!

Gorgeous zoo with lots of attractions. Being on a Familytrip we decided to visit the prague zoo. We were absolutely surprised. You can see the Kattas running and sitting near you, without being in a cage, there is a small Chairlift up the hill, to see the Horses and lots of small paths and many playgrounds.

best zoo i have ever been to. definitely worth a visit, we spent all day there and for the entry fee its definitely worth it! we went as 2 adults but walked through like excited children. definitely take a camera. easy to get to too, we went on the Zoo bus, you simply can't get lost it, the last stop is the zoo! :)
Worth the money. Prague zoo is hudge! Never seems to end lots of animals and lovely walks. Cable car back to top of the zoo.

Amazing day. Prague ZOO is really huge and it takes all day to see all the animals you like but it's worth it. The ticket price is alright for what you see. The ZOO is pretty accessible. The parking lot is few metres from the entrance or you can go by bus. There are so many types of animals, lots of places to sit down, to eat, several toilets just everything you need. When you go down the hill there's a beautiful view of Prague. You can also use a cableway to go up the hill, it's good when you're tired or your feet are sore. I like that you can see all the animals very close and love the new pavilions for elephants and hippos. The only thing that's driving me mad is that I've never seen a porcupine because he was holed up every time I've been there.

Highlight of Prague. We hadn't had time to check any website and didn't know where the Zoo was located in relation to the city center. And nor did we know what to expect.The Zoo is really big and you can easily spend a whole day strolling around.We easily managed to get there by subway and a bus. There are some kiosks and smaller restaurants. We can recommend the Pizzeria place located on the top, got some nice views. Regarding the animals they range from small little spiders to polar bears. Something for everyone and definetly worth a visit especially with the very cheap entrance fee!

Loved the zoo. We spent all day here, had a blast they have lots of baby animals including a giraffe and meerkats. The buses pick you up at the tram stop and pick you back up and its really good value for money. There are lots of places to eat. They have 2 polar bears and loads of big cats. Maps are not in English.

A wonderful zoo. London Zoo should go to Prague and see how to combine interesting animals with terrific viewing sites.The enclosures for lions, tigers, hippos are so good that you are able to see them very closeThis zoo has a bewildering array of animals, some of which I had never seen before.Easy to get to by tram, good value entrance fee

Great day at Prague Zoo!!. This is a great place to go if you are visiting Prague with kids. The ticket price is 200 CZK for adult and 150 CZK for child over 3 years. Check zoo website for the family and group discounts.Prague Zoo is located in the Praha Troja municipal district. To get to the zoo you need to catch the red line metro and get off at Nadrazi Holesovice metro station. Walk outside the station building and get on bus number 112. The last stop of this bus is zoo! The first stop being Nadrazi Holesovice. Also the metro station has mcdonald and other kebab shops if you want to grab breakfast or lunch before boarding on the bus. The bus takes appx 20 minutes to reach the zoo. The bus will leave you just outside the ticket office and on a work day there was no queue before us. It's highly recommended to have a map of zoo before you enter. You can buy one at the same time as buying ticket for less than 10 pence or can download one for free for your smart phone or tablet from here:http://www.zoopraha.cz/images/default/MAPA_ENG%202013V02.jpgThe zoo is very well laid out and have directions and maps available at many places but in local language. This is not a big problem and carrying a map will help in case you are looking for direction and is not available nearby. The zoo has abundant toilets, places to sit, food and other facilities. We were surprised to find the free wifi near elephants and kids play area.The animals are very well kept and on a relatively modest walk we could cover 80% of the zoo in one day after reaching zoo at 11.47 am. The zoo also runs a railway, paid separately, if you are tired and want to be carried. We suggest to cover the zoo in anti clock wise direction from main entrance because it was easier to walk steeper uphill pathway with a buggy in the morning. So from the map above starting at main entrance go to Polar bear > hippo house > African house > Elephant valley. From there you can go for a chair lift ride which we found a bit adventurous so did not attempt. Then we headed downward hill and mid alleys for tortoises and lion. In summary we tried to cover all animals marked with dark black colour :)The kids were amazed and wanted to go to zoo the next day as well but this place is highly rerecorded. The zoo is clean, food options are not expensive and majority of them being under £5. On a hot day in May, do not carry any extra weight that needed, bringing a large bottle of water and camera. We loved Great Aviary and Chambal as per map.We left zoo at 6.30 pm and the exit doors are spacious enough for buggies for self check out. Please note that exit is different from main entrance and located next to fur seals. The bus stop for 112 return journey is just outside the door.Highly recommended zoo for a brilliant day!!

Great zoo. By far largest zoo I've been to - almost impossible to see everything if you are visiting with a few years old child... So plan your trip wisely. If you are travelling by car, there is plenty of parking spaces (chargeable) at each entrance. Also prepare for al lot of walking up/down hill.. really! :) As for the zoo itself it's excellent - the enclosures are big and well maintained but at the same time easily accessible. Animals are versatile and looking great - never have I seen so many gorillas playing on the grass; tapirs, ant eaters, monkeys... looking so good as opposed to many other zoos. The Ocean Restaurant serves decent food at very good price - you will find there both Czech specialities and standard fried chicken breast + fries options. Scattered around the zoo there are also many booths with drinks, as well as one or two smaller restaurants. After the lunch, when you are exhausted but your children still have a lot of energy, go to 'Bororo Reserve' - a massive playground for children in the southern part of the zoo, near the main entrance. A huge construction of tree houses, rope bridges, slides, very well designed and suitable for children of all ages. In a word, a must see when in Prague.

AMAZING!!. Let me start by saying I am a HUGE zoo fanatic and love anything to do with animals....This did not disappoint!! A few points....1. The animals enclosures are beautifully maintained and are good decent sizes! 2. The sheer number of animals here is amazing. I've always loved chester zoo, however this has a number of the same species, meaning that animals are not alone! 3. The animals are really close up, and everything is a photo opportunity as they are so close. 4. The environment is beautiful. There is large spaces between each section of animals, but this is filled with flowers and statues which make it amazing. 5. Transport to the zoo is very reliable6. During our visit, the elephant enclosure was being cleaned. During this there were two men who had obviously trained the elephants and we're doing tricks and riding them. One of the elephants appeared to have some scrapes on it, 4 of the zoo keepers were checking this and looked genuinely concerned. The showed compassion to these animals. Tips....1. Wear comfortable shoes, there is a lot of uphill walking (if you are like me and are petrified of the cable carts you'll be walking ALOT) 2. Take a packed lunch and drinks. The food in the park isn't great, and the drinks are quite bland.3. Don't expect too much from signs, there is not much Czech to English translation (nor did we have access to an English map) 4. Some of the workers there don't have great English skills either (but then again, us English can be quite ignorant to the fact that not everyone speaks English when we feel they should) 5. Take a camera.....you'll be disappointed to not be able to see this again afterwardsBest bits....1. Polar bears2. Penguins3. Elephants4. Giraffes5. Gorillas

Huge Zoo. It's a must-go if you are in Prague!! It's a very huge zoo, animals are divided by species and there are of all kind. It costs really few money and there are several discounts (if you are students, family tickets or group tickets for example). It's easily reachable by bus which stops right in front of the zoo. If you like animals it's worth definitely a visit!!
Must do. Lovely and huge zoo. Not nice food provided but friendly people and animals :-) Cheap entrance, great yearly deal if you plan to go at least 3 times in a year.

Great to spend a day with kids.. Nice 4 hour walk, also visited botanical garden right after (1 bus stop). Lovely time, lots of interesting animals. Polar bears were playing. Washrooms were free :) and enough food courts. Great day. The only thing is that you have to love to walk hills.

Nice zoo . Pretty huge place that will take the entire day to cover, with a good variety of animals to see. Food stalls aplenty with reasonable prices so one won't get hungry. My only gripe was that people are allowed to smoke all over the place. Smoke ain't good for the animals.... In all, this is a good place to visit for anyone, and very family friendly.

Brilliant! . This is the best zoo I have been to! I thoroughly recommend to any family or couple. It's cheap to get in compared to English zoo's and there's tons to see and do. The elephants and giant tortoises were my favourite bit. If you want to reduce costs catch the bus it stops right outside. Food, ice cream and drinks are also reasonable.
HUGE!. One of the best in the world, without a doubt. Just beware: it's big, very big, huge. So bring good shoes, think about how to manage your kids and book loads of time

A whole day of wow. What I like the most about Prague Zoo is that you get to see many of the animals from literally centimetres away behind a glass. It is one thing to see a tiger from 10 metres distance behind bars and another to be able to witness how the big cat is eating its food just a glass width away. You should save a whole day for the zoo. It is a great escape from the busy Prague streets and the entrance fee is relatively lower to most zoos in Europe. :)

Worth a visit. I had read some not so positive review on TA but I went nonetheless. It is huge and some areas are under renovation works but I think it's worth a visit if you like zoos. Enclosures are not so small as I had read here and actually many animals enjoy spacious enclosures to roam in. It is easy to get there from the city centre (metro and a short bus ride) and it's cheap. Very well organised and suitable for families with kids. Don't miss the Africa section!

Zoo. We were here in the summer. IT was great time. Even my boyfriend who went there to make me happy was happy suprised. And nów I dont have to recommend zoo to him . Perfect way to spend time. But you have to send there all Day to See everything :)It's worth to See it ! :)

Very nice place to go with family or friends!. Lots of attractions for children, animals a bit sad bus there are all of them: tigers, hippos (amazing one), wolfs, penguins, elephants and giraffes. We had an almost 3 hours walk and it was still interesting. The only bad thing was that the road was not marked so we had to find ourselves all the spots without any noticeable order.

Lovely day trip . We managed to see all animals and birds in 5 hours. It is huge! Would definitely recommend viewing everything on the lower levels then working your way up as the entrance and exits are on the lower ground.The whole zoo goes up in layers of steep hills so make sure you wear comfy shoes.There are great views when you reach the top and there is a cable ride that reachs the top of the zoo if your lazy.There are a great variety of animals and birds and an amazing rainforest section which looks quite spectacular. There is also a section you can walk through where there are free flying fruit bats. It is dark inside so it's hard to see them but it is a great experience .

the best zoo visit. if you like animals, it's a must visit. with 10 kms of trails you will really enjoy a good walk along with a close encounter to hundreds of species.it's very important to be ready to walk for long hours, and it needs more than 6 hours.... make sure to study your trip in order to avoid duplicate paths.the only problem is that the exit sign isn't clear, so u need to rely on others to find ur way out.an enjoyable experience, especially when the weather permits.
You must go there. we troveled there on 2012.it was cold and still it was excellent expirience.it is one of the intresting zoo that i ever been.
It's a zoo!. Nice big zoo. Great way to spend time on a sunny day. Cheap prices both for entrance and food. A place to go if you have the time and like animals

Awesome place to spend rest of the day!. If you're going there - prepare for whole day, because there are aaaaaaalot what to see! I loved it and definetely if you are in Prague - you need to visit it!

Cheap, amazing views, cable car- just great!. Visited here with my boyfriend during a 4 day trip to Prague. Just brilliant! So cheap at 200ck each and absolutely huge. We spent almost 4 hours here and completely lost track of time. Take the cable car to the top part of the zoo and enjoy beautiful views over the whole of Prague, followed by a coffee(or beer) at the cafe at the top of the cable car to be greeted by even more incredible views of the city. Highly recommended (follow this by a stroll to Letna Park in the afternoon and you're in for a pretty awesome day)!

Perfect day trip for the family. Beautiful zoo covering nearly every range of species one can think of.. Take the small chairlift to the top and enjoy a great view of the city before you wind back down. We especially enjoyed the lions and tigers. Food was really inexpensive, but you could pack a lunch if desired.

Fantastic Day Out!. Me and my boyfriend visited Prague Zoo on our last day of our stay in Prague after hearing it was one of the best in Europe. It only cost us about £5 to get in which we were quite surprised about. We really enjoyed ourselves here and saw plenty of different animals and was able to get quite close to many. There are lots of places to stop for food and drinks dotted around the zoo and the prices were very reasonable. As the zoo is located on a big hillside it can get quite tiring to go up and down if you have missed particular exhibits out. We kept looking at the maps situated around the park to try and plan the routes we wanted to take so we saw as many animals as we could as it is quite a large zoo! There is also a chairlift that takes you up the hillside or back down for only 20ck each way, which is convenient and fun too. It was a great day and we spent about 5 hours here but you could easily spend more time if you aren't too tired, and for the price we paid we definitely weren't disappointed!

Very cool Zoo.. Very cool Zoo. Everyone liked it. Very cool polar bears and cage for birds of prey. A lot of different animals, beautiful views over Prague and cable mainly for children and people to weight 100 kg. Overall, I recommend. Only downside is parking garages as anyone out there chooses the car it I suggest to be there about 8-8: 30 in the morning.

Animal and people friendly. Nice zoo.Can be easily reached from Prague centre by metro (zoo marked exit) and bus (almost ad hoc) for abt 120 CZK (4,5 euro appx).Zoo is well organized, with nice rest and food areas scattered across the sections.Many nice and well treated animals, among those worth a special mention:Large polar bears, big cats, Indian elephants, tapir, large scavengers and eagles.A perfect experience to complement my enjoyable time in Prague

Amazing Zoo. Went to this Zoo and was amazed at the facilities and animals... They have Polar Bears!? I had never seen a Polar Bear before in my life!!It's such a big Zoo it took us the best part of 5/6 hours to get round it (and we cut out the stuff that didn't interest us like birds)Good places to eat (omg, the hot dogs!) and a chair lift which was quite amusing, a bit like at skiing...Steep in some places but easily manageable. Good value for money and a great day out!

Brilliant day out. We visited prague zoo on easter sunday! We spent almost 6 hours there and probably could have been longer if we weren't so knackered. The zoo is massive and goes up the side of a hill! We decided to walk up and down so that we could see all of the animals! The zoo was really well laid out with toilets and food stops all over the place. the food was reasonably priced and very tasty! There were so many animals there that it is hard to pick my favourite I did particularly like the elephant bit and the polar bear bit! The enclosures were very spacious and the animals seemed happy. Its lovely to see how the zoo has rebuilt itself after the devastating floods and it is hard to believe the height of the flood when you see the post showing you how high it got. Prague zoo is definitely worth a visit!

Fantastic zoo. A very good zoo! Loads of animals and very cheap. As we were student we only had to pay £4 a ticket. Food and drink is excellent, I had a beer for English equivalent at only 89p and my burger £2.50. Absolute bargain and you can really get up and personal with the animals.

Amazing place!. This is the best zoo I visited in my life. An incredible number of animals and all the place has very well level of maintenence. You can also find many restaurants and place where you can eat. Amazing place for 200kc

Very decent zoo, up close. Good zoo, easy get to. Take red c line metro to holesvice.. Get off and take bus 112 to end of then line (10 min journey) nb. There are two exits at holesvice. take the one to the left as you exit the train if you arrive from Prague centre. Zoo is free for under 12s, so was only £20 for us... 2 adults,2 kids. Great range of anmals , big park, lots of food outlets. Some animals doing that pacing thing, but most seem happy. We spent to 6 hours there. Bus back every15 mins. Nice chair lift in the park and play area.

One of the world's best. It's the second time I come to visit Prague Zoo with my family and we love it.Is's the 8º best zoo in the world and with good reason and it's not expensive.The best way to see it, because it's on a hill is to start down and go up wilh the forfait they have.The gorillas are amazing!

A very interesting and well organized zoo. We went to the zoo on a cold and rainy day. Much of the zoo can be experienced indoors, which is invaluable on such a day. The variety of animals was astounding, and each habitat was well designed and spacious (many are both indoor and outdoor). The felines are fed indoors, so that one can watch them from less than a meter away from behind a huge glass. It was a memorable experience. There were also many enormous birds I had never seen before, and I've visited my share of zoos. All animals looked to be in excellent health, which is very important. I highly recommend a visit!

Worth a visit. We visited the zoo in early February- yes it was a little cold but the sun was shining and the zoo was quiet- felt like we were the only ones there! Very spacious and beautiful grounds and all the animals looked well cared for- the larger animals such as giraffes, elephants etc were missing because of the weather, but still pleanty to see. It is so cheap too compared to other zoos I have visited but one of the best- definatly try and eat at the cafe near the Africa enclosure- very cheap but very delicious... Enjoy!

Excellent day out - highly recommended. We visited the zoo in March 2015 and had an amazing time. It's very cheap (only €5 for the day). The zoo is very big, I think the perimeter spans about 10km so I'd seriously advise wearing comfortable shoes. It's also very hilly, so you will have to climb if you want to see all of the animals. There is so much to see and the enclosures for the animals are massive. They all looked very happy, which is always a nice thing to see in zoos :) One of the best things about this zoo is that they have vantage points to see the animals in their indoor and outdoor areas. We found that a lot of the animals were indoors because the weather was quite bad but you can go in and see them. My favourites were the cats, giraffes and polar bears! I'd definitely recommend this place, it's a great day out and one of the highlights of Prague for me. One of the best zoos I've been to in years!

Wonderful Range of Critters, and They All Look Happy!. To get to the zoo take the Metro Line 'C' from anywhere in the centre to Nadrazi Holesovice (direction of Letnany) and then take the number 112 bus (runs about every five minutes). You can get various timed tickets from the Tourist Information office in the Old Square - 30 minutes, 90 minutes etc, but we found a 24-hour do-what-you-like ticket was the least stressful way of doing it. The zoo covers a large area on a steepish hillside running down to the river Vltava, and I would advise strong comfortable shoes. You will find yourself covering a fair distance. Having said all that, this is a cracking zoo! There is so much to see, and all the animals look well cared for and generally happy. In fact we were there in Springtime and we observed quite a number of very happy animals indeed! The Humboldt Penguins and the Big Eared Dogs were especially energetic.Probably best to allow a whole day in order to see everything. There are little restaurants dotted around here and there, and there are cold drinks machines (Coke etc.) all over the place. Highlights for us were the big cats (they have so many!) and the giraffes, but it's probably unfair to single any of them out.

Don't miss it. I am glad I went. An absolutely enormous ground, set on the river and up and down a steep hill. Cheap to get into, and you could spend a whole day here. Very quiet on the day we went (Monday), less than 2000 visitors for the day. Food and drinks, toilets all the way round. People with wheelchairs or prams should be aware of some steep hills.

Worth visiting. One of the best ZOO's in the world. When you see it, you believe it! Yes, some areas are still really old - the polar bears area is shocking but the bears seem happy most of the time, we have witnessed them jumping in the water and swimming, playing around. The elephant valley is amazing! I also love the Indonesian Jungle and the Archaeologic walk. The best cooked food is in Gocarovy Domy, yes a little walk away from the main animal area but worth it! The Bororo Reserve area for children is absolutely amazing. We visit few times a year!
Zoo and park in one place! ))). Perfect location to spend a whole day with your children, friends and families!!! If you have some time left you can also visit botanic garden next to zoo!

Amazing, Must Do If You Like Animals.. Decided to go here on my birthday, it was well worth the visit. The zoo is huge, lots of walking, both up hill and down hill. Animals seem to be in a great area which looks very well maintained. The food and drink amazingly was very cheap for what you would expect from a zoo.

GIGANTIC. The Prague Zoo was the largest I have ever been to. They have some of the greatest exhibits with a wide variety of animals! A trip here takes an entire day, so plan ahead. Also, make sure you have good weather because otherwise it will be miserable. You probably won't be able to see the whole thing in one day unless you're really dedicated either, so pick out your favorites on the map and just see those.

Enormous zoo. The zoo is so enormous we've spent almost 5 hours wondering around. The only problem was that we came in march which is off season and because of the cold weather many of the animals were in their cages. also a lot was under construction. and the Cable Car didn't workSo it is better to come on season when the weather is warmer.

Amazing zoo. Prague zoo is absolutely massive! A wide variety of animals with massive enclosures and are clearly treated very very well! We were happy to spend the entire day there as there was soooo much to do! Lots for little kids too with playgrounds and lots to explore! My only complaint is that the chair lift was not up to my health and safety standard seat belts were just a chain and they didn't go round the adults! This zoo without the chair lift is a must do!

The best zoo I've been to. I visited this zoo on my last day in Prague with my boyfriend. We were both very impressed. This zoo is huge & the layout is very unique. There was so much to see, some animals that I have never seen before in a zoo such as polar bears. It wasn't too busy at all & we had plenty of time to look at all the animals. I would definitely recommend visiting here on a trip to Prague. It's a really good day out!The only negative is that a fair amount of the zoo is uphill which was fine for us but I would imagine could be rather restricting for people with buggies or elderly people. Be prepared to do a lot of walking if you come here!

Excellent fun - plenty of animals!. This is really a wonderful experience. You can easily spend 5-6 hours wondering the massive grounds. You'll need a nice day, otherwise it might be quite miserable. The place is clean and well run, there are plenty of bathrooms and little food stalls throughout the zoo, and they have a very wide selection of animals, from bugs, reptiles, birds, critters, and the larger mammals like lions, elephants, giraffes, and tigers. It cost only about 200Kc per adult and is definitely worth your money! I would definitely go back.
good day out. nice zoo good for a half day visit. comfy shoes required as there is plenty of walking involved some of it uphill.

With San Diego ZOO, Prague's ZOO r the nicest in the world!!!!. just one great zoo with a nice scenery and nature even not far from old town prague and right of the bangs of the Vltava river!!! Must see place if you wanna se how the ZOO should look....

Really lovely, everything good. I've been there alone and with biologist friends. After the terrible floods a few years ago, they re-did it and it now has some really great enclosures with very interesting and generally very happy animals. It is very large - i spend a whole day there literally and still don't see everything. i like that families can take their dogs in on leashes. It is hard to have highlights that everyone would enjoy, but the pack of South American bush dogs was fantastic as too was the anaconda exhibit with the snakes swimming in a large aquarium. the Tigers and big cats had large enclosures and the vultures lots of red meat. They have some really nice bird exhibits as well as Barbary apes and mountain goats on real cliff faces. If you like animals this will keep you occupied for ages - sadly not many labels in english

A good day out. There is so much to see here, the layout is quite unique, I suggest that you get the cable lift to the top and work your way down, There is such a large variety of animals and is a great day out for all the family. It is easy to get to, Once off the metro a bus outside takes you directly there in about 5 mins. The kids will love it

Really nice experience!. Went to the Prague zoo on a rainy sunday and was pleasantly surprised. It was a bit empty (being off season) and some animals were inside since it was cold and rainy, but we still has a very good time. We especially loved seeing the Gorillas. Wow. And being a bird lover, I also love seeing the owls up close. The flamingos were also so beautiful and impressive. The zoo is big and took us around 3 hours go go through it. We had a great day and were happy we decided to stop by. PS: we also ate a sweet round wafer cookie they were selling at one of their stands and it was really good!!
Spacious zoo. Very spacious zoo with large animal residences. Loads of walking to be done, so I was thrilled there was a cableway to get up the mountain again.

Loved It!. Visited Prague zoo last week, had a brilliant day out! So many different animals to see and a great day. Only downfall was a lot of the animals were inside due to the weather and for the larger animals it did look a bit of a squeeze. So many paths leading off everywhere with indoor and outdoor areas! so many animals and such a good day out! Had a good day and would recommend a visit if you have some spare time in Prague! You can also get some really lovely views of the whole city from the hills of the zoo!

The Zoo that keeps on giving!. We are not a lover of zoo's having been in some that make us want to kidnap the animals and take them home but having read the reviews on Prague zoo we thought we would give it a go and I’m glad we did. I love animals, in particular happy animals and this zoo has plenty. It is extremely clean and the animals have plenty of room to run, fly and swim (depending on what they like to do!!). There were many doors which led to open and closed spaces which took you through to see many different animals in different climates and this is where you get the 'keeps on giving' image...it just didn’t stop! We saw many animals we had never seen before and were very pleased with the way they were looked after. Plenty of babies which in my mind means there is a good level of happiness! I fell in love with the polar bears who were having such a fab time swimming and running etc....totally gorgeous. I would definitely recommend but wear good hardy shoes......took us 6 hours to get round without a break!

Best Zoo I have visited. Really beautiful zoo with nice views to the city. Easy to reach from city center.You can spend there all day, have some good food, nice walk and animals all around which are treated with respect and great care.

a great day outdoors. there are a lot of nice animals. the area of the zoo is huge! we walked for 5 hours to see the whole zoo.we walked from our hotel to the zoo- a recommended walk with a great park in the middle.

Excellent day out.. Start at the top and work your way down, follow the map. So many species of animals, make sure your camera is fully charged. Plenty of snacks and drink stops on the way round, you will need them as it takes about five and a half hours to cover the zoo. Brilliant day out.

The Best Zoo!. This zoo is a must visit if you're in Prague, the public transport to access it is second to none (if two people that don't understand one ounce of czech can do it anyone can right?). The animals are cared for in huge enclosures that are interactive, exciting to look at and their array of animals is huge.This zoo is incredibly good value, at the equivalent of £5.80 for an adult (the price in the UK for a zoo is about £15-£20 pp) you can see lots of animals such as polar bears, a honey badger and gorillas. Even the shop was really inexpensive. Just over £3 for two pens, a notepad and a lanyard. If I lived there I'd be a member for sure!

Still obsessed with it!. I visited a lot of different zoos, but the one in my home town is still my favorite - it's got beautiful animals, some new areas and homes for the animals to be in and it is very cute! No matter if it is summer or winter, when you visit Prague, this is a must-see! A great place to spend the whole day with your family, kids or just your partner!

Interesting program. The zoo itself is much bigger the we thought it will be. The tickets are really cheap, but they have a wide range of animals. If you have at least 3 hours, then it can be a nice program.

Enjoyable day.. Make sure you buy a map as we ended up walking back on ourselves a few times! There are signposts around the zoo so a map isn't necessary but would have been a great help. You need at least half a day to see everything especially when you have young children as there is a lot of walking to do. Many of the animals were inside and not out which made it difficult to see them at times, a lot of getting up close to windows. There were plenty of toilets around the zoo which was good. The choice of food that we saw for sale wasn't that great, would definitely recommend taking food with you just in case. The range of animals is good and my neice was very happy she got to see giraffes and tigers (as was I). Overall it was a good day out but tiring!

Big zoo, lots to see. The zoo is very spacious with a great range of animals to view up close but unfortunately a few of the animals were pacing in their enclosures. Some of the enclosures were a little small but hopefully in the future the animals should get some larger areas to roam in. Take good walking shoes as there are some steep hills and the car lift was not in use when we visited last week.

Go For the Polar Bears and Seal Show. This was on top of the list of the things we wanted to do whilst we were away in Prague. After buying a daily travel ticket for 100czk (as didn't know where the zoo was) we went about to find somebody of english speaking so we could ask them where we had to go! A lovely tourist information centre at the end of Charles Bridge showed us the Tram to get to the Metro Station (C) then a train, then another bus to the zoo. Took a while to find it but was so glad we did. Then walked round in a massive circle trying to find the entrance (not well sign posted).The zoo cost us about £5 which was an absolute bargain. We followed the zoo map around and didn't realize actually how big the zoo is! It took us 4 hours to look around the whole zoo and we were pretty knackered by the end.The zoo restaurant is all in Czech so take some food with you! If for any reason you are wanting to visit the zoo. Make sure it is for the above reasons! The polar bears themselves are stunning and the seal show is fantastic. We just so happened to catch it on the way out of the park and we are so glad we did because the trainer and the seal together and the perfect partnership!

Nice Zoo. Overall the zoo was good. A bit surprised that the enclosures were larger than expected. The location of the zoo is great. It is beside the river and then goes up to the top of the ridge which makes for some real nice views of the city.

Superb visit. Prague Zoo is one of the best Zoo's in Europe and is not to be missed. The animals are well cared for their enclosures are of modern design. The layout is well signposted and there are plenty of refreshment stands and facilities along the help to cater for families. Plenty for the kids to do as well. I cannot recommend a visit to this zoo enough.

Favorite outdoor activity in Prague. I am Czech, who lives in Prague, so I might be biased, but I just love our zoo. I have visited few zoos around the world, and the only better one was in San Diego, but that is hard to compare. The zoo is improving constantly. New pavilons every year, new restaurants, new play grounds. We also went once for evening guided tour and it was also great. Highly recommend to anyone who is staying in Prague for longer than a 2 days. No need to have kids to go:)

wear comfortable shoes!. the zoo was beautiful with a variety of animals. it was allot bigger than we had anticipated and we had to walk so much. luckily there were chairs everywhere and the animals were so many the kept us distracted. we spent a good 4 hours there and didn't even notice the time.

let down and felt sad for the animals. I don't know how this place has good reviews.. All I can think of is that we went in the off season as almost all the animals were locked inside tiny cages. Their outside space is massive so it was heartbreaking seeing them clearly distressed, pacing back and forth in the smallest spaces i've seen in a zoo.If you're an animal lover you will not enjoy this zoo - at this time of year at least. The tigers were pacing back and forth, the elephants were confined to a horrible concrete cage all together barely having the room to move. The giraffes were the same. Their inside spaces were dirty. There were also orangutans advertised everywhere and when we got to their section there was a tiny sign saying there was nothing here.I understand that a lot of the animals will not be used to such a cold climate but in that case they SHOULD NOT be in such awful small spaces!! Something really needs to be done about this. The park is massive (we spent a whole day walking around) so they have the room to extend the indoor space.There was also lots of signs about how the zoo is prone to flooding, in their first flood almost all the animals died.. in the latest flood they said they had managed to save almost all the animals but it's still not good enough. There shouldn't even be a zoo where it can flood where there is endangered species. I would tell people not to go but at the end of the day if they don't, the park has no money to look after the animals. something needs to change in the off-season of this park. I'm sure in the summer it will be a lot better for the animals welfare.

Best Zoo in Europe. This is by far the best Zoo i've been to, first time we were there we had to go back the next day to see all we missed. Well worth a visit, they have everything and many amusements for kids too. This time we were in winter, not as much fun though, and many attractions closed but still ok and we had fun. Reasonably priced at 20 euro for whole family!
Great Zoo. Not a fan of Zoo's but my girlfriend realy wanted to see a Giraffe. This zoo was wonderful, ive never seen zoo animals so active an happy looking.
Fun. Nice place not only for kids, but also for adult. Plus very nice cafe inside with Czech cuisine. Should go for a whole day.

Best zoo I've ever visited!. Hand on heart this is the best zoo ive ever been to. It is immaculate, well set out, cheap and full of weird and wonderful animals. We took a taxi to the zoo, as we had read it was a long walk round to see everything, and it sure was, around 10km altogether to see everything, with one steep hill in the middle. However there are plenty of benches and pavillions to use, and a variety of restaurants and snack vendors, but if you aren't used to walking long distances you may find it difficult. Some animals include lions, tigers, eagles, vultures, elephants, tapiers, polar bears, gorillas and galapagos tortoises to name a few, all of which looked happy and healthy (which is always the most important thing!). We were here all day and enjoyed every second, would highly recommend you visit!
great place to spend a day. Pretty nice zoo. I always have a great time when I go here. Nice snacks as well. Close to the botanical garden as well which is very nice.

Awesome news: Prague zoo thinks about giant pandas!!!. First of all: we love giant pandas. We were in Vienna several times - just because pandas, we were in Madrid. Both zoos had efforts with pandas and I can tell you: there are not many people in Czech republic who knows these animals like me and my wife (and we are not zoo breeders)...So last news about pandas are totally amazing. Yeah, it could be in five, six years. In Prague maybe eight. But it could be and thats awesome.Somebody should talk with China and though we dont like our president Zeman, he could manage that! I suppose and I hope, many people will donate like other animals.We go to Prague zoo every week. I must give it now five stars, but you must bring us pandas!!!What else? Red pandas usually sleep in the tree, polar bears sometimes swim and play. Cute are small leopards - three babys, now teenagers. Its funny to hear people who thinks the black one is puma :) We could recommend gorillas, elephants have bigger area now, but in winter they are usually indoors.

Excellent Zoo. Sent most of a day here. We got there via the metro and the 112 bus which terminates at the Zoo and a metro station, at each end. It is massive and although it caters to the locals, is easily navigated via the signage and maps located all around the park. There are a great deal of animals to see. (Not all are out in the cold though) All the animals we saw were in good health, although a few of them seemed to exhibit some stressed behaviour. The enclosures and compounds were clean and well maintained. I envisage the zoo being very busy in summer, but as it was, the weather was lovely and we had an enjoyable time, mainly accompanied by mothers and their children.Pleas allow plenty of time to see this attraction as it is big. The food on offer is limited but is nice and really cheap. Note that most of the food outlets are closed out of season.

Great zoo, bring comfy shoes!. Not normally a fan of zoos, I hesitated before being convinced to go to Prague Zoo, but was pleasantly surprised with it - especially with the 200CZK (~£5.00) entrance fee. Our visit was on 13th Feb and there were very few people there. There is an amazing collection of animals, all appear very well cared for and the larger animals have plenty of outside space. Whilst indoors many of the animals are behind glass screen so you can stand just inches from them, which is amazing. Refreshments in the cafe's within the zoo were very reasonable (around £1 for 1/2 litre of draft lager) and the food looked very good too. All in all, excellent facilities, and a fabulous zoo, easy to get to from Prague centre using public transport. Even though it's laid out very well, expect to walk a few miles in order to see it all!

Amazing, completely unexpected!. This zoo will blow your mind. I was shocked by the excellence of this zoo, the condition of the animals and the fantastic enclosures. I always look at this as I am not really one to advocate zoo's but you should visit to see what great things they are doing at the zoo. We had a fantastic 4-5hrs here, we caught the metro which is very simple and then the bus to the zoo. The bus was 112 and as you come out of the station turn right!! We walked around like numpties for a while. Defo worth doing for something different in Prague and unbelievably inexpensive.

wonderful!. We were a little skeptical about going to the zoo during our time in Prague but I'm glad we did. It was a fun way to spend a few hours and the zoo is top-notch; it offers a huge variety of animals and is clean and well-kept. There are a few restaurants and cafes scattered around as well, they fill up quickly during prime meal times but we enjoyed them nonetheless.

Nice. We had a very good time at the zooMany animals to see its a big zoo and we where there 5-6 hours.the only thing i dident like was that no many choice for some thing to eat or coffe but no problem we have a good time there.

Excellent Zoo. As my last visit to a zoo was Guilin in China it was refreshing to visit an establishment where the animals were cared for and the staff seemed enthusiastic and happy in their work. Well planned, maintained and very reasonably priced too. Well worth a visit.

One of the best zoos. I love the Prague zoo. The location spreads over flat land that borders the river, a large hill that provides prespective over the city and other higher elevation levels. It seems well maintained and it has an organic, easy feel. Some large zoos (particularly in the US) feel more like extreme commercial amusement parks - not here. Of course there are ethical quesitons about having a zoo at all, but if you're going to visit one, I'd recommend this one.

Perfect day out.. We visited this Zoo on Friday 13th February 2015.We arrived here at about 10am, at first we was a little bit disappointed as there was no animals to be seen!I guess they was just having a lay in ;-)at about 11am every single animal was out, We spent 5 Hours here and it was such a lovely day, I was amazed at the Polar Bear, Elephants, Giraffes, Lions, Tigers and Gorillas and so much more.I will return here again on my next visit to Prague!Excellent day out.Katie Lincoln.

Prague Zoo a great day out!. On a recent visit to Prague in Feb we decided to have a day trip to Prague Zoo. It was a fantastic day, great animals, nice / good enclosures for the animals and a bargain as in the off season it cost just over £10 for two people :-) there are a good variety of animals that include lions, tigers, elephants, giraffes, hipos, cheaters and lots of other great animals. You'll have a great day and suitable for all the family. From the old town area of Prague you will need to take tram 17 and then bus 112 this will cost about 70p for the 30min trip. One of the biggest surprises was the pizza restaurant at the main gates to the zoo. We decided to stop their for tea and the pizza chips & beer was amazing! Good food, great service and cheap :-) I would 100% recommend a visit yo Prague Zoo for both couples and families of all ages!

Amazing day at the ZOO. Prague Zoo is fantastic, definitely a place to visit! Animals are super cute and the ZOO itself is like a huge park. Take at least 3 hours, and you'll probably want to spend even more time there :)
Cool zoo. Really nice zoo, food good and facilities clean. One of the best zoos I've been to. Great for kids and all the family

Huge place - leave plenty of time. The Zoo was well laid out and all of the area's gave plenty of room for the animals and all enclosures seemed to be very well maintained. A couple of the area's in the Zoo were unoccupied for our visit but then it was February and for a Zoo that operates all year round I suppose you have to expect that there are certain jobs that have to be done at some time. Some of the animals such as the elephants and Giraffes and Gorilla's were all indoors but again with it being only a touch above freezing outside then I would have been indoors if I had had the choice !!The area was clean and the facilities for food and toilets etc were good.A couple of small things that I didn't like, in some area's there seemed to be a lot of vehicles moving around and given the amount of children in a Zoo they should really have stuck to a much slower speed. There also seemed to be a lot of staff walking around in groups smoking, they may have been on lunch but it didn't give a very good impression.We all had a great time and would go back again. Prices were cheap in comparison to the UK too
Great day out. Lovely zoo, with many animals with big habitats. Big new area for kids. Great place to spend a day out with kids.

Amazing!!! Couldn't think of anything that could be improved.. We went to the zoo during our three day trip to Prague. It was the highlight of our trip. The zoo was incredible value for money - I would have happily paid at least double for the entry, as the quality of the zoo and the variety of animals is outstanding. The animals are quite clearly very well looked after and the enclosures give them plenty of room. We were there for 4 hours and didn't get to see all the animals as it closed and there was so much to see! Would love to go with children in the future! Also, we had food in a lodge and it was of outstanding value, amazingly presented - far more than you'd expect from a zoo! Perfect day! Can't believe they don't shout about their zoo with better marketing! There are no zoo leaflets anywhere and their website really doesn't do them justice!!

Just perfect!. This is the BEST zoo I've ever been to! Though a bit far from the main attractions of Prague, this is a perfect place to spend a day or even two at - either for the big diversity of animal species living in a place resembling their natural environment, or for the atmosphere created for all the children at heart. There are lots of playgrounds and alleys to stroll down.I definitely enjoyed it and strongly recommend it! Go and have fun there! :)

Great Zoo. Lovely place for a stroll. This is one of my favourite European Zoos, or actually, a botanical garden with animals. The area reaching from the riverside all the way up the hills is really green and lush, and it provides the animals their own nice, almost secluded habitats. The area is rather large, so you can expect quite a bit of walking, but instead of climbing the hill you can opt to take the funicular to the top.Highlights of the place include sea lions, elephants, big cats, and a family of gorillas. And stepping into the vultures cage to admire the big birds...
Perfect zoo. It is very nice, clean and fun place to go! they have a train that will take you around, many nice animals and a great stands for a snacks! the zoo is very big and the dogs are aloud!

Great zoo. Hard to get to using Prague transport and eventually had to get a taxi as a bus was running late. However the zoo was large and interesting and had many animals not seen before, such as Polar Bears. Definitely a full day to do properly, be aware that when we went in February many animals were inside or hibernating due to the cold!

Well maintained. After a rough night out in Prague the perfect cure was to visit the zoo. Easy to get to by public transport. Entrance was 200kc. There was a wide range of animals and the Czechs seem to put a lot of effort into maintanence. Ohh and you can buy a beer :) Love Prague
A place where you would love to spent more than one day.. A ZOO made with love, care and patience. It's very popular so better visit it Mo-Fri because it's a bit crowded during sunny weekends.

amazing!. Absolutely loved it!200 koruna each which is about a fiver I think, amazing value for money!The animals were all amazing and the zoo is absolutely huge.Probably my favourite day out whilst being in prague.

One of the best. Good variety of animals, including endangered species, well kept, a breeding programme that was evident and surroundings that really made the animals feel at home. The observation points for visitors were well planned to enable maximum viewing.Our only dislike was that having walked the 7 kms to the zoo, the bus and tram ride back (choice to save time and weary feet) required purchasing tickets with coins through a machine at the entrance. As we only had notes and cards these were unacceptable.We have since learnt that tickets could be purchased in Prague 1 prior to visit. Still the walk did us good and we were able to pass through the former Royal Hunting Grounds (Year 1265).

Hands down one of the best zoos in the world. This zoo is incredible! The animals are well taken care of and seem to be (mostly) happy. The elephants, giraffes and primates all have large enclosures where they can be active. Most of the exhibits on the lower level are new due to the flooding in '08. The bears and the cheetah are the only animals that I feel could have larger areas. I've been coming to this zoo for many years and compared to zoos in other countries (Germany, Croatia, several in the U.S.) this is by far my favorite. The fee is reasonable and there are many educational areas and play areas for children. Be prepared to walk uphill as this zoo is built on 2 levels. There is a chair lift that will take you up to the 2nd level but that won't help you if you have a stroller.

In the animal world or spend one day in the world of the nature. Prepare comfortable shoes and good camera. Cafe and place to relax you can find there. And for comfortable price 200 kc, around 7 euro. One of my favorite place in Prague. If you stay in Prague more then 3 days you defiantly have to visit this amazing place! In September 2014 it was my 5th time already there and every time no regrets. If you child or adult, it doesn't really matter. Here you will have a lot of fun and it will also useful for your view. Good opportunity to walk a lot combine pleasant with useful. Found out more about giant salamanders. Get an impression from huge savanna with giraffes and zebras or observe gorillas, our brothers smaller. It's 100% best option for one day trip.

A great day out. Prague Zoo is a great day out and relatively inexpensive to enter (200CZK for an adult). Be prepared to walk as the zoo is big, with some big open pens for elephants and giraffes. The only issue we had was our niece got bored whilst we watched the Polar bears swimming and playing! But there were plenty of things for her to do as well.An added adult benefit is that the beer on sale was great - and easy to get to by metro and dedicated bus.

Large collection of small mammals. Awesome zoo! My favorite parts were the slow lorises and the bats. The bats have no wall on their enclosure, so they'll just fly around above you. And if you're an antelope fan, those guys are scattered around everywhere for some reason. The food near the Vally of the Elephants looked pretty good. Also, this is probably the only zoo in the world with a chairlift.

Take your time!. It is a awesome place to get out literally and mentally from the city. It is a bit out, but it is huge and nice and interesting. But don't arrive too late, since you'll need to take comfortably long walks and you'll stop much more often than you expect ;)

Not the best zoo.... This zoo was very big however everything was spread out. Most of the signs are in Czech so it isn't very good if you don't know the language and want to read about the animals. When we visited, hardly any of the animals were outside so it was a case of walking around looking at a lot of empty areas! I imagine the zoo would be much better in the summer months!

A wonderful experience. we visited Prague zoo July 2014 and were very much amazed with its natural layout, and the variety of wild life. Our other bonus was ,that when you are 70 years and over like us, it is a coin entry, making it the best value day out. Food is also plentiful .Just be wary of your personal belongings when traveling on the packed bus number 112
Amazing!!. Simply amazing!!Best zoo ever!Would return to Prague just to visit the zoo.Do not miss the polar bears and hippos!!
Wonderful and big!. Nice even in the wintertime! Good price and many animals! Easy to reach with bus number 112. We spent à great morning there!

Amazing value. Huge zoo, great place to visit. Cost only about £6 a adult to get in, which considering our local zoo is about £20 is extremely good value. Worth a visit and they have polar bears, which was the highlight for me. Food was very good there and good value. Make sure you wear sturdy shoes as it is vast.

Best zoo ever visited. We visited here in January 2014 with my 5 Year old daughter and my parents. The zoo was subject to some very bad flooding in recent years but the team have done a fantastic job to restore it and repair it. It's laid our beautifully with a huge selection of animals, it takes a good day too see everything. Our favourite was the new elephant enclosures.Very reasonably priced compared to uk zoos and in my opinion the best zoo around.

One of Europes finest. This zoo has a reputation the best zoo in Europe. We saw it in the winter with lots of building work so it possibly wasn't that well represented for us and i would suggest that there are certainly better zoos in Europe (Colchester in the uk, Amersfoort in the netherlands or zoom and hannover in Germany come to mind). However this is still ranked right up there, and if not Europe's number 1 zoo its well in the top handful.The zoo has plenty of signs with text in Czech, French, German and English and some really nice interact bits, as well as brilliant facilities for children. It must be awkward to work with the space they have but their use of the cliff (especially with macaques and ibex) is astonishingly good! There are a huge number of birds in old style enclosures but there were some exhibits which really stood out:The giant salamander house is amazing with it being lit in blue so that you can actually see it. However even without flash they were very protective about the use of cameras.The carnivore house was a real treat. Very clean (if a little too clinical) with some unexpected surprises in the form of reptiles.The seal enclosure is the nicest I have ever seen.The elephant paddock is not huge but makes great use of the area and is themed exquisitely well.It is a huge collection so make a full day of it.
A day trip. The place is gorgeous and really amazing me and my children like it so much specifically the play ground for the kids
Excellent zoo. One of the best zoos I have ever visited. The tiger, lion, jaguar exhibit is outstanding. The variety of animals were fantastic! It is fairly large so be prepared to walk a lot.

Ideal for Sunday afternoon. I just love going to this zoo so much! It's relaxing, you can clear your head very easily and it will definitely improve your mood ;)Zoo is partially reconstructed after the floods in early 2000 and they did very good job! I love the new pavilions and you can see all the animals very clearly.I read somewhere it's the 7th best zoo in the WORLD! Which speaks for itself ;)

Amazing place . Had the best day ever this place is well lay out and lots of cafés and loos every where, missing 1 thing direction arrows as got lost a couple of time as it's a MASSIVE zoo but all in all a well spent £6 transport from the city was easy too. See you in the summer
Zoo Trip. exceptionally well laid out with lots of interest along the winding paths. all the animals looked healthy and well fed

Polar bears!. So we got there and it was like empty - not just empty of people but most of the animals where hiding too - or were just not there. However there were Polar bears which I have never seen before so that was pretty amazing - it made my day, with out them though the zoo wouldn't have been great. Also closes at 4 which is really early.

A wonderful zoo!. Despite being located on the side of a hill which can make the journey to one end of the park tricky, the zoo is one of the best I have visited. The animals (notwithstanding the polar bears) appear to have sufficient room and seem well looked after. With so many indoor and outdoor enclosures you simply have to come back a second time!

Best zoo ever!. My boyfriend and I both agreed this was the best zoo we have ever been too and a bargain at only 200kc entry. (Around £5). It's a must visit if in Prague!The zoo is very big and has a large range of animals. The enclosures were large and good enrichment. They had polar bears, lions, tigers, penguins to birds and reptiles etc. We visited in February thinking we wouldn't see many animals due to weather but we saw nearly everything. Great views of the city when at the higher part of the zoo. Vending machines and food huts and toilets located all around the zoo so it was very convenient. Only downside is it is quite hilly. We didn't have a problem but it may be difficult for wheelchairs, prams etc.

Family fun. Spent a several hours at the zoo with the family... At first sight it didn't seem like there was much, but after walking around for couple of hours and realizing that we hadn't even seen 1/2 of the zoo we decided to be a little bit more strategic on what we saw/how long we saw it for... There are many interactive places to go to and see animals get fed. The cat house was my kids favorite part... Definitely worth a check out...
Easy to reach by public transport. Larger animals up very steep and long hill so unable to reach them due to mobility. Stair lift dismantled for winter.

Excellent day out even in winter. The zoo is definitely worth a visit, it is actually really easy to get to (metro and a short bus ride- we got a bit confused by the ticket prices and I think paid twice, the journey can be done in 30 mins all in so the 1 ticket for the metro and bus will do. The prices are cheap anyway. You can get the return ticket from the machine at the bus stop at the zoo but make sure you have change).I was surprised at how cheap it was to get in, it was around £15 for 2 adults and a child which is less than for 1 adult in a zoo in the UK. Anyway the zoo is massive with a lot of hills but plenty to see, I wsn't sure many animals would be out in the winter but most were except I am not sure where the elephants were! There are a number of indoor areas which are really good (beware the bats!) and we ended up running out of time as the zoo closed at 4pm on the Sunday. I would suggest you need at least 4 hours to get around everything. There are a number of food stalls where you can get drinks and snacks.I would recommend this as a place to visit when in Prague it is a great day out and excellent value.

Amazing Zoo. This is probably the best zoo I have ever been too. it is set over a large area and all of the enclosures are spacious. There is such a wide range of animals and the polar bears are the most lively I have ever seen! (and we have visited many zoos)Also the beef soup we had in the restaurant was the best we sampled while in Prague! Would highly recommend even in the winter!

You could talk to these animals!. We spent 4 hours here last Sunday.Elephants,lions,tigers,gorillas to name a few.agood walk to all the exihibits,plenty of WC s and drink/ food stands,very good value and worth a visit, lots for young kids to interact with too.
Beautiful ZOO. Large garden with a great reputation around the world and a huge bunch of critically endangered species of wildlife .
its a MUST!. the Zoo was one of the first places I visit while in Prague, I had so much fun even though it was a -4C day. The Seals where absolutely adorable. Totally Worth the money you pay

Lots of animals. Beautiful zoo, with lots of animals. Maybe not lots of different species, but I think it more interesting to watch 10 giraffes together, than lots of different species locked in a cage alone. There's lots to see even in the winter time. In the summer even more and it's better time to visit, but at summer the zoo is also very crowded.
The amazing Zoo. You have to go, its a huge zoo and has great animals, an awesome lift that is worth the money to get on. The zoo is a great day out and such a good value for money!

Like a good zoo. Most of the cages did have animals but sad to see only 1, lion, 1 leopard and 1 tiger. We went to see the polar bear and he didn't really come out of his cave. Not really any zoo keepers around either which is rare for Whipsande and London zoo always one around to ask any questions you may have.
A great choice!. It is really one of the best zoo in Europe. If you have 2 days in Prague, you must spent few hours in the zoo (3-4 hours minimum).

The best ZOO I´ve ever visited!. Few months ago I´ve noticed somewhere on the internet that Prague ZOO is in top 10 best zoos in the world. And have to agree. Services like restaurants, souvenir shops and others are really good and not expensive. Staff is friendly and ready to advice you. Animals look content in this zoo and have big space to live in. Theres also lot of animal species that are not anywhere else, just in Prague! I recommend all day to visit and enjoy this zoo because its quite big. We visited this zoo in Janurary so weather was cold, but there are many pavilions (such as terrarium, Indonesia pavilion, penguin pavilion etc..) where is warm, so all time here was pleasant. You can also take your dog to this zoo, what is restricted in many other zoological gardens over Europe. If going from city centre by public transportation, take metro to station Nadrazi Holesovice, then take the bus which terminates in the ZOO. Its about half an hour from city centre to get here.
Great zoo- great surprise. We are on our honeymoon and we decided to go to the zoo. Beautiful! Natural settings, interesting displays, good English explanations, and a good walk!

ZOO in Prague. Liked the place. The animals seem to be treated well, with mostly enough well-arranged room around them. The entrance fees are not cheap, but it is worth it. You can make it in 2 or 2,5 hours (if you are disciplined) or longer.. I /wonder how it looks like in summer, yesterday (it is January) quite a few of the outer spaces were deserted, so one had to look for the exotical beasts in the inner premises. The location of the whole ZOO is soooo beautiful - it sits right on a hill / rock so you can see the river Vltava and its valley.

ralaxing walk throught a beautiful park full of animals. Brilliant place! Kids loved it!! We took a boat from a city centre there and back. Lots to do and lots to see. Our favourite was a baby gorilla, so cute:) You can take a little train to take you around, you can take the cable car to the top, where is stunning views over all Prague. Lots of people but it seems to spread around as it is a big place. Well recommended!
great. The best Zoo I've ever been to. Animals seemed to be happy and had lots of space! Entrance fee only around 5 euros.

Lovely afternoon. The Prague Zoo is amazing place for relax afternoon. With children, i'm sure it's trip for all day. And i was happy for normal food (tandori masala, czech cusine, salats, fruits, sandwich), not just fast food with fried food!
Big and well kept. Prague Zoo is really big and nicely kept. Transport from city is easy and tickets affordable. Nice way to spend a day in Prague with plenty choices to have something to eat.

Really great. Worth seeing any time of year! I liked it! Especially the pavilion of gorillas and Indonesia are amazing.
The area is also nice for walking....
Big and cheap. Went for a day out hungover and it was great. Lots of different animals and the park is huge! Definitely worth a day out.

Some good, some bad. The zoo is a short distance outside the city. We got a cab there (340czk) and bus then metro back (48czk). The staff at the entrance were abrupt and not very friendly. The facilities are average. The cafe at entrance was closed for refurbishment. We had a long walk uphill to the Gulap restaurant and the food was basic but nice. Many of the animals were inside as it is winter. However there was still some good attractions. The polar bears were having fun although one seemed agitated. The giraffes were spectacular. The tigers seemed very distressed and you could hear their roar from far away. All in all it was an ok day out but I do feel some of the animals were distressed and this was upsetting to see. The lack of facilities was also disappointing.

Amazing Zoo. We were surprised to see the attractions at this zoo, which is reputedly one of the top 5 in Europe. We were there over Christmas, so it was cold, but the animal exhibits were still a pleasure to see. The zoo is situated about a 20 minute taxi drive from Old Town, and is sited on a hill with some nice views of the river valley.  There is one exhibit that is a must-see, and which we have never seen in any other zoo. It is the Hippo Exhibit. The hippos have a pool in which they can frolic, and one side of the pool is enclosed in glass, giving viewers a wonderful sight of what hippos do under water. We have seen hippos in rivers and pools in Africa, but never under water. It was fantastic.

Fantastic zoo it's huge and so many happy looking animals. The zoo is huge and easy to navigate with animals round every corner it's well worth a visit they look happy and have space it was great too see the big cats

Mediocre at best.. Today was a beautiful, sunny day, yet the giraffes were kept inside a small enclosure. Also, it seemed like the tigers are permanently kept inside behind plexi-glass? I *could* be wrong about this. I'm not an animal behavior expert, but it seemed like the large cats were exhibiting repetitive, neurotic behaviors... Such as nervously pacing back-and-forth in the little space allotted. One of the tigers was making a sound that can be best described as a "horse sneeze." The highlight of my visit was seeing electric fences surrounding various animal enclosures. Thankfully I didn't witness any children being electrocuted. The yellow and black signs everywhere warn english speaking visitors of the "electric sense." Yes, 'sense.' In America we would refer to this as a law suit. Heads up: if you decide to visit, be careful of the automated doors. They will automatically close after a short period of time (regardless of whether someone is still standing there). I had a couple slam into me. Protect your children.

Great zoo(staff left a lot to be desired for). I'll start with the negative! As we arrived we went to the kiosk to get tickets, I was about to ask the lady for my tickets and she saw her friends and called them over and nudged me to the side!!!!! Anyway went to the next kiosk and got our tickets(although I thought twice about this). The zoo itself was large and we spent ALOT of time, but thoroughly enjoyed it! Be awae the souvenir shops close so staff can all have lunch together?!?

Still worth a visit in winter. We visited on a very cold day and most animals were inside except the polar bears! However there are great indoor displays and lots of feeding time activities. Our kids loved their visit. Would highly recommend for families as good value option.

Great Zoo. Getting to the zoo is easy enough, there is a regular bus service towards (112) here and it's the last stop, so it's hard to miss it. Admission was very reasonable, I think maps cost 2-5 czk, not entirely sure. We didn't have one but the zoo is very well sign posted and there's large maps all around the place. It was pretty cold and damp when we were there so some of the animals were inside, but you still had the option to see them, ie giraffes and elephants. All animals look to have plenty of space in each enclosure and looked to be happy. There are plenty of buildings to go into and see various animals/insects that aren't outside in the open. It's a lot bigger than I thought and we dedicated 3 hours to walking around, but we were all in agreement that we could have stayed for another hour, at least. It's a very well kept zoo and it was probably the time of year, but it was pretty quiet and we had no problem seeing anything or waiting to look at the animals. Overall, I can safely say it was one of the best zoos I have been to.

Prague Zoo/River trip. I have taken a boat trip to Prague Zoo and it was lovely to combine 2 things; the river trip and the zoo. The trip to the zoo along the river is very good and picturesque. The zoo itself is worth a visit. I thoroughly enjoyed the day spent visiting the zoo.

Great Zoo!!. one of the best zoos I have ever seen... one can easily spend about 4 hours in the zoo... beautiful place to stroll up and down the hill... it snowed for abt 30 mins in Dec when i visited and this place looked awesome... getting there is easy as well... just take the bus 112, stop is just outside Nadrazi Holesovice metro and zoo is the last stop of the bus...

Absolutely Wonderful Zoo. We visited Prague Zoo in September and spent a lovely afternoon thereThe zoo is amazing - so many different animals, including elephants and polar bears, and you can see them close up. The location of the zoo is good to, beautiful area and easy to get to using public transport..There is a great restaurant there and plenty of kiosks selling drinks, ice creams and snacks
The Zoo. The zoo is well maintained and the animals appeared content for the most part. The setting is attractive and the restaurant food was excellent.

Top 7 among European zoo. Worth it.. Good planned zoo, but you still need at least 4 hours if you want to see everything. Most of animals are rather active, and the cave with bats is really awesome.Good place to go with a family also.

Great zoo, the best I ever visited. We visited Prague Zoo on Christmas Day 2014 and spent great 5 hours there. The zoo is amazing - so many different animals, including elephants and polar bears, and you can see them so close, very different from other zoos. The setting of the zoo is nice as well and it is very easy to get to from the city centre using public transport.I can imagine that it is even better during summer period with all cafés, kiosks being open. Will definitely plan to visit again!

Family afternoon with plenty of possibilities. Prague´s Zoo was always good place to spend family afternoon in, as was large and full of exotic animals. There were animals we were not able to see before (communism has forbided citizens to travel to any other countries but communistic), but what job has been done during last two decades, i always find myself amazed. Its location behind the river has some advantages (like beautiful view on Prague and possibility to travel there by steamboat from City center), but also some disadvantages (like floods - especialy the one in 2002 was devastating)...so it has been rebuilt several times, using modern methods like natural paddocks for animals, new pavilons and visitors friendly environment. You can find there hundreds of animals, rated as one of the best around the Globe, good services and friendly staff, always trying to talk about animals they are responsible for, public feeding, stories about different behaving of there animals they are naming and even possibility to adopt some animals (donate money directly to animal you choose, etc.) If you want to spend a family afternoon there, you find yourself walking around without realizing, how much time you spent there. Worthful to go there, is one of the best attractions in Prague. You can go there by steamboat, by Bus (special line from Nadrazi Holesovice subway stop) or by car. You can buy drinks and food there and in the end nice merchandizing also. We go there at least twice a year and we always look forward to go there...Good TIP - close by is a huge Fata Morgana - huge greenhouse with beautiful park surrounded.

Don't miss out. Prague Zoo is one of my favourite places in Prague since I was a little girl. I'm always saying to my friends from all over the world they have to find time to visit this amazing place and no one ever were disappointed. Its just a great place to relax, also great with kids. Don't miss out the gorillas and hand feeding goats, my two favourite things.

Great day out, well worth the monies. You'll need a whole day to explore the zoo and you won't be disappointed with the animals and their enclosures. We found the mountain goat enclosure to be very creative and the Indonesian Jungle was fantastic. We were worried we might miss some of the animals as we visited during the Winter, however there's the opportunity to see them indoors. The Shoebill stork should not be missed! Some of the main restaurants and cafes were closed for refurbishment when we visited, so be prepared you may need to bring your own food.

Lovely visit!. Although it was a little bit cold, the zoo visit was great! It is a huge place and in the winter a lot of animals are inside of building so it's nice to enter and warm up a little bit. The zoo is huge and there are a lot of special and beautiful animals! You can have a view of Prague from the top of it and then go down by the funicular that cost only 20 czk!There are also a lot of food and coffee stands all over the zoo!You can get there by taking transportation to Nádraží Holešovice station and then take line 112.

One of the best ZOOs in the world!. This progressive ZOO is full of new pavilons and attractions. After serious floods some years ago this ZOO has been totally reconstructed and offers the best you can see in the world of ZOOs. Recently new pavilons of elephants and hippos.

This is my favourite Zoo. We have vissited this Zoo a couple of times, and everytime the Zoo has been updated.The Zoo is wide spread over hills and country. The have achieved to give every animal a huge livingspace. I love to watch the monkeys, polarbears, elephants. The restaurant is very basic but gives good food for little money. I can only recommend this to everyone

Lovely zoo, good selection of animals. Great day at the Zoo! Some animals were not in their enclosures however due to the cold weather, but there was still a good selection, plenty of lions and tigers!

Loved it!. Lovely experience, we went there with friends a lot of times, and everyone was thrilled: so many different animals that you can see, they have good living conditions (nice and clean), interesting view from the top of the hill and unlimited fun for kids and adults. Totally worth to go to!

Excellent zoo, on a par with Colchester in England. Excellent zoo, on a par with Colchester in England. Great day out for the kids, highlights being seeing the 4 polar bears and the massive adventure playground.Reasonable prices compared to zoo's in England and good variety of animals.The ski lift is a little scary though! Give that a miss if you don't like heights.
Prague Zoo, a great collection. Very large and a great day out in the outdoors. Very well thought out grounds, with many unique enclosures.

Zoo in the snow. Our first day in Prague was Prague Castle, Charles Bridge and Old Town (plus Christmas markets), so for the second we wanted a change in pace. So despite the snow and coldness (-5C) we caught Metro then bus (112) to the Zoo (look for the 'Zoo' signs from the Metro platform to get to the 112 bus stop). For us this was 30 min journey and hence the cheaper travel ticket, The entrance prize was reasonable (350 Ck =£10; 1 adult plus 1 child). The zoo map was in Czech - but easy enough to follow. The zoo is large but we covered it from 10:45am to 3:45pm (it closed at 4pm) with a lunch stop. The restaurant served hot meals, and again these were reasonably priced and good meal portions. There is a wide variety of animals, birds, insects, amphibians, and fish to see. Lots of information boards - but virtually everything in Czech (except the bat house where there is a warning about free flying bats). We enjoyed it. Clearly the zoo caters for larger numbers of visitors than Winter. The animal enclosures were well designed, clean etc. Catching the 112 bus back to Metro was easy as the zoo is the end of the line.
