To then get to the Red line Metro station you walk between the small shops to the right when you get off the bus.

good day trip. it's a good day trip if you try to see everything. its a nice stroll up the hill with a good view on the surroundings. Getting there is pretty easy although since the connection is with public transport (bus) it can get cramped because alot of families go there during the weekend.I think its worth a visit if you have kids
Not to be missed. Visited many ZOOs with my children, this one cannot be beaten so far. Be ready to walk a lot. Lots of space - giraffes must be happy there.

Really nice zoo!!. Good value for money, very clean, big and a lot of animals! :)
It really exceeded expectations. The kids liked it a lot.

The best zoo I´ve ever been to. We had a brilliant afternoon at the zoo. It is well designed and the restaurants and cafes are modern and clean. It’s easy to get to – on the red line and the zoo bus and you get the chance to see the animals up close. Really great afternoon – the best zoo we’ve been to.

Great zoo!!! Plan a full day or two visit. I am not a great fan of zoos. However, I really like the Prague Zoo. Most of the animals have large, natural settings. Every hour there are exhibitions of the animals with a trainer who provides information about the animals. I especially liked the lemur talk. As the zoo employee talked and fed the lemurs, they often scampered above our heads on tree branches and vines. The elephant world was especially nice because there is a baby elephant now. He scampered about and convinced two other elephants to join him in the large pond. It was amazing to watch these creatures playing in the water. I would recommend taking at least two days to see the zoo because there are so many exhibits. I look forward to going many times in the future so that I can see everything.

Beautifull zoo. Very nice zoo for all ages , plenty of space for children to run . A pitty we did not see any elephants at this time of the year . Three ,four hours are necessary for getting all the way around.Avoid rainy days.
Tiger. The tiger was stuck in this small cage and it really broke my heart :( I cannot understad why some animals were kept in very small cages.
Woah!. I don't want to spoil anyone's surprise, so I'm not gonna say much about it!The Zoo's fantastic and has a very extended area; prepare yourself to get pretty close to certain animals...

Beautiful Zoo with lots of space. The animals look well looked after here. They seem to have a variety of enclosures that change with weather or other circumstances. This was winter and a fold day so we had the zoo to ourselves almost. It was nice to have some space. We missed some feeding there is not a lot in other languages but we saw the tigers It was scary and amazing bring so close yo these animals while they are chewing meat off bones I'm sure you will enjoy this zoo

Really Good Zoo. Easy to get there (metro C Nadrazi Holesovice + bus 112 signposted ZOO and the line finishes there) It is a big zoo and a really good one, there are a lot of animals to see with very open enclosures - even when the animals are in their pens, the majority of them have a way to see them inside - We saw almost all the animals but did not walk around the whole zoo. There is also a 4 story high jungle gym type park inside for children aged 6+ which is rally good. There is also free WiFi so if you are taking your children there, you can catch up and plan from there. I took my 6 year old with me and we enjoyed 5+ hours there. Cable car was closed (winter) but that was not a hindrance as we could walk everywhere. Map has to be bought at the entrance (there are maps inside like in every zoo but the signage is not that clear - at 5 Kc it is also not expensive. There are vending machines all over (20 Kc for water) and kiosk with hot drinks.Overall, this was a very good experience and well worth the time and money.
Large zoo!. Had a nice time a zoo Praha. Lots hills to climb. Display great for seeing animals. Nice little coffee machines along the way!
Prague Zoo. A great day out, especially if you have children. Travel to the Zoo is easy and cheap by public transport - tram then bus.

Fab. Brilliant zoo with lots to see (the polar bears and Tigers were amazing) we spent three hours in there and didn't get to see it all. It's all up hill and can be steep in places though so just watch out for that

Excellent zoo. Really enjoyed my trip to the zoo, it is the best zoo I have been to by far. All the animals looked well cared for with good spacious enclosures. It is a bit out of the city centre but easy accessible by the tram & a short bus journey that brings you right to the entrance. Paid only 1kc to get in so not sure if there was a special but works out about 3cent! Plenty to do for kids there with playgrounds dotted around the place. Plenty off shops and cafes aswell. Vending machines machines with hot drinks are all around with clean toliet facilities.

A truly top European Zoo. My trip there was with some friends who live here in Prague -- but who had not been to the zoo. We were looking for something to do different. Though I had been to Prague's zoo a few year before, I must say that this was a wonderful afternoon and truly enjoyable. After several times being reconstructed due to floods -- the team at Prague Zoo certainly have lived up to their ranking as being one of Europe's top Zoos. This is not to be missed if you like the zoo.
loved it. went for a hen doa lot of walking but everyone and a good time had a lot of animals the apes are really funny to watch, must go and see

The perfect getaway.. Spend allmost An entire day at the Prague Zoo. The variety of animals is spectaculair (lions, badgers, snaken, horses, elephants, wolves, strange fishes, ...). Visited at least 5 zoo's, and this one is really worth the visit. Even in cold temperatures you could see allmost all of the animals (didn't know Kangaroos could stand minus 2 temperatures). I was actually dissapointed after 4 hours there that it was time to leave.

Dedicate whole day. Prague ZOO is one of the biggest ZOOs in Europe, so I would recommend dedicating a whole day for visitting the ZOO. I would recommend going there early. Even if you dont stay there for the whole day, there are things to do around the ZOO - like Trojský Zámeček chateau and Botanical Garden. But I think that you wont have much time if you want to see every animal in the zoo. But be prepared for lots of walking.And dont be an idiot, if you dont know where it is, just ask, literally everybody in Prague knows where it is and yes, there is a bus line that ends there, you can even go there by boat.

Prague Zoo. We went to see the polar bear but it was in its den, and no way to see it inside. The cassowary's were great, and the tigers better still (just 0.5 metre away behind a glass panel). We thought it was very hilly for a zoo, and the signage was wanting - plus it was only in Czech. Pleased we went, but still not as good as Nuremberg zoo.

Beautifully laid out, plenty to do, very tranquil. Came here just two of us for a wander and it was wonderful - you can easily spend easily spend several hours wandering around and there's a lovely balance between different types of animals.We happened to go into the big cats enclosure during the slot where the lions and tigers are put into indoor rooms and you can get incredibly close to them. They were pacing around and clearly wanted to get out as it was a small space - but I don't think they're in there for much of the day.There is a lovely added feature of a chair lift to get up to the higher part of the park. There's a small fee but really worth it as you get amazing views and it's a great feeling.A few of the smaller indoor chambers looked a little bit sparse and could have done with some sprucing up - but that's only criticism.

Great visit!. We had a great time at the zoo and would definitely recommend this attraction. It's very easy to get to from the centre of Prague and only took us half an hour in total. It's also great value at 200 per person. The zoo is very large with a huge variety of animals. Saw lots of animals we hadn't seen before too. We would recommend half a day to get around (we went in December though so very quiet and easier to get around I'm sure). As it was winter time some of the animals were indoors (which is to be expected) but we still managed to seelots. The animals appear to be very well looked after and have good space enclosures. We loved our time here.
Great !!!!. even that we went in November and it was cold for the majority of the animals we still got to see a lot !!

It's worth to visit at anytime and any weather. One of the top rated ZOO's in the world. In year 2014 on place 7 worldwide. You'll need at least 6 (very quick) hours to have a look everyvhere. If you want to enjoy this place, safe one whole day. Perfect services, great restaurants, it's a great place to see in Prague.
Wonderland. Our visit to the Zoo provided us with great views, amazing animals, a lot of exhibitions and a lot of fun.

Stunned... I live in Prague, but although I'm ashamed of it, I haven't really visited a lot of atractive sights that this city offers. So I decided to do something about it and the first on the list was the zoo. I was amazed. Wide range of animals, all of them adorable, nice, clean well taken care of. The area of the zoo is huge and it took us all day to walk through everything. It was amazing trip suitable for both couples or family. I definitely recommend!!!
The Best Zoo ever!!!. Take the whole day just to visit the zoo. It's amazingly big you'll never run out of things to see! I'm looking forward to next time!!
Faboulous. Liked everything , It could simply take 2-3 to explore everythingThe only exception is that the Indonesian jungle was closed

Take No 112 bus from Nádraží Holešovice metro station. Make sure to get off at Nadrazi Holesovice station to get the No 112 bus to the zoo, it will drop you at the entrance of the zoo.The zoo was great, so many animals to see and they were all out during our visit. They had some shows with the seals and there were also pony rides and a petting zoo and playground for kids.Plenty of picnic areas and places to get food, and also very cheap.
Massive. I don't normally like zoos, but this place had a lot open spaces and a lovely botanical garden. Go early! It's a big place.

Must see. Definitely :-). Zoo Praha is about one hour walking from old town square. The fee is around 5-7 euros. You have lots of restaurants, bathrooms, refreshments inside it. It is a huge place, if you want too see the whole zoo area, it will take about 3-4 hours, but it's worth it! Plenty of animals, from all over the world...awesome!

brought us back in good old days. It*s the best zoo we*ve wisited yet ) as all Prague itself leaves only outstanding experiens. This is really the home for all birds and animals residing there. Wish our Moscow Zoo could have been that way (
beautiful. it's rlly gorgeous zoo with so many animals, like it in there! it's really big and u will have to spend there a ot of hours to see everything u want to
ZOO Prague. A large and beautiful ZOO, children friendly, even in the autumn worth to be visited. Must go and see!

Wonderful zoo. We visited Prague in mid November 2014. We knew the weather wasn't going to be great so visited the zoo on the day the weather looked the best, unfortunately that turned out to be on a Czech bank holiday (17th November) so it was very busy. The animals had very big enclosures. I was a bit worried visiting a zoo abroad as you do hear horror stories It's a very big zoo and needs the whole day to look around. My only criticism was how busy it was but we didn't realise it was a bank holiday so that's our fault! It also would have been nice to read some of the signs around the zoo but only a couple of them were in English. There's a huge number of animals and my personal favourites were the elephants and polar bears. I've never seen a polar bear up close before (I imagine many people haven't) and the bear was swimming towards the glass where I was standing and so I was literally nose to nose with him at one point.Would definitely recommend the zoo for people coming to Prague. Also it worked out at about £5-6. Which is the price of a guide in places like London and Whipsnade so it's very good value for money..

One of the best zoos! Must see :). I have visited the zoo a couple of times with family and is really a great place to spent a day. Try not to go on a rainy day because most of the animals tend to seek shelter and you will miss a lot. I like the fact that the sanctuary is large and almost nature like so you don't actually see the animals behind cells. It's more of an open space nature all around! A good day trip!
Historical zoo. Historical zoo in prague, must visit place, dont miss when you visit to prague. this zoo has a several collections of animals and historical message inside it. recommended

magnificent zoo. Beautiful and large zoo - lots of different animals, from hippos, elephants and lions to penguins and crocodiles.Very large aviaries - convenient to humans and animals.Trekking on all dayWe were in the autumn - of the animals were in cages (giraffes), and did not see the panda. The funicular was not working.Walk is better to start with a hilly area (counterclockwise - from polar bears) - by the end of the day just go down to the more flat terrain to the lions, crocodiles and penguins (so a bit easier).

Great zoo, lots to explore. The zoo is massive, you will need a whole day to explore it all if you want to get the most out of it. Very cheap to get in, cost around £6 for a student. Lots of great exhibits, only problem we found, which was probably in part due to visiting in October when it's quite cold, was that some of the bigger exhibits e.g. safari, kangaroo, elephants weren't on show. Other than that, great experience, and very easy to get to from the city centre.

fun. On our four day visit to Prague we decided to go to Prague Zoo. Very goo dvalue for money, we got the 112 bus from the metro station to entrance of the zoo. Entry was £6 each ( 200 Czech Koronas). Took us about 4 hours to get around the whole zoo. A large selection of animals. Very enjoyable. Be warned that some areas of the park are quite steep. Wear good walking shoes.

Impressive. The zoo is situated on a large piece of land and takes a few hours to see everything. Most of the animals are outside, but there are internal exhibits also. The enclosures are generally well thought-out for the animals and they seem to have a reasonable amount of space. We ate at the restaurant there, the food was fairly plain but quite cheap. Unfortunately two of the big attractions, the elephants and the lions, were absent with no explanation. Even so, itś a great way to spend a few hours, definitely recommended

World Class Zoo. Prague Zoo as you are told once or twice was flooded recently and has been rebuilt. This has been done to a high spec with some really interesting enclosures and excellent viewing opportunities. The range of animals is huge as is the size of the zoo itself. You'll need the majority of the opening hours to comfortably see everything. The only blemish is the lack of a carry around map, and some of the enclosures were missing information. Apart from that though it's a highly enjoyable visit.

Nice visit. There are many varieties of animals to see in a big zoo. I recommend it for families and couples. Almost everything is outside so you should wear hot clothes. The restaurants aren't very good, bring your pic nique!
amazing. What a fantastic zoo, so big and well worth the high praise/reviews it gets, its so big we were there for 5.5 hours and still did not see everything. Highly recommended
it was great. i liked everybit of it. i dislike the people pushing in line. it was the 1st amazing zoo that i went to.

Like nature. A beautiful, spacious zoo - at many places, it feels like walking in the woods, not in something artificially created.
This zoo has a great atmosphere, too - there's enough space for the animals, and for the visitors as well. Very very nice, and worth the visit.

Like in a real jungle. Zoo is very huge and there are range of animals. It is situated a little bit far from the city centre but the public transport is very comfortable. Zoo consists of different parts. It took us more than 2 hours to walk and watch those wonderful animals , insects, fish , birds etc. it is one of must see places in Prague. Even we are not kids we enjoyed there.
One of everything. The various collections of animals and birds and together gives you the chance to know about the historical images around.
One of the best zoos I've ever visited. I even got lost a bit, coz the zoo is so big. There are lot of animals to see and I had a great time there.

Fun. We spent about 6 hours here and we still had things to do, very fun, very large zoo, would recommend! We were glad to see that the newest addition to the elephants had been rescued, seeing the star scars on his back was a strong reminder of how much better they are off in wonderful establishments such as praha zoo
Awesome ZOO!. we went there several times and they keep adding attractions and things to do for kids plus there seems to be a new pavilion for animals every year.

One of best zoos!. This is definitely a must do when visiting Prague, especially with kids. After s few days of walking around the streets of Prague, our kids (5,3,1)were ready for some fun, so we decided to take them to the zoo. We drove from our hotel near the old town area, about a 15 minute drive, parking was 100 CZ, entrance for a family of 4 was 300 CZ, our 1 yo was free. The zoo has a lot of hills, even with our jogging stroller it was a bit strenuous, up the first few hills. It's a huge place, it took us 5 hours to complete including a 45 minute lunch. Our favorite was the polar bear, he swam right up to the glass and we got some great pics. Second were the Tigers, we got there at feeding time and that great to see. The exhibits are awesome, very close but safe. We ate Lunch at a pizzeria, had delicious lentil soups, hot chocolates, 2 coffees, and a pizza to share for under 75 CZ AND HAD AN AMAZING VIEW OF THE CITY. we have been to a lot of zoos and this is one of the best so far. Totally worth the visit and the kids and adults equally had a great time.

Well worth visiting. I wasn't sure about visiting the zoo on our last trip to Prague but I was encouraged by previous trip advisor reviews. It really is a fantastic zoo - my nine year-old old daughter absolutely loved it. In particular there is a real sense of being close to the animals. Watching the hippos swimming underwater was a real highlight. Most of the enclosures are modern and spacious, there is loads of information about the animals and so much to see - there is definitely more than you can fit into one day. Catering is fine with outlets well spread over the site - standard (Czech) fast food I think but on a warm day there are lots of spots where you could picnic.Admission is excellent value especially compared to UK animal attractions and the prices in the small shops are reasonable too.We drove there - it's not on the tram or metro but there is a bus and I think in the summer you can take a boat trip there which we'll definitely do another time.
one of the best zoo s. I can recommended visit of this zoo. A lot of animals and special attractions for kids and nice place in Prague.

Best Zoo ever. Amazing Place. So natural. You can walk and see the animal without any cages. It's like you are there with them in the wild nature. Not only the animals are great, here you can eat, rest and just walk. Amazing playgrounds so it's a great place for the family's weekend. And it's huuuuge :) It takes us more than 7 hours to see everything :)
Nice Zoo and was a great programme.... I'd liked very much the Zoo in Prague, will go back next time I am in Europe for sure it was cool...
Just perfect. Nice, clean, natural. All exhibits are modern, allowing the visitors truly appreciate the animals in their habitats. Don't forget nearby Botanical garden.

Walking and see the animals. Very good place for children and adult too for walking. Just is better to go there during the week because on the veekend is there many people, crowded place. I recommend that you take at the entrance to the cashier map and go the longest way.

Near Rival of the San Diego Zoo!. This zoo was incredible! Growing up near the San Diego Zoo I definitely thought I'd seen the best of the best, and expected little of the Prague Zoo. But WOW was I surprised! The zoo was huge, the enclosures were beautiful, there was such diversity of animals and it was very walkable! I would highly recommend this during your visit to Prague, even if you're not with children it's a blast. It breaks up the constant sight-seeing that a Euro-trip tends to have. Clean, fun, interesting, and beautiful.

wonderful zoo. At first we were surprised about 1 week tickets to the zoo. But then we understood it - the zoo is really big and it`s impossible to see it all during 1 day. All animals have a lot of place to walk. A lot of diiferent animals, some places to rest and eat something, to by souveneers.

Excellent ZOO, great time for kids and adults alike!. Great place that evolves with every season. In 2014 was rated the 7th best ZOO in the World and for many good reasons. Although it was nearly completely devastated by the floods in 2002, it rose from it's ashes in order to surpass it's former glory. All exhibits are modern, allowing the visitors truly appreciate the animals in their habitats with as little distractions as possible. Trust me that the visit of this ZOO will make a great memory for the whole family. The entire ZOO is practically a huge park covering almost 60 hectares (150 acres), adjacent is also very beautiful Botanical garden you may want to visit while in the area. As you'll see for yourself while visiting, it is not popular only by families with kids, but you'll see many young couples holding hands, as it is a popular place for early dates... :) Don't miss the Indonesian jungle and the new (2014) Giant Salamander exhibit.
7 top zoo in the world. Must see, take the whole day it is worth. Best with children - you can rent a child pram or cart. Lot of playground. You can feed animals in child farm. Great
One of best places in Prague. This ZOO is one of the best I ve seen. Visit the new area of elefants devoted to hindu culture. Nearby you can visit the botanical garden and the Troya castle garden.

top rated Prague attraction. If you're in Prague for more than 3 days OR you travel with kids, I recommend this ZOO.Top reasons:- all informations are available in English and Russian- some animals are really rare- modern habitats - best being Indonesia and Elephants, modern equipment (partially thanks to floods of 2002)- lot of options for refreshment- lookout tower, chair lift, kids playground etc.

Beautiful. . So nice, clean and natural. Everything is well preserved. Some people that say the cages are empty, that's not true. You have to notice that some animals are active ONLY during night hours . It's a must. It's for a day with sun. Wear sport shoes to walk many hours. You will love it.

We were greeted by smiling faces and screaming kids. After finally getting there because I never listen and took us to the wrong station (must be a man thing as a few others did the same too!) take the No 112 bus from Nádraží Holešovice metro station on line C and it drops you off outside the main entrance. Cheap and cheerful, it was very cold and foggy the day we went but we still were able to see everything as all animals were still out and having a good time. Hot wine and beer is everywhere and even your dogs can visit the zoo. Plenty of seats and picnic areas and a massive playground for kids, as well as a petting zoo that has goats, chickens, cows, ponies and pony rides (if you're planning a family day out).Many places to get food and drink while there and also very cheap.
Nice place to spend one day. A very big area to explore. Easy to reach from Prague city center with metro/bus combination. Great selection of various animals.
Rellax. Going to Prague ZOO on regular basis....5 times a year at least.Always nice time there. The only thing I´m missing...they do not have Langoš at any food place anymore.

Outstanding. Hands down the best Zoo I have ever been to... and all for the bargain price of around £6! Nursing a frankly horrendous hangover from the previous evening's festivites I was dragged out my bed and to the zoo for a bit of fresh air and a walk. The zoo exceeded all our expectations and we spent a good four hours there. The animals were enclosed in large and often imaginitive enclosures and looked a lot more contented than many zoo animals I've seen in my time. Costs around £12 for a taxi to the zoo from the city centre although it is easily reached by taking the Metro to Holesevice and then Bus 112 which terminates at the Zoo.

really nice. The best thing was the chairlift, it showed you the whole zoo and it was fun for all ages. The rest of the zoo was also really nice, and, I have to say, the whole planning of the zoo was excellent. It had coffee machines, the chairlift, and restaurants, so I really enjoyed my visit.

Great Zoo. Now that I travel with munchkins I take time to visit zoos. One of the best zoos. The animals were not squeezed in tiny cages nor were they sickly. My daughter really enjoyed the zoo and did not want to leave. Very easy to get to via public transportation.

Outstanding. We had plans on visiting the zoo before we arrived as we saw it was the fifth best zoo in the world. Seeing as the entrance price was under £6 each, we didn't expect too much on arrival. After walking through the entrance we saw on a map how big the zoo was and how much variety in animals there were. It took us a good four hours to complete the zoo, looking at all the animals. We were amazed by what we saw. Compared to back home, paying near on £20 each for Marwell Zoo with barely any enclosures, this zoo is incredible. The amount of time and work gone into each animal enclosure was just amazing. One of the best days I have had, it is a great day out and a must see!

Very Picturesque and Romantic. I do love the old town. Even with the addition of new designer stores, it has not lost its quaint appeal. The cobbles are a challenge for high heels, so bring walking shoes.

Best zoo I have been to...and I've been to a lot. i have been traveling for seven months with my 4,3 and 1 year old. We must have been to nearly 10 zoos and aquariums.This is the best I have been to. The price is reasonable and the facility's are good. It's huge, but there is a chairlift and train which you can use to try and help minimise walking.I have read some bad reviews saying the animals looked sad etc. I don't necessarily disagree. But tripadvisor is used to compare various activities. In comparison to many, many other zoos, I found the enclosures to be large, very few animals are kept alone and generally they seems in good health etc.So, it's a zoo, if you don't want to see animals in cages obviously don't go. But it's the best zoo I have been too and all at a very reasonable price.
ZOO. beautiful zoological garden with all the trimmings. place for relaxation and lots of attractions. next year I come back

Absolute washout- not Prague's fault though.. Went Wednesday but what a big mistake- the aftermath of a hurricane from the USA meant torrential downpour- still we stupidly decided to go anyways- bad idea....the zoo was deserted of visitors- worst still most animals were indoors so not much to see. Though we had an umbrella- we were soaked through, socks wet walking through puddles. Getting lost and not knowing how to get out.....wish i'd got a map, better still not go today. What can you do with the weather? Assuming the weather is good this zoo would of been fun and is a great zoo- just don't go on a monsoon. There are indoor areas to rest us from the rain but still it was a complete waste of time. Next time need to at least learn the word exit in czech so to not get lost. Another is is animal's are not described in english so peculiar animals were of an unknown to us.

Prague Zoo. Prague Zoo is well worth a visit as there are numerous species that you may not see else where, the price is very good value for money and the zoo is very interesting for both children and adults. The zoo is well maintained and the facilities are very reasonable. The zoo is very large and will take you a fair amount of time to walk around however, this does not make the zoo unsuitable for young children as karts to pull your children around in are available. Overall, the zoo is fantastic, just remember to wear comfortable shoes!

Brilliant zoo!. Even after the massive flood they still had the majority of the animals. The best thing about this zoo is the size of the enclosures, they are absolutely massive giving the animals loads of space to utilise.

Don't miss it!. Comparing to Budapest Zoo...more ways better! It could be a bit far from the city centre, but easily reachable with the bus. It is cheap and we had a great experience. The animals are so close to the visitors the whole zoo is kind of interactive. :)

A pleasant surprise. The zoo has a number of very rare species. The selection of animals is very good and there are a number of good underwater viewing opportunities for aquatic or semi-aquatic species. Most of the enclosures are fairly modern and provide a reasonable amount of space; however I do feel that the facilities for the polar bear were a great let down.
One of the best zoos I've been to. Great for couples, there is a wide variety of animals in the zoo, and the entrance fee is very cost-effective for the experience.Very recommended.
A real find. Takes a while to get there via public transportation but worthwhile. Visited on a Sunday with all the Czech families. Well done, clean and enjoyable.

Nice experience. It was a nice experience, very spacious and for many animals it seems as living in a natural surrounding. We found the southern part much more interesting. Unfortunately the upper part (central circle up the hill) didn't seem very interesting, and the chairlift was not working, so probably we were even more exhausted by climbing up and didn't enjoy it so much."Monkey business" was as usual the funniest one and kept us very focused for quite a long time.One detail was pretty disturbing: a tiger (I think it was written tiger from Sumatra), who was in a glass cage in one of the houses where some smaller wild cats and being kept. It is really sad to see him in such a small space and I only hope it was maybe some temporary solution for him.Keeping in mind that there are not many attractions for children in Prague, Zoo is a must see in the case you go with a family.
Best Zoo in Europe. Far better and cheaper than London and I wnt for a few hours and spent nearly a day. Lots of walking and quite a few slopes to keep you fit. Will be back with the family in 2015.

Guidebooks are out of date. We'd been recommended this before we left home but were almost put off by negative comments or a general lack of recommendations in guidebooks. So glad we went as the zoo has been greatly improved in recent years, the transport links are excellent (112 Zoobus from Nadrazi Holesovice metro station), the location is very attractive, food and drink are at bargain Czech prices and there are few tourists! It's about £6 entry for an adult but the are reductions for children, seniors etc. If you are over 70 then it's the equivalent of £0.04!

Zoo Praha... a must do for families with young kids. I took my son out to the zoo on a Monday. I wasn't going to office and was in mood to avoid tourist hoards of the weekends.The transport is rather simple and comparatively hassle-free. The zoo has its own pram support so, you don't have to take your own. The entry fee is 200 CZK for adults and children under 3 years are free.Zoo covers a LARGE ground, so be ready to walk, walk and a bit more walk. There are places to eat. Enough places to sit and view the animals, and playing areas for kids to run around and enjoy.I have a few very strong views about Animals in captivity, and keeping those views aside, I'm going to say.... families with young child should visit the zoo atleast once. Its a good experience for young children to see so many animals in such a small time.Be ready to walk, bring your own food if you have strict food limitations like my Mom, arrive early and keep your camera ready.

A great day out!. I think this is the biggest zoo that I've ever visited! It's a vast place that you can easily spend a relaxing day wandering around. There's a chairlift around the middle of the zoo which is cheap to ride (around 20czk if memory serves correct) and lasts a couple of minutes but is very enjoyable. The food available is of good quality - though not the healthiest option, I do recommend the sugared doughnut seller who makes fresh mini doughnuts, as they're cheap and delicious! There is a good variety of animals on display and they all seem to be happy and kept in extremely neat and tidy conditions. Two gripes - the optional map that we bought was all in Czech and the zoo would benefit from dual language signposts as again they're all in Czech (which is understandable, but the zoo IS a tourist attraction).

Good. Very good, much bigger than I expected. We were there for a couple of hours, we had our son with us, which is 1,5 years old, and we had a good time, and saw a lot of interesting animals. The animals seems to have good space to live in :) We didn't have the time to see the whole zoo thought.Easy to get there by tram 17 from Old Time Square and and switch over to bus number 12.

Lovely Zoo!. Me and my boyfriend spent the day here without expecting too! The Zoo is bigger than we both expected so spent all day walking around and visiting all of the enclosures. Animals looked happy and were well looked after with spacious enclosures. Entrance was ridiculously cheap compared to most Zoo's in the UK which made all the difference as it didn't break the bank! Food/snacks were available also at a very cheap price! Is away from they centre but very easy to navigate following bus or tram routes, our hotel printed out all the possible ways to get there by tram etc. Throughly enjoyed our day out and would definitely visit again!

good day out. If you have spare day in Prague definitely go to the Zoo.Its nice walk around there if you have kids,but even without them its fun.You can see variety of animals in there but my favourites are polar bear(relaxing in swimming pool) tigers and all kind of cat predators.If you are tired of walking there is also cable cars giving you lift on top of the hill for very good price.Can also recommend scenic tower on top of the hill with nice view of the zoo.There is also plenty of refreshments and toilets free of charge.
Great food at the ZOO. This is the best zoo I´ve ever been there. The food is typical Czech and international too. You have to try!
Nice zoo. The zoo was pritty far from the city but you got there easily with the subway.The animals were well cared-for.

Really good zoo. It was a really good zoo with a lot of different animals and was pretty impressed by the polar bears as I have never been up close to one before but you could see them through a glass screen having a swim. All the enclosures were themed around the different areas of the world and looked really natural. The zoo was brilliant value for money at only about £7 each and the food there was really cheap too. Also there are lots of buildings to go in and out of so that's good for visiting on a rainy day.

Amazing!. What a wonderful zoo! Plan a whole day to see everything. Beware that bats are free in a pavillon, it may surprise you !! Notice that the vending machines all over the zoo offer quite good prices ( around 55 pennies for a cappucino and 35 pennies for a salty snacks pack.) Also the toilets are free of charge, which is not usual in Prague.
Must visit. Prague Zoo is a must visit in case you have family and kids. We definately enjoyed the cableway, but we had no guts to go down, so we had to walk...

Zoo lover. I loved Prague zoo! It has so much to look at you can easily spend a full day here. I loved the outdoor animal areas but felt aweful for the tiger in the indoor glass enclosure (Think pet shop puppy glass cage but with a tiger instead) the poor bugger was so anxious! The food was great and very reasonably priced. Tip: Don't try the chairlift if you are scared of heights, it's higher than it looks!!
Nice place. Very nice zoo! Went for whole day, since there's lot to see. Can highly recommend.Many different animals from mouses to Lions and Giraffes
love this ZOO. Very shortly. This is one of most beautiful ZOOs I have ever seen. If you have a time and you are in Prague at spring or summer, take boat from city center which takes you to the ZOO

Love Prague Zoo. Many many visits to Prague zoo and every trip it is improved. They have made real efforts to give the animals large enclosures, this time the elephants were in there new large enclosure. Good value, not over the top, and inside the prices for food and drink and other options are reasonable. Our wee girl got a few minutes on a little horse for 50p. Recommend a trip to the zoo if you have wee ones.

Worth it. A really great place to visit. The complex is big enough for a stroll so, if you have nothing to do the whole day, I recommend going to see the animals. Most of them were on display though I wasn't able to find an English version of things which meant we might have missed some special hours when certain animals did something in particular.It's easy to get to since it's at the end of bus line number 112 Zooligicka zahrada stop. Prices are reasonable (250 CZK per person for an adult if I remember correctly) and don't let the long line fool you, it goes fast so you won't be wasting time. I recommend having a map of the zoo since the maps around the facility are a bit hard to find when needed and/or are a bit ripped.It is fairly easy to go around and there's lots of things to see. For example we spent around 7 hours there....but don't worry there are small cottages where you can get something to chow down and some refreshments.

Worth the trip!. The Zoo is actually in the Troja district but getting there is easy by bus. It ia only about 30 minutes to get here from the apartment we rented in Chotcovy Sady area. Expect to spend around 5-6 hours here as there are really attractive things to do and see here...Our children really loved the Gorilla cage and also the Polar bear. in summer it will be very cooling if you just sit in the Penguin area and watch their antics. The best thing was we get to view 'Kawi' the tiger who was transported all the way from malaysia to Prague. We felt really proud to visit him there.

Best Zoo I've been to. Easily the best zoo I've ever been to in terms of displays, animal count, and proximity to the animals. If you really wanted to, you could get into just about every exhibit. They do allow you into most of the bird enclosures and onto the lemur island. It is a massive zoo with a huge hill in the middle so definitely bring comfortable walking shoes. It's also a fair distance away from the city center, so be ready for lots of public transit.Top 10 things to do in Prague

Amazing zoo. We had so much fun! It's an enormous place, and all the animals seem to have lots of space to roam around with very good conditions! We spent 5 hours in this place and enjoyed every minute! Also- and this is important- according to their website: "Prague Zoo is engaged both in ex-situ and in-situ conservation. It coordinates the breeding of selected species as part of conservation programs and keeps studbooks, but it also takes part in activities aimed at helping species survive in the wild, sometimes even running these activities. In many conservation projects, both approaches combine, with animals born in Prague Zoo returning to their ancestral homeland to be released into the wild." So... THUMBS UP for Prague zoo!

Big and fun but a little hard to find certain animals. We enjoyed it and, shockingly, it was mostly flat walking until the end. Then we found a part that was really UP hill. It is a big zoo and has a wide variety of animals. Place is very family friendly. We took the subway to a bus and then the bus to the zoo. Travel was only 25-30 minutes from the city center.

Cland and easy to follow.. Very interesting, clean and well orgonised. I went to the Zoo with my friends, two families with children and really was pleased to have done so. the children spend the whole half day walking from one cage to another, taking a lot on attention to see the aninmals, birds, fish etc, etc. It was worth visiting.

Well worth a visit. The zoo is a little way out of the centre but is well worth a visit - even if like us you have no children to take. It is very clean and the animals live in very natural enclosures. They all seem quite happy and well cared for

Great zoo. . We spent all day in the zoo today, it was a lovely blue sky day, and very warm...We arrived around 11am and left at closing time at 6pm. We had a bit of lunch which was nice and it wasn't expensive either which was a real good deal. Take a good camera, and even better walking shoes because it is a big zoo to get around. There are plenty of little play areas for the children if they want to play. Plenty of drinks machines all around. And the toilets are free. All in ask a really nice place to visit. We got in the 24 tram.. Then jumped off then onto bus 112 which terminates outside the zoo. From Prague 1 to the zoo 28 mins all done.. Great public transport.

few things missing but well worth a trip. We visited.on a lovely sunny day today. Easy to get to on the fabulously efficient public transportThe.first cages we saw were a line of disappointing averies but thankfully it picked up quickly after that. They have made very good use of the rocky position by allowing some enclosures for mountain dwelling animals.to be very spread out and natural. The way they have you so close to the.animals by using moats is fabulous. Unfortunately the gorilla and orangutan enclosures were being modified so we didn't see.those animals but the highlight for me was.getting within 6 inches of a.sleeping tiger and a.rather content diving polar bear! Very easy to navigate and I don't think I saw one distressed animal. Good play areas for.kids and good number of vending machine and cafes. Definitely one the highlights to our 5 day trip.to.Prague
LOVELY ZOO. We liked the layout of the zoo. Lots to see and some animals we had not seen before - Polar Bears!!Thoroughly recommend a visit. The entrance price is cheap too - approx £5 for adult.
zoowoo. prague zoo is one of the nicest zoo we ever went...we liked the lift up, its really handy, elephant and gorillas pavilon are amazing...really breathe taking..must see in prague

Great day out at Prague Zoo. we spent nearly all day here, it was very good and I was quite happy with the animals living conditions, maybe the Polar Bears could have done with a bit more room. It's very popular, it was nice to see so many young mums and toddlers making their way around the park. My favourites were the giraffes.

Brilliant day out. Great thing to do while in Praha. One of the best zoo's I have ever visited and for the lowest price. The animals all look happy and the zoo is well kept. There is a bus that goes every ten minutes from the city centre but if you are leaving as it closes then it can get very busy.

A zoo worth visiting. The zoo is easily accessible by car, or by metro/tram linking to the 112 shuttle bus. During the main summer months, as well as at weekends and on national holidays, there is the attractive option of of cruising to the zoo on the Vitava river. It's a great day out for adults and children alike. There are play areas for the kiddies, but it's much more interesting to look at the animals.You could spend the whole day there, and certainly need 4 hours to visit all the enclosures, so don't leave it too late to turn up.. There is a general sense of space, and the animals look in good condition. One highlight for me was a herd of giraffe, including little ones, being driven towards a savannah area, where ostrich zebra and antelope were already roaming. Food for visitors is a bit mundane, (unless you fancy yet another sausage!) but you can always take a picnic, and not everything is translated into English. All part of the fun!

Brilianty zoo. The best zoo I've ever been to and it doesn't cost much (£5)Its very easy to get there and so many animals to see. They also have a special lift with lovely view. You can also take your kids to the play area with little sheep and you can feed them, play with them... I would recommend to visit it sometimes during the summer.. You will see more:-DIf you are going to visit Prague you should definitely go there :-) The best zoo I've ever been to and it doesn't cost much (£5) We spent almost all day in there and we were not bored at all just so tired at the end. We used a special lift to get up to the hill so we didn't have to walk and we had a lovely view. You can also take your kids to the play area where they have little sheep and you can feed them, play with them... I would recommend to visit it sometimes during the summer.. You will see more:-D We were there in August and the only we didn't see was the polar bearIf you are going to visit Prague you should definitely go there :-)

Glad we went. We went here only so its a treat for my 8 year old boy who walked through Prague attractions and boy was it a treat for the entire family!The chair car ride up the hill - dont miss - memorable experience - not as scary as it looks.The polar bear swimming - worth many clicksViewing giraffes from the top - unique experienceProximity to animals - very satisfyingDisliked nothing about this placeSo well-planned and child-friendly

Cold But Worth it. Perfect time to go because there were hardly any people about - The chairlift was out of order because of the temperature I suspect - The Views were breathtaking - along with the rest of Prague. It' located on the top of a hill so you can imagine the views! Perfect for cheech or chong

Very good day out. This is a very well laid out zoo with some very good animal exhibits. The elephant enclosure in my opinion is great as is the Gorilla section. We went early afternoon and could only spend 3 hours there as the zoo shut at 7pm. So some of the animals were already housed for the night, best to go earlier so all animals are out.

Good way to spend a day. If you live in Prague and are looking for something to fill an afternoon, the Prague Zoo is a nice place to go. It is not too large, so it is manageable in an afternoon. If you are traveling, I would not recommend going as it is pretty typical to most zoos.

Great place to spend your time!. It is really nicely shaped, concept seems to be very smart, a lof of animals and special pavillons from african to gorillas'. I really love the place. Next time in Prague, I go again!

One of the best zoos in the world. Prague zoo was ranked #7 in the world recently and it definitely deserves the ranking. The entrance fee was 200 crowns which is about $9.20. Awesome value in Czech republic as were most things I did there. The displays were clean and the animals were very well tended to. The habitats were very natural. The zoo is well marked. The zoo is rather large and you can spend a good 4-5 hours there easily. Only thing which annoyed me was that anytime you purchase water in Czech republic they sell you carbonated water. I found this just about everywhere I went in Europe? Here is a website for the zoo: http://www.zoopraha.cz/en

Fun day out. I'd heard Prague Zoo was very good so we spent a day there and we're not disappointed. We couldn't get much info in English so maybe that could be improved. Otherwise, it was great to see so many animals in their natural environment. The chair lift was fun and the beer was the cheapest we found in Prague.

ZOO = Awesome!. Overall - We had a great day at the zoo! Tickets were less than £6 per person and there was plenty to entertain for a whole day! Animals -The Elephant Valley was a highlight and the standard of the Zoo was very good. Plenty of variety and some really good well thought out enclosures. Some of the areas you are allowed to enter the enclosures and get really close to the animals, also the childrens area was great with loads of animals you can stroke and pony rides at around £1 per child.If you buy lunch there you can get the usual burgers and hotdogs at the kiosks, but there are also some restaurants. We went in the restaurant that is in the bottom left corner of the site map next to Gocars Houses and had a really good tasty meal at a very reasonable price!!! Location - We got a boat from Czech Bridge near the town centre in Prague which cost around £6 return per person, it took 50mins and was a lovely way to travel to and from the Zoo.Negatives - The hippo enclosure was the only let down for us as it was small and the water was not clear so we only saw their nostrils. It would be nice if they could put a path around the Sahara plains area as we were only able to stand at one end and look at the animals from a fair distance. It was great to see such a massive enclosure with so many animals but I feel we could have appreciated it more.

Very good value for money. I am a zoo fan, this one was a reasonable rate and I was there for around 3 - 4 hours without even realising it !! it covers quite a wide area, so theres a fair bit of walking to do, nicely laid out and the animals looked quite happy. My only slight negative, which isn't really a big deal is that nothing seemed to be in English, the Meerkat enclosure was shut, but I have no idea why !!Good transport links, the bus goes right to the front door.

Zoo in Prague. Briliant visit of this zoo in Prague. It's huge, many exhibitions.. I recommend to reserve one day for visiting the Zoo. You can bring your own food or you can buy from the shops in the Zoo.Ticket costs 200 CZK.

This zoo is NOT just for kids!. It was a super experience.Getting here is easy, Metro and a bus that takes 10 minutes, last stop is the zoo.Probably one of the best Zoo's in the world.It's huge, many exhibitions.Never seen animals SO CLOSE!Indoors and outdoors habitats, beautiful setups in each animal area and even amazing views via the cable cart (yes they actually has these in the zoo, it's BIG).Bathrooms and snack areas are all over, we had a wonderful break to have german-style hot dogs and Czech beers.It's a full day tour, totally worth it to escape the Goth castles of the old city.

Feels like you're actually in the exhibit!. Definitely one of the most unique zoos I've been to. It's a massive area so you could easily spend an entire day there - lots of animals, lots of walking around. The coolest part is that the exhibits feel like you're right in them! For example, there was only a rope between you and the tiger exhibit, and bats flew right in front of your face in the bat exhibit. Although there are many many other great historical things to do in Prague, this is a great activity apart from the main city.

One of the best Zoos in Europe. Zoo Praha is a wonderful zoo park. You can get easily to it using public transportation: from the metro station Nádraží Holešovice (line C) you can take bus 112 to the zoo. Be careful that sometimes it can be very crowded. Another alternative is to go by the steam boat on Vltava river.The Zoo is huge and the animals have a lot of open space in an environment that is similar to their natural medium. You should see the prairie dogs, the tigers, elephants, giraffe. Also don't forget to visit the lemur's island, where the lemurs will come near you :). Unfortunately you won't be allowed to play with them, but I can guarantee you that you'll take some wonderful photos and will have great fun there.I recommend to reserve one day for visiting the Zoo. You can bring your own food or you can buy from the shops in the Zoo.Take your most comfortable shoes and enjoy a fun and interesting experience!
Too big. Tip for seniors. Was too wide spread. After vien and zurich disappointing.But have a great tip for seniors. Showed my senior card. Was asked how old i am (71) and paid 1 krona!!!
One of the best Zoo. Very nice Zoo.Run friendly for animals.Lot of animals in natural environment.Great house for tigers,elefants,monkies and lot of others

One of the best Zoo I've ever seen. My husband and I decided to take a break from historical Prague and see a Zoo. It took us approximately an hour to get there from the city center. We google mapped it but still had to ask people on the streets for directions. Once we found the Metro, it was very easy. At the Nadrazi Holosevice we took a bus 112 towards Zoologiska zahrada. Entrance fee is 200 konunas and a map is 5 korunas. Unfortunately, they didn't have a map in English, so we bought in Czech. The map is not very accurate, we could not find Gorillas. And we think, we were not alone. The Zoo itself is well-maintained, spacious, very clean. Lots of animals, some of them I've seen first time; even I consider myself a big Zoo fan. We, especiailly, enjoyed the enclosures with polo bears, penguins and elephants. Polo bears were swimming back and forth, even on the back. It was a lot of fun. Penguins were performing a little show. You could touch a glass in the pool and they would swim a wig their tails and little wings for you. Very cute. There are plenty of restaurants and food places in the Zoo. We ate in self-serve restaurant close to the entrance. Lots of choices and very cheap. There are a lot of free washrooms on the grounds. Prague Zoo is one of the best Zoos I have seen. It's a great fun for any age!
average experiece. Its my personal view as i am not enthusiastic in watching animal in cage. But i would say its very huge zoo with wide variety of animals and well managed.

Prague Zoo Czeched!. Decided on a city break to take a break from Baroque etc and visit the zoo! It's a little bit out of town but metro & bus links are frequent. Entrance fee very reasonable but not offered any guide in English. Some English on the signs and notices around the animal enclosures. However this didn't really mar the experience and the zoo is imaginatively designed and definitely an enjoyable experience. Hippo pool and giraffes were highlights. Didn't see everything but impressed by what we did. Worth a couple of visits given the modest admission charges -200 CZK/person is just over £5. Certainly worth a visit.
Great!!!. Visited Prague Zoo already several times and every time we spent great time there. One of the best Zoo gardens in Europe, just pity they do not have real Panda bear there :-)

MASSIVE!!. The zoo is very big and entertaining. Loads to do and unusual animals compared with other zoo's I have visited. There are polar bears they are so lovely. They seemed ok but I would have like to see them have a bit bigger space. The zoo has a little tractor/train thing. I advise using this the zoo seems to never end and its a long walk to the top of the hill. Lots of toilets and food/drink and not too many gift shops. Also the price is cheap compared to what you would pay in the uk. good views from the top of the hill of Prague. Good visit

A zoo on the rise!. This zoo is getting better every year! After the enormous floods in Prague in 2001, when the whole zoo was washed down the river, they really achieved something magnificent - a zoo where the animals are being taken care of in beautiful surroundings and the visitors get great value for money (an adult ticket costs only a few Euros!).The only downsides are the, sometimes pretty overcrowded, parking lot and buffet at the entrance/exit.

Worldclass. At Prague Zoo most animals have extensive space and seems to be happy. My two children love coming here as we see new things almost every time, apart from the all time favourites that have to be visited each time: The Gorillas and The Lemur park. In the Lemur park you can go in and pad the Lemurs this is priceless.If in Prague with kids do not miss the Prague Zoo.
One of the best zoo. Prague Zoo offers not only unique and interesting fauna, the place itself is just great with scenic views over the city !

Surprisingly High Quality. I visited the Prague Zoo on a bit of a whim and am VERY happy that I did. The zoo has a great layout (built on a hill), so many of the animals get to live in a semi-realistic environment. Don't miss the Prezewalski's Horses!

Loved it!. The best zoo I've ever been to. Amazing place to walk around, fantastic enclosures and well looked after animals. The birds of prey enclosure was brilliant. It is hilly, so be warned if you find walking tough.
Prague ZOO - fantastic place for childer and also adults. I was very surprice about new look of the Prague ZOO. Also I appreciated many facilities for children.
Best zoo EU. Cheap, happy animals and a nice experience. If u are in Prague, I recommend this zoo for a half day trip. Elephants, tigers, birds and other animals you never seen before.

Best attraction in Prague :). The zoo was fantastic! Lots of variety in the types of animals, and the majority of them had lovely big enclosures that all looked well cared for. It was on a very big hill, so be prepared for alot of walking, although there is a cable car up to the top. Lots of nice places to stop and rest/ get a bite to eat. The zoo was really easy to get to by Metro and bus. Would recommend to all visiting Prague!

Large bird selection and great elephants & zebras. This zoo is a little nicer than what you might even expect in Prague. It's a ton of walking, but there's a lot to see. A large selection of birds, which might surprise you, and they've also been heavily advertising the giant chinese salamanders they've got (spoiler: they tend to sit in their pools and face the wall under moving water -- you can't see them hardly at all).They also have a very good selection of big cats and elephants and even some fun hippos. They've got wolves and kangaroos and lots of stuff you might not see in quite that number in a zoo in the US. I was also impressed by how much room they give some of the animals.It's a little intimidating to get to if you don't do much traveling around Prague, but it's really just a subway trip and a 10 minute bus to the zoo itself. There's also vineyards and other parks nearby.

Well worth the trip to go to the zoo!. The zoo is very easy to locate from all areas of Prague using the metro and a bus which takes you directly there. It's a very cheap place to view so many animals. Definitely not just a place for children as it's fabulous and full of fun. There are a large variety of animals - including some unusual ones!! The food served in the lunch cafeteria is cheap and not a rip-off. Overall wonderful trip.
Amazing zoo. This zoo is one of the greatest in all of europe (and we have been to many of them).there are a lot to see and there is also a "savana". we reccomend to go there, and see for yourselves,

A fantastic place for young and old. It is placed perfectly. Close to the center. Down by the river. And with a lot of space to show the animals I great surroundings. You can walk there through a nice park. Opposite zoo you find a fantastic and beautiful small Castle.

Very Good Place But Smoking Must Be Prohibited!. It was amazing place for both families and children.You do not have to pay money for the children who are under 3 years old.Huge. Not only ordinary animals are exist but also tropical and polar spicies you can see. There are restaurants, coffee machines and vending machines in the zoo.At the same time children play areas.I will list must see animals as follow.Polar BearsElephantsSnakesBlue ParrotPenguinsCrocodilesGoats

Animalistic and Geological exhibition. We took the tram and the free bus to get here and i don't regret it for one second. First question was were is al the animals?Lots of empty cages. But finally we saw some monkeys, tigers and birds. The prauge zoo has an geologically interesting part because it's placed at a fault and you can actually see it

You can spend there all day. When i surched what animals the zoo has, i didn't expect much from it. I was happily surpriced how well the animals were so near to see and to be photographed. I got some very nice photos. The chairlift was scary and i wouldn't allow small children take the chairlift alone.There is only single seats and the security chain is not so secure, because it is manually put in place after take off. I don't like hights but i don't panic easily so i survived the trip but didn't enjoy at all that. Also the food and drink selection was awful. There was only water sold suitable for me. The bier selection was also bad on my husbands taste, so we left there very hungry and thirsty after spending 5 hours on the area.
worth to see. if you have 3 or more days in Prague.Big areas for animals nice newly built renewed pavillons.Wide range of service food/drinks/playgrounds/ropeway
Brilliant. All the animals very well look after, the polar bears were great also, shame about the rude staff. Sky chair thing bit of a con as you have to pay twice for up then down

wonderful zoo. We had an extra day in Prague and we went to this zoo based on reccomendation of our friend,we are not big fans of zoos,but we loved this one,lots of hiking among different pavillions and we especially enjoyed the Indonesian section
Well-cared for zoo. You can spend a whole day in the Prague Zoo. In addition to all the animals, there is horse riding (cost 0,20 Euros), swimming pools for children, playgrounds. We had so much fun!

Fun place for the kids. I love the fact that alot of the animals have space to be in the open. The walk is not too long ,takes you around an hour and a half to see the whole zoo. getting there and back is very easy
the best zoo ever. so close to nature and the scenery is also awesome...! Kids wud love it. Not so far from the city center...from Wencelas Square take the metro train and then a ZOO bus.
awwww nice oneeee. very nice experience, very big zoo and it wort to visit a lot of things to see. i warmly recommend to visit the zoo

love it. We couldn't miss the famous Prague Zoo. We spent there 5 hours walking and walking!!!! Saw the new place for the Gigant Salamander.
Perfect place for everybody even without kids like we are.

A pleasure!. Visited a Zoo after ages, and were happy to share the joys with the many many visitors who were thronging the place. Well-kept, and interestingly designed- the Zoo is a delight for all alike. Conveniently located, it proved to be quite easy for us (first time visitors to Prague) to find and reach the Zoo.

Not enough time. We only had 3 hours and it definitely wasn't enough, the setting was lovely and the food and drink very reasonable. Used public transport to get there which was much easier than anticipated, you can buy travel tickets at tobacco stands near the stops and a machine at the zoo (English instructions available). An English zoo guide or more English on the animal enclosures would have been a bonus, although as the guide had pictures of the animals it was easy enough to find your way around.
Spring at Zoo Praha. Well worth waiting until spring for Prague's zoo. Very well laid out, easy walking and they even have Australian marsupials.

Nice zoo. Really large and well organized zoo. My kids were a bit tired so we only did a small part (up to the elephants and then back down to the seals). food was good with reasonable price too. Took the tram + bus (about 40 minutes from old town) without problems.
Many exotic animals on show.. There was a lot of exotic animals but appeared not to have enough space for larger animals. Very good transport to Prague Zoo.
perfect place to go with children. great time, great facilities, plenty of places for children, animals have large and comfortable paddocks, they seems to be happy, worth every penny

had a great day at the zoo. make sure not skip the wild cats and tigers section. also the children part is great.
we went on Monday and it was clouded a little

Good choice. The Zoo in Prague is a really nice, I went there with my childrens through our stay in Prague this summer. We had a really nice time in there, the zoo park is surrounded by huge park and there are a lot interesting animals.

Fantastic Day Out!. Go! Just go! It is an amazing zoo, such a variety of animals. It is absolutely massive, we spent from 12pm-7pm there and still didn't get to see everything (sorry Bisons, maybe next time). Fee to get in is reasonable, if you are a student take your ID with you! It worked out to be £5 each with out student cards, I think without them it worked out around £7-£8 each. However here are a few things we found about going on a trip to the zoo: very easy to get to, metro (red line) then the bus 112 (I think) or Zoo bus takes you there. We took the advice of others on here and went on a week day, however we didn't go early (due to over-sleeping oops!) and arrived at the zoo around 12 pm, and by golly the queue was large, out the zoo and round the corner. I regretted those extra hours in bed immediately, however, in reality the queue went down very quickly, we were probably waiting for 25 minutes max. So if you aren't the waiting type then I would suggest getting there early. The beer is around £1 there, really not expensive at all and the food wasn't badly priced either, we brought a packed lunch yet looking back, for the 2 of us we probably didn't need it, if there's a large group of you though I can imagine it getting pricey pretty quickly. We also bought a zoo map, others say there is no need but for 5 crowns (which is like 6 pence) I believed it was fully worth it for the moments where there wasn't a large map near us and we required knowledge of where to go. The chair lift is definitely worth doing, its 20 crowns a journey but it was nice to get an overall view of the zoo (better on the way down than the way up). Overall it was a great day out, I would recommend this to anyone who loves the zoo/animals/doesn't mind walking a lot. Just an awesome day out!

Excellent !. This is the best ZOO I have ever been at !Number of multicolor animals is awesome. This is a really big garden with so many advantages included. I truly recommend it for a sunny saturday family or friend visit !

Perfect zoo day. This was my little daughter birthday and since she is great animals lover we went there. We spent he time between 10 am and 2 pm and had small lunch as well. The zoo is great, there is a map in English and the queues even though looking disastrous went quite quickly. If you have Czech notes there is practically no queue at the entrance. A great variety of animals and impressive try to keep them in surroundings that are as close as possible to their natural habitats. Elephants and the mountain goats are to be remembered.

One of the best in the world. I first visited the zoo after the revolution and I found it to be a depressing and dreary place. Not any more. When my children were younger, we had the season pass and we really enjoyed visiting all the new pavilions and areas. Now you get much closer to the animals and the facilities have also been improved. Try to avoid going on the weekends when the crowds can be overwhelming.
Fantastic zoo.. A great way to spend a sunny day , great views, great walks. Parking space available, pay for it at the entrance. Food and drink available for everyones taste.
not good. many of the animals looked under nourished and the fact that we couldn't see many of the animals as they were shut inside very run down needs updating
Beautiful zoo. We like this zoo a lot, as there are with the animals also interesting readings about historic and prehistoric lives placed all around the yard.

Loved it all !. Loved it all ! Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all ! Loved it all !Loved it all ! lOADS OF VERY BEAUTIFUL ANIMALS AND IF YOU ARE OVER 70 IT IS ONLY 1 KRONA !

Give a whole day to do this attraction. We thought we could see the zoo on a couple hours, it's massive with great attractions elephants, giraffes and lots of other animals including good bird displays, liked the way the mountain goats had their own environment.Brilliant stair lift to take us back up to the top or back downIt was busy and bit confusing at times as not all of the displays were translated into English Definitely worth a visitWe went via prague steam boat for 1450 czk for 4 adults and 1 child but missed return boat and got 2 taxis back to hilton Praha 1 for only 164 czk per car would have been cheaper to get there by taxi

A beautiful zoo - definitely requires a whole day to look around!. We were blessed with beautiful August weather and decided to spend it at the Prague zoo - we were not disappointed! By the end of the day our feet were sore, and even with no children in our party we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The cleverly disguised enclosures do not seem to have the same cold and caged appearance as many other zoos, and the walks through the Indonesian experience and bird walk are lovely. We would highly recommend the zoo, right down to the delicious and reasonably priced food and beer in the restaurants.

Great Zoo! Awesome polar bears!. Normally we wouldn't have considered going to the zoo instead of all the historic attractions throughout Prague but had read an article that the Prague Zoo was one of the top rated zoos in the world on TripAdvisor. So we just had to czeck it out (pun intended). And they were right - it was a great zoo! The polar bear exhibit was our favorite as they continually swam right up to the viewing area. The zoo seemed more geared to domestic tourism (not much English signage or menus) than international tourism, which we liked because even though its a tourist attraction it gave us a sense of being a local. All around fun day!

It was pretty OK. Maybe I was expecting too much. And maybe it would be better If we waited a couple of months. In April too many animals were hidden or inside. But still it's a beautiful ZOO and it worths a visit. Especially with kids, of course. The free lemurs exhibit is very nice, gorillas are unique!
One ot the best zoo in Europe. I went 3 times to this Zoo. It's very beautiful and the animals are quite a lot. There are a couple of attractions unique and I highly suggest the experience.
Great zoo. A wide varsity of animals from all around the world. It is not very easy to get there (metro &bus) but it really worth.Most animals have wide cages.
My girls loved this ZOO. Plenty of English interaction! Definitely recommend this attraction :) I lovely the giraffes and my girls (5 and 8 yr loved elephants)

Lovely place to spend weekends. The zoo is very nice it has two levels, to the second level you can walk or take the lift. There are places to eat up there so you can stay the entire day there ;) There is a lot of atractions and interactions with teh animals.
Big!. Great place for family tour, could spend 2 days, interest, many animals, good condition.A little discomfort is orientation - not so easy to find the directions.

A whole mountain of zoo!. The best place to take your kids in Prague. It makes a great city, even greater! The animals are great, and its like in the description, one of the best zoos in the Europe (Personally the best i've been). We were in such a hurry to see the rest of the city that we had to stay only 2 hours in the zoo and left with a bitter taste cause we needed a lot more time to enjoy the whole thing. A must for the tourist, and a great place to spend your weekends for the citizens of the city.

One of the best zoos in the world. We spent the whole day here and there was loads more to cover. The animal enclosures are very well designed both for the animal and the visitor. The chairlift is a thrilling ride, we took it twice as it seemed too short to take it all in one go. We all loved it.
Good. It was nice to kinda go out of the city. Property of this zoo was suprising. Only this advantage was food. There is no good restaurant.

Excellent zoo. I am not really a big zoo fan, but have visited a couple of zoos before, including some of the leading zoos in Sweden, Finland, Australia and Indonesia. The Prague zoo that I visited with my family on Wednesday is clearly the best I have visited. (The ranking of the rest is: Taronga (Sydney), Taman Safari (Bogor), Helsinki, Canberra.The Prague zoo covers a large land area around a scenic hill close to the center of the city, next to some vineyards and the Vltava river (which has sometimes flooded the zoo, e.g. in 2013 and 2002). The elephants, giraffes, zebras and ostriches have their very large enclosures in pleasant looking semi-natural setting. The big cats (tigers, lions etc.) have largish well-kept enclosures, with animals clearly visible, and it seemed that they could also been seen indoors in winter when Prague is too cold for them to go out. I liked the hippos! The area is quite large, and we strolled through most of it in 3 hours with our 3-year old, but did skip part of the area in the middle, including the moose/elk and some others. Reserving 4 hours for the visit would have been better. Tip: go early in the morning, starting at 9am, to avoid the crowds. This worked in late August. I wonder if crowds are bigger in July.

Absolutely amazing experience!!! Go there in summer, but not on Saturday or Sunday.. Everything was great! Sun, ice-cream and hundreds of animals - what can be better?Don't go there oh Saturday or Monday - there are crowds of people and a huge queue in the front of entrance.

Great Zoo and Fantastic for Families. Went to Prague Zoo two days ago with my Son and we spent almost 6 hours there having a wonderful time. It was very reasonably priced (food and entry). If you have young children and you are visiting Prague for a few days, you should definitely add this to your list of things to do!

Great place for a family trip. I have seen many Zoo in my life and still love to come back each year to Prague Zoo. Even after hard times with floods it is amazing place for a family visit.... I strongly recommend

A nice way to spend an afternoon/morning. I like Prague zoo as it is clean and shows many species of animals in their habitat. However, there are nice zoos in the world, this one has got rather touristy.

Fantastic!. First of all be prepared if you want to see all the animals that you need 4-5 hours. At entrance you can buy a zoo map for 5 czk but there is no need for it as the maps are all over the zoo. There are places to eat but also a relaxation/resting points at which you can eat your own food if you brought it. Great number of the animals and one of the best in the europe.
Lots to do for everyone! . Brilliant day for me and my husband! Lots to see, everywhere was very clean and plenty of places to get food and drinks
Huge zoo. Great huge zoo with a lot of space for animals. The animals seem to be well kept and fed. We spent most of the day there and had great fun.

When you like ZOO, go for it!. Nice ZOO design with a lot of animals, which are very easy to watch. You have here also a lot of possibility to have meal for reasonable price. All in all, we spent here very nice few hours.

Amazing . So good! So many different animals. Much better than London zoo. There is a huge hilly/mountain terrain for mountain animals too. So cheap and pretty much need a whole day to spend here.
Make sure you go to the neighbour of palace for the most beautiful pics ever.

Go there- you wont regret!. Me and my husband spend 4 happy hours at this zoo! This was worth every penny!
We recommend this trip for all ages! Come with conferrable shoes and without limited time:)
zoo overview. gorillas are the best, good to visit during the working kdays, not so crowdy ... 5h for the visit at least
Well loved animals. Clearly a well run zoo with healthy looking animals with lots of shade. It is very hilly so best to visit on a cool day

WE loved this Zoo!. We had some extra time one day, and decided to take the metro/tram out to the zoo. We are so glad we did! It is a fairly large zoo and set on a hillside, so plan on walking quite a bit. Also, the animals are kept in more natural habitats with many viewing areas, so you never know what you might see. I love to take animal photos and got some incredible ones that day. We also went to the Vienna Zoo, and this one was so much nicer. Do it if you can-highly recommend it!
Money well spent. Nice place to visit with family. You will spend there whole day,, so it's good idea to take something to eat/dring with you, 'cause prices are quite high...

A great day. Visited here arriving at 10am and spent all day here until 4pm and only left because of big storms. There is a lot to see here and also shows by animals. The place is massive and I'm pretty sure we didn't even see half of it. One of the best zoos I have ever been to. Could do with a bit more information infront of every enclosure though. We also ate here and had traditional Czech food which we really enjoyed. The only annoying thing is we didn't get the opportunity to buy a map and the ticket desks and couldn't find anywhere inside the park where we could buy one. Would recommend.

Excellent attraction. Must visit.. There are many animals in this huge zoo and they live in their own natural environment. You need many hours to visit every corner of the zoo, but you will really enjoy it. You can also stop for a beer and a snack.
Excellent. The best zoo I ever seen. Many kind of animal. New plave for elephant is amazing. I love the reptiles

Nezapomeňte na člunozubce!/Do not forget to visit shoebills. Perfektní značení od parkování až po východ ze ZOO. Skvělý den s dětmi plný zážitků a programu, velmi milý personál, přehledné značení, čisté toalety. Nezapomeňte se podívat na parádní člunozubce (v jihozápadníí části)!!!Stojí za to!Perfect signs form parking to exit from ZOO. Great day with children full of adventure and programm. Really nice staff, clean toilets. Do not forget to visit shoebills (in the southwest of zoo). They are really great!

Straightforward diversity. Many animals, huge, two levels, domain but it not manages to surprise you.Even the animals look bored in the zoo, just like you get after 15 minutes of walking through it.It is a zoo, nothing more and with the diversity of animals it looks like it has potential for more.People in charge with managing this place lacks imagination. It is a good place for kids, they get excited seeing the animals, it could be on your list if you are traveling with kids.We got to the zoo with the 112 bus, the subway (I think C line) gets you to the end of the line of this bus. The price of a ticket for an adult is 200 czk. Be careful to buy also a map of the zoo, is not included(!) and it costs 5 czk.On the side you get cheap food, fast food.It is a nice, animal rich, place, but what we didn't like is the fact that cages looked all the same.

Amazing!!!. When we arrived at the zoo it was 2 o clock.
