We walked around and saw lots and animals, insects, birds etc. We then found a chair lift and realised there was a load more to see down below! Well, it was 6.30 and it closed at 7 so we decided to come back the following day.We spent the entire day here as there is so much too see! The map we had was very useful and only cost 5kc (3p). There are plenty of food stops and drinks machines around the zoo and cheap too. Everything was clean and tidy. You could tell the animals were well looked after. It is built on a hill so walking about needs to be planned i.e start from the top!We managed to see everything in 10 hours so get there early. An excellent zoo and a fabulous day (or two) out. Cost was 400kc (£8) each for adults.

Come in early, stay all day. Huge place, lots of animals in their natural environment.Come early, plan to stay all day, don't be in a hurry, it takes time to enjoy it all.You can buy food in several cafés inside (your kids will need it).We used a boat from Prague to come in, I would not recommend it because it takes 25 minutes walk to get from the boat to the zoo, and the travel itself is quite long.

Amazing Play Structure. Our daughter loved the giant play structure at the Prague Zoo - it occupied her for ages. She also really enjoyed the water area that all of the kids were walking in. The Zoo is relatively small and is a bit out of town. The 17 tram wasn't running to the Zoo when we went so we had to connect to the Zoo bus. Overall fun experience.

Amazing!!!!!. Easily reached via public transport. Get the 3 trip pass which covers the zoo, the nearbye Horticultural Gardens and Chateau. Get a map from any of the little shops or at entrance kiosk and plan your day. There is so much to see. Take the chairlift up or down to the centre of the zoo half way up the hill or catch a ride on the little train. Don't forget to clinmb the observation tower for great views of Prague.

Scenic and large, but a lot of misused space. The walk up to the zoo along the river was very enjoyable, and you do get some good views of the city in the zoo.It is a very big zoo with lots of animals, but I would say that they have too many...I don't want to say boring animals...but similar 4 legged mammals in large spaces whereas the tigers we saw were in very small rooms & inside. Yes, it was amazing to see a tiger that close-up but you can't help wonder how unhappy the lad must have been in there.The highlight was definitely the polar bear, had never seen one before and there were two of them that we got quite close to. They also have a nice open area filled with giraffes, zebras and ostriches together.My favourite animal is the lion and we didn't get to see one except in the little room above the enclosures, that was a shame. In fact, there were quite a few animals that were just nowhere to be seen as we went through, but I guess it depends when you go.I wouldn't say it's the best zoo in Europe - I preferred Artis Zoo in Amsterdam personally, the animals had more space and it was easier to get around; you'll definitely need a whole day here if you want to see everything.It was very cheap to get in, especially as we managed to get a student discount. In terms of food, there wasn't too much choice but we ended up having a nice baguette + beer for a decent price, so it is an affordable day out. I'd say it's worth a look but I probably wouldn't go back.

One of the best in Europe. The zoo underwent extensve renovations after the floods in Eastern Europe in 2002 and since then the exhibits are updated the animals are up closer and in more open spaces. Also in 2013 and 2014 they had a ton of animal births so there were lots of cute and cuddly animals. Great place to spend the day with kids.

Nice Zoo. Large zoo with many animals. We really enjoying to see so many. We liked that most animals had large enclosures, and it was okay that we didn't see some of them really is so big . We spent more from 5 hours here and is not enough to enjoy.

A Dreadful Experience. Our journey begins with the happy promise of a wonderful zoo but don't be fooled by the wonderful scenery, this place has crippling flaws that will ruin your day fairly quickly, lets set aside the crying children that slowly pry at your sanity and begin with the walk ways, you must keep in mind that you will walk for a good long time on pathways that will wear you down very very fast, and don't think that happy looking train will save you because it is a anthropometric nightmare with seats clearly designed to fit children and not the adults accompanying them. but surely the animals are fun right? i mean they must have good enclosures right ? WRONG!! some animals are given enclosures that are akin to animal cruelty, the iguanas barely have enough water and we cant forget the cougars separated from their mothers and siblings, certain creatures are also under considerable stress such as certain lizards being harmed and chased by other larger lizards, and species of birds that are put next to other species that harass them and clearly terrify them. OK, so maybe you don't care, maybe you just want to point and laugh at the animals like most humans do, well then ill have something to concern you a tad bit more, and that is the security, i found it difficult to forget the terror i felt as i saw a cheetah pacing back and forth eyeing a crowd of people, this ofcourse wouldn't have been scary in normal circumstances but the thing is the fence was very low for a cheetah, easily jump-able in one try, have we so easily forgotten the San Francisco zoo incident ? overall if you don't get lost because of the terrible directions, and if you are oblivious to obvious security issues and animal rights violations like most idiots are then i suppose you could have a wonderful time pointing at that silly bird screaming in terror because of the intimidation from its neighbor.

Average Zoo. I am truly baffled by the extraordinarily complimentary reviews of this zoo. It is a perfectly adequate local zoo, but it is by no means worth a special trip, nor is it one of the top zoos in Europe. The boat trip to reach it was the highlight of our visit, although a long, unshaded walk from the river to the entrance was necessary. It is built on the side of a fairly steep hill, so if you go, prepare yourself for some up and down walking. There are so many better zoos. I would use precious time in Prague another way.

Great zoo lovely surroundings. Prague zoo is on the edge of the city and well worth a visit if you have time. The zoo is quite modern and all the animals are really looked after. There were some beautiful birds of prey . Penguins...tapirs...elephants...and wild horses. Theres lots of interactive areas for kids and climatic zones. Theres a chair lift that takes you up to the top of the zoo. The views over the city are fabulous. Theres not many eating places and service is not english standard. But its cheap and makes a great day out.

They have a polar bear need I say more..... VERY LARGE and well presented zoo. Be prepared for lots of walking. I would suggest getting the chair lift up and then walking back down the hill around the attractions. Easy to get to using the metro and buses and very cheap considering how much there is to see.

Worth visiting for family travelers. You can make this zoo in the list "must to visit" especially if travel with young children. It has a wide range of animals which has a lot of space and well maintained. The zoo is well laid out, has a wonderful landscape and clean. The family entrance ( 2 adults and 2 children) is 600 Czk for a whole day visit, really a good value of money. There are some children playground area, one with a little swimming pool, when visiting during hot summer day, come along with towel and swim suit for your little one(s).

Great zoo £6 admission!!. Great day out if spending a few days in Prague, new restaurant's since last visit as well as new areas for the elephants etc, for the admission i don't know how they keep it open, spend a day at twycross recently, nothing like the diversity or landscape that Prague zoo offers and 4x more expensive.
Animal-friendly place !. It's a big zoo with many animals there. Especially I love friendly atmosphere here, because animal have a lot of place for walking and feel free

Nice zoo. Clean, large zoo with an interesting combination of animals. We really enjoyed seeing the chinese giant salamander. We liked that most animals had large enclosures, and it was okay that we didn't see some of them as long as they didn't suffer. We spent about 4 hours here, so we recommend wearing good shoes (which we wish we had).Downside: the gorillas looked extremely depressed, and you could tell they were tired of humans pointing and laughing at them from the glares they gave too the crowd.

dissapointing. what we disliked was that the enclosures of the animals were very small and the Cheetah cage was dangerously exposed.All the signs lead to very confusing directions , plus they were all in Cezh , I mean there were a lot of tourists like us who came to see the Chinese Salamander which was the main attraction so it wouldn't kill them to write in English.The zoo employees were rude and did not speak in English when we asked bout anything...I regret spending precious time of my vacation in Prague at the Zoo, I could have done something better.
Wonderful ZOO. The best zoo I've ever visited. Adapted to children, adults and seniors. Wheelschairs access. Beautiful and clean environment.

Great! . Had a great time at prague zoo at sunday in prague.. We actually went for 4 Hours because we came quite late but you can spent a whole day over there. This is a zoo where you can get really close to the animale and iTS not too crowded at all. I would highly recommand the twilight zone. There are actually bats flying next to you ! Had An Amazin time -> 10/10
Nothing special. Of course you will find several animals inside but they are very hard to see properly because they have so large rooms. It is good for the animals there but not for visitors.
ZOO. This Zoo is newly reconstructed and it is really beautiful. I visit it every year and highly recommend!

Nothing like a day at the Zoo. For the most part I felt the Prague Zoo was great. It's no small zoo and will keep you entertained for a whole day or two.The glass-walled enclosures were clean and well maintained and experienced many animals up close, eye to eye. The African animals (especially giraffes) were interestingly viewable from above.The Zoo has considered kids very well. There are several small parks and play areas with zoo-styled climbing structures. There is even a swimming pool for kids to dip in on a hot day.The only reason I cannot give full points is that I have visited the amazing Copenhangen Zoo.

Great!. I have been to the zoo already twice in the last 2 months. It is huge and beautiful and you can see many interesting species in there! The most of the animals have quite big space for themselves. I give an extra credit for this as I consider it the most important thing!The zoo is clean inside the cages/pens and also outside them :P There are several recreated or brand new parts as the zoo was flooded twice in last few years.There are many activities for children and playful adults. Food and refreshments are O.K. Bathrooms are dirty.I would truly recommend it!

Don't waste your time!. Being at many zoos over Europe, this one unfortunately was the worst, reading many review rating this zoo as one of the best in Europe, made me disappointed!! Most cages had no animal!! Or they were hiding so you have to wait long time to see them!!

Impressive in Every Regard. I read that this zoo was one of the best in Europe. Initially, I was not impressed at the start of the visit since the caged birds were difficult to see. However, as I continued on, I quickly realized how big and modern this place is. I saw the damage and devestation from the flood in early 2002 and a smaller flood in 2013. The zoo has done a remarkable job rebuidling. My hats off to them.

One of top 10 Zoo's of the world. I am Czech and my family have tradition of going to the Prague Zoo every year ever since me and my sisters were a babies. Now we are all grown up and working or living apart but we still meet up for the Zoo trip every year. With every years the experience is getting better. New gorilla and giraffe babies almost every year, new Africa house with extentive seeing of elephants created together with explanatory about Hinduism, elephants in different kinds of myths etc... I must mention the Lemur monkeys at the beginig of he lower oart of the zoo. If you comd early when the westher is not so hot, you can literally sit with them on the bench. One of the monkeys even came and sat on my boyfriends lap. Great experience, so definitely give it a try!

The zoo without cages. Very nice place. During last years several times damaged by floods. But because of it there are many new buildings and expositions. Restaurants, playgrounds, Przewalski's Horses, salamaders and gavials. Really nice place...
Nice. NIce but not world quality service just yet. Weekend crowd put us off a bit. Pick midweek day! Also parking was a nightmare, come by public transport if you may.

The most beautiful zoo I've ever seen. I spent one beautiful day walking through this Zoo and I felt like I didn't want to leave anymore. If you reach Prague, you should certainly visit it. It's simply amazing! The variety of animals is amazing and its area is huge! I had one of the best days in Prague while visiting this Zoo!

A zoo at a whole new level. A wonderfull zoo contrasting the city. A beautifull piece of nature just outside the city center. The animal shelters were adapted to the needs of every animal. A natural environment has been created for each and every animal. This zoo is very popular, you can notice by the over 10000 visitors on the day we visited. No worries, you almost did not notice because of the largeness of the zoo.

One word AMAZING. By farrrrrrr the best zoo I've been too. In comparison to london zoo this was 1) cheaper and 2) just HUGEEE and more animals and the tigers lions actually came out. Loved the feline bit was amazing. And monkeys/gorillas/orangutans. CUTE! I could go on and on and just say everything in a list.
Splendid architecture. What to say?... Couldn't get enough of admiring the buildings, old town hall, the astronomical clock.. everything is fantastic! Lots of teraces, many tourists, nice atmosphere.

Great Zoo. I had a great time at this zoo. It was larger than expected. There's a bus that goes right to it, so getting there wasn't an issue. Definitely would be great for kids. There was an area with goats and such that you could pet!

Best zoo experience ever!. Visited on 25 June 2014.Excellent experience, all types of animals, animals are treated and have more space than any other zoo we have seen.Far from the center but can reach easily using public transport, the directions are on the website.Spent 3 hours.

Massive zoo with loads to see. Really enjoyed the zoo - easy to get there by underground and bus which was cheap. Good entrance fee considering we spent the whole day there. There are so many animals to see although it was VERY hot when we went and some animals were hiding in the shade and were quite hard to see (although I don't blame them it must have been so hot for them). Food places available were decently priced considering they could have got away with charging a lot more I thought.

Fantastic Day Out. Visiting Prague Zoo was one of the highlights of our holiday. We had to take the Metro followed by a busy bus to get there, but the services are regular and not too difficult to figure out for foreign tourists. The zoo is huge and you can easily spend many hours wandering around. Most importantly, the animals have plenty of space and look well-cared for. An adult ticket was only 200 crowns, which is great value for money. Overall I would definitely recommend a trip to the zoo: it makes a really nice change from the other attractions in Prague. Some of my personal favourites were the tigers, the penguins, flamingos and ducks (with incredibly tiny and fast ducklings) and monkeys.

Average zoo, destroyed by the floods. This zoo was probably worth visiting before the floods but when we visited there was nothing to see but empty enclosures. Plus we had to pay full price in and were not advised that half the animals are not out. Disappointing !

Huge!. It takes a while to get out there, but the best way to do it is getting on a boat that goes up the river. Definitely plan to be there for an entire day - it was a little musty in the indoor exhibits on a 80 degree day.

Prague Zoo a must see. Great way to break up the week of Castles / etc with kids. Very easy to get to via local trains / bus service. The seal show was fantastic. The property is huge so leave about 3 hours to enjoy the entire property.

Makes for a great half day adventure. My husband and I greatly enjoyed our day at the Praha Zoo. We arrives around 9:30 am on a Friday and stayed until 1pm. We were able to see most of the exhibits. Got an English map from the gift shop before we walked around. Really enjoyed the lemur exhibit and were glad we went there in the morning when the lemurs were active and mingling with zoo goers. We went back before we left and the were all in the shade. Great walking paths and wonderful exhibits for the animals. We enjoyed seeing the polar bears swimming. It was hot but the shady paths and breeze kept us cool between exhibits. Lots of areas for kids to play and we enjoyed being able to get a Cider to drink while we walked around. Also enjoyed the restaurant out side the entrance before we took the bus back to the metro. Very easy to navigate to using public transport. Great way to spend time in Prauge if you love animals.

Great day at Prague zoo. Spent a thoroughly enjoyable few hours wandering around Prague zoo. Easy to get to via public transport. Very cheap admission at 200czk and also buy a map with your ticket for only 5czk. We took advice from others on here and took the chairlift up (20czk) to the top and worked our way back down. Plenty of animals to see all around the zoo which seemed massive! Resfreshment stops and toilets all around the zoo also (delicious ice cream for only 18czk!). We really enjoyed our day and recommend a visit.

I love the ZOO. It's one of my favourite ZOOs around the world! I recommend you to go there if you have time for it. You can find lots of animals and the food in the ZOO is pretty good, not just fries and hot dogs! Go there if you can :)

Worth a visit. Visited Prague Zoo in July this year. Overall the zoo is of a very good standard - most enclosures are modern and very big (exceptions include the Polar bear). Allow a lot of time as the zoo is spread in area of around 10km. There are lots of food and drink outlets (very cheap!) and souvenir shops.Would have given the zoo a 5 star rating -if the polar bear enclosure was bigger and had more objects etc in it to stimulate the bear.Easy to get to from the city by public transport, very kid friendly.

An attraction not to be missed!. Prague zoo is the most beautiful zoo I & my wife have visited. Be prepared for a full day, as the size of the zoo and the number of species & animals are beyond belief. You will have the opportunity “to meet” animals from all continents. Zoo is only half an hour from the city center with frequent and reliable public transportation, located by the river side and spans to a hill top. Breathtaking view of Prague city and its surroundings. Very clean and spacious both for the visitors and the animals. Highly recommended for a visit! Congratulations to all staff who work so hard to maintain and preserve such an attraction.

Don't miss the Prague zoo. Everything was great. The zoo area is enormous, there are so many animals to see! Children love it, adults love it!Plan to go on a whole-day trip and visit on good weather!Souvenir shops were a disappointment though.

Fabulous zoo. Prague zoo is an amazing day out. It's a huge place so be prepared for lots of walking, though to save those with tired legs they have a chair lift between the lower and upper level. The main attractions of course are the animals. They are housed in lovely large enclosures simulating their natural habitat. The outside sections are designed so that there are no need for ugly fences. They have also opened up the inside sections and have large glass windows which gives you a wonderful view as they relax. The information boards have lots of info about the animals, obviously the majority of text is in Czech however they have shorter summaries in English which tells you the basic info. My favourite animals to watch were the apes, expecially the gorillas. Had the pleasure of watching Richard the dominant male silverback eating leaves by picking them off the branches as he sat barely 1m from me - simply amazing

The biggest and the best zoo I’ve seen so far. It’s hard to add anything after many other reviews. Maybe it would be worth to repeat a few recommendation which I read here and for what I’m thankful to Tripadvisor.First of all, put on comfortable shoes, take a bottle of water if sun is shining and temperature is high – the path will be long.Second, I confirm that it will be better to start your hike from upper part of the zoo. Otherwise after exploring lower part of the zoo you won’t have vigor to climb to the hill. Alternatively there is a chairlift.Personally I was fascinated by a polar bear swimming in its pool. Only thick glass of the pool separates you from this wild animal and you can nearly touch its nose when it swims by you. Children adored that. I had never imagined I could be so close to that dangerous creature. The zoo has huge amount of various animals. Another exhibit in the zoo was mountain goats. Actually I was amazed by not the goats themselves, but rather a way they were presented. They were leaping and cavorting up and down on a steep rocky wall between higher and lower levels of the zoo. Descriptions existed for all animals and were written in English and Russian. But the most interesting text still existed only in Czech language, e.g. it gives interesting facts like a difference between dogs and wolves, home and wild cats.I was slightly disappointed that many wild cats like Fishing cat (Prionailurus viverrinus) were hiding somewhere and were not found in their cages and enclosures. But nevertheless the zoo was very impressive indeed.

highly recommended!. I'm not very into zoos but I really enjoy that walk. To see everything took us about 4 hrs! There is a lot of animals and they seem to be happy. perfect for walk with families and friends.
Huge place. Very interesting place to visit. Full of animals with reasonable price. Lovely ice creams are sold there. One of the best zoos

ZOO Prague. you can spend 1 fully day walking the ZOO, very nice area, animals are not kept in separated cages if not required, different species sharing the areas if possible, very nice time spent if you are visiting with or without children

Best Zoo I have Ever Been To. Visiting Prague zoo is truly a memorable experience. It is one of the few zoos where you don't feel sorry for the animals. The size of the zoo is impressive, it is really children friendly (you can even borrough a little wooden troley that can fit a kid or two when they are too lazy to walk around). They have numerous activities for kids as well for the adults. The information presented is interesting and entertaining. I love this place.

Great Zoo. This is one of the best zoo in Europe. It is very clean and nice green area. You can see almost all the animals from really close distance.Also there is a lot of places to seat and eat in different areas of the zoo.
Excellent. Little bit further away from Centre, but absolutely incredible zoo. Absolutely massive, cheap prices for food and drink inside the zoo. Well worth a visit if you have time.

a very large zoo for a day trip. Amazing large and cheap zoo.with a lot of animals. on warm days most of the animals will still be in there shelters early in the morning. but most of the shelters are also visible. But what would you expect on a hot day I would go outside if I was a animal in the zoo. the zoo takes good care of there animals and let them make the choice where they want to go. the zoo is so large that I would recommend to start in the morning and just enjoy the animals and let time pass you by.

Gorillas were my highlight!. Great visit to the zoo and at 200Kr, it was a steal. The compound is pretty huge and hilly so be prepared to walk. Take the chair lift (20kr) up and then walk down from the top bit by bit, and enjoying the animal exhibits along the way. The highlight for me was the family of gorillas as I have never seen them before, they were such a tease, posing for our pictures and playing with each other. Do check out this exhibit near the base of the chair lift. Cater at least 3hrs if you wish to view all exhibits.

Fantastic!. Best zoo I have visited, lovely animals with good enclosures and loads to see! Takes a whole day to get around and has a bit where children can feed goats and a very shallow pool for them to paddle in so great for kids. Wear comfortable shoes as there is a lot of walking. The public transport to the zoo is easy and cheap and zoo entry was reasonable, and so were the food and drink prices once inside. Brilliant day out!
Brilliant day out. Prague zoo is amazing - it's really cheap entry and pretty easy to get to on public transport. The zoo has loads of animals which all seem to have plenty of space and seem happy.

Slightly Insulted. Liked the zoo but after being treated super rudely by the woman at the information desk. She has the wrong job! It is an information desk after all so why would she insult us when we asked a question? After that first impression, we spent a few hours walking around the zoo on a hot day. An annoyance to us (and the animals, no doubt) was a very loud loudspeaker INSIDE one of the pavillions. Dumb on every level. You also have to pay for the little train if you can't walk or have tired children, etc. The free strollers at the front gate were a redeemer!

Huge zoo. It has variety of animals but you walked a lot to see them all ,so put on your comfortable shoes and use sun cream if you go there in summer time and enjoy.If you take bus and metro it is cheaper than using boat.
Looks like a nice park and you get to see lots!. I like spending time in the zoo, it's fun, has lot's of things for kids. The restaurants inside are not too bad. Weekends it's quite crowded though.

Generously sized, one of the best in Europe. First of all, if you're off to the Prague zoo, you better have no other things planned for the day. The whole park is huge and you'll easily spend the whole day there especially if you brought kids (...because kids have tiny legs and get distracted easily, and there will be distractions). Parts of it are full of pleasant shade and feel serene, some are sunny, many themed buildings throughout the park (expect your hair to frizz up in the tropical ones), petting zoo, a choice of transport (mini train! chairlift!), couple of convenient food and drink spots, too. I never really feel like there's anything missing in the Prague zoo, maybe apart from pandas, and if you ever actually saw any pandas in any other zoo, you know those are pretty overrated anyway. (I live in Edinburgh. Trust me on this.)

Dissapointing visit. Was really looking forward to the Zoo trip having read so much about it. Zoo bus very crowded with Buggies, so suggest a visit later in the day. No Maps supplied and very little signposting. The Zoo is on 2 levels and one is 60 feet above the other. There is a chairlift, but this costs extra. The alternative is a very steep walk. So if you go do the top bit first and then the lower levels. You would know this if you had a map!SO go to http://www.zoopraha.cz/en/before-visit/prague-zoo-map and download the pdf before you go.
Very nice area and much animals. Big area and they have lots og animals. And the habitate seems that they have been taken good care of. Very nice activity with and without kids.

Outstanding sightseeing day off for the kids. If you travel with kids, and have spent several days exploring various (and copious) beautiful spots and places that Prague has to offer, and your kids are getting bored, take them to the Prague Zoo. You'l enjoy it, too.The Prague Zoo is located in Troja district, a bit away, but easily accessible from the city center. You must reach Nádraží Holešovice which is a big local transportation hub, and take either bus 112, or Zoo bus, both leaving from the same place.In the Zoo itself you will find various animals, many of them in open aviaries (protected by electric fence), so you see them "naturally". Polar bear swimming face-to-face with you (separated by a transparent window), gorillas, tigers etc. leave an outstanding impression for the kids. A must-see is the seal show - all are cute and great performers. Although the show is conducted in Czech, the gestures are quite understandable.A visit to the Zoo can be combined with the nearly located Troja Castle with a nice garden, and/or the Botanical Garden.The Zoo is well equipped with WC's and cafe's.

AMAZING. simply amazing, you have to visit! very cheap entrance, cost us £6 each and you can spend a whole day there. the cable car up to the african area is a bit daunting but once you're up there the elephants and giraffes are a must!

a lovely day out.. went by river cruise from rasinovo quay this cost 290 czk each return and is a wonderful leisurely way to travel.there is a bar on board and you can get snacks served by a very friendly girl.the trip takes around 75 min and you get some lovely views.be careful on return trip as some boats only go to chechuv bridge.on leaving boat it takes about twenty mins to walk to zoo.entrance fee was very cheap around 4czk for us (over 65s)the zoo is excellent with loads of animals but the hiighlight for us was the gorilla compound with the great silverback and his wives,around 4or5 of them with 2 babies a memorable sight.other highlights were the tigers and penguins.a really lovely day out.

Best zoo I've ever been too. Basically it's the best zoo in Europe I've ever been to, you can get inches away from tigers, lions, apes, polar bears and my personal favourite hippos (they are the most massive animals I've ever seen) plus loads of others. the lists are endless and the use of glass screens to basically put u in the enclosures is fantastic. Have u ever seen a 10ft crocodile swimming underwater at eye level, have u ever stood on the ground at the side of a giraffe to appreciate the size, u must come here to experience this, use AAA TAXIS to get here, they speak English and are cheap. A must if u want to go to a zoo that isn't boring and is full of animals that u can get really close too.

Very enjoyable day out!!. After seeing all of the sights in the city we decided to have a trip out and this did not disappoint. What a cracking day. Very easy to get to via metro and bus as all stations/stops are clearly marked. The bus stops right outside the zoo. The zoo itself is huge so allow yourself plenty of time to wander around. I would recommend you buy a map (5kc) as it will be needed to make sure you get everything in. There are a lot of animals to see! The entry fee is also very reasonable at 200kc. There are plenty of restaurants, shops, souvenirs stalls along the way and all are of a very reasonable price.I would certainly recommend this visit!

Fantastic. A great day (and it is a full day as the zoo is huge) a good variety of animals to see in many cases in a habitat which is very closely matched to the natural environment. Can get really close to some of the animals.

Pity that it is not so well known!. Wonderful place for relaxing day trip away of crowded center of beautiful Czech capital. Huge territory, very rich in animals and shows and restaurants. Outstanding level of maintenance! Easy reachable in a few minutes by special bus "Zoobus" from nearest metro "Nádraží Holešovice". Cheap!!! And don't miss Troja Palace - just opposite the entrance to Zoo!

Really good day out!. We had a day left in Prague after we'd seen all the historical sites and everything else we wanted to see so we decided on Prague zoo. We were not disappointed! I usually come away from zoos feeling a bit depressed and sad for the animals but this zoo has really fantastic enclosures. You feel really close to the animals. The tigers looked a bit stressed in their indoor enclosure but we assumed, as they'd just been fed, they were just waiting to go outside. The tram and bus system to get there is very well sign posted and easy to follow. Really good day, and it took us all day to get round! A must if you've got a spare day in Prague. PS. Maps are 5Kc and worth it!!!

A must for children. It was good to see so many animals and the children really enjoyed it .the positive was that u could get free strollers and carts as the terrain is hilly an d u have to walk a lot up and down .there were refreshment cafés inside the zoo so u don't need to carry food or drinks from outside . I only wish that there were more signages in English as sometimes one is left wondering what is written . On the whole a good experience though a little tiring but definitely worth a visit especially if u have kids with u .

Good value but a bit hilly. Very good value for such a large place. A bit out of the way, but easy to get to, we took a boat trip from the centre of town to get there, and came back on the 112 bus to Nádraží Holešoviceto Metro station. The bus seems to run very frequently. The zoo is big and seems to have recovered from the floods very well. The only thing to be aware of is that it is a bit hilly and so can be very tiring walking round. There is a chair lift to get up to the higher sections. Plenty of animals, although most of them seemed to want to hide when we were looking at them.

Nice place for outside walking. The zoo is one of the biggest in Europe. It's pleasant to spend one of your day off walking here and watching the animals life.Note: there is free transfer to the Zoo and back to metro "Nadrazi Holesovice" in week-ends!Bus "Zoo Praha" (not 112 bus).

Somewhere you should go in Prague, but might not think of.. Prague Zoo is unusual (by UK standards) and really very good. Visitors to Prague would naturally not normally schedule a zoo visit. But I advise if you're there for more than the weekend go!It's a little bit out of town, but a Taxi is simple (Zoo is pronounced 'Zo') and there used to be a passenger boat that you could take there and I'm sure still is.You get up close to the animals in a mixture of large outside enclosures and inside pens depending on the weather and animal preference. Sometimes the zoo guides will be holding animals for you to touch where this is safe and not distressing to the animals.It's a big zoo, spread over a wide walkable area - you can hire a hand drawn buggy for kids - get up close to Otters, Penguins, Giraffe's, Camels (sometimes fed by hand apples from outside the enclosure), Meerkats and hundreds more - the bat pen has bats flying free around you. I once got to see Elephants play football there with a very large soft football.There's also a ski-lift to get to the upper section if you don't want to walk.Google it and go.

Well laid out and easy to get to!!. Very enjoyable, well laid out in terms of seeing everything without having to double back over paths!! Beautiful surroundings! Very easy to get to and wasnt expensive!
Brilliant Zoo!. Execllent zoo! lots of animals and well laid out. took us about 4 hours to walk round the whole place. very interesting

a real Salamander. This zoo is one of the biggest I've visited. Animals, birds, insects, snakes and reptiles of every kind including a salamander. Went for a day and only saw half of it.Very good value too. Take the metro (red line) to Nadrazi Holesovice then the 112 bus (outside station) dirct to zoo where it terminates.

Worth the visit. its an amazing place and the way the architecture of the place was done is just so amazing. The animals looked so healthy and the atmosphere was so serene. the place brings out the feel of being out in nature with the wild

Great Day Out with the Kids in Prague. Visited Prague Zoo on a recent trip to Prague with 2 children age 3 years and 8 months. Had explored the lovely buildings and the castles of Prague on the previous days and wanted a change of scenery to keep the children happy! Took a Taxi from the hotel in Prague due to convenience as the other options involved a metro and a bus or a steamboat. Cost of taxi 400 CSK one way.Entry to the zoo cost 200 csk per adult or 6 pounds!! So cheap and worth each penny and more, Recommend buying a map at the entrance as the zoo is massive and no real signs in the Zoo. The enclosures for the animals are spacious and well laid out. The zoo is based on two levels and we managed to do both despite having two strollers with us. The hill is steep but doable in 5-7 minutes. Highlights of the day were seeing the Gorillas, Indonesian jungle, Elephants area, Lion and Tiger Area. The view from the top-tower is good but avoidable if travelling with kids. Plenty of open areas for the kids to play in. We found the food disappointing probably because we chose the wrong restaurant and due to dietary restrictions (vegetarian). Overall we spent 8 hours in the zoo and thoroughly enjoyed it. Will rank it as one of the best zoo we have visited.

Very nice after renovation.... I have been to many zoos in my life, this one is definitely the nicest... now. I have been here 12 years ago and remember it as a bit shabby, after the floods in 2003 it had to undergo extensive renovation and is now a prime example of what a zoo should look like. The old area for elephants and hippos is now empty and a huge, beautiful and fully new area has been developed. A lovely place to see in Prague, especially during the week when a bit less busy. Well done !!

Must visit!. Little outside of city centre, so you need to take a bus or taxi(legal taxis are cheap in Prague), Absolutely amazing place, which is fully renovated because of bad floods. Large area from "ground level" up to hill, where you can take a scenic walk or "ski" lift. Animals were healthy and good looking, whole place was clean and enough kiosks and restaurants. We spend here over 4 hours and with children I guess this is a whole day trip. We've been at least 15 different zoos and overall this is maybe the best! Adult ticket for a day was about 7 euros, hard to think better way to spend that

Best of the best. I have never seen such well thematically perfectionised zoo as the one in prague. Everything matches perfectly with the location the animals are originally from, except for pavillon of elephants which was practically only made of concrete.

Better than San Diego zoo. When you want a change to beautiful buildings, museums and churches this is the place to go. The zoo is laid out on either side of a hill so may not be suitable for people with mobility problems.Visited with our 14 year old son and we were all very impressed. The enclosures were well laid out and spacious. The types of animals here are very diverse and some we hadn't seen in other zoos we have visited such as the extremely rare Przewalski’s Horse. There were numerous baby animals and we even saw several animals trying to make babies!!! The only part of the zoo that we were not happy was was the Feline Pavilion home to various wild cats, although we did have the amazing experience of being right next to a sleeping tiger only separate from it by glass. Food and drink prices were very reasonable - lunch for three which consisted of pasta, tandoori chicken with rice and sausage and chips with two Kozel lagers and a coke came to only 389 crowns.

One of the best place for walking in Prague. Except poor gastronomy, of course, it's a common problem of plenty tourist atractive places in the Czech republic. I like Indonesian pavilon and the old-fashioned chair lift. And Penguins pavilon :-)

Well worth the trip and good value. Animals in fine fettle and some wonderful enclosures and displays. Only exceptions were the ponies being used for children's rides; these looked very hot and bothered and slightly unhappy. Went there by river boat and there is a 15 minute walk from the riverside. Our only problem was signage - it wasn't entirely accurate as some animals had been moved round due to refurbishments, maps were not offered on entry and although signs at animal enclosures were in several languages this was not the case where the history of the zoo was explained so we missed out on some interesting information. It is/will be fabulous but wear flat shoes, it's a bit hilly!

Very spacious realistic enclosures. The lowest entry price major zoo in europe. A very big site, with excellent safari park style enclosures. They are now breeding a lot of CITES species. Most recently opened is a special building for Chinese Giant Salamanders (they don't say where they got them from - they are available from disgusting food suppliers in China, killed to order!!! the worlds biggest exterminating country). Recommended - 6 the Indian Gharials, Anaconda tank, male Malaysian Tiger, all of the walk in Vulture enclosures. Plenty of food places with all drinks very low prices.

A must in Prague. Been to a couple of Zoo's in Europe and I must mention Prague's Zoo was the biggest.The general feeling is like visiting a kind of a forest, for it's located outside the city taking a an enormous part of land.Every animal get a lot of space and there are many of them (11 giraffes for example).I'm recommending at least half a day for this trip! (also there are boats from the center of Prague to the Zoo which is very cheap and very recommended adds a lot for this special trip!) The zoo itself is very well maintained and the animals each gets a "natural, big, dwelling place like cages".The price is very low for a Zoo entrance fee in Eurpoe!

Great Zoo. A huge zoo that takes about 4-5 hours to see. It is a bit tricky to get around it - you better plan the paths from the very beginning. Unfortunately we were not able to see all of it because the pavilions are closing at 19:00 and we were late.

Very nice Zoo. The Zoo is very nice. It is definitely not a small Zoo - took us 4 hours by foot to visit all of the Zoo.
Overall very interesting and just nice to walk there even for a person who does not enjoy a Zoo very much(like me). In some parts of the Zoo you have a great view of Prague.

one of the best views I've ever been too.. Excellent zoo, better than london zoo or colchester zoo and most zoos in the uk to be honest. They have pretty much all the animals you'd want to see and the zoo itself is extremely clean and well thought out with lots of interesting large enclosures that have all been individually personalised. You can easily spend half a day here and if you have kids there are numerous playareas (lost count of how many we saw). Food and drink aren't too expensive either so i wouldn't worry about taking food with you. Very easy to get to just take the metro C (red one) to Nadrazi Holesovice stop and then take the 112 bus to the zoo (it's clearly marked) The transport system is excellent so i wouldn't bother getting a taxi there. cost of entry was 200Kz/6 pound ish
Not only for kids.. One of the best Zoo in the world. I am looking forward to returning back with our new born baby. And I will keep visiting it to find out how the new born animals are doing.
The must!. The great zoo. Really is. I spend most of my day in it, and love it. Animals are well cared of, facilities neat and organized. Personally, had a blast.

A place worth visiting while in Prague. We went to the Prague Zoo using the steamboat, it took us about 10 minutes to get to the zoo from there the boat left us, we just followed all the people. It is more of a huge park with animals than a standard zoo so you will have to walk quite a lot to see everything, but it is very lovely and has very nice views. We spent around 6 hours in the zoo (including a break for lunch) and we probably saw most of the animals. We were there during and after lunchtime (11 am - 5 pm) so a lot of animals were sleeping after being fed and weren't too active so I would suggest going there earlier. It was a very nice day and we had a great time and enjoyed ourselves. A nice change from the busy Prague streets.On the way back we couldn't find the metro so I would just suggest taking the steamboat back if you are not sure on how to get back, we on the other hand walked very very far (we got lost) until we found another metro station.

A place for a great day out!. I love Prague Zoo, it is great for family day out of course, but also groups of friends or couples go there if they just simply want to go for a walk in a nature, but stay in Prague. The place is huge, so you can easily spend there the whole afternoon in and have a great time!

Amazing Zoo. Our visit was in the summer which means a lot of people but you can survive it. Everything is clear they even make couple of shows with the animal. It is really huge Zoo with any kind of animals you are thinking of.

Fantastic day out!. I recently booked a surprise trip to Prague for my boyfriend and organised a trip to the zoo for the first day. It was easy to get to via metro and the zoo bus. No queue to get in, and a cheap day out at 200cz per adult. The place is absolutely huge, so wear comfy shoes! I wish we had bought a map, but we managed to see everything and there are maps all around the park, so you never got lots.They literally have every kind of animal you would hope from in a zoo, and the enclosures are so nice for them. I love they way they had walkways over the enclosures, and different paths to take.We managed to get so close to the animals, and they are so calm. We even saw an elephant having a bath, which made my day!Absolutely the best zoo we'd ever been to, and I would recommend to anyone that is in Prague!
Enjoyable place to visit. I truly enjoyed my walk through this zoo as I am an animal lover. They have the typical zoo animals and then some surprises. You must visit while in Praha. Happy travels.
Super. It's very good please. Very interested. More interesting animals. Penguins is very funny and very beautiful.

Excellent day out for anyone!. Prague Zoo was such a great day out for me, even during the wintertime! The zoo is not far from the city, but far enough to create an oasis of nature in which people can relax and see some amazing animals. Plan for a whole day of visiting, as the place is huge! (60 hectares)I was really impressed with the zoo's range of animals and their impeccable living conditions. The habitats are cleverly landscaped so you can come really close to animals without any risk to them or yourself. The enclosed Indonesian jungle was a highlight: it looks and feels like you're in an actual jungle! I loved the reptiles, the giraffes and the herd of elephants. The gorilla family is just hilarious, especially their rowdy 'teenage' son.This zoo is a must-visit for any animal lover and families. For a great price, you can see a vast array of amazing animals, contribute to the zoo's environmental efforts and have an awesome fun-filled day! Get a map of the place for easy navigation and bring a camera!

Interesting. The ZOO is okay. What makes it different from other others is location ( we took a lovely Vltava boat to get there) and also there is a cabel car ( extra little 20 CZK fee) inside the zoo to get to different areas of the zoo. Otherwise, it is just a zoo. For children it would be fun - the cable car.

You need to buy a zoo map!. Nice, quite average zoo. You need to buy a zoo map. There are almost no direction signs, and because of the location on a hill the zoo does not have an easy to understand layout. Sometimes it is rather hard to find the animals, and there was a lot of construction going on. But we did see the Prewalsky horses from upclose, and tigers, penguins, ...Zoo is not accesible by metro. In the metro station you need to take the bus. Which was not too difficult.

Worth the visit. Not a bad zoo, easy enough to get to by trams from city centre (if you organise yourself). It's a nice park with nice natural enclosures, although a lot of animals were missing when we visited there was still more than enough to keep us interested. Food is expensive but that's to be expected at a zoo. Overall it's a nice day out (especially for kids I would imagine) and the trams are a great way to see some of the city.

One of the best Zoos in Europe. This is a wonderful zoo to visit. Spacious, clean and well laid out with a huge array of animals, including elephants. I went with my partner and we had a great time looking around it, well worth a visit. Be prepared for a lot of walking though. A nice way to get there is by boat from the centre which was relaxing and lovely in the sun. Worth doing when you've done all the other sights in prague first.

Great exhibits, full of fun!. We took our 2.5 year old and 4 month old here as we were looking for something kid friendly and fun. It certainly didn't disappoint! It's a large zoo and the animal exhibits are fun and up close so you can see them well. There are many play places and even a little water pool for kids to splash it when it's warm out. One of the best zoos our family has been to thus far.

Well worth a visit.. Large zoo with a good collection of birds/animals. Wear good footwear as you will be walking a lot, not all on paved footpaths. Some quite steep areas. Some exhibits are a bit of a walk between each other. Spent a good 6 hours there and didn't see it all. Food was a reasonable price. Take your student card as you can get in at a discount (this seems to apply at most attractions in Prague). Got two adults and one student in for less than the price of one adult into 'Chester zoo' UK.

One of the best zoos visited so far. This might the best zoo where I have visited so far. First of all the place is beatiful and built on a big hill.There is lots of details everywhere e.g. Indonesian jungle pavilion is really a jungle. Lots of activities like free scenery tower, one-seated cable elevator (20 korunas) and good cheap restaurants and at least one terrance were you can sit, drink beer and watch animals. We enjoyed at least three and half hours in the zoo park. You get close to animals and there are multible places to see same animals so you cannot miss them. It is also very easy to get to the zoo from Prague city center by using public transportation.

Great for families. We have visited our favourit Zoo 15 times at least already, and willingly recommend it to anyone visiting Prague and has an extra day.Zoo has a very informative and helpful website, so an attempt to discribe it in detail would be just nonsense. But shortly:Yes, it is huge, so plan to spend 5 or 6 hours to fully enjoy it. Dogs are allowed. Food is mainly regular or fastfood, but in our opinion much better than in Euro Disney, for instance. Beer is everywhere. Lots of kids play areas. Even fun trolleys for kids are being available if you come early.The main reason why we decided to give this review though is that if you plan your trip to Prague within next 2 or 3 months, please keep in mind that most roads in a neighbouring area are under reconstruction now and it could be difficult to get there by car at least (I am not positive about public transport). Invest some time to get more information before you go. You may try a steam boat or ferry; in that case better have one full day for trip to Zoo, as those are time consuming.
Great Zoo for family. Nice elefants location where You can walk close to the animals; nice location though little hilly. Parking close to entry.

Bring your tennis shoes. Lots of animals and lots of walking. What a beautiful setting!! Take the swing tram to the top and walk down. We walked the hill plus the rest of the zoo. Exhausted. Everything is in the native language but the pictures helped to navigate. Very easy to get to from old town. Train and bus. DO NOT forget to validate your bus or train ticket. We didn't know and got fined 80$. Even though we had the tickets they fined us. They are on the buses so don't try to sneak. Now back to the zoo. ..... The sea lion show was cute thank god we stumbled across it because we wouldn't have known there was a show. If your into birds they have a ton!!!

Nature park. I went to this zoo with my wife and 13 year old. They call it a Zoo but it is really a huge park with lots of animals. So if you like nature walks and animals this is a great place to go. You can also take the river boat back to Prague
Average food , best atmosphere. Arounds are animals and flowers , so good idea on trip . Nice place , but normal food and worst price . So much on 1 hotdog or frenchfries.
Best zoo in Europe.. Amazing range of animals and such a big zoo. Entry cost is cheap and you can spend all day here gawping at animals you probably have never seen before!

Best Zoo ever!!!!. Prague Zoo is amazing, if you are visiting Prague, make sure the Zoo is on your list of things to do! It's huge, it's clean, it has loads of animals, it truly is an amazing day out and not just for young children, for all ages!!! Wear comfortable shoes and enjoy it!

Fantastic daytrip with kids. I have seen many zoo's in the US, then the one in Vienna and this one. Must say that the Prague Zoo is the best -its location is superb -on hills and in the valley of Vltava River. We loved the African exhibit, the tower on the top of the hill, many children playgrounds, unique Przewalski horses. It is a great feat to renovate after two floods but they did it like the Phoenix bird, every time better and bigger. And their efforts pa back. Congratulations Zoo Praha!!!!

Prague Zoo. The history of Prague Zoo goes all the way back to the year 1881, when, on the occasion of the wedding of Crown Prince Rudolf and Princess Stephanie of Belgium, Count Sweerts-Sporck published an open letter in the newspapers calling for the establishment of a zoological garden in Prague.Prague Zoo offers you exciting things to do all day. As you observe our animals, you may grow hungry, or you may perhaps wish to buy a souvenir featuring your favorite animal. Thanks to the excellent services offered by our zoo, you can enjoy your visit to the full. Provided for visitors are parking lots, a number of restaurants, a children’s play area and many other smaller playgrounds, as well as an observation tower. The wide array of services we offer also include an electronic information system, available free of charge at several sites with free Wi-Fi connection.
Wonderful. Wonderful place, especially in sommer time, nice place for visit with family or friends, You can spend there whole day, it is huge territory , lot of animals, very beautiful arrangement
Beautiful place. Every year better and better :) Beautiful place for families, couples and also friends to spend all day long. Great attraction is one-seat cableway for 20 CZK.

Surprisingly large zoo. Went to the zoo on the advice of Tripadvisor. It was an excellent zoo. Only about £6, but is huge and can easily take all day to walk around. Most of the enclosures are wonderfully laid out and seem to be designed with all the animals needs in mind. There are even cable charis if you don't want to walk as the zoo is built on two levels on a hill.

One of those few zoo's that aren't cruel. I dislike the zoo generally...don't feel like seeing trapped animals crowded behind iron bars. Well, this is the future, there is so much freedom and recreation of natural habitat in this zoo you well be amazed.It's absolutely lovely to see that another way is possible, and they have trilingual educational boards that are quite comprehensive. Well done Prague!
Good place to go with your children. Very nice place, new outdoor and indoor pavilions imitating real-life environment in different places on Earth (Africa, Indonesia, ...).

Love this zoo - for the whole family. This is great place where to go in Prague. A lot of animals, nice nature, attractions for children. You can buy nice and funny Tshirts with their animals. Of course, you will spend some money, but it is normal.
great zoo. A great zoo, but for such a large zoo i was disappointed with the gift shops, very smal, couldn't barely move in them!

An excellent example of what can be done in a city Zoo.. Prague zoo is probably one of the best zoos I've ever been in. There is the always the feeling that the zoo is designed for the animals and not for the humans. It is not a big zoo, but has plenty of animals and an amazing range of activities for children. The animals are not really caged, for example the monkeys have their own island surrounded by a moat, large trees and very natural environment. Humans can brings their dogs too, and there was plenty of well behaved dogs and families. Lots of refreshment areas, toilets etc. highly recommend a visit, transport links, tram and bus from Central Prague are excellent.
For children perfect. Think that prague zoo is one of the more nice.you can go also there whit boat and near is botanic garden also really nice.

The best ZOO in the World!!!!. The ZOO at Prague is so nice place, its so green and large Design of ZOO is cool. All day is not enough to see everything. There are so many attraction!!!! It´s very close to the center, the public bus is very convenient and the bus stop is at the station of metro Nádraží Holešovice (line C - red line). Close of the ZOO is a botanical garden.... We really enjoy this visit!!!!! You have see the ZOO and you help to the animals too!!!
beautiful zoo. Beautiful and large ZOO, many kind of animals. Trip to the ZOO is daylong. New elefant place is interesting, gorilas and lions was amaizing. Visit in ZOO was excellent.

My daughter loved it. This is a good one day outing while you're in Prague. It is very easy to access through public transportation. I understand that one can also reach thru ferry....but public bus is very convenient. The animals are let in natural environment. There are some fun rides too. Great array of food kiosks, restaurants thru the walking path. We found it interesting to see a look-alike model of Hindu temple next too Elephant section of the zoo. Also interesting for us to see were the Penguins! A very enjoyable visit for our family, especially for my daughter..!

Great 4-5 hours. designed well, Built well, tons of animals, very spacey.
many attractions and clear view. very close to the city center.
Nice and peacefull place. Zoo is very quite and well feeling place, there is plenty living space for animals and they looks good. We have enjoyed our time in the Prague zoo very much.

Loved the zoo. Great zoo lots of animals and they all looked happy. Plenty of places to grab food or a beer and plenty of places for the kids to run around a play. It was a little out of the way but if you plan to take he bus and but a ticket you have to do it in the machine and most of them only take coins. Go see this if you have kids or you just like zoos!
Really big and nice Zoo. At first we just planned to stay there for just a few hours, but it ended up we stayed for almost a whole day, because it's just so big!
Great family day out. Great place to spend a day out, just make sure you're wearing very comfy shoes as you would walk a lot!
Nice place!. Very nice ZOO! I like it! One of the best what I saw! There is too many grounds, nice areas! You can go by boat there, it's romantic. Very good place for families, for couples too.

One of the World's Finest. Years ago, I spent four years traveling the world to zoos for a photography project. I would rate the Prague Zoo equal, if not better to the famous San Diego Zoo. Lovely environment, well teated animals, great variety (especially birds), many wonderful facilities for attendees comfort (trams, restaurants). Just excellent.

A big, nice zoo. We visited the zoo yesterday. We were there for two hours and recommend to stay for at least 3 - 4 hours, because we didn't even see half of it, until we had to leave. For me, this i a good sign, the Zoo is big, there are lots of animals and it seems that they are taken care of. I highly recommend using the cable car in the zoo, which costs 20CZK and gives you a great view of Prague and the zoo itself. It is also a great way to come around in the huge zoo.

I love this place!! :-). Prague Zoo are a Zoo that really care for the animals and are continuously upgrading the facilities for both animals and guests. This is a great day out for all ages, there is a lot of walking and there are a lot of hills but there is many things to see along the way. My favourites are the Polar Bears :-) The petting zoo is also a very interactive experience. Though if you want to feed the goats then you need to get there early as there is only a specific amount of food available a day and once it is gone, it's gone :-)
Best Zoo.. One of the best zoos in the world with a variety of animals. Great place to spend the day with good restaurants and friendly staff. Totally recommend

great Zoo. The zoo of Prague has a lot of facilities, is kept very natural and is clean. Animals appear to be in good shape and cared for. It's located in Prague 7 and quite easily reachable with public transport. Worth visiting, you should calculate with a minimum of 3 hours to see everything.
Great ZOO. Interesting place to visit, great for kids, wide selection of animals, elephants are the best! Be prepared to spend there the whole day.

Good Zoo. This Zoo was very nice. There are a lot of animals to see, but word of caution. Be prepared to CLIMB, CLIMB, CLIMB! Most of the zoo is uphill. You will get a real work out in, but there are a lot of animals (including big cats) to see. Plenty of vending machines places to get water and soda.

Under Construction. Zoo Praha had a lot to offer, and a lot still under construction. I also recommend visiting the Zoo later in the morning, as we went very early and many of the animals had not been released into their exhibits yet. There was a wide range of primates to see, and a lovely Hippo set up. The Zoo isn't the easiest to navigate, so I would definitely pick up a map (and wear comfy shoes as the terrain is varied). Take advantage of the wonderful restaurants that have gardens and great views! Beer is also available at the Zoo for adults that crave to quench their thirst.
amazing but no english. good- lots of animals, horse riding for kids, special kids petting farmbad- not many exhibits in English, lots of crowd on weekends.

Big and nice zoo. Visited the zoo as a couple. Big area and a wide selection of animals. Lots of restaurants and toilets. Bus from Holesovice went right to the gate of the zoo. I would deffinetly recommend also to couples without kids :)

Huge and varied zoo. We were a little unlucky with the weather because it started to rain hard practically the moment we got inside, but this is a zoo well worth visiting. The animals often have a lot of space and the terrain is varied. There is even a chair-lift that you can use to get up to the top of the hill for an extra CHF 1.-- (entrance fee to the zoo is about CHF 10.--). There are unusual combinations too. For example, in the Feline House you can see a number of tigers and other smaller cats but also reptiles, which makes a change from the habitual homogeneity. So if you like animals, go for it.

Awesome place not just for kids. Allow a full day to visit, take your time, do not rush. And go on a sunny day, as most exhibits are outdoor and they are spaced away from each other, so be prepared for some walking as well. If possible, go by public transportation and not by car, as access to parking lots tends to be jammed on busy (read: sunny) days. Or take a boat trip from downtown Prague to add an extra to your day out. If you are in Prague for an extended period of time, go repeatedly in different seasons. There are always things to see.

Excellent. People say it's a great day out for kids, but me and my partner are both 21 and we loved every second of it. Best zoo I've been to and great value for money! Recomend doing this during your visit at prague, will not disappoint.

Very good. This is an excellent zoo which is well worth visiting if you are in Prague. It's big. I spent nearly 6 hours there and still didn't see everything. There are various cafes selling snacks, coffee and beer and plenty of toilets so you can take your time wandering around. It's not expensive.Getting there is easy, take the Metro to Nadrasi Holsovice then catch the No 112 bus to the Zoo. If you don't know how to buy transport tickets look on Youtube. I particularly liked the indoor exhibitions, especially the one with the Bats flying around. One flew so close that its wing touched my head. I spent half an hour watching the Otters and the Tigers were amazing.If I ever visit Prague again I will definately go back to the Zoo.

Whole day visit. Prague Zoo is quite large and nice and if you plan to visit it allocate whole day for it. As there are about 70% of exhibitions outside pavilion buildings go there if the weather is sunny and warm.

One of the best attractions in Prague. Prague Zoo is one of the best attractions in Prague.
Summer is coming; on a good summer day this is one of the place to be. Awesome

An Amazing Day Out!!. On the first day of our visit to Prague we went to the Zoo and didn't regret of any minute spent there! Many different animals who had plenty of space and didn't look very disturbed. Our highlights were gorillas and orangutans which we haven't seen before! Seen a snake swallowing a rat and even manage to film it! Another surprise was bats in the tropic house, they literally fly above your head!Few useful tips:The ticket cost is CZK 200 (about £6) for an adult and CZK 150 for kinds and students (international student cars are accepted)Getting there by public transport is easy- you take bus number 112 which stops at Nádraží Holešovice and it's final stop will be the Zoo. You can reach the bus station by metro or tram. For public transport we used this website a lot: http://jizdnirady.idnes.cz/praha/spojeni/The price of transport ticket would cost CZK32 per person one way.All additional information can be found on the Zoo website which is available in English.
Great day. Nice place to spend a whole or just a half of a day. If you are lucky for the weather. there are many animals and exhibits to see. good location and reasonable prices.

Very nice. Allow at least 2 hours to walk yourselves through this beautiful zoo. Lots of interesting animals, and plans as well. Try to catch the seal feeding which is very special. English information is very clear and concise.

Amazing place!. We took the boat to the zoo, which was lovely although not the most picturesque journey! We got the bus and metro back. The zoo itself is massive and we thought it was much better than London zoo. There is a big focus on conservation and helping to breed endangered animals and introducing them back into their natural environments. There are two levels to the zoo, you reach the top level by walking or getting the chair lift (which is really scary!!!). We saw loads of animals (for example: gorilla's, polar bears, elephants, tigers, seals, penguins, bison etc). Most of the info is written in Czech but there is a little bit in English. The restaurant near the top of the chair life is amazing! Really lovely pasta and pizza, much better than the food you usually get at these kind of tourist attractions. There is a lot of walking involved. If you have children, they provide cool little trucks that you can pull them around in!There are a few shops but they are tiny and they don't seem to sell anything that advertises the zoo which seemed odd? But overall we really recommend the zoo! Oh, and the views from the top level are amazing!

Best zoo we've been to for years. We were told about the zoo by a girl we met on the plane. It was fantastic. It's very big and has an amazing variety of animals. The reptile house was our favourite because they had dead rats for the snakes to eat and we watched one devour 2. The tigers were pretty amazing too because we were only a pane of glass aware from them - particular when one stopped by my side and began to roar. The zoo is on a main bus route - but be warned that people don't queue so it's a bit of a free-for-all at the bus station.
excellent value. superb place to visit for both children and adult alike--we had 4 hours there without even thinking about it.good bus service back to local metro station.

One of the best Zoos in Europe. It was bigger than I thought and most animals had more space than usual. It was rather easy to go there by underground and bus. Would recommend this to anyone who is ready to walk a lot and have a lovely day outdoors. We stayed here for 5 hours.

Ok.. The Zoo was ok, a fair choice of animals - great views of the city from on top of the hill by the Polar Bear enclosure, the one thing I would say - be mindful if you dont speak Czech, (we didnt expect everyone speaking fluent English but no one can speak english and no signs, maps etc are in English) this made getting food in the restaurant and gaining entry, finding our way around a bit of a challenge but all in all a good exprience but nothing special! Wouldnt visit again if we where to return to Prague.

Better than what we thought. We visited the zoo in March as we were in prague for 4 days. We werent sure what to expect from the zoo as we had heard different views.We were very suprised at the size of the zoo and it was bigger than what we thought. The cost of entry to the zoo was by far alot cheaper than what we would pay at home. When we got to the zoo we heard the awful story about the zoo being flooded a few years ago and alot of animals were drowned. The zoo was a mess and recieved donations from people to get itself back on its feet. Knowing this did make us appreciate the zoo more and the effort that the zoo has gone to.Being tortoise lovers we were a little disappointed that the tortoise area was closed due to being refurbed but there was enough animals there to see. The penguins were great and the monkeys were also good to watch. Theres alot of walking in the zoo and some up hill so make sure you have good shoes on.We spent 3-4Hrs in the zoo and saw nearly everywhere apart from some of the birds as we werent bothered about that.The eating places are an experience!!! We ate in the restaurant/cafe near the entrance which was like a school canteen. We couldnt really understand the menus as they werent in english but we pointed at the chicken and chips as we werent sure what the other food was. Very cheap food so we werent bothered, just dont expect anything flash.We would return to the zoo in the future, would be great to see how they improve even more areas after the flood. The animals looked well and being an animal lover i wasnt upset about how any of the animals were kept. Overall def worth a visit.
Wonders of Wonder. Special Attractions are Polar Bear's, Wolf's, Chimps, and many more.... the ambiance is excellent they need more animals to make it best

A fine Zoo that is worth visiting. This is a large zoo with a great variety of animals. It has suffered from flooding in 2012, but they are doing well to recover. We found the upper level most interesting. We must go back to explore further.

Excellent zoo, one visit is not enough. Beautiful and very extensive zoo park (about 60 hectars), with good access from the city centre (by tram and zoo bus) and beautiful view of Prague (the best is from the observation tower). It's very nice long walk, I personally always spend more then 4 hours there.The tickets are really cheap (200 Czech crowns - ca 7 EUR), there are lots of restaurants (reasonable prices, the staff is unfortunately sometimes not so kind,...) and kiosks, souvenir shops and playgrounds. There is around 5000 animals of 700 kinds.Animals have large compounds and there are not "behind bars", only windows, with lots of thematic pavilions, educational programs, etc. I would mostly recommend to visit the polar bears, hippo house, indonesian jungle, chambal pavilion, lemur island, giraffes, fur seals and penguin pavilions. It's a very good place not only for families with kids! Even dogs are allowed here, there is also a bike parking lot, etc. etc.One big disadvantage, no credit cards accepted here! (There is ATM though, at the entrance, so don't forget to get a cash).And ask for a map at the entrance, it's very useful :)

Very large and lots to see. The zoo is easy to get to via a tram and bus ride from the centre of Prague. Tickets are very cheap, just make sure you have coins to buy the tickets as the machines don't take notes. The zoo is vast so be prepared for lots of walking but the animals are amazing and there are some stunning views of Prague as the zoo is at the top of a hill. Would definitely recommend a visit.
Very Good. Very big place and although we were there in February many animals were out. Wear comfortable shoes as you will be doing a lot of walking , some uphill.

Cheap day out !. My wife and I visited here during a week in Prague. We checked online and it was really easy get there by train and then a short bus journey (the bus leaves from outside the station).We both really enjoyed it, it's been ages since we went to a zoo and we were both impressed, if you have kids go ! If you don't have kids go and take a break from the 'touristy bits !'

Best zoo!. We took a break from exploring the historical sites of Prague and took our 4yo to the zoo. Boy are we glad we did! It is amazing! Very well laid out, so many different kinds of animals, and the views of the city are spectacular! I highly recommend.

A zoo is a Zoo?. Well yes, but some are good and some no so good. This one was excellent and the animals had plenty of room and looked very well looked after. I liked the fact that these days, they don't have bars and cages but enormous windows so you can get so close to wild animals like tigers, lions and aligators that you are really within an inch of touching them. Its really good and for a day out it is hard to beat (providing you enjoy looking at animals).

Loved it. I love this zoo: it is one of the top 10 zoos in the world and they really deserve the high rank. I especially like their concept which enables to observe animals in their "natural" habitat (behind windows, not bars, or even walking among some of them). It is also baby friendly (there is a couple of playgrounds,mini zoo where kids can touch and feed some domestic animals, changing tables in public bathrooms, possibility to borrow a stroller, etc.). Good website too. The only con is food in the zoo, you are either stuck with fast food (bratwurst, hot dog and such) or you can eat at "Gocarovy domy" which offers good variety of restuarant-style food for reasonable prices but is - strangely enough - rather baby-unfriendly (no changing table, limited number of child stools, uncooperative waiters etc.). A good way how to solve this dilemma is to bring your own food in and have a picnic in designated areas :)

Brilliant. We came to Prague on short break and the zoo was one of the places we had arranged to come to.
Price was very reasonable for a tour that definitely needed 3-4 hours to walk round.
Could have brought the tigers home with me!!!!!

One of Europe´s better zoos. The zoo has improved a great deal in recent times in terms of the space and environment offered to the animals. It has also recovered from two serious floods within twelve years. Worth a visit by children as well as adults. Ideally avoid the weekends.

Massive Zoo. My intention was to walk to the zoo from Dejvicka but ended up get a bus for a few stops when it appear the pavement ran out. Then we took the little ferry boat across the river from V Podbabě to Podhoří, using Google Maps all the way. This boat cost the same as the buses and trams using the same ticket wtihin the time restriction.The entrance to the zoo was on the opposite to where the ferry drops you and so had to walk all the way around. When we got inside we found it to be a huge well laid out site. There's a lot of walking involved but it is well worth it. We particularly enjoyed the playing Polar Bears. They did seem to keep the tigers shut into a visitors viewing area rather then let them roam throughout the enclosure, not sure for how long.This place really is an all day thing, if you want to see everything.

Definitely worth a visit. Fantastic zoo, got tired walking to the top but it's definitely worth it. Give yourself a few hours to walk around because it's huge, we arrived at around 2 and still didn't quite manage to walk the whole of the zoo before it closed at 4! Loads of great animals, great place to take the kids, fantastic value, highly recommended.

Beautiful Zoo. We visited the Prague Zoo in March of 2014. We enjoyed our trip and you cannot beat the price (about $35 for a family of two adults and two children). You feel so close to the animals and we visited near feeding time so all of the animals were active and running around, which made the trip even more fun for my children!

Enjoyable day. I thoroughly enjoyed my couple of hours at Prague zoo and spent the majority of it running around the place like a big kid, however there were a lot of empty enclosures! No elephants or giraffes to be found, and I only saw one female lion! There are a lot of birds which are quite boring, but the tigers were beautiful :) Pretty easily accessible once you know where to go. A word of warning, there's a lot of walking to be done, steep hills as its halfway up a mountain!
the best. The best Zoo we have ever been to, by far!so much space, sp much to do, easy to get to and although very popular there was still loads of room to move around.Viewing panels are excellent

Beautiful zoo. Very nice and large zoo. Lots of animals to see to. Just realize that 95% of the information provided is in Czech, so no big chance of learning a lot. But still a great getaway from the city for about 3 hours. Easy to get to by public transport too. Just take bus 112 from station Nadrazi Holesovice.
Nice day. The zoo was clean and beautiful. The animals looked to be well. Ice bears were magnificent. Food was ok and cheep.

Very disappointing - where were all the animals?!. This was a real let down! Following all of the rave reviews on trip advisor & the admittedly low prices (about a fiver for me with my student card) this was such a waste of time! The zoo does have very large, well designed cages & enclosures- but everything is so far spaced apart it takes an age to walk from animal to animal! - But only half seemed to be there! The elephant enclosure was empty, as were the zebras, gorillas, lions & many more! I asked a member of staff where they were but he just shrugged and said 'eating inside away from public''. A real disappointment - oh & don't eat at the restaurant as soon as you enter- I found hairs in my food! Ugh!
