Penguins, kangoroos and "halusky". I went there with my kids and friends. We loved the penguins, kangoroos. The elephants and hipos have a new pavilion. There is a Jurkovic house (art deco style) as a restaurant with delicious "halusky" and no crowd - I can recommend!

Nice family day. Great place to spent with children. We have spent a great sunny Saturday there, we saw a wide range of animals etc. The cableway up to the hill was an adrenaline experience. You have there a good choice of boarding places with a standard quality.

Just Brilliant. Brilliant full day out, we could have done with 2 days here. Easy to access from central Prague. Amazing, affordable zoo, unlike UK Zoo's. Animal enclosures looked like great fun for the animals ,as well as the humans watching them. We visited on a sunny cold day in Feb, would love to visit in the summer. Will definately be back.

Better than expected!. Great zoo-lots of walking so be warned! But plenty of refreshment stalls and a massive variety of animals, the polar bears being our favourites by far! Worth strolling over the bridge though to the giraffes and meerkats! Average of 3 hours needed there and away from central Prague so took a taxi. Great morning out-well worth a try.
Great Zoo. This was a beautiful zoo nestled in the rocks and hills of the area. They took great care to keep the areas as natural as possible.

Happy animals!. Wow! This is the best zoo I have ever been to hands down. I have visited many zoos in the UK and this one beats every single one of them. The enclosures are vast and have been amazingly designed and planned out which really gives you a snapshot of the real-life habitats of the animals - this in turn enables the animals to truly behave in the way that they instinctively should! I have read some reviews from small-minded, selfish and heartless people on here actually complaining that the enclosures are 'too big!' and as a result they couldn't see the animals - quite the opposite actually, i saw every one of them up-close and behaving in a happy and natural way. The animals just looked 'happy and contented' - something i can't really explain but compared to London Zoo which is diabolical, it was amazing and the way a zoo should be. the zoo is full of long, winding hilly walks with AMAZING views of Prague city, excellently clean and tidy with flawlessly clean amenities. There were people constantly cleaning and sweeping. The food and drink is also cheap - as is the actual entrance fee - 200kc (about £5)! Compare this to £18 for london zoo where bottles of coke there are no less than £3. The indoor enclosures and walk-throughs were excellent too. I would Highly recommend the visit - don't be put off by journey either - its cheap and easy to get to and from. From the old town its 2 stops on the red metro line then a short bus ride (every 10 mins), clearly marked 'zoo' outside the station.

Great. I ve heard a lot about it and definitely, I was not dissapointed. We went there just after the floods, so the ZOO was still recovering but even if it is the information side or the amount of animals, it s really great. Do go, no matter you do have or do not have kids :)

Fantastic. We went here for my husbands 30th, we took the metro and then the bus to the entrance, was really easy to get too!There are so many animals to see and enclosures to look at. i was especially taken with the polar bears!The zoo wasnt advertised anywhere in prague nor any leaflets in the hotels etc. Im glad we came here though! The only negative would be that theres alot of walking between enclosures / attractions.

It has it all and some....... From Rome, Monaco, Munich and New York. This Zoo has it all. From the standard expectations of lions and tigers and bears ;). But above and beyond that it has things you will have never seen before. Half rat and kangaroo, a shoebill (craziest, scariest bird i have ever seen) amongst loads more that i cannot describe) dont write this of as 'another zoo' as i almost did. Its only 3 pounds each and we spent 3 hours there. Well worth the money and its easy to get to via the tram and bus (not as difficult as you may think and we are useless with public transport) Have a great time. I hope this was helpful!

One of the best zoos in the world. I visit Prague zoo a few times a year. As I have seen a few zoos all around the world I can honestly say this one is one of the best. Great for visitors, especially families (and dogs as well), great for animals. The zoo participates in many scientific reintroduction projects, especially of its heraldic animal - Przewalski's horse. What is really unique about Prague zoo in world context is the fact how beautifully it is integrated into landscape of Troja district - ibex rocky slope and african savanna are my personal favourites. Worth a whole day trip. Highly recommended!

Don't miss it!. It was one of places that you must visit in Prague ... It was an amazing experience for the entire family ... Unfortunately it was raining that day, we couldn't stay longer but the time we spent there was quality time .. Had several memorable pictures

worth it for any age. I went with a group of friends when we were briefly living in Prague, and while several of them weren't particularly excited about spending a day at the zoo when we set out, every single one had changed their minds pretty quickly once we got there. It is pretty big, so reserve a whole day if you want to see most of what's there. And plan accordingly when you get your zoo map, because the only food on the far side is the chalet and there is quite a wait.
Great zoo. So much to see and very clean. Easy to access by the bus system. My kids love zoos and this one did not disappoint!

A very nice zoo. We visited New year so it was very cold and not all the animals were around, but the ones that were out and about were very pleasing. especially the gorillas complete with baby. We spent about four hours here but on a nice day you could spend much longer, children will love it. price is very reasonable compared to uk zoos. It suffered really badly in the floods a few years ago and there are pictures and reminders dotted around to show this, which makes this places comeback even more remarkable. we used public transport from Prague again so cheap and easy to find. Door to door.

Amazing zoo. We loved this place. On initial inspection it looked as though many of the animals weren't out, but we were not disappointed. The animals were amazing and the benefit of a cold January day meant we didn't have to wrestle crowds to see everything. The giraffes were amazing as we're the huge hippos and baby gorilla. We didn't get to see it all on a day and would definitely go back. The only thing that let it down was the staff service in the food hall, unhelpful and almost rude, but even that didn't dampen our day. Can't wait to return and £20 for a family of 4, an absolute bargain.

Excellent value for money. The entry fee was only approx £6 each. Even the on site restaurants were reasonably priced. (Although I don't know if this would change in peak season). There is a great variety of animals to see ranging from snakes to polar bears and everything inbetween!
Best zoo. This was the best zoo we have ever been too and we have been to a lot of zoos around the world. Great for kids! Huge habitats, lots of baby animals.

Prague zoo. Loved the openness of many of the animal exhibits. Easy access from the subway and bus that drops you at the zoo and picks you up at the same location. Mass transit is not expensive. We especially loved the giraffes. This zoo has an excellent reputation in Europe.
Great Zoo. Well worth a visit, I go there often with my Daughter, she loves itIt was damaged in floods last year and in 2002, better flod defences neded to protect this great place and the animals

Successful trip out!. Myself and my partner had a lovely day out in the zoo for my birthday. We paid our entry fee and walked straight in.A lot of the first few enclosures were empty which makes sense because it was off-season, but we soon came round to a large magnificent Avery which has an open viewing platform.Following round we came across countless types of animals such as ducks, large birds, pelicans, flamingos, tigers, lions, other miscellaneous cats, polar bears, insects, badgers - an entire section dedicated to Africa and much much more.Lighting in a lot of the zoo isn't very photo friendly if you are trying to take photographs of the animals as there is a lot of fencing and glass reflections that get in the way.Overall a lovely day out.
great zoo. Near the prague center, good location, Troja(i think). A lot of animals, it is in a hill, so you can even use a special tow to get up, whole looking at the animals. Nice to visit !

Awesome. I took the kids here for the day whilst my wife and mother in law had a day shopping. Its easy to get to on the metro and then a bus and is a must see attraction (if you have kids who like zoos!). Its well kept, clean, well organised and has some great animals and well thought out enclosures.

Worth a visit!. We decided to visit the zoo on our last day in Prague. It was well worth going there. We paid the equivalent of £7 each for the day. It's well laid out with countless animals to view. It's a shame they don't provide maps but there are several large 'you are here' type maps in the zoo but they're not very clear and in no other language apart from Czech. That said though it didn't hinder the experience too much. Our favourite was in with Gorillas. It's indoors and amazing watching them. We also enjoyed the tigers, leopards etc. the indoor area with the monkeys etc was brilliant too. I will say if it was a sunny day the experience would of been ten times better as it was 20th December and overcast and cold and the zoo would of been more appreciated with the benefits being able to take the animals in more instead of being more concerned about the weather

Very popular!. We went on a sunny day and got there about 30 min after it opened - there were already 400+ people through the gate - by time we left 3 hours later there had been 2500+ !This zoo was great - even though some of the animals had been put away for the winter. The polar bears were just great - playing like little kids! The zoo is pram (buggy) and wheelchair friendly BUT there is a steep hill right in the middle so you should consider this if it's going to be an issue.The animals were all well kept and cared for - many were interactive which is greatThe zoo is very easy to get to by public transport - a train then bus for us - but it was all very well sign posted (the zoo stop is featured on the metro line maps) and when you get to the metro stop the bus stop is very clear.This zoo is well worth the visit - even in winter

Probably Avoid in Winter. When possible, we visit zoos wherever we are and are often pleasantly surprised by the experience. This was the case last month with the Jerusalem Zoo - awesome experience and great zoo. Not so much with Prague Zoo. It was about 6 C/43 F today and other than polar bears and elephants, animals were either not out or huddled against a fence to keep warm. The zoo did not give us free maps (minimal cost, but still a first) and the zoo is not language friendly outside of native tongue. Two of the elephants look very old and both just kept wobbling their heads back and forth. I'm not a veternarian or elephant whisperer, but this behavior seems to indicate they were either not happy or had pachyderm onset dementia. Bottom line, if you love zoos, it's a zoo and worth it if the city bores you terribly...otherwise, I recommend passing.

Good day for the kids. Having read earlier reviews I was expecting big things and was a little disappointed. The polar bear and the owls were highlights and we were fortunate to see them. Yes it's hilly but I thought that was enjoyable, especially as the site lent itself to some great views. A lot of animals were not visible as it's cold but that's not the zoo's fault. On the downside I didn't think the enclosures were that great and I felt so sorry for those poor Australian birds, especially the magpie who was clearly distressed - on the other hand the emu looked quite happy. Our big mistake on the day was having lunch afterwards at one of the restaurants at the entrance, it was the one that was not accessible by steps at the front. Food was woeful, slow to come and cold when it arrived. One other disappointment was the zoo shop - comprised overpriced stuffed animals.

Nice ZOO in a hilly place. We visit this ZOO every year in December and this year we were lucky to get there on Monday before Christmas Eve when the entrance fee was just CZK 1 - so it was quite crowded. Some animals are moved to a safer place, away from the river due to floods. Comparing ZOO Gardens in other large cities (Vienna, Munich), Prague ZOO is situated in quite a hilly area, you have to go up and down quite often, quite demanding in terms of physical condition.

Great value!. Entrance to this Zoo is much less than you would pay in most places, making this excellent value. The zoo site is huge and most of the enclosures are spacious. The animals we saw all seemed to be content. The site is hilly and there is a lot of walking, but there were great panoramic views of Prague from the top! We were not too impressed with the food, which was inexpensive, but just not to our taste, so if we went again, would either take food with us, or wait and eat once back in town. We only tried one restaurant though, so we may have just been unlucky. It was very easy to get to the zoo using the metro and then a bus (well signposted and easy to navigate). We would definitely visit again.

Lovely zoo.... go by tube & bus it's easy!!. Loved the zoo...we went as a family and it was a lot of walking but worth it!!!! Also, the food is not expensive at all in their restaurants!! The price: 2 adults and 1 child was cheaper than 1 adult ticket for London zoo!!!!
Excellent day out. Easy to get to with public transportExcellent exhibits Worth a visitYou can take your dog to this zoo if you are lucky enough to be travelling with your best friend!

definitely worth to visit!. It is a place in Prague worth to visit; it is very easy to reach vis Metro and bus.
The surrounding is very nice; the workers in the zoo put a lot of effort for the animals.
It will take a whole day for you to visit this lovely zoo, no matter for couple or family.
nice !!!!!. even in witer you get to see loads of animals, there are bistrost with hot vine on the way, only the lift was not working so we had to walk up the hill.

happy mondays!. Big zoo, but because it was winter we didnt see a lot animals. The ticket was 290ck but when we went to pay they charged us 1ck!!!! The reason? It was a monday and thats the price they have on mondays! That was just perfect! Dont miss the zoo!

Wonderful Zoo. This is simply a great zoo,A wide variety of animals, most of them in extremely natural-looking surroundings and looking pretty happy.I go to the zoo at least twice a year, sometimes with my grandson, sometimes with adult guests. I have never had a disappointing visit yet. Each time someting different stands out - the polar bears swimming just yards away, the sheep and goats climbing almost sheer rock faces, the bats flying inches above your head, ... . If I have guests coming to this beautiful city for only three or four days, they are sometimes surprised when I tell them I am taking them to the zoo. Once they have been, they understand why.

BEST ZOO I'VE BEEN TO!. I hadn't done my research for this zoo, so was expecting an average experience. I was absolutely shocked when we turned up and it was so AMAZING!!! A trip we expected would take a few hours took the whole day and I still don't think we quite saw it all. Also, (from my experience of zoo ticket prices in England) £8 entry?! How do they manage that? Incredible value for money!!The zoo is built into the side of a mountain so the gradient of the whole zoo is quite extreme, this is not a zoo for the less physically able. But they do have a really cool chairlift to get you from the bottom to the top (or vice versa) in the centre of the park. I have never seen such a wide variety of animals in one place before. The polar bears took my breathe away. The tropical world, African world, bird world, night-creatures world etc etc.. all were fantastic and in winter, a nice break from walking around in the cold. However, most of the eating places we discovered were outdoors (apart from the big restaurant at the entrance) so bring your hats and gloves!! I have never seen these animals so close-up either. We got very near to some amazing crocodiles, hippos & gorillas. There were some gorilla babies on display and they were so cute & easy to watch from multiple viewing platforms! The zoo was also a fantastic example of how to give animals the space and habitat they require without compromising the experience for tourists. You felt the animals came first in this zoo, which was most pleasing, yet we still saw everything. Incredibly well thought out.I have read some people didn't see the polar bears- we went round to that enclosure three times and only one time they were not available for viewings. I think you've got to be lucky there, but two out of three times was good.DEFINITELY go to the zoo in Prague on your visit, whether you have kids or not! It also offers fantastic views over Prague from high vantage points, if the animals aren't enough to tickle your fancy!

World class zoo. I'm a zoo lover. I go to zoos in almost every city I visit, from San Diego (best in the world?) to London to smaller cities like Oakland or Knoxville. The Prague Zoo is certainly in the top five! A great location on the side of a hill, overlooking the city's main river, it has animals unique compared to most zoos (such as the only collection of primitive horses) to wonderful layouts for its hippos and elephants to excellent restaurants (a rarity at zoos) that are not overpriced. Good maps for English speakers and most displays have at least some English explaining the animals. It was so good, I went there two days. Allow at least 4 hours just to see it; better to spend six hours and have lunch there.

Most beautiful ZOO I have ever seen. This ZOO was elected 7th most beautiful ZOO in the world and I can see why. I am sensitive about animals beeing hold in captivity, but here i didnt feel like that. Everything is so cool and build as close to animals natural environment as possible. Everything is new, not older than few years and its great maintained. They have a lot of rescue animals, helping them have a better life. Recently they also opened this huge area for elephants, which is REALLY cool. All the animals have enough room and you dont have to feel bad for them. The ZOO is so big you can easily spend all day in there. And all these cool pavilions made like a jungle and tropic forests. The bats fly around you and stuff like that. Its great.
Pleasant place for trip. We were here just to relax and see something new. Very well made ZOO with many interesting animals and atractions. Esspecially the cable car is funny :-)
Polar bear melted during winter . Dissapointed not being able to see some animals (I.e. Polar bears, Siberia tigers, lion, and etc) They were taking leave or went for winter holiday

Great zoo, but lower your expectations during winter. We spent all day at this zoo with our 3 kids during December. The zoo is huge and very well laid out. The animal exhibits and displays are fantastic. This zoo ranks as one of the best we have visited. However, if you are visiting during the winter, you need to lower your expectations. Many, many of the animals were not out. I would guess that the about half of the animals could not be seen because of the cold weather. We still had fun walking around the zoo and I would highly recommend this to others. We would go again if we were ever in Prague again.
Progressive Zoo. Clearly many improvements have been made in recent years and others are planned. Most enclosures now genuinely excellent. Compared to British zoos offers exceptional value for money.

Wonderful day at the Zoo. My husband and I decided to try something different on our second trip to Prague. We decided to visit the Praha Zoo on a suggestion by a friend, we were glad we did! It was very easy to get to, take the Metro C to stop Nadrazi Holesovice then bus 112 to the Zoo stop. All staff were extremely friendly. We did not expect to see as many animals there as we did and even in December they all seemed to be out and playful. My husband even commented that he thought we had seen more animals here than at our own Zoo in our hometown! We would definitely suggest the Zoo as a place to visit! We had a great time!

Great zoo, easier to get to than you might think. We - two parents and 18 year old son - spent about 3 hours here today and really didn't see everything. It was around 40 degrees F, not too bad, and we all really enjoyed it.To get there by public transportation, you have to get to Station Holešovice (via Metro line A or one of several trams including the #24) and then take bus 112. That sounds like a hassle but it was really easy. We ate at Černohouska – Pizzeria Panino Nera. A 120k Margherita pie fed 3 of us and was delicious. With table service and a clean modern bathroom. Amazing.

Great zoo. Easy to get to. Lots to see. My girlfriend and I ventured to the zoo from the centre of Prague. Was easy to get to. The zoo is huge and takes a few hours to get around. We went in December. It snowed! Saw almost all the animals. Had a great meal part way through for a really cheap price. We were almost the only ones there but everything was open. Great day out.

One of the best zoos in Europe. What a fantastic place! If you're going to Prague, do not miss the zoo! We spent four hours there last week in the wind and snow and had such a great time. All of the snack and drinks stalls were open, along with all of their restaurants. The staff are lovely and friendly, food is fresh and delicious. Everything is very cheap (entrance, souvenirs, snacks) and despite the cold weather we only missed out on a few animals. The gorillas had babies playing around, the deer were great to watch. It is spacious and very well looked after, I'd love to go again.

Perfect. I used to visit Prague Zoo very often.It is located in very nice hills in Troja and walk through is really very pleasant. I love animals and there is lot of kinds.Big mammals,variously monkeys,lot of girafes and other animals.One thing I must say.I have a big favourite and it is a Richard a big gorila male.It is a really very strong personality.Prague Zoo is worth to visit,leave a day for it.
Where are all the animals?. i was there, but almost didn't see animals, some places where close due maintenance, others had nothing in the cave, probably felt shy..
The best zoo I have been to. A huge zoo. Wonderful to walk around and lots of different animals. Well worth a vist.Wonderful views of the city

Impressive zoo with wonderful gorillas. This is a world class zoo. It is obvious that the staff care greatly for the animals. The outside areas for the animals were very good, albeit that most of the animals were in their inside quarters when we visited, being a cold November day. The gorillas were wonderful, especially the two young ones who kept us entertained for ages as they played chase with each other. Good facilities. Please support it by visiting.

Wonderful!!!. I absolutely loved this zoo!! The lay out is lovely, although you do a lot of walking, you end up seeing the animals from different angles, their enclosures are large and most of the animals seemed very entertained and content.The zoo opens at 10, closes at 4 and you definitely need to get in there early if you want to see everything at your leisure!

You can't eat if you want to pay with Euro or with credit card...... We wisited the Zoo on 19th of November .The location and the place is beautyful and there are many exotic animals in big sort.The zoo is really in nature and perfectly cleaned.It was our last day in Prague with my little daughter and my 70th years old Mother .We really enjoyed the zoo but when we become hungry we got an unpleasant experience .We wanted eat something in the zoo but nower accepted Euro or credit card !I don't know why ..... I thoght this zoo visited by lot of turists and Prague also a part of the EU.So we had to finished our visit earlyer than we planed ......

Beautiful place for kid's birthday. A big area with lots of animals and places loved by kids. There are a lot of attractions for kids and grownups: polar bears, penguins, elephants, giraffes, owls, reindeer, etc. The kids can ride a horse, or play on slide.

Rated one of the best in the world - Can see why. So you have to take the underground(metro) to Holesvice station then take bus 112 to the Zoo gates. Its extremely cheap and even cheaper if you have a student card (around £4.00) The Zoo is very big and built on hills so it does take a while to see everything and you end up walking alot but, as stated on most reviews, the enclosures are nice and the animals seem to have plenty of room and for some reason, seem quite active too! The gorillas and polar bears seem to be the big hits but a nice day visit and really easy to get to and from.
recommanded!. not only for children!nice day trip (like half a day)!but there is a part of the zoo that closed for renovations.tip- get there by bus!
Nice place to spend a day with kids. Very nice zoo, lots of animals kept in good conditions.Lots of both locals and tourists, so sometimes there's lack of parking places.

Elephants... Oh my!!. The baby elephant was so, so cute!! There are many animals and exhibits, but some of them are empty (I'm assuming because of the flooding in Prague during the summer). Worth a visit because it is fun and quite cheap -- a student ticket was about 7USD.

Lives up to the hype.. We visitied this zoo recently and were not disappointed. We spent about four hours wandering around and I still think we missed some bits. Most of the exhibits were quite well presented although there were still some that were in urgent need of updating, especially some of the smaller aviaries. There speciality apppears to be elephants and there has been no expense spared on this exhibit. Although I felt that some of the money spent on the peripherals to this site could have been better spent elsewhere.
Zoo to visit for sure. It is a very healthy way to keep animals and good to show to the kids. Even being an adult (38) I enjoy walking there with the family!

Wonderful zoo, definitely worth a visit.. Wonderful zoo with many animals to see. Very adequate entrance ticket price. Several cafes and souvenir shops on the territory. Easy to reach (by metro to Nadrazi Holseovice on red line and from there by 112 bus).

Where are all of the animals?. Visited the zoo in October 2013 and was a little disappointed, lots of animals missing including the huge tortoises. I'm guessing it's because its cold but they should let you know so you are aware of what to expect.

Mediocre zoo. Nice surroundings but thought most of the bigger animals had small living quarters, not all but many. Also it is quite an uphill walk to see everything. There are some free wifi areas and vending machines throughout the park. There are some of the most common zoo animals but quite a few are missing I would say.

Hit by flood but being rebuilt. The Prague Zoo was hit again by 2013 flood. Its nice to show support by taking your family there and help to rebuilt it by paying the small ticket they ask. Sure, there are bigger, nicer ZOOs around the world but being patriotic I take my boy there every year we visit Prague.They have a great herd of elephants and other animals, adjacent climbing stone area for kids,nice eating areas and architectonically interesting little restaurant on top of the hill. The visit makes a nice day out for the kids. Some areas are closed due to water damage and are being cleaned and rebuilt. The Zoo gets busiest during weekends and state and school holidays in July/August.

It was a fun day. It truly is one of the best sights in Prague- a heaven for animal lovers. The area of the zoo is vast so even in cages; these animals seem to be very happy being in natural surroundings. Some parts though were closed as part of reconstruction work which was going on to make for the losses caused by the flood in Vltava River. So missed on some part. Some rare species of spiders and other reptiles were amazing so are the other animals including the polar bear, elephants, wolves and many more. It was a nice experience in Prague. Will surely return next time.

A must visit for all. If you have seen really good zoos then you could miss, but the whole Troja region in Prague is worth a visit. The zoo is beautiful to say the least, esp their whole dedicated space for elephants, pony rides for kids, chair lift and the seals. You can get free trolleys or prams for kids right at the entrance. Consider spending about 3-4 hours there atleast.
Meh. you can pass it, just a average zoo, nothing special and pretty far from the city center.can be a lot of fun for childern.
Great value. Less than £10 for a day at the zoo. Baby seal, elephant, gorilla and giraffes. Very enjoyable and easily accessed using the metro and bus systems.
The original pedestrian bridge. The inevitable crowds manage to add to the atmosphere. Well preserved but not over preserved it still gives the feeling of age and history.
Fun for the children. Nice and fun activity for the children to do in Prague. You can take the boat there from the center. The Zoo is nice and there is a lot to see.

Mixed feelings. I have a lot of mixed feelings about this place.The zoo itself and its location both are beautiful.It is on top of a hill and you get a super view of prague from here.The zoo itself is really niceley designed and decorated. It is also huge.The problem during my visit was that half of the animals were not there.1/4 of the zoo was empty due to water damage because of a flood.Another 1/4 seemed to somehow not be there and the rest of the animals seemed all to have problems in the head due to small spaces or boredom. Also the elephants have blood marks on the ears probably from electro shocks and many animals show similiar behaviour to people locked up in isolation cells for months. Not sure what to think.It could be the 7 th best zoo IF all animals were there and did not show sign of any problems. Too expensive for 1/2 empty zoo.

Ok experience. Prague Zoo is first and foremost very, very big! It took us a good while to walk around the whole zoo, and this was still when it was under restoration after the floods! It's a cool zoo, with heaps of different animals. The restaturants and food offers are not that great, and they barely spoke any English, so we had troubles getting decent food. If you plan a whole day at the zoo, then bring some food. As there are so many things to do in Prague, and if you're short on time I wouldn't waste my time getting out of the city to the zoo. All in all an ok experience, but I've definitely experienced better zoo's, and I've been to quite a few.

Pictoresque place. Note the tickets are not cheap but You will not regret. Very nice and friendly place with variety of animals. You can walk and watch on the many park alleys. There are many place to seat and rest.

A great day out. The zoo was still recovering from the floods during our visit but there was plenty to see. Entry is extremely cheap compared to Australian zoos. This is a very large zoo with plenty of places to eat or get snacks. The animals are very well cared for in large open enclosures. Getting there from the center of Prague is easy by train and then bus, very cheap too if you get a day ticket.
even in October still very good. really nice day in the ZOO ith my bussines partner !!!! had a greal meal there and saw loads of animalls

Made the mistake of visiting with a zoologist!. So I visited Prague with an old drinking buddy, forgetting that he had a degree in natural history. Whoops. So off to the Zoo we go... It's also worth noting that another friend came with us who had previously said that he hates zoos as he doesn't like seeing animals cooped up, and he specifically said that if he felt uncomfortable he'd leave.Ok, so we enter, realise we don't have a map, then have to go and buy one for 5kr. Then we hand everything over to Greg and follow him around.I don't think that a blow-by-blow account is perhaps useful, but let's try some highlights and lowlights.Highlights:The bird enclosures which visitors can actually enter through a double-door. They're massive and even my mother - who hated seeing caged birds - wouldn't mind them.Plenty of places to have real refreshments. I think I counted five real restaurants/cafes. Not like in the UK where this stuff would be an afterthought or a ripoff.The two-level hippopotamus enclosure was great - basically one wall is glass so the hippos can be observed underwater as well as over water.The whole environment was open, airy, large and pleasant.LowlightsNot many really but it would have been nice for the chairlifts to be open. I suspect it was too windy for them on the day we visited.This is actually my second visit to Prague Zoo - the first was aborted about three years ago as I had a twisted knee and painful walking finally got the better of me. This time, we walked and walked and walked - there must be several miles of walking tracks here - and I'm very glad we did.The verdict from my zoologist friend? "Excellent". We concur.

Part of it closed.. We would have really enjoyed the zoo but part of it was closed off due to a flood they had the week before. I'm sure if there wasn't a flood that damaged part of the zoo, I would have given it an "Excellent" rating. That is why I gave it an "average" rating.
The Best Zoo in Europe. The Prague Zoo is just an amazing park with animals, nice trip, lots of different animals, baby elephant Sita, giraffes, horses of Prevalsky
Amazing elephant valley. The most beautiful elephant paddock I've ever seen, very tasy refreshments for reasonable price. Just a too much of visitors on Saturday, I recommend a visit ZOO another day.

very big zoo. recommended. The zoo has many animals,but since it is winter time, some animals were hiding in their homes and did not go out. I am not mad about the zoo or rhe animals, you just need consider that some animals are not active in low temperatures.prices are reasonable.

Great place for children and adults. This zoo is worth visiting and is very reasable price compare with other zoo@s in Europe so do not miss out which is a grreat opportunity to visit on a nice day. There are lot of well kept animals whcih surley you need a whole day to see.

Had a Great Time. Went to the Zoo while visiting Prague. Very fun Zoo, not a lot of exotic animals but the layout is fun, be prepared to walk up a hill as the ride to the top and the lower half of the Zoo was closed due to the flooding this summer.Also, note that if you take the subway you will need to get on a local bus from the metro station to the Zoo entrance.

Great refreshment for Prague sights. A perfect day out of hectic, watching animals and having fun! The elephants were marvelous. It's a pity, part of the zoo was closed in September due to the damage, caused by Vltava flood. Anyhow, the "must see" for those spending in Prague more than three days. Don't forget to visit Troy palace & botanical garden nearby.

Highlight of Prague. This was the best day out I had in Prague. Very big zoo. Definitely need the whole day. Bit too many birds though. Also, I'm an animal lover and my eyes filled up a little looking at some of them. Eg. The gorilla sat there staring out at everyone staring at him. I believe they know what's going on. He looked very sad and bored. I love tiger so was excited to see them. When I went to them. They were in different areas. In one the tiger paced back and forth at the back wall constantly between two gates. (Must be where he's fed or when he gets to go inside) I came back 2 hours later and he was doing the exact same thing... Over and over again. The polar bears kept doing repetitive things for ages too. It was very sad. The flood happened not long ago so some animal areas were empty. Still a great zoo to go to none the less. It just broke my heart a little. Oh and you can feed goats which is great fun. Just beware of the crazy black one. Kept ramming into me haha. The whole zoo is fantastic value

Not just for animal lovers. This could've been the highlight of Prague for me. You can get so close to the animals, there's even a section where you have birds and monkeys flying around you! There were feeding times so we saw the cats being fed which was fascinating. Not only that but it's a beautiful walk, as it's very high up and you can see across Prague city at certain parts. I really think this is the best zoo I've ever visited.
lots of animals. Lots of animals, but cages are sometimes small and many animals seem to be sad.When I was there there was quite a lot of construction works going on so I hope it's better now.

A day at the Zoo. It is a large and very nice zoo and it looked as if the animals had a good life. There were several places to eat and drink and it was not expensive. You may need a whole day to get around the whole zoo

One of the best European Zoos. I have been to a number of ZOOs in Europe and can definitely say that this one is one of the best. What I extremely like is the vast territory of the zoo - most of the areas are open spaces where animals feel as if they were in a natural surrounding. Even if the animals in are in cages, they are so big you feel no pity for the poor things. You can tell that the animals are well looked after and fed. For children it is amazing - they have lots of teaching sessions there, descriptions etc. And many many various spieces from all over the world. What is worth doing is taking a chairlift to the top - it will give you a great view of the zoo and the Vltava river. I lived in Prague for 5 years and this Zoo was one of my most favourite weekend places.

loads of baby animals. a brilliant day out i was amazed at how close you could get to some of the animals and loved seeing all the baby animals that were there, a great day for zoo lovers and a family day out

Best zoo I've ever visited. The Prague's zoo is wonderful: No so many people, a lot of different kind of animal, the aquatic animals swimming in a big pools with glass where you and/or your children can try to touch a polar bear, penguin or seal. Cable chair to go up and down from the highest point to down or up, different kind of meals in each bar, showers in each area to help you to due a hot day or wheelchair ways around all the zoo to visit every point without problems.But the most amazing place is lemur's environment... Let's go to discover!

Family friendly. I liked the park very much, they have all the animals you want to see.. from spiders to Penguins and elephants.But, i was a bit worried when a saw some animals just walk Walking on and on in the same pattern in small Cages, they looked kind of under stimulated..

Big Zoo!. A very big, nice Zoo. Some parts are still closed from the flooding so off limits. These are the cages birds areas so you can see all the big animals still. We spent about 3-4 hours there and I think only saw about half of the Zoo. Very good value, Polar Bears are a sight! Food was nice and cheap also, only 175czk for two beers and two plates of meat and pickles. 200 to get into the Zoo which is a bargain in my opinion.

The Most Wonderful Zoo. This is the best zoo I have even been to. You can spend all day here and you will not get bored!!!
Animals are amazing, nature and whole system how this zoo works is remarkable.
TIP: You should visit zoo during the week (less people). Take one day off and enjoy it till you are really tired!

Hard to see it all, easy to get lost. We took the zoo bus, rather cramped, but gets you to the entrance.The zoo itself was very uneven, there were some nice exhibits, but as you have to climb to some of them it was rather tiresome. We couldn't see it all, and in the end we were just looking for the exit, which was hard, as none of the signs were in English. After visiting the zoo in Berlin this was rather disappointing, (I know the comparison is not exactly fair, but it's inevitable). If you go with small children or older people take into account the ups and downs of the circuits.

If you have a spare day.... Zoo Praha is a nice zoo. I bet it was much nicer before the flood hit. But still if you have a spare day, you can visit and have good time there. Seeing (especially) the Singapore Zoo before, kept my expectations so high that I haven't liked it too much. In addition some animals were definitely seemed very sad and that may broke your heart too.Nevertheless, nice place to spend a spare day, very cheap compared to other zoos and the food is good.

2-3 hours is not enought. If ZOO, so then this ZOO! Cool. From cash desk till last souvenir shop. We was there last august weekend: its means lot of peoples cause after this children starts in Czech republic new school year. Its was amazing to see how briliant they manage lines from cash desk: 300 m of waiting people are moving in 5 min! And you are in: left food courts and water animals, right walk to hill on top you see polar bears, Brazilian pavilons, real Africa exhibitions etc. Then cool Elephant walley-amazing. So, you need minimum 1 day for this visit, ideal is 2 days. If you want you take self picture directly from Elephant walley and sent anywhere via mail:)

POLAR BEARS!. POLAR BEARS! The zoo was spread out, lots of animals to see, even with the snow being a few inches deep. Quite easy to get lost in the zoo which made for a great 6 hours.The zoo however isn't in central Prague but a bus takes you right outside the entrance.

Trip to the ZOO. It was really very good ,it covers a very large area ,with a fair bit of walking to see everything.Lot of it is very new following the Prague floods some years ago. There is no shortage of refreshment fascilities or toilets.

Fun for the whole family!. We go here often and it's a favorite place to go to bring families that have never been. There is so much to see and the animal exhibits are usually clean and well done. I love the otters and polar bears! My boys love the wolves and the monkeys. My girls love the penguins and peacocks that roam around the zoo free!

Great zoo. We enjoyed a lovely day wondering round the zoo set on the hillside. Access to the zoo was easy using public transport which cost less than the equivalent to £1, zoo admission price was also very good compared to UK zoos. Some of the zoo is still under reconstruction after the floods but this did not detract from the experience. We have visited many zoos across the world and I thought the elephant enclosure was the best I've seen anywhere. Although we didn't have any small children with us the zoo was very family orientated from the small buggies to transport youngsters in to the reasonably priced and delicious ice-cream.
Gorgeous baby gorilla.. Not good for anyone with mobility problems, all exhibits on a hill. Free shuttle from train station, good value, great exhibits.

A Very Good Zoo That Cares. My wife and I visited on our wedding anniversary and had a very good though very tiring time and were very impressed - and, with a son in the zoo trade you could say, and being British animal lovers, that is saying something. We made sure we got there early and at 9.45 we just beat the crowds and were immediately amazed by how extremely cheap it was to go in. By 3.30 we were very tired with aching feet ! The zoo covers a very big area over and around a small but steep hill with many animals having big enclosures - especially the Elephants. The animal environments are made to be totally natural for each occupant - so much so that this can be to the detriment to visitors trying to spot a small animal in its natural habitat ! The animals are also very healthy and happy - especially when we were there the mating elephants and the toddler gorilla and mother playing together !!!!!!. When we reached a café we were again amazed by the low prices of food and drink - not the rip-off prices we get charged at British top visitor attractions.Go early by bus or tram + bus - get a rest and a drink at noon - carry on and rest in the main refreshment area by the entrance/exit at the end and return by boat

Lovely ZOO!!!. Absolutely lovely zoo which is being updated in certain parts. Our only problem was it was heavy rain but we still went round for 4 hours and never got round all of it. Would be a great place to visit with lots of different animals to see especially on a nice sunny day. Very easy to get to as bus stops right outside it.
great day out!. great zoo - lots to do and see. only downside - Czech's do not get health and safety... diggers suddenly appear and run down walkways while everyone has to dive out the way!

nice one but we were not lucky. we took E bike from old town to the zoothe trip was wonderful but we arrived just 2 hours before they close. so most of the animals were sleeping. but it is a wonderful zoo and it worthtry to go from 11 or 12 to 3 or 4

Nice zoo but has a few drawbacks. Before I start the review, I will add that the zoo is still recovering from some flooding in June which caused a lot of damage and has led to some of the attractions and pens being closed. Before even entering the zoo I found the parking very difficult to find and we were 'wafted' by a staff member up a very steep slope which dismayed us as we had a disabled passenger. We eventually found another car park (by driving past the wafting man) which was on the level. The entry prices were excellent value, far cheaper than most zoo's in the UK. We paid 600kc (about £20) for a family ticket which covered 2 adults and 2 children. The car park cost an additional 100Kc.Now, for a word of warning! This zoo is built on the side of a very steep hill. Yes, there are little road trains which whizz around (be careful of wandering in front of them as they are pretty speedy) but I don't think they cover the whole area. I did see some parents with little wooden garden type trollies they must have hired to pull their offspring along - it was quite funny watching them hauling them up the hill. But if you are elderly, infirm or have a heavy pram or pushchair this may be a real problem. Oh, yes, there is a kind of chair lift which wasn't working but again this may only appeal to certain people.The other thing I think the zoo lacks is enough toilet blocks, we did see a couple of porta loos, but this may because some facilities were knocked out by the flood.We toiled up the hill with the prospect of having lunch providing us with the necessary energy. The restaurants were very small, very full and seemed quite understaffed. The menu was fairly limited but we managed to find something for each of us. What a surprise when the meal arrived! It was really restaurant style food, really tasty and good portions. The price was excellent, only £3-£4 for each main meal! Now for the main reason we were there. The animals! Some of the pens were quite small, especially for the bigger birds. They reminded me of Paignton Zoo many years ago when I was a child. But I think the work is ongoing in Prague to build better facilities for the animals. The elephant enclosure was wonderful and we enjoyed watching the hippo from under the water as it has glass walls in it's pond. One of the attractions is a nocturnal animal display which was dark to the point of actually being a little dangerous and may also scare small children. The mountain goats live happily on the side of the very steep slope and it was fun seeing them in the sort of environment which they obviously enjoy, but looks so precarious.The zoo was very crowded and at times it was very difficult making your way around the various displays but this was to be expected as the visit was in the high season.All in all, this is a good attraction and I think the zoo has an excellent reputation for it's breeding programme. I hope they overcome their difficulties post flood, hopefully the income from visitors will allow for a quick recovery.

WooW. Large and green. You can walk, watch animals, or enjoy nature. The zoo has it all. The cages are huge and preserve animal rights and allow them to enjoy almost normal life. The decoration of cages and other is brilliant. I really enjoyed every minute there

Well maintained zoo. Praha zoo is very good and well maintained. It is vast and has many species of animals and birds. It requires almost 2 days to enjoy this place. The enclosures are good. The restaurants and rest rooms are well spreadout. Great place for family outing. You can take your pets also!!

A day at the zoo. Great day out, my daughter and i went while in Prague for a wedding, I have to say it is one of the best zoo's i have been to. It cost about £7 to get in which we felt was well worth the money. There is a lot to see and it is quite a walk, there are little trains you can catch but we never seemed to be inb the right place to get on one, but it didn't really matter to us. The amimals looked well cared for and they had made good use of the natural area. It poured with rain at one point and the birds were loving it. A great day. We arraived at 10:30 and left at 4pm and probaly only because we were soaking wet from the rain, but thats nature for you.

a full day experience. I am quite a regular visitor to Prague but never had enough time to explore this amazing place. Until now! :-) Leaving our „daddy“ in his very world (Aviation Museum Kbely), my daughters and I have spent great adventurous five hours in Prague ZOO. Have got there by a short ferry and a short walk to the south entrance. Entrance fee seemed quite high for the three of us (500 CZK), but was definitely worth it. We were enjoying the walk among numerous dormitories and expositions, marveling at the awesome seal and lemur show, having fun watching ground squirrels and penguins or admiring the majestic giraffes, elephants and hippos. Except for the poor ponies and donkies having to carry one child after another, the animals were apparently happy in their environment. Unfortunately, girls have been quite tired after a few-hours-walk, so we left without visiting the whole south-western part of the garden. Next time we’ll definitely use the child cart available for borrowing near entrance. Make sure you check the programme on the website before visiting so you can watch as many special shows and animal feedings as possible. When in lack of time, definitely visit seal and lemur training at least.

Nice but dated. After all the churches and historical information, our teenagers were looking for something "fun". We went to the zoo. The train and bus was easy to use. The fee was reasonable. There was a good assortment of animals but the pens were not fully utilized. Quite a number had no animals or water or anything in them. The animals looked tired and bored which I guess would be normal compared to their natural habitat, but there are ways of livening up the exhibits that were not employed. The arrangement of the animals was disorganized and the zoo sprawling so that we were forever walking back and forth trying to find something on a map, and the signs were sparse. My children did enjoy it, but smaller zoos with more focus and others we have been too were far superior.

Average. I found the overall experience average based on other zoos I've visited. I found that there was not too many information in English and there wasn't any maps to help you get around, only the occasional large sign. Some areas smelled foul especially the primates enclosure which we had to run through fast as the smell was so bad. Some other enclosures where empty with no sign of explanation. It wants bad value and it was a couple of hours walking around, the lunch wasn't great either. I don't think I'd rush back to this zoo if I was visiting prague again. Not bad for a visit but don't expect too much.

Nice Zoo. We took our 2 girls (11 & 7) and our baby girl to the zoo.They enjoyed watching the animals especially the Tiger, the Giraffe and the lion. We spent nice 3 hours and I think it is quite enough for a zoo.

Highlight of the trip!. My friend and I really fell in love with Prague zoo! Although it is a metro ride and a bus journey away from the centre, it is well worth the journey! The variety of healthy looking and happy animals is astounding! One of the best zoo's I've ever been to. The zoo makes you feel as though you are having an adventure and exploring the wild yourself with all the different themed areas!A few tips: I recommend spending a full day here.Make sure you wear comfortable footwear as the zoo is very big and a lot of it is an uphill climb, so your feet will be aching!

Nice day out. Beautiful zoo. Lots of nice places to eat, very reasonable. Ice cream two cones for a pound. Lots of different animals, seemed well kept. Very lovely views from top of zoo. Staff very friendly.

Prague Zoo is full of baby animals. I was impressed--even though I visited right after the flood. The zoo is immense and has the highest success of any zoo in the world for breeding. It's easy to see why--the pheromones are flying! And the statues and shrines around the elephant's habitat shows that animals are honored. The animals were curious and interactive.

Very nice zoo. Pleasant park with a variety of well-kept animals. The zoo is kept clean despite the crowds scampering around on daily basis. Nevertheless, the park doesn't feel crowded, the area is large and one should plan 4-5 hours to see the most of it. The Zoo offers refreshments every 100-200 meters, the alleys are shaded with old trees and the overall impression is very positive, even in the heat of July.

Good but why keep Giraffes in an indoor cage?. Very good Zoo, scenery is fantastic and its in what seems a very nice part of Prague.Only disappointment was some animals were nowhere to be seen. On the day we went, the Komodo Dragons were missing, as we're some other animals.Our biggest gripe was why they keep the giraffes in a very small indoor enclosure when there is a mass of green fields near their exhibition. Seemed quite cruel but hey I'm no zoologist!All in all, enjoyed it but expect to do a lot of walking, both up and down hill.
Top class ZOO. Prague ZOO is ranked as one of the best ZOO in the world and I have to fully agree. You need whole day to see all corners and to visit all animals.

One of the nicest zoos we have visited!. The animals looked really relaxed and had enough space. There is also a lot of small fast foods with reasonable prices. The highlight is the Indian rainforest pavilion. If you have enough time for your stay in Prague, spend at least half a day there.
Great fun!. The Prague ZOO is set in very beautiful garden with a lot of views of the city. Whole garden is very clean with a lot of interesting animals.Definitely worth a visit.

Enjoyable time. Myself and my son enjoyed slowly walking around taking pictures, loved the gorilla's and the bird enclosures. Only downside was some parts were still closed and being refurbished due to flooding so that wasnt the zoo's fault.

A fantastic place to visit with loads to see...fit it into your trip for sure. The zoo was really great.loads of things to see. The kids and adults will enjoy it a lot.not too far from town,so make the trip out.....
Perhaps one of the best in Europe .

Good for the kids. a lovely park with many animals, reptiles and rides. Very shaded with lots of trees especially on a hot day. Pity that some areas look shabby but maybe this is due to the fact that recent floods hit the area (june 2013).

nice and modern zoo. very nice zoo, is modern. with nice and unique animals which are clearly sorted and you can easy find which you prefer with map. you can use cableway or walk. Beautifull elephant show. With visiting zoo you will help them after floods.

Great landscaping, Family friendly, Thoroughly enjoyable. The animal enclosures are very impressive, obviously well thought out - the animals have large varied environments. The overall landscaping is excellent - everything is set in a lush forest type environment and there are great views of the river and city.. The facilities are first rate with toilets, drink machines and kiosks abundant throughout the park. At this time a significant portion (around a quarter) of the zoo is closed for renovation after flood damage. In some enclosures there are few animals and sometimes only one. Some of the animals are presented in creative ways (the giraffes are viewed from above for instance). Overall a fantastic experience - the kids loved it. Make sure to get the family ticket (2 adults, 2 children) for a discount.

Nice affordable zoo. Great zoo with lots of room. Very nice enclosures for the animals. Part of the park was closed due to flooding but there was lots of things to see anyway. I wish that all the signs would have English texts as well. Now it was difficult to know more than the name of the animal. Overall a very friendly and inviting zoo. And cheap.

A great break from Prague centre!. Went to the zoo hearing that it was a good trip - and they were right! It definitely isn't just for children/families and has great views and souvenirs. Defiantly worth a visit.

A wow experience. We have only visited 4 zoos (Budapest, Barcelona, Prague and the Bioparc in Valencia) but I can say for sure that the zoo in Prague is our number one till now. It is some kind of paradise for animal lovers where one can see all kind of animals and lots and lots of birds. The zoo is huge, well organized and you can get close-ups of different species. You can see the animals also outside where they play but also at their “homes”. For example we got so close to the tigers that only a glass window separated us. We watched them while they were eating and it was just…wow! I intended to write a large review of the zoo but now I realize that I have not enough words to describe how I felt by visiting the zoo so I will stop here and I’ll invite you to go there…just two more tips. The ticket for the zoos has the lowest price compared to the others zoo we visited but it offers you a great experience. To get there you must travel by metro and after that by bus no 112 that comes very very often. Don’t miss the zoo if you visit Prague!
We recommend a visit in zoo. We usually visit zoos on our vacations. This was well designed and a nice place. Animals were well taken care off.

Much bigger than expected.. Wow,this place is huge. Unfortunately many parts are closed following recent flooding but we're still having a lovely time. It's not too crowded and so cheap to enter,far cheaper than other zoos in Europe. Loved the flamingos so pretty and the gorillas we could watch all day.

Wonderful zoo, worth the money!. We only had about 2.5 days in Prague, and had decided to do this zoo because of the good reviews. We weren't disappointed! It is really lovely, so big and well spread out with a huge range of different animals. We only had a few hours to see everything but managed to fit most of it in. It was really sad because the place was still recovering from the flood, so some areas and enclosures were not up and running. Hopefully things recover soon for them. It definitely didn't impact our great day at the zoo in any way. The elephant section was amazing and the polar bears are a highlight. One of the best zoos I have been to!

Prague Zoo. We have visited Prague Zoo on several occasions. I really like this zoo. It is a large zoo with plenty of animals to see. The zoo is well laid out but spread over a large area so anyone with children should take a stoller with them as it is a lot of walking for children. The zoo is exceptional value to get in and all of the money helps the zoo. The food and drink inside is also reasonable and there are plenty of places to eat around the zoo offering various kinds of refreshment.There are children's play areas around the zoo and they are all really good. The designated children's play area is fantastic offering train rides, water fun and climbing frames.The information is in both Czech and English and there are educational resources around the zoo.The zoo is very open to the elements so wrap up warm if you visit in winter and there are not many shady places during Summer so ensure you have good sun protection and take a fan.We have used the zoo boat to return to Prague. This was a fantastic way to end the day but the directions to the boat is not well signposted from the zoo and the staff were not particularly helpful with this. We nearly missed the boat as we walked in the wrong direction.The zoo is easy to find using public transport - we caught a tram to Nadrazi Holsovice and there is a bus stop outside which says ZOO. You do not need to pay extra for the zoo bus.

Great day out!. Prague zoo is great! Lots to see & lots to do and for a city zoo it’s very big and vast with lots of greenery! Unfortunately in the last 10 years they were hit by bad floods twice as the lower part of the zoo is right next to the river Vltava. First time I visited was not long after the first flood in 2002 and most of the enclosures and pavilions still weren’t open. Our next visit was in May 2013 (only a week before the most recent flood) and we had a lovely day out! First you walk around the lower level part than you can take the seat lift up (or walk up and take the lift down – up to you) which is quite a fun experience and gives you lovely views over the zoo and Prague. The higher level is home to the larger animals and to the recently opened “elephant house” (which was moved up there after the last flood) and the “Africa house”. There is also a viewing tower which gives you great views of Prague (great for pictures). Our highlights were: baby gorilla, baby elephant and baby giraffe :-) I hope they manage to rebuild everything again the same way they did after the last flood and I hope that they don’t have to go through the same thing again! If you have a spare day whilst visiting Prague & if you are a zoo lover you should definitely go and visit! By going and buying a ticket you will also help to rebuild this fantastic zoo!!!!

One of my favourite zoos in the world. My wife and I are zoo lovers and have been to over 20 I'm the last 8 years and this is without a doubt one of the best zoos I have ever visited.Please be aware there is currently a lot of rebuilding going on following a large flood but even with this our day was not spoiled.Animal enclosures are very spacious and beautiful and animals seem very happy. There are also a few species here I have never seen before in zoos over Europe.Only thing I would warn is the Zoo is very spacious and this leads to a lot of walking including some very steep hill sections so people who are unable to walk far for whatever reason may want to do further research.Also the cheapest zoo I think I have ever been to.Wonderful day out and a must visit for Zoo lovers visiting Prague.

Zoo Prague. This zoo it is definitely in my top 5 from Europe. It has a very nice position witch allows them to create nice environments for different species. Best enclosure to visit are: Elephants, Giraffes, mountain goats, lion, lemurs, gorillas, see lions, and many more. It is accessible by car and bus.

Amazing. We spent a whole day at the Zoo and I don't regret a minute of it. We were a bit disappointed we couldn't see the red Panda(s), though we managed to get a glimpse of one at one moment. But it's not like they can control the animals and send them out, it depends on the animals themselves if they want to go out or not.There were so many animals that we were afraid we wouldn't get to see all of them. We didn't really see all of them. That might also be because we spent nearly an hour with the giraffes. Amazing creatures.

Giraffe enclosure excellent and the cafe food wonderful. This zoo involves a monstrous amount of walking and the first half an hour is either empty or goats! Still half of this zoo is clearly closed after the floods but we checked online the previous day it said a number of things were open - that were not. I don't think they should charge the full price until the situation is resolved as it is a bit misleading. Thanks god for the giraffes or we'd've come away very disappointed. The indoor enclosure is the best I've seen anywhere in the world. The cafe restaurant (blue/red house) at the top of the hill the food was extraordinary. You have to wait a while but this fine dining was definitely a highlight if our holiday.

Great way to spend the day. Decent sized zoo with a broad range of animals. Good facilities on site and a very good price (compared to other zoos that I have been to). The zoo is continuously being improved with new features and enclosures being added all the time. Allow yourself at least a few hours. Kids will love it.

Amazing animels. A very clean welcome zoo. staff helps alot and there is a verity of animels to see. take into account a minimum of 3-5 hours there. try not to come on a hot day as the animals are hiding from the heat.
big zoo - what can i write?. It´s really big zoo with plenty of animals, but with 40+ visits im losing my interest. However, after floods this year zoo needs reconstruction again...
Still visible signs of the flooding of 2002. There is still much work that needs to be done before the Zoo is up to standard to recieve customers.

Great Goat Habitat. The zoological park was easy to get to via the Metro and the 112 bus (once we found it) with drop off at the zoo entrance. They have great little cafes all around the park. You can pay with a card for admission but bring cash for the cafes. Some up hill walking and all paths are paved/stone. Some exhibits have been challenged due to recent flooding but is a nice get away from the usual tourist haunts.

Best zoo ever!. After choosing to walk for quite a while we finally got to the zoo. When you first get there everything seems as nothing extremely interesting and pretty ordinary. Boy were we in for a surprise, after getting a map we chose the direction that we would be going in. When we began to walk then we began to realise just how large this zoo is. Not only is there a huge variety of different animals, unlike some zoos the animals in Prague zoo have so much space!! As the day went on we began realising that we were constantly climbing a hill of some sort and in one section of the zoo the views were absolutely breathtaking. After sitting down enjoying the views, we decided to make our way back to the exit, after about 2 minutes of walking this was the big surprise of the day, we see a hut and cables leading downwards, and as you got closer to the hut you were then able to see a chair lift!!!!!!! Obviously we went down via the chair lift, even though it is pretty short, the views are worth it.This is a very different zoo, the landscape, the views and the amount there is to see make this zoo so much more than just a place to see animals. It was amazing, if you have the time then I definitely recommend this. There is so much to see!!!

Don't waste your time. It's quite far from the city center, there are very rude cashiers, zoo is totally disorganized, unable to find animals' places, most of the animals are not there!, no staff around to ask a question. Managers of this zoo, please go and check Vienna Zoo and try to change most of the things. I regret that I spent my 550 Kc there...

Zoo that thinks of children. we have read that the Prague Zoo is the 7th best in the world, at leat that is what the Forbes magazine said. And guess what, the magazine was right. Not only plenty interesting animal that you wouldn,t see anywhere else. i guess that is a must if yuor zoo aspires to be among the first 10 even first 20. But the Prague Zoo offers a possibility to touch,feel,hear,smell the animal, purely experience them. For our 9 and 11years old kids it was , as they said the best they have seen sofar. And belive me we have visited many zoo,s and safaries. Take them and go

Nice side trip. When visiting Prague and a break form all the history is in order try the Zoo. A short tram or metro ride from anywhere in Prague. The variety of animals is interesting. The ground are not flat so if you are not up to hill climbing that the little tram that is offered

Great!. Prague zoo is great, I,ve visited a few times and enjoyed it every time. It's quite large and everything seems to be spread out so not all cramped together, the chair lift is good although a little scary first time, families with small kids can hire buggies that you can pull along as it does involve a lot of walking. The animal enclosures are all really nice and it seems they have done some renovations recently.

Very nice, wide variety. The Zoo in Prague is huge, spread over a very wide space and with a wide variety of creatures/species. We only had about 3 hours that day and covered about half of what was open (some parts are closed for restoration). It is a very interesting place to see, well arranged and presented, the only downside is some animals don't come out to be seen by tourists and you can miss some stuff due to this (they all have large spaces at their disposal).

Fantastic. Wow! I was stunned at the expanse and the variety of this zoo. The elephants and the giraffes were a particular treat. I shall heartily recommend the zoo to all of my visitors to Prague and I shall make sure to get back there again. Also, if you're a senior, (over 70) then admission is just 1czk! Well recommended!

zoo. Absolutely lovely zoo which is being updated in certain parts. Our only problem was it was heavy rain but we still went round for 4 hours and never got round all of it. Would be a great place to visit with lots of different animals to see especially on a nice sunny day. Very easy to get to as bus stops right outside it.

The best one on the world. Really, really nice place to see. One of the best world zoo´s I have ever seen. It is so sad, that each 10 years the floods destroy the whole bottom part and it has to be renewed again and again and again.

A nice zoo if you have kids or the time for it. If you have kids, this place can be fun for 3-4 hours. The Zoo Praha is very large and has a great variety of animals. It is reachable within the city center very easily (Metro C towards Letňany get off at Nádraží Holešovice. From there you take bus no. 112 which is like a zoo shuttle bus). It is not a must see but if you have the time for it you will enjoy the visit.
Massive. Very large Zoo with big animals like Tigers, Elephants etc Only £6 to get in and 80p to get on the Tram/Metro/Bus to get there. Amazingly cheap
Love the Prague ZOO. Not only for families with kids... The Prague ZOO is huge and really amazing. Go and you wont be disappointed. Go to Nadrazi Holesovice by metro and take a bus from there.

Amazing zoo. Best place to spend a whole day in,allot of great spacious areas for animals,for some you can even think that will fly or run away...it is so close to natural habitat. The worst thing one can do being there to run trough it,you need time to experience it,to take a rest,and those smoothies i got addicted to them. The only minus in my eyes is the lack of English explanations,good thing i brought my own tour guide...but in other words it is perfect,was sad to hear about recent flood....i hope all animals are well...Were in the zoo July 2011

One of the best zoos in Europe. Very huge overall area in the city - Bus 112 gives easy access to the Zoo.Unfortunately the flood in July destroyed many cages.The elephantes´ area is astonishingly great.We spent nearly 5 hours in walking along all the cages,this is approximately the maximum time you should calculate for a visit with children.

Best Zoo I've ever been to!. I've been to quite a few zoos worldwide, and have to admit this is probably the best one yet. They've got lots of animals I haven't seen anywhere else (polar bears, hippos etc) and I believe they were happy.There seemed to be a few animals that were a little bit stir-crazy - we guess they lived alone and were a bit lonely.We also thought some of the birds were too confined and didn't have much space to fly around - this was the only negative really.The animals did look well looked after.Sections of the zoo were still closed due to the flood earlier in June but it was still impressive for such a cheap price!:-)

Beautiful large zoo. Despite the flooding earlier this summer the zoo is mostly open and was really nice. The zoo is very large and has some real nice exhibits. Plan to spend at least half a day. For the best deal buy the Troy Card. It gets you into the zoo, Troy Castle, and the botanical garden, for 300 kc. All three are close together so makes for a good way to spend the day.

Nice way to spend an afternoon. The zoo is located near the river and was recovering from the floods in June when we visited, so a number of habitats/displays were closed. There were still plenty of creative displays and a wide selection of animals. The popularity of the zoo for local residents was apparent and there were large numbers of families with young children present. There is one substantial hill and visitors should be prepared to walk quite a bit to see all of the animals.

Never getting old. I have been here uncountable times and I still enjoy it. When visiting, you can find small billboards with information written on it, playgrounds and a farm for kids with a possibility of riding a pony. You can also take a little train to get through the zoo but I prefer walking and seeing all the animals. Another plus: Prague Zoo is still improving - they constructed a new pavilion for elephants and hippos. Moreover, every pavilion is themed of the place where the animals come from. The only problem is the car park. It is not well organized and you have to pay additional 100,-Kč, which seems a little exaggerated.
Beautiful. Huge park with lots of animals, went there short time after the flood, and many of the animals wasen't there. But overall a great park

Go for it!!!. If you visit Prague,you have to visit Prague zoo.We enjoyed every moment.It is not so difficult to find it.We took metro and bus.It is very big and you need at least 5-6 hours in order to watch all the animals.Don't miss it!

Best Zoo ever!. I have really only been to a couple of other zoos before but this was far better than any of them. There was a huge range of animals, many you would never get to see if it wasn't for the zoo. They all looked very healthy.The zoo itself was designed really well, it had 'houses' where you got to see certain animals up close and they were divided into the areas they would usually live in. I really enjoyed it. My boyfriend and I spent well over 5 hours there, only stopping for a hot dog and a beer. When we went a few of the habitats were closed due to the recent flooding in Prague but there was still plenty to see.It was easy to get to even though it is out of the city, just get the red line to Nadrazi Holesovice and then the 112 bus to the zoo. Wear good shoes and expect a lot of uphill/downhill walking.

Unique Animals, Large, and Geared towards Kids. My 5 and 7 year olds and I spent 5 hours here and didn't see everything because it is so big. There was a lot of walking and many hills, so be advised. The zoo includes many unique animals and habitat enclosures. When we went, they were still cleaning up from the flood of Spring 2013, so a third of the park was closed to the public. But there was still too much to see for one day. One nicething too is that there are kids play spots throughout the park and restaurants and cafes scattered around as well. Reasonable pricing on entry and the restaurant fare.

Well maintained. I am not really a zoo person, but a lot of the students in my study abroad program had visited and really enjoyed it so I thought it was worth a trip.I don't think it's actually within Prague itself, but if you're coming from the city the public transportation to the zoo is extremely simple -- you can just take the subway and make an easy transfer to the bus. The transfer location is obviously marked and the subway even has a little graphic of a zoo next to the stop where you make the transfer.It was both inexpensive and well maintained and I remember spending upwards of 10 or 15 minutes looking at just this one monkey enclosure with lots of trees and swings as well as an indoor area for the monkeys. We also really enjoyed the tigers and the red panda. The animals seem to be very well cared for and fed.The zoo isn't huge, so you should be able to finish seeing everything in about 3 hours but it's definitely worth your time and money.Highly recommend!

A fantastic zoo. On our recent visit to Prague zoo half of it was closed off due to the flooding in June but we still had a great time! The zoo is massive and we easily spent the day here (and that was only half of the zoo!). It has an open plan feel and the enclosures are all very well suited to the animals. I'm not 100% comfortable with the idea of zoos but this one made me feel as though a huge effort had been made to make the animals feel at home. Entry is very cheap in comparison to the zoos we have in the UK and came in at around £6. We had lunch in the Asia section beside the elephants which was affordable and enjoyable. Definitely worth a visit!
average. I can find better in Czech republic. I would expect more from ZOO in capital city. There is a problem with parking sometimes.

my experience. sadly when i been there it was 3 weeks after the flood , and half the zoo was closed , i saw few animals , my experience wasn't so good , i hope to visit the zoo next time and every thing bee good

I Love Prague ZOO. The best zoo I've been to. Big and fun to visit again and again. Lot of programs with animals (feedings and stuff) If possible (depending on the kind of animal) their shelters are made without too many barriers. So one can feel to be there with them. Great especially for kids, possible to make a whole day out of it and still have a lot to see next time. And there is an awesome cable car that makes me all nostalgic :)
:-). One of my favorite places to rest in Prague. Year after year I watch improving the quality of life of animals, I hope that this effort will still continue.

Fabulous Zoo. We quite often visit zoos when travelling started this tradition when our kids were young but still enjoy even now as adults...really enjoyed Prague Zoo set on a hill, great enclosures and in particular loved the polar bears, could watch them playing in the water for ages. It was spring when we went and lots of families enjoying a day out...not too far from town we were lazy and got a taxi but can get tram then bus if you want. Would recommend this Zoo,its good sometimes to have a break from the normal tourist sights .... feel like a local on a day out.

Considering the recent flood, it was still very enjoyable!. Went there a little after 5 and it closed at 7.
