At first I didnt think I would be able to capture an entire zoo in less than two hours, but considering the disastrous flood they just had not even a month ago, some exhibits were not available, the elephants, tiger, orangutans....unless I just missed them. Anyway, it was a nice walk. Wonderful decor. Some are really dramatic! Lol..I actually waited until I saw a group of people walk into one underground area because I didnt want to walk in alone. Super dramatic decor! 200kc for adults. A great family affair. And great for us solo travelers as well! Take your time and enjoy..especially the hippos! What fun!

Aquatic Zoo. The Zoo was still recovering from the terrible flooding so we couldn't see all the animals but what was there was pretty interesting. The elephants and giraffes were great and there was a lot of opportunity for photography. A wooden tower in the zoo offered some great views of Prague. Well priced, could easily spend half a day there. Recommended. Obviously if you're against zoos ethically then don't go but I would say the animals looked very well treated and most enclosures were large.

One of the best zoo i have seen. Really clean and clear place. Little bit of a walk, but it is worth it! A big variaty of animals and birds. We walked around the park almost three hours and still we didn't see all the animals. (take a tram number 24 and switch to bus number 112) We took a taxi to the zoo (20 €) but it was easier to leave with tram and bus. :-)
Nice calm place. Very nice place far from rush of city. Large area with many animals, good service (food and drinks), beautiful view of Prague.

Relly the best thing to see in Prague. The zoo and the animals are really great but the layout is not very logical. You get a map but in order to see everything you have to go back on yourself a few times. There is no route no numbers to make sure that you don't miss anything. You will notice this with Prague in general not much direction or signs. I gave it 5 stars because I didn't want the lack of directions to take away from all the great animals we saw. Also we saw this with Trojska kart (a ticket that allows you to see the zoo,the botanical garden and the troja house with art work) we found this a good deal.

best zoo. Beautiful, great ZOO! Animals keeping in very natural and big spaces, trying hard to bring them both comfort, privacy and space. You will feel like in nature. In some cases, it is possible to go very close to animals, like lemurs :).

Nice zoo with cute baby monkeys!. Since we had 9 days in Prague during Christmas, we choose to get out of the city and see the Prague Zoo. We choose to go to the zoo because we had the time and because we have been enamored with wildlife shows lately. To get to the zoo take the Metro C line to the Nadrazi Holesovice Bus 112. It will take you about 30 minutes to get to the zoo from the town center, but you will get a chance to see working Prague. The zoo was really well done and there were lots of animals here that we had not seen before. It was lightly raining so there were not a lot of people around, and there was a lot of peace and quiet. The animal enclosures were large and the animals looked happy. I especially liked visiting the baby monkeys, lemurs, and the penguin exhibit. The penguins were swimming and it was fun to see the Czech kids laughing at them!
Very reasonable and well set out. Easy to reach and a lovely leisurely look around the well cared for animals. A little zoo train to take you to the top

A zoo that will be great again when it's recovered from recent floods. We really enjoyed this Zoo and were really surprised how large it was despite a large area being inaccessible due to the recent floods. The majority of the enclosures are brand new following the 2002 floods and we spent a good 6 hours exploring. The views across town were also a added bonus. We will definitely return once the Zoo has been restored to its full glory!
Very nice Zoo. I love zoo/safaries and this one is one of the best.They just opened some parts that were damadged cause of the floods...Come late so- not many visitors....

Not a Zoo Lover. I'm not normally a fan of zoo's at all, but I made an exception to go with the group I was travelling with just to make things easier. And because I read such great reviews here on TA. Overall I was pretty impressed with the layout and how natural everything seemed.Only the upper part of the zoo was open for visiting due to the flood damaging the lower half, but it was still a great day. We went on a very hot summer day, but there were plenty of shady spots and places to grab a refreshment or ice cream!There were a couple of animals that seemed to be stressed out. Not sure if that was due to the heat or the upheaval from the floods. Overall a really nice time though.

Good zoo, still partially closed. Had read that Prague Zoo was an excellent experience and sure enough the animals seemed well looked after in good sized enclosures. The only slight drawback was that the lower half of the zoo was still shut. These things happen and it must take a lot of cleaning up after the floods. My only criticism would be that there was no information as to which animals were not able to be seen. It would have been nice to know that prior to buying a ticket to make an informed decision as to whether it was worth it. In the end it was and I'd thoroughly recommend it especially when completely open.

Half of it was closed after the floods but still great. The "lower" part of ZOO was closed after the floods in 2013. However it was still a great half day spent in a ZOO. Lot of animals (huge "African savanah" exposition was great); nice view from the tower.

Top Zoo.... As someone who have visited some great Zoo¨s,like Munich and Vienna,I really cannot believe people who thinks Prague Zoo is poor or terrible.Sorry,but those people are insane.I read about it,and expected world¨s top ten zoo,and it surely is.You will find gorilla¨s,tapir¨s,hyena¨s,przewalskys horses,red panda¨s,clouded leopard¨s and so much more than that in Prague zoo.The most important thing is that the zoo is really big and animals have a lot of space to live in.There is even a cable car for the people who doesn¨t want to walk to the higher level.We made some great shots and videos,and purely enjoyed for 5 hours there.Sometimes I had a filling that I was out in the nature and not in the zoo.It was a great experience to visit it and I highly reccomend it for everybody.I wish them to recover from the flood as soon as possible...

Great Zoo. We visited when it snowed, so that brought a different side to the 'Africa' section, many of whose animals were warmly tucked up inside.There plenty of animals to see, Penguins a personal favourite who have a great exhibit. All seem to be well cared for and have large, well designed enclosures.Easy to get to from the centre of Prague, use the underground to Nádraží Holešovice then get a bus direct to the zoo.Prices are good too, very very cheap entry and the restaurant was reasonable too.

Fantasic day out. Despite the recent floods myself and my girlfriend visitted the reopened Zoo yesterday to have a look around the animals situated on higher ground. As documented in the news, the floods have affected the Zoo quite badly and the lower half of the Zoo was closed to the public. However, despite this unfortunate circumstance, our day out to the Zoo was great. The enclosures were superb and offered you great view points. All of the animals looks happy and well cared for and were well engaged with their surroundings. What impressed me especially was the space available for them to roam within.Furthermore, at 200 CZK for an adult ticket its more than affordable. There are cafes and facilities dotted around the place and all offer food and drinks at a good price. We sat and enjoyed ice creams overlooking nice views of Pragues old town near the Bison during our visit.My only recommendation would be that the Zoo could have included more English signs. However, the enclosures that appeared to have been recently developed did include more English information on the animals and it did not discredit the Zoo at all.

Excellent time. Prague zoo is beautifully set up! There are so many animals, I don't think one day is enough to see them all. The views from the zoo are also something to behold. Our LO had a grand time here! The only con is that all descriptions of animals/sign/etc. are in czech, but then again we are in Czech.

Awesome. There are so many paths and different things to see, I ended up spending the entire day there! It was a great value for the amount of time I spent, and there are lots of restaurant type places scattered throughout. I'll definitely be going back this summer!

Highly recommended!. The Prague Zoo is a great way to know the city from a different angel, and not only for children!!It is a low cost activity that takes you out of the city into a beutiful peace of animal world. We are a young couple without children and we loved it! we paid 150 CZK with a student I.D.

the biggest Czech zoo. It´s a great place for a family trip that can last the whole day. There are many animals in new modern pavilions. You can take a funicular from lower to upper part of this zoo. There is a nice child tram circle and other attractions.

Great attraction for children. Nicely planned zoo, with a varity of animals. Easy to reach by public transportation.
I do not recommend the zoo if you do not have children.
Greatselection of Animals. It was probably the best Zoo I've been too. great variety. Only down marks was the polar bear in the sun looking a bit sad.
Excellent - worth visiting. It's definitely one of the best ZOOs I've ever visited. Lots of trees and parks, animals properly taken care of, attractive settings.

Great ZOO. I was sceptic at first, but it was great trip. So much to see there. Its quite large area so prepare to spend there some time: if you want to see almost everything prepare to sacrifice at least 2-4 of your time. Its not the best ZOO I have visited but its definitely worth your time.

Worth a visit!. Brilliant, we got the underground then a bus, bus was very packed. The zoo was fantastic, lots of walking though and hilly. Animals well kept, don't forget to get a map, Eating places very reasonable, plenty of toilets too.
Regular visit. We go there regularly every year and there are always some new things to see - new pavillions, animals etc. Also good for walking exercise, lots of paths going up and down.

Fine Zoo. Worth a visit if you're on an extended stay. I lived in the city for 6 months and went after a while. Elephant tunnel built after the floods is an interesting aside in terms of facts, but it's well kept and you feel like the animals are cared for.

Loved it..!. This must be one of the best zoos I've visited & I wished my grandchildren had been with me. It's very well kept & it's clear that a lot of thought has gone into arranging the enclosures to suit the animals. We especially liked the way you could get quite close to them. Some of the enclosures were quite small though, ie the polar bears. It's very easy to reach & the entry is very reasonable as are the food outlets there. I'd definitely go back & make it a whole day trip next time.

An unexpected surprise - a fantastic zoo. I've been to zoos all over the world (my husband is a vet) - beijing, sidney, barcelona, New York, Washington, San Diego, Singapore.... This was a gem. For such a small city - we were surprised at how nice this zoo was. We had just been to barcelona's zoo and was not impressed. So we were expecting something similar and was surprised at the quality of this zoo. Since I see so many zoos, I wasn't expecting to enjoy this zoo - but I did. And of course my husband loved it also.So if you are in prague for 3-5 days - take a bus trip to this zoo.
Best Zoo. Well there are animals, all sorts of them :S. It's a well spaced place with animals I had never seen before... Nice for a family trip and even for tourists...

Amazing not only for children. Prague Zoo is considered one of the top 10 and there is a good reason for that. The collection is huge and animals seem to be happy there :) You can easily spend half of the day there. Getting to the zoo is a bit tricky, and would probably require changing of a couple of buses/trams. I would suggest to plan the roat ahead, you can get a map of their transport system at any station.It is strange to see however that Prague Zoo is not featured in the mobile version of trip advisor...

One of the most wonderful memories of Prague. This March I have been to Prague and spent one of my days in Zoo Praha. It was just amazing. I had never been in such a huge zoo before and first 20 minutes were pleasantly shocking for me. It's very important to buy a map not to get lost in the zoo. I would recommend to visit Zoo Praha in summer, because when I was there it was still cold and some of the aviaries didn't work. I spent there the whole day, but managed to see only one second part of the zoo. I fell in love with all the animals which I have seen there.
Prague ZOO is beautiful!. Do you like animals? Then you must visit Prague ZOO during your stay in Prague. We recommend that you set aside at least 1/2 day for your visit.
A trip into childhood. Excellent, an exciting journey into the childhood. The animals actually look happy and healthy, they have a lot of room for playing and walking. The penguins were a blast!
Amazing!. one of my best zoos that I visited in diffrent countries! I like it! I'm a big fan of animals lol so I go there alot, I have a student year membership. must visit

A lot better than other Zoos. As controversial zoos might be, this one has a number of enclosures that are very well laid out and the animals seem to behave like in their natural environment. For example, one enclosure contained 3 different species (Mouse, Tortoise and small Lizard) and it seems to work. The indoor "Theme Park" Indonesia is fantastic, with tropical birds whizzing around your head and the smell of rainforest.Having said that, some animals in this zoos exhibit the usual behaviour issues that is common place in most zoos. I was particularly sad to see my favourite animal, the Wolf, trudging around in circles for hours.The Zoo is quite large compared to Zoos I have visited and has plenty of other things of interested, like exposed rockfaces where one can study the geology of this place. Great views to the river and beyond and (most) information boards were also in English.The café is good but the shop is terrible.
Great place for a visit. Biggest zoo that I have visited in Europe. If you have any interest in zoos.. you should see this one : )

Hide and seek. Most animals we could not see, like wolves, cheetah, lions, bears, because of the terrible viewing platforms or because they were not there. Badly laid out. Map was incorrect, as was the signposting. Highlight was seeing the big cats up close, but by the time we got there we had to leave. Pathways were badly maintained.

The best Zoo, I've ever seen. optionally buy ticket to trojya palace and zoo (280CZ).The zoo is very large, and will take at least 5-6 hours of constant walking to see most of the attractions. The terrain that the zoo itself is built on is very cool and you can get some very beautiful views of Prague

Lots of Animals, Nicely Laid Out, Fun Trip. This zoo is quite large and diverse with its species. The enclosures are clean and spacious and the animals looked happy. I visited when they were doing some refurbishment so was unsure where some of the animals were, so didn't get to see them all, the zoo is nicely laid out and easy to get around. The restaurant is very nice, with good prices although they do not have multilingual menus only Czech, but the people who work there are happy to help you :) There are also things like a little train that goes round the zoo and a chairlift which is quite scary. Fun to do with kids. Easy to get to from Prague.

Great. The zoo is really great.
Pity it is closing after 6p.m.
Nearby area is fanastic too. There is a palace, big park for skating, biking, rollers etc.

Great Zoo loads to see and do. This Zoo is the best one I have ever visited in Europe which a huge selection of animals in great animal friendly enclosures. The highlights for me are the big cats, gorillas, lemurs enclosure and elephant valley. You can quite easy spend the whole day here and for 200 CZ ($10) it's well worth the money.

Very nice zoo. Very nice walk in Prague zoo. When is sunny you can spend here a couple of hours. There are upper and lower parts of the zoo which are connected by cable car but you don´t have to use it. You can go by walk. The best parts of the zoo are polar bears, gorillas and elephants- btw there is new born baby elephant, just 2 months old. It´s very cute..

Great Place!. As a lover of Zoos, i decided to visit on a recent trip to Prague. I was not disappointed, but rather surprised as this is the best zoo i have visited yet! The zoo is on 2 levels and there is a cable car that connects the 2 levels. The animals look and act well. Great place to visit if you have some spare time in Prague!

A Nice Attraction for Kids. The zoo is large with a nice variety of animals and many attractions (feeding time, petting yard etc.). If the weather is good, you would enjoy a nice day there. Since the zoo area is not plane, I would recommend to take one of the various "trains" in the zoo uphill and then walk down. Do not expect to see it all in one day, so read about it in advance and decide what is it that you are most interested to see.

prague zoo. We were not sure what to expect but we were extremely impressed with the zoo and would recommend it. The best part for me was the polar bears swimming on their backs to entertain every one watching(at least I think they were doing it for us but they were really enjoying it )

Worth the visit. It is really not too bad to get to. You can take a taxi or ride the Tram #17 all the way to the stop which is on their website. Then you can either jump on bus 112 or just walk 15 minutes to the zoo which is what we did. The zoo is very popular and the lines were long. But this is zoo is one of the best I have ever visited with my family.

Amazing experience!!!. I absolutely loved our time at this zoo!! From the very reasonable admission price (150kc for students, 200 for adults), to the friendly and happy atmosphere- this zoo is in a league of its own!! The enclosures are spacious and the vast array of animals seem very happy in their space... The zoo is very family friendly and even allows people to bring the family pooch along for a day out! The food available is also reasonably priced, with plenty of options. However, the very best thing about the praha zoo is how close it allows you to get to the animals- i've never experienced anything like it!!!! a truly magical day!

The best ZOO I've ever been. Prague Zoo is really the best ZOO I've ever been. It has a vast collection of animals, that I kept in very good living conditions. Some animals are walking as free (without cages); to some cages it's possible for visitors to enter. The territory of the ZOO is very big and beautiful.If you go there - plan to spend the whole day in this beautiful place. And even the whole day can be not enough to see all habitats.
Good place to spend a day. Different animals, some of them you can touch or feed.Lots of place for animals, chance to see them in the comfortable scenes. Much better than any zoo in Russia
I love the staff,I love this zoo!. Everything was very nice and goodwilling,thanks allot.I absolutely love animals and our Prague ZOO should be one of the world wonder.

The best zoo I've ever been to!. I love this zoo! I cannot stress how lovely it is.Unlike normal cities the zoo is not over crowded, nor all packed into a tiny space, its spacious, with big enclosures and lots to do!Not only this but its cheap! It's around £5 to get into the Zoo as a student.Well worth doing as a day trip out from the city, especially for families.

Best one I've seen so far. I was really surprised by how clean and beautiful the zoo was, as I got skeptic over the last years about zoos in general. It has plenty of parks and green and there seem to be a lot of newly build areas. Most gates and cages are very big and seem to offer a friendly environment for the animals, anyway there were a few that I doubted. They have different theme parks (like Indonesia or Africa) which are really interesting and build with a certain love to the detail.There are plenty of restaurants and cafes with fair prices.All in all, this is probably the nicest zoo I've seen so far.Tip: I got the feeling that, if there are a lot of visitors, it could become quite busy in there. Better go during the week, not on holidays.
Most amazing zoo in the world. I absolutely love animals and our Prague ZOO should be one of the world wonder. They have so many animals in wonderful areas and more than you can see anywhere else.

Great fun!. This zoo is really well laid out, and excellent value for money too. We went on a Sunday and it was really busy; however, we still managed to see all the animals, and it didn't feel too busy after you get away from the main entrance. It took a good four hours to get round everything. All the enclosures are spacious and the animals seem quite content. Highlight was the baby elephant - super cute! We walked from the castle area all the way to the zoo, which took about an hour and a half, but I believe it's possible to take a boat there from Prague city centre during the summer months, which I imagine would be a relaxing way to do it...
Elephants. This place is really amazing. I thinkis the most powerfull place in prague. the penguins are there the elephants,.. everything you can see there.

Great Zoo. I am a very keen Zoo visitor and had heard much about Prague Zoo . It more than met my expectations with a vast collection , mostly very well housed and cared for . There were many species not found in the UK . The baby elephant and gorilla were both very appealing . Despite a nearly full day , I did not manage to see verything . Very easy to get to by Public transport . Some rather steep paths in places .

out of this world. Took a visit to the Prague Zoo and i was not disappointed.Although i am a mature adult i like to visit the Zoo in each city i visit.It takes approx 4hrs to get around at a leisurely pace.The surroundings are beautiful and animals have tons of space.Got to see the lions been fed with only glass screen between us-awesome.The weather was nice and dry so we sat outside to eat at zoo cafe which was very reasonably priced.Try to arrive by mid-day so you can make it all the way around.Best zoo i have been to by far.

Endless fun!. The husband and I love a good zoo. In fact, we make a point of always visiting the local zoo when we visit a new place and this has to be the best one we've ever been to. Firstly, it's huge and pretty spread out, so it never feels too busy. One half is on a cliff / hilltop where you can get a chairlift (or climb if you prefer - actually you can walk along the Eastern without too much effort if you don't want a steep climb but the chairlift is fun) and there's a great sense of space. It really feels like they've done a considered job in recreating each animal's habitat. Also, everyone is walking around drinking beer. Beer, animals... what's not to like?! We also had amazing luck with the animals. It must have been a coincidence that they were all up and about and ' performing' to the onlookers. We got really close to the cheetahs (which they have incorrectly labelled at the Javan Leopards), tigers and hippos. Far closer than we have ever before.We had not properly investigated how to get there and thought we could walk up through Stromovka Park but unfortunately there are very few signposts, plus a lake and railway in the way, as well as a very steep climb, which together make for a very long, tiring journey. So probably best if you work out some public transport in advance. Either way, I would highly recommend this fantastic zoo. A brilliant day out for adults (not just kids), especially if it's sunny!

Great day out. Although a bit of a treck out of town, it is well worth it. Entry is very cheap and the zoo is quite large. The enclosures are very open which makes the whole thing feel more relaxed. Only down side is that most signs and information is in Czech.

A nice zoo - love the baby giraffe. As Zoos go, this one was pretty good. A short bus ride direct from Nadrazi Holesovice couldn't be simpler, and only 150Kc for students. 20Kc for the cable car/ ski lift thing.We spent a good half a day here, arriving for opening time there was half a dozen people, and it didn't get remotely busy the whole time we were there (the weather was a bit overcast but still...).They have polar bears whose enclosure has views over all of Prague, and a number of tigers (their enclosure is a bit small) who happily sit near the glass posing for photos. There is also a small herd of elephants (including a small baby) who have quite a large area to roam compared to in other zoos I've visited.The highlight for us though was the beautiful baby giraffe. Only about 6 foot tall, it stood near the glass staring into our eyes, pretty sure it would have given us a kiss if it could have. My girlfriend fell in love with it and we stayed with it for ages!

Amazing Zoo!. I have visited Prague Zoo in the mid of April and it was amazing. Reasonable price and definately value for the money. You can spend there whole day so many animals to see, lots of benches to rest and nice fast food. We were lucky to see a baby elephant and baby giraffe. So cute! Also I loved wild cats and gorillas. Perfect for the family day out.

Best zoo. I like to vote it as the best zoo I have visited. The zoo is built by a hill and beside a river. This makes the enviroment likes more natural. Add some more signs could improve the experience.

Simply amazing!. Back again to the Prague ZOO and I was simply amazed with all the new improvements! Every time we return to this place, there is always something new and exciting to explore! Definitely beautiful place to visit with kids as they will enjoy every bit of it. But make sure you plan this trip in advance as you will need plenty of time to see everything! Enjoy it!

Incredibly spacious view that looks to have great animal welfare. Spacious zoo, with more animals than you could think existed! The polar bears in particular seemed really happy!Many animals you wouldn't expect in a zoo with all of those you would. Take your camera for sure.The walk through exhibit with the lemurs needs to be seen in summer. If the chair lift was working I'd have been on that too!The zoo is pretty big so be prepared to walk a fair bit. The food and drink within the zoo are well priced and tasty. Only down side was some of the staff didn't speak English and a restaurant we visited didn't have an English menu (my Czech just isn't up to scratch!).
awesome. it was really a good place if u want to see the real animals of Europe. it was very clean and had a good environment. the animals were really good taken care of.

not impressed as much as others. If you've spent a few days in a city and would like to visit some nature sights - probably it's ok. The zoo is big but I'd say it's too simple. Nothing very exciting and special. The only impressive animal - is giant anaconda. It's huge and very interesting!

Best zoo I've ever seen.. The zoo in Prague was by far better than the Edinburgh or Amsterdam Zoos. The selection of animals was fantastic. We even managed a rare glimpse of an orangutang!The animals seem well looked after and cared for. The zoo is a fair bit out of town. We had to get the metro and then transfer onto a bus in order to get to the zoo. The size of the zoo made up for this though.

Excellent!. One of the days was a day to visit the Zoo. There is a large variety of animals, and the staff was extra friendly, surprisingly most of them spoke amazing English. As far as the Zoo is concerned, a fitting Zoo for the most beautiful city in Europe. I do not know if I would have visited it if I had known how many things you can do and see in the week we were there from the start... If you have the time, worth to see!

Apart from the crowd...most fun bridge in Europe. I hate crowds...but in Prague the crowds are actually fun. And when on the bridge, you see the Moldau, the statues of the siants, the towers at each end,,,on the only sunny day in Prague spring...it was a great experience.

It's All Happening at the Zoo. We like the Prague Zoo. It hasn't always been a favourite destination in the city for us, but after the 2002 floods, there was a sea change. To begin, a new director brought with him some much needed, and critical changes. The first thing that Mr. Fajt did, taking over an institution mired in the past, and severely damaged by flood waters, was to clean house. Old vendors which had enjoyed their monopolies for decades, now were faced with a process of selection that was both competitive and transparent. This had the immediate effect of improving food services and facilities. Then he traveled to Asia, Africa, and the Americas, where he found a number of new partners who were willing to help the city of Prague rebuild it's zoo. A new Indonesian Pavilion was added, and a large track of land was added, along with a new home for the Giraffes. These changes were slow in coming, but were greeted by general enthusiasm and appreciation. News of the birth of new Gorillas and architectural improvements were welcome, despite occasional closures for construction.The final result, however, is a Zoo which is in league with some of the finest in the world. It is not an inexpensive day outing, but the experience is well worth the price of admission. The areas where you can walk into the cage with the Gabon, or the Petting Zoo, take full advantage of new concepts in keeping animals in captivity. More than anything else, it is now one of the primary destinations for families with children or teens. Coupled with the Botanical Gardens, and the Troja Chateau, this is must see, and one of the penultimate day trips in the city.

The best ZOO in Europe. The Prague ZOO is a huge and nice and really very profesional renovate and arranged.For to see alll the animals and attractions you will spen there a whole day.The gorilla pavilo,the icebear, the elephanten ...everything is very interesant .The long walk but is not too much also for smaller childeren - you can take a "child cart" - was just for refundable deposit, but free of the charge, and you can walk really whole day.The refreshment - like fast food, restaurants are not the high quality, but - the sell a food, you can eat it, even wasnt to tasty, it was a frsh...Plus, the prices are little bit hoghr than in the town.Well, to spen a nice , frsh , quiet day, go there and enjoy!
Best ZOO in Europe. Very big ZOO, animals are not crowded - lots of space. And they just looks happy!Highly recommended visit to baby elephant - sweet!
Worth going to Prague, just for the zoo. Beautiful park, big zoo, many animals to see and we've never been so close to lions and tigers in our life!

Spacious zoo with a great variety of species. The Prague zoo is clearly trying to create good conditions for the animals. At the time of our visit many of the enclosures were under construction and they were building new large spaces for the elephants. Polar bears and tigers seemed to be just as anxious and sad as always, pacing obsessively, but many other animals seemed content with their surroundings. They should work more on giving the animals stimulae, for example not just giving tigers meat but making them chase it first.The facilities were good, lots of clean, free (no charge) toilets and little cafeterias (staff didn't speak English very well).In many enclosures there was only one animal (like one wolf), which was a bit odd.

wonderful. cheap to get in and puts our zoos to shame. built new enclosures which are amazing and everything up close as some enclosures are glass windows instead of cages,feel like u can reach out and touch the animals

Great if you can find it!. My guidebook bought in England made no mention of there being a zoo, the locals I spoke to also were not aware of one. There was no leaflet for it in my hotel and no advertising in the papers. The trams dont go there, the metro doesnt go there, and its a complex job finding it. However when you get there is is absolutely massive, with a great collection of animals at a very reasonable price. I cannot remember the last zoo where I saw a polar bear, ok there was only 1 which was sad, but nevertheless a lively healthy looking specimen. Komodo dragons were also a recent addition and were very popular with the visitors, The gorilla pan was fantastic and they had several young of different ages, as had the orang-u-tans. It was a cold day and many of the animals were inside like elephant, giraffe, red panda, etc, but there was plenty to see. It was possible to go into the vulture/red kite enclosure without wire between us. The cheetahs were very active, but the lions and the tigers were inside. The zoo closes at 6pm in April. It also has a chairlift which was quite a novelty and the usual feeding displays/talks/shows including the usually amusing sealions. I also really liked the crocodile enclosure.
Great day out. A nice break from the city. A great day out especially for families. Really large zoo but make sure you catch the bus as it is a very long walk on foot.

Good day out. This was a cheap excursion and well worth it. We got there really easy as a bus was outside the metro which took us straight to the zoo. It was clean and well kept and the animals seemed happy.

Must see if you enjoy animals. This place is great and with all the public transportation, it's easy to get to. They have made a lot of recent improvements and the elephants are a highlight. They've got almost every animal imaginable. The enclosures are big and there is plenty of food and drink to keep you satisfied. You can get lost all day in this zoo!

Bigger than expected, good day out, easy to access. The zoo it well advertised and reasonably easy to travel to on the metro and then onto a bus which terminates at the zoo itself. The prices are very good for a zoo and excellent compared to prices i've payed for entrance to other attractions in Prague!Its a big attraction and has two levels, the level where you enter and then a second half on the hillside accessible by a cable car or a steep walk up the hillside. Unfortunetly I visited in mid February so a large ammount of the enclosures weren't open as obviously the African/Asian animals have to be kept warm. Also didn't help as we'd had a big covering of snow the night before so additional attractions were closed! Beautiful blanket of snow though!!Reccomend this 100%Easily a whole day out!!animals sizeprice

Incredible zoo.. This zoo was the best one I have visited. I visited in February when a thick blanket of snow covered the whole place. Out of season, the zoo was quiet and walking around it felt like I had the place to myself. I was pleased to see the animals in such well kept surroundings, and more importantly, looking happy.The variety of animals was incredible. It was mind blowing how close you could get to the tigers and giraffes. The free wifi in some of these enclosures was an added bonus too! I spent a whole day there. The views from the top looking out over Prague were simply breathtaking. Go, you won't be disappointed.

One of the best I've ever seen. We go to the zoo in all the cities we visit. Everybody told us the Praha Zoo is very special, but we never imagined that! The property is absolutely huge. And they were just building a beautiful large enclosure for the elephants.Speaking of large enclosures: the eagles' home was marvelous. We have never seen anything as big as that in any of the zoos we went to.The most impressive part of our visit was staying 10 centimetres away from a beautiful tiger. We had a glass wall between us. But it was a once in a lifetime experience! Loved it and surely will go back there one day!

worth visiting but not in winter. We visited the zoo in March, it was extremely cold and couldn't enjoy it. Very big, you should take a map so that you can see all of it without getting lost or seeing 2-3 times the same things. Due to winter time a lot of animals were missing and here were constructions in progress. I guess it will be really amazing in summer time!

Nice zoo with red panda. I've seen many zoos, can't say that Prague is by far the best, but it is very very good one. The territory is huge, so plan on 4-5 hours there. Definitely should see shy red panda (very rare for the zoos), big white bears, tiger and leopard. Africa territory was partly closed in March but still nice. If you like animals - definitely must-see. But you'd better eat outside, too many people for just one cafe inside the zoo.

GORGEOUS. I took my 6 year old, and we loved it. It was freezing because of a freak cold front, but they had hot cocoa and coffee machines to purchase cups at regular intervals. Plus, there were indoor exhibits at regular intervals. The views from this zoo are amazing. They were also building what looked like a huge Indian exhibit while we were there that I'm dying to go back and see. It looked amazing. The variety of animals is great, too. I loved the aviary. Great zoo!

Not for winter visit. We visited the Zoo Prague,hearing is one of the best in Europe.Unfortunately by the March was extremely cold and we were almost the only visitors. It looks very professional work and located in a suitable location with perfect view of Prague.There were a lot of areas under construction and a lot of animals had been moved temporarily. It should look much better in summertime.Also it would be beneficial if they could provide more information in English.

Good for kids. Came here to bring my kids (and play fair) and I was pleasingly surprise...really nice zoo with outstanding views over the river. We had a fantastic time!All the animals have lots of room and conditions are quite good.You can grab some snacks in the few restaurants...tasty and inexpensive!

cant fault it. Visited the zoo in the snow in March so wasn't expecting much, but from the moment I realised we were only paying £7 to enter to the moment we left I was very pleasantly surprised.The setting of the zoo are perfect, based in parkland around and up a hill, it is deceptively big and will take you most of the day to see everything.While snowing not many animals were outside but the indoor viewing places are excellent and as my partner is a passionate photographer she came away with some amazing photos of entertaining monkeys and a beautiful Lioness who rolled over and posed for the camera only inches away.An extra comment about the little zoo cafe we ate in where we got 2 different homemade soups and 2 drinks for around 6 pound.

The best zoo ever. It seems to be the best zoo I've ever been. Very big, well organized, nets don't spoil your photos, food is tasty and natural, our favorite places are monkey pavilion and bat caves! It's worth seeing!

Prague zoo: a great, affordable day out! (4 days in Prague). We visited the zoo by bus on our last day of a long weekend in Prague. The transport is direct and the entrance fee was low in comparison to other zoos I have visited. All the essential details can be found on their website. The animal enclosures were lovely and the animals were very active and seemed to be having a great time. Our highlights were the polar bears, honey badger, armadillos, and not to forget the baby gorillas and giraffe. The zoo is in development but we appreciated that they are making great improvements for the animals that do not disrupt your visit and we will go back on our return visit. In all, a lovely day out if you're lucky enough to have good weather with a good walk around and great view of the city. Food is reasonably priced too in comparison to city centre venues.

Must see if you like the zoo or have Children. We visited the zoo on our last day in Prague. We got there by using the metro and then a bus which was very easy and low cost one short journey ticket is enough for a 40 minute journey and you can buy a return ticket at the machine at the zoo so make sure you have some small change.The enclosures are very open with many of them having glass panelling so you can see straight into the enclosures for a very real close experience. The park is very large and i would definitely allocate a whole day to it. We would have spent much longer there if it wasn't so bitter cold.There is a large selection of animals and plenty of walking to do up and down hill!Whilst we where visiting the zoo where doing building work to improve there elephant enclosure which is due to be finished shortly.

Worth the visit. We have visited Prague three times over the past couple of years, this is the first time we ventured to the zoo, it was really easy ti get to from Prague center, just a few stops on the metro then a short bus ride. The bus stops right outside the zoo so you cant get lost, although they were busy making improvements it was still well worth the visit, the animals are so well looked after, probably the best zoo we have been to. We also had a meal at the cafeteria which was very nice and also very reasonable. We will definitely visit again next year.

If you live in Prague, get an annual pass!. Ranked as one of the top zoos in the world for their excellent breeding and other programs, this is a must-see in Prague! We have a yearly pass and use it regularly from March til October (otherwise its a bit cold, though the super-heated Indonesian building is GREAT in winter!). The animals look comfortable and happy, and there is a great variety, especially in Spring when all of the babies are born! The PERFECT place to take kids- there are play areas, a petting zoo, and lots of plexiglass to allow little ones to be able to see too (the penguins frequently play with young visitors through the glass- its darling). The information in English ranges from pretty decent to almost none, depending on the exhibit, but things are steadily improving. The zoo has recently built huge new areas for Elephants and other African animals, so you can see that they really care about the health and welfare of the animals.

Really worth to see, especially if you travel with children!. Prague zoo is one of the best zoo's in middle Europe, so it is really worth to see it. Very easy to get by transport, bus 112 goes there every 10-15 minutes during season months. You can catch it from metro stop Nadrazi Holesovice (red line).The only thing that is good to know - the best way to enjoy it is to go on a working day if you have such an opportunity. On weekends, especially on sunny days in summer, it can be over-croweded and somethimes it is a problem to get a sitting place for a lunch or to get closer to the most interesting animals.
£7.00 entrance 6 hours of fun. Really lovely zoo great prices a reall treat. Really good cafe facilities toilets located every where go after March as cable car is closed during winter

if you like zoos,do not miss it!. we really enjoyed our visit here,despite the cold,we had a walk outside,the temperature was for sure low,but the unit is sufficient and friendly to animals. i love aquariums,so we had a stop there, a variety of sea animals and fishes.

A lovely half day out, easy to get to and good value for money.. This was a lovely little surprise. It was easy to get to by bus from just outside the city center (we got bus 112) and the bus ran fairly frequently. It was was good value, about £7 per adult. They had lots of animals and the enclosures were really well presented. It is still under construction so I think it will be fantastic in a year or so. We went in winter so not all the animals were out (I can't blame them!) but we still had a thoroughly good time. It was a big zoo so expect a fair amount of walking. Also worth noting, not many of the signs provided English information, but this didn't really matter. Nice day out for adults and kids with all the animals you would typically expect in a zoo.

fantastic. would give it 6 stars if i could as its absolutely amazing! very easy to get to from city. a very well laid out zoo with so many animals and only a couple of foot away from you. we were lucky enough to see the tigers being fed!!! a great experience as your so close to them. would really recommend a trip out here. it's a massive place so go early in the day to get to see everything.

Massive zoo. A great variety of animals and was easy to travel to from the centre of Prague. Made our last day enjoyable rather than feeling like you were waiting around to travel to airport for an evening flight. A large area was under construction for the elephants but this didn't affect the wide range of animals that you were able to see. Great value.

Great Zoo, and still under development!. The zoo is very good! Animals seem well looked after. We went in the snow and although some animals were not outside, but most had indoor enclosures where you could see them. Well worth a visit, but make sure you take a whole day to do so. We only went for half a day and only got around about half of it...it is a BIG place. To get to the zoo from the city center the quickest way is a taxi, but this is expensive. Taking the metro to Nadrzi Holesovice station and the 112 bus to the zoo is the easiest, but takes about 40min or so. I think the bus only goes between the station and the zoo so you can't go wrong. Oh and they have Bush Babies which were unbelievably cute and can jump a very long way for their size!

A pleasant half day out. Access by tram and bus easier and cheaper than expected and zoo was quiet and quite charming the winter. Some info in English as well as Czech. Buiding works are underway for new facilities (due for Spring 2013 completion)
Beautiful zoo. Huge place so do plan for a full day here. A lot and lot of walking but with all the animals and wildlife here you don't even think about it.

You can easily get to ZOO by nice walk through Stromovka park. It is nice walk through Stromovka park, cross the pedestrian bridge over the river Vltava,turn left behind the bridge and continue straight some 500m. You will have Troja chateau at your right hand ( also worth seing in summer). New in ZOO now : little gorilla ( born January 2013)-big attraction.

If you enjoy zoos this is one of the best. I know a day at the zoo is not to everyones taste but Prague Zoo did seem better than many others I have visited.Our visit was during snow so many animals were indoors.The animals indoors (our favourites including gorillas, tigers (plus many other large cats) and some galapogos tortoises) all seemed to be in fantastic health as did every single animal we saw.Of course you see some large birds etc caged and think how cramped they look but that is sadly the nature of a zoo.The grounds of the zoo are massive so expect plenty of walking.

felt sorry. We spent the day at the zoo. Lots of different animals and I don't think we got to see it all. Parts of it were under construction. I did however feel a little sorry for some of the animals. The one elephant only walked backwards and it was sad to see. The polar bear just swan back and force in such a very small space and didn't do anything else. Would not recommend to be honest, so much other stuff you could be doing in the city.
Just WOW!. Simple words: I LOVE IT! Almost no cages, just free space for people to meet with the animals and for animals to feel free :)

Thoughtfully designed exhibit with very active animals, even in the middle of winter.. We visited the zoo upon reading good reviews from TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed!The zoo is quite large and has plenty of exhibits. For some reason all their animals are active; we watched the polar bears for at least 15 minutes and they were just playing and running around.The zoo is built next to a hill, some paths are gentle slopes but they are not demanding at all. The view from the top of the hill has great views of the area, including the Vltava. There is an outdoor mountain goat exhibit that masterfully uses the landscape of the area.The animals rarely hide or shy away from people. In fact, we had a camel, an emu, an otter, a penguin, and various monkeys that walk up to us in their respective exhibits.However, all the placards are written in Czech (with some English in certain exhibits), so it isn't as educational in that respect.The restaurants and vending machines in the zoo are quite reasonable. I wouldn't consider them cheap, but they are definitely not Old Prague prices either.We went in winter during a snow day, so we didn't sit out much. But we saw plenty of family friendly picnic areas, sensibly designed and common throughout the zoo.
Well kept animals.. Never though I'd say this but there are more animals (lots of each) than London Zoo. Great enclosures and you can get very close to most animals.

great zoo. We love zoos and this didn't disappoint, really good collection and very clean with decent facilities, be prepared to do a lot of walking to see everything, they are improving some of the enclosures and when finished the goodwill be even better.

Best zoo ever. This is truly the best I have ever seen. Ever since the great fllods it has added services and animals. It is very friendly and targets all sorts of visitors from families with children to couples on a date.
Wonderful! Don't miss.. There are ZOOs looking like museums and there are ZOOs like the one in Prague. You will really enjoy your stay there.

brilliant zoo. cost around 8 euro to go in and had a great time there. was very clean and the animals had lots of space. some of the paths were hilly and you should wear comfortable shoes. Loved the indoor place where the tigers were. transport to the zoo is comfortable and reliable. Get the underground train to Nadrazi Holesovice and get a bus from outside the station and have a great day there
Had a lovely day!. The site was brilliant, spacious and relaxing. The food was really tasty and the overall day was cheap! Most importantly, the animals seemed happy and content :)
Great experience. Spacious and modern zoo, all animals are kept very well. It's better to stay all day here, donť forget to visit famous gorilla family.

Great way to spend the afternoon.. Easy to get to by public transport. Lots to see and not too much walking (unlike the Toronto Zoo). Very compact yet totally amazing the way they accomodated the needs of each of the animals. Great way to spend the afternoon. Reasonable price and food as well. Friendly, lots of families and dogs. Took the ferry back along the river to downtown Prague. Great way to end the day with a boat cruise - you get to see a different view of Prague. Reasonably priced as well. Definitely worth seeing if you are in Prague.

Worth a visit!. Definitely worth a visit if you're a bit longer in Prague. It's relatively (or it used to be at least...) cheap, but it's a beautiful zoo, where you can have great walk and some nice views

Great way to spend the day. The zoo is very easy to get to by public transport. We took two metro trains and the 112 bus from the city center using 90 minute ticket. The zoo, as a main attraction of Prague, was easy to find and well sign posted. The zoo itself is amazing. We spent over four hours in it and only managed to visit two thirds of the enclosures. There is a large variety of animals in spacious and very well designed enclosures. Highlights included the gorillas, seals and the various large birds of prey. Do not miss the Indonesian Jungle if possible,It is worth the trip if you can spare the time.

Great big Zoo. The Prague Zoo is one of the largest in Europe. There is a bus from the metro every 10 min. and the zoo is really huge, had a really great time. Make sure to take a map or somethig 'cause you can really get lost and miss a lot of animals.

Great Zoo. We went here in January just after New Year - there was quite alot of building work going on and the cable cars were not working but we spent a really enjoyable day here. The zoo is massive and the animals enclosures had been well though out for them and the visitors. Very easy to get to on public transport. It's well priced and the cafe is also reasonable. Some enclosures have bats flying free which can be a bit alarming ! Didn't see the elephants as there new enclosure was being completed.Great day out

big and beaty. a great place for the whole family. You can walk all day. You can purchase a ticket for 3 Entertainment - Zoo , Botanical Gardens and the Castle Troy. You can climb to the second level by cable railway , but it's though a bit scary.
Loved it!!!. Beautiful zoo and wonderful animals visited last week so we weren't able to see all the animal as some or locked up for the winter but still worth the vist.

Very impressed. Out of all the zoos I have recently visited such as Dublin, London and Berlin, Prague was defiantly my favourite zoo. I found the zoo very accessible to reach, it is served by a bus which departs from a train station regularly. On arrival to the zoo I noticed that the prices were very reasonable, 200 CZK which is roughly 8 euro which is very cheap for a zoo! On entering the zoo I was admiring the lovely surroundings, the zoo appeared to located on a hill but alot of it was downhill. There was a wide variety of animals and I was impressed that most animals had an adequate sized enclosure. There were various indoor displays such as the African house, rainforest and tigers. I was pleasantly surprised that the gifts in the gift shops were decently priced unlike other zoos I visited and there were alot of things to choose from. If visiting Prague this is a definite place you should visit.

Best Zoo Going. I never get my hope's to high when im looking forward to going somewereBut this Zoo did not let down :)By far the best zoo i ever been to, the animals had such nice Exhibits and looked very taken care of, it was hard to figure out which direction we where going as we had no map to help, but we got to see what we wanted to , except i did not find the Scope as i thought it was going to be where Owl's were listed on the map so i was sad not to see this Owl , Still an amazing zoo, keep up the good work , and everybody should visit here as it is easy to get to

Maybe winter wasn't an ideal time for a visit.. As zoo's go, Prague's is definitely up there with the best, a grand selection of exotic animals, and their enclosures are a lot larger and better equipped than some other zoo's that I've visited previously. The layout is fine, it's easy to find via public transport, and the entry fee is very reasonable. We visited the zoo mid-winter, so a lot of the larger enclosures appeared empty, most large animals were instead kept inside smaller rooms, and appeared bored and lethargic. It hit home that animals such as tigers and gorillas do not belong in the kind of cold climate which Prague offers for much of the year.

Great little day trip. While not the largest zoo around, the Prague zoo is nice and open, well laid out, with a lot of variety of animals.In particular, the African Exhibit is beautifully set up, as is the indoor monkey display.Some beautiful views of Prague and the river are also available.

A Zoo going through an upgrade. Probably visited at the wrong time of year as most of the animals were inside due to the cold and the zoo looked like a 'work in progress'. I'm hoping by the Spring the zoo will have their lovely animals in bigger enclosures with much more vegetation and looking a little less sad. The day there upset me more than anything :-(

winter break. even in winter, Zoo is a good place to go if you're in town for 3 or 4 days. You can get there thru bus (connecting from a Underground station). Huge diversity and lots of walk in a Zoo, for sure. I'd consider going in early hours to avoid queue and also because staff is not that bad at this time. Although some species weren't there because of the weather and temperature (lots of red spots warning you about this - but only in Czech). Maps available in the entrance for 1 euro (English, Czech and Russian only).

if you get to Prague, you must see the Zoo. It's worth it!!! If you get to Prague, you must save one day for visit the Zoo, because is big enought. You must start the day there and take your time! I was very impress by the variety but, the most important, the excelence condition made for the animals. It's impresiv also for the adults!!!

Huge zoo, good value, but not sure if the animals are happy.. We came here with high expectations as we heard it was in the top 5 zoos in the world! The zoo is very big and has a huge amount of animals. I was disappointed because we did not see any elephants due to them building the new enclosure. My partner was excited to see the orangutans and we did not see them either. Being a rainy January day a lot of the animals were not out so we missed out on a few things. It made us feel sad because some animals only had a small space and seemed distressed or depressed! There was a tiger pacing and kept headbutting the gate to be let out. The polar bear and cheetahs also paced. The gorillas laid around and looked very sad.There were large parts of the zoo seemingly unused, and I feel that it could have been used for the larger animals to be housed in, instead of locked up in small tanks with children banging on the glass and taking pictures with the flash on!Most of the staff seemed young, and we approached some to ask where to find a map. Three of them all walked past us as if we weren't there. Someone eventually pointed us to the information centre for a map, when we got there a young woman was just locking the door, we asked her if we could get a map there, she rolled her eyes, tutted, sighed and unlocked the door. She then had an attitude when we bought it, huffing as we looked through our money. Nice customer service!Good value for money and you could spend a day here, just wish the animals had more space.

Great outing for a pleasant day. We've been to Prague Zoo several times. It's a great place to while away half a day or even more. The site is huge and there is so much to see: every time we visit we discover something new.The chair lift is great fun and a quick way to get to the upper paddocks. The Zoo has multiple cafes with play areas for children.The gorilla enclosure is a must see as is the wild cats enclosure. We recommend visiting on a mild/warm day: you'll be spending a lot of time outdoors, so better to avoid extremes of temperature or weather.
great. This place was astounding. really cant wait to bring my children to prague. everything is in this park. anyone coming to prague at any time of year should visit.

Great!. We drove there (free parking if you visit the zoo, use the ticket code when leaving the parking) and although it started raining we had a funt ime first visiting the closed pavilions with monkeys. just when we thought that we have seen it all we realized that there is one more part below, apparently there is a cable car in the summar connecting the two parts. lots of tigers and wild cats, the lion was sleeping, the snakes stink like hell:) well,a ll terrariums do:) did not however see the lephants it seems they are building a new enclosure for them. the pavilions with giraffes is quite big and they have space to walk around, the meercats are just adorable:) my daughter scanne dthe entire are aas tehre are coin machines with Zoo medals, make sure you have change on you, she collected several. seems to be well connected with public tramsportation as we saw several buses stop right in front of the entrance. the map of the place is available for a small fee, soda and candy machines are available.
Great large zoo, walk around all day. Fantastic large zoo, good food, take good walking boots and must visit the new Elephant enclosure next time. Just missed opening when we visited

Loved the zoo!. Could not fault the zoo. There are a lot of animals to see! It's very easy to get too. You need to take the Metro line C (red line) to Nadrazi Holesovice and then take the bus no 112, which literally drops you right outside of the entrance. Everything is very clearly sign posted and you can use your Metro tickets. Having student cards meant it was very cheap to go in as well. Brilliant.
nice one. too big when the weather isn't perfect, but it's beautifull and worth a visit. go to monkey pavilon and go see bats and insects, bit creepy, but interesting :)
Worth the trip. There is a quite large selection of animals and the place is modern and in good condition. Unfortunately it is a bit spread out and some areas are very boring even for young kids.

A fantastic place for kids. A great ZOO that got partially destroied by a flood in 2002. They rebuild a great pavilion of primates, fantasticly huge space for girafes with nice observation decks. To get there take Metro “C” (subway) to station Nadrazi Holesovice and then by bus #112. The regular public transportation tickets are valid, no need to get a special ticket. The ride takes 10-15 minutes. I believe the bus leaves every 15-20 minutes in the summer and a bit longer in the winter. Your concierge will give you a timetable. Pragers are rightfully very proud of their ZOO.

A good and varied attraction in a spacious part of the city. Prague Zoo is easily accessible by metro line C and a short bus ride from the city centre (if you're energetic enough, you can walk it, through Stromovka and up the hill). It is a very large and varied attraction well worth more than a few hours. Large enclosures for the animals, everything from giraffes to spiders to farm animals. Good eating options just outside. If you combine it with the other attractions in the area (Troja Castle, Botanical Garden), you will really need all day.

One of the top zoos. Being a photographer I have visited a lot of zoos around the world and Zoo Praha is a favourite of mine. What I always look for in a zoo is the variety of animals, their enclosures and what the zoo does to look after them and conservation. I can say that I wasn't disappointed with the enclosures and really enjoyed my walk around. It is a very large zoo so there is plenty to see and the price of admission is very decent.This zoo also allows you to bring your dog as long as they are kept on a leash. You will find water bowls around to accommodate your pets thirst. I find this amazing as a majority of zoos don't allow dogs and from what I've seen they are very well behaved.I'd recommend visiting Zoo Praha if you love animals or if you want a good family day out.

Animals up close. This Zoo has been gradually updating itself over the years and the status of the enclosures is improving all the time. I had a really moment while watching the Gorilla's as one of them was going from the inside to the outside through a narrow glass tunnel he stopped and looked at me, we were less than 1m apart and I really felt he was looking at me and thinking sometime. I will never forget that moment.

To the Prague Zoo in winter?. Of course yes! You can watch the newly born lovely gorilla-baby (Dec. 22nd, 2012) with his/her "family group", new elefant "teenage-girls" Tamara and Yanita (from Sri Lanka) and another more than 4,300 animals of more than 670 species. Playgrounds for children, restaurants, souvenirs.
Love them animals. It is snowing, we enjoyed the walk uphill the zoo. The cheetah, or was it leapord was just beautiful running freely.

Huge!. Prague zoo is massive. There is so much to see and a really wide variety of animals. We spent all day there and it was well worth the money (it wasn't expensive either). Relatively easy to travel to from the City Centre too. Despite it being cold we still saw most the animals and the indoor pavilions were a nice break from the minus temperatures, even if the camera lens did struggle a little.

One of the world's best zoos, rivals San Diego. Great Design, very well cared for animals. Very reasonably priced. For the family of 4 (1 student, 1 under 15 and 2 adults) less than $40. You can spend an entire day here. Plenty of parking available and easy to get to from downtown Prague. The zoo is so well thought out in its layout and how things are positioned. I highly recommend a visit if you are trying to see the city with kids or teenagers. It offers a great break from visiting 12th-13th century churches. There are plenty of restaurants and snack bars. Great for children of all ages
among top ten zoos of the world. Go there by bus, come back by boat!The zoo itself is huge, full of very special exhibits. I was fascinated by the space for birds of prey. It looked so natural.

Winter at the Prague ZOO. Me and my girlfriend arrived to the ZOO at 12:00 PM, was a bit snowy outside so we had a clear idea that some of the animals will not be in their areas. The surrounding area inside and outside the ZOO was beautiful !! Especially inside the ZOO. The guy in the entrance told us "Today is a special day, price for 2 people is only 2 CZK", we were very surprised by the cheap ticket pricing, we asked again, and he replied the same.. I think it was due to the fact that it was very cold and had only a few visitors but we didn't ask too many questions, he's English was very basic and even if we would asked to pay 200 CZK (which is the price at winter according to their website) we would happily pay. The ZOO is huge, at least for us....(comparing to Amsterdam ZOO) we had a great time, next time we will come back in the summer...Amazing at winter but still would be more reasonable to visit at hotter seasons. After a few minutes we started to feel a bit cheer by the fact that a few animals were "missing" from their areas since it was way too cold for some animals to just wonder around in their areas, for us it felt like a long walk in an amazing park with a few animals, so although some of the animals were "missing" we had a great time.
Good fun for kids. Nicely built, new pavillons. The lower parts reconstructed after the 2002 high water. Good fun for kids. Can be very crowded during the high season, though

Truly in world's TOP10. I love ZOOs, so if any city has one (with elephants ;-), I go visit. I had the opportunity to see ZOOs thru Europe and US and I recall only a few better and mostly just better exhibits, not the whole park. It's a crown jewel of Prague and they're better each year!
Worth seeing. For me, Prague Zoo is one of the best zoo gardens, I've ever been. A huge one with a lot of species.

Fantastic!. I absolutely LOVED my visit to the zoo!I saw animals I had never seen before (elephant and polar bears) which was incredibly exciting, and I loved that it wasn't a flat zoo, it had elevation, which meant it had a mountainous area. I loved the way they made certain exhibitions very realistic, for example, in the indonesian jungle they have carved canoes on the floor, and the fish tanks have vines inside really making it an enjoyable experience.It started to snow while I was there and it snowed quite heavily which was a lot of fun to walk around a zoo in the snow. But it was really very cold there (because of the elevated position), so wrap up!I loved seeing the baby kangaroo in its mother's pouch and seeing the penguins and polar bears walking among the snow. The range of animals they hold is excellent and they zoo itself is really nice, the animals are kept comfortable.

just great. its my first and main attraction every time i visit prague. me and my wife just love walking around in the zoo. i never managed to walk it all of it. the last time we were there it was snowing but we still had a fantastic time.

super interesting day. our second visit here and enjoyed it as much as the first , think was 5 and half hours spent walking around looking at close quarters at the animals , easy to get to just get to holesvice one the main stations and easy to get to then 1 bus think was 112 to zoo but well signposted and takes 20 odd minutes , once arrived just opver £ 6 each to get in and a map for 15 pence , then walk round and enjoy it all , they almost finished the elephant enclosure but still see the elephants and my best was probably the emu spent 20 mins playing with him from very very close range , my partner she liked the polar bears and big cats , but monkey enclosure is extrememly good , the day was cold but saw most the animlas and zoo easy to navigate and see all , signs mostly in czech but not a problem , so go and enjoy if in prague spend day there then night time enjoying food , bars , charles bridge and times square

Best ZOO. We visit Prague Zoo every year, it ´ s fantastic, every year is new attraction, now is in building new place for elephants, hippos etc. We reccomend minimum 4 hours for visit all places. Near is Slalom canal for kayakers, rafters, - in nice weather is nice show too :-) , and it ´s free.
very good to go for all the day. You have to visit Prague Zoo you will stay there all the day .Don't go on Sunday because all the locals is going there and it so crowded for food and everywhere

Brilliant zoo.....one of the best. I loved this zoo, despite travelling in November when the country is quite cold, there was still plenty to see at the zoo. It is incredibly easy to get to on the bus and probably the cheapest entry fee i've paid to get into a zoo anywhere. The zoo itself is very large, I think it took us over 4 hours to get the whole way round and the elephants/rhinos were closed because they're building them new living facilities so i expect in the summer it could take even longer.The zoo has a fantastic selection of animals and some are quite lively (especially the monkeys!).We ate at the zoo in one of the cafes and the prices are very good, not overinflated like tourist attractions often can be. If you're in Prague for a few days, i'd definitely recommend a visit to the zoo.

Great Zoo. I'm not sure, but according to time spent there, it's the biggest zoo in Europe! 5 hours flew by and we didn't visit everything!!! It's better to plan one-day-staying in the Zoo and spring-summer visit is preferred (I was there in late autumn and quite all birds and monkeys were in cages).

Well Laid Out. Had a great time at the Zoo. Lots of variety of animals, and very family friendly. I hear it one of the bigger Zoos in Europe. It took two modes of transportation to get there that is the only negative I have about the over all experience.
The Pony ride and kids farm. My daughter 5 yrs loves the pony ride and kids farm! very good place for the kids. More things during the weekend

We are children of any age - you will like it!. We are children of any age - you will like it! It's the biggest zoo in Europe. It takes all day! I recommend the eating joint near with owls - nice place. St. Martin's menu was delicious.

Nice grounds, could use more animals. I make a point of visiting zoos whenever possible, so was excited about the Prague Zoo. I enjoyed it but found it a bit disappointing.To get there by public transport, take a Metro (red) to Nadrazi Holesovice, which is a Metro/Bus station, and take the Bus #112 to the end.The grounds of the zoo are very nice, although it is rather confusing to walk around and there are several areas under construction. There are supposed to be some trams for internal transport, but they were not operation while we were there.Most of the exhibit areas are reasonably spacious, but it was difficult to see some of the animals and it appeared that a number were empty. There were some indoor areas with fruit bats, etc. One of the indoor areas appeared to have mice in several of the glass enclosed cages that were eating the food left for the exhibited animals. These mice were multiplying and one hopes that they will be removed before the animals become overrun.If you have extra time and enjoy zoos it is worth a visit, but I would not put this on the list of my top zoos. It might be somewhat better in the summer when more animals are out and more things are open.

Excellent Zoo once you realise you can't judge it by British standards.. A huge selection of animals, well laid out, looks like huge investment is being implemented. Some of the animals look like they could do with larger enclosures, however it seems that new areas are being built to overcome these concerns, one not to miss

Well laid out zoo, if a little dated in parts. Being In the zoo industry ourselves wherever we go on holiday we take a busman's holiday and check out the nearest zoo. To get there from the centre of Prague means travelling on two tubes lines and a bus, however thanks to clear instructions from our apartment landlord and a very easy to use system we arrived there very quickly ( tip on the metro when you buy your ticket don't forget to validate it in the yellow machine before you board) . The zoo has a pretty non descript entrance and although the ticket desk did not speak much English we purchased our entry tickets and an English guide and map quite easily. Entrance cost about £8 an adult. The zoo is well laid out and easy to follow on the map, beware though there are a lot of uneven surfaces and some steep hills. There are parts of the zoo that are very dated, very old enclosures and yet huge investment is being made in other areas. The new elephant and hippo enclosure that is still being built looked amazing. What didn't I like about the zoo: some of the bird aviaries were very dirty with lots of excrement, some had tonnes of leaves on the roof which left the birds in darkness, and a lot of the animals were showing stereotypic behaviour ( some of which could have been avoided with better management of their enclosures). The other thing that was missing was any interaction with the public, keepers were nowhere to be seen , there were no keepers talks or feeds , would have made visit so much more enjoyable if we had been told why things were happening. What I did like : the grounds were very well laid out, the Indonesian pavilion was amazing!! Lots of animals I had not seen before and to have bats flying around you in daylight was an incredible experience. The gorilla enclosure was great and got you right up close to the animals,and we were lucky enough to get there as the gorillas were let back into their enclosure for feeding. We spent a good 4 hours there and probably a visit could take longer but in November it is very very cold and a lot of the animals were tucked up inside ( who could blame them!) Catering is limited, big restaurant at the entrance and then lots of smaller eateries around the grounds serving snacks and fast food, first time I have ever had a deep fried burger!! Would have been nice if they had the menu translated into a few languages, we had no idea what they were serving, staff could not speak English so we just pointed to something someone else had. Very small shop selling limited gifts. A nice afternoon out, some unusual animals but need to work to bring it up to the standards expected from a modern zoo.

Worth A Visit. Took my 4 year old out to Prague Zoo. Had been told by many it was a worthwhile zoo to visit. Well laid out with planty of walking to be done, there was a pleasant display of inclosures. I was relieved to see that most inclosures had doors with an exit to natural outdoor space. Even more pleasing was the new inclosure for the elephants currently under construction. They are in for a treat.Loved the Bat Eared Fox and the Polar Bears were totally at home in the 3 degree day we had for our visit. Good enough for a swimm and frolic in the water for one bear. It was a joy to watch.Even enjoyed a meal in the restaurant after the geological trail. A very nice plate of potato gnocchi with fine bacon and sour cabbage hit the spot for a hungry-for-czech-food appetite. Reasonably priced too. Most impressed with the catering in this zoo after my familiarity with the crap found in hometown Sydney's Taronga Zoo. That goes the same for the zoo entry price. While the average Sydney family might need to save for a couple of weeks for a zoo entry ticket at Taronga, Prague's zoo cost myself and 4 year old just 300k ($15).Also entertaining were Australia's own sugar gliders who were having a riot of a time and giving a hysterical display if antics in their nocturne house.It is a good and worthwhile day out especially with children.

One Of The Best. I have been living here in Prague for 6,5 years in Prague, I go to the zoo at least once a year. You get to see a great variety of animals living in very good conditions. If you are visiting Prague and are an animal lover like myself, make sure you pay the zoo a visit.
Well appointed. The ZOO works wonderfully with the nature around. E.g. the mountain goats' annex is set into the rocky cliffs above the river. Very natural looking.

Great day out. Loved this zoo! Plenty to see - even had two polar bears! There is a free bus from the bus station to and from the zoo and it runs regularly. We spent the day here and still didn't see everything. Suits all ages, very reasonably priced entrance fee and plenty of food outlets to cater for every palate.

A great day out with the children. The zoo is very nice indeed, a lot of animals, albeit some of them a bit repetitive, for instance birds and "Bambies". The cafeteria at the entrance offers decent food at decent prices, worth mentioning in Prague. We took the boat to the zoo as transport is otherwise not very easy, but the boat ride in Prague is just great!! There are two docks where you can take the boat from the center to the zoo, be sure to take the boat from the south one to enjoy great views of Prague and Charles' bridge. The boat leaves you at about 10 minutes by foot from the zoo (nice walk too!)These boats don't work in the winter though.

a laaaaaarge ZOO. A very large ZOO with all the animals you can imagine and a lot of attractions. Try also the botanic nearby in Troja just next to the ZOO. Be prepared for at least full afternoon to enjoy it. Only thing I would improve is the food (yes, there is a lot of fast foods but I really miss one good restaurant in the premises...)
Many different type of animals. Beautiful and large zoo, they have beautiful monkey pavillion. You can even "adopt" animal. Great for all year roung trips with kids or romantic days out.

Zoo modernisation. Prague Zoo is modernising to address cramped conditions for many of it's residents and the flooding of a few years back. A 600 Crowns for a family ticket, it is unbeatable value for hours of educational entertainment.

One of the best ZOO's in Europe. I have seen a lot of ZOO's across Europe and I this one defenetly finishes top three on my list. It has everything ZOO can offer to you . Lots of different spicies of animals from all around the world from polar bear to three different varieties of tigers. I was very impressed with Indonesian jungle dome that is placed in the centre of ZOO where bats fly around freely around your heads. Currently they are renewing some parts of the ZOO and we weren't able to see all the animals (hippos, giraffs,...), but when construction works will be finished in the beginning of 2013 they will have all imaginable spicies - except for pandas :)
