Fantastic park!. You can walk for ten minutes without passing a single human in this wast and beatiful park!Spend almost six hours enjoying the wild exhibits and amazing scenery.This is especially the place to be if your a bird lover :)

Prague Zoo, a real nice surprise. We went for a day with kids and grandparents to Prague Zoo. Was not sure what to expect but it was superb and in some ways better than San Diego Zoo where we were in August.A fantastic range of animals and a chance to get real close - for example, tigers have big enclosure but when fed they are inside right next to glass wall so you are 3 feet from them. Tigers, lions, polar bears, wolves etc. Wolves were amazing.Set over a big hill but you can take chairlift up to top and walk your way down and around. Getting there from central Prague via metro and bus (112) only took 35 minutes and work off one ticket.Only cost 700 crowns (23 pounds) for 2 adults and 3 kids, bargain! And grandparents were free.

A fantastic zoo!!!. We are regular vistors at different zoos due to travelling with our toddler. The Prague Zoo is one of the best we have seen. The living conditions for the animals are great, and the variety there amazing.

disappointed. We read a lot of fantastic reviews about the Zoo. There were even reviews saying the visit lasted over 5 hours...Well, our "visit" lasted only 3 hours because the Zoo is not fantastic, is just nice. The Zoo in Budapest in fantastic , this one isn't
great place to visit. very well taken care ZOO. Amazing developments.... Love the project for the elephant pavilon. Good level of snacks inside the ZOO.
Good even if you don't like zoos. My wife doesn't really enjoy zoos, but this one is so good - layout and also variety of animals - that she gave it an enthusiastic endorsement

Good day out - Watch out for the high speed buggys. Went to the zoo last Wednesday, and it is a beautiful place well worth a visit. Parts of it are under renovation, and nearing completion this does not detract from a good day out.The staff drive around in high speed (20-30mph) electric buggies which are very quiet. My daughter panicked and froze when one came flying round the corner of the path where we were admiring the parrots. I challenged him and demanded that he slowed down, only to be subjected to a string of abuse in Cz - rather disappointing from a middle aged man with a grey beard and cowboy type hat !! Seriously though if these vehicles continue to drive along the zoos paths at the speeds they do there will be a serious accident probably involving a child as they are the most vulnerable.

Huge and very enjoyable!. We felt like we walked 10 miles touring the zoo. It is huge! cost is very reasonable actually cheap based upon US Prices. Bring your camera! The displays place the animals in large open areas making it seem like you are not in a zoo at all.

One of the best zoo's in Europe. If you are in Prague and have the time stop and se the zoo.
It is very well layed out and is quite an enjoyable way to spend an afternoon be it with the family or by ones self.

Really fun. Man, Zoos are really cool. As was this one.We had a really fun time just wandering around and looking at all the cool animals. We loved the seals and the tigers best. It takes about 5 hours to go around the whole thing and there is a decent and reasonably priced restaurant there as well.Really good value at about 200 CzK for a student.

Lots of animals in varied settings. Prague zoo is a little out of town, but if you like to see a good variety of animals it’s well worth a visit. We actually took the boat from Prague rather than a tram. The river journey is pleasant without being spectacular. However, if you time it right you can travel from a further quay and include a boat trip through Prague as part of your day out (do be very careful when you examine the timetables as you need to be sure which boats leave from which quay). There was a 10 minute walk at the far end, but easy to follow and easy terrain. The zoo itself is quite varied to walk around. They have made an attempt to give character to each area (Africa here, rain forest there, etc.). There was a lot of development going on for the elephants when we were there, so I expect that to be significantly improved by 2013. There were times where we weren’t sure the animals were completely OK. The three polar bears were simple parading back and forth in a very repetitive behaviour manner that was something you used to see in old zoos. However, this could simply have been because of the heat. Most of the animals looked content enough. One word of warning for the bat-phobic: don’t go into the rain forest exhibit. Towards the end you have to go through a dark tunnel where the bats are free to fly around. There are half height glass panels, but if you get some complete imbeciles who insist on shaking the branches then you get a large number of bats flying out over your head. They are harmless, but large fruit bats. My wife doesn’t like anything flying around her head, let alone bats, but you are not allowed to back out. Staff insist you walk (or run!) through the enclosure. We had a bite to eat at the small restaurant outside the zoo, which was OK. We didn’t see anything inside that looked particularly better, but we probably didn’t cover everything (it is quite large). If you plan your walk right you can travel from the upper to lower sections via a chair lift. Looked fun, but we didn’t plan our walk right. All in all, if you enjoy zoos, you should enjoy this one too, and it does offer a change of pace from the crowded tourist areas in Prague itself

Loved it. A very cheap day out, loads of animals to see and a little performance from the seals, only downside was the african animals were closed as they were building new pens, it was very big and a good day out

An unusual and well-managed zoo. Here the landscaping is very intriguing, over various levels of height and with interesting water features running through it, and with interesting zoo architecture. The animal collection is verfy good in that it contains certain original species you wouldn't find in every zoo. Maned wolf, gavial, aardvark, these are just some of the interesting exhibits you won't get everywhere. Could do with an aquarium section - there are aquariums in one or two of the houses like the Indonesian one, but they are not dedicated aquaria. With the exception of the elephants, the animals appeared to have enough space and to be happy.
Excellent Zoo. Plenty of beautiful animals to see - plenty places to eat and drink. Very good value for money. Easy to get to by metro and bus.
all time favourite for prague families. Great place for a whole day trip, not particularly cheap, but you have to believe its for the animals.
a great day out with kids.. Excellent zoo went by boat but it's a long walk from the wharf. The chairlift was a hit and the lemurs were great.

Amazing!. A fantastic zoo! The Zoo is really huge! Animals are in good conditions, lots of tourists there, it could easily take you all day to see the majority of it. Many of the animals look like being in free nature. The best zoo I have ever been to.
A good selection of animals. Very enjoyable , easy access and some different animals to see, all clean, healthy and happy . Limited food selection

Animal Planet !. I could see most of the animals here which I had only heard off. They have been very well maintained. This is surely the best zoo I have ever been to. I had been there with a zoom lens, so it was totally worth it. Only negative part is that, many of the boards are in Czech. So could not identify some of the reptiles and animals.

Probably the best zoo on the world!. What a fantastic zoo, firstly the prices to get in now around £6 per person! An absolute bargain for a whole day out! There is so much to see and do already & they are further expanding! Due to major flooding in Prague many years ago the zoo go destroyed and is still in the processs of being rebuilt. . . However what a great job they have done! Tonnes of animals and if you plan your day right you can watch their feeding times or even feed some goats yourself! Fantastic all around day out!

JUST OK!. Well nothing too good or too bad about this place. its big, clean and has plenty of animals. i mis took it for a bird park cuz we could only see birds in the start. we took a tram ride which was not worth it. the driver pretended he knew no english and made no stops or slow down for us to click pictures. just start to finish in 20 mins.

Reinvented a child inside me. Had some spare time, decided to go to the Zoo. It was worth it, since the weather was fine. The Zoo is really huge! Animals are in good conditions, lots of tourists there. I'm not a fan of all these caged animals, but they seemed to be happy there. You can spend a lot of time exploring different areas of the Zoo. Of course, it's the perfect option for families with kids, but even for me (a single adult) it was pretty good. If you already explored the Old Prague & you have nothing important to do - go and see the Zoo. It's like to be back to school :)

Huge ZOO full of gems. It could easily take you all day to see the majority of it. It is huge and very famous. Located on the hill above Vltava river, right next to Troy Castle, which you could see at the same time, just like the smaller part of the Botanical Garden right next to it. ZOO has a lot to offer and some world unique specimen. Worth of seeing.

Wildest Moments. The Zoo of Prague is awesome. It's really big and the the animals are living in a really nice environment. The Zoo's own spacious savanne seems quite unique to me! The Zoo is really worth visiting when you're staying in Prague and have (half) a day left, it's a nice attraction when you've already seen the classic ones!

Zoo Prague. Really great place to go to. Alone, with friends or children. Many of the animals look like being in free nature. I would only appreciate some food for coeliacs (gluten free). We spent there more than 4 hours and still didn't see it all. Great experience.
nice and intersting. So meny difrent annimal,and tiket for enter is not so much ekspensive because it is about 8 euro for a person

nice zoo. the design of the zoo is quite well done with the exhibits worked into the existing topography of the site. Wonderful views to the city from the south and west sides of the zoo. Don't miss the polar bears or otters.

Excellent.. Gigant territory, various animals, birds, insects and so.Exciting close biosperes:birds, who fly aroubd us; bats, who touch your head in twilights; atmosphere of jungle.Show of seals, from which it is impossible to break away.6 hour of walking, playground for children.No things that was disliked.

Such a reasonably priced zoo. I know zoo's are a cop out as far as sight seeing goes but Prague zoo was damaged badly by flooding a couple of years ago and the regeneration is still undergoing. But what they are doing is really impressive: beautiful setting and great enclosures. Some information in several languages. And its so reasonable in terms of entry and food and rides (especially compared to for example London Zoo!). Recommended if you have a day to spare and are history saturated
Cute animals!. Easy to get into, tram and bus from the Old Town took about 20 minutes. Lots of cute animals, for example Asian and African tigers, elephants, horses and penguins.

One of best in Europe!. Plan the most of your day out if you decide to visit the Prague zoo. Excellent for children, extensive and large type of animals. It also offer you the choice to sponsor some of the animals - great idea!

Great fun. We spent 6 and half hours in there! Do not think you will see everything in less then that! It is great ZOO. Animals have nice closures and the walk in cages with birds are good extra. New elephant and hyppo closure looks great, just shame it wasn't finished yet. Sea lions show is fun half an hour, try to come earlier so you can get a seat. The chair lift is bit scary, but saves time and energy especially on a hot day, like we had.
good value. the zoo was good value and plenty of different animals it took a good half a day to walk around,there were plenty of snack bars around the zoo
Fantastic day out even without kids. fantastic facilities, very well doneBring plenty of coins for machinesWatch out for rip off taxi drivers outside, charge double, fast meters

Adorable. This is one of the most adorable zoos I have ever seen! The terrariums are spacious and interesting and the animals look quite content and well cared for. I managed to see all of the animals except the savannah terrarium (zebras, giraffes, ostriches) and I loved it! There was one creepy moment though- one of the wild horses had a number "24" carved into its flank. I hope this wasn't the work of the zoo officials :(

Happy day to be had. The Zoo is full of a wide range of animals all well housed and described. There are little trains to take you around and a cable car to scare you and a free hire of wooden carts to pull the tired children and day packs. The Zoo is on a hill so take good shoes. Various restaurants, ice-cream points and refreshment stops are dotted around.The children loved the sandpit which allowed them to "excavate fossils" which were then described on boards nearby and exhibited in a nearby shop. Such na inspiring idea to discover dinosaur’s footprints in the sand…We found the shops limited and uninspiring so no souvenirs
Well worth a visit. Well organised and plenty to see. Dont bother with the waffles the wasps are just waiting for you! Good views from different directions of the animals

EXCELLENT. *huge territory, but extra facilities offered in case you are not up to walking all the time: cable cars line going to the top, small train, little carriage-carts to take small kids around, if tired. all these are at extra reasonable charge*playgrounds every now and then to keep kids busy and parents taking a break*children zoo where they can feed animals and go for pony ride*many food and drink outlets: from snacks to full menu cooked food*short time shows involving different animals at different times during the day* well organized online page with detailed information available*vast variety of animals*reasonable entrance fee*bus stop right outside the zoo, an option of getting to and from zoo by boat, regular serviceI suggest - all day visit

Kids loved it. Its a LOT of walking but very extensive, and well laid out. Some indoor and outdoor exhibits-the Africa savanahs were great. Lots of innovative play areas scattered around including a feeding area where you could enter. The kids didnt wanna leave that! Good food options inside too. Couldnt cover it all though we were there most of the day. Reasonably easy to get to if y ou are ok with public transport and a couple of tram change.
Great.. amenities Very good .Refreshments and toilets everywhere. So much to see and do with new projects being taken up everywhere.. Going to Prague? Visit the Zoo :)
relax. Prague zoo is one of the best zoo in the world i have ever been. There are lot of animals, nice walks, good meal. Dissadvantages: lot of people (crowded) and little bit expensive.

A very nice zoo.. A very nice zoo. Worth visiting especially families with children. The animals are well maintained and groomed. Playgrounds for children inside (even a pool of water - do not forget your swimsuit).

A great day. Take note - this takes a whole day! We went on a very hot, cloudless day so some of animals were either sleeping or hiding in the shade! Nevertheless we had a fantastic day, loads and loads of animals but beware of the bats in the 'twilight zone' as they fly around your head!!Gift shop great, so cheap compared to UK prices - got a few soft toys (....not for me as a fully grown adult, honestly) for about £5.Tickets were £6.20 for adult and I had a student card so £5 for me, seeing as this is a whole day it's great value. We both had lunch there too - good, healthy food for not a lot of money at all.

A great day out!. A wonderful zoo. Took us a whole day to do the whole zoo. Had great fun and it was good exercise trekking up the hill (there is a cable car if you don't want to walk). Some wonderful animals and the majority have decent enclosures. Staff were friendly and there are lots of places to eat- we had a traditional Czech meal at a sit-down restaurant (a very different experience to most zoos!). We took a taxi from our hotel in central Prague and it cost around £12. We got the zoo bus and the metro back- very easy to do and you simply purchase your ticket at the zoo stop. Thoroughly enjoyed our day here!

good zoo, lots to do, take your dog!. Prague Zoo is really interesting, the entrance price seemed pretty good (200 CZK = under 7 GBP when we visited in 2012). There were a few things we didn't like so much (polar bear, leopards - some animals need more space than a zoo can provide) but most of the enclosures were good. Food was interesting and relatively cheap, and there's a chairlift between the lower and upper areas which is a good enough reason to visit in itself.Oh, and they let you take your dog in! this doesn't seem to cause a problem for the animals or the visitors, and makes me wonder why we can't do the same in England?

Nice Zoo with some unique designs. We were impressed with some of the 'natural' enclosures, particularly the african plain area where the zebras, giraffes and antelope could wander. And we thought the large natural cliffs 'enclosure' designed for the mountain goats was awesome. Likewise, Monkey Island was quite good. Our only criticism would be that the design makes it a little difficult to cover the entire zoo in an organized manner, without backtracking. But, definitely Recommended.
great zoo :). massive zoo, was really impressed. Rare animals here , the staff also friendly and helpfull. Great value for money, defo worth a visit

must see in Prague. The Zoo is on a hill and is practically a beautiful garden which invites you in. All the animals have spacious surroundings and you can also find there a pretty large variety of species. For a lovely afternoon with your friends or family, go there !

Worthy to see.... Regular visit of Zoo in Troja is almost a tradition for families with childerns from Prague. I can´t harly coun´t how many times I been there and therefore it´s easy for me to see grow of Prague zoo.Currently it´s definitely attraction that is worthy to see due to many animals, modern surrounding, facilities and services. I would honestly recommend Prague Zoo despite the last change in prices - for family with childerns it might be a little bit expensive.+ allowed dog entry, size, number of exotic animals, good services

Excellent zoo!. Visited the zoo whilst on holiday in Prague with family. Easy an cheap to get to, either take the subway and then the zoo shuttle bus or there is also a river cruise which drops you off around 5 minutes away from the zoo entrance. The zoo is huge! It takes a whole day to get around, but is well worth the money they charge, it is clean and well looked after. The food they offer inside the park is also cheap and to a high standard. Overall a fantastic zoo!

Fun for everyone. So much to see, the prices are great, they are currently rebuilding the elephant enclosure but the building work doesn't effect the visit. Lots of children's areas and you can also bring your dog too.

escape to the animals. thought the place was fantastic, easy to get to and escape from the crowds and unlike other zoo's i have visited i felt that it was excellent value for money (about £6.80) and didn't feel ripped off at every turn. Well thought out pens for the animals. Do the chair lift if you dare and enjoy the veiws from the top. ps watch out for the bats!!!

Fantastic Zoo. I was skeptical before visiting the zoo, as a lot of zoos in eastern europe have somewhat lower animal welfare standards than they do in the UK. Needless to say, I was very impressed with this zoo.The zoo is located to the north of Prague in some hills near the river. The zoo itself is very modern (tragically, a flood in 2002 devistated the zoo, and killed many animals) and well landscaped. We went on a boiling hot day, but there was plenty of shade, the whole zoo being covered in trees. The majority of animal enclosures are very modern, being spacious and clean, and attempting to recreate natural habitats as well as any other zoo I have been to.There are various different themed areas, such as a Jungle area (in a large green house area, housing monkeys etc.), and more traditional insect areas or snake areas. The zoo is hilly, and there is a chair lift that can take you to the top of the zoo for a small additional price.The zoo has plenty of eating places, which are reasonably priced considering the touristic nature of the place.To get to the zoo, we took a metro to Nádraží Holešovice followed by a bus (using a 32kc 90 minute ticket), and to get back to Prague, we took a boat, which was a very pleasant way to return.

A great {and cheap} day out.. This is a really nice way to spend an entire day- there's just so much to see!It's very good value, especially considering the size and amount of time to be spent there- expect to spend 150czk for students/180czk for adults (£5 and £6 respectively.)A lot of the zoo has shaded walkways/areas which was excellent as we went on an incredibly hot day and so could still enjoy the visit. There is a little train with tours part of the zoo, horse/pony rides available, and a chairlift (like for skiing!) to go up which cost 20czk and was really worth it for the views and fun factor!The food is no more expensive than anywhere else- you could get a beer/drink, saussage with sauce and bread dumplings and an ice cream for the equivilent for £4/5 or so. Lot's of eating options anyway, and the food looked and smelt very nice. The animals are very well cared for- they seem happy, with nice spacious areas, natural vegetation and plenty of shade/food. We were there for about 6 hours and only saw half the park, so it really is a whole day of activities!

One day trip to the zoo. A lot of actraction and animals. One day full is needed. Good for the whole family. Currently some parts are under renovation but even without a good experience.Connection from city center by metro and bus is quite convenient. More fun can be added going there by bike.

Excellent zoo!. We visited the zoo last Sunday in Prague, as we had a 3 day tram/bus/metro ticket we could grab these to travel to the zoo for cheap, and the entry price to the zoo was very reasonable too, 200kc for adults. The zoo was absolutely great for the money we paid. We managed to catch a very cute and funny seal show towards the end of our visit. On hot days it is best to bring water and wear comfortable shoes as there are lots of hills, the variety of animals in the zoo was incredible! Loved the animals!
Excellent. Great day out with kids. We took a boat trip to get there, recommended. Make sure you can spend the day there.

The environment is still improving. I really recommend to visit this ZOO, especially If you have got a children. Thera are many atractions and programmes like feeding animals, training animals, some interactive programmes for kids. In 2002 the garden was flooded and many buildings was destroyed, many animals died.But nowadays there are a lot of new buildings, paddocks and areas for animals everything still improving and getting bettter. There are also greenhouses with unique flora, observation tower, chair lift and many fastfood restaurants.
Nice zoo. I really enjoyed my day at Prague zoo. It is a large zoo that has some interesting exhibits like the free range lemurs.
Loved it. Spent all day here. Lower than the cost of a UK zoo and it is massive with loads to see. Had a very good day out and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Animal magic. I have been to the zoo twice and was most impressed with the walkways, the number of animals and the general layout of the place. On both visits I paid 200 CZK ,(just over 6 pounds) which wasn`t too bad considering how long you can spend at this zoo. A family of 2 adults and 2 children would pay 600 CZK. There are many ways to get to the zoo, I went by bus 112 from the side of Prague`s `Holesovice` train station, you can also get a bus from near the tram stop at `Troja` or there is a ferry across the water from the left bank of the Vltava near Dejvice, I haven`t used this ferry myself, it is small but frequent. Personally I loved the Giraffes, (especially when you see them outside in the open) the wonderful Tigers and other exotic `big cats` and the wolves, this was the first time I remember seeing wolves in the wild, they are amazing. The Polar bears must be seen and if you like insects and small reptiles etc then there is plenty of opportunity to see these in the special indoor viewing areas. When I was there the food and beer eating areas were doing good business and it also seems like many tours visit here during their stay in Prague. There is also one other way of visiting the zoo and that is to catch a special `zoo` boat which leaves from one of the wharves on the river near `Charles bridge` ,not too sure when this service runs but it would be a wonderful way to get to the zoo. All in all a wonderful place to visit, families love it and the variety is excellent.

One of the best. After seeing many Zoo Parks in Europe, I can say Zoo Praha is in top.I think at this point it might be placed in 2nd position after Vienna's Zoo, but when the re-building activities are finished, it could be definitely number 1 in Europe.It's a location that must be seen ... Remember, it will take 6-8 hours visit to the park, because is very large and very beautiful.
Love Prague Zoo. I have to admit it's getting better. A little better all the time. (It could be worse, it was A LOT worse).
Great ZOO. Big space, and very good environment for animals. Lot of animals. We were with 2 kids (6y. and 1y.) and one day was not enough to see everything.

Visit this in 2013. This Zoo is undergoing a major re-build and although it is nearing completion I think it will be a much better attraction next year. Having said that there is much to enjoy hear not least the chair lift that links the Zoo's 2 levels. I also could sit and watch hippos for days and this Zoo has 3 of them. If you have children with you I recommend this place fro a day out.
Best zoo I've ever been to!. Fantastic zoo, which houses almost every animal you could imagine, who all seem very happy, and have plenty of space to roam.

Family zoo but couples can have fun too!. Loved the walking paths, easy to get around, wide open spaces for animals. There were many families but my fiance and I had lots of fun. Do show your student discount even if you don't study in Czech Republic to get the discount at the admission fee. Loved the gorillas (especially the small one!), fur seals, giant turtle, alligators and huge anaconda!

A bigger zoo than expected. When we travel, we tend to always visit local zoos if we have time. We went to the Zoo Praha not expecting much but was definitely surprised. The zoo is huge with a lot of area for the animals. The night exhibit was great and there are free flying bats, so if you're with someone that has an issue with that, avoid going in there. We didn't have kids with us and this was still a great place to visit.

Troja card. We went to the zoo recently getting the troja card for 280 czech crowns, there are included the zoo, the botanical garden and the palace Troja, the card is valid till the end of september so you don't need to see all three things in one day (impossible thing to do). The Troja palace is nice, with two interesting expositions at the moment and interesting halls, with no furniture but lots of afresco. The zoo is wonderful. There is a funny seal exhibition every day at 13.30 except of Fridays and the zoo is huge, with lots of places to have a snack. There is also a tower with a panoramic view of Prague. Inside of the zoo you can also use the sedgeway, little train and little carriges for the little ones when their legs hurt. It ia also easy to arrive. There are big parking places or you just arrive to the Holesovice station and the you take the bus 112, from Fri to Sun there is also a zoo bus transfer free of charge.

Worth a visit. a really good zoo, lots of open space for the animals, fairly easy to get around, and most of the enclosures have 1 paragraph summaries in English so foreigners have some idea what they're looking at. Easy to get to from the centre of Prague (4 stops from Museum Station, then the Route 112 shuttle bus, takes about 30 minutes)
Zoo and Troja. Walk up through the stromovka park to Troja and the vineyard. If you have kids with you seeing the zoo is definately fun too

Unexpected, but beautiful zoo. Visiting Prague and looking for great things to visit with kids, age 6 and 4, we found the recommendation on trip advisor to visit the Prague zoo. The zoo is easy accesible from centre of Prague by car and has a big parking. When entering we were initially not sure that we took the right decision as the zoo looked a bit small and outdated, but we were quickly prooven wrong. Since 1997 the zoo has undergone huge investments and is turning itself in a very modern zoo with beautiful pavillions with a lot of respect for animals. With the exception of the leopard and cheetahs who looked too confined all animals looked beautiful and well taken care of. We were especially impressed by the alligator pavillion and the tigres enclisure, seeing those during feeding time was a treat. We ended up spending most of our day in the zoo and as A little extra we also got a great view on Prague castle from one of the zoos viewpoints. Investments are still very much ongoing and the Africa enclosure which is targetted for completion end of Dec 2012, looks just fantastic!

A briliant bargain!. Seeing the price of the zoo, we didn’t expect much. However, this is one of the best zoos I have ever visited, and I often visit zoos!I would put aside a whole day, or even two days to visit this zoo. The enclosures are very well set out and there is a huge variety of animals, from goats to elephants and tigers.There were a number of places to grab a bite to each, all at reasonable prices.I’d recommend the ski lift for some amazing views across Prague.

enjoyable and important zoo. I'm somthing of a zoo officianado and visit zoos all over the world. This is one of the best. Visited with my partner who is not normally that keen, but really enjoyed Prague Zoo.A flood in 2002 swept away many buildings and this led to very good redevelopments since. Imaginative enclosures and a focus on endangered animals incuding Malayan tigers, Komodo dragons. Mountain sheep and goats clamber over a real mountain side. Giraffes, zebras, ostriches and antelopes have a large paddock. Elephants getting a new large enclosure curently under construction.Lots of educational displays, though mostly in Czech.The site is very steep and there is no obvious route aroud the zoo. Well worth getting a map - available in several languages.Food is feshly prepared and good and much better than fast food often available.If you think zoos are dismal places, try this one. It may change your mind.

Day at the Zoo. We are Americans living in Prague and decided to visit the zoo for the morning. We got there at about 10 A. M. and left about 2 P.M. Our visit was on a Saturday and we parked within a couple of minutes walk from the entrance which cost us about 5 US dollars. We paid and were inside the zoo in about 5 minutes. I was surprised at how empty the zoo was on a weekend. I have been to the Denver Zoo and the San Diego Zoo and the lines are long and the parking is not close. The cost was 10 US for each and 5 US for our dogs,yes they could be in the zoo. I was very impressed with the zoo layout and the way they have kept it natural for the visitor. Not a lot of large signs and some of the paths are still dirt. The zoo is set up much as the zoos I have visited in the states except that here it seems that the animals are more accessible to the public. I enjoy photographing the animals and I was surprised how close the animals were. Even though I don't have any small children the interactive parts of the zoo was very good for the younger people, with lots of hands on things to touch and experience. They are in the process of building a new area for the African planes animals which looks like it will be quite nice. We ate at a small place on the east side on the way up to the top of the zoo property and the food was quite good and very reasonable. If you don't want to walk to the top of the hill there is a tram that will take you up to the top. There are plenty of places to rest and lots of shade on a hot day. We spent only 4 hours and did not see but maybe half of the exhibits, so it is easily a full day excursion. We drove but the public transportation makes getting to the zoo very easy from anywhere in the city. It is well worth the visit, and I it would be a great break from the tourist areas in the city and enjoy a quite afternoon walk.

Fantastic day out. Prague Zoo was a lovely day out for us and our two year old son. A short trip on the Metro and then a bus ride from outside the station - Bus was very busy both there and back and is a free for all however the zoo cost around £12.00 for 2 adults and under 3 get in for free. Good variety of animals, stunning views and some great play areas for the children which were lovely for having little breaks throughout the day. The snacks and drinks were relatively cheap however the souvenir shops are small and limited in stock. There were lots of wasps around whilst we were there which seemed to bother us more than anyone else.
manageable. It is a small zoo on top of a hill with a great selection of animals. There are cafes and other places to rest and eat.

One of the best ZOO in whole Europe. ZOO in Prague is really something what you have to see if you have time. Its very big, but you can also use little train there if you will feel tired of walking. Especially Gorillas and African pavilion are great!!!! :)

best zoo. i love this zoo, it has been reconstructed beautifully and just to walk around the place is nice.lots of kinds of animals, so make sure you have enough time to go through all the pavillons. bring a water and snack with you, i would say that the food there is overpriced.. anyways, by far the best zoo i've been to.

Large and well planned. As zoos go, this is nicely laid out with a good selection of animals and lots of greenery and winding paths between the enclosures. There are two main tiers with the larger enclosures at the top (giraffes, wolves, zebra, etc). If these animals interest you more, there is an entrance closer to the top so you don't have to walk all the way up or risk the perilous cable cars (health and safety, what?) The annual family pass is good value if you plan to visit more than once. There aren't many restaurants, so a picnic is a good option. Go early at the weekend as it gets VERY busy.
New place for elephants. Visited with my daughter. We both enjoy it. Higly recommed for everyone..not just for children.Elephants now have more space..come to see it.

The best Zoo I have ever seen with the worst customer service... ever. We looked for to visit Zoo in Prague for a long time, however our visit was spoiled immediately after we arrived. We bought one student and one 'retiree' tickets. After me got confused, I returned and claimed in my best belief that we supposed to pay a little bit less then we actually did. Lady behind the desk started to shout at me that she already told me how is it and what I want now. This really turned me off and so I complained about this attitude. Today I received general apologise from head office which didn't concerned any of the issues I did have. I am considering this as a very low standard of customer service.On the other side, the Zoo is amazing with a lots of places, where you can have close contact with animals, is perfect for kids and everything seemed to be cleaned to a very high standard. They are also building a new walk path which is promising a lot of beautiful views of Prague and Zoo itself, so something to look forward to. In general the place was enjoyable to be in, however building of new enclosures and lack of quality and healthy food in the area was a bit downside.

Fun day at the zoo. We had a really nice day at the Prague Zoo. They have loads of different animals and the food we ate at one of the restaurants was really nice. It's a big place so make sure you have plenty of time and prepare yourself for a lot of walking. We left after six hours (without having seen it all) with sore feet but very happy with our visit. Do note that pretty much all the information is in Czech with very brief tidbits in English, German and Russian.

I was impressed!. This zoo was nicer than I thought it would be. As an animal lover, I hate seeing animals in tiny spaces, but they had a lot of room, everything was nicely spaced out, and there are tons of places to see. Perfect for families.

The zoo is a must see for kids. Count on a full day here. It is a very well designed/conceived zoo.Easy access by subway plus a bus from the center of the city. The enclosures are tailored to the animals natural habitats, quite naturalized, others like that of the gorillas rather fun.Was such a pleasant day strolling though the various paths. Feeding time at the various animal stations was a treat for the animals as well as the spectators. Polar bears were a hoot.The concession stands were great! Sure there were some hamburgers and french fries, but there was much more diversity then you would see in North America: chicken tortillas, soup, paella...each of the concessions differentGreat play round near th end, also a petting zoo. All in all a great experience.

Not only for kids!. Amazing experience, we didnt have a good weather but even thought all of us enjoyed it on 100%. We saw a lot of beautiful animals and realized, once again, that ZOOs are not only for children and even adults can find their joy inside as well. Really worth visiting it:-)
Very nice zoo. I like the zoo. It was very nice all day trip. Lot of fun there. There are lot of nice animals and they have shows in some hours of the day.

Great Big zoo. Its a very big zoo and the animal have lots of space, you have to walk a lot and there´s a mountain where you can take a chairlift to the top, but only if its not a little child, because there can only sit one in a chair, great zoo to visit, theres a hour walk from centrum, and theres a little bridge there you only can work over the river to Troja castle and walk to the zoo from there.

The best ZOO. Prague ZOO, it's a whole day trip. It has changed a lot in the recent years, you get closer to the animals, the giraffes have really big field to run about and the monkeys are only separtaed by glass. It feels like you are standing next to them. Try the night visit, it's definitely worth it.
Perfect to go with the family. One of the best zoos to visit with the baby, as they have the "baby zoo" with the animals that you can touch and play together!

Best place if you come with kids!. Very nice and entertaining place! When you come, first find out, what time are the feedings. Because they have fixed timetable for feeding different annimals (pinguins, seals...) and watching it is an awesome show!!!

Amazing zoo, don't miss it!. I was a little hesitant about visiting the zoo here, as the trip out involves a number of metro stop changes and catching a shuttle bus. But I can guarantee that it's well worth the time and money.You'll spend 24-32 crowns getting out to the zoo from the center of Prague (depending on which ticket you buy and how much time you need) and another 150-200 crowns to get into the zoo. There are a lot of different animals to see, including some awesome snakes, gorillas, tigers, Galapagos tortoises, bizarre birds, and all kinds of others. But the best part of this zoo is how easy it is to get right up close to the animals. Many are behind full glass of course, but the displays allow you to see a lot of amazing creatures without craning your neck to try and find them camouflaged in some far-off corner. In a lot of cases, the animals will come right up to where you're standing, and most of them aren't shy at all. If you go, be sure not to miss the lemurs (you'll see what I mean).Overall, a great value and well worth the time to get out there. If you're in Prague, go to this zoo.
Not cheap, but worth the trip.. Great viewing areas.More interesting than many Prague tourist sites.You will need to take the Metro then a bus to get there. Or, take a AAA taxi.

amazing view of Valtava river. amazing for photographing an awesome view of valtava river, the bridge decorated with old statues on all over both sides, also at the start of the bridge the old tower is nice.

The best zoo I ever visited. The zoo is really big, you may spend the whole day there! There are cafes with nice and not expensive food, free clean toilets, and you may bring your pets with you - there are bowls and clean water for dogs everywhere!

Place for families. Wonderful and well organised and contain lots of ViewThere you will find almost most animals and there are several restaurants and all the necessary facilitiesThere is also a cableway and a small train to tourSeveral shows are also available with the animals
Excellent with kids.. All animals there are in very nice and naturally lookig settings.

I dont like Zoo's.... But with a son aged 5... I have been to quite a few Zoo's and this is one of the better ones. Whit some execptions, like the vultures, eagels and owls, the anaimals seems to have ample space, the range of animals spends form South Pole (Peungvins) to the Arctic (Polar bears). New aereas are under development. Resturantnts and kiosks spread out over the aerea, several playgronds and toilets when you need them.
Giant and beautiful ZOO. Very natural and beautiful Zoo, easy to reach with public transit. Take the lift up and down, totally funny.
Best Zoo in the World!. A must do--and take public transportation, adds to the experience.

Great Place for family. The Prague zoo offered a great experience as the children were very happy and we the adults also had a good time. It is a whole day fun and there is plenty to see. The upkeep is also fine and a great relaxing day.

Wear good walking shoes -you'll need them!. We went to the zoo on a Tues morning and enjoyed it very much. They have a tram you can use if you wish. There are lots of eating options and a funicular you can go up or down on to get to the other areas of the zoo. We spent about 3 hours and were exhausted..and did not see the whole thing... Only thing that was a bit disappointing was seeing the polar bears out in the hot sun... some were jumping in the water to cool off.. Most of the exhibits are in Czech language only but there were many that had some English so that was helpful. You should only pay about 300 crowns from the old city.. a taxi driver tried to get 500 on the way back and we told him no.. and he agreed to 300... Enjoyable few hours.

Fantastic zoo - not only for children!. I have been to quite a few zoos/safari parks in England and must say that the Prague zoo has always been my favourite by far. It has so much to offer and you can easily spend a whole day there. There are so many kinds of animals have plenty of space to move around and their enclosures are nice and in a very good condition. There is a chair lift to take your from the bottom part of the zoo to the top one,if you get tired of walking. It is really nice and offers a great view. I'd definitely recommend the zoo to anyone who has more time to spend in Prague.

Absolutely brilliant! Awesome for kids!. This zoo is perfect! It's very big, beautifullyl kept. Animals are not in the cages, but behind glass walls or natural fences. The path is quite versatile with lot's of play areas for children on the way, picnic tables, refreshment points. The biggest playground has even a water paddle kids can play in. We spent half a day at the zoo with 2 kids - 4yo and 2 yo. It is so big we still didn't see everything (missed hippos, lemurs). We bought combined tickets for zoo, Troja & botanic garden, but managed to visit only zoo and part of the huge (!) botanic garden. Next time we'll reserve whole day for this trip to make sure we see everything. A must see!!

Wonderful place for a full day of relaxation. I've been at Prague zoo at least 4-5 times and will definitely go again! The atmosphere is so pleasant with animals & other creatures presented in their natural environment. You can walk there all day and you will never get bored :)

A world-class zoo with great exhibits. It offered something you don't often find, especially in the U.S. -- animals and people roaming freely in the same enclosure. While this is not so unusual for goats and sheep, being in with the lemurs was a real treat. The zoo has been in a process of modernization after a flood destroyed much of it about ten years ago. Most exhibits are well done with very good conditions for the animals, with only a few remaining old-style cages left.
worth to see. well kept, cheap to get in, really enjoyed day at zoo.
Winding Paths and Beautiful Enclosures. One of the most lovely zoo layouts I've ever seen. The view from the top of the zoo is breathtaking and the animals have a lot of indoor and outdoor space.

Prague Zoo. Every trip we slow down and something just for the kids. Hence we found ourselves in the zoo. Hands down the best zoo we have ever been to. We had bats fly through our hair, saw polar bears, tigars, lions from feet away. Monkey of all varieties playing. And on and on.

Must see!. Easy to get to via metro and bus. We enjoyed 4 hours here (I am 50 and was with my 22 year old daughter). Amazing habitats and lots of well cared for animals and babies. Our fave Prague place.
Big and nice, do not miss!. A big zoo, well equipped. A lot of animals. My favourite place to visit with my daughter.

Lovely spacious zoo!. I like zoos, and have been to quite a few. This is probably my favourite so far. Some animals you don't see often, and the enclosures are very spacious. The animals seem content, and it's a joy to walk around in the sunshine. Very good prices for food and drink too, and entry is less than half you'd pay in the UK for an inferior zoo.

Give this some time.. The zoo is a great place to spend an afternoon, or if you like, a whole day, either alone or with your family.You get very close to the animals, so be prepared - don´t wear your sunday best if you plan on going into the birdhouse for instance, because - you guessed it, they fly freely around in there, if you have a great fear of bats, don´t enter the "nocturnal animals" house, because you might come out of there with a bat or two still stuck in your hair.You do get great pictures though, because most of the animals are totally fearless of people, and get very close up to the fences.

Great zoo!. Big zoo. Not to expencive. It took us 6 hours to see it all. The tiger display was great! We took taxi from the city to the zoo and paid ca 300 czk. Take taxi's with 14014 numbers, they will not try to cheat you, but ask for price first! From the zoo we took a river boat to the city for 100 czk.

Must of the Prague. It's probably the biggest zoo i have been into! It has a lots of parks for kids and I am sure there are all animals which exist! Now they are changing part with elephants so you have to find them somewhere else in park ( unfortunatelly I haven't)

Just an average zoo. Too many birds, tigers looked bored as they paced around a very small enclosure and there is very little signage in any language other than czech. The gorilla exhibit is nice as is the insect/snake/rodent house. Entry costs 200 cz for adults which is reasonable I think.

Great Zoo. The animals are well respected and approachable. So are the humans. It will be even better when the new elephant & giraffe fields are open. The chair lift is probably worth the extra money to see both the inner & outer circles saving some walking.

Nicest zoo so far. By far the best zoo I have been to. The place is huge; our planned two hours were not nearly enough. Several new exhibitions were under construction while we were there, so I trust there will be plenty of new stuff to see next time!

Enjoy!. When you're a bit tired of Prague crowd - visit this place. Peace for your mind, rest for your soul, pleasure for your eyes. Get ready do walk a lot - huge territory.
Do not miss lemurs! They aren't afraid of people and can sit down on your lap. Fun for kids!
Great to visit with family!. Make sure you plan this trip for at least half of a day! Very well renovated and maintained! Lots to see and explore. Kids will enjoy this trip...and not only them.

A good day out. Prague zoo is not the easiest place to get to, we had to take 2 trams and a bus from the centre of the city - but it was worth the effort. For just 200 CZK entrance we were not able to see all of the major attractions in an afternoon - a vast choice of different animals to see. I will go back on my next visit to Prague. i particularly liked the Polar Bears and the large cats

A ZOO worth too see!. The easiest way to get there is to take a metro line C and take a ride to metro station Nadrazi Holesovice. When you get out of the metro station, look for a bus stop for bus 112. It will take you straight to the ZOO (the ZOO is it's last station). Ticket for the ZOO is about 150 krona's (for adults). And you can stay there all day if you want...Unfortunately, my friend and I didn't have much time since it was our last day in Prague, but we spend about 3 hours at the ZOO and we saw about 60% of it. It's a pretty big ZOO, most of the animals have good habitations, they look pretty much like their natural habitats. The diversity of animals is wide, if you have a favorite animal, you will most likely find it there.Maps and directions are everywhere (it's a big ZOO, after all), bathrooms if you need one, and there is a restaurant and some fast food stands at the ZOO entrance in case you get hungry.I liked it really much and I would be happy to visit it again, just this time to see all of the ZOO.
Good, layout could be improved. Nice zoo it is is #4 in the world for a reason, could be better laid out, bit too much walking and unstructured

Giraffes!. We made the mistake of spending a week in Prague. Sure, it sounded good to unwind after Oktoberfest, but we fled for the zoo once boredom hit. It's a walk & bus from the train, and exhibits include exotic giraffes, elephants, and flamingos. A pleasant surprise, though you may want to take a taxi there and back.

Great services and excellent organization. I was really impressed by the great diversity of animals and the close recreation of their ecosystems/ habitats. As well, you can find refreshments/restaurants/toilets quite everywhere so it makes a very pleasant walk.
Excellent. A bit of a trek but well worth a day outGo with the kids or with friends.Its a nice peaceful day away from the bustle of city lifeWell recommended

amazing. although not very well sign posted & a bit of an adventure to find!, easily the most enjoyable day! i don't know about the moron who describes it as a park we spent 6hr's there & did not see it all!!! under construction to modernise at the mo would love to go back & see how it looks when they'r finished, we just loved it.
Very nice ZOO. Constantly improving and growing ZOO park with number of unique animals.

Not the Best. If you are thinking the Prague zoo will be similar to the Bronx Zoo, San Diego Zoo or even Woodland Park Zoo, you will be disappointed. I thought it was ok. There are some beautiful views, some really good exhibits, some really bad exhibits and cheap beer. Frankly, I left feeling sorry for a lot of the animals. But then again, I always leave zoos feeling sorry for the animals and I worked at one for 5 years.

Prague Zoo is among the most well regarded. I think everyone will appreciate the concept of Prague Zoo, but the fact is that major changes took place after the devastating flood in 2002. Nevertheless thanks to Prague zoo the Mongolian Przewalski's wild horse is roaming again the steppes and many other species could've been released back to nature, they are also successful in breeding gorillas
nice time. clean and nice , good grill restaurant, all day in relax
An excellent zoo. An excellent zoo set in wonderful grounds. It is a wonderful place just to walk around, and there is a wide selection of animals to see.

Fine city zoo. A thoroughly enjoyable zoo experience. We have visited twice and still need one more day to finish. Currently building a new African animal exhibit. Built on two levels, the zoo includes a chairlift to the upper level with a nice view of the zoo and surrounding parts of Prague.

Great day out.. We spent our last day at the Zoo which made for a really pleasent end to a great trip to Prague. Arrived just to see the end of a bit of a show with the sea-lionsThe weather was wonderful and the layout of the zoo was very good. Lots of pretty shaded areas/walkways, plenty of seating and facilities to get drinks or snacks from machines & snack bars dotted about.Small children seemed well catered for with little wooden pull along carts for them to sit in. A small train went round the zoo which we didn't use neither did we go on the chair lifts up to the higher level.Should imagine they would be fun for some. Enjoyed the variety of animals there and particularly liked the orang-utans and the reptile house where we saw the keeper placing dead rodents for the snakes to eat..then watched a massive anaconda devour one! Well worth the very reasonable entrance fee of approx £6.

sense of humor. the zoo is a do-able size and much like any other european zoo ... but be sure not to miss the funny signs telling you not to bother, harass, insult, agitate, toy with, etc the animals. :)

BRILLIANT - you get excited like a child again.. That is definitely a must in Prague. However, bear in mind that it takes a lot of time to see everything, and you really don't want to miss much. I loved giraffes, seals, penguins were hilarious, elephants were great. I don't really like birds and fish in general, but enthusiasts of that will find it there too. It's cheap to enter, just 150kc per student, you get the whole day ticket. There are facilities to eat and to rest, there's great children area with a train, small swimming-pool and a play ground. ZOO is filled with funny sculptures of animals you can take pics with. It's a big ground, so get ready for a lot of walking, we spent there 6hrs at medium pace and still didn't manage to see everything. It's brilliant for friends, couples, families. Some animals were lazy, but it was feeding time so it's quite normal I guess. They are currently renovating some parts, so some animals are moved from their usual places. The only drawback that day was that the chair lift was not opened. During some days, at certain times there's a feeding show for particular animals, which I think might be interesting. Don't miss out on turtles, penguins and giraffes. They are adorable. there's some information in english, but not all.

Perfectly looking and perfectly organized. It's a very good place to spend your time. Everything is very clean and well-organized. While walking along the zoo (it's quite large), you may have places to relax, have a snack, etc. You may see plenty of different animals which are happy because they have everything for a happy life: plenty of space and care. Part of the zoo is situated on a hill, therefore, you may also have a very good panorama from out there. It's easy to get there, there is a usual bus from the closest metro station and a special zoo bus with a significantly reduced price going right along with the schedule.
not zoo but park. a lot of place for animals, better to go early morning as not so much people

Superb zoo with great value for money. We love city breaks and make a habit of visiting the zoo wherever possible, so we were looking forward to this and we weren't disappointed! It edges Amsterdam and is now our favourite so far.Easy to get to from the city - take the Metro to Nadrazi Holesovice, turn left outside and there's a bus stand at the side of the station with a sign for the zoo - bus number 112 which just goes backwards and forwards between the station and the zoo. Entrance fee is only 200kc for adults, which is half what you'd pay in the UK.The zoo is in two distinct parts - the older part is on the lower ground nearest to the main entrance, then there is the newer part up the sloping paths to the right as you go in, which utilises the natural woodland terrain and which they are further developing with a new enclosure for the elephants and hippos. If you don't want to walk up and down the sloping paths that link the two levels, there's a chairlift for only 20kc which gives you spectacular views right down to the city.A great feature is the indoor pavilions such as the Indonesian Jungle and the Terrarium where they have two huge anacondas. Far too many things to mention, but the silverback gorilla has pride of place!What impressed us most was the number of kiosks for food, drink and WCs dotted about the zoo. It was quite busy with school trips etc. the day we went, but we never had to queue for anything, and prices were cheaper than cafes etc. outside: rip-off UK please take note! Example in the main restaurant (very clean and modern with a lovely outside terrace) was a plated hot meal (not fast food) for 69kc - go figure!This is a great day out and is probably the best value for money you'll get in Prague. As you can probably tell, we were very impressed!
nothing much. place is nice, but the variety is poor. Service is horrible, it's actually self-service with nice long faces

Great for a family afternoon (or a nice date). Prague ZOO is a wonderful piece of nature hidden not too far from the busy city centre. It's been recently renovated (after big floods approx. 10 years ago).Would recommend for a family visit and a nice quiet date.
Kids paradise. Wonderful interactive experience for children of all ages
Go all year round. Just modern (in progress) and thinking about the animals, not the tourist!

Probably the best zoo in the world. I've visited San Diego Zoo and Disney's Animal Kingdom - both highly-rated zoos. Prague zoo is better - which is even more amazing considering the resorces they have to maintain it and the price they charge for entry.I'm sure your trip to Prague wasn't for the zoo - but if you have an extra day then it's worth a visit and much less expensive than an organised tour out of Prague.

A very good day out. We got to the zoo via Metro and bus which was very simple- bus stops right outside. The zoo was brilliant and only 200ck entrance fee ( approx £7). An excellent collection of animals behind glass rather than bars means you get closer. Being 2 feet away from Sumatran Tigers feasting on a large piece of meat was an experience. This is a vast zoo which took us at least 5 hours to cover. There is a cable car to take you to the top where the view is panoramic. Major building going on developing a new savannah area which will make the zoo even bigger and better for the animals. Would recommend this as a good day out and excellent value for money.

Great day out. We caught the 9am river boat to the zoo which was a great start to the day. As we departed the boat there was some confusion as to which way to go to get to the zoo but just follow everyone else! There were not any queues for entry to the zoo so there was no hanging around. Its a big zoo so we went to the building named "information" to ask for a map - we were then directed to a souvenier shop to pick one up! All the animals seemed pretty well looked after and had plenty of space in each enclosure. There is some construction going on as it looks as if the zoo is expanding but that didnt hinder our time there. There were lots of varieties of animals and birds to see - there were lots of species that i had never seen before. It threatened to rain a few times but there are lots of areas inside buildings where you can see the animals.We initally thought we would only spend 2 hours there but it ended up being 4 as there is so much to see. Returning to the centre of prague was pretty easy - we got on the 112 bus (we bought a transport ticket at the metro station the day before and got it validated the day we went to the zoo) right outside the exit then walked back into town via the Technical museum and through the park. It was a great day out and very reasonbly priced.

Big Zoo. One of the largest zoo we ever saw.It was nice to walk there several hours.The Map of the Zoo is very helpful, the place is huge and this way you don't miss anything.They also have all pictures of celebrities who have visited there.
nice but average. very nice day, but very average, the layout of the so is pretty poor, and the viewing space of the animals is not very good, take a packed lunch with you as the food is terrible.

one of the world's best. national zoo in Washington D.C. Is my home zoo and I consider the San Diego Zoo my favorite. having said that, I was blown away by the zoo in Prague. easy to get to via subway and bus combination from Old Town. while the zoo was upgrading its facilities (what major zoo isn't?), 90 per cent is operational. Prague has one of the best big cat exhibits I've seen (we hit it at feeding time and I cannot wait to get home to print out my pictures). Prague zoo is kid friendly, which is expected, but it is also welcoming to those of us who appreciate a lot of places to stop, sit, and enjoy refreshments. favorite stop? the gorilla pavalian. loved the interaction between youngsters and old gray backs. biggest thrill? watching the tigers frolic together in a friendly but rough display of affection.
must visit it!. i liked everything, animals there really enjoy, if nothing else, they enjoy more than animals in Belgrade :)))

in transition.... We were there on the hottest day of the year so most of the animals were inside and not too energetic. Kind of like most of the visitors. The zoo seems to be in the middle of a major redo so I think given a year or so it will be great.

Certanly the best place in Prague. I like it very much. It is very large, it took us 2 days to see everything. The animals seem very happy and live in large spaces. You should take a map so you don't miss anything

Don't need to be a kid to enjoy it. The best day on my trip to Praha! We went on May, so the weather was chilly in a good way. the price is about 100 Kronot if i remember correctly, which is pretty cheap for what you get in comparison to other zoos in the world. Many types of special and beloved animals; you can watch most of them from outside and from a closer glass window look. the zoo is very big and you'll need at least a half day to tour it. The atmosphere is pastoral full of green and a river flows in it. Bring an umbrella in case it rains!

One time experience!!!. We went to the Zoo in the morning. We thought it will take us 4- 5 hours to see everything... In fact, it took us around 8 hours. It is not a simple zoo, it is more like a real natural park where you can meet some animals... There you can meet animals living in their own environment. Unlike many other zoos, here the animals are not in cells. We loved the polar bears, the tigers and giraffes! One thing that some people might not like is that you cannot see all the animals always...They have the opportunity to choose whether or not to show themselves... For instance, in the morning the polar bears were outside their 'stone lodging' but in the afternoon when we went to see them again, they were inside because it was too hot for them...The entrance fee is very reasonable! It costs 200 Crowns for adults which is around EUR8 per person. The prices in the restaurants in the zoo are also reasonable, the quality of the food- very good!
The most beautiful zoo in which I was. I have seen more zoo in Europe but this is definitely the most beautiful, especially the part with the giraffes

Highly recommended. I love the Prague Zoo, especially after the renovation! It's really large, there is a chairlift in one part, so you don't have to go uphill on foot, it has a lot of pavilions and installations, it's great for kids (but if you don't like crowded places, don't go on weekends, holidays, sunny days and the end of june - the school kids have couple weeks to the big summer holidays and lots of teachers think Zoo is the best idea for them!:) Every hour you can watch feeding of some animal (http://www.zoopraha.cz/en/programme/do-not-miss-in-the-winter). The entrance fee grew from the 1.5.2012 again, but I think it's still worth it.
good. Zoo in Vienna is much better! here you will see only a lot of birds and monkeys...
Modern zoo. The animals have plenty of room and it i nicely landscaped.Easily reached bij subway and bus.

great for kids. they have a baby hippo. huge zoo. we spent like 4 hours there, but could easily devote the whole day to this zoo. there are plenty of playgrounds for kids here. giraffes, hippos, crocodiles, galapagos turtles... animals variety is enormous!they are expanding their territory now. ducks are flying and walking freely, cheetahs were coming very close to us, and the glass was the only border between people and these really nice animals. you will find some very stunning views of the old town of Prague from the wooden tower in the zoo. the adult ticket costs 200 CZK. 0.4 of the kozel pilsen in a cafe-spot will cost you 89 CZK.

A great way to spend a day in Prague with kids!. Easy to access with a bus from central Prague, we've spent a wonderful and interesting day both for me and for a 5 year old.Getting away from the city and enjoying the quiet spacious Zoo is a great way to learn about the animals.Close to the exit there also attractions for children not to be missed...a small train, a ski elevator and a playground.

A little something for everyone. This may sound ignorant, but I'm not big on churches and historical sites when it comes to cities so this was a beautiful break from all the tourist traps. Whether is big animals or small, you see them all, pay a little extra and do some feeding
travel. Terrible to find the zoo! We skipt out of it! The sign in the metro isn't right.
BIG!. One of the largest zoos i have ever been to, this will take up the majority of a day to visit properly. and even longer with kids!Animal were active and looked very healthy

A fun Day!!. To give the children a break form old castles and historic sightseein we decided to give a try based on tripadvisors reviews, is a little too far from the city centre but manageable. Bring comfy shoes because is big, you can be walking around four , five hours, there is not comparision between this zoo and any zoo in America, but other than that is very good! Entrance fee is reasonable and even you can enter with your dog, which result so convenient at least in our case since we travel with our dog everywhere! Parking is not a problem and in general is a good place to expend one day in Old Prague.
it's huge and good fun!. It was great value for money! So easy to get to, too! It's pretty big, we spent like 4h there I think :D

Didn't plan this but should have. One of the days looked to be questionable weather for a quick out-of-Praha trip. So we tried the zoo instead.Phenomenal! This is an excellent zoo to visit. I would highly recommend you put this on your list.

Nice Zoo. Spent a day here - was easy to get to by Tram/Subway to bus that takes you to the front door. The Gorilla exhibit is great - there's a glass window and the gorilla was on the other side of the glass less than a meter away watching us as we were watching him..

Becoming the greatest. The zoo is not really advertised but is of very high standard and a at the Zoo is a day well spent.We visited the Berlin Zoo a few days earlier and i must say Prague Zoo is on par and much more enjoyable.It is a must see.

Great views of animals. The zoo is quite large and is gradally being improved and updated. It is possible to get wonderful views of many of the animals too, and see them close up. There is a little train for children to ride too. The zoo is based on a hill, and has an upper and lower part. We didn't see much of the upper part as our daughter was getting very tired after we'd been around the lower part, and the path up to the polar bears is still fairly steep. There is the option of using the chairlift between the 2 sections as well. There is a good variety of animals to view and getting there from the centre of Prague is very straightforward using the metro and bus network.
Last day in Prague. We wanted to do something different on our last day in Prague and the zoo was the perfect choice. Reasonably priced and not difficult to get to on public transport.
Take your kids there for a day. and they will love it. Very nice place to relax, special events and attractions, time just flies there.
Positively surprised. Only the weather stopped us from enjoying it completely (but for the beginning of April it's expectable), it's big and interesting enough for the entire day.

Fantastic zoo. This is a really good zoo. One of the most enjoyable aspects of the zoo is just how close you get to the animals; it's very nice to be trusted! I really enjoyed being able to walk inside an aviary and look around to realise that the carcass on the floor was for the vultures that I was so very close to. The only downside for me of being so close to the animals is when children inevitably try and disturb the animals to try and get them to do something and for me I found it quite upsetting to see a couple of sleeping cheetahs disturbed like that. Prices were very reasonable (150 CVK for an adult) and the zoo does take a long while to walk around, so plan a few hours in to see everything. I am pretty sure that we missed a number of enclosures as it was rapidly approaching closing timeThe absolute highlight for me was seeing two of the polar bears in the water play fighting with each other - when one pushed off the tank I just managed to put my hand on the glass right next to its giant paw (I certainly wouldn't want to be in a fight with that)Two things I would say would stop me from marking this as being "excellent": one would be that the weather on the day was miserable with a constant drizzle, so a number of animals remained indoors or looked despondent. The other aspect keeping my mark lower is that there were clearly a number of new enclosures being built that will make the zoo absolutely amazing; I know it's going to get better.

Bit of a trek but worth it. On the one hand then any animal kept in a zoo should have enough space to live in a relatively similar environment to their natural habitat. On the other hand then they could be easier to find once you get there. And it's inconsistent. The Giraffes have about 200 acres whereas the Meerkats have about 20 square feet. This isn't an exact science, but seemed odd to me. Do they allocate the space according to weight or natural habitat?It's a good zoo. Just the signposting is confusing and it's too big to see in a couple of hours, at least 25% of which you'll be trying to work out where the hell you are and how to get to the next place you want to go to.But it's worth it.

for animal lovers). If you love animals you have to go tj this zoo!! It is very big and it has plenty of different animals living in real nature. no caves for them. You can see how they eat, walk, play))

Paradise !!!!. Without a shade of doubt ,a place one should not miss upon visit to Prague !!! A zoo with variety of spieces that left me counting !!! The zoo is very well planned with various pavillions like indonesian ,African maaking it a more better viewing experience !!! large spaces for animals all around , A place you can easily spend a day easily walkng from one end to another end .At the end all you pay is 150 kc thats what i call a steal !!!

Amusing Experience Even for Adults!. I like that the ZOO is very diverse. You can even go inside the area for lemurs, then you can go into tropical area, you see a lot of different wild animals. One part is uphill, one downhill.The overall atmosphere is very relaxing.
If you've got kids, go there!. Title says it all. You can even walk there through Stromovka and cross the river. The refurbished restaurants are great with the kids with lots of space for prams etc.

Nice place. A really Nice zoo, but in wintertime very grey-ish.
Hope The elephants can go to their new home soon!
Other animals have à lot of space!!

One of best we have been to so far....and that's a lot of zoos. The zoo lives up to its rep. It is also huge, with lots to see and excellent playground all around. We did a pony ride for .20k and took the chair lift up to the top hill, yes the zoo is built into the mountain side with a sloping climb to the top if you have strollers etc. We really enjoyed the exhibits and had a chance to see the polar bears play right after feeding time, check with the staff as to when this is as these bears are somewhat sleepy at other times of the day. The size of the zoo will require some time and energy, you may want to plan for that to be the big event and schedule some rest time before heading out to dinner. It is very easy to get to, take the Red line and the 112 bus brings you right to the zoo.

I brought my dog with me. More of an animal park than a zoo. The habitats are spread out over a huge area. Very well kept animals. They were tolerant of me bringing my dog along for the day. They had the usual big draw animals such as lions, tigers and elephants but they also had wolves, cheetahs, vultures and many other creatures that are not in every zoo. The zoo ranks in my top list with Berlin and San Diego.

Excelent zoo and great value. Visited this Zoo august 2011 , cheap admission. Massive zoo a day as not long enough to see it all properly. Food and concession stands were good value to. There was a fair amount of construction ongoing to a couple of enclosures but the giraffe enclosure was great. Use the chair lifts to the upper part of the Zoo and outdoor restaraunt. Took the ferry back to Prague city centre which kids loved as well, totally different view of Prague. If you have a day to spare and need to entertain the family, then a visit to Prague Zoo is a must.

A lovely day out. This zoo was very accessible by public transport (metro and then bus) and was a lovely day out. It was recommended by a tour guide as a good thing to do on a rainy day in Prague but I wouldn't agree with that as the zoo was about 80% outside. Parts were under construction ad the zoo will be even more spectacular when these are finished. The entry price was reasonable (150 Kc) and its open from April to September. It's said to be in the top 10 zoos worldwide. A bad flood in 2002 badly damaged the zoo and the animals but they have bounced back and have made it a nice place for a family day out. They have a chairlift to move between the higher and lower levels of the park which seemed a little but dangerous though and I wouldn't recommend it for children.

Big but building. One of if not the best and biggest zoo i've been to, way better then the ones in the UK but there is currently lots of building work going on specifically for elephants, giraffes and lions / tigers so don't expect to see any of those.
very good. was only £5 each to get in and although they are expanding it, there is still so much to see and do!
beautiful large zoo, awesome walks in summer. one of the best zoos in Europe! in summer you can take a boat trip to the zoo which makes it evenbetter experience...

Great Afternoon !. Prague zoo in the winter seems to be when they make any improvements, sensible, there were new walk ways being built and a new larger elephant enclosure. There is a good selection of animals, some of which you don’t tend to find in the UK , mainly the lovely polar bear, my main reason for wanting to visit. Most of the enclosures are a good size and well maintained but the hippo enclosure looked a bit tired due to it’s age. Only 150czk entry approx £5. Definitely money well spent, even Angelina Jollie and Brad Pitt have visited this zoo. Some of the animals didn’t make an appearance probably because they found it a bit chilly and they were quite happy to stay indoors in the warm, we didn’t see the orang-utans or lions and neither looked like they had an indoor viewing area. The gorillas do though so even though they were inside we still go to see the baby and friend getting into mischief which was funny. The zoo is fairly large, I’d say around the same size as Chester (for those who have visited Chester zoo) and is a mix of gradients, there is a rather precarious looking chair lift in the middle bit it’s not enclosed and there was no way my other half would have gone on it had it been running, it wasn’t so that removed any option. It looked in good repair so I suspect that it was just closed due to the time of year. It would be easy to spend a full day here but because we did a walking tour in the morning we only had the afternoon. We arranged a taxi from AAA taxis (also reviewed) to take us and collect us from the zoo. The zoo closes at 5pm in the winter months so thinking that we could perhaps loiter until 5.30pm I booked the taxi to collect us at 6pm, we were actually done by 5pm and very close to the exit so we headed out, as did everyone else, it seems everyone obeys the closing time. We then had to wait for the taxi, poor planning on my part, there is a nice mansion over the road to have a nosey at over the wall but that’s it so it was a case of sitting waiting in the cold for the taxi to turn up, he was 10 minutes early which was excellent ! Please read my review on AAA taxis if you’re thinking of using a taxi firm yourself.
Fun&Children Friendly. Great Interactive workshops with Kids. Yummy pancakes. A lot of animals to observe.
Perfect ZOO. Nice ZOO, good place for a day visit, a lot of things to see
Best ZOO in Europe. Go in the spring, when all is green and blossoms. And animals are out in the free.

If you like animals, go!. I was a bit cautious about visiting this zoo, I had heard a while ago that some of the enclosures weren't very animal friendly. But on the recommendation of the lonely planet we decided to go. Apparently it had been a bit grim about ten years ago, but since then they have had a massive overhaul and it is FANTASTIC! The animals are in large enclosures, some of it almost like a safari park, and they are obviously very well taken care of and happy. We went first thing in the morning and left last thing at night and still didn't get round it all, so we decided to go the next day to see the rest. The restaurant there is ok, it serves beer which is quite strange to be in a zoo drinking beer, but there are loads of picnic benches and most people seemed to bring there own food. It's very easy to get to, a bus takes you directly to the door, and I think it only worked out about the equivilant of £4.50 to get in. If you go, and you should, say 'hi' to the red panda for me :o)
