One of the best Zoos in the world, cheap entry, very scenic, animals well looked after,. Prague zoo has to be one of the best zoos i've ever been to.Entry is 150kc (about £5) and defintely a bargain considering the size of the zoo and the amount of things to do and see.The animals all seem to be very well looked after and placed in reasonable sized dwellings for each animals.For me the highlight defintely had to be the tigers (siberian and sumatran) and the big cats pavillion as well as the polar bears.The views as you walk aorund certain areas of the zoo are simply beautiful.It's a great place to go for families with young children, and even adults without children wanting a nice walk whilst seeing many different beautiful animals.Definitely recommended.

Good zoo. I'm not a huge fan off Zoo's but this is a good one with lots of open space for the animals.All the signage is not in English, but that's not a problem.Some of the attractions are at the top of the hill, involving a steep climb, or use of the chairlift (which is only open during 'high` tourist season)

Good for children. Nice variety of animals, Was a bit noisy (as you would expect in attractions where the main audience is children).Nice option, do it after you finished all other main-attractions in prague.

Well worth the tram journey from downtown Prague!. It's not an easy place to get to, but switching trams was all part of the enjoyment. A huge place and well kept, it represents excellent value at only 150 Corunas for the whole day - and you need a full day+ to see all it has to offer.

Fantastic day out. The Zoo was amazing! So cheap to get into and had great views over the city. Loved the bird enclosure that you can walk into, and the Africa field was so big...great to see the Zebras running around. Plenty of animals I hadn't seen before, but they do focus on a lot of birds.New enclosures were being built for the elephants and hippos amongst others...will be great when it's finished.
The best zoo in Europe. Amazing zoo, cheap entry and wonderful experiences. I recommend to visit!!!
A Must Place in Summer. Should take your young children during summer and they really enjoy the Prague Zoo.
Reconstructed after floods in 2002. Floods in 2002 gave the ZOO nice face after reconstruction. Floods were a disaster for anyone in the city, including me. But now ZOO looks amazing.

What a zoo this it.. This is by far the best zoo i have been too, although only the 3rd (paignton.bristol,longleat, cricket st thomas) There is a great selection of animals in lovely enlcosures.Only cost us 150cks (£5.50ish)to get in and would have been happy had i paid £20 or even £30.this was the best thing i saw in prague.Lovely and scenic and lovely enclosures makes this a place not to miss.

Must-visit in Prague!. The Prague Zoo is really one of the best zoos in the world! To my mind, your trip to Prague will be imperfect if you don't visit the zoo. Me and my husband were so impressed with this attraction! First of all, the zoo is really enormous. You will spend at least 3 hours there, wandering about and enjoying the views.The zoo is always kept in good order, all animals are well-cared-for and look quite happy. Of course you will enjoy your visit more in summer, but in winter it is also worth seeing.There are plenty of snack bars on the territory, so you can always have a rest if you're tired.You will definitely leave the zoo with plenty of wonderful impressions!

Winter wonderland. Most people might not consider going to the zoo when it's snowing a lot, but let me tell you: if you're in Prague, and it's snowing, don't think twice! It's really a magical experience to see this Zoo completely covered in snow. Sure, you won't see a lot of the animals outside, but the landscape is simply beautiful. We pretty much had the entire Zoo for ourselves, so it was always just our little group and the animals. A very different experience from visiting a Zoo with hundreds of people staring. This is a Zoo that you should visit in every season.

One of the most beautiful Zoos on this planet!. Situated on the side of a mountain and with beautiful views of forests and hills, this Zoo is one of the most beautiful I have ever visited - and I've seen a few.Make sure you block out the entire day as this place is a rather huge.
great place to visit with family. Only positive comments, great experience for weekends and any other days

Great day out!. Definitely worth a visit if you have time, easy journey from centre of Prague by metro and bus. Well maintained with spacious, well designed enclosures. We had a lovely day at Prague zoo, which was helped by a bit of sunshine!
One of the best ZOOs in Prague.. Little big far of the city, but managable by public transportation. Take a subway and then a bus.
Amazing day out. Not to be missed if you have a spare day. I absolutely loved it and the animals are well cared for. The highlight of my trip.

Great place. Great place to go for a walk and relax. If you don't want to walk, you can use the train :) You can find there many species of animals, cages and runs are clean and large. Everything's clean and it's easy to orientate oneself.
Brilliant Zoo. Really lovely zoo, highly recommend it. It would be a great day out for families (though my and my husband went and loved it - we are just big kids though).

Great Zoo. We have visited several Zoo's over the world and we were very impressed with Prague Zoo. The entrance fee is really cheap at around £6 and worth every penny. There's some fantastic enclosure's and they are building some large new enclosure's so lots going on. The polar bears are great to watch playing in the water, they have several big cats and you could spend hours watching the gorilla's. Allow yourself around 4 hours to get around the zoo and try to go early morning as it gets busy by lunchtime.

very nice. cool - real european standard. animals are well treated and there are great conditions created for them in here. It's a unique chance to see animals in their natural environment. Also Zoo offers a lot of interactive fun!

An okay zoo. I've been to several zoo's but it's nothing better then oters. In february many cages were empty which is sad. The animals looked great and they had 'enough' space (it is never enough). It is a great attraction for kids though. You can get there easily by metro and bus. Buy food and souveniers. Pets are also alloud in the park.

Nice visit in Prague Zoo - but a lot of empty space.... I february 2012 I visitet Prague Zoo with my family (girls age 7 and 13) and we liked the place. There was a couple of animals we had never seen before, and especiallt the tigers were a succes for my girls.The entrance fee was very reasonable, and the Zoo was easy to find with a GPS. But in the summer i suspect parking to be a challenge. The Zoo was quite empty even this lovely tusday in february with the sun shining. The park is located very nicely on af slope next to the Vlatava River with nice views over the city. Unfortunately a lot of the animals ware not out, but it beeing february this was in many places understandable. All in all a nice day out, but the park seriuosly needs better signs (in english!), and the petting zoo was totally worn down. The staff was helpfull but like many other places i Prague their knowledge of english or german is not good.

LOVED IT!. This zoo is so cheap, only 150 czk (about £5), It is such a big zoo and the animals we did see were great! We went the second week in Feb so it was still quite cold so not all the animals were out e.g. lions, giraffes. I had alot of fun here however and it is a very big zoo

One of the best zoos!. I have been to lots of zoo's and based on the animals here and the price this has to be by far on of the best. We was slightly dissapointed because it was cold so a lot of the animals were inside and not all of the attractions were open, but it was still well worth the money and would recommend to anyone!

Stunning location and habitats. Must sees = Polar bears, giraffes, tiger, wolves, gorillas, and goats on a rock face. New enclosures being built for hippos and elephants. Extremely reasonable (150 kroner each). Easy to get to by metro and bus.
Great Zoo. Zoo cheap to get in approx £5. Got a cab from town 270 crowns. make sure you agree the cab price before you get in though

Great zoo. Czech always told me how great is the zoo of Prague. The previous director did a great job, he was promoting during the previous years great advertissment for zoo in Prague. With amazing pictures of animals in big format. I everytime spend a nice time there.

Best to visit in the summer. They take good care of the animals, but it's best to visit it in the summer, as most of the settings are in open space. They are struggling to continuously improve.Most animals there have a sponsor (anyone can adopt or sponsor an animal - see their website).
Kids place. It was good for the kids, but it was probably a bit too cold to go there and see some things, so would recommend people doing it earlier in the year when the weather is warmer.

Birds!. A disappointing zoo on the whole, but very cheap considering. I found the zoo to be a bit bird-heavy, with alot of empty enclosures but then it was the winter. Highlights include the penguins and the turtles.
Great zoo. Just a great place to wander on the weekend. They are really upgrading the facilities (much destroyed in the flood).

A great walk with the added incentive of animals.. We loved the zoo, will go back if we have the chance.
Be careful in the hottest months of summer though, as it might be too much with kids.

1 incredible day. Prague's fabulous architecture might keep you away from the zoo, but if you decide to go there, you will have the best time ever. First of all the entry fee seemed very cheep for a place like that. Very big, and still getting bigger as they are still working there. Been there in november 2011 and spent five hours there until closing time, at four. You feel like there is always something new to come and another species to see. Before leaving we ate at one restaurant there and the food was very good and cheep.
very friendly place for animals. very friendly place for animals and a lot of educative programms

Good side line attraction but a bit far out of town. This zoo is a great place to visit. It has all sorts of wonderful animals, an enclosure where bats fly freely above your head and hippos and elephants which are so close you can almost touch them!The zoo is a bit far out of town though so can take a while on the public transport system and I expect would cost a bit in a taxi.If you have a few days spare and are at a loss at what to do, or you have bored kids, then this is a great place to visit.

Lovely zoo, kids gonna love it!. Travelling with kids? This is one of the best attraction for kids in Prague.. but that doesn't mean, this place is only for kids, if you love animals, you will love this place. This zoo is so huge, that it is like a small city in itself, you probably need a whole day to explore it fully!

Excellent. I’m a fan of animals so it was for me a must to see the Prague Zoo, despite it was December and I was worried if we will see at least some of them I was positively surprised. There are many pavilions which you can visit all year round and all of the animals which are placed indoors can be seen in the winter homes. Especially I liked the show with the seals and the variety of birds they have in this ZOO. In case you like animals and walking around this is a must.
Great Zoo but.... It looks like some animal can't tolarate the winter. couldn't see them.

Amazingly BIG zoo !. I visited this many times and never was able to see it all, it's huge! Best for me were the polar bear and the seals. I saw just 2 tigers (probably was cold and they were inside) and liked the monkey 'open' cage where you can actually get inside !!

Exhausting. It took us a long time to walk around inside, and it was not really worth it. One of the central attractions, the polar bears, were crammed in a small cage where they anxiously walked around and jumped in the small pool to cool themselves in the summer noon heat. Why would they exhibit such polar bears in a sun-baked petite cage? A lot of other animals were not treated much better. It was crowded and noisy, too, which added to the misery. Not recommended.
Relax. So fun! I can spend 4 hours there. Literally. It's great for families but for dates as well. you get to be outside and relax. Just don't go there when it's terrible weather.

definately worth a visit. fantastic zoo, very big, need plenty of time, walking uphill is good exercise and worth it for the fantastic rainforest area, brilliant bat exhibition, best ive ever been too, great animals lots of variety, brilliant value for money. really enjoyed this day out,
top5 in the world. this is seriously the best zoo ive ever seen. it also is one of the top5 ZOOs in the world. Prague ZOO is a must for every traveller!
One of the best Zoos in Europe. The zoo is located on a hill. It has a wide variety of animals, it is a nice walk and it has plenty of places to rest, eat or drink.

So many things to see!. It is a very big zoo compared to other European zoo's I visited. What's nice about it is that the animals are not crammed in small cages but have large natural plains to live in. The entrance fee is low and you get to see so many animals. Do not miss out.
great zoo. We went there with our 1.5 y/o child, and all of our family has enjoyed it very much.

Go there during summer and enjoy beatifull day. Very nice and big enough. With childs you will enjoy a max. A lot of different kind of animals from smallest insect to the biggest elephants. Also a lot of potential to take a rest and have a stack and drink. I was there 2009, and I am looking forward to go there with my family again.

A full day out at the Zoo. We love zoos. We took the local underground and (zoo) bus - took about 30 minutes. There was a big queue as it was school holidays - but the queue went down very quickly. There were heaps of different sorts of animals - and birds - the vultures were huge! Inside spaces had anything from ants and ant - eaters (not together of cause), snakes and nocturnal mammels with their babies. The Elephant park was just being built - but looked huge. And there were Meerkats - which had a big crowd!! Loved it all.
Brilliant!. Make sure you have a whole spare day to visit the Zoo! Its absolutely massive, it took us about 8 hours to go and see everything. The polar bear and the giraffes were awesome!
Nice. Many cute animals, very easy to find, excellent to spend time with kids.

Amazing place - Unbelievable price. Went here on boxing day on the tram(12?) & then bus (112) took about 20 mins from Prague 5 area. I couldn't believe the price it was about £5-6 to get in (150czk). I couldn't believe how close you could get to the animals. Also a good point to add is the price of food & drink was cheap (i'd of expected it to be expensive). Would like to go back in summer.

Zoo in Prague. The most beautiful zoo in the Czech Republic, completely destroyed by a flood in 2002, then rebuilt into a pleasant place to spend your free time, many special programmes and houses to entertain after walks, definitely worth visiting!

amazin zoo. Square of the zoo is great. Many kinds of beasts, birds, reptilies. all animals in good conditions Price is budget enough for a ticket and in cafe aswell, though cafe was a bit higher than average in Prague. I was in march and i'm sure that impressions in summer will be much bright, because many animals was in the closed premise.

Good day out!. Visited it on X-Mas day and made for a nice (yet cold) day out! Last zoo I visited was that of London and Prague zoo has by far a much wider selection of wild and rare animals! it Also some interesting exhibits (Indonesian Jungle, African Savannah , gorillas etc) also they where in the process of building new exhibits for the long outdated Hippo and elephant ones which was a good sight to see

Great day out and fantastic value for money. I go to Prague regularly but had not been to Prague zoo since I was a small child and could remember very little about it. Having decided to return, I checked online before I went and was stunned to find out that every Monday in December they were only charging 1 crown for entry (about 3p!). Even the usual price of 150 crowns is incredibly cheap considering the amount of time you spend there (we were there about 6/7 hours). It is very spread out, with lots of hills, so you end up doing a lot of walking, which we liked but I understand that may not be to everyone's liking. They do, however, have carts that you can hire to put small children in and all those we saw being pulled along in one seemed as though they were having a great time. I was amazed at the size of the zoo and the amount of different animals there were to see. I particularly enjoyed being able to get so close to all of them. The highlight was seeing the elephants being taken for a walk around the zoo! I also liked the twilight cave, where the bats fly freely around you, and spent ages watching the slow loris! The only downside was that lots of the animals were inside their houses/cages, which obviously isn't as nice as seeing them moving about in their bigger enclosures (I'm assuming this was because of the low temperature).Getting there was easy. We travelled on the metro to Nadrazi Holesovice (C/red line) and then got the 112 bus from directly outside, which drops you off at the entrance gate to the zoo.I would definitely recommend a visit, even when the weather is colder in the winter.

One of the Top 10 ZOO´s in Europe. Place was heavily damaged during the flood in August 2002.They done a lot of work and today it´s the most visited in whole city after the Prague Castle.Don´t miss Ape pavilion or Przewalski horse section.

just wonderful. Even if we've visited the Zoo in December, the surroundings were still green, a good diversity of animals, they looked very well taken care of, we have enjoyed very much the time spent here.I think that a visit in spring or summer must be delightful!

The most beautifull Zoo in Europe. I go there every moth with my children and it is always a dream for them to go there. It is clean and also if it is a zoo animals seems to be happy. Nice space and it take me and my children more than 4 times to visit all the Zoo. Very nice
A must-see place. Awesome zoo! Fresh air, lots of trees (bamboo!), happy, healthy animals. Nice cafe in the center of it. Easy to ge to from the subway by bus.

Natural and Spacious. I have been to many zoo's in my lifetime and I always admit I HATE how animals have to be placed in such unnatural artificial enclosures either to appease the humans or to "fool" the animals into thinking they live in the Serengeti. However, my first trip to the Prague zoo shortly after the flood of 2002 I was astounded how much attention to creating spacious and wonderfully natural enclosures the Prague zoo had done. My favourite enclosure was the giraffe habitat with acres of space to roam in. The animals looked healthy and were seemingly not "mad" with cramped space as I had witnessed in the Berlin zoo (something unholy to behold). The zoo is so large its almost hard to see it all in a day. There are two "levels" one up quite high on the hill and the lower part. The crowds are quite large some days as we have tried to go during holidays and literally could not find parking (a premium). I would suggest taking public transit and avoid the misery of having to park a few kilometres from either entrance.
Excellent. monkeys, gorillas, lift, large pavilions, atmosphere, reasonable price.

World class zoo. Prague Zoo is world class zoo. There aren't thousands of different species but the ones there are well selected. The care for the animals is great. The zoo-keepers have tried to re-create the natural habitat of the species and I think they have succesed.The most interesting animals are the red panda, gorillas, polar bear, penguins etc.You have to spend at least half a day in the zoo.

wonderful at every corner. well set off early on brisk coldish day but dry to see what this place had to offer , arrived on bus from holesevice easy to get to as bus stops and ends at zoo near enough and easy transport back and thought would been about 300 ck at least to get in or ten pounds but amazed to see it was just 150cz or about £5  anyhow walked around and straight away you get a feel thsi place is good or bad and this pl,ace was good more than that , at every corner and bend something good appeared from 4 large wolves howling and playing , to the cages of the mountain goats up the cliff edge to the large mesh over the rocky side for the large hunting birds , to the tiny cages fror small spiders inside and the moinkey cage with about 8 monkeys playing and eating could watched them for hours , to the seal tyrainer giving the seals their food and jumping through rings and going where she pointed , oh and so so much more , polar bearfs lions tigers elephants , lots giraffes  so if you do go to prague and mange to leave charles bridge make a visit to the zoo as it wonderful and cheap and great day out

Visit Prague zoo but don't expect too much despite your guides telling u it rates high in the world.. It's spread out. So lots of walking. A bit haphazard, for example lions and elephants missing, monkey in with mountain goats looking confused, tiger in cage easily accessible by public with no staff on guard, accident waiting to happen. Bats flying around freely divebombing public. And one sad, freezing cold kangaroo.

The best zoo in the interests of its animals!. This zoo is magical to those who enjoy viewing animals who are well cared for, in their large enclosures. However, i don't like to see creatures penned up, away from their natural surroundings, but this place is the best of its kind in the world.
super day out. Clean,very well layed out, good value for money, great for the family. Prague zoo is bar far my familys favorite day out. A must when in Prague.
My review in Russian. Take a look at my review in Russian on my personal blog: http://geniusua.livejournal.com/34451.html

Well worth a visit. I went to Prague Zoo mainly to see the Przewalski's horses they have there. I had no idea how big the zoo was but could have stayed a lot longer than planned had I known the scale of the zoo. I stayed for 5 hours & still did not see everything. There is so much there & they are improving things all the time.At present they are building a new elephant enclosure, a very impressive structure which I'm sure the anilmals will benefit from.There is a wide variety of exhibits where you can view the animals outside & inside. The cafe is basic but serves a decent meal at a reasonable price. The gift shop is small & sells mainly toy animals but they do have a few books & postcards. There are small catering outlets dotted about the zoo, some have spectacular views over the valley.It not expensive to get into the zoo, we paid Ckz150 ( about £6)to get in.The only down side is that it is not easy to reach on public transport so a taxi is the best bet.

Famous gorillas living here. A very nice zoo with the famous gorilla family, whose fans from allover the world are making it a bit crowdy in the pavilion, but you'll have a chance to stand at the glass.And I liked the enclosures for horned animals living on the rocks which are placed on the slope of a real mountain.

Polar Bears in view. The zoo at Praque is a graet place to walk round. It is abit hilly but a good place to take kids. The polar bears are very repetative in their behaviour but i have to say they are very close when you see them swimming. The gorillas are great. It is a zoo still being developed but well worth a visit. A good day out, enjoy the chair lift for great views of the city.
Good for kids. Very nice ZOO is in Prague Troja. I went there with my childrens and they enjoyed it.
Great day out!. Prague zoo is great value and a great fun day out. Especially loved the polar bears and the bats! Super easy to get there by public transport.

Great day out in the zoo. I really enjoyed my trip to Prague Zoo recently.I decided to get a taxi as I was unsure of the transport. There is cost 300CZK but I got stung on they way back 480CZK.The admission was only 150CZK so that was great.The highlight for me was the polar bears. I was speechless to see them swim and play with the ball, it was an incredibly experience to get so close.I was very upset with the elephant enclosure. They seemed very unhappy and I couldn't understand why one male elephant was all alone in a seperate play, he did seem very lonely rocking back and forth.I found it interesting that they allow dogs in the zoo, some of the animals were very amusing with this.I said and had a nice hot drink in a small cafe which was well priced and pleasant to come in from the cold.Some of the indoor enclosures were very smelly which I ahven't experienced previously much at many other zoo's. Overall a lovely day out with lot's of walking.
One of the best. Deservedly nominated as one of the best ZOO´s in the world....
A great day out for a cheeky monkey.. it's BRILLIANT. polar bear, baby gorilla, spider monkeys, crocs, hippos, elephants... everything, it has everything!

Excellent. What an excellent day out! The zoo is massive and has loads of animals to see. The polar bears are especially good! Easy to access using public transport and admission fee was only 150 Czech/ £5.00 per adult, bargain!
Beautifil place !. By a nice weather I surely recommend the visit ! The botanical garden in the neighbourhood is also just amazing !

Incredibly cheap and very large zoo. If you like Zoo's, the Prague Zoo is a little gem which doesn't appear in many of the guide books. It's very cheap to get in (Less than 100 crowns for an adult) and you can literally spend all day there exploring as it's huge! Really well presented and laid out and the animal welfare was really good (apart from the elephant enclosure, but they're building them a new one!)

Speechless. Being the biggest Zoo in Europe and most popular, its definately the place to go visit, you have all types of animals to see from all over the World, the Zoo itself is very neat, organized and Child Friendly as there is lots to do.... You could spend the whole day there, thats how big it is, have areas with Shade to rest and stands selling good food/snacks and refreshments if needed.
Much bigger zoo than in other Eastern European cities. We liked that animals are having big places not like in other zoo. On the other hand you should walk a lot between two sectors.

Much more natural and "fence-free" than most zoos!. Prague zoo was far one of the nicest zoo I've visited. The animal's spaces were bigger than in most zoos, great systems allowing fences and caging to be reduced, new elephant park in construction (which is going to be quite big so it feels nice to know those animals are going to have a happier life), huge savannah space. Beautiful entrance tickets.I wanted to buy a bucket of elephant poop as a joke for my father but they ran out of it.. =)

Concern for the elephant and large bird enclosures. The Zoo is impressive and large. The most enjoyable visits were to the seals in their tanks, who engaged with the public when they moved their hands around the glass. The seals followed.I was disturbed by the elephant enclosure and the large tropical birds. The birds were in such small enclosures they couldn't roost as two of the elephants seemed to be disturbed and doing distracted movements and rocking as though at the end of their sanity. The third elephant did her best to prop the other two up with calming nudges. The large black and white birds' cage was very small and they with four of them in the space of a small bathroom they were competing for a place to roost. With all that room there should be bigger spaces for the birds and the elephants should be in the countryside in a savanna enclosure like Whipsnade in England.

great zoo. The zoo is quite big and there are many animals there that you would not expect to find in Central Europe. The only bad point is that the zoo is made on a hill and it is quite tiring to climb it each time you want to see a part of it. The food there is not that amazing.

A little sad. This is a small zoo and compared with zoos is this country and America it is rather sad with tigers and lions in very small cages but it was interesting and no doubt the local children enjoy outings there. One just hopes the larger animals get to go somewhere else for a break. There must be plenty of countryside so may be there is a Lion park - one hopes

Wonderful day out.. We spent a whole day at the Zoo. Its an excellent zoo, very large with a great collection of species.They use a section of rocky hillside to give mountain goats a natural habitat.Loved it there. Its eay to get to on public transport too.

AMAZING!. Great trip!!!Highly recommended. We took a boat from the center directly to the ZOO. We passed under the Charles Bridge and we saw the whole Prague from a different view. The ZOO is new and has a lot of animals which I didnt see in an other zoo. There are island with animals where you can enter and be in between the animals. I believe it was named in the TOP 10 ZOOs in the world. I agree!

Great Diversion for Kids. Zoo Praha (Prague) does not stand out among the great zoos of Europe, but it is a clean, well-run diversion for kids tired of sightseeing. Having visited Prague before, I let my wife take adults to the sites while I took the kids to the zoo. All the regular zoo stuff plus a cool playground. Food was inexpensive and good (though the ordering process is a bit chaotic for non-Czech speakers. You can get there by bus, but our hotel recommended driving. With a navi, it was easy to find.

Prague Zoo, one of the best we've visited.. We first thought of visiting the zoo by boat, but found the trip wasn't available at the end of Sept. However, the tram was an easy, convenient and cheap transport system. Number 17 tram took 20 minutes to get to the zoo stop, 2km from the zoo location. We however walked the distance and enjoyed the flat easy journey. The zoo itself was one of the best we've been to. Clean, well organised, easily navigated and plenty of variety to keep anyone happy for a full day. Being a hot day we used the refreshment facilities situated regularly across the park. A nice cold beer and a light meal at one of the many picnic benches was most welcome.A small point to note..we purchased tram tickets for our return journey at the zoo. But with it being so busy around the machine felt it's better if you purchase these in Prague beofre you set off.

Fun ZOO - take the boat to get there. This is a very nice ZOO in a beautiful setting. Well worth it, with or without kids. I wouldn't bother going there if I was only on a very short stop in Prague, but if you're there longer, it's worth it. Also, you get to see some "regular" life, with locals and their kids. Not to worry about language issues, as all labels are in English as well. Quite impressive actually.We took a boat there (http://www.praguesteamboats.com/river-cruises-to-prague-zoo.aspx), floating down the Vltava for around an hour, including going through locks. Interesting views - pleasant way to get there. You get to see the "other" Prague, the part that most tourists wouldn't see. These boats leave either from Rasinovo Nabrezi or from Na Frantisku (in front of the hospital). I don't think this service is available in the winter. A quick way to get back to town is by "ZOO bus", a bus that takes you for a mere 1Kcz from the ZOO's entrance to Holesovice metro station. Warning about the boat option: The walk from the boat to the ZOO is quite long, so you might want to avoid this means of transportation if you're not much of a walker.On the other hand, if you have lots of time, you might want to stop at Troja Chateau, along the way. This is a beatiful site, with a lovely garden.The ZOO itself has a good collection, not as big as some, but has interesting, unique exhibits, including a night pavilion for nocturnal creatures. Watch out for the free-flying bats!The facility is on two levels, meaning parts of it are on a hill, and walking around can get tiring. There are chairlifts to take you to the top level! Also a little ZOO train for the kiddies.Toilets are abundant, as are eating places. Quite impressive, actually. Several restaurants, self-serve and otherwise. We had burritos (and beer of course!) at one place, and crepes with nutella and fresh bananas at another. Everything from burgers to Czech specialities to stir-fryes.the ZOO has a very good, informative website in English with map.

Better than I expected!. I had read the reviews and saw that people liked it, but I was still expecting a rather small, cramped place. It's not at all. There are still some enclosures that don't seem appropriate (a previous reviewer mentioned the elephants. A note - I'm pretty sure they're making a new elephant area at the back of the zoo.) but most of the zoo was quite nice! It was also much larger than I had expected. We were able to rush through without missing too much in about 2.5 hours, but we easily could have spent more time there. Like somebody else mentioned, a map is a good thing! There's no straightforward route through. If you end up in the middle, by the observation tower, get a bag of mini donuts. They were sooo good!

Only visit this zoo if you can bear watching elephants in extreme distress. Having read all the glowing reports about Prague Zoo, my friend and I decided to take a visit, and I can hardly believe we were at the same place. We are definitely not a pair of bleeding heart liberals or we wouldn’t have decided to go in the first place. What we saw shook us to the core. We walked past a lot of caged birds, and whilst it is never pleasant to see birds flying around in captivity, it did not prepare us for the horror of the elephant enclosure.The enclosure was a small circle, way, way too small for two elephants. It had a pond in the middle and a large tyre hanging from a rope at the far side. The only possible activity for the elephants was to walk around the pond or ‘play’ with the tyre. They were not able to walk more than a few paces in any other direction.One of the elephants was in obvious distress, desolately kicking the tyre before backing slowly away from it, to shrieks of laughter from the crowd watching. The other elephant remained still, its expression one of hopelessness and deep depression.Possibly the rest of the zoo was better, but my friend and I found the sickening spectacle of these two beautiful animals being tortured to the point of insanity by their cramped living conditions so hideous and traumatic that we had to leave.Prague Zoo became an ugly blot on what was otherwise a fantastic holiday.

A wonderful experience with so much to see and enjoy. You would need to set aside a full day to enjoy all that the zoo has to offer. You definately need a site map as there is so much to see and the pathways can get a bit confusing.There are ample toilet facilities and places to rest for refreshments.My favourite moment was the interaction with the ring-tailed lemurs !!!
It's huge!. Go there early. It took 5 hours for me to see everything. Plan your route. Big cats are best.

Great full day out. Plenty to see. Excellent value.. Very impressed with the zoo. Well designed, easy to walk around and see everything. We saw pretty much everything in 5 hours without rushing.Cheap day out and cheap food and beer.We took the zoo cruise boat to get there which was a nice experience.All the animals in general look really happy and have great enclosures.Only bad point was the polar bears. As is common with these bears they were showing tell tale signs of struggling with being in captivity (repetitive swimming from side to side) quote sad. If the bears were released, or at least given a bigger, more natural enclosure, then it would be my favourite zoo ever. Must visit if in Prague for 3 or more days.

THE BEST ZOO!!!. I was really impressed with the Prague zoo! And what a great job they have done restoring it after the terrible flood in 2002. I spent around 5-6 hours there and I couldn't get enough. Usually when you visit zoos you can't help but feel pity for the animals, because they look tired, sick.. But it's the opposite story in Prague Zoo. They did a really great job in creating comfortable and close-to-natural-habitat environment for each animal. It's absolutely worth going! You won't regret it!
Faaaantastic.... Very impressing ZOO take a whole day to walk around simply amazing :)

Excellent value for money. I'm not normally a big fan of zoos but my wife and I took a trip here to escape the heat of the city (around 34 celsius when we were there) and were pleasantly surprised. It's set in very spacious and attractive grounds so, even when busy, it doesn't feel crowded. Furthermore, the animals seem to have a fair amount of space to move around in and they are building a new enclosure for the elephants to give them even more space. The entrance price was cheap by UK standards (although you had to pay a nominal amount for a map which I would strongly recommend.) The zoo is well laid out and for those who don't want to walk all the way round there is a mini train that one can take (although this is extra as is the chairlift that you can take to ascend the hillside). There's so much to see that you do need to invest the best part of a day to make the trip worthwhile. My favourite part was the Indonesian Jungle which was very well designed and the nocturnal section where the fruit bats fly over your head!. They also have a baby gorilla (at the time of writing), a baby hippo and some tiger cubs all of which are very photogenic .There are also plenty of food and drink kiosks dotted around the grounds and the prices are very reasonable. As other reviewers have said it's very easy to get to by metro to Nadrazi Holesovice station and then the 112 shuttle bus. They have a good english language website too.

Nicest time in Prague. It has a lot of animals and the habitats are very nicely done. And they keep expanding. Go see the savannah.
Benches are everywhere also toilets and places where you can drink and eat very good meals at very low prices.

Wow! Brilliant place, plenty of walking, its massive!. What a lovely Zoo! This is a must see. Beautiful surroundings. Animals all happy and active. Large, roomy enclosures. There's a lot of thought gone into this place, and it shows.Really good value at about GBP 6.00 per person, unlike rip-off UK where its double that and a bit more at some establishments.Only comment iwould be that a map should be handed to you along with your entry tickets because you do tend to wonder which way to head sometimes.Relatively easy to get to using the metro and zoo bus. Neither ticket machine working at zoo for return travel tickets so had to pay bus driver.

7hrs was not enough... Most of the tourist in Prague only see spectacular city centre, but only a few minutes along the river you find another amazing site. When getting to the ZOO it is really easy to use public transport, bus 112 (from underground station Nadrazi Holesovice, red line) stops just in front of the main entrance. Fee 150CZK or even less if you are a student is really good value even for Czechs.Having the ZOO on our schedule for a long time we went there at the end of August on a day when thermometer showed more than 35 Celsius degrees in shadow, but just around first corner we found water disperser and there are more of them in the zoo. As soon as you turn to be hungry just find one of many stalls. For those who are tired, there are hundreds of benches and some of them offer you really amazing views. If it starts to rain just hide in some of many pavilions in between some animals (but remember, some of the animals love tropical weather conditions..). For those who would like to see the city from different point of view there is a watchtower in the upper part of zoo. Don’t want to climb the hill to see what’s there? Use the funicular. Have a dog and don’t want to leave him for a whole day? Take him with you. Just a symbolic fee allows you to spend the day with your pet. The zoo is trying to keep it “dog-friendly.” so time to time you find a spot where dogs can drink. But of course, you can’t take them to the pavilions. Your children got bored? There is even a “children-zoo” providing some activities.Remember to take good shoes, since you can walk up to dozen of kilometres there. A camera is a must unless you don’t live in a safari.. There is one disadvantage – as a tourist who does not understand Czech language you will probably not catch all the facts which enrich your stay at the zoo (history of zoo, 2002 flood, protection of animals..), but if you spend more days in the city, just do it as an amazing relax.And for those who are interested in special experiences, every single day you can see animals being fed at announced times, time to time they offer thematic tours or just a night walk there. All you need is a few hours of your time and I can highly recommend going there.PS: In the neighbourhood there are a botanical garden and chateau, so you can buy a ticket which covers everything in this part of Prague.

Great zoo and easy to get to on public transport. We had decided we were visiting the zoo after reading the good reviews.We were a family group with adult children and no little ones.Easily accesible by metro and then the 112 bus having said that the bus was packed with lots of strollers and it was standing room only but thankfully it was only a short journey.Admission price very reasonable at 150 crowns however somehow got ripped off by the guy who drives one of the little trains round who sold us 14 tickets for the 6 of us at 30 crowns each which seemed wrong compared to the admission price, he spoke no english so it was impossible to get an explanation why he had sold us so many so dont know if this is a regular occurence so beware.Lots of animals, great enclosures and nicely laid out all in all a good day out.Definately the best zoo I have visited,

must not miss it. we walked 4h and saw 98% of the zoo.it's very nice, it's a must see ; the zoo prague is the 7'th in the world if I'm not mistaking and the entry is 150czk, a map of the zoo 5czk , and then to go to an upper lever for other animals you take a tele chair to that lever for 20czk/person.

Very nice zoo, but #1 attraction?. We love zoos, and visited this on because it was listed as the #1 attraction in Prague. It is a fine zoo, well-designed with lots of shade and a good quantity and selection of animals. However, it was not very different than other good zoos I have visited in the United States. If you are a tourist seeking to see what is unique in the Czech Republic - and there is plenty - I would not put the zoo on your list if you normally have access to a good zoo.

Exceeds Expectation. Our guidebook describes the Prague Zoo as one of those old-fashioned mid-European ones one hates to remember from childhood. Reluctantly we went, at the wish of our teenager who saw an attractive poster for it. From the first moment we were pleasantly surprised! Not only do the animals seem healthy, well cared for and content, but the Zoo's management obviously understands what it means to bring children to such a physically demanding outing. There are wonderful children's areas, cool streams, even a pool where kids can play. The food stalls cater to various tastes and are not junk-food oriented. There are several means of transportation within the Zoo, but also lots of shady resting places. The Zoo itself is actually enormous. We walked for three hours, guided by a very well marked map and haven't seen more than two thirds. Lot's of interesting and rare animals. Interesting point: one can buy their elephant dung as fertilizer. The staff is very friendly and helpful. All in all, it was a day well spent.

a lovely well designed zoo. to get to the zoo travel on the number 12 tram heading in the "castle" direction.Get off at the bus station at nadrazi holeovice and catch the very frequent 112 bus direct to zoo gates total trip cost £1.20 each way.Prague zoo is set in a wood has a little train which takes you all around zoo for a pound.There is also a chair lift that takes you up a small hill to the upper zoo costs 80pence each way.You can also walk.There are many cafes on the route around the zoo.The animals seem very happy none of that pacing up and down and around and around the cages.Ideal zoo to take children admission for adult circa £6.

A day at the Zoo. It was one of the highlights for sure!We're both in our 30's my gal and I and feel closer to animals then we do Churches (which were nice, but soooo many of them)...The Prague Zoo is magnificent, i loved every one in it. Zoo management really love the animals there and you can see it.Don't think about it, just go - it's worth the extra trip :-)

Excellent zoo. We visited the Prague Zoo for 10 full hours - the entire opening period of the day - and it was great.Lots of exhibitions and different animals, beautiful sorroundings and very fair prices. We had a day of saying only yes to our kids, since everything was So cheap. The entrance fee for the entire family was the same as it would be for one adult in Denmark. The ice creams, slush ice, coffees and sodas were much cheaper than in the city center and the restaurants were fairly priced as well.we will surely repeat our visit, next time we visit Prague.

Best zoo I've been to. What an awesome zoo! The animals were highly visible; due to the construction of the enclosures which dropped down towards the sides so fences weren't necessary for a lot of the animals. Also a wide range of animals including polar bears, hippos, Inidian elephants, tigers, lions. There were also some enclosures which you could go inside and get very close to the animals, such as the lemurs and some birds. A huge number of species in total. One warning though; there are some pretty steep climbs in part of the zoo which are hard work if you're pushing a baby buggy on a hot day! Highly recommended

Hidden Gem, worth a whole day's visit and more. I can honestly say I've never seen anything like it. For a zoo that is on the edge of a city, you'd easily think you were out in the country. Built into a hillside this zoo has no 'cages' as such. Each animal has it's enclosure that is as close to their natural habitat as possible (and with plenty of opportunities to get up close) - ie the mountain goats have a mountain side to jump across, there's a stream/river that runs through the middle of the zoo and it's not uncommon for a family of ducks to waddle past you on the path. some of the enclosures have 'kissing gate' style entrances so you can enter and be inside with the creatures such as birds, there is a lima area where you can go in under the careful eye of zoo staff. Big cats etc are behind glass/plastic walls that you can get right up close to. I could go on and on but I wont. It also has marine life, nocturnal creatures a couple of kids play areas (there could be more, but we were only there about 5 hours so didn't see everything). At the top there is a food / drink area with breathtaking views over Prague, I think there is a mini train to get you around as well as a sort of ski lift if you want to get from top to bottom in a hurry otherwise everything just seems to be sloped so good for pushchairs, wheelchairs etc.. The entry fee is around £5 and food / drinks are cheap which is a nice change for a tourist attraction that has you in its grasp. We travelled to the zoo on foot from the stadium through the park, it was about a 45 minute walk at a brisk pace but you can get a bus which drops you right outside (goes between the zoo and nearest metro station). If I get to go back to Prague again I will definitely be revisiting the zoo
great day out. The Prague Zoo is the best one I have ever visited. The animals are in great shape, the staff are very helpfull. I am going back to visit Prague very soon and you should too.

So many happy animals. I am not a Zoo fan I I believe animals should be free and happy. But this Zoo is amazing; the animals have so much space, real space. The place is well kept, easy access from centre of the city and well organized too.The display of animals is also vast, you can spend at least 5 hours there and not get enough.The Polar Bears are the best animal I saw there, they were very active and looked happy too!

A great day out in the summer. A good time at the zoo. Two options to get to zoo - ferry or metro. We took the metro to the zoo, but took a boat/ferry ride back to Prague. It was a great ending. The exhibits and pavilions were interesting. Interesting animals we wouldn't see elsewhere. We were hoping to see more local animals or animals from this regions in their natural habitats. It was disappointing to discover some of the trees were made out of fiberglass and not natural wood. We are glad that the zoo is recovering well after the 2002 flood. A really nice summer day spent at the zoo.

Awsome. One may never think of visiting a zoo in such a historic city as Prague but for me it is a MUST after having seen itAmazingly well put together , very natural and a whole day treat for children as well as adultsI would say DONT MISS

Great Zoo. I am not a big fan of Zoos or animals being kept in captivity, usually the zoos I have experienced are small, the pens dirty. However Prague zoo was a positive experience, there are a large variety of animals and the enclosures were large well maintained, the animals did not seem stressed. A good day experience close to Prague!

Excellent zoo in a huge area on the outskirts of the city. Visited as part of a city break. Took a special boat trip to reach the park and admission was very reasonable (only around £6), especially when compared to similar attractions in the UK. Spent several hours in the attraction, which is situated on a hillside overlooking Prague.Highlight was the Polar Bears while the Zoo was a very modern facility with well maintained and large enclosures for all the animals.

Nice zoo not far from the city centre. I visited the zoo during the winterseason, so not al the animals were outside. It is a nice zoo, with a diversity of animals. The entrance is very cheap( 5 euro) and It's very close to the city center ( Tram 5 + bus 112). The food in the restaurant at the entrance is very good. The zoo is partly on the ground floor, and the rest on a hill. There is a cablewaybetween the 2 parts.

Best Zoo experience. We are big zoo people and this one is definitely the best we've seen. Highlight was hopping off the sidewalk to allow 2 elephants the Right-of-Way. Amazing. Using the scenery the way they did to create the exhibits was both creative and the most natural zoo settings I've seen.Bit of an adventure to get out there, metro to bus, but totally worth it.

Need a break from Baroque? Zoo Praha!. If the thought of seeing another gilted cherub is making you nauseated, take a trip to Zoo Praha! It's the best zoo I have ever visited (my BF says it's better than the San Diego zoo!) and there is SOOOOO much to see. They have an amazing collection of animals (I could spend hours watching the polar bears!), cool exhibits (check out the mountain goats exhibit) and a chair lift that will take you back to the entrance if you're too tired to walk and aren't afraid of heights. The zoo is HUGE and after a day here, you'll be ready to go back to more Baroque, Renaissance and Goth, oh my!

7th best - truly is. Prague zoo is according to Forbes magazine rated as the 7th best zoo in the world and it truly is. After the floods in 2002 it was vastly reconstructed and now has great open spaces where you can go and meet the animals without fences and glass panes. It is also a great zoo to take photos (no additional charge for that and not much fences to disturb your pictures). I am local and I go threre regularly. The landscape is wonderful as well (all the rocks etc. In my opinion it is one of the best non-cultural attractions in Prague.

Great Place to Visit If Travelling with Children. This is the perfect place to take your kids while visiting Prague. Our 7-year-old daughter loved it. My husband and I enjoyed seeing the animals very much too. While the centre of Prague seems too crowded and noisy, the Prague Zoo is spacious enough even on a sunny Sunday. You can spend the whole day there and not be bored. Wonderful walk, great homes for the animals and impressive variety and numbers of animals. Reasonable prices of food and drinks and of souvenirs too (unlike major sights). Highly recommend it!
Great 1/2 day trip. Easy to get there. Animals looked well taken care of and happy. Nicely landscaped. Has some food outlets by rather limited, I would recomend bringing your own food.

Amazig experience!. We have read a lot of great reviews on this attraction and we have been told that this zoo is already 80 years old, but just after the visit of the Prague Zoo during the Easter holidays of 2011 we truly understood what a great place it is! You could spend one entire day there (I spent there 7 hours and even skipped some parts of it!) - the zoo size is amazing, everything is so well-organized (there have been some reconstructions for relocating some of the big animals but this doesn't affect so much the overall impression), there are so many animals and attractions plus places to rest for a while and eat and/or have a coffee/beer and I could say for sure is that it is a must-see attraction! The easiest way to get there is to catch the C line of the Prague Metro and at the metro station Nazdravi Holesovice to take a bus 112 that will drive you directly to the zoo. The admission fee is 150 Kc per adult (around 5.50 - 6.00 EUR) and 100 Kc (around 4 EUR) for children over 3 years (it's free for children under 3 years), retired people and students, there are also special fares for families (2 adults and 2 children) and groups above 10 people. Among the most spectacular attractions within the zoo is the Indonesian jungle pavilion with an area of 1,950 m2 that holds 160 animal (check the primates - orangutans, gibbons, macaques, leaf monkeys), Komodo dragons, turtles, fish and bird species as well as 1,600 specimens of live plants coming from Southeast Asia. Don't miss also the gorilla pavilion where there is a relatively recently born small gorilla. I would recommend you to visit this zoo during your visit to Prague, you will not regret it for sure!

well worth a visit. We had a thoroughly enjoyable day trip to Prague Zoo. At only 150CZK for the entrance fee & having spent 6 hours there, I definitely thought it was worth the visit. The zoo was really well laid out, has the usual great variety of animals you'd expect from a modern zoo. The public transport there was really straightforward & cheap & the cafes were reasonably priced. We went on Easter Saturday & some of the main animals were too crowded to see properly, but I consider that my fault for choosing that day, not the Zoo's fault.
Welcome to the Jungle. Beautiful weather Saturday meant a trip to Stramovka park and a walk across the river to the zoo. Fantastic day out.

OH MY..... What a surprise!!!!!!!!!!!!. I read reviews on trip advisor about the Zoo in Prague before visiting and decided to take my lady here for her birthday. All I can say is BELIEVE the reviews. This zoo is amazing. For only 150ck ( around £5.50) you can visit something which is truly unbelievable. The zoo took us the best part of 6 hours to visit and we had to miss some because certain areas had us captivated for sooooooo long. I recommend you pay a visit to the Gorillas, Giraffes, Polar Bears and best of all the Orangutan greenhouse. You will be in for a BIG surprise. I wont give it away just go and find out for yourselves (hehe). The zoo is an amazing place with loads to see. I am gonna go back to see the new outdoor section for the elephants and Hippos when it is completed. When we went it was -10 degrees but there are many places to keep warm and it was worth braving the cold lol. Def visit to mix up with the cultural side of the city. Enjoy :-D

was concerned about the non conservation kept animals but habitats great and made interesting for guests. the zoo was spacious and fun there was a seal show where they experienced and kept the seals mentally activy which was very good. the polar bars have got private areas and outdoor areas where they are given toys and room to keep themselves busy. lots of walking. all the exhibits have bi lingual signs in english spanish and believe dutch chinese german and of course czech. in the summer there are lots of flys and bees to be ware of. the food was good and not to expensive. lots to do and see. nice to get out of the city and to a more activy attraction.

Great day! Polar bears were amazing. This is an amazing zoo, the best we have ever been to. The polar bears were amazing and it was great to be so close to them. They have every animal there that you could think of, and they all look really happy.it's a huge zoo, and to make sure you don't miss anything, buy a map in english when you buy your ticket, because all the signs are in czech. i would also get there early too, we got there at about half 11, and didn't really have time to see everything that we wanted to, as we wanted to go back and see the polar bears again. dont be put off by "childrens zoo" we are both 23 and loved it! you can buy food to feed the baby goats it's great fundefinitely worth the trip if you have the time in prague. great value for money.

An excellent day out away from the ancient history of the town... The Zoo is located in Troja so follow the Metro on Line C direction Letnany and get off at Nadrani Holesevice, where a bus can take you up the hill to the Zoo.Because of the distance - perhaps a half-hour from Prague 1- very few tourists make it this far so expect a hassle free and pleasant afternoon.Prague Zoo is a distance out of town, set up on a hillside overlooking the Vlatava valley. On a nice summer's day, there is nowhere better in Prague to go.The Zoo is modern, and being unconfined by the city is spacious with large open uncaged pens for the animals. Having spent a day or two in the tourist mill of Prague 1 a day at the zoo is welcome Rest and Recuperation for anyone.In August, I spent 4 hours here, and rushed the last quarter of the visit because I had to meet someone in town. I'll go back next summer and allow more time!

Don't forget to bring fido!. Everything everyone else has said about Prague Zoo is true, it's a great place. But what surprised and delighted me the most was that you can bring your dog along as well. Ours had a lovely time, there's water provided outside all around the place, and even places to tie them up if you go into one of the buildings where they're not always allowed. The only zoo in the world that does this, so I've been told.

countryside ZOO. Visiting Prague ZOO is a clear pleasure! You need at least 3 hours to see all animals, but is better to spend there all Saturday or Sunday. ZOO is located outside of the city in really nice area. You can get there by bus no. 112 from the metro station Nadrazi Holesovice. All day on the direct hours is possible to see feeding animals for example at 11.00 a.m. penguins, at 14.00 p.m. Komodo dragons. Walking around ZOO is really nice, animals are close to people. Good idea for 1-day trip outside the Prague.

Great Day Out - But a lot of walking. We had a great day at Prague Zoo, probably one of the best if not the best Zoo we have visited. The zoo has vast grounds, so to see everything there is a fair bit of walking, but there are lots of places to stop and have a drink or a snack along the way.There is a huge range of animals here, covering just about everything you can think of. For us the highlight was seeing the gorillas, as there was a 6 month old baby gorilla that was just barely able to walk. Something I have never seen before.As everyone else has said in the reviews, the animals all seem well looked after, many in spacious enclosures.When we visited (October 2010) it wasnt at all busy, and there was a lot of construction work going on to improve the facilities for example the elephants we due to be rehoused in a much larger area.

Bit of a walk but worth it.. We decided to have a walk round Stromovka park with the initial intention of visiting the planetarium. We got there just as it closed for lunch, so thought we would have a walk through the park, when we saw a sign for the Zoo and thought we would head there as a plan B.After 20 minutes of following the signs, we found the Zoo and spent the rest of the afternoon walking around. There is such a wide range of animals with a number of species that I had never even heard of before never mind seen. There was also alot of rebuilding work going on to repair the damage done during flooding, which looks a very good project.While walking round there are numerous indoor sections where you are in the enclosoure with the animals (including Bats, Birds and Monkeys). The Bat/Monkey enclosure was brilliant but nervy, we did not read the sign outside and so did not realise that we were in close contact with the animals until one flew at my head ( which was funny and brilliant to se in equal measure).The wide range of animals in this Zoo is amazing, for example there are 3 different types of tiger alone. I myself love to see different species of birds, I could have spent all day looking at the birds in this Zoo. There was one Australisian birds with huge beaks and heads that I have never seen before and would love to learn more about.All in all this is a very good Zoo with great attractions for both adults and kids. If you have a spare day in Prague I would strongly advise a trip on the red Metro line and then bus 112 to the entrance. I would definately visit the Zoo again on a trip to Prague and hope to visit again once the rebuilding work has been completed, as this looks to be a brilliant attraction once complete.

One of the best zoos in the world. I have been to many zoos all over the world and this zoo was only second to San Diego. The price of this zoo though was amazing, about £5 per person. Drinks and food inside the zoo were very cheap. The animals were very well looked after and there were some enclosures such as the mountain goats I had never seen before.

One of the best ZOO in Europe. This ZOO was hit really bad by floods in 2002. But in these days is back in gerate shape :-) You can visit new pavilons and even small cable railway. The entrance fee is 150 Kc (around 6 EUR or 8USD). To get there take a metro (line C) to "Nadrazi Holesovice" and than continue on special ZOO bus. The jurney takes around half an hour.

Prag ZOO is great. Prag ZOO is the best i have ever visited. Full service for adults and children including furnicular, playgrounds, outside restaurants next to the animals. Location next to the river is just fantastic. Access from the center is easy (it takes by bus/metro 30 min). I recommend visit ZOO at weekdays due to the crowds at weekends. The entrance costs 8 Euro per adult (family tickets available)

Animal lovers - make time to visit Prague Zoo during your trip to Prague. Well worth it!. I love animals. My dream job would involve working with animals. So, when I heard about Prague Zoo, I made sure we included a visit during our trip to Prague. Apparently, this Zoo was voted 7th best Zoo in the world.How surprised was I when we literally stumbled across a polar bear! Yes, they have a polar bear. I had never seen one before (only on TV).If you love animals, you’ll enjoy seeing the range of different animals that we do not have at London / Whipsnade / Colchester Zoo.Some of the enclosures are much better than those I have seen at London Zoo. For example, there are Caucasian Ibex living on the side of a cliff. Watching them climbing up and down the cliff face will cause you to gasp on more than one occasion. There’s also a semi-open bat enclosure that’ll test your nerves – don’t miss it.If you have children, there is a children’s petting zoo. I think there was also Horse / Pony rides.Use can get to the Zoo easily by using public transport. Take metro line C (the red one), to Nádraží Holešovice and then catch either a 112 bus or the designated 'Zoo bus' from outside the metro station. They both stop right outside the zoo's entrance.Entry for one adult is 150CZK (approx £4.95). A child (3-15 years) or student ticket is 100CZK (approx £2.30). A family ticket (2 adults and 2 children) is 450CZK (approx £14.85). Under 3's are free. Grab a map on your way in. It's all written in Czech, but there are pictures to help you work out where the animals are located.Tip: If you forget to pick up a map, use your digital camera to take a photograph of one of the large zoo maps located all over the zoo, and then refer back to it if you get lost.Below, I have listed the times when you can see the animals being fed, as when you get to the zoo, it’s all listed in Czech.June, July and August - every day, if the weather is nice.April, May and September - only at the weekends, if the weather is nice.10:00 - Feeding of the Aardvarks11:00 - Feeding of the Penguins12:00 - Meet the Lemurs12:00 - Feeding of the Peccaries12:30 - Feeding of the Camels13:00 - Meet the Gorillas (this also happens every hour, on the hour)13:00 - Feeding of the Otters (everyday, except Mondays as the pool gets cleaned)13:00 - Feeding of the Moose’s13:30 - Feeding of the Komodo Dragon (only on Saturdays)13:30 - Training of the Southern Fur Seals (everyday, except Fridays as the pool gets cleaned)13:30 - Feeding of the Lorikeets14:00 - Feeding of the Big Cats (everyday, except Saturday)14:00 - Feeding of the Przewalski’s Horses14:00 - Meeting the Iguana (only on Sunday's at the Big Cat's Pavilion)14:30 - Introducing the Giraffes15:15 - Feeding of the Wolves16:00 - Feeding of the Hippopotamuses16:30 - Feeding of the PorcupineThe feedings are good, but the animal keepers will speak only in Czech. We stayed long enough to see the animals being fed, and then left whilst many locals remained to listen to the information from the keeper – this meant we had the next enclosure pretty much to ourselves for a while.Definitely make sure you visit the Giraffes – they are amazing. Look out for Jonah, you can’t miss him – he’s the tallest Giraffe I have ever seen!But don’t bother attending the 14:30 “Introducing the Giraffe” unless you speak Czech. Basically, an animal trainer will show up and just talk about the Giraffes. The enclosure will also be quite busy during this time, so go earlier or later and have the enclosure all to yourself.We made a day of our trip and spend about 5-6 hours there. There are places to eat and the food was better than expected and reasonably priced. Near the exit there is a gift shop, but it is teeny tiny and there’s not a lot on offer.

Excellent Zoo and great value for money!. We used public transport (metro and bus) to get to the zoo, and it was so easy! I would recommend anyone to use the public transport rather than taxis.The Zoo was very cheap (approx £5 per adult) and was huge - we spent about 5 hours here and we also missed some areas out. It was great for kids too, loads for them to do with the petting zoo, paddling pools and play areas. Evereywhere was clean and tidy, there were plenty of food, drink and toilet stops and loads of signs with feeding times etc, The only downside was that there wasn't many signs in English (but there were plenty of pictures so you could figure it out!)

Very solid zoo. Nice side trip for those with kids.. I've been to many, many zoos in the world, and I wouldn't say it's the best, but I did find it to be very enjoyable. Some things that would make it better: maybe a real train that goes around the perimeter so people can get from one side to the other faster. Another small complaint is that all of the animal "pavilions" allowed strollers to go inside. Great since I had strollers, but bad because there's not enough room inside of them for all the traffic. All the pavilions were extremely crowded because the lanes were just too small to accomodate gawkers and passers-by. It would be nice if there was a metro stop to the zoo, but it's easy enough to get to. Take the C line to Holesovice, and then bus 112 takes you straight to the zoo entrance. Cost to the zoo is 150 czk per adult, 100 czk for children. Food there was reasonable (I had a burrito and a coke for about 150 czk). The zoo is very good, but could use some improvements.

Brilliant day out - even for big children :-). I thought Prague Zoo was amazing - definitely the best Ive been to. Its huge - my boyfriend and I were there for 4 hours and still didnt see everything! The enclosures are lovely - very spacious. All of the animals looked like they had loads of space (except the polar bears). The selection of animals is very broad. We were able to see most of the animals. If they werent outside you could almost always go to the indoor part of the enclosure and see them there.I will definitely go back!!

as some reviewers have said, the signs.... as some reviewers have said, the signs are in czech. Kinda obvious really! Animal names are in english so that's fine. We went on a freezing (-3) day in february and weren't disappointed. Getting there is easy and well signposted. We took the metro then the bus. Once inside we bought a map for 5crown, about 18p and started exploring. Snow covered everywhere so many animals were inside but had room to explore inside as well as out. The 3 polar bears were obviously loving the cold! Lunch menus were also in czech, but a simple enquiry found out the guy serving spoke perfect english. Entry, lunch, drinks, cake and travel for 2 coming in at 650 crown, about £25. Well worth it. Zoos in england would charge nearly that for entry! Great day out, if a little cold, but i have photos of tigers and camels in the snow. How many people can say that?

Best Zoo I have even been too. We visited Prague Zoo at the suggestion of my motgher in law, who likes zoos. I dont. In the guide it looked as if getting there was going to be a bit of a trek, but it wasnt. we took the tram, and changed to a bus for the last part. nearly everyone on the bus was going to the zoo, and it stopped right outside (you ca also see the palace next door - Troja-, but the zoo will fil up your day). The paths wind quite steeply up from the entrance, and things donty look hopeful, but then we can t an inside exibit with anmals from borneo and other tropical south-east asia, the orang utans looked right at home, and you felt like you were visiting them in a real home. Over the top of the hill and down the far side you come to the africa safari exibit. The giraffes were all close to the viewing platform, so we got great views. Later we walked round the hill, back towards the riverside. The enclosures for the mountai goats are ona very steep scree slope, which seems to suit them fabulously. We were initially disappointed f to find few big cats outside, on a day which had stated warm but wet cool and damp, but once INSIDE we were able to see the tigers through the glass from a few inches away. there are als elephants, fruitbats, aardvarks, cassowaries, and everythig else you might expect. A good day out, for all children, even those in their 40's or more

See animals up close. I've been to many zoos due to the fact my 7 year old son loves all animals ( hint my tripadvisor handle). The kids loved the zoo but I was disappointed by the poor landscaping and some dirty and smallish enclosures. There are no maps, signs or menus in any other language other than Czech.The best part of the zoo, is due to compromised human safety and animal habitat reasons, you can get very very close to the animals.Lastly Family Travel Forum recommends you take a boat on the Charles River to the zoo. Great idea if you don't mind a visually stunning BUT 75 minute long oneway boatride.

A pleasant surprise!. I have been to quite a few ZOOs around the world, however the Prague ZOO exceeded my expectations. Since I am Czech, I am very proud of such a ZOO. It seems animal-friendly and I did not have a sad feeling about the lives of the animals as I have for example here in China. It is located on a hilly Prague 7 area (within the ZOO there is a cable car which adds to its attraction), not far from the center. It is great for families with small children.

The best zoo we've ever visited. We took our six year old to Prague for the February Half term (2008) and spent one of our best days at the zoo. Travel to the zoo from the centre of Prague cost 26Kc each way for the adults (about 80p) on a combination of tram (No 5) and Bus (No 112). The zoo is exceptionally well laid out in themed areas with animals that would live together in the wild sharing enclosures. The animals looked healthy and happy and there is an enormous range to see. We were there for ovver 5 hours and managed to see about 2/3 of the animals. We have visited a number of zoos in the UK and in Europe (Chester, Edinburgh, London, Copenhagen, Barcelona) and this was by far the best. Entry for two adults and a child cost a total of 400Kc (about £12) - money extremely well spent.

An uplifting experience. On a very warm day in early ctober2003, we 3 adults visitedPrague zoo. A yeaar after the devastating floods, most of the animals were back in secure housing in large runs. All looked well and contented. Polar bears swam in a pleasant pool and watched the visitors through several layers of toughenend glass. The ooters looked jolly and came up to the bars to communicate with us. The sign inside their run shwed that it was nearly lunchtime and explained their interest in people. We latwe returned to watch them being fed, not on fish as the notice said, but on white mice. Each run had a descriptionof the animals inside and a notice explaining about each of the young born in the time since the flood. A litter of 6 now adult sized wolf cubs ambled around their ample space, thebaby fur seal,the enexpected daughter of a father who swam downsteam to Germany and died after being found, played athletically in the pleasant pool with her mother and aunts, leaping out of the water. They were fed as we watched and had an obvious raport with the young woman keeper. The chairlift is available for people who don't fancy the steep paths, the food in the restaurant is first class and the toilets well kept. this zoo is an altogether positive experience for visitors.
